name: Suma Samawi Hostel
description: The signs on the front advertised camping, pizza and a hostel. The bathrooms are a bit dodgy. The water is solar-heated, and the electric shower heads don't supply enough juice to heat water in the morning, so it's only somewhat warm in the afternoon. But the price is right and the Argentinian couple who run the place are very friendly. We opted for a room because it was only US$5 more for the three of us, but you can pitch a tent here as well.

name: Altai Oasis
description:
50 pP now! Not very suitable for people that sleep in (or on) their vehicle.

One of the best campgrounds of our trip to date. Lots of grassy areas to pitch a tent plus a fire pit that we used nearly every night. Very friendly English-speaking staff. The camping area's kitchen was wood-fire only. We used the oven half a dozen times with great success. Internet is available in the restaurant, which serves great food at reasonable prices, but only worked a couple hours during our six night stay. Big rigs be careful on the drive in. The road is narrow and there aren't places to turn around.

name: Sol y Luna
description:
Hotel and campsite. One of the best tent camping spots we found in Bolivia. Grass, a fire ring and a covered common area with power. Vehicles have a "reasonly flat" spot available close to the hostel area, just within wifi coverage, but right at the entrance of the hostel and kind a walktrough your camper van. Not too recommend for overlanders.
Lots of bugs, but blissfully warm temperatures relative to La Paz. The restaurant is reasonably priced and has a good reputation for German food. The surrounding property is huge, and is dotted with cabins that sleep 3-8 people. At the end of a narrow dirt road with no good turn arounds. Big rigs may have trouble. When wet, you probably need 4x4. (Update: a 2wd will do it for sure)

name: Hotel Sumaj Wasi
description: Continental breakfast is included, but we're not sure if the restaurant is open beyond that. Oruro isn't the happiest town in Bolivia, and finding a place to stay that had secured parking proved difficult. If you sleep in your vehicle it would be possible to stay a night in their parking lot.

name: Camping Alberto and Felicidad
description:
Ideally the area is suited for self-contained vehicles; i.e. rooftop tents, small motorhomes etc; not for stand-alone tents on their own, i.e. cyclists or motorcycles. This is because, particularly in the rainy season, the area can get quite wet. You can visit in the dry times like Winter but just be prepared for them to say no....they simply don't want people to be inconvenienced if they set a tent up and then get inundated with water.

A small grassy area very close to the center of Sucre. It's not signed, but it is a well-known stop for overlanders. Upon arrival you need to track down the owner, Alberto or his wife Felicidad and have them let you in. Alberto may be in his workshop on the property, knock loudly on the red door number 70, or at their house which can be found around the corner at 416 Aniceto Arce. Very friendly people and an excellent (and the only) place to camp in Sucre just a few blocks from the center. They also have a room for rent at the top of the A-frame common area.

Update: The entrance gate is now 3.20 meter wide and no height restrictions. Internet is fast and reliable.  Camping outside on the street is possible and would be a good overflow facility for reasonably self-contained campers during peak times especially since passing traffic at night is close to zero.
Tel. Felicidad: 74427260

WhatsApp Carolina (daughter, speaks English): ‪+59172876378‬

name: Uyuni Salt Flats
description: You can camp anywhere on the Solar de Uyuni, but Isla Pescador is probably your best bet. Not to be confused with Isla Pescado, the more popular destination for tour groups. You can stay on Pescado, but it's not a friendly place for tent campers and is likely to be crowded in the afternoon. However, there are bathrooms and trash facilities available, whereas Pescador has nothing. We spent the entire day and night without seeing another soul. We recommend camping around the back side of the island so you'll have a view of the sunset.

name: Canyon Camp
description: Just off the road on the right as you leave the Laguna Colorado area we found this dry canyon. You can drive a few hundred meters into the canyon and find a secluded place to camp for the night that's protected from the sun and wind. The elevations in Bolivia's southwest are incredibly high, meaning brutal sun during the day and very very cold temperatures at night. There are bathrooms and trash facilities at the ranger station on the north end of Laguna Colorado.

name: Hotel Gloria
description: Camped in the parking lot of the hotel. Access to toilet facilities inside the hotel. WIFI. Nice location. Price: 70 Bolivianos

name: Lakeside Bush Camp
description: On Lake Titicaca Beach further along from the trout restaurants. There is a good space just before the Hostel which appears to have no name. This was very quiet overnight with no traffic. Come to an arrangement with the owner of the hostel (who sells some pretty inventive jewellery made out of old cutlery) for toilets. There are also public toilets at the other end of the beach. FREE.

name: Road to Isla del Sol
description: Free, No facilities, short hike to beach for tent campers, wood for campfire

name: Volks Auto Shop - Ernesto Hug
description:
Camping free with vehicle service.  Services: Bathroom(no shower) / electricity
Good swiss mechanic with 40 years of experience, speaks English, German and Spanish.

name: Thermal Baths
description: No facilities. Sandy car park of the Thermal baths. Cold and quiet overnight. Spectacular views of surrounding mountains. Free. (Thermal Baths are S30 each and consist of natural pool in the altiplano).

name: Laguna Huanakuta
description: 4353m.  Camping free with NP entrance fee

name: Bush Camp #1
description: 3722m.  No facilities / Decent Cover / Not much to look at  free

name: Lakeside Bush Camp #2
description: Reservoir by the road just after the town of Challapata. Most of the access roads to the shore have been blocked but you can negotiate one. No facilities. Free.

name: Mirador
description: 4072m. No facilities / Nice views over the red rock valley / Good cover from road/  free / benches and tables

name: Canyon Steam Bush Camp
description: 3800m. No facilities / poor cover / beautiful setting. Plenty of bush camping in the area, not much cover. See our Overland guide to Bolivia’s Southwestern Circuit for much more info such as additional campsites, propane plant, gas stations, bathrooms, ticket control, etc.  free

name: Island Incahuasi
description: B/30 entrance fee per person gives you access to the island which has services such as bathrooms, a water faucet, restaurant, trash cans, and hiking trails. You can camp anywhere on the Salar.  The sunsets are gorgeous

name: Camino San Cristobal Alota
description: (approximate):. Past San Cristobel you will be on the sparsely-populated altiplano.  You can camp anywhere in this area, but there is little to no cover from the road.  free

name: Camino Averoe Alota
description: (approximate). Much better place to camp as there are numerous large boulders to block the wind and view from the road.  Several great places to turn off and camp several miles before and after the given coordinates.  free

name: Laguna Chulluncani
description: 4462m. The first flamingo lake you will come across.  No facilities, just flamingos and snow capped peaks.  free

name: Laguna Colorada
description:
Please confirm, ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed along the lakeshore, please respect the wishes of the locals. Camp at parking lots as per check-ins.

4317m. Campsite overlooking the red lagoon.  Nice spot but an even better spot may be before the registration and checkpoint: S22 09.885. W67 47.915.  Camping here buys you an extra day in the park.  free

There is wildlife here between the flamingos and llamas. There is no indication that pets are not allowed here, but a leash is a good idea!

name: Hot Springs Camp beside Laguna Chalviri
description: Excellent spot next to hot springs. The geography gives you a bit of a break from the wind. The hot springs are crowded during breakfast and lunch time but wait an hour and you will have them to enjoy in solitude. Hot springs cost 6bol. ticket in the building in front of the pool.

name: Villa Etelvina
description:
Kitchen: 
Cook inside the dinning room with your own cooker. There is a sink to do the dishes. 

Bathroom:
Soap, Shampoos, warm showers, toilet paper. Very clean. 

Garden:
Beautiful with benches and tables, hammocks. 

Internet: 
Very very slow as everywhere in Torotoro. 

Parking: 
Leveled. Perfect. Space for 3-4 cars. Entrance approx. 2.4m. (We could enter with our Unimog 3.20 height. enter through the gate.)

Prices:
60bol pp incl breakfast 
40bol pp without breakfast

name: Residencial Tarija Camping
description:
Central parking if you want to stay in your car. Basic. Boris is a nice guy (owner). 
Comment: 2.8 meters entry MAXIMUM entrance is on a slope the first beam is 3.10 Mtrs the last ad you enter is 2.8mtrs

Showers Water Restroom Pet Friendly
Central parking if you want to stay in your car. Basic. Boris is a nice guy (owner). 

Price: 60  bol
Comment: No permiten parqueo para camper con camping (rooftent), sólo espacio para vehículo 
Full Details


Price: 60  bol
Comment: No permiten parqueo para camper con camping (rooftent), sólo espacio para vehículo

name: Hotel Res Raldes
description: 50 to park out the back, take a shower. 10 in the morning for breakfast. I see what they meant about the showers, they decided to not connect any of the earth cables! so say a prayer beforehand I guess. WiFi was decent and reached out back for parking.

name: Francisco de Uriondo Plaza
description: We parked up in the street as recommended below. Not very peaceful but very convenient for the town. First night was fine. Second night a car drove into us in the middle of the night! Think he was drunk. Luckily for us, he hit our sandladders, so no real damage to our truck, but there was a dent in his car! Be careful where you park, tuck-in between other cars if possible.

name: Ruta F1
description: path down under the bridge is still possible, even though we just stayed on a big area around the Bridge, hidden behind some trees

name: Hotel San Antonio
description: 80 Bs for a single room. The bed is not really comfortable. The location is good, close to the city center. Close to the road, so noisy and you can smell smog even inside the room.

name: Ruta F5
description: There are many places along this small track to stay. Good for a night. No one around.

name: Hosteria Jardin
description: Cheap, dirty and stinky room. Big parking area, entrance not suitable for motor cars. We payed 60 Bob p/p.

name: Ridgeline Camp on the Road to Sorata
description: On the road on the way to Sorata. This spot has a great view of two valleys. No facilities. FREE.

name: Parking Lot in Potosi
description: We were too tall for Hotel Tarija (S19 35.069 W65 45.347) which is the usual overlander’s place to stay. This secure parking lot was very cheap and a 15 minute walk from the centre. No Facilities. B25 per night.

name: Hotel Austria, Sucre
description: Next to bus terminal. Secure parking lot behind hotel. Toilets and Showers available (hot if you use the ones inside the hotel). External water tap but no power. They wanted B120 to sleep in the truck or B100 to take a room. We took a room and slept in the truck anyway as it is a lot nicer than their rooms! WIFI in the hotel. Collectivo into centre from here is 10 minutes. (3 or A). They have 3 dogs on the grounds, be very wary of the little black one which took a chunk out of Sarah’s leg and tried to do the same to me!

name: Outside Tonito Hotel, Uyuni
description: In the street slightly up from Tonito hotel. Tonito hotel has Minuteman Pizza which serves very nice Pizza. This is in front of army base guard post so very secure. No Facilities. FREE.

name: Laguna Honda
description: No Facilities. FREE. On shore of Lake. Bitterly cold at night – but fairly sheltered from the wind.

name: Laguna Blanca
description: No Facilities. FREE. On Flat exposed ground next to lake. Bitterly cold and very windy during the night.

name: Quime
description: No facilities. Just needed at place for the night. Nice and quiet just off the road in between some trees.  Price: free

name: South of Uyuni
description: We were looking for a laguna, but took a wrong turn and by the time we realized we just needed at place to camp.

name: Copacabana beach from
description:
Feel wonderful place right on Lake Titicaca, quiet, no Infrasturktur.     Free     WiFi Hotel OnkelInn  Trip to the Isla del Sol is very nice with migration from the North to southern tip

Best wifi we found was the one from Cafe Europa

We slept in here for 3 days, quiet and safe. We even left the motorhome alone while we were running errands through Copcabana. Even if it’s in the touristic center it is quiet and calm and there are great views. There is a water tap outside the hotel estelar, just ask permisson and they’ll let you fill your water tank. There are baños publicos at the end of the road, have to pay some bolivianos. There is enough space for big rigs. We have been three motorhomes T the same time

name: Football Field. Oruro
description: Good overnight place in front of Oruro, quiet, no infrastructure. Free

name: Street Parking. Huari
description: Good overnight place, quiet, no infrastructure.     Free  Blockade

name: Castilla Huma Chullpares-Spa
description:
Lovely quiet staying for the night at the spa, clean warm water, no infrastructure.     Free  Turn left into some kilometers to the Huari gravel road. Thermal follow the slope to about 10 km.

2014 - roofed over with clothes washing facility on the end of the building

Not sure if it is locked at night.
Level area for parking/camping

name: Ruta 5
description: Lovely quiet staying for the night, no infrastructure. Free. The thermal bath is not recommended. After Uyuni turn left into gravel road to the thermal.

name: Canyon - Ruta 5
description: Idyllic and wonderful peaceful place overnight in a clean river, no infrastructure.  Drive 160 km to Uyuni on the big bridge and then turn left into the canyon down

name: Riverside Ruta 14
description:
Lovely quiet staying for the night. 

only few cars passing .

no one bothered us.

name: YPF Station
description: A few kms north of the city, at a YPF petrol station. Quiet place, toilet and cold shower.

name: Hotel El Torre
description: Spent the night at the lovely, friendly, clean Hotel El Torre (price around 70 *bolivianos* for double room). The first time we were in Tupiza, we parked in the same street and slept in the car. It was a quiet night and without any problems.  Price: Bs.70 per double room

name: Mina Candelaria
description: About 70 kms northwest of Tupiza (towards Uyuni). Quiet place, friendly custodian of the mine who let us camp here.

name: Sud Lipez, Laguna Verde
description:
Overnight Prohibited camping is illegal here. Protected Area
.....
Along the long lake you'll see a small building to can change clothes. It's adjacent to a wonderful thermal bath. Perfect place for rough camping.

name: Sud Lipez, Laguna Honda
description: Another awesome rough camp, between the flamingos.

name: Salar de Uyuni, Isla Pescado
description: 20 kms northwest of Ihla Inca Huasi. Fantastic spot for rough camping. During the day maybe 2 or 3 tour-cars stop by but during the evening we had the place to ourselves.

name: Salar de Uyuni, Volcano Tunupa
description: Village Colquesa. Beautiful place to spend the night. Walk up to the volcano or watch flamingos.

name: Alojamiento Sicancahur
description: Spent the night in the parking lot of Alojamiento Sicancahur, shower for 5 *bolivianos*. Friendly owner.  Price: Bs.5 per shower

name: Eco Hotel Ituaba
description:
Border with Brazil (Guajara Mirim, Rondônia). Good spot for camping at the terrain of eco hotel Ituaba with a very friendly owner. Located 3 kms outside town towards Riberalta.

Comment:    10/2017      50 bob per person . didn't seam keen on us being there in 2 vehicles and pretty unfriendly restaurant staff didn't sample the food and they were not keen to show the menu Great natural swimming lake and location

name: Route Riberalta - Rubbenaque
description: Lovely spot for rough camping, well hidden from the road thanks to high bushes.

name: Yucumo
description: Fine spot for rough camping, hidden behind an abandoned hut.

name: Coroico- wild camp
description: Camped at a private parking above Hostel El Cafetal, right outside Coroico's center. el hotel está a la derecha según se sale de coroico, esto está a la izquierda,  subiendo una rampa que sale del hotel arcángel.

name: Hotel Casa Camprestra
description: Hotel Casa Campestra. Stayed in the parking lot of this luxurious hotel. B90 per night, including use of shower (when room is available) and extensive breakfast buffet.  Price: Bs.90

name: Termas la Cabaña, de la Torre.
description:
Open weekends only. Friday and Saturday nights.
Thermal pool and Jacuzzis, rooms to rent and ample space to park. Big green grounds, many trees. Restaurant with good food.

name: Pilot club
description: Spent the night in the parking lot of the Pilot Club.

name: Buena Vista
description: Perfect, shady parking spot at the plaza. There are restaurants happy to share their wifi passwords.

name: Estancia los Portreros
description: Camped on the property of a farm (Estancia los Portreros) on the main road between San Javier and Concepción. Asked permission to stay alongside the field, which was no problem. Beautiful, quiet spot.

name: Agua Calientes Los Hervores
description: Campsite along hot water springs. Quiet place. Obviously also hot showers available. Price: B15 pp for 24 hours.  Price: Bs.15 pppn

name: Jesuit Missions Route, camp 1
description: Tranquil rough camp wit lots of birds some 45 kms south of San Rafael, in the fields / forest of a farmer.

name: Camping Mama Pacuala
description: Camping Mama Pacuala. 5 kms before (below) the entrance of the UNESCO site El Fuerte. Quiet camping (maybe not in summer holidays?), kept clean and maintained. Swimming pool and toilets.

name: Incallajta campground
description: We camped in the parking lot-cum-camping ground of the Inca ruins. Beautiful place to stay. Running water available and toilets.

name: Tiwanaku Camp
description: Parking. Quiet place to spend the night, no facilities but there are toilets in museums. Good Entel reception.

name: Parking lot Gloria Hotel, Coroico
description: Parking lot Gloria Hotel. Quiet place to spend the night.

name: Colibri Camping
description:
A beautiful, peaceful campsite near the Valley of the Moon, 30 mins south of La Paz. Amazing views over the Valley of the Flowers and to the Devil's Tooth. Really well-equipped kitchen, fire pits, hot showers etc.

Grassy areas for tents, teepee and cabins for 'glamping'. 

space for small vehicles - call or email ahead for bigger rigs, it's possible to park just outside the gate on a larger flat space.

Price for campervan per person per day is Bs 50. 

You can use the Colibri kitchen which is completely equipped and has a fridge. There are also bbqs.

Rolando is a sources of so much useful information, including local garages and mechanics if you need it.

This place truly is beautiful and the best place to relax and enjoy the hammocks and amazing mountain views.

The staff are very friendly and happy to share tips and information about Bolivia. There is a trues sense of family.

This is a really safe place, where you can feel comfortable leaving luggae or your kit as Rolando´s family lives on the same site.

The complementary services include: 

a) Huge Hummingbird Full Breakfast Bs 35.- (Seasonal fruit juice, coffee, tea or mate, cereals, yogurt, milk, bread, butter, jam and scrambled eggs) 

b) Basic Breakfast Bs 20.- (Tea, coffee or mates, glass of fruit juice, fresh local bread and a slice of cheese) 

c) Lunch or dinners Bs 55.- (including vegetarian options) 

d) Laundry of approximately 8 kilos of clothes Bs 45.-
 
e) Pet friendly  (Rolando also has 3 friendly dogs and a cat)

name: Boulder Camp
description: Just off the Ruta 5 around 30k after Ollague a sandy but fairly good dirt path leads off the road into bouldery landscape. The natural formation of he rocks make this area an ideal place for a wild camp. Quiet at night with only the odd passing truck reminding you of civilisation. Very cold at night due to 4155m elevation.

name: Valle de Rocas
description: Turn off the main road towards the spectacular rock formations. There are plenty of possibilities to spend the night. No facilities but great view.

name: Border Crossing: Chile-Bolivia
description:
This building is on the Chilean side, PDI & Aduana at the border
Furthermore:
- PDI in San Pedro (only in operation when the building at border is closed due to weather conditions)
- 5 km more to Bolivian Immigration
- 5 km more to Bolivian Customs. Customs is at the white metal building.
- 200 m to the park entrance (150 bols/p).

From Chile to Bolivia or from Bolivia to Chile, ask everywhere. 

No fee. if he asks for money, don't pay.

name: Construction Pull Off On The Way To Uyuni
description: Not long after Huari the road turns to dirt and seemingly never ending construction. We found this pull off right before dark and there weren't many other options. It's well hidden and level.

name: Lake Titicaca, Bolivia
description:
Gravel road from village right to the lake edge.  Small jetties for paddle boats in season, but for us it was a nice quiet scenic spot with a great view.

Plenty of bird life.

NO dogs and apart from a couple of friendly local policemen out for a stroll, and locals working in nearby fields, no noisy neighbours either.

name: Banco de Credito (BCP)
description: Here you can withdraw USD Dollars and change the 20 bills into 100 bills (for Argentina).

name: BMW Motorrad
description:
Andar Motors,  
BMW dealer with a small motorcycle section
8 Hernando Siles Tel 68074457. Open Monday to Friday 08:30 - 12:30 14:30

name: Mac servicing and repair
description: MAC Visual are authorized service agents. AppleCare warranty repairs on site. Owner speaks English. Friendly  and professional service. Recommended for Overlanders with a Mac problem. Calle Juan Jose Perez No 282. Possible to park in street outside if your not staying long. Open Monday to Friday 9-13:00 15:00-19:00 Tel 244 4375 or 244 4160

name: SOAT - Purchase here
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Users report"Alianza doesn’t do Soat For bikes anymore. They indicate UniVida instead. October 2018 "

Alianza Av 20 de Octobre No 2680 (corner of Campos)Tel 243 2121 Monday to Friday 8:30-12:30 14:30-18:30 Annual coverage (all that is available in Bolivia. Price is 190 Bol for Motos, for 2014 season. Cars slightly cheaper. Take copy of passport and vehicle title. English spoken. Don't forget your sticker! 3/7/2016 Mobilehome fiar ducato 80 bol.

name: Vehicle batteries
description: Baterias YUASA. Calle Almirante Grau No 308 (San Pedro). Tel 248 0776. Good section of quality batteries. Very good selection for Motos. Between here and place opposite you should find what you need. Fair prices, will haggle. Professional service. Monday to Saturday 9:00-13:00 14:30-18:30 Sunday until midday. Recommend.

name: Parking In the City
description:
Great place to park in the busy market district. Cheap hourly rates. Good for smaller rigs and Motos. Will look after your helmet and riding gear :-) used many times. For the entrance look for the Osadia discoteca sign. Opposite Hostal Alsigal. 

I paid 90 Bolivianos for 3 days and nights of secure parking. Very friendly staff.

name: Virgin Of The Rocks - Beach Camp
description: Beautiful wild camping on a secluded stony beach, 10 minutes from Copocabana.

name: SEGUROS ILLIMANI S.A.: Insurances for neighbour countries of Bolivia
description:
Use the Address! Place is difficult to locate with coordinates alone.

In this office of Seguros Illimani they sell international insurance for neighbour countries of Bolivia. Clle Loayza No. 233, Edificio Mcal. de Ayacucho, 10th floor DANIEL ARCE S. (Speaks English perfectly)
GERENCIA DE OPERACIONES
e-mail: darce@segurosillimani.com.bo
OF. CENTRAL C/Loayza No. 233 Edif. Mcal. de Ayacucho P-10
Telf.: +591 2 2203040   Fax +591 2 2391149 
Web.: www.segurosillimani.com.bo

name: Red Valley Camp
description: Fairly quiet spot off the road. Vegetation and bushes hide you from the road. A few locations around here to camp but accessible only with dirt bikes or perhaps small 4x4 vehicles.

name: Hotel Oberland
description:
Yup at a hotel... 

With the new Owner they are only possible to refill south-american gas bottles or you bring your own Adapter, they don't have any Adapter

Propane/Butane is nationalized in Bolivia and the government does not allow refilling foreign tanks... The wonderfully sympathetic owner of the hotel, Walter, has an adapter and will fill your tank cylinder to cylinder for cost (28b/$4)... It does take a few hours...

name: Hotel Toñito Uyuni
description: Good base location in Uyuni. There is a small secure parking lot that can fit cars with a maximum of 245 cm height. The rooms are old but clean. Minute Man Pizzeria is great (including gluten-free and vegan options) and US-style breakfast is good.

name: Unisur
description:
This gas station has clean gas and they will sell to foreigners. We got gas for 5B/L here. You may have to tell them you don't want a receipt. 

july 2018 : didnt want to sell to foreigners

name: Rio Lauca
description: This is a little pull out on the way to the thermal baths. Free with NP entrance fee (40B/p). Good views and quiet.

name: Sajama Geysers
description: This is the parking lot for the geysers in Sanama NP. OSM roads to the location are approximately correct. You can stay overnight with your motorhome and with a tent is also possible.

name: Sajama Tent Camp
description: Area near geysers good for tent campers and all sorts of even bigger vehicles.

name: North Entrance To Salar De Uyuni
description: North entrance to Salar from the town of Jirira. We opted for a northern entrance when we found the road (highway 30) to Uyuni was under construction. Getting out to Jirira is not an easy road (air down!), but you'll get spectacular views of the volcano as you enter the salt flats from this point. Head west first to Salinas de Garci Mendoza and then follow the signs south to Jirira.

name: Vila Vila Bush Camp
description: We had a flat tire and Michael found this bush camp outside Vila Vila. Lots of space, flat, and far enough from the highway that you don't get much noise. Overall not a bad spot.

name: Llanteria San Cristobal
description: We had a flat tire repaired here. Mechanic may be able to help with other issues but this place is a small town mechanic so it's difficult to say.

name: Laguna Colorado Gate
description: The gate for Laguna Colorado is here. You'll have to buy an entrance ticket to get to the rest of the park. Tickets are 150B/person (foreigners). Children (at least up to age 9) do not pay. And 25 bol for the car.

name: Hotel Titicaca
description: People in Bolivia block the Panam Hwy to protest. Thats why we have a very expensive lunch for two in this horel. They let us stay in the common areas and use wifi. The room here its about 350 bolivianos. We have to pay 150 for lunch. We spend at least 8 hours waiting for the road was open.

name: Bug Camp
description: Just off the road near several houses but hidden from passing traffic is a small clearing suitable for wild camping. There is a nearby water source and apart from passing cars is fairly quiet accept for the jungle chorus of weird wildlife. Bring your bug spray!

name: Sajama NP - Geyser Valley
description: Take the road past the church in Sajama Village to get to the Geyser field. Just short of the geysers we pulled up into a valley to get out of the wind. Spectacular Mt. Sajama view. We entered the park from the north and have not yet had to pay.

name: Outside Oruro Valley Camp
description: Getting lateand we needed a place to land, followed a road around the edge of a dry lake and mountain to this spot. There are some properties in the distance but obscure and far enough away that no one noticed us. Might be quite different in wet season.

name: Boulder Field
description: Track leads off to the right if coming from Uyuni, several options, it really depends on the direction of the wind. We took a close to the road easy spot after a long day but there are many more creative and adventurous options.

name: Riverside bushcamp
description:
Very quiet place, close to the river, nice views. Hardly visble from the tiny main road. 

Comments: Lot of trash!!! If you are looking for a free trash wild camp, it is not this one...

name: La Cupula
description: You CANNOT camp here but we anyway opted for a room. The hostel is great, comfy large rooms, living room with fireplace, well equiped kitchen, very good restaurant and fast wifi. And secure parking! We paid USD 37. for a double room. There are cheaper options without bathroom. Great view on the bay.

name: Gas Station
description:
We stay at gas stations frequently. this one offered no facilities but otherwise was fairly quiet at night and clean. 

Update: There is a restroom! No charge to use

name: TNA Island
description: Large island with lots of rock and coral structure. This side has a cave to explore. Great views of the volcano in the north from here.  Excellent views to the west to watch passing storms and amazing sunsets. Be sure to check out the cactus on the east side of the island.

name: TNA Island Beach Landing / Bay.
description: Check the tracks and drive right up onto the beach if it is firm enough. If not park out in the wind protected bay, even if the bay is soft parking out further you are protected from the wind on this side of the island. This makes it a good spot to camp for the night. Lots of cactus and coral to explore on this side. The beach is very friendly for tent campers. Enjoy the seclusion out here as you will see few or no one passing by.

name: DG Gas
description: Good clean gas, very welcoming. The plus here is that they have a water tap they allow you to use. Non potable water ( no salt, locals call it aqua dulce) for washing dishes and bathing in on the salar. When we returned from salar we also used this water for cleaning chairs, shoes, etc that were salty.

name: Chissi
description:
- beautiful views of the lake and mountains
- free
- flat
- no amenities
- dirt road

Nice mirador area, many spots to choose from.

name: Under Chacaltaya
description:
- free
- no amenities
- Camped under the mountain of Chacaltaya - we tried driving up, but managed only up to around 4900 m. asl., then the road was too steep and rocky to drive fast and our van refused to go slow. You might need low gear to get up there. But it might have also been bad Peruvian diesel we took earlier. So we returned here. 
- around 4500 m. asl.
- next to a lake
- very calm, only llamas and two shepherd dogs came in the morning
- pretty cold at night
- access road is partially rough dirt, some small river crossings and rocks

name: Roadside camping on the way to Chile
description:
- free
- no amenities
- this is a backroad to Sajama (rather rough and bumpy at the beginning)
- we arrived at night and camped alongside this road about hundred meters from Ruta 4
- nice desert setting, not much cover
- Note that there is only one Bolivean gas station on the way to Chile (in Tambo Quernando, right before the border) and it is often out of diesel; next gas station is in Arica. Try to get a full tank either in Patacamaya on the Bolivean side or Arica on Chilean side.

name: Sajama Geysers
description:
- camping included in park entrance fee 
- we camped in a parking lot right next to the "geysers" (more like hot springs)
- beautiful location, llamas grazing, geysers geysing, etc.
- do not try to bathe directly in the hot pools, they are boiling hot (literally, we boiled eggs in one of them); rather go find a deeper spot in the stream running through the valley, it gets progressively hotter as it flows down
- the sandy access road here from Sajama crosses two smaller streams - nothing serious, just be careful if your vehicle has large overhangs front/back

name: East of Ancaravi
description:
- free
- a bit further from the road
- we needed to take a break here from the horrible A12 road, which has been washboard and stones for dozens of kilometers already (coming from the border, May 2014)
- nothing spectacular, partly visible from the road

name: On the way to Toro Toro
description:
- free
- nothing special, just roadside camp next to one of the side roads leading from the cobbled road
- watch out for thorn trees here, some are really fierce, will not only pierce the sole of your shoe, but also your tyres
- the road to Toro Toro is about 80% bumpy cobbles, the rest is dust/dirt with some small creek crossings (in May, gets much worse in January/February)

name: On the way to Sucre
description:
- free
- We set off from Toro Toro disregarding any comments about a very bad road to Sucre. The road started ok, then it disappeared, we drove through a dry river bed for a while, crossed a spanking new bridge, climbed a single track path along with some cows, arrived to a tiny village, got stuck on a rocky/gravel road, rescued by a local ambulance driver (Land Cruiser 75), climbed the worst road of our trip, descended into another dry river bed and ended up here in a saddle and parked next to a cross for the night. Hundred kilometers to go tomorrow. But one of the most remote and spectacular campspots of our trip.

name: Hostal Pachamama
description:
- 140 BOB per car (2 people)
- narrow entry gate (2 meters max width, height should be ok for most campervans)
- "camping" in a nice (but very narrow) yard of the hostel
- kitchen, bathroom with hot shower (suicide type, equipped with see-through curtains and windows as a bonus)
- strong wifi signal, consistent connection, but rather slow
- ask before filling your water containers/tanks, one tap has potable water, the other "recycled" water for flowers (don't ask how we know)
- small grassy area with tables
- table tennis
- for power plugs look for a small grey box under the ceiling of the covered seating area
- walking distance to the main plaza

name: Laguna Hedionda
description:
- free
- After much consideration we decided to tackle the Lagoon Route with the van. We set off from Uyuni, the 701 is mostly good packed dirt. We took a left turn around point S21.39596 W67.99307 and drove up the hill for about 3 kms. The road is rough and rocky. Afterwards there are multiple tracks, usually one worse than the other, with deep ruts that made us drive on top of them. Next came a bit of soft sand accompanied by a serious washboard, which pretty much continues to the Chilean border. We would not drive it again, even in a 4X4. You can see pretty much the same stuff in northern Chile, with better roads, less people and for free. 
- nevertheless, the views are beautiful here
- bitterly cold at night, -5° C in the morning (May)

name: Isla Incahuasi
description:
- free
- We camped on the northern tip of Isla Incahuasi, since we wanted to catch the morning sun from the east and have as much as warmth of the setting sun from the west. 
- There is probably a nicer spot in the cove around the corner to the west, but it was occupied and it won't have the morning sun. Or even better - move to the island about 15 kms NW from here (whatever it is called, something with fish) - no tours there and plenty of opportunities for camping on the adjacent small islands.
Can also camp closer in to the tip of the island where it might be a lot less windy in the evening.

name: Mecanico Severo
description:
Would definitly recommend for not-too-complicated problems of not-too-complicated cars.
We had our clutch pump give out while parked at nearby Hotel Oberland. We went to look for him, and he came over the same day (don't depend on him showing up at a certain time, just go get him). He sent us to find the stuff to fix it. We were charged 70 Bs. Afterwards the pump was still leaking. We went back, he identified the problem and sent us to a place where they could improve the pump a bit.
We'd also had some cardan (drive shaft) problems, which he promptly identified. In the same metal workshop they improved the piece. At that workshop it was another 70 Bs., plus some 50 Bs. for the mechanic. However, he didn't tell us the cardan should be balanced, which probably is why we still have some vibrations.
Severo does not speak English.

name: Coipasa Salt Flat
description: FREE. parked up on a grassy are off the salt. Needs to drive 15-20km on the salt to get here.

name: Tunupa Volcano Near Jirira
description: Great spot by the 4x4 trail that leads up to the foot path to the volcano. Great hike if you fancy a walk up to the view point (with the view of the Salar!) super windy over night but calms down for the morning.

name: Uyuni Train Graveyard
description: Fun but spooky place for the night. Peaceful night though there a still trains running that you can hear over night.

name: Stone Forest West Of Uyuni
description: Wonderful place to stop for the night. Plenty of place to choose from. Peaceful quiet night.

name: Pan America Bakery And Pizzeria
description: Really good pizzas, pick four toppings for 80b for a medium pizza. friendly owners from Chicago (but sell thin crust pizza), also sell baked goods. only open from Friday to Monday.

name: Hostal Kory Wara
description: Curahuara de carangas is a interesting place with ruins unknown for tourists. Stay in Hostal Kory Wara, aymara family owned, good food, rustic and cheap. Go for a tour! Ask to the owners, they can arrange with a local guide.

name: Hotel Gran Poder
description: Can camp in the secure parking area for 25bol a night. Gate is slightly narrow but with no height restriction. Big rigs might struggle. A bit "pricey" for the basic accommodation but no more choice if you need to spend the night. Restaurant and minimarket in site. Secure parking, no internet.

name: Pozazul Hotel And Camping
description:
60bol /pers (tent or campervan) Swimming pool, very relaxing. Hot shower. Cabanas : 150bol for 1 bed. 220bol for 2 with AC and private bathroom
 Quiet clean campsite and cabanas. A little traffic noise

name: Beside An Old Church
description: Just off highway 108. The owner of the nearest house asked us to move our truck to a spot where he could see us. He said that,in case we had any trouble, he could call the police for us. Reassuring. The view is fantastic.

name: YPFB Propane/Natural Gas Station
description:
The Bolivian national gas company will fill up your propane/natural gas tanks here. It's open from 7am to 3pm. 
Filled up a US tank without adapter. They might refused because of the size of the bottle (too small). Insist, come back, do not bribe them!

name: Humberto's Taller De Moto
description: Had to change clutch cable, oil, mirror and some bulbs of my Colombian bike. Humberto was very friendly and honest

name: Palacio Incas
description: Basic hotel with breakfast (tea/coffee, coca leaves & bread with butter/jam). Friendly staff. I paid 50 for a room with tv. Good wifi. Parking lot one block down and left half a block I paid 10 a day for my motorbike

name: Alojamiento Dazi
description: Cheap básic hotel. Very friendly staff. Wifi (not working today though). Small parking. I paid 35 pesos for the most basic room without a tv or bathroom.

name: Tupiza Train Station Parking Area
description:
We stayed here for a couple of nights. Hotel La Torre seemed not to have space for our motorhome and police recommended us this spot. They told us the town was quite and safe so it was good enough for us. It's close to the center, free and there's plenty of space for any rig.

No amenities. However, there's local street food served every night in the parking area.

The train station has toilets for 1 boliviano, although they do not open everyday (we couldn't figure out the pattern). For showers we went to a nearby YHI (the second one down the road) at 15 bolivianos each hot shower.

name: Residencial Panamericano
description:
At the corner of 20 de Mayo, a block east of the PanAm. 

The Residencial Panamericano is a hotel with parking lot where overlanders are welcome to park and stay in their vehicle for the night (20 bolivianos). Rooms are 25 bolivianos per single bed (50 double, 75 triple). 

There is a rustic shower, not great, but hot water & ok pressure.

Not many ammenities, but there are toilets and drinking water.

name: Tambo Quemado
description: You can negotiate the price here. They don't have the machine here to charge the international price legitimately.

name: Socinbol
description: Have a machine to sell gas to foreigners, but also was willing to barter because 'the prices haven't come in yet'

name: Alojamiento
description: Very basic accommodation with parking. Couldn't find anywhere with internet. Warm showers, good cable. I paid 30 pesos for a room with cable and shared bathroom, normally 40 I think. Very friendly staff

name: Valle De Rocas 2
description: Another campsite amongst the beautiful rock towers. Still windy!

name: Ciclik Int Food
description: Do you have enough of the "pollo alla plancha"? Does your stomach reject the local fair? Check out this place for international food. Great sandwiches. Decent fries. Sandwich for 40 Bol. Beer 16 Bol. Fast wifi.

name: Engraseria
description: They will grease all mechanical parts which should offer some protection from the salt. However not as effective as the complete coating you can get in uyuni

name: Don Carlos
description: Two gas stations. We haggled down to 5 Bol without a receipt and filled up the land cruiser plus 4 jerry cans (we needed to go to both stations as they would only led us fill 80 liters at a time

name: Zarate Electric Mechanic
description: Very helpful electrical mechanic for cars. We had the contacts on our starter changed here. 380 bol for 2 Hours of work and parts

name: Villazon, Bolivia to La Quiaca, Argentina
description:
Border Crossing: Bolivia / Argentina. Make sure you line up at window 4 as soon as possible. If there is a bus in front of you expect to wait at least 2 hours for the Bolivian migration to process you - BE AWARE YOU NEED ARGENTINEAN
 INSURANCE TO PROCESS THE PERMIT PAPERS AND THEY DON'T SELL INSURANCE AT THE BORDER (but they do sell in La Quiaca, but not the best conditions it seems).
Border Crossing Argentina/Bolivia: Easy for us with 2 chilean motorbikes, as foreigners non resident. Really cool agents on the Bolivian side. No search. Just check our serial number on the bikes. Didn't ask for insurance. Less than 10 minutes if there is nobody waiting.

name: Don Chuma
description: We were stuck for a couple of weeks and got repeated recommendations for Don Chuma. It's a brown metal gate, no sign. He managed to fix our clutch without spare parts enough to get us to Chile. He took some convincing to do the work, he's busy, but it was affordable and good quality. Unlike most mechanics in Potosi.

name: Uyuni - Car wash & Anti-rust Treatment
description:
Wash off the salt!!!  2 places next door to each other, one labeled as a car wash but wasn't open, the other had an unlabeled, open blue gate and welcomed us in. $80B for our huge van, $50B for normal sized trucks. Drove the vehicle up on raised stand, over a work out. They pressure washed the entire exterior and oiled the undercarriage to prevent rust. They offer interior wash as well, though we didn't get that added service. 

Update Nov '15: Cost 60Bol for a normal SUV

name: Toyota Service
description:
The biggest Toyosa in La Paz (Toyota dealer).

Note: They may be the biggest but don't have all parts.

Closed between 12:30 and 14:30.

name: Field Camp
description: Really beautiful and peaceful wild camp near the fields. Turn left on the main road on direction to Uyuni (a new one is on construction). Then drive 2kms on a dirt road pretty bad but ok. Bigger rigs can stop near the main road, it's a nice place too and greener.

name: Bushcamp Edgy Rocks
description: From the main road (#5) A dirt road leads to the entrance of a lithium mine (where we accidentaly ended up after taking a wrong turn on the salar), but coming from the south there is a dirt track before the entrance of the mine that leads into some hills where the rocks provide coverage from the wind. We could park our motorbikes behind some rocks and also saw cartracks. The rocks are quite sharp.

name: Bushcamp Rocky Valley
description: A good camping spot in a gorge with some rock formations that provide good cover from the wind. There is no river or water in the gorge. We saw some tours that ride through the gorge as well. There is not much shelter nearby, so this is a good place when there is a lot of wind or snow like we had.

name: Honda Hi-Store
description: Sucre branch of the Honda Hi-Store where they sell various Honda motorbikes and parts.

name: Optica \ Lenses
description: They are able to provide lenses on the same day. Optica Cosmos in the Galleria Walvic on the left side, ground floor

name: Supermercado
description: Well sorted for restocking more special food stuff

name: Hotel torino
description: 150 per night for a double with private bathroom. Old charming hotel. Wifi. Clean.

name: XXL supermercado
description: Hypermaxi - like at home ;) expensive, but it has a selection of imported goods

name: Hostal El Viajero
description: parking lot of the hostel. It's also the parking lot for several tour Jeeps and therefore we had to park as close as on a ferry. We also had to move several times to let tour Jeeps out. Very dirty toilets. We previously had a look at Hostal Marith, but we found it even more boarder line.  Ride across the Salar de Uyuni. As there was water on the SAlar we did not want to drive our own cars and therefore have booked tour with seven people. The tour included the trip to Isla Pescado, to train cemetery and lunch. Originally 200 Bolivianos / person we bargained to 170 Bolivianos.

name: Laguna Chiar Kkota (Laguna Negra)
description:
Nice spot overlooking the Laguna Chiar Kkota (Laguna Negra).

BTW  The launa route should be driven only with 4x4 vehicles and high clearance. The route is 400 km long with no options to buy grocery or fuel. The consumption is high due to the altitude (4000-5000 m).

name: Wildcamp
description: Nice and quiet spot. Starting from here you can drive Offroad to the place you like...

name: Gas Station & Water
description:
Gasoline and diesel at local price! 
Did even camp there a night, as i hit some fog at the evening.

name: Wild camp
description: Followed a narrow, off-camber and somewhat steep dirt track off main road.  Found a level spot that is just visible from one of the higher turns of the main road.  Would only attempt with 4wd and would avoid in any significant rain.

name: Wild camp near river
description: Wild camp down a dirt track off the main road.  Ends in a (currently) dry wash that drains to river in another 50m.  We parked here because there was no threat of rain and it was the only place out of sight of the road.  Still a little road noise, but private.  Easy access to very silt-laden river.  Recommend 4wd and avoid in rain.  Pretty rock for a tent, but you could make it work.  Free, no services.

name: Alojemento Loreno
description: Very simple hotel. Rooms situated around a private courtyard. No private bathrooms. Communal bathroom and restroom. Cold shower. Cars parked behind closed gate. We paid B$ 40 per night

name: El Chiquitano
description:
Gasoline and Diesel

NOTE - supply not guaranteed (seems like a normal gas station, don't know if this still applies? May 2019)

name: Cafe 1900
description: Very good fresh orange juice. Good coffee and Wifi. Touristinformation

name: Hotel Rosario
description: Every day Bolivian hotel. Friendly people. Reasonable beds. We paid 200,- a night for 3 people in a 4 bed room. Shower and toilet to be shared. Quite bad condition. Water hot only occasionally. They also had a room with two beds and private bathroom for 250 B$

name: Hotel El Posada
description: Very good place in the center of Sucre. Find it on Trip Advisor. High Landcruiser fits in parking.

name: Hostal San Miguel Arcangle - with motorcycle parking
description: Nice hostel in the centre of town on the square, 80B for a double room with shared bathroom, hot water, motorbikes could be parked in the courtyard for free

name: Camping Casa De Telegrafista
description: Beautiful campsite and hostel in the centre of La Higuera (village where Che Guevara was executed) at the former house of the telegrafist, run by a French couple. 20B per person for camping. Only solar power, no wifi, shower with hot water.

name: Hostal Siles
description: Clean hostel, friendly staff, good value for money, safe parking, kitchen, hot water ( electric showerhead), 120B for a double room with private bathroom (and towel, soap and toilet paper)

name: Hostal Bar La Magia de San Juan
description: Nice Hotel in Suan Juan, almost new, very clean, rooms with ensuite bathroom, nice warm beds, serve breakfast and dinner, 330 Bolivianos/room with breakfast (simple breakfast but ok)

name: Motocar
description: We had a number of broken parts on our motorcycles (plastic and steel) that needed repairs as a result of the corrugated roads through the South West Circuit of Southern Bolivia as well as faulty brakes. Mick (the owner) was very helpful and fixed everything up in only a few hours, he also drove us around to get the required parts and went out of his way to show us parts of the town in the process. Highly recommended.

name: Bushcamp In Tupiza Mountains, 4x4!!
description: Nice place between canyons about 4km outside of town. The place is called 'puerto del diablo'. Quiet and peaceful place with nice views of the 'Quebrada'.

name: Bush Camp on Side Of Road
description: We pulled off the A-31 and drove up the canyon looking for a place to camp.  This is a lovely spot with some nice geographic features, but it is right next to the road so some truck traffic does occur.  Free.

name: On The Way To "Death Road"
description: Gas station heading out of La Paz on the way to the "Death Road" and Coroico. They sold us gas "sin factura" for 7 Bol a liter.

name: La Paz El Alto Cable Car
description: Superior view all over La Paz for just a few Bolivianos. Buy a roundtrip ticket in the valley. Bring a coat for it is cold 400 meters up

name: Wild Camp Near North Entrance To Salar
description: The northern part of the Salar is beautiful. Clean, white salt, few tracks, and few Land Cruiser Tours. We entered at the Jirira entrance, drove about 5 miles and camped on the salt. We didn't see anyone.  We slept two nights on the Salar and exited at Colchani. This works particularly well at times of year (like in May) when there is no water on the salt flat and therefore it's not as important to get the undercarriage of your vehicle sprayed with the anti-corrosion mixture. This service is only available in Uyuni, as far as we know.

name: Wild Camp In Protected Valley
description: There are tracks to follow up into this valley with large boulders that provide some protection from the wind. The site is at 15100 feet (4600 meters) so it's very cold!

name: Salt Hotel
description: Salt hotel in the middle of the salt flat with international flags . All the tours come here for breakfast and lunch . You can try and camp here during the wet season as it’s the only place inside with dry land outside the islands. It’s March 4th , and it’s mostly dry but still wet at entrance . I was here in February and was completely wet. You can see what it looks like here in my YouTube video https://youtu.be/_PklViabMHk or www.youtube.com/alexchacon

name: NE Isla del Pescado, above Salt Flats
description: We chose to camp here to get out of the wind.  Good morning light (and beautiful sunrise view!).  Short walk to see sunset.  Free.

name: Akapana Hotel
description: Great place to stay in Tiwanaku. A room for 2 with private bath was 180 bolivianos. Showers are strong and hot. Breakfast included. It's just a block from the archeological site. Rosario, the owner, is very nice. Her English is very good since she lived in the U.S. for many years. Secure parking at the back of the hotel.

name: Undercarriage wash
description: We found this place to rinse off the salt from the undercarriage of our van.

name: Camp Next To Big Boulders And Rock Quarry
description: Nice and quiet bush camp.  Natural wind breaks from surrounding rocks.  Hidden and away from the road.  Our son loved playing in the piles of dirt and rocks.  Free.

name: Laverap
description: Good laundry place. Open monday-saturday 8am-1pm

name: Florin
description: Nice atmosphere, food and wifi was good. Burgers are 35-40 Bob (with blue cheese) salad are 30 -40 Bob (a bit expensive for what you have in your plate). And all the other main course are between 40-80 bob. The waitress told us that the owner doesn't allowed to charge your laptop. Wine was okay, coca beer (22bob) was excellent. Open on Sunday.

name: Gasolinera YPFB
description: No fuel for foreigners, not even for international price.

name: Hotel Lago Azul
description: Great hotel with motorcycle parking and warm clean rooms. They put heaters in each room so you are warm throughout the night. The showers are a little tricky to work with the instant heater on the shower head. We paid 100 bolivianos per person for a matrimonial room and 120 bolivianos for a single room. Breakfast is included with the room.

name: Residence Marian
description:
The best place in town. 50 or 60 B per person with basic breakfast. Shared bathroom. 

60 per person with private bathroom.

Secure gated parking across the road.

name: Ecolodge Los Flamingos
description: You can park and stay in the parking lot. Bathrooms 5 BOL, hot showers 20 BOL (only if they have available rooms)

name: 5 comentarios
description:
NOTE warning about fuel quality

A full stocked grocery store also with diesel and gasoline. Friendly owners. On weekends you can find vegetables and fruits 2 blocks from here at La Plaza

name: Patocchi
description:
Great food!!! This place has legit sauces and pastas and really tastes meats. And a very good "Swiss" Röschti too. Definitely a good place to go for some good flavor.
Very friendly and nice communicating owner couple!

name: Off Road Wildcamp
description: Wildcamp on the way from Sucre to Cochabamba or Samaipata. Off road, a little path that ends at some elektricity poles. Nice views and quiet at night.

name: Hotsprings San Javier
description: We camped at the hotsprings near San Javier. To enter the hotsprings it's 10BOL per person. There is a grassy parking space opposite of it. We asked the owner to camp for free, and he was OK with it. No other facilities

name: Wild Camp Behind Entrance ToroToro
description: Right behind the entrance arch of Torotoro nacional park there is a big grassy spot where we camped for 2 days while visiting the park. Not hidden from the road but after dark not a lot of traffic and people passing by where really friendly! Coordinates don't match, we forgot, it's just 2km further along the road.

name: Ñaupa House Hostel
description:
Nice hostal with beautiful patio where there is also nice restaurant. Double room with shared bathroom is 120Bol. We stayed in the car on the patio with use of all facilities for 70BOL (35 per person). Good Wifi, hot showers, little kitchen, friendly owners! 

The garden is shared with a restaurant, 2 bars and some stuff so it's kind of public. But we had no problems, the bars close at 12 or so, so its quite in the night. Good vegeterian restaurant, 20 bol for all you can eat lunch! The height is limited due to the entrance, not sure, maybe 2,50 meters or so.

name: Diésel La Paz
description:
A good general mechanic workshop specializing in diesel. They have a computer to check the problem and put a lot of interest in solving it


Un buen taller de mecánica general especialistas en diésel. Tienen ordenador para chequear el problema y ponen mucho interés en solucionarlo

name: Insurance Office
description: A place to buy insurance for Argentina most other southern countries of South America that require it. We paid $50US per Moto for 6 months liability coverage. Same price for cars

name: Balvar Servicio Técnico Automotriz
description: We only changed oil, but had very good recommendations from another overlander, who had his Land Rover fixed there. They are about to move to Calle 32 Final, n. 1104 - Cota Cota.

name: Surtidor San Pablo
description: After two gas stations refused to sell us diesel in La Paz because they didn't have the official price list for tourists and are strictly controlled, we were told to try in El Alto. This station actually sold by an intermediate price: Bs 5 (after negotiation).

name: Coqueza
description:
Mirador and mummies, the view of the salar is fantastic but the way up is appalling, sand, stones and holes is a shatters motor homes at the tourist office in the square we were told that the road was fixed and could climb without problems a lie to collect 30bv pp it costs rise. If you are fond of your vehicle better walk up or not go


Mirador y momias, la vista del salar es fantástica pero, el camino de subida es horroroso, arena, piedras y agujeros es un destroza motor homes, en la oficina de turismo de la plaza nos dijeron que el camino estaba arreglado y podíamos subir sin problemas, una mentira para cobrar los 30bv pp que cuesta subir. Si tienes cariño a tu vehículo mejor sube a pie o no vayas

name: Lubricantes Soto
description:
Diesel in drums, 5bv 

Diésel en bidón, 5bv preguntar porque lo tienen escondido

name: Playa Blanca
description:
24/03/2017 6Bs/l gasolina

Diesel for 5bps per litre if you haggle a bit!

name: Achira Resort
description: Here is the campground. The other sign signals where to leave the Highway. The first meters are very steep and not all cars will Marke it. So first check it before you enter. We were here in June in the no-season and toilets and Walter was closed. However wie could stay for one night.

name: Road Camp
description: at R4 West of San Jose. Left oft the entrance of a hazienda. Wie asked the owner which was no problem. But you hear the Street noise.

name: Outside La Paz
description: gas station that will fill up at 6 bolivianos per litro sin factura.  They also accept dollars

name: San Cristobal Gas
description:
Jan 2023: No USD or Credit Card

Jan 2023: No USD or Credit Card

Here you can buy gas, tourist prices though ( 9BS).  We were told this is the last gas station before the Ollague border into Chile.  A few feet from the town mercado. The only gas station between Uyuni and Calama. So be sure to stop here or have some spare fuel. 

At the border it is also possible to buy some gas from a private person. But wouldn’t count on this.  The guy is very friendly. Toilets are a no-go.

name: Morales
description:
Arreglo de Turbos, 
Turbo, Injection diesel, rapide et efficace

name: Gasolinera
description:
Diesel and gasoline in cans at Bolivian prices. Sometimes...
...
Diesel y gasolina en bidón a precio boliviano

name: Laundry
description:
Laundry service near Concepción: 12 pieces 30 Bv

12 prendas 30bv

name: Laguna Zapoco
description:
2 km from the village, Laguna Zapoco 
Is enabled for camping. Very quiet during the week. Price: 30bs per night (per car).

A 2 km del pueblo la laguna Zapoco esta habilitada para acampar. Muy tranquilo entre semana. Precio: 30bs por la noche (por auto).

name: Hotel La Cuna Crucena
description:
5 minute walk to the beautiful plaza. 
80BOB for double private rooms, shared bathroom. 
120BOB for double with ensuit and AC. 
Not sure if the host still Sells Gasoline for 5Bov the Liter

name: Salinas de Garci Mendoza
description: Gas station, pay no more than 5, clean gasoline and diesel.

name: lavamatico
description: self service laundrette. 40bs for a wash and dry. we brought a massive bag of washing and it was able to fit in one machine. Doesn't take too long, we sat and waited. there is wifi although we didn't ask for the password

name: Death Road
description:
NOTE -- there may be at least one more pay point half way up the road so keep your ticket and use that to maybe avoid paying twice

Paid 25 Bobs to drive up Death Road

name: Nissan - Servicing, Main Dealer
description:
This is the main Nissan service centre for Bolivia.
The head of servicing is Alexis who speaks good English.

We had a full service here and were very impressed, not ridiculously expensive either and pushed us ahead as we weren't in La Paz that long.

Highly recommended 

Alexis:
adelcarpio@nissan.com.Bo
796 75722

name: Quality batteries- Bosch, Helios etc
description:
Many, many battery shops in this area although most just sell names you've never heard of.

The lady here has a good stock of new/packaged bosch car/truck batteries up to about 75Ah. 

Haggled with us, 'sin factura' -20% with our old battery.

name: Exel Norte Oruro
description: We filled our tank and jerry can with gasoline for 5 bol/liter.

name: YPFB
description:
We tanked diesel for the foreign price.They didn't accept "sin factura". 

Could fill one Jerry can at local price

name: Potosi - Ruta 1
description:
First station coming from direction of Sucre.

6bol/l diesel sin factura direct in car tank. no problem

December 2023 - filled up for 3.72 bol/l diesel after giving 20 bol tip.

name: Villa Serrano police Station
description: Camped in front of police station. On street. Probably could have camped at Centro but heavy slope.  Quiet and safe at night, but they get up and start working around 6am

name: Zudanez
description: Paid 5bobs per litre.  Jerry cans at local price.

name: Hotel El Refugio - Mitru
description:
UPDATE: They now have wifi!

You can stay in the parking lot of this hotel.
Same price if you sleep in your vehicle our in a room (2 pers). Price is 80 bol/ night.
Shared bathroom with hot showers and towels. Kitchen for the guests, with an oven.
There is no wifi on site,  but you can acces via the lobby of the main Hotel Mitru  (500m away). You can also enjoy the swimming pool there for free.
The parking lot is not big.Only place available for a few vehicles. There is a narrow gate to access. For big rigs, be carefull: max height around 3,40m and wide around 2,40m.
If you go on a tour with the sister company Tupiza Tours (the office is in the main Mitru Hotel ) ,  you can leave your vehicle in the parking lot for free. A safe opportunity to visit Sud Lipez.

name: Vehicle Wash - Ruta 30 / Maria Elena Lavadoro
description:
An excellent place to get the van washed. Agua dulce (non-salt water) and very thorough clean of the underside as well as the rest of the outside. Gave the engine a blast as well. 140 bs for the wash. Also, when there were power cuts to the rest of the town, they had power. They also do laundry here and rent rooms. Additionally they have a good shower and provide potable water for motorhomes for free. 

Open from 8-17h Monday to Saturday. Sundays only half day.

For emergencies, appointments or questions call 74121061.

See more recent check-ins for pricing. They do treatment before/ wash after salar pricing as well.

name: Parque Cretácico
description: Longest dinosaur tracks in the world.  They cover the huge rock wall on the eastern side of the complex.

name: Aguas Termales de Polques
description: Nice hot springs and pool.  Lots of tour groups in the morning and at lunchtime but quiet in the afternoon and evening. pay for the ticket at the central building right opposite the changing rooms.

name: Thermal Springs Hostel
description: We were planning to camp at the hot springs however a park ranger told us camping is prohibited in the park at this time due to the cold weather. He even told our friends in their enclosed vehicle that they couldn't camp, but they did. Hostel is packed with people from the tours but they had a room out the back for us. We used our own bedding and were warm all night. 20 Bolivian per person per night. It got down to minus 18. Toilet is basic, but there is a better one at the building next door for 3 Bolivian. They allowed us to heat food in their kitchen.

name: YPFB - Grupo Colque
description: Gas station, sold us Nafta at a reduced price when we stated we didn't need a receipt.

name: Banco Union
description: Able to get large sums of Bolivianos or USD over the counter. You can ask for Javier in targeta de credito department second floor. They do charge a fee, but better than having to do multiple ATM transactions. GPS location on map slightly off, bank is on the next corner.

name: Start/end Of The Death Road-
description:
Locals recommended we go up the road from Coroico, so you are on the inside of the road. Wait until after 230pm so the bike riders are done. We did it and loved it.

Comment: took RN25 and RT40 to get to Coroio.By far road of death is the best scenery and IS a thrill and not a Sunday drive. 1530 start time is the key traveling up hill from Coroio as you have more vehicular control... downhill you will be constantly braking. you drive on the opposite side of the road to normal as does everybody else.....one barrier stop asking for toll money but I took 2 locals who were hitching to thier house which seemed to qualify for gratis passage ...The other tolls mentioned are scams. I drove by as the barriers were up.

name: Marias Lugar
description:
We spent a couple of days at this Place. There is like a big garage for two or three cars (max. height 2.6m). You can sleep in the car and use the bathroom with warm shower, the kitchen and the washing machine. You also can sleep in a nice double bedroom for 70 Bolivianos per night and room. Similar you will pay if you sleep in the car. The owner Maria is really helpful and is a Spanish teacher. You can also take spanish classes for 35 Bolivianos per hour per person. To the historic center you need by foot about 10 minutes. Nearby are a lot of good and cheap restaurants. The direction is: Majta Khapaj# 51, Sucre. There's no sign and it's rather a rented room in a private house than a hostel, but nice.
To contact the owner in advance: marymtgdo85@hotmail.com
Big rigs can park in a parking nearby: ask the owner.

name: Control policial CORRUPTO/ CORRUPT police station
description:
There is a police control in every toll station, and they asked us for 5 bs in all of them. But in this one they asked us for 60 bs!! Of course we sent them to fly!

En todos los peajes hay un control policial, y todos nos pidieron 5 bs. Pero este nos pidio 60 bs!!!!!! Los mandamos a freir espárragos!

name: Casa de las guias, Sorata
description: This is a good place to find a guide to hike around the area, Laguna Glaciar, Mapiri or Llampu circuit. The guides mostly speak Spanish but are very nice and charge about 300Bs per day for their services. If you want to book before you get there, try Mario on 73241480 or trekkingsorata@gmail.com (you will have more luck with the telephone as the internet there is poor).

name: Hostel Panchita
description: Simple place to stay and park if you don't think your vehicle will make it to Oasis down the road. They charge 70bs for a double room with shared bathroom. Very nice hot showers. Plus 10Bs for a car in secure parking around the back. You can leave the car there for a few days if you go trekking at 10Bs per night. Internet is slow but ok. The parking lot is big enough for most sized rigs inside, the only restriction in the height. Up to about 3m should be fine (we were fine in a westy plus roof racks with 4 surf boards). You can use the kitchen but pay 4Bs for gas.

name: Aduana Sucre - TIP extension
description: Aduana for vehicle paperwork

name: Las Petas Wild Camp Ruta 10
description: Near by the street. Very quiet in the night. Near Las Petas (5km)

name: La Vispera - Hotel
description:
Very clean. Organic vegetables and salads for free. Nice showers, if you shower one at a time, a fully functional equipped kitchen for the campers. but no real level camping area for Overlanders. Restaurant with delicious food "fresh and organic" and herb shop (prepare tea, marmalades, oils). Also  cabins for rent (2,4,7 or 12), space for tents. Reception is open 8 am to 5 pm (after which they lock the gate; guests get a key). The owners are sweet and competent Bolivian-Dutch family. 50 BOB pp plus 50 per camper. Free Electricity, and organic herbs during your stay. Also enjoy the village view, a native park with eucalyptus and pines. Free Library during your stay with great options. 

Be aware that the last 800 metres of access road are rough/bad. High clearance is definitely a plus. Locals drive up in standard 2WD cars but you need to be careful and drive slowly. 
As a reference: I checked the time we needed to drive down into town today. It took us 6 minutes and we’re driving with a Unimog. Uphill will probably take a bit longer.

name: Villa Serrano. Football Pitch.
description: Very quiet place. 10 min by feet to center

name: Ricardo And Esteban
description: Motorcycle mechanics just outside city center. Friendly, knowledgeable, good prices.

name: Private House
description:
If you don’t get gasoline at this location, don’t despair. Ask around. Somebody in this town will find gasoline for you. Expect to pay almost double the local rate. We were grateful to pay the price.
.....
Brick house with red metal gate, no sign. To the right of a little store. Sold us 120l at 5bol. There are a few houses near by that also sell gasoline and diesel.  Friendly town.  Ask people!

name: SENASAG
description: Here's the whole deal, you go to a vet in the town to update the deparasitization medicine, pay 277 B at the national bank near the cathedral at the city center (good luck finding it) an come here to get the papers. They are only valid for 10 days so that determines your Salar and Laguna itinerary. We were also asked to specify the exiting border post.

name: Veterinaria La Madriguera
description: Very friendly vet. Got deparasitation done for 80bol. Internal/external since it needs to be within 30 days in order to get the senasag certificate to travel to Chile. The other vet was closed during lunch hours.

name: Banco Union
description: For Zoosanitary certificate from Senasag had to pay 50Bol here. Needed passport.

name: Monte Roca YPFB
description: Sold gasoline at official price (8.68 bols per litre)

name: YPFB
description: Busy gas station but they were very helpful filling our large gas tanks on our motorcycles, even with foreign plates and no paperwork. We paid the higher price but it was worth it to have a full tank.

name: Termas de Obraje
description:
These are the right coordinates for the baths. People told us it was allowed to stay on the parking. There also is a playground but no other amenities.
 Prive bath 15 pp Open from 06.30-18.30

name: Yunguyo/Copacabana Border Crossing, Bolivian side
description:
The Bolivian side of the border crossing is  closed from 13:00 to 14:00  (Bolivian time). Easy and small border. 

Entering Bolivia:

Park on right side of road after going through stone arch. 

First go to migration and get stamped in (see check in from @opusonthemove below for VISA requirements for citizens of USA and other countries needing it) 

Then go to Aduana. You will need to fill out Form No 250 on your phone using a QR code (standard customs declaration). There is an open wifi network. For the vehicle TIP, If you have found Formulario No 249a on the Aduana website beforehand, completed the form and brought a printed copy, things will go very quickly. Officer just reprinted the form and stamped it. Link to form: http://anbsw01.aduana.gob.bo:7401/sivetur/Parametro.jsp

IMPORTANT: there is no insurance available right at this border (neither for Peru nor for Bolivia) NOTE recent addition of place to get Peru insurance near the border. Can walk or take a local taxi. See separate entry on ioverlander.   On the Bolivian side, the police checks the insurance right at the border. NOTE - it is said that NO INSURANCE NEEDED if you stay in Bolivia less than 30 days, and the official can give you a paper that states this..  insurance not available in Copacabana. Or may be able to  get the insurance online: speiserseguros.com.ar. (All vehicles)
mapfre.cl (only for Chilean vehicles: Insurance valid for Peru, Bolivia, Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay & Paraguay.)

name: Ollague, Chile to Estacion Avaroa, Bolivia
description: Entering Chile, as usual a lengthy process. Migrations went fast, then aduana took very long. Seems like there is not enough staff, also very chaotic officers running around from trucks to cars to the building, processing different people at the same time. Resulting in that we had to wait for 20 extra minutes (whilst vehicle was already inspected, and the officer said we are good to go) to get our BICYCLE registered, according another aduana officer.. come on. Chileans just love bureaucracy. In total it took about 1:15 hours. Have had better border crossings.

name: Visviri, Chile to Charana, Bolivia
description: just visited it, Chilean side was very formal, No fruit and veggies in! Bolivian side was sleeping.

name: Yacuiba, Bolivia to Tartagal, Argentina
description: Standard crossing procedure.

name: Putina, Peru to Puerto Acosta, Bolivia
description:
This road is not the route you should follow if you're crossing between Tilali and Puerto Acosta. We did immigration at Tilali, followed the signs to the aduana, then single track cross country (road doesn't show on ioverlander) to Puerto Acosta.

Crossed August of 2007.  Aduana on the Bolivian side, just before the town of Puerto Acosta.  
Police in  Puerto Acosta said that there was no immigrations.

name: Bush Camp
description: Not much on the way from Sucre but here is open area with plenty of bushes to hide you from the road. Could be suitable for both camping and staying in truck. Can hear the occasional passing truck but otherwise quiet. Area is very clean please take everything with you.

name: Reserva Nacional Entrance
description: If. You are kicked out around the Laguna Verde, as happened to us, this is a nice place to camp, behind the Refugio, to cut the wind...Said to be the only legal place to camp around the Laguna.

name: Police Check Point
description: We wanted to enter Salar Uyuni here when we where stopped by military and a women from the tourism office. After a quick check of our papers the military guy wanted to let us pass and adviced us not to go any further than the Dakar monument because of the water. However, when we were about to leave the tourism lady came and told us it is forbidden to stay at the salar by our selves and that it is also no allowed to sleep there (which is also obviosly a lie). The reason for this is that at the moment there is too much water. When I asked her if we could just follow the dozens of tour cars she said that they are not allowed to take us. The only way we are allowed to go is (oh wonder) with a guide who is here at the entrance of the salar. As they didn't want to let us pass I got really upset because obviosly this is some kind of scam. After a long talk to other tour cars who were passing by and said they couldn't be our guides we accepted our fate and went to the main attractions with the guide the tourism lady hat told us (400bob). The guide was nice and she also right away noticed that this wasn't what I wished for. She told me that at 3pm the tourism lady leaves the checkpoint and that we could enter then following the routes she showed us. Long story short I am conviced this was/is a scam, which could be avoided if you enter just after 3 o'clock.

name: San Augustin Roadside
description: Parked on a flat area next to the road. Nice and quiet. The villagers seemed friendly.

name: Rock Camp
description: Could be a nice place to spend the night sheltered by beautiful rock formations.

name: Andean Fauna National Reserve Ticket Office
description: Entrance fee 150 BOB per person. ONLY CASH! CLP and USD are also accepted. You have to pay this fee for driving further north.

name: Taller Mechnico
description:
Excellent mechanic. Steady stream of tour Land Cruisers coming by for work. Real professionals.

We had startup problems with our Sprinter and Mario knew how to solve the issue. Apparently, he has a big team of people working in the shop. He looks like he knows what he does and he has a lot of experience. Nice and friendly guy too :)

name: Nissan authorized mechanic
description: our pathfinder have full service here and change the brake pad here, good price and the boss speak English

name: Between Colchani and Uyuni
description: Go under railway bridge and park on edge of the Salar. This is also an alternative way onto the Salar (see tuckstruck note below on the access to the Salar - not recommended)

name: Laguna Capina Wildcamp
description: Nice spot with some protection from the wind. Very cold at night for us.

name: apart Hotel
description:
USD 21 for a small room with bathroom, you can park the car in the hotel, very secured. walking distance to the center. 
German help us buy the gas because most of Gas Station didn't sell gas to foreigners

name: football ground Camp
description: just park next to the highway, in a football ground

name: San Matías Aduana
description: Need to get/hand in your vehicle import permit here.

name: Mechanic
description: A mechanic opposite Casa Suissa. They were very good and we are hoping that they may have managed to finally fix an ongoing suspension problem.

name: Taller El Chile no - open now!
description:
Walter is the owner, a great guy eager to help we fix the roof. It is dedicated to metal structures and mechanics in general. He works a lot with 4x4. Being very economic is very professional, which is greatly appreciated by these homes ... The one we recommend NOT to go this street camacho, between Mexico and Uruguay.

Walter es el dueño, un gran tipo con ganas de ayudar nos arreglo la baca después de que el peor soldador del mundo nos la destrozara mientras supuestamente la arreglaba. Se dedica a estructuras metálicas y mecánica en general. Trabaja mucho con 4x4. Siendo muy económico es muy profesional, lo que se agradece enormemente por estos lares...El que recomendamos NO ir esta en la calle camacho, entre México y Uruguay.

name: Residencial Costanera
description: A cheap place to stay with reasonably secure parking (50B pp). Some showers are hot - others aren't (ask for room 202). Good location on the water. Note.. one bed had a sharp spring sticking out of the mattress. Watch yourself.

name: North of Villamontes, 3  west of the N9
description: grasssite near a dirt road to a small river.

name: Automobil Club de Bolivia
description: A balneario of the Automobil Club de Bolivia. Its near the highway to Montero,  1km after the airport  on the left side of the road.
