At the backsite there is room to park a camper near the banos. You can stay there for Bol 50 a night. There is a toilet, water, electricity and a cold shower.

name: cementerio antiguo con momias
description:
Adobe pantheons with mummies inside all over the valley opening up to the sunrise. They are on both sides of the road. Free visit

panteones de Adobe con momias en el interior en todo el valle con apertura hacia el amanecer. están a ambos lados de la carretera. visita libre

name: valle Precioso
description: Beautiful valley with river, rising and alpacas

name: Customs San Matias
description: Slept at guarded car park of the customs

name: Police San Ignacio
description: Slept in front of the police station, shower and toilet inside the station

name: Bush camp Salar de Uyuni
description: Bush camp near the Isla Incahuasi

name: Station De Servicio
description: Gas sometimes sold here to foreigners for 8.68B per liter. No paperwork.

name: Hostel El Carretero
description: Cheap. Loads of character. Centrally located. Hot showers. Kitchen. Awesome communal space in a 4-floor terrarium with tons of light coming in from the ceiling. Groovy neighbourhood. And if you've got a small motorbike (or are especially skilled with a big one) you can park it in the lobby. 35 or 45 per person depending on bathroom choice 50 for a private ensuite.

name: hostal oasis
description:
Rooms with private bathroom, heating, hot water

habitaciones con baño privado,  calefacción,  agua caliente

name: zona arqueológica
description:
Next to the road you can see some square mounds that were / are pre-Inca tombs

al lado de la carretera se pueden ver unos montículos cuadrados que eran /son tumbas preincaicas

name: Hidden Lagoon
description: Camped just over the hill from the large lagoon, looking for some shelter from the wind. The black rocks were radiating some warmth and the place seems hidden from the road. Beautiful little lagoon with flamingos. Freezing at night. There are quite a few trenches in the ground. Be careful driving down. Wouldn't recommend the drive in the dark.

name: hostal copacabana
description:
We have not gone, we have seen it happen. But these areas are good to know!

no hemos ido, lo hemos visto al pasar. pero por estas zonas esta bien saberlo!

name: Sampaya Outdoor Equipment
description:
At number 807 of this street is this store with mountaineering products. boots, sacks, camping gas, etc ...

en el número 807 de esta calle esta esta tienda con productos para montañismo. botas, sacos, camping gas, etc...

name: top Service (aceites para auto de todo tipo)
description:
Oil of all kinds

aceite de todo tipo (conseguimos semisintetico!)

name: filtros y baterías
description:
Filters and batteries. The manager Javier very nice. Can be consulted by WhatsApp, number + 59178957009

filtros y baterías. el encargado Javier muy simpático. se le puede consultar por WhatsApp, número+59178957009

name: Camping Dos Rios
description: Camping on the left hand side of the road direction Caranavi. Earlier than it is marked on the map! Swimming pool and playroom.

name: Gasolinera
description:
Chilean plates OK. US plates were not able to get gas.
.....
la hemos visto, no hemos parado

name: Spot near a lake on the road to Potosi
description: A lovely wild camping spot out of sight of the road. Peaceful.

name: Las Huellas de Dinosario
description: These are footprints you can touch! A 45 minute walk in from the carpark and a lady there will charge you 20 Bob per person. We enjoyed finding them ourselves.

name: Parking for Las Huellas de Dinosario
description: It is a rough track to get here. It might be almost impassable in the wet season. 4wd recommended. It is about a 45 minute walk from here.

name: Wild camp on Las Huellas de dinosario track
description: Parked up for the night by the side of the track. Great view of Sucre and only other vehicle to go by was the school bus in the morning. No facilities. Further up the road there are some rough bits and I would hesitaste to drive it in the wet season.

name: One of very few wild camps between Corpico and Guanay
description: On this rough road stretch there are almost no nice wild camps to find. This spot (right at the bridge drive down, fort the creek, within 80m you'll be there) is quiet, relatively well hidden from road, with "swimming" pool beside, 4x4 track is dead end so no passing cars and persons. West of Guanay it eill be easy to find many fine wild camps but the road is 4x4 only and very slow to travel. Have fun!

name: 4x4 Camp with view on Sajama overlooking deep gorge
description: A wild camp close to the road but hidden from traffic. You will enjoy a good view on Sajama and the perfect sunset location. The camp is on rocky terrain and right on a colourful deep gorge. Access is about 400 meters from the west: head up the sterp little track just where the roads savety railing starts. Drive crosscountry to the gorges edge. (It's not a savety railing it is a water drainage chanel / about 200 m further west a track heads up in a right angle to the same spot)

name: Sajama NP Second Entrance
description:
North entance gate to National Park with good info board
Beautiful national park with very few tourists. 
I recommend driving around vulcano Sajama and exiting through the second entrance gate. It's a gravel road but can easily be done with any vehicle.

name: Road barrier !
description: The road up to volcan Uturunco is closed with a iron barrier at this point. Motor cycles can get around it. If you are an excellent offroad driver with a light and well equipped 4x4 (and a bit nuts as well) you could drive around it (maybe). In Quetena Chica you can organize a key and you have to hire a guide as well. The road to the highest point is not very steep, graded and only at 5630m is a tricky and steep passage. A strong car will master it. The walking track to the top is easy to find and technically very easy.

name: A real and huge Ghost town
description: PUEBLO FANTASMA: a huge area of a colonial mining town. Churchrs, buildings and streets but no mining equipment to see. Good spot for a break or camp (at 4681mts). Some kms west you pass a post where everybody has to pay 15.- Bol/person. A fascinating spot!

name: Canyon not unlike monument valley
description: A fascinating canyon with bizare rock formations. One of the best sceneries we have seen in Bolivia. If you are not afraid of flash floods you will find very nice camping spots in the canyon.

name: Chulpa Pukara (polycromas)
description: Some of the nicest and most colorful Chulpas we have seen in Bolivia

name: Chullpas Huanuni Cachu
description: Easy accessible Chullpares with interpretive sign

name: Aduana National (DAB)
description:
NOTE -  2 OCT 18: IF YOU ARE GOING TO GET YOU VEHICLE EXTENDED, ADUANA WILL NOT ACCEPT THE "30 DIAS" STAMP. YOU HAVE TO MAKE A COPY OF YOUR PASSPORT AND IMMIGRATION TICKET ONE ONE PAGE AND HAVE THEM STAMP IT WITH THE OFFICIAL IMMIGRATION STAMP AND SIGN IT.

see photo

1. Go through gates and and turn left and park.
2. Enter main building and turn left, go to second set of windows
3. Dial 175 from one of the phone and tell them you need to extend your vehicle. Someone will come down. 
Copies needed
1. Immigration extension stamp as described above
2. Immigration ticket you received at the frontier
3. Passport photo page
4. Immigration sticker (If applicable usa)
5. immigration stamp from entering the frontier.

name: Tienda Silvia
description:
We left our camper in their locked garden beside her shop and house for three days, while we stayed at Isla del Sol. We payed 20 B per day. There is a toilet.
Sleep in car same price. Nice family. Place only for one camper up to 7.5m.

name: Maya Hostel
description:
- Bs140 for double room with share bathroom,  Bs280 with private bathroom 
- Bs20 for car parking 
- close to centre 
- wifi only available in common area

name: Utama Hostel
description:
- Double room with bathroom Bs100, without bathroom Bs60
- Hot shower 
- Good view of lake Titicaca & sunrise

name: La Casona
description:
nice hotel 2yrs old good breaky
close to main square

name: Alojamiento El Ocaso
description: Very basic cheap hospedaje with parking for one or two small motorbikes. Hot shower. Near some restaurants. 50 bs pp plus 5 more for parking. No WiFi.

name: Parking lot at flower fields, free
description: If you follow the dirtroad down to the valley, Right below camping Colibri (where dogs are not permitted) there's a parking lot where the local flower farmers park their cars during the day. At night it's very quiet and the views up to the cliffs are amazing. The farmers are very friendly. There are no facilities. We loved it! The road down is a bit steep but we made it with our 42 year old VW, so i guess most of the travellers will have no problems!

name: Calle Lanza Parking Lot
description:
Parking of the "House of lawyers "
Price update 03/2024: 40 bols during the day, 30 bols during the night
Secured and closed.
Quiet at night. Very close to the center.
Big rig friendly up to 3,65 m

name: Hostal La Carcel
description: Lucky find, grassy pitch (quite long grass) 30 Bob pp. 50bob for a dorm bed with straw mattress. Elec shower heads (haven't tried them yet) No wifi. Had best meal we have had for a while in the restaurant in the square (walk straight up road to square and restaurant is on left at far end of square). Free wifi at restaurant. Some power outlets at far end of covered area but did not try. Excellent for 1 night stop.

name: hotel inti
description: 120 bobs for private room and shared bathroom for my partner and i, including secure parking for motorcycle. clean place, friendly owners, only Spanish spoken. 5 min walk from tourist centre. lightning fast tinternet. nice gaff

name: Quetena Chico main place
description:
We spent one night here on our way to Laguna Colorado and San Pedro .
Very quiet . 2 tiendas and a restaurant very closed , which is a lot in this very remote location

name: Estacion De Bombeo Taterenda
description: A guarded compound with a large grassy area in front of it mostly hidden from the road and quite well lit. Dark by the time we got here, asked if we could stay and they were happy to let us stay just outside the fence. Perfect spot if you get stranded in the dark.

name: Police Check Point
description: Have to Show papers. Don't pay anything, or just take a side road to avoid it.

name: animal pens
description: Stone animal pens sheltered from wind for tents and motorbikes.

name: Laguna Colorada Hostels
description: If you don't fancy camping, rooms are available here. Several places available one had hot water showers. We paid 50bs pp for a 4 bed dorm.

name: Colonia Real Hotel
description:
3* hotel, private bath with great shower, cable TV, good wifi. Moto parking in foyer or there is a parking lot next door.

140Bs for single room with breakfast.

name: YPFB
description: Bought gas at local rate of 3.7Bs/litre and gave the guy a tip and were all good to go.

name: Pampa camping
description: Many sites to camp before crossing the  border to Chile, great view of Mt Sajama and hundreds of llamas. Quiet, free.

name: Quarry
description: Good overnight spot, mostly hidden from view.

name: Chocolate Para Ti
description: This chocolate factory now has several locations in the town, but the selection is the same. We love chocolate and this shop does not impress us. The flavors are weak, and only one piece of dark chocolate. Our favorite was the white chocolate and lime. In general really sweet. If you like milk chocolate, maybe you will like the chocolate. Prices from 2 Bob to 4,5 Bob per piece (not cheap). The Alfajores is good. They have hot chocolate, but it varies s just ordinary.

name: Smoothie Stands
description: Huge food market with everything you will need. Fruits vegetables meat fish and all other stuff. Very cheap and very fresh. Open all days without Sundays

name: Surtidor
description: Don't accept sin factura. 8,5 bolivianos for gasoline.

name: Breakfast Food Stands
description:
Around the square (where homemade bread is sold) there is a mercado with small food stands. Mostly fried chicken with rice, jello treats, empanadas and hamburgers.

Affordable dining if on a budget. 
5 bols: small hamburger and fries 
4 bols: chicken empanadas

name: Road Entrance To Espejillos Waterfalls
description: Beautiful nature reservoir with waterfalls and river pool in the middle of the jungle. From here it is about 18km on a bad 4wd road. Also big 30m river crossing needed. Great fun but be careful. The reservoir has a camping where you can stay for 10B per person.

name: Cibau Pet Store
description: Have high quality food and toys for pets

name: Migration Office, Visa Extension
description:
Place to extend visa 

This is where to extend your 30 day entry stamp visa. opens at 800am expect a full day here .NO parking anywhere near only parking is at Red Skyrailway station and walk.

UPDATE: recently it's taken most people 5-10 minutes to extend tourist visa stamp.

name: Estancia Caraya
description: Old farmhouse 1552 and museum. You stay at the square. Us$ 10 or 70 Bol. From the 1 iT is 10 km.

name: Wild Camp 10m Off Potosi-Sucre Road
description: Small piece of flat land looking out over the river (dry when we were there). It's a gravel layby - if you go downhill and left at the bottom of the layby there is a flat area looking out on the river. Hidden from the road but you can still hear the traffic (traffic dropped off/stopped after 10.30pm). Not many places round here so a good find. Warm with a good breeze when we were here.

name: Flat Spot By Quiet Dirt Road
description: Slept a night here. Friendly local shepherds and farmers stopped by for a chat. Good for roof tent / camper, not for tents (rough ground). 4wd not needed. No wind when we were here but not sheltered so wouldn't be good in high wind. Beautiful view of lake and snowy mountains for sunrise.

name: Dead end road
description: Dead end road close to the paved one leading to Potosi, but separated from it by a hill. Quiet and road noise free. Should be possible to tent camp, but ground is a bit rocky. After periods of heavy rain some parts of the spot might be submerged making it impossible to accomodate big rigs.

name: Hostal Marjor
description: ok place to stay. rooms 80 bobs for a twin. Wi-Fi. motorcycle parking inside.

name: Alojamiento Rofrely - Cabanas
description: Just about 10 minutes outside town with several cabana options. Electric showers,  sufficiently equipped kitchen and a pool. There is minimal street side parking (our truck barely fit) and the cabanas, although very quaint, are quite rustic.

name: Hotel Milton
description: Quirky hotel right up close to the downtown action. Don't let the 1960s architecture put you off, rooms are spacious and those facing south east have killer views. Quad room for 400 Bs. sepatate parking on same street for 30 Bs for 24 hrs.

name: Landhaus Restaurant and Camping
description:
A good Restaurant with Camping, where we ate very good Steaks. A beautiful campground with electricity and water and new amenities.
NOTE - Map Marker is at the front gate. Camping area is through the gate and around to the left behind the restaurant.
A very clean and smart area! The owner Don Sergio is super-friendly and very helpful. 
e-mail:  serzalles@yahoo e-mail 

Rigs with black and grey tanks can dump directly through the top of the septic tank but wash water is not available unless you carry it in buckets.

12kg load washing machine costs 10 Bol and normal cycle takes 80 minutes. No dryer..

Good lighting at night

Update: 
-There is WIFI now and the signal is pretty good.
-The new showers are very good with hot water and good pressure.


PETS - those with pets should know there are at least 5 large dogs resident (and one tiny one) and a boxer-cross (???)  is inclined to be sometimes aggressive towards visitors and workers so take it carefully.

name: Bolivian Customs - Aduana for Vehicles
description:
This is for the vehicle (Aduana).
January 2023: Open and working. 
Directly after comes the ticket office for the park, 150bol for the park entrance (ONLY CASH in US dollar, Chilean peso or Bolivianos)

name: Wild Camp In Canyon
description: Nice quiet spot.... Protected enough from the wind. A family of what we think are chinchillas kept us amused in the evening

name: Wild Camp By Rocks
description: Driving along the ruta 5 SW from Rio Grande you'll see a rocky outcrop on your right hand side. Drive across the scrub and find a place behind the rocks so you're protected from the wind. We had a lovely evening as the sun went down and we watched three separate electrical storms spread across the far horizon. Very quiet. Free.

name: Casero las Cabanas
description: Big park with cabanas. They do not usually do camping, but we were driving around looking for a spot for some time and ended up here. The care taker is called Weimar.

name: Chipaya
description: Incredible place . Don't know if is marked in the tourist guides but is an exceptional place with a very interesting vernacular architecture. Ask for Guzmán. He let us park in his "backyard" . Payed 50 bs as a thank you since he didn't charge us at all.  Right next to the main plaza.

name: Monticulo Apart Hotel
description: 310 for a double and 350 for a triple with two bedrooms, a separate living space, private bathroom and private kitchen. The electricity is out at the moment but we are assured there are two wifi networks. Parking for 6+ bikes or a small truck/van. Quiet neighborhood. Breakfast included. Haven't yet stayed here but wanted to put it up as another option in the city.

name: Casa Skyways B&B
description: Cannot recommend this place highly enough. Lovely bright common areas, modern but comfortable rooms, clean kitchens and bathrooms. The outdoor areas are even nicely landscaped. Quiet neighborhood. Great place to relax or get work done. Wifi is fast as long as everyone isn't on it, but even then it still works well enough. The owners and staff are extremely welcoming, nice and very helpful. Breakfast (included) is delicious: fried egg, toast, coffee/tea, fresh juice and fresh fruit salad.You could park a low clearance truck/van or 4 motorcycles in their on-site parking area. 5 minute walk to park and nearby restaurants and shops. 30-40 minute walk to the touristy area or 15-18 Bol taxi (they will gladly call one for you). Definitely book ahead (bookings.com) as they have great ratings and a great reputation (we're here in the rainy season and they've been fully booked every night).

name: Consultores De Seguros S.A.
description:
2231 Calle Sanchez Lima
Courtier en assurance

name: boulder field next to Laguna Turquin
description: take a track from the main road to the lake. It will bring you to the hill with some boulders and view on the lake. Seems more people come here. One tour jeep spotted when we were there.

name: Tinguipaya
description: Amazing and authentic valley worth de detour from road between Potosí and Oruro. Incredible views of natural landscapes (canyons and valleys), small towns, llamas, and the incredible tinguipaya culture. Need 4x4 from Tinguipaya to Ventilla. We calculate it's maybe a 5 hrs tour (stopping to take pictures)

name: Wild Camping Near Macha
description: Nice place to spend the night near Macha. Surrounded by bushes, close to a small local road (cars and trucks pass by, not that many.) The only person that we saw was a man looking at his livestock. Nice and safe. Look out for the ants in the grass. They bite.

name: Wild Camp Between Tinguipaya-Maragua
description: Nice place near a small town to spend de night. A hill hides the camper from the town

name: Hotel Villa Fuerte
description: We paid 150 Bol for a triple (she came down from 180, said the normal price was 210). Single is 80 Bol. Basic, a little rough around the edges, though. Hot shower, but no shower curtain-type-of-place. Wifi is good enough to surf, probably not to upload anything, though. Parking across the street that could probably accommodate trucks. Parking inside the hotel for 5+ bikes. We had to take our cases off to get through the doors but our friend with soft luggage squeezed right in. Plenty of eating options nearby.

name: Hostal Naval
description: Friendly, clean, hostal in LA Paz. close to the stadium and the Parque central. nice neighborhood. walking distance to Parque central and the raised boardwalk to the central market. Good location in LA Paz. Some parking but only for small cars or motorcycles. Nanava 1874, Miraflores Centro, LaPaz. Paid $ US 37.00 for a room with 2 beds and private bathroom. Spa & sauna also.

name: Rock Formations
description: Amazing spot, no amenities.  South of Laguna Vinto. Coolest formations so far. Stellar rock climbing/bouldering.

name: Public Toilette and Hot Showers, Lavandería
description: We only used the hot showers, they are wonderful!! 15 Bol pP.

name: Incallajta
description:
A lot of ruins of a formal Inca city. It's a pity, as they don't get financial support like Machu Picchu does, they don't have the money to restore the place, but it's well maintained. There is one guide at the entrance explaining the site on a map (most probably Spanish only!) and if you like, he also comes with you to the ruins. The place is nice and interesting. You can walk along the ruins and there are a lot of signs explaining what you see and for what the buildings were used for and the best: you gonna be alone up there No crowds. 
Entry fee 25bol pP.

name: N.P Torotoro
description:
We only found out here that to see the park you HAVE TO hire a guide, which per tour costs (if you take him with you in your car!)  100 bol/tour. There are generally about 3 tours which you could make: Canyon +el vergel (+- 5h),  the caves and the ciudades de itas, which is 21km hard ripio drive (Aprox 1h drive one way). Each of the tour is 100bol. They don't do more than 1 tour/day except the caves, which are on the way of the ciudad de itas. Additionally you pay Park entry 100bol pP which is valid 4 days.  You could also go with a group and pay for transportation, but it seems with this a tour then rise u
p for even 100 bol pP. You can arrange your group of max 6 persons and share the costs. You have to hire a guide also for the Dino tracks on the river   and the tortuga cemetery.

name: Pottery Village
description: They sell fine handmade Pottery (barro/cerámica) here; no real market, just ask or knock on any door, they'll have some for you ;-)

name: Julio Rosales V.
description: May make some very occasional mistakes, but worked extremely hard to rectify them to a high quality.

name: Duchas Paraiso
description:
10bs for 15 minutes, 5 cabins. Hot water.
Edit: They charge per shower and not per person, so sharing is possible.
20 minutes of bath = 15 BOB
15 minutes of shower = 10 BOB (nov. 2022)
There is the option to use only the bathroom/toilet for 1 BOB.
.....
Edição: Eles cobram por chuveiro e não por pessoa, então é possível dividir. 

20 minutos de banho = 15 BOB
15 minutos de banho = 10 BOB

Há a opção de usar apenas o banheiro/vaso sanitário por 1 BOB.

name: Sandy camp
description: Wild camp among wild grasses and yellow flowers, some 300m from the artificial lake. Lots of sand, close to a dirt road with almost no traffic.

name: San Martin Gas
description: Sold us gasoline for local price, but would only fill jerry cans.

name: Capitania del Puerto Villarroel
description:
Ask here if you are looking for a boat heading North (e.g. to Trinidad). It is relatively easy to find a passanger boat, but when it comes to cars it ia another story. We were told that between January and March 2016 not even one ship arrived, which could take them, so one would need luck to get anywhere.

Next to the capitania there is the port, where for 150bs they will load a 4x4 on a ship, once you have the documents from the capitania.

name: Servicentro
description: Sells gas at local prices, but only 40L (to buy more you need bolivian id). May need to talk a bit before they agree. Only jerry cans.

name: YPFB
description: Filled up jerry cans for local price.

name: Surtidor San Ignacio
description:
Filled up jerry cans for local price.
Regularly runs out of diesel with massive lines of hours waiting. Don’t take your last chances here.

name: Mennonite Pueblo
description: Small village with some Amish presence, bar, shop and a pension.

name: Municipial recreational park
description: 90% finished construction, no maintenance (stay clear from the toilets). Popular with anglers in the afternoon (has artificial water reservior). Otherwise quiet and peaceful. Roofed places where one can pitch a tent, places to seat and grill. Free of charge.

name: Isla del Sol
description:
Nice Island! 
Accommodation: In Yumani you will find lot's of hostels, all seem to be more or less the same price (80bobs pP for private room with showers and breakfast, 50bobs pP same without breakfast y 30BOBs pP for double room with shared bathroom, without breakfast). 

Transfer: we went one way ticket Copacabana - Yumani (20bob pP) and the next day from Yumani to Challapampa (25bobs pP) and from there we walked approx 3 1/2h back to Yumani (path closed at the moment due to local conflict). You can also do it the other way round or go directly to Challapampa. 

If you don't want to carry all your luggage the trail: you can leave it for free at the restaurant directly at the harbour, before the inka stairs. 

Boats leave from Copacabana to Yumani at 8. 30 and 1.30. Going back it's 10.30, 3 and 4 pm. 
Maybe there is more frequent transportation in high season. 
Entrance fees(supporting the communities) Yumani - region South it's 5 Bob pP. Challapampa- región North, archeological sights it's 10 Bob pP. 
Challa - middle region (you cross it when you walk the trail) it's 15 Bob pP. 
Enjoy your stay!!

name: IC Norte Supermarket
description:
Large supermarket with some imported items, but very expensive.

No camping gas

name: Campsite at La Pajcha Waterfall
description: Site right next to La Patcha waterfall - 2 hours south of Samaipata on a dirt road.  There are about 4 flat sites. Tent camping is also an option on a sandy beach next to the waterfall. If you'd rather wildcamp, about one km before the waterfall, the road turns right and goes over a river. We were able to camp on the side of the road because the road was closed due to landslides.

name: Condor Hike Trailhead
description:
This is the unmarked trailhead of a hike along a ridge line where you can see many condors flying overhead. There is a clearing of about 4m x 5m to park. You hike south on a clear trail for about 60 - 90 minutes. Then the trail runs out. We saw about 12 condors in 4 hours. Beautiful!
If you prefer to go with a guide, we've been told there is a 6-8 hour round trip hike to an area where the condors nest. Guides need to be arranged in Samaipata and you can do a day trip with an early morning departure.

name: Sur La Route Vers Uyuni
description:
Quiet and without person.For motorcycle 4 * 4 and truck! 

Calme et sans personne.Pour moto 4*4 et camion!

name: Taipi Uta
description: Awesome food, wide variety and fair price! Recommended!

name: La Pajcha
description: Cascada La Pajcha. Waterfall with beach and swimming possible. Not too big, but nice rest place. We were the only ones there. It is 40km ,4wd drive. From Samaipata you can do it without 4wd but super slow, about 3 hours. The road had bad parts even when dry, would not advise it after heavy rain. Would be possible to camp, but we have not done so. Few waste barrels and fire pits are the only facilities.

name: Sleeping Iguana Island
description: A medium sized island out in the salar. Named as such by our 5 year old (no actual iguanas were spotted).

name: Isla Sierra Luna
description: A tiny island, named after our tiny girl.

name: Coco Loco Island
description:
A small island named after our 5 year old. 

Many islands in the area to homestead as your own-at least here on ioverlander!

name: Museo de Chantani
description: On the Salar side of the road, a sculpture garden with small picnic tables. On the mountain side, an ethnographic museum showcasing pre-colonial, colonial & modern array of home items, local flora & fauna.  15 bov per adult. Sr Santos Quispe is the lovely creator & curator. There is no sign.

name: May Apa Lavanderia
description:
After many years on the road, we truly appreciate a lavanderia who takes pride in their much appreciated work. This place charges 15bov per kilo for wash, dry & fold- all done w attention to detail.  Same day service with a smile. A big industrial machine available for big items.  

Colombia #255 between Colon & Cabrera. cell 72924260. If it appears closed, just ring the bell.

name: Soluna
description: Hotel or hostel. 90 bolivianos/adult for bungalow. Pool, lots of space.

name: Konani
description:
We talked with the guy for a while and waited for everyone to leave and were able to get gas at the local price. Spanish and a sense of humor go a long way.

Other experience: 5bol after asking, then he waved me away

name: Immigration - Bolivia
description: First stop to exit Bolivia. Can park at back. Hand in exit cards, they take a photo and then you can head to Aduana over the road. Open 8-6pm.

name: Aduana Bolivia
description: A block away from immigration. Open 7 days a week. Hours Monday - Friday are 8:30 - 18:30. Saturdays, Sundays, holidays open 8:30 - 14:30

name: Route Sud De Lipez Après San Cristobal
description:
Tranquil and splendid life 

Tranquille et vie splendide

name: Salar Chiqua a
description:
Alone in the world, truck, bike or 4 * 4 !!! quiet and possibility of making fire. 

Seul au monde,camion,vélo ou 4*4!!!tranquille et possibilité de faire du feu.

name: Laguna Honda
description:
Splendide a lot of wind in the evening, tour operators from 9h until 12h.and then from 2pm to 5pm but very quiet 

Splendide beaucoup de vent le soir,tour  opérateurs à partir de 9h jusque 12h.et puis de 14h à 17h mais très tranquille

name: Près De La Laguna Colorado
description:
Quiet and out of tour operators 

Calme et hors des tours opérateurs

name: Entre Lagunaire Blanc Et Lagune Verde
description:
Tranquil but windy bcp and frozen at night 

Tranquille mais bcp de vent et gelé la nuit

name: Estancia Churata
description:
We drove over the San Juan bridge & turned around to explore the incredible rock formations (we hoped we could climb) we saw from the road. When we arrived at the small estancia, an older gentleman asked us how many days we were staying. We had no idea how much there was to explore, but clearly he did! 

Ask permission to camp, then head up the left side of the grass & park near the large boulder, where its semi-flat.  Incredible rock formations to hike among, and over 30 bolted routes if you have sport climbing gear (climbing for all levels) There is also a road that goes up to the top left side rim above the valley that would be good for camping.  Enjoy.

name: Parqueo
description: Stayed here for a night as we arrived late and this was last ditch. 40 bob for 24 hours. Locked gate from 8 pm to 7 am with no entry exit. Worked for us because we just needed a spot before finding a mechanic in the am. Fit our 18 foot van. 3.3 meter height restriction

name: Banzai Service
description: Jorge Taborga R is the general manager of this shop. We blew a shock on our way into La Paz and he was recommended by the Toyota Dealership. He was able to locate a new shock for our 3 ton Dodge Campervan. Stayed open late to fit us in and get us on our way. Same day service was such a blessing. Speaks a little English and runs a tight ship. Seems like a trusty and fair priced shop. Tel 2774477 or banzaiser@hotmail.com

name: police stop after toll booth
description:
Toll booth 3 bolivianos for transit to Tarapaya. 

Police stop after toll asks to see all documents, fire extinguisher & first aid kit. Ours were currrent, but they will sell you them if you don't have.

name: Viajes rutas
description: Shop with road maps and Lonely Planet guides.

name: El Germen
description:
Vegetarian-vegan Cafe (that also has a few beef, fish & chicken options) in the heart of Sucre serving fresh, homemade food that'll make you smile.

Everything is homemade- from the fresh out of the oven wholewheat bread to the sweet tart apricot jam, the savory and not too salty tomato soup, and even the tofu is made here! 

Located at San Alberto #231
tel: 6441044
www.elgermen.com
8am -10pm Monday- Saturday
serving breakfast, lunch, dinner & dessert. 
closed Sunday

name: Kora Kora
description: Asked for 7 bol w/o receipt, but bargained to 6. very friendly.

name: Sanitary check
description:
When comming into Brazil they will take all your fruits, veggies, unprocesed seeds, canned fish/veggies and spices. Vaccinacion certificates are enough to get a dog through the checkpoint. Veeeery friendly staff, but doesn't speak Spanish. 
The office aduana for the car is here now.

name: Receita Federal (aduana)
description:
Customs control at the border. They will direct you to Caceres to get your TIP. If you are leaving Brazil you will need to do your paperwork here. Since mid-December 2015 Brazil reintroduced TIP/TECAT (Termo de Concessao de Admissao Temporaria). It is valid as long as your visa. If you don't get the TIP here you have to get it in Caceres. This is customs only, immigration/passport stamp is at the Policia Federal in Cáceres. 


No TIP ( leaving or entering Brazil) on weekends!

name: Cabanas Trudi
description: Cosy rooms with private bathrooms for rent. Clean, quiet and dog friendly. Water under the shower is really hot! Paid 100bs for two people. No internet.

name: Gas Station 'Velez'
description: Filled up jerry cans for local price 3.74

name: Not so level spot
description: Grassy area on the top of a hill. Possible to level out using stones. Quiet.

name: Gysers
description:
Geothermal features abound. Lots of tourists for sunrise.

Free.

name: YBFB: ES Aroma
description: First bid for gas was 8.5, then she said if you get more than 10 liters 7. We said we were getting 40 liters and wanted to pay 5, we met & filled at 6. Patience and a little humor will (almost) always get you a better price :)

name: Gran Hotel Sucre
description: Hotel with comfortable rooms. A little old but still nice and clean. Matrimonial (actually had space for 3 pers) for 360 BS if you want the heated version. Unheated and smaller for 280 BS. Hot shower and Wifi. Parking in secure garage. Entrance maybe just under 3m. Very friendly staff! Breakfast included.

name: Punto Tigo Money Lavanderia Cheap
description: Lavanderia 6 kilos 20 bol ou 4 kilos 16 bol good prince good job but cloches are not dry

name: karaxama2
description: very quiet and nice place for the night near the Rio tupiza. impeccable to clean the 4x4 after the dust ripio to uyuni.

name: Wild Camp at Riverside
description: Nice campsite beside the river. Follow the small road 100 meters from the main road and you find a great place for your tent.

name: Cascada Pueblo Camp
description: Dirt lot camp at the bottom of Cascada village- on the river side. Trail from camp down to a nice big swimming hole with cascades. 5 minutes pasts this village was construction that had the road closed from 9am -5pm so we came back here and spent the day swimming. (Ask the friendly locals about the road for current closures.)

name: Gasolinera
description: filled at local price 'sin factura' - without receipt

name: Rurre river camp
description: On the banks of Rio Beni, a flat dirt lot. A cool breeze blows off the water at nightfall & in the morning,  which is a lifesaver in the middle of the Amazon! Some nearby streetlights, but you can park a bit away. Access to town with plenty of restaurants, a promenade to walk on, a kids park 100 meters away. Nice views of life on the river. Clean municipal public toilet 1bol, opposite direction from park.

name: Wild Camping Outside Tika Tika
description: En route between Potosi and Uyuni, we pulled off the highway onto a dirt road that went alongside a riverbank in a big valley. Vast flat land and nobody bothered us. A few friendly townspeople walked past and said hi. Beautiful sunset and sunrise.

name: Construction Site
description: Not really sure what this is. Some kinda construction site, but a lot of open flat land and doesn't look like it'll be finished anytime soon. We set up camp here and nobody bothered us all day and night. It is surrounded by houses.

name: Parking Lot by Lake Titicaca
description: Very good informal parking lot by the Titicaca Lake. Quiet and safe, close to the center.

name: Panaderia Paris
description: Amazing French bakery in Rurre owned by a real life French man! Open 6am-12, then 3-6pm. Croissants, quiche, bread, omelettes, real coffee, fresh juice. Go (probably more than once) and take food to go into the jungle.  Can preorder a big loaf that they will wrap in foil to-go.  Don't miss!!

name: Cucuta
description:
Bought diesel at 6bs sin factura (or 9bs with factura)
Frendly people 

3,72bs for bolivian people

name: Chimore
description: Don't know if they sell gas to foreign people because I didn't stop. But it's good if you're in an emergency!

name: YPFB
description: YPFB Gas Station. Sell local price if filling your jerrycan.

name: Octano
description:
Excellent gas station, we were able to fill the entire RV tank plus the jerry can for 5bs/litre without even negotiating. 
They also accept US dollars.

name: Gas Station
description:
Good point to stop to sleep in your way to/from Corumbá. They also sell gas and diesel for foreign people.
Bought diesel at 8,88Bs/litre

name: Next To Petrol station
description: Emergency stop behind a petrol station. Not much traffic on road and we were outside the village so barking dogs were far away. Petrol attendant didn't bother us as i am sure we were off his property and it was way past 11 pm to really negotiate :)

name: Los Salares
description: hostel just out of town, has private rooms with shared bathroom for 110 bobs and with private bathroom but not sure on price. had secure garage underneath for parking for free, would prob just about fit a car or I'd guess about 3 motos. They are really friendly and helped us fix a couple of small problems we had with our motorbike

name: Petrol Station
description:
There are two places to buy petrol/diesel next to each other. We tried both.  if you're coming from the south, the first station you get to let us buy petrol at local rates in a jerry can and once on our bike (the bike currently ha no plates). The other place would only give us the foreigner price, even in a jerry can.

The station in front of the bridge sold us gasolina for 6bol/L in our truck tank. There is a cold shower( average clean).

name: Hotel 9 de Octubre
description: mall hotel, a little bit outside from center (2km). Can be booked on booking.com. WiFi, Room was big but basic. Shower warm, not really hot. Parking for Motorbike was possible (14 Bob / Night extra). Owner very friendly. Paid 84 Bob pppn for single room.

name: Hospedaje Franz
description: Small town at the edge of the salt flats. The hospedaje is relatively new (some amenities are still being built). We got a room with 2 single beds for 30bs, with secure parking in the courtyard. There were also nicer rooms available for 100bs. There is a nice dining room to sit and eat, there is a kitchen however only the sink works at the moment, which was fine because we just used our cooker in there. The lady who runs it is really nice, but can be difficult to find. We only found this place by asking some locals, it's off the main road down a side street towards the flats and is not signposted yet. The courtyard gate door is red and the building is new & beige.

name: Atacama wild Camping
description: Free under the trees. Nice to spend the night. No facilites.

name: Wild Camping
description: Free camping, no facilities. Too close to the road but it has some trees to cover the car. Good to spend the night.

name: Wild Camping
description:
Quiet and hidden spot next to R4. 
nice views and no noise

name: Skyline Traveller
description:
Good and professional travel agency. friendly people. good and safe cars. we paid for a one-day trip 250.00 bs. per person. it was from 10.30 am till 20.00 pm. We recommend this agency.
Send Angie, the owner, a message, if the office is closed: 
WhatsApp: +591 (6) 850-6665

name: salt hotel
description:
No sign of hotel outside but it is one; in south of San Juan, near the Necropolis. Built with salt; don't know if it is the same place that other comment from ioverlander near of this place. For us welcome was friendly and prices correct : 80BOL for a double + 20 BOL for shower + 50 BOL for 2 diners + 30 BOL for 2 breakfast. Total : 25€ for half pension for 2 of us. Pretty place. 
salt hotel close to town, 40bobs per person. unfriendly service, turned the power off at 8.30pm, gave us breakfast 20 mins later than we asked and then she harassed us to leave when were 10 mins later than we said we would be eaving.

name: Colchane - Pisiga border
description:
Chile to Bolivia

Coming from Chile drive along the big chilean border post. past it there is the Bolivian post on the right hand side for both leaving Chile and enter Bolivia. The Chilean Aduana ask for a Certificado de inscription y anotaciones when travelling with an Chilean car. after Chilean Aduana you visit Chilean PDI, Bolivian immigration, The Bolivian food check (Yes they checked our car, we were flabbergasted and because we weren't expecting this they 'stole' our apple and potatoes) and finally Bolivian Aduana. No further problems, although it took a while even when no other people were there.

Road from border to Oruro is now surfaced and very fast-going.
There is a toll on the road to Oruro (a real one which gives you a receipt you must show when arriving in Oruro). Change your money in order to have 10 BS for it.

name: Isla Pancha
description: Small island just north of Isla de Pescado. Beautiful sunset!

name: Boulder Wild Camping
description: Just another place in the middle of this huge boulder field. FREE

name: Pisiga |Bolivar
description: We bought gasoline here at 6 bol sin factura. They don't fill jerrycans as that is prohibited here.

name: Border aduana migracion Bolivia
description:
Heading west toward Chile, On the left side is the building which both has migrations and Aduana(for vehicle). Both very easy. The offices are open from 8.30 till 12.30 and from 14.30 till 19.00. Drive past any line up of trucks.

Important TIP REQUEST: Some officers may request that you tip them 15 bs per person for the migration out stamp. There is NO such official charge. This is a blatant request to line their pockets, so just ignore it.

There is no possibility to change money, bolivia - chile or chile - bolivia money!

name: Next To Town Square
description: Very rough road after Aiquile (coming from sucre) slowed our speed to less than 30kph so had to make an emergency stop here. Not much around but town square seemed safe as families were moving around for evening walk and many trucks were making quick stops. noisy till 9 pm with all the trucks but noise died down except dogs go barking for a while...

name: Town Square
description: Safe place to pass the night  in emergency. Facing the Jesuit/church. noisy - it was weekend/1st may which is the san jose festive week so was crowded with festivities going all night. We moved twice due to noise from drums n pipes. It was fun to see folklore music and dance but after 12am it got a little too much. May b weekdays  will be better. There is water tap in the grounds of square.

name: Petrol Station
description: 8bol/l no chance to negotiate as police guard around. Didn't see any other pump till border.

name: Gasoline Station
description:
6 BOL/l 

5 bol/L 20/11/17 on Aussie plated motorbike

name: Lavandéria
description: 12bol per kg very clean and fragrant . Not very fast but on Main Street so easy to pick

name: Hostel Mexico Lindo
description: simple but and clean hostel/hotel. Mainly double rooms. Cost 120b for 3 people in two rooms with private bathrooms. showers good and hot. no parking for trucks but lots of secure parking for motorbikes. only warning, it can be a little noisy as it hosts the nurses from the near by hospital. no wifi

name: El Mirador
description:
Recently renovated Hotel and Campground with a spectacular view. located over the town of rurrenabaque surrounded by nature. 15min walk to town. also possible to rent cabins. Price: 35 bol pP incl. Pool. possible to park the car during Pampatours.
Only pool visit: 25 BOB

name: Villa Verde Hotel
description:
Coordinates are for access road. Hotel gate is 25 meters down road on righthand side. 100 Bobs per night (off season) for simple room with private bath and shower.

2 swimming pools wonderful garden and much nicer climate than La Paz.

6 kilometers from end of Death Road.

Restaurant serves b/l/d for 25 Bobs each.

name: Villa Verde Hotel
description:
Coordinates are for access road. Hotel gaye is 25 meters down road on righthand side. 100 Bobs per night (off season) for simple rpom with private bath and shower.

2 swimming pools wonderful garden and much nicer clate than La Paz.

6 kilometers from end of Death Road. Bike tours stop here to swim in pools.

Restaurant serves b/l/d for 25Bobs each.

name: Hostal Butch Cassidy
description: On the highway. Great wifi. Very freindly staff. A convience store located at hostal. Kitchen with stove and oven. Secure parking in lot at rear. 100Bobs/night for private room with hot water - not suicide showers.

name: Hostal Karoca Vildo
description: Clean bathroom with hot shower. Secure parking. Single room with TV shared bathroom is 50 boli. Room is simple but clean.

name: Mountain View
description: The old Ruta has been replaced by a new one making a good place to pull off . There is plenty of camping along this stretch of road this just being the most secluded. And nice view!!

name: hostel los tucanes de rurre
description: a hostel we found with secure parking for motorbikes and small trucks. were happy to take care of our bikes and gear for a few days while we went on a pampas tour(which was awesome). down side, internet is useless and shower block can smell a little. basic breakfast included. otherwise great place to stay. 40bs is the cheapest option.

name: El Chorro
description: Gas and diesel  here at El Chorro for local prices

name: Wara Del Salar
description: Clean, friendly owner, wifi, warm/hot shower, simple kitchen. 1 room shared bathroom for 1 person is 45 bob. I parked my motorcycle inside building on night time. Only for small motorcycle. You can wash your cloth by yourself and there is place for dry cloth. you can put your bicycle inside. Both shower elec and gas.

name: Aduana Aeropuerto El Alto
description: For extension of temporary permission of foreign vehicles. You have to bring the vehicle for verification on site. Car documentation and Passport wirh extension of visa are required.

name: Lavanderia
description: Good service, within 1 day, 10 BOL/kg, very nice owner

name: Queso Mizque
description: Buy locally produced cheese and peanut butter, both really tasty from a friendly local lady.

name: Paracay Linde
description: Sold to us at local price. no problem.

name: Hospedaje Max
description: Ok hostel just in front of the Magie St Juan Hotel that is more expensive and was full when we arrived. We paid 100 bolivianos for two people, room had three beds and private bathroom. Friendly owner. Secure parking at the back of the hostel.

name: Estacion de Servicio Dana
description: Sometimes yes..sometimes no... you  can negotiate diesel at 4 bolivianos/liter . water potable.

name: aguas calientes el puente
description: Nice spot 10bob pp to camp under big palapa. Good cover as it rained during the night. No power, host left about 4pm & locked toilets, locals left as it got dark. Plenty of mozzies & bitey things.

name: Andoriña Hostel
description: Cozy hostel run by Dutch/Bolivian couple. Great breakfast with fruit and maracuya marmalade. 120 bolivianos for a double room. Kitchen, balcony and relax spaces. Ask for the cuevas tour with Benjamin for a wonderful tour to the waterfalls without going through an agency (80 bolivianos for 2 ppl). GPS location incorrect, correct coordinates are -18.179026 -63.873353

name: las balsas
description:
Good place and at good price. cheapest was 40bs for 1 person in a private room, shared bathroom. comfortable and clean.
they have a garage for motorcycle too, would fit about 4-5 bikes. we recommend this place

name: Susanas Parking Spot
description: Nice little parking Spot. 30Bo. Dirty Toilette. Very nice owner susana. Small gate, so no big rigs

name: Hot Pool
description: Hotter Then Ojos Del Inca. Beside The Road. Lot Of Locals, They Were Very Friendly To Us. At On End Of The Pool You Can shower By the pipes. 4 Bolivianos

name: Hostal Central / Hostal Puenta Plata
description:
Though it's called a hostel, it's more of a motel with a lot of rooms surrounding a nice (mostly paved) garden.
Breakfast included. Though instant coffee, instant juice and 1 pieter of bread with marmelade and/or butter..
Parking available, not for big rigs. 
Close to centre/shopping.
Wifi.
Relatively quiet.
100B + 10B for parking per night, so a bit expensive

name: Los aventureros
description:
Hostel with dorms and big tents for the  private 'rooms'.
Place is, meh allright.
Guy who owns the place is very helpful and speaks Spanish, German, English and I think I heard him speak French aswell.
Wifi
Breakfast included (eggs and cheese, butter and fruit)
I want to say 50 Bol for a dorm bed, but my memory is failing me
Secure parking for bikes, possibly one car. Maybe street parking for anything else..

name: Hotel Oriental
description:
Hotel front plaza de Rurrenabaque. Rooms with private bathroom, clean, good breakfast and Wifi. Ideal for motorcyclists with secure parking for motorcycles. Parking not suitable for large vehicles. 100 Bolivian cost per night 

Hotel frente plaza de Rurrenabaque. Habitaciones con baño privado, limpio, buen desayuno  y Wifi. Ideal para motociclistas con estacionamiento seguro para motos. Estacionamiento no apto para vehículos grandes. 
Costo 100 Bolivianos la noche

name: Football Field / School Yard
description: One of the only "public" places (but conveniently located about halfway between Vallegrande and Ipitá on Road 22) that offered firm ground and was mud-free. In fact it's a nice lawn behind a fence and gate beside the road in a tiny settlement. When asked a man on the neighboring property said they used the that football field only on occasions and it was no problem to camp — but the next morning the building by the field turned out to be the local school. The teacher didn't mind at all and invited us into the classroom! The kids loved to have some excitement but they were too shy to speak much.

name: Jungle monkey riverbank hideout
description: Howler monkeys singing to us at dawn and dusk, and sharing the fig tree shelter with us. Sandy spot recently used for quarrying, easy access on a track on the left side of the road (when driving north) before the bridge. Road pretty noisy all night. Track might be muddy in the wet season.

name: Dakar monument and International Flags
description:
here is the Bolivia Dakar sign. lots of tours come here for lunch

Correction: after corona there are only a few of cars, but most of them go back at late evening

name: San Ignacio de Moxos
description: Gas at local price! no problems in July 2018

name: Fire-flies, mossies, birds and bats
description: Bank of the river, turn right after the bridge if heading west towards San Borja. Then go underneath the bridge and follow the track west (upstream). Excellent quiet campsites all along bank (apart from the buzzing of the bugs, obviously!)

name: hostel sonia
description: Good clean hostal, rooms with private bathroom 50 bols per person, roof terrace, tv in room, use of kitchen, breakfast 20 bols per person extra, laundry service 15 bols per kilo, can buy your tickets for isla del sol here for 35 bols per person return (depart 08:30, return 5:30pm) has free locked off street parking for all size vehicles

name: Gas Station Tankstelle 24hours
description: Good place to stay over Night. Parkingplace behind the Gas Station. 24h a service is there. Er feel quiet Save

name: Vallegrande Main Plaza
description: Vallegrande Main Plaza. Good For Small Rigs And from Here You Can book a Tour Throw The City About Che Guevaras Death And The Place They buried Him. 40bol

name: La Higuera
description:
Duplicate. Delete.
.....
La Higuera, The village where Che was killed. You can stay on the main plaza. A little museum and a lot of Monuments. Drive here from routa F7 mataral or routa 6 Tomina. Its a dirt road but in good shape. Take 3-4 hours. Nice nature. You can use a baño und cold showers in the new school for free

name: Vallegrande Che Guevara Memorial Tour
description: In the Touristinfo (office across the plaza directly opposite the church) you can book a short Che Memorial Tour (takes around 1 hr). You visit the place were he and his compañeros were buried and his dead body was shown to the public. Good Tour with many informations in spanish. 40bol

name: Jislene
description: Very nice hostel on the river with a great breakfast. We had a matrimonial  room for 40BOB each. They do laundry for 10b/kg and have many hammocks to relax in! Also organise cheap trips to the jungle and pampas.

name: Casa de Huéspedes Villa Eva
description: We stayed up the hill in a new building. 150 B's for a double.  Pet friendly

name: Mountaintourguide
description:
If you want to hike the mountains around ( Huayana Potosí, Illimani...) ask German Gernandez Reon. He is an experienced Guide and it will be cheaper if you contact him directly than over a tour agency. German speaks a little English, but it would be good, if you know some words spanish ;)

Email: seruiturgillimani@gmail.com
Tel: 73703299

(the location I spotted is not his adress - it's just where all the agencys are)

name: Hostal Tunupa
description:
Nothing to write home about, but hey... It's here. And just next to the entrance to the Salar. 

80b pr person including dinner and breakfast. 10b for an almost lukewarm shower. Squeaking beds and the taps in the sinks in the toilet facilities almost have water ;-)

name: SOAT
description: Just because I spent 1.5 hours looking for this place ;-)  Alianza sells SOAT. I paid 195b for my moto. I asked for 30 days, but reading the paper now, I think it actually lasts the year out.

name: Cadena Hospedaje
description:
very nice place, clean and comfortable. i think it is a fairly new establishment. We had a triple room at 50bobs per person with breakfast - bread, yoghurt, fruit and drinks. Owners are very friendly. there is a patio and kitchen available.
laundry available at 8\kg

name: Parque Regional Lomas de Arena
description: Surprisingly enough there are some very pretty Sahara-style sand dunes less than 30 minutes from the city center. This spot marks the entrance gate to the park. From here it's 7 km / 20 min. down a sandy track (a 4WD was necessary due to patches of soft sand when we visited) to the bottom of the dunes (the biggest one is maybe 30m high) where you are allowed to camp wherever you like! Ask the guardaparque at the entrance for directions. Easy to find level spots. No shade or useful wind protection. Apart from some picnic shelters at the western foot of the big dune there are absolutely no facilities. However, there is a resort that offers formal camping inside the park, about 500m before you get to the dunes, but it seemed closed that evening. Entrance fee which includes camping by the dunes: 10 Bs per person.

name: Palmasol Petrol Station
description: They wouldn't fill our tank (not for the locals' and neither for the foreigners' price of 8.80 Bs) but the lady advised me to buy a jerry can at the same street corner (20 liters, 20 Bs.), then she filled that for us 5 times for the local price of 3.72 Bs. This was after being denied diesel at 4 other places on the 4to anillo of Santa Cruz. So it did pay off well to buy a jerry can although it's utterly ridiculous to fill a 300-liter tank from a jerry can right next to the diesel pump! Plus we spilled some and it was back-breaking, too.

name: Club de Campo - Santa Rosa de la Mina
description: Nice setting of this country club, beside a small farm with cattle, sheep, horses and dogs.  They offer cabins and a pool area. We were allowed to camp on the lawn opposite the swimming pool and to use toilet and hot shower. We were the only guests. The small lagoon nearby attracts lots of birds. Some road noise but hardly any traffic during the night. The place has seen better times, some lack of maintenance and cleaning, but the people were very friendly. We payed 100 Bs for two people and our car. Do negotiate the price, they suggested USD 50'as a start!

name: Plaza Mision Jesuitica Santa Ana
description: Situated less than 100 m from the Jesuit mission church, in the NE corner of the enormous plaza (which is actually more of a park than a traditional plaza) under a huge shade tree. We talked to the custodian of the church and he pointed us to this location. The site — and in fact the whole park — is well lit at night, the village is quiet and secure. Loads of birds in the morning. No facilities at all, so you have to be self-contained. Good Entel reception (data). Free.

name: Plaza Carmen De Ruiz
description: Situated next to a small church, on an enormous grassy plaza (which is actually more of a park than a traditional plaza) under a huge shade tree. We talked to several people from this small village and they  pointed us to this location. The site is well lit at night, the village is quiet and secure. Loads of birds in the morning. Some road noise but not during the night. Apart from a water tap iat the center of the park, there are no facilities at all, so you have to be self-contained. Free.

name: Balneario San Ignacio
description: According to the Tourist Info office in town it is possible to camp and swim here. The location is nice but looks a bit run down. We didn't stay.

name: Hostel Monarca
description:
150b per person. 20b for parking.  Closed off parking with space for a single car or a couple of motos. 

Room ok with WiFi and hot shower. 

When I checked out, they wanted an extra 20b for parking, claiming that they could not use the parking the day I was leaving (at 11 o clock) .

name: YPFB
description:
Say you don't mind paying the national price (e. g.  because all the other places refused to sell to you) this place will sell to foreigners. 

I got the feeling that if there had not been a police officer at the station (and my Spanish had been better) one could have negotiated a sin factura price.

name: CHARCAS Hostal
description: Hot shower, kitchen, roof top, simple and clean room. Owner Marita is very friendly and kind. 30 boli p/p.

name: YPFB
description: Bought diesel at 8.88 bob (foreigner rate) into the fuel tank.

name: Mercadito San Vicente
description: There is a small warehouse turned into a minimarket that sells predominantly Brazilian everyday products. We were going to setup camp at the nearby little soccer field but the Brazilian shop keeper came and invited us over. Very friendly indeed. They offered us (very basic) shower and toilet adjacent to the warehouse, put up a hammock, etc. They also run a small hotel 200 m East of here. In our opinion, all the communities along the road to San Matias are safe options to spend a night; there are very few options "in the bush" and there is no need either. If you do end up stay at this place please, pass on our greetings.

name: Community entrance wild camp
description: Arrived here from Rurrenabaque in dark to be ahead of road closure from 6 am to 5 pm in the small town called 'Cascada'. After asking some locals we could camp just before the big community entrance sign. Not very idylic and some traffic passing by, but OK and safe.

name: Taller Electronico Santa Cruz
description: automotive electronic repair shop recommended by a local Landcruiser club.

name: Tacune Frenos y Embragues
description:
Decent brake shop with knowledgeable staff and Hawk pads. refinished front 
rotors, changed pads, fixed broken stud, and adjusted e-brake for a little over $100usd

name: FP Motors
description: Fernando is a general mechanic for off road vehicles. His shop is at his house. You can arrive at his house and knock on his garage. See attached card for the exact address. Email: fplmotors@hotmail.com.

name: Las Petas village green
description: At the army check-point at the pretty village green we asked where we could park-up for the night. They directed us to this spot outside the village medical centre. The friendly nurse there offered us use of the toilets and showers but we didn't use them so can't say whether there is hot water. No charge.

name: Independencia
description:
small town but gasolina available by the bottle ,  a friendly Gomeria and accommdation available if folk don't fancy camping.
paid 8 bols /litre

name: alberto
description: If you run into trouble with your motobike, car, tractor , truck or bus alberto will do his best to sort you out. no reason why you would out here- unless you drop your bike in the river!

name: YPFB
description: Paid 6 Bol after negotiating. Friendly people. If we had bought more gasoline we probably could have even gotten a better price.

name: Hostal y Camping Mirador
description:
On one hand a great hostel with many facilities (kitchen, bar, bbq, pool table, table tennis, swimming pool) and a good view. 

On the other hand, it is a somewhat run down / miskept. Oh well... It's Bolivia and it is fairly cheap. 30b for camping. 47 for dorm. Private rooms available too.

Note: The bar and swimming pool were closed while I was here - but I am also the only guest (off season).

name: Urkupiña
description: Sold me gas to local price - but only because I only needed 10L to top up my motorbike.

name: In the canyon, next to the lake
description: On a small side road towards Chinchiri there is a little bit of dry grass for your tent on an (almost) even ground. A few locals have passed me by, said nothing but Buenos tarde :)

name: Peluquería Oster
description:
Sold me gasoline for 8b pr liter. Don't think they have that much... He was filling my canisters with a 2L bottle.

It is not certain it is open... You probably have to ask around. It is a peluquería that also sells gas. 

Also, watch out... They tried to short change me, pretending they could not figure out 8 x 8L = 64. All the while the girl was holding the remaining change in her hand.

name: Ruta 25
description:
Small area a bit hidden next to the road. Cars may have a problem accessing this because of a small ditch you have to cross. See photo. 

During the next few kilometres North, there were a couple more places that seemed possible to camp overnight. Not as well hidden and closer to (unmapped) local settlements - but more suitable for cars.

name: Licoma
description: Small shop, no sign. Sold me gasoline for 7b pr liter.

name: GOX 4wd Equipment
description: This place will design, weld and repair 4x4 equipment (bumpers, awnings, etc.) The owner, Julio, has several off road vehicles and knows local trails. The shop is in a neighborhood and has a large orange gate.

name: mechanic
description:
Small town mechanic. Does small repairs and emergency fixes. Not a lot of instruments so I don't think he can help with engine problems. 
No sign, knock on the door right of the red/brownish fence. It is one of the last houses on the right when coming from the salar.

name: San Cristobal Uyuni
description: They sell diesel sin factura for 7 bob per liter and gasolina for 8 bob

name: Takana Hotel
description:
We parked our car here for 10 bob per day during a jungle tour.
Fenced and secure area, not very suitable for big rigs.

name: La Cabaña
description: This is more a farm than a campground, though all facilities of a campground are available. I'm not sure if they have guests often, everything looks quite old but OK. They have almost all animals you can imagine (including an ape) and you share grassland with their cows and lamas. We paid 20 bols for 2 persons plus our car. Super friendly people, good atmosphere, highly recommended.

name: Coroico
description: Gasoline. Variable prices and experiences. Read posts of other overlanders.

name: Motorbike mechanic
description: Little motorcycle workshop that was helpful when I had troubles with my rear brake.

name: Camping Fabriola
description: Close to the center of town where you can walk to restaurants. It's very basic, but has flat ground and can accommodate several vehicles. It's located at a home and has a little visible sign. Good place to stay if you want to explore Parque Machia.  15B pp

name: Lubrificantes Juan Carlos
description:
Clean and perfect place for motor oil change and to greas driving shaft. Friendly and attentive staff. Highly recommended!
Open: Mon-Sat 7am-7pm / no Siesta

name: Ancupata village
description: Ancupata village, has a couple of places to eat and stay, pretty and friendly little town to stay for visiting the Iscawaya ruins which are about 15km away.

name: turn off for Iscawaya ruins
description: turn downhill and go for about 7.5km to visit the Iscawaya ruins

name: Todo Moto
description:
A local pointed me to this place. Seemed like they had a good selection of tyres - including Pirelli for my KLR. 1272bs for front and rear. 

They won't change them, though, so check out the Honda shop nearby. They also have decent tyres.

name: Honda
description:
Honda motorbike dealer and mechanic. He also have a selection of branded tyres.

They were very helpful when I needed a bit of service on my KLR.

name: Bolivian Border Post
description:
Trucks can queue up here for kilometers. Just overtake them and head straight into the custom offices. Travelling to Bolivia we were not checked for any food items. Leaving the custom area you have to pay 10.- Bolivianos road toll. 

The claim that this border crossing point is closed (and consequent marking of it as permanently closed) seems inconsistent with recent media reports that it is operating and, furthermore, it is becoming a 24hr crossing point: https://boliviatravelernews.com/index.php/2024/05/16/bolivia-and-chile-announce-24-7-operations-at-key-border-crossings/

name: Area of Auto Parts near centro
description: if you need car parts, but not service, within a few blocks of this point, you can find a lot of car parts. especially Toyota and Dodge.

name: Alojamientos
description: Old hotel-style alojamientos (habitaciones) but with good mattresses and fairly fast WiFi (Bolivian standard) . They have snacks near the entrance, no breakfast. Parking space for motorbikes but not cars.

name: Camping Tucan
description: Nice clean campsite with jetty to access hot water river. Roofed or grass tent pitches with lights, several plugs, space for campers near toilet block, flushing water clean toilets and sinks, dish sinks, a couple of cabanas also available. 55 bolivianos per person per night without electricity!!! Plus 10 bols for electricity.

name: Mirador
description: A nice walk with 2 viewpoints over the pantanal and interesting rock formations, around 1hr round trip.

name: Hotel Villa Chiquitana
description: 5* hotel 395 bs for a Standard double room and 495 Bs for an Executive double room. Incl pool, breakfast, ac and private bathroom

name: Cotoca
description:
Gasoline Sin factura. price 5 or locale price bolivianos per litre.

Con factura 9.5 bolivianos, also fill jerry cans.

name: Pension Florida
description: Road in is 120 miles of 4x4 rough track passable only in the dry. At this time (end of may) we had 3 water crossings upto door sills on pathfinder. Pension is rustic basic Individual rooms with communal seating / dining area outside them, outdoor toilet and shower which werent working when we were there as they are solar powered and there wasnt enough sun to make the pump work! Friendly people and the Place over the road sells cans of beer for 10 bols each but must bring own food. There are local guides here for going into the national park noel kemff from 2500 bols for 2 people for 6 days

name: La Casita Hotel
description: Decent sized rooms with private bathroom, 1 double & 1 single bed, air con and tv for 180 bols, wifi and breakfast included, short walk from shops, central plaza and laundry. Secure parking inside gate space for 1 large or 2 small rigs

name: Hostal Ibanez
description: Its a clean, basic hotel in the center that lets you park inside the gates at night. Double or matrimonial 200 bol or 250 with A/C. Private bathroom and towels / soap. Not a lot else, no wifi or breakfast but ok for a night as all others were twice the price or had no parking. Lots of options to eat on this street, 1 block from main square with ATM's that accept mastercard

name: Hotel El Bosque
description: Twin room with AC, private bathroom, breakfast, wifi and locked parking. 250 bol per night. Short walk to center

name: Jatata Inn Hotel
description: Twin room 240, matrimonial 250, private bathroom, parking area, large swimming pool, includes breakfast

name: Pizzeria Italia
description: Had pizza here twice due to other options being closed. It's a bit pricey indeed, but the pizza was good and the owner Daniel's a very nice guy. There's wifi but it's slow. In the evening there's a happy hour for the cocktails.

name: Police Station/Toll
description:
Nice police officers turned out to be really corrupt. We were two cars and passed other police stations without any issue and with a smile. Here we had to pay 50Bs without any receipt for some paper which they printed on their own and nobody needs. While we were here locals arrived and also paid 2 Bolivianos each for a stamp. The money disappeared in a hidden hole in the table. 

This action really ruined our day, and we thought about writing some letter to the police station in Santa Cruz. I would advice everybody if possible not to pay or at least complain about this.

After that we talked long to a local businessman and he told us that this is well known to the government and that it was in the press already. They replaced the policemen but the new ones just continue asking for money from everybody probably also protected by the government. He strongly advised us not to argue with the police because otherwise they will check for your first aid kit, your fire extinguisher, all your papers or any other thing they find or make up. He said welcome to Bolivia and do not wonder why there are so many "Evo No" signs everywhere....

name: Camping
description: There are not many possible camp sites on this road. This may be one. Fairly ok shielded from the road. The ground may be wet, though. The usual litter appear.

name: Lookout at 4918mts
description: Lookout from where you can see as far as Cerro Rico, Sucre, the Yungas, Salares in all directions for a couple of hundred kilometers. / Access track from the north in very good 2WD condition / the last 2 kms are not for faint hearted, very steep slopes, 4WD recommended / big trucks might get up, but the 2 kms are narrow / two guards   stay on top of the peak (to guard the telecommunication installations) / sleeping on level ground possible on top

name: Nissan
description: They have connection to a place where they have experience with dieselcars. Andy speaks perfect english. Very helpful!

name: Near Restaurants
description: On the US1, 2 km before here, we take 2 peoples on our RV. They are the owners of a small restaurant here, so they said we could stay here. It was very quiet included late in the morning.

name: El Junte Gas Station
description: Gas direct into tank at local price 3.72 Bs

name: Riverside Spot
description: Old boat docking site slightly off the road. Beautiful sunset by river but mosquitos at dusk are really bad.

name: Official Stop
description: Looked like an agricultural checkpoint but he asked for our passports and wrote down the number. Asked where we were going but we couldn't understand him with our owners spanish skills. Didn't ask for money.

name: Car "Ferry"
description: Go into the town and turn right towards the river. There is a small car track down to dock. Prices are listed on sign near dock. We paid 60 bolivanos for a Toyota 4 Runner. Runs about every 10-15 minutes. Probably closed during lunch. Steel platform is small with a small boat basically pushing it, but gets the job done for the small distance. But have no fear, we saw them safely transport a double decker bus with passengers.

name: Bush Site
description: Pull off next to road. Parked behind bush. Partially visible from road but high enough ground to stay away from gators.

name: Dirt Flatland
description: Semi large pull off where you are mostly hidden from road. Lots of trees and birds, not lots of traffic so peaceful.

name: Cholita Wrestling
description: watch traditionally dressed CHOLITAS wrestle WWE style. fake but entertaining. Thursday and Sunday at 6pm. 50bs/person

name: Yampupata - Boat tour
description:
ride the road to the end and you end up in a small fisher habour. Look around for a fisherman and he will take you for a boat ride. Its also possible to get to the ilands from here. Nothing official.
We asked the fisherman for a ride and he offerd us ine for 60 bol. I said 40 bol for 30 min and he directly agreed. Very nice and defenetly worth it!

name: YPFB
description: Gasstation just before Sorata. He didn't want to give us gasolina "sin factura", so we had to pay 8,3 Bolivianos per liter.

name: Gran Moxos hotel
description: Cheapest hotel in town that we could find with parking, space for several motorbikes and a couple of cars. Nice hotel, clean rooms, proper showers and breakfast (bread and jam) included. we paid 130Bs for a double room

name: Hotel Rosario Lago Titicaca
description: Very nice hotel, little expensive but good value right on the lake. We needed a break from the cold and the altitude. Very comfy bed, good breakfast and all rooms have lake views. We paid $88.  Easy parking for all size rigs right on the property. Excellent restaurant on site too.

name: Dentist ini odontologia
description: We found a good dentist, repairing and (ultrasonic-) cleaning our teeth in a very professional way. Ilsen runs a little, modernly equiped praxis. She is a sympathic doctoress. Prices are very reasonable. 9:00-12:00 and 14:00-20:00 Mon-Sat.

name: Bien te fué
description: Nice place close to bus station. fast internet, really clean, pretty bathrooms and really good vibes. the don't have parking area but  we left our motos  in the patio (inside garden). We stay in a private room for 50 Bp P/P whit shared bathroom.

name: Residencial Acuario
description: Room is sImple but clean, secure parking. There is one warm shower at 3rd floor. Owner is nice person. 30 boli for single room, 10 boli for my moto. There is garage(5 boli) near hostel.

name: Taller Electromecanico Villaroel
description: Got our starter cleaned here. Recommended by Don Edil, VW mechanic at the corner of the 3er anillo externo and Avenida Busch. Also on iOverlander.

name: Taller Rectificaciones Cordova
description: Parts machine shop where we got our major engine parts remachined (for VW Kombi engine rebuild). Recommended by Don Edil, VW mechanic. Cordova also found us a new engine block. Our old one was in bad shape. He was very honest, telling us that he could machine it to be usable but that he would prefer not to since we would just continue to have problems. Nice guy, very thorough. Also invested in us getting on the road and staying on the road. Asked us to please stop by before we leave the city so he can give us advice for maintaining our engine.

name: Vardona Gas Station
description: Sold us gas at the foreigner price (which is the normal price of gas in the rest of South America) and also filled our gerrys (two 20 L gerrys and one 10 L gerry).

name: Mirador Escencio
description: Mirador Escencio. Free for Camping. Picknick tables and little tower.

name: Parqueo including nights
description:
We paid 50 boles per day for our big rig (26 boles for a car).
No high limit entrance. Open from 7h30 to 22h30, Sunday from 8h to 11h.
No possibility to sleep in the vehicle.

name: Valle de la luna
description:
Easy to go from La Paz : good road
Easy to go from south of El Alto : from the I-1, take the good road to Achocalla (nice lake) and continue...

Here you can do a beautiful 45min walk between crazies used stones.

Une superbe promenade parmi les cheminées de fée et les longs pitons érodés.
Un paysage étonnant. A voir !

name: Big area near a gas station
description: The night was quiet and cold. In the morning, gas station looks like still closed.

name: Thermes and Playground
description:
Quiet, free, and fun for kids in the morning !
Showers, restrooms and probably restaurant in the thermes, when opened.

name: Chacavuco - wildcamp
description: Open area just outside a friendly hamlet. No provisions, quiet.

name: El Lobo
description: Hostel with place to park in fielded area by pool. Enough room for large SUV but needed 4×4 to get in/out. Let us keep car while doing tour. Possible to park in front, but not sure about security because next to many local homes. Had private room w/ private bath for 140B, or dorm for 55B pp. Includes breakfast, good coffee, bread, fake juice. Very good hot showers and decently clean facilities. Rooms have no windows but mosquito nets over beds. Mosquitos weren't bad though. Noisy from parties/ boats from river. Had pool area, bar w. happy hour, pool tables. Wifi is useless. Beautiful view, semi friendly staff.

name: Calle Batalla de Iruya
description: After driving in La Paz for hours to find a free place to sleep, we found this nice little street. Calm, close to the center, secure (military base just at the end of the street). There is also a mini market where you can buy water, bread, food,... Perfect for few nights!

name: Camp in saddle with panoramic view
description: Camp high above Torotoro village. Visible from road, but it is a side road without traffic. 13kms above Torotoro. Views to all sides, maybe a bit windy, flat ground for 2 cars, you need probabely a 4x4 to get up there.

name: Lakeside Camp
description: Grassy, level camp at Laguna Juntutuyo. Very quiet, not suitable for swimming, some birds. 1.3kms on a good dirt track from main road

name: Cloud Forest (western extencion)
description: Here start the first patches of the Bolivian cloud forest (western limit). The forest stretches for the following 40kms eastwards (towards Santa Cruz).

name: Hosteria Las Islas
description:
Really nice, homey place with great views. Nice chill areas for enjoying the lake and mountains. 
Matrimonial room with private toilet and breakfast and amazing view was 90bob. We looked around at a few other hostels nearby and this price seemed to be on par with the surrounding prices but we got a much nicer room than the other rooms we saw at other places. 
Even enjoyed a hot shower! No wifi though.

name: Workshop at Landhaus Camp
