description: If you stay at Landhaus Camp,  there is a friendly, helpful guy with a small welding workshop in the corner of the camp. He did a good quality weld on some minor stuff for us and also good work on a bigger job for the overlander parked-up next to us. Sergio the camp owner is also very helpful and will recommend other places to go if you need other work done.

name: Mining Company Buildings
description:
UPDATE- No longer the entrance to park. Just mine company business. Pass through. 

Entrance to the national park at the salt mine buildings. You have to purchase your ticket of 150 BOB when entering and show your ticket if leaving the park.

name: Plaza Chochis
description: Nice, well-lit town plaza. Parked on a stretch of lawn directly opposite the town alcaldia. Talked to some locals who said it was okay to park here for the night (we avoid the word "camp" in these places) and also assured us it was secure here. Quiet except for the odd motorbike and a group of locals talking well into the night. There are absolutely no facilities here so you have to be self-contained. Don't miss the Santuario by the huge red rock towering a few kilometers NW of here.

name: Santuario Chochis and Mirador
description:
Commemorates the victims of a local flood in 1979. Designed by Hans Roth who renovated all the Jesuit mission churches of the Chiquitania between 1972 and 1999. "The wood carvings that adorn the sanctuary are the rival of anything seen in the Jesuit missions" (the Lonely Planet). Best visited early morning or late in the afternoon when the red of the rocks make a fantastic contrast to the blue of the sky. The road leading up to the site and mirador is paved with cobble stones all the way. Great views over the surrounding landscape. There is an entrance gate at the bottom of the access road that limits vehicle height to approximately 3 metres.

Entry costs 10 Bob ppn.

name: Roadside Camp On Way To Torotoro
description:
Free roadside camp in a beautiful valley on the way to Torotoro from Sucre. Quiet night. 
Update 03/2022: new tarred road doesn’t lead to this point any longer.

name: River Wild Camp En Route To Torotoro
description: This free wild campsite next to the river was perfect during the dry season. Wet season may be another story. We took a turnoff the main road the is used mainly by people getting the rock from the river bed. Very quiet night and in the morning the workers taking the river rock pretty much ignored us. Very nice sunset. 23km from Torotoro. Did not need 4x4 to get here, but good clearance is nice and watch the sandy areas.

name: River Canyon Swimming
description: Beautiful river canyon with nice swimming holes. Park by the bridge and walk up the canyon until you find someplace you like.

name: Little Hostel
description: Found on google, messaged and reserved a triple room with private bathroom a day in advance. Negotiated from 390 BOL down to 300 incl breakfast. When we arrived in Villamar, we drove to a few other hostals to shop around but they were either booked out for the groups or much more expensive. We arrived around 4:30pm from Uyuni and the place filled up with tour groups by 6pm. Richy runs the place +59164395254 Like many, this place doesn’t look like much when you get there. It’s basic but ok clean and you get used to your room. Still overpriced, for the same money you’d get a better place in Uyuni. Richy has ok internet. There is parking for 4 landcruisers inside the gates, vans and rigs would fit but not sure if he’d let them take up the space.

name: Lavanderia
description: A bit expensive (we payed 90bol for 7kg of laundry same day), but they did an excellent job. Wash and dry same day, nicely folded and in bags.

name: Residencia Yacyreta
description: The Drive from Santa Cruz to Paraguay takes quite a long time. So we slept here for one night to continue in the morning. They usually just have rooms for rent for 100 bs per person when you want your own bathroom. There refused just to park in the secured parking lot in the first place but after a bit of nice conversation with our 100 Spanish words we were allowed to camp und the yard. It's closed to the street but there was not much traffic at the evening and about the night we can't say as we both slept very well. They have clean banos and hot showers. No wifi (we didn't ask but there was no signal in that parking area). We paid 50 bs for the both of us and the truck. The name is residencial yacyreta

name: Mirador Valle Grande
description: 5 min walk from plaza, great views over town & mountains. Restaurant too, but we didn't use it.

name: Flat spot by river
description: hidden from road, we stopped here for a break but would make a nice wild-camp nightspot. no facilities. Free.

name: Urubicha Jesuit Church
description: Probably one of the least visited Jesuit Mission churches but very worth the detour. Very distinct architectural style compared to the ones east of here (San Javier, San Ignacio, Santa Ana etc.). Another masterpiece of the architect Hans Roth who renovated all of the six Jesuit Mission churches who build the UNESCO world heritage. Wonderful clocktower who is manually operated. Starts usually half an hour before the mass. We parked our car at the placa by the church. Was an ok stop, busy until 11pm. The lighting of the church at sunrise is magnificent. Nice little village. It is reached by 40km of dirt road. The first half was rather bumpy, afterwards ok. Took us about 40min to get there from Ascension de Guarayos.

name: Kilometer 62 Truck Stop
description: Safe place to sleep in front of restaurants and tiendas. Popular stop for truckers. Toilets and showers available  for a fee. We just parked in front of a shop. They close at 11:00pm and start opening at 7:00am.

name: Posada del Amor
description:
Nice place with a bit of charm. Close to the centre. 
We got a 4 person room but it wasn't cleaned properly after the last people with full bins etc. 
4 person room w/ensuit 150BOB
3 person room no ensuit 100BOB
2 person room w/ensuit 100BOB
Street parking only by the looks of it.

name: Tres Cruces
description:
3.74 for gas after we parked and used our can. Good service.

Update: don't need to use any can. must to use the second pump directly at the car tank. local price.

name: Stone Snake
description: A recently discovered, 2000 years old stone snake. Interestng boards to read (in Spanish), free

name: Lakeside camp near Santa Ana mission
description: Close to the tranquil village of Santa Ana, a lake where one can swim, very few locals will pass here, we have not seen a single car. Grassy, more or less level ground. The usual trash...

name: Mercedes-Benz and Mitsubishi Service
description: The only authorized Mercedes mechanic we found in La Paz. Good option if you need anything more than basic repairs for a Mercedes or Mitsubishi. Very friendly and helpful staff.

name: Ch' Askita tour operadora
description: Agency which offers very interesting mine tours for 120 bol/pp, they take you to active mines in Cerro Rico, not to a touristic mine or museum. The company is run by real miners and they gave us a view of their hard work and life in their working space. David was very good and speaks english.

name: Meadow next to river
description: Tried to find an overnight stop nearby Ruta 6 when it was dark already. We asked the very cute family on the other side of the road, obviously no problem to camp here. 4x4 not necessary except for rainy weather, could be a bit muddy then.

name: Fishing Area
description: Nice wildcamp in a kind of fishing / picnic area. There's a gate on ruta 22 and a sign which says something like "Zona turistica", open the gate and drive about 14 km to the river. Somewhere on the way there's another gate, we asked a farmer, it's no problem to open it and camp on the river. On the next day a group of men came for fishing and a family for swimming. The only big minus: we have a lot of bug bites!!!

name: Grassy patch
description: A flat grass area. Easy access and flat with great views. Used by locals as picnic area. No shelter. Phone signal with Viva. Some trash but not too bad.

name: Sacaba
description: First gas station we encountered out of Cochabamba that would sell us petrol. Tried 8 others on the way here and all said flat no to both car and jerry cans (This one fills jerry cans for slightly under the foreign price).

name: Santa Barbara
description: Sells to foreigners (Jerry can only) at local price.

name: Milan Centre Cafe
description:
First, the people in charge are not friendly. Second, we have seen many times people leave because they did not come to take the order and let them wait a long time. Asking something is like bothering them all the time and if you need to connect, you should do it less than an hour because the only thing they want to do is take your money and when you leave soon, they prefer !

Primero, las personas en carga no son amables.Segundo, hemos visto muchas veces personas irse porque no vinieron tomar el pedido y los dejaron esperar mucho tiempo. Preguntar algo es como molestarlos todo el tiempo y si necesitan connectarse, deben hacerlo menos de una hora porque la única cosa que quieren hacer, es tomar su dinero y que se van pronto !

name: views
description: even if you don't plan on doing the full lipez route to laguna colorada, it's well worth a short half hour detour from the main road through Tupiza just to see the views from up here.

name: Sonko Chipa
description:
for normal price and we gave a tip to lady
or
Accept diesel for 5 bol/L 'sin factura'

name: Alojameinto/Hostel
description: we could stay in our van for 20 parked in garden and use hot shower. our friends had double room for 60.

name: Top Of Volcano Trail
description: This point is the end of the trail.  To get up here you will need a 4x4 with high clearance and low range; we had to use all 3 diff locks at one point!  The trail is not too bad until about 4400m, when it starts to deteriorate.  There are amazing views of the Salar from this trail even if you don't get all the way to the top (4636m).  There are a few flat areas to the side of the trail where you could camp and may be sheltered from the wind if you don't mind the altitude.

name: Santuario Chuchini
description: Santuario Chuchini is a family-owned nature park that includes a large tropical lagoon rich in birds, fish and crocodiles; expanses of rain forest; a sanctuary for wildlife in need;  restaurant is closed. it is a great place to relax under tropical trees; a number of cabanas to let; a heaven for weary overlanders. Chuchini seems to have gone through a bit of a decline in recent years but is now being refurbished by the young and enthusiastic owners. They offer expertly guided wildlife, birding and river tours and great food. Accessible by car only in the dry season, The place is a favorite weekend destination of the people from Trinidad but they hardly stay for the night when the park is almost entirely yours. Note that there is an entrance fee to the park, however, there is a special package for overlanders who camp in their own truck (no tents): BOB 50 per person per night if you take the lagoon tour by boat for BOB 100 p.p. during your stay (which lasted 1.5 hours for us and was well worth the money because we saw loads of different birds, crocs, Efrem even tried to find an anaconda for us). We loved to wake up in the mornings and listen to the distant "thunder" of the howler monkeys.

name: Car window replacement service
description: We had a big star in the windscreen of our Toyota Landcruiser 70 series. They could not repair the star, but they replaced the windscreen within an hour for BOB 600.

name: Servicio Nacional de Areas Protegidas SERNAP
description:
Here you can arrange a guide to meet you at Amboró Park if you have your own transport.

Park ticket is 100 pp.

name: P.N. Amboró - La Chonta
description: La Chonta is a "campamento", but the last 500 m to it are not accessible by car anymore. The 12 km from the main road include 5 river crossings as well as some muddy parts, so a 4x4 is recommended. The place to camp (just before the road block) has no facilities, but is in a beautiful jungle. The campamento has toilets, cold showers and  some accomodation. Meals can be provided on request. Camping itself is free, but for visiting P.N. Amboró a guide must be hired for BOB 180 per day, independent of the party size. Guiding and management of the site is done by seven families from a nearby community on rotation basis. Arrangements for the guide can be made at SERNAP in Buena Vista or directly at La Chonta. You have to buy the entrance ticket to the national park in Buena Vista. They check it at La Chonta.

name: Challapampa
description:
5Bol x litro de gas.                    
now it's 6 BOL

name: Pension Villa Puente
description:
A basic place to sleep, after negotiating a little I got 30 Bolivianos for a room for two people, they wanted to charge me 5 for the parking, but I told him that I had not asked for a discount when he gave me the price and that he let me enter the 2 Motorcycles, I finally accept 

Un lugar basico para dormir,  despues de negociar un poco consegui 30 Bolivianos por un cuarto para dos personas, me querian cobrar 5 por el parqueo pero yo le dije que no habia pedido una rebaja cuando me dio el precio y que me dejara entrar las 2 motos, al final acepto

name: Alojamiento Buena  ventura
description:
The place is clean, in the day it is hot in the cold night. So be sure to ask for an extra blanket, the girl is not very friendly but it is a place to spend the night, the place seems quite safe, the showers of the second put are cold, the only hot showers without the ladies bath priner nive , Cost us 60 bolivianos for two people and 5 x each bike 

El lugar es limpio, en el dia hace calor en la noche frio. Asi que asegurate de pedir una cobija extra, la chica no es muy amable pero es un lugar para pasar la noche, el lugar parece bastante seguro, las duchas del segundo puso son frias, las unicas duchas caliententrs sin las del baño de mujeres priner nive, nos costo 60 bolivianos para dos personas y 5 x cada moto

name: toy dinosaur shop
description:
If like us you are going to the salar and you plan to take some awesome photos of you and your friends running away from dinosaurs then you can buy some toy dinosaurs here.  if you brought yours from home then you are smater than me and you probablly won't need this store.

also there are streets and streets of markets up this way.  lots of people, felt very safe, worth a look.

name: Petronila hospedaje
description:
Petronila is an old and nice women who has a small 2 beds room for travelers. Nothing fancy but a nice place to pass the night between walls.
She charged me 15 bolivianos for the night and another 15 bolivianos for a meal she prepared me.
I could park my motorbike inside the courtyard. You may put a car or bigger rigg but opening the main door seems to be more difficult for Petronila.
There is a dry toilet on the other side of the courtyard. You can have water in a bucket to wash yourself.
Let her know if you don't want a breakfast. She prepared one for me even if we hadn't speak about that on the evening and I already had breakfast on my own.

name: Oruro
description:
I was with my motorbike, the guy didn't want to sell me. I asked if he would sell me if I went to park the bike farther away an came back with containers for gasolina. He said yes.
I finally got two 4L containers at local price.
Convenient solution for bike, maybe more complicated for bigger vehicles.

name: Sorata; Cafe Illampu
description:
Nice campground with lots of animals (4 dogs, cats rabbits, ducks and chicken). The coffeeshop is great but closes at 6pm. We could use the kitchen of the coffeeshop. Nice hot shower and the pit toilet is ok.

Stefan and Petra are great hosts, german and spanish speaking.

Paragliders: Stefan can show/bring you to excellent spots.
Closed for holidays between March and May 2017. But try because Petra is there during this time and only the coffeeshop will be closed then.

name: Bazan - 20l water jugs
description:
20l water jugs for sale, not sure about the location, there is one written on the card they gave us:
Calle Subteniente Abaroa 464, Achachicala, La Paz
Just call 76791927, tell them you want the water and your address and they will bring it to you, they did to us. 20l for 20BOB.
We don't have the 20l empty jug, so we just opened the jug and poured the water to 4 5l water bottles we saved and returned it on the spot. No problem with that :)

name: Alojamiento Villa Costanera
description: Very basic hostel to spend the night. 25 bs/person (we negotiated it for 20/p) The owners are quite old and put the tv and radio volumes very high, don't hesitate to ask them to lower it down. Probably one of the cheapest options of villa tunari. They own a friendly parrot called Benjamin ;) probably pet friendly as they own 3 dogs. Big parking space.

name: Sica Sica Village Square
description: A peaceful and friendly village square. A local chap said it was ok for us to park-up overnight. Opportunities for wild-camping are  hard to find along this route but this is ok if you are fully contained. The church is worth a quick visit, even if you don't need a night-stop. Local chap told us it is the second oldest in Bolivia and the tree out front is over 500 years old.  No facilities. Free.

name: Sica Sica Church
description: Beautiful old church. Locals told us this is the second oldest church in Bolivia and the tree outside is over 500 years old. Worth a quick stop if you are passing down this route.

name: YPFB
description: Forecourt has camera with numberplate recognition which links automatically to the pump computer, so no price negotiation possible. We were just pleased to get served after 4 other YPFB refused to sell diesel to extranjeros.

name: wu-tour Island
description: After 5 days on the salar we went to this island. At this side you find a "private" beach which you can park on, off the salt. There are easy acessible stonewalls in the upper third of the island for tenting, the rough coralstones are cleared away and there is a fire place. The stonewalls give protection against the wind. On top of the small island you will have a nice 360 degree view. We parked our sprinter just at the given coordinates to whatch sunnrise and sunset. no facilities, but you get excellent entel- internet reception ( no wifi, but 3g). just to enjoy!

name: MAX Gas Station
description:
*Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
.....
24h gas station, security. We were allowed to park in the corner for free. toilets, shower, water, wifi is available just ask administración for the code . Quiet.

name: Salt Hostel
description: 100bs for private room, nice facilities. Breakfast was 10bs. Hot water. Arrived at 1:30am after being stuck in the mud for 30hrs, owners very nice

name: Puerto Suarez lake
description: Nice place in front of the lake. You can walk and park. It was a little bit noisy until 20 pm and quiet during the night.

name: Luciernagas
description: Authentic Bolivian food at its best. Run by a Dutch-Bolivian couple, this place offers authentic Bolivian cuisine for small money. The owners are very knowledgeable about what they serve and really interested in introducing local food to travelers. Set in an apartment converted into a restaurant one can get original Bolivian cuisine for small money. Definitely recommended to all foodies. If you can cook/reheat in your hotel/hostel/apartment, ask for a doggy-bag - if not, feast for a day or two - portions are massive and very affordable. 2 - 9$.

name: start of Choro trail
description: This is the start of the Choro trail, one of the old Inca trails. If you start in the morning at this point you can reach Chairo in 3 days, from where there is transport to Coroico (minivan 180, fits 8 people, car is less, fits 4 people). if you leave later during the day or want to take it easy it is better to allow 4 days. Beautiful hike, spectacular change of scenery and perfectly doable without a guide! (the path is also on mapsme if in doubt). Only very bacis supplies on the way, so better to bring (most of) your food. In terms of logistics: We left our car in Coroico and took a minivan to La Paz (ask to get off at La Cumbre) but it might also be possible to leave your car in Chairo, right at the end of the trail.

name: Villamontes - Residencial Pilcomayo
description: We could put our car at the small courtyard (2 cars max.) of the residencial and use the shared toilets and showers. Because the manager wasn't around, it was late and the lady in charge didn't know what to do with a request for sleeping in the car and using ablutions we accepted to take a room and told we would sleep in the car. When we were about to finish cooking the boss of the establishment arrived with her car and requested us to move to let her in. We needed some time to clean up the kitchen stuff to be able to move without damage. When it took too long to her taste she called the police. As this all didn't contribute to a pleasant stay we agreed to leave under the condition that the police would guide us to a better place. They took us to hotel San Francisco.

name: Estacion de Servicio Emanuel
description: Sells to foreigners at international price.

name: Bio Petrol
description: They did not sell to use (only if we would have had jerrycans) although they had a system to handle international customers.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Similar story as reported earlier between Samaipata and Santa Cruz. Tried to sell us an "Orden de Circulacion" for BOB 50. When we twice told crearly that we didn't need such a document we got the usual stamp on our TIP and could go.

name: Hostal Sajama
description:
Good place to stay, quiet. 60 bols per night for one person, moto (or car) parked inside (no gate but quiet place) in front of your room. 
20 bols for breakfast 
25 bols for diner

add 100 for entrance to the national park.

name: Muzungu Hostel
description:
nice hostel with shared accomodation (45bs/55bs) and rooms with or without private bathroom (140bs/160bs). Breakfast is included. Nice, hot, clean showers.
No parkinglot, there is a parking next block, but it was already full. The 3rd floor is a bit loud because there is a bar upatairs.

name: Hostal Maya
description: nice little Salt hostel. Clean showers and facilities, but cold water only when we were here. Bed for 60bs/p, we could negociate a bit, because it was four of us. We could use their kitchen as well.

name: Santa Rosa Bush Camp
description: Santa Rosa is not a very inviting place even to stay at the main plaza. This spot is at a dead end of a (former?) mining side track. Reasonably level, well hidden, somewhat narrow (high grass and shrubs on either side), Quiet.

name: archeological site, alcaya, chulpas,parking spot
description: there is a round course. it will take about 90 min. including fotostops. first up to the cementry: you see lot of bones and clothes, than their houses: round huts, no door, just one window, food storage huts, terraces all around the mountain, water irrigation system, view points, caves with quite a few mummies, old potteries. our lady guide ( 25 bs p.p.) explained very well and we decided how fast to go. the coordinates indicate the parking. there is a locked chain across the road at the entrance- close where we indicated the place we stayed over night.

name: alcaya, centro arqueologico, emprendimiento turistico
description: tourist resort, with toilets, showers, accomodation, including museum, but eyerything closed due to lack of tourist. our guide allowed us to stay with our camper here. its was very calm and save. nearby natural and collected water. very nice church. less than 10 min. walk to the parking at the arqueological site (which is definitely worth a visit!). there is a locked chain across the road, the guide  will open.

name: Volcanic Crater
description:
Meteorite craters, right next to the street. 
.....
 meteoritenkrater, direkt neben der straße. mit hinweisschild.

name: Temporary gas station
description: Located here whilst other one in town is built.  Next to the toll booth.  Gasoline and diesel.  Offered gasoline at foreigner rate into the tank, or 7bob for the Jerry cans.  We declined and went to the next town which fills for local rate.

name: Tienda of Dona Irma
description: If passing by this town stop in to say hello to Dona Irma Rosado at the small tienda off the square.  She served Che his last meal of peanut soup, and was the last person to speak to him before his execution.  If you ask she can tell you his last words (if you cannot speak Spanish you can read her story on our blog, but I won't spoil the experience on here :)).  She has some photos and news articles she can show you, and you can buy some small momentos or snacks from her.  We do not speak Spanish very well but we're lucky to have someone with us who could translate.  She is a fascinating lady with an amazing life story to tell.  I believe 2017 is the 50th anniversary of che's death.

name: Llaves
description: Need new keys cut?  This little kiosk on the corner is cheap, and his work is very good.

name: Comber: auto parts store
description: Has genuine and copy parts for vehicles.  We were told they were best in town for Toyota, and we were able to replace our very overdue 4runner air filter for 150bob.  This street has lots of auto places.

name: Start of Laguna Route/Southwest Circuit
description:
This is the most common point to turn off the main road when beginning the Laguna route.  

Seriously, turn around and go the other way unless you’re ready for this!

Additional Information: “Preparation for Laguna Route” pin located in Uyuni, and “Route Info SW Circuit (Tupiza-Lagunas)” pin located in Tupiza.

name: Corrupted Police Station
description:
Recent advice from Aduana is that your TVIP is accepted in lieu of an Orden de translado  and the police at control points should stamp the back of the TVIP and make no request for a payment or a tip.

We had to pay 50 bol to pass through. We didn't want at first but the policeman menaced us.. so we payed..
Second time for us in Bolivia with corrupted police..

name: Patacamaya
description: Accept to fill the tank for 6 bol 'sin factura' the liter (diesel). very friendly !

name: chullpas southwest oruro
description: from oruro f12 south, turn right directly at puenta espaniol. you can visit two groups of about twelve pre- columbian tombs, called chullpas, just a few hundret meters before there are more. or you can watch the birdlife at the shores of lake uro uro. no infrastructur.

name: Yapacani
description: Fuel station that fills foreign plated vehicles at local price.

name: La Mutualista Residencial
description:
A place to spend the night, the staff is friendly, 80 Bolivianos two people, it is clean, you can keep your bike but beware of cats like scratching the chairs, has air conditioning, television and porno channel: p Over the parking lot The bikes in the restaurant area, there is a parquo drive for cars and they charge 15 or 20 bolivianos 

Un lugar para pasar la noche, el personal es amable, 80 bolivianos dos personas, es limpio, puedes guardar tu moto pero cuidado a los gatos les gusta arañar los sillones, tiene aire aondicionado, television y canal por porno :p   Sobre el parqueo estacionamos las motos en el area de restaurante, hay parquo aparte para autos y cobran 15 ó 20 bolivianos

name: Residencial La Visión
description:
Modest tiled rooms with ceiling fan, fairly comfy beds (we've had some bad ones though) and shared bathrooms and showers hot and cold. 
We are here for 6 days during peak for the festival so the prices varied:
Normal rate - 3 person room was 50BOB per person (150BOB) per night. 
Peak rate - 100BOB pp (300BOB) per night for the 4 nights during the celebrations (28/7 - 2/8). 
Plenty of space to hang clothes if you do a wash. 
She was hesitatant to let us use the kitchen but said if we paid a little extra for gas it would be okay. 
Secure parking for motorbikes only, maybe a small car.

name: Off access road under the bridge
description: Heading towards cochabamba, hang a right after the bridge and follow road past several houses and down under a second bridge. Ok spot, not too pretty, but certainly out of the way and fine to layover one night before heading to cochabamba. This spot is under the second bridge on your right from the main road, you'll see it when you go down the path, fine for everyone to make it.

name: Wild camp off the road on field edge
description: Pulled off the road after AyoAyo but before the next overland pin at the hotel gran poder. there's a sign for the right hand turn, we pulled off and drove up the dirt track a bit and parked in a small turnout on a fields edge for the night. A local lady walked by and asked a few questions but otherwise it's super quiet, if cold and at 12500 feet. we didn't want to enter la paz at night so it's a decent place to layup.

name: Stannum Hotel
description: On the luxury end but they do have private parking in a garage big enough for overland vehicles. About $100 per night, super nice rooms, breakfast, bar and all above a cinema and Cinnabon. not exactly local flavor but nice place to place to lay up before hitting the border

name: El Bato
description: 3.75 x litro

name: 24 Septiembre
description:
40 bolivianos per double room and 5 for the parking of the two motorcycles 

40 bolivianos por habitacion doble y 5 por el parqueo de las dos motos

name: bush
description: nice, quiet spot bush camping, feed the dog!!

name: ypfb
description: Gas at 3.75 use a drum to fill and then put it in your car or motorcycle, they lend you the jar and the funnel.....Gas a 3.75 usa un bidon para llenar y despues lo pones en tu auto o moto, ellos te prestan el bidon y el embudo

name: Gas Station Santiaguito
description:
Update: Now gives fuel straight to the tank.

We filled our 20 liter jerry can three times for national price at 3.74 BOL. In total we bought 60 liters. Parked at opposite side of the road to fill it into our car. A bit ridiculous but cheap!

name: la paz
description: diesel Sin factura 7 bol/ litro

name: Wild camp on the way to Torotoro
description: In dry season you can get off the road here and follow the dry river track as far as you want. Good place, quiet and hidden from the street. No facilities. Take your rubbish, unfortunately there is already some...

name: Gasolinera
description:
They didn't want to give us gasolina......
Moderator Note: More recently, overlander was able to obtain diesel.

name: near cala cala pinturas rupestres ( felszeichnungen)
description: guide in village caro caro. just ask for him. 3,5km eastwards beneath an overhang are reddish pictures of people, lamas, condor, puma. the guide will open the fence, after you payed 10bs p.p.

name: Hostal San Marcos
description: Nice hostel for 60 Bol/p/night for a private room with private bathroom. No have Hot water all the time and average wifi. Nice patio. One block from the main square. there are kitchen nice with good equipment. no breakfeast. no laverie.

name: Luz de Mar
description:
The best daily menu we found in Rurre. Really good food (and a bit different to all the chicken places, finally) - for 15bob (25 on weekend) you get soup, main and a cold lemonade. Served by super nice owner too. Don't bother with cooking and go here :)
Tuesday-Sunday 7:30-22:30

name: El Retiro Camping
description: Nice area with toilets and cold shower, clean, play for kids and bbq. It's 15 bol/adult. Unfortunately, the access for waterfalls is not included in the price (15 again) and the man didn't want to negotiate. Also, we didn't try. The night was quiet. We were alone.

name: wild camp near dry river
description:
We parked in a completely dry river. It's hidden of the road and it was very quiet at night
the 4g reception is very good

name: wild camp near river
description: Very nice place in the valley near the river. The access might be difficult with the river's level and the road construction. We don't have 4x4 and it was possible for us in july. Choose if it's possible for you!!!

name: on the road to sajama
description: Big gravel pit well hidden of the road. Very quiet at night.  Lots space and no one to bother you.  Some view of the country side.

name: Entrance to Salar
description:
We have done 3 entrances to the Salar and this was one of the easiest and driest ones. Highly recommended if you are coming from the North, as it is easy, beautiful and no other cars around.
----
We entered the Salar here coming from La Paz. The road up to Salinas de Garci Mendoza is entirely nicely paved! From Salinas de garcia mendoza to the entrance is a dirt road but not too bad. We averaged 20-25km/h. The erntrance is really good. Just a little water in mid-july. Much better than the one in the south! If you follow the main track from here, you will reach Incahuasi.

name: Torneria Carlos V
description:
Welding workshop and lathes, they wanted to charge me 120 x work, I told them that for the same work they charged me 3 times less in Costa Rica. He asked me 80 and I offered him 50, I told him that I was walking and that I did not work, that if I did not willingly pay and I left 50 Bolivians 

Taller de soldadura y tornos, me quisieron cobrar 120 x el trabajo, yo les dije que por el mismo trabajo me cobraron 3 veces menos en Costa Rica. me pidio 80 y yo le ofreci 50, le dije que estaba paseando y que no trabajaba que si no con gusto pagara y me lo dejo 50 bolivianos

name: Hostal Quinua Dorada
description:
If you look for accomodation in Uyuni than no need to look further.. 
We got stranded in Uyuni with a broken front diff and tried several hostals and hotels, cheap and not cheap but this one stands out by far. Wilma is a host like a caring mother and did everything  to make our stay comfortable. Brougt us warm bread in the morning. Allowed us to cook and use her kitchen stuff as well. In fact we lived here as if it was our house. The place is one of the cleanest we stayed in Bolivia. Showers are suicuide but the better ones. There is a mirador overlooking Uyuni and the Salar, nice during night when lightning over the Salar. We paid 220 for a double with private bathroom and 200 for a quadruple with shared bathroom. 170 for double with shared bathroom. There is a garage with limited height, about 2,6m but in front of the door nothing goes on, Uyuni is not unsafe at all. 
They are not on booking as Wilma was not sure if her place has the standards to be listed ... well we assured her she will be a runner up when she does ... Give her a hug from the Dutch Family.
NOTE BigRig parking in street.

name: Genex - gasoline and diesel
description: Filled two jerry cans gasolina for local price. parked in front of restaurant next door

name: San Miguel Laguna
description: A beautiful lake near the town of San miguel, we camped on a grassy spot by the lake shore. Plenty of birdlife around and capibaras can be spotlighted at night.

name: Gasolina at local price
description:
Since we have left Uyuni, we have only paid local price. 
We park just out of view (this place has a perfect spot with trees next to the deisel side). 
We just walk in relaxed, say Hola and hand them the bidons. "Ochenta por favor" - 80B for one full. "Siento Sesenta" for two.
One place in Sucre asked for a passport number. The rest have just filled. Dont bother asking Sin Factura unless they start talking precio extranero.

name: San Antonio
description: Need a carnet de identidad, otherwise international price. mostly depends on the operator that takes care of you... can be local price.

name: Public Toilets & Showers
description:
Public Toilets and showers. 
Cleaner than most.

name: Aeropuerto el Alto
description:
Excellent place to visit La Paz and El Alto without entering the traffic. You can stay as long as you want. Easy access to the city Safe, bathrooms and wifi. 6 Bs. no matter how long you stay, you pay at the exit.  40 Bs. per 24hr in secured parking area. Three km walk at 4010 m high to the cableway but it is a great walk. Regular small buses to the cableway and to La Paz for 4.5 Bs.

.....
excelente lugar para ir a conocer La Paz y El Ato sin entrar en el trafico. cobran 6bol al salir y se puede permanecer el tiempo que uno quiera. facil acceso a la ciudad y pueden conocer la feria del alto.
seguro, baños y wifi

name: Irupana
description: Filled our tank at the local price, no volume limit, no bargaining. And they have water (supposedly potable)!

name: Hotel El Monarca
description: To fix some stuff on the car we searched for a plane campspot without sand or mud - not very easy along ruta 25 :-). So we fortunately found this hotel with a public swimming pool and a restaurant (which was closed when we were here). They have a levelled grassy area where we camped for only 20 bol per night (2 persons + car). The very friendly owner couple was amazed about us and the fact that we sleep in our car, they have never had foreigners here. Sadly the toilets and the cold showers are dirty and could need some maintenance...

name: Abandoned thermal bath
description: Hot springs for free. Temp ~40°C We only took hot water for washing from here as the bath is quite overgrown. Small ruined building nearby.

name: Access point to Licancabur Volcano's trail
description: You can leave a car here and climb Licancabur (trail is covered by OSM). Also a nice camping spot- there is a stone shelter, so it's not windy. Inca ruins 500 m away. Beautiful views of Laguna Verde.

name: San Pedro. Hot Springs
description: No facilities, but you can enjoy nature by yourself. Same temperature as in paid one.

name: Access to the canyon
description: Nice spot for wild camping. Not windy and hidden from the road. Plenty of canyons nearby - a lot of camping possibilities. Awesome views in the morning!

name: Huge Canyon - viewpoint
description: Amazing canyon - just a viewpoint, access to the canyon is nearby Estancia Capilla Filo.

name: Sol de mañana - Checkpoint
description: Eduardo Avaroa Nacional Reserve starts here. Entrance fee: 150 BOB/person. Toilets available: 5 BOB.

name: Canyon Camp
description: Access point is by Estancia Capilla Filo. 4x4 only as you need to cross quite deep rivers 3 times + drive through soft sand. Windy in the evening, but not during the night.

name: Toyota parts ONLY
description:
We were sent here to buy a part for our tyre (we somehow lost a lug nut on the Laguna route) when they didn't have it at the Toyota service centre near the telerifico (16.51942° S, 68.11539° W).

I wouldn't drive here in a big vehicle as it is right in the city centre, and would definitely try to do everything you need at the other Toyota outlet if you can.

Showroom on top level, parts shop down the bottom.

name: queseria suiza  by buena vista
description: a good place to stock up with cheese prepared by swiss owner. very tasty! we just can recommend it

name: Church on a hilltop
description: We followed the signs for a tourist centre which was promising toilets and showers.  Alas, it wasn't open (and didn't seem entirely built) when we arrived.  There is a parking lot and a church, and the start of some walking trails.   There is a non-potable water tap next to the tourist centre, and some intermittant open WiFi networks available.   Free and no facilities.   Only small rigs will make it up the hill (much like the access road to Sol y Luna)

name: Julio Gamarra Mecanica Automotriz
description:
Perhaps one of the best workshops in Sucre! Repairing all brands. Very reliable. brown red big gate. Open mon-sat 8:30-12:30/14:30-18:30. Even mentioned which screws we should check again after how many kilometers... But please be patient, always have a lot of work.
Approx 6 working days net or 50 hours = $ 250.-.
Very nice people too, Offered us a room to stay in their own house for BOB 60.-/day.
P.S .: On our VW T3 Syncro Vanagon we have repaired the gearbox, the clutch and a wheel bearing.

Comment: very busy and does not touch diesel engines

name: Pacheco Motors General Mechanic
description: Marcelo is a brilliant mechanic who replaced all our brake pads and sorted another problem with our back wheels. Fairly priced and thorough work. Friendly, honest and speaks some English if necessary. Recommended. Not allowed to camp in workshop.

name: Gingers Paradise Hostel And Restaurant
description: You have to park on the side of the road and walk across the suspension bridge then a nice 10 min walk through the jungle to first the hostel and then a bit further along the house where you can have breakfast/dinner. Very friendly. Organic everything and amazing homemade juices for BS10. We didn't stay in the hostel so do not know many details - sorry!

name: Hotel Villa Chiquitana
description:
*Overnight parking/camping is NOT available at this location.
....
Beautiful Hotel with campground in garden next to pool. 40BOl p.P.
Restaurant, WiFi, gym, book exchange ... a great place, but tents and vans no longer accepted!

name: Ocotavi
description: ES Ocotavi 5BS per liter. First gas station since La Paz that would fill for less than the international price.

name: Sacaba
description: gas for regular price. 8.6 BOL. have cameras

name: Transmission Specialist READ CHECK-INS
description:
6/2017  not a good place to go anymore, if you don't have choice, be carefull, the team is very friendly but one of the boss(pepe's broyer ) is not a good guy, he will do anything to get a lot of money from you.

Jose (Pepe) specialises in transmissions and was able to work on our automatic US van. He had a Ford scanner, spoke great English and was really knowledgable. Very reasonably priced too!

name: Electrical Mechanic
description: We had the electrical mechanic here work on our vans brake lights for the whole day. Efficient, cost was great and we now have working brake lights.

name: Gas Station
description: They fill cars for the tourist price 8.68 per liter gasolina (police presence) or local price if you have jerry cans (bidones) . Park outside the gate to fill bidones otherwise they will not give you the local price.

name: Valley Camp
description:
drive up a gravel road that branches of this beautiful pass.  I imagine the road would be suitable only for small rigs because of the tight corners.  we made it fine with our 2 wheel drive 4runner.  this spot is on the side of the road, it is the flattest spot we could find but we needed rocks to level.  there are plenty.  you could go further if you like but the road looks like it gets a little worse from here.   it is just past a small settlement.   didn't see anyone except cows.

we went for a morning coffee walk up to the next abandoned settlement.  there are some better camping options further up.

name: bano y duchas
description: cold showers 3 toilets 1 bol.  is what you would expect

name: Dried up waterfall camp
description: This is just a pull off on the main road but is the best thing we saw between here an Mapiri.  We did see a few sports grounds like places near towns but wanted to stay away from the locals.  the road between here and Mapiri is mostly a single lane that runs along the cliff.  it does go down close to the river for a while where wash outs are plentiful.  one was fresh and we had to use our shovel to get through.  actually the taxi driver the rocked up 5 minutes after used it and we just kinda watched.

name: ABC For Free Route Map Bolivia
description: Here you Can get an actual Free map of Bolivia at ABC on the 8th floor. Tip, take the most right lift to the 20th floor, to have a great view over the city. Beware it is a big poster, not really foldable.

name: Credinform SOAT
description: Easy to buy soat here, Bs130. Opening hrs 8:30-12:30, 14.30-18:30 Monday-Friday

name: Airport El Alto
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please stop posting wifi passwords. This is NOT allowed on iOverlander.

Atention.... big rigs do not go in anymore !!! Secured parking for B40 per 24hrs. Good place to park your vehicle safely. Walking distance from red teleferico. Or taxi to purple one (25 Bs).  We were told that the free parking on airport (only one time B4 for entering airport) is not safe. Friendly security, we stayed 5 nights. Toilets and wifi in airport, 1 minute from the parking.

name: Bermejo Square
description: Quite town to safely stay the night, not much around, few little restaurants and beautiful view on the mountain.

name: Next to school in Pozo Del Tigre
description: Quiet and dusty town. Nothing here but friendly people who guided us to the Escuela. There is a 24hr guard.

name: Square Of Santiago De Chiquitos
description: Safe place to park for a night. We could even plug in to power at the 'Internet-cafe' on the corner. There is a electricity socket under the exterior roof that we could use.  But the owner did a bit secretly about it, because its government power. We could plug in after 8:30pm and he asked not to tell the people in town about it. Nice BBQ on the square at night and the climb to the top of the mirador is worth it. Beautiful view and rock formations and many birds (we saw toucans!).

name: Roundabout Gasstation Puerto
description:
5Bs/Ltr, he began with 6Bs, we negotiated a bit. 

Bidon for local price with local ID (just ask someone)

name: 20l jugs - Cascada
description:
Bottel station where you can buy 20l jugs for 20bol.
Friendly staff, they cleaned our bottles, provided a funnel and helped with the transfer of the water to our tank.

We prefered to drive here as they are just one street back on the way to Coroico, but you can also call them for delivery in the next day. Number must be printed on all the small bottles you buy on the streets.

name: Migración
description:
Easy. They gave us 30 more days and could extend permit 14 days prior to die date. 

official just 5 days before expiring!!
we guess it depends on the guy!

name: Aduana Car Extension
description: Easy, fast. Bring the car and make sure you park it in their parking lot as they are not willing to go out to the street to check motor numbers and so on (they did not look inside). We could extend for 30 more days; in the beginning they said 30 days from today, we finally convinced them to extend 30 days from due date - so 38 days- like they did in immigration.

name: Mozzarella
description: Delicious pizza, cheap prices. Cute and cosy restaurant with good wifi. Perfect combo!

name: Car Parts Area
description: This area of La Paz sells lots of different types of car parts and oil. Some places take credit card. We easily found fuel and oil filters for our USA van here.

name: Hostal Edén
description:
Really new place. 
50bobs p/p for a private room, shared bathroom & breakfast. 
30bobs p/p for a 5 bed share dorm, share bathroom without breakfast. 

Breakfast is bread & spread (the usual suspects) but they also offer eggs and fruit which was nice.

For internet they only have a USB dongle plugged into the wifi router (very limited) and they ask that you only use it for messenger services.

They have a kitchen which apparently nobody had even used yet but it costs 10bobs (for the both of us) per day to use so we opted out.

There's the local food market across the road and another place on the street below the hostel with food too so it might as well have its "own restaurant"

name: Station Arani
description:
First station in Bolivia where they serve us at local price without any question, directly in the tank.
No camera no issues, friendly workers! :-)

name: river camp
description:
level space on river rocks. near the road.
maybe too rocky for tents.

name: old road
description: part of the old road, right next to the dirt road. big level space. visible from road. very quiet. nice view.

name: Disused asphalt road.
description: Free, quiet spot between train tracks and river, close to road but I seen

name: Veterinario Angeles & Guardianes
description: Very friendly and helpful staff. We got our pup microchipped for Europe (200 B) and a rabies shot after (70 B). You can also get a health certificate here for 50b. Deworming 20 B. They offer full veterinary services and are very professional and clean.

name: Paso de la Cumbre
description:
Good overnight stop including toilets outside La Paz, next to the information center for the Choro trail. No people, no traffic noise.

Comment: Still a great place to stay overnight at 4700mtrs I arrived in the dark so followed IO location ...multiple options to park seen in the morning The problem is that the Death Road Cycle tours all leave from this point early morning with music and high five woopings ...alternative parking can easily be found for more privacy

name: DC Treasure Island
description: Nice island. Coordinates lead to a huge beach, but this could be inaccessible during wet season. Lots of cacti.

name: In the field of rocks
description: Wind sheltered + amazing views of rock formations around. We managed to squeeze between rocks in a small canyon. Not for big rigs. Invisible from the road.

name: Barraca Lubricantes
description: Green building at the corner. We paid 180 BOL for engine oil change (6 l of oil and we provided an oil filter that we bought before) and 20 BOL for break fluid top-up (small bottle). Guy also cleaned our air filters and engine with air pressure for free.

name: ATM
description:
*See comments below. This place is NOT likely to accept foreign cards.
.....
ATM in the border town. If you don't want to change money.

name: YPFB
description: Not possible to refuel there. Don't fill jerry cans.

name: Gas Station
description: They fill up for the normal tourist price.

name: Basic Food
description: This is one of the only places in town that has food. It's tasty after almost having a heart attack on the way here from Mapiri this morning.

name: Good Place To Sleep
description: There is not many free places on overlander in La Paz, but this place is good, we parked here on two different occasions and its close to a lot of bars up the street and a park, but it's nice and quiet. Next to the police station and a little church senor a deal Carmen. I felt safe. Park exactly across/ infront of the church

name: Kasa Cultural - for free
description: It's a nice eco hostal, restaurant and (tent) camping, we asked if we could spend the night across the street on the pebble beach without using their facilities and the owner was completely fine, we were allowed to use their "Bano seco" for free. Nice views on the beach, quiet at night and even clean of rubbish because the hostal had installed waste separation tons on the beach - not common for Lake Titicaca yet! We tipped her 15 Bops...

name: River and Llama Camp
description: Beautiful spot on the way from Oruro to Uyuni, on side of the road but far enough away that you're not visible at night. Right on the banks of river. Llamas and bird life. 4WD not necessary in dry season, not sure about wet, might be boggy? Note, the road direct from Oruro to Uyuni is fully paved and looks brand new - best road we've had in South America so far!

name: Argentina / Bolivia
description: Customs and Immigration for both Argentina and Bolivia are located on Argentina side of the bridge - do all necessary vehicle paperwork there. Clearly marked booths! Very quiet and easy border compared to Villazon. Argentina Aduana checking vehicles at a checkpoint before the border formalities. Police and toll road in Bolivian on the other side of the bridge. Bermejo has a huge market and tons of food stalls, worth checking out.

name: Don Tomás Vinos & Singani
description: Take a detour off Ruta 1 to visit Villa Abecia - it's a gorgeous town. While you're there go to Don Tomás Artesanal Vinos and Singani. All are pretty sweet, but if you have a sweet tooth you will love them! He will give you a free (generous) tasting. He's located on the plaza, with a cool mural outside. Can't miss him. There are a number of other low key bodegas on, and slightly off, Ruta 1 - if you can find them and they are actually open. Absolutely stunning drive through red rock formations and lush river valleys !!

name: Rio Tumusia Wild Camp
description: Lovely spot right on the river, surrounded by red rock formations. Lots of flat area and sunshine. Access down small dirt road (same one as other ioverlander spot), then over a log bridge and through some sand - bridge is sturdy and sand fairly firm. We spent 2 days here and saw no one. Can swim / bathe in the river. It is definitely worth driving further up the valley for a look, it is absolute paradise.

name: Cinti SRI Gas Station
description: Wouldn't let us tank, but let us park out of camera view and then fill up jerrycans for local price. We were only allowed 40L / 2 jerrycans worth though. Tap for water available to use too.

name: Parking Lot
description: We parked here from Saturday until Monday over the weekend and came back at night to sleep in the Van. From what we seen the parking is free on the weekend and during the week you have to pay. Not sure what the hours are for the paid parking as we left Monday morning.

name: Small Fuel Shop
description: There are two places in this tiny town which sell gasoline and diesel. 32 bob for 5 litres gasoline

name: Centro Minero Pulacayo
description: Abandoned mining town where still locals live. 10 Bol pp

name: gringo tech - electronica automotriz
description:
Very good workshop for any type of electrical problem. David, his owner, knows a lot and is an excellent person. There are many customers so be patient!


muy buen taller para cualquier tipo de problema electrico. david, su dueño, sabe muchisimo y es una excelente persona. hay muchos clientes asi que paciencia!

name: Petrol Sin Factura
description: Guy offered 5 Bobs per Lt without negotiation, all young and nice

name: Caracolles lodge
description:
A jungle-lodge run by Bala-tours (in Rurrenabaque) where you take a motor-canoe onto the Rio Yacumo. You'll see caymans, capibaras, dolphins, fish for piranhas, and thousands of birds.
The cost of a 2 night, 3 day stay is U$ 260.= (including lodging, meals, guide, water, thee, coffee).
Booking at Bala tours, calle Santa Cruz in Rurrenabaque.

name: River Bank
description: Several places also close to the river. Quite spot. You can take a swim in the river.

name: Border Crossing Bolivia-Argentina V.S
description: Very quiet and easy. Don't forget a stamp from the police at the Bolivia site. After you cross the bridge. (Update: Not sure this is required now).

name: Gasoline Station Tarija
description:
Easy diesel at 5.5 bol.
Have a smile and go... :)

name: Near The Ruta 1
description:
Nice and quiet place. 
May levelled spots.
Could be cold and windy

name: Taller de Lubricantes GYM
description: Oscar Machicado runs this family garage. This place was recommended to us by our travel agency and we were really satisfied. We went there for a routine maintenance check on our 4x4 (motor oil change, fuel filter and oil filter change). Oscar sourced the pieces in the adjacent street. In addition to the raw price of the elements he charged us 80 bolivianos for man hour. You can also ask for a complete car wash. We didn't need one at that time but the work on other car appeared serious (including washing of the engine). Oscar also accompanied us to change our front lights to a neighboring store. You can reach him at 79667566 or 72599850. The full direction is Valentin Avecia n. 1849 Suc. Calle José Saravia n. 1642 Zona Alto San Pedro - La Paz - Bolivia

name: Alojamiento Pukara
description: This alojamiento is a family run place right in the historical center. Prices are unbeatable for such a location. Matrimonial bedroom at 80 bolivianos with private bathroom and 50 bolivianos with shared bathroom. The rooms/beds are sort of clean and the common area is cleaned many times a day. The electric showers are okay. We went for the shared bathroom option because otherwise the shower is right above the toilet for a private configuration. There is no wifi and TVs only for the 80 Bol rooms. We parked our 4x4 inside the hostel for a supplement of 10 Bol per day.

name: Soldar / Welding
description: Came here to fix something walter   (el chileno) had fixed 2 days before. this guy seems to have the better welding skills and maybe walter has more car related skills. at the end we think both are good. this guy is opposite the school and its a brown metal door next to a yellow painted building

name: tika restaurant
description: fabulous!!! :o not more expensive than the other tourist pizzarias, but the meat, the desserts and the wine is a class of it's own. if you want to do yourself something good after jumping out of your dusty truck: come here!! for bargainers: real good burgers incl. homemade french fries for 55 BOBs!! we paid 30€ for 2 mains, 2 desserts, 3 wine, 1 beer, 1 espresso, 1 water and it was great!!!

name: Waterfall camp
description: Not very hidden, but locals are friendly and won't bother you. Nice waterfall with pool by the bridge.

name: River Dolphins Puente Tijamuchi
description: You are able to see the river dolphins from this bridge

name: Museo de Arte Indígena ASUR
description:
This museum is one of the best we have been to in South America. It focuses on the textiles, as well as music and dance, of the Jalq'a and Tarabuco cultures. The displays of textiles, costumes, instruments etc are stunning. We found it far more engaging than some other museums we've been to. Also, they provide a booklet with all the display text in English so you don't miss anything!

Hours:
Mon-Fri: 09:00 - 12:30, 14:30 - 18:00
Sat: 09:00 -12:00, 14:30 - 18:00

Entrance: 25 BOL

name: Flores - Taller de Chapa y Pintura
description: If you need any paint or panel work done head to Edgar Flores. He was recommended to us by Don Julio (mechanic). We had some horrible spray paint removed from our van, no panel work. Super quick, friendly and a really good job. Address is Mexico 202 - big spray painted gate.

name: Mirador / parking
description:
Nice view of the mountains and a big flat area to camp. No facilities. 
Lots of trash!

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Update 30.3.28: no corruption today. Checked driver license and let us pass.

name: By the river
description: If going from Caranavi to Mapiri: turn left just beyond the bridge and drive down to the river approx.80 metres. A little bit muddy just before the river but will do. A lot of sandflies - like everywhere in the jungle! Hidden from the road.

name: Street Market, Public Toilet & Shower
description: Small street market for fruit, veges, meat and second hand clothes. 15m away is a clean public shower and toilet.

name: policia de transito
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Corruption reported on cost....paperwork is required according to Aduana.

This is a place where you can get your orden de transaldo. It seems a real official paper and cost 50 bol. Took around 10 min with driving licence and car papers. With this you can pass any control without any problems.

name: alanoca
description: An air-conditioning hose had slipped off, and was dumping water on the passengers feet! He tried to fix it but after 15 minutes he told us the hose had slipped off deeper in, and it would be a half days work to fix. He suggested we go to Santa Cruz, and he gave me a recommendation of a mechanic there. Had quoted me 100 Bol for the fix initially (parts and labour), so just gave him 50 as he had had to pull a bunch of stuff off to assess it.

name: Alojamiento El Viejo
description: Nice clean room, with TV and fan. Share bathrooms with hot shower. very good price, we paid 50bol for a room (2 people). Better value than Cuna hotel

name: Main Plaza
description: We stayed on the main plaza, quiet at night, busy at 6am. There is everything you need in town, even a bank. It took us 6 hours from la Higuera to here, dirt and rocks. 4WD not needed but good driver is ;)

name: repuestos VW
description:
Shock absorbers, spark plugs, korea,


amortigadores, bujias, corea,

name: Torneria
description: torneria recomanded by don Julio Gamarra, el mecanico

name: lider supermarket
description: Lider supermarket with good prices, good street parking. Not too much traffic

name: Residencial Huari
description:
Nr 50, orange/yellow building. Reasonably priced rooms with shared bathrooms, electric hot showers. WiFi.

They have a parking at the back

name: las retamas
description:
We wanted to have a small cheap diner like a pension (10bob each) thought it was perfect from
the reviews. They had only meat a la placha as I am vegetarian, they served me a soup and a soup to my husband too who took the chicken plate. It was good but the bill end up at 130bob!!
It is trie that they have a great wifi!
Good spot but not for small budget :)

name: Aduana
description: aduana

name: Aduana for TIP
description: Big Aduana building. Park outside and walk into the door on the left side of the gate.

name: Next to the road
description: We had to stop cause it was night. We were with truckers on the side of the road. They are some restaurant and tap water outside. The closest hôtel is at bombeo, closer to cochabamba.

name: hiking trail along the river
description:
A self guided hike along the river. There are a few sketchy bridges which add to the walk and a little tunnel. Local people are building new bridges. Many different butterflies and access to swimming. 
Initially you walk past a few houses and it feels like you are in someones yard but it is the best access. Just say hola as you pass and everyone smiles back.

name: MAC Tyres and bateries
description: Good tyres and bateries shop. They also do alination and rotation.

name: Very good electrician
description:
our alternator had been water damaged in Rurre when it was cleaned. 
This guy worked through the night and also dropped us off and picked us up from the hotel and offered recommendations in town. 380b for repairs. 
Very good

name: Vet Mundo Animal
description: Excellent vet. We check all the others on ioverlander but non of the vets were there. So we found this one and it is great! Very friendly and professional. 90 usd per certificate and desparasitation. Pet food and medicine.

name: Alojamento Riberalta
description: Hostel with rooms up to 4 persons. space for parking the bikes, possibly cars.

name: Chiriguano
description: good bike mechanic

name: Hostal Compañia de Jesús
description:
Nice quiet hostel with parking for 3 bikes (or more if you are good at Tetris).
entrance is a narrow fit but should work for most bikes without taking panniers off.

80b for single with bathroom
130b for double with bathroom

name: Villa Bonita
description: Great family run vegetarian restaurant. Cheaper than the restaurants in town with large portions. Beautiful location with a very appealing atmosphere. There is accommodation available also

name: Agencia Pil - food store
description: We found unsalted butter and natural yoghurt here. The owners are very friendly. This business was recommended locally as the distributor...

name: Turnout at road number 23
description: big turnout, some parts hidden from the street, very quiet at night, little traffic starts at 7:30 a.m., good opportunity on the way to Cochabamba or Sucre

name: Lookout over Cochabamba
description: behind the street leading down to Cochabamba, hidden from the road, beautiful views to the valley below, nice and quiet at night, not too cold

name: Da Vinci - Italian
description: Incredible Italian food at really reasonable prices (30B for pasta and 45-65 for medium/huge pizza). This is now the best pizza we have had in Bolivia! It's popular with locals and expats. 2 for 1 cocktails on Fridays. Highly recommended.

name: Hare Krishna - Vegetarian
description: Lovely vegan restaurant - Tulasi. A drink, postre, sopa and self serve buffet for 20B each. Pile your plate high of all kinds of veges and salads. If you're craving some green stuff after weeks of papas then come here!

name: Hostal Gladisol
description: Free parking in the back yard of the hostal. Stayed for free in the car. Room for 50BOL.

name: Alianza
description: Place to buy  the SOAT.

name: Aduana Nacional
description: If you need to extend you temporarily import permit after getting a longer visa, you have to go to window 4 (ventanilla 4) and they will get you the new paper with the the later expiration date. Copyshop for the needed copies is in the same building complex. You also can eat lunch (15BOB) while waiting for the paper to get ready.

name: Ruta 22
description: No problem to fill the jerry cans for local price. Also diesel directly into the tank at local price (November 23).

name: Auto repuestos formula 1
description: Don Pablo has everything you need for VW Kombis and Bugs imported from Brazil.

name: hostal vallegrande
description:
30 bol pp. free parking. hot shower. clean at the bolivian standars. shared bath. 
you can get better amenities but prices go high.

name: Beula
description: Great hotel on the plaza of Santiago de Chiquitos.

name: Help to get your car out!!
description:
Here lives Anasto, old man who will help you to take the car out the Salt you got stuck in the mud.
He asked strait for 500bol (negociated in 50usd) and we get in his crappy toyota loaded with woods plates until the van. We lift it up slowly and put salt blocks under the 4 tyres until we could fit the wood plates... and drive out over the wood to a safer place.
WARNING: Do not go too close to the Islands or the shores of the Salar, we sank until the axe in the South side.

name: Hi Tech / Retenes Ortuño
description: Maintenance and repair of brakes, steering - hydraulic systems in general. Both shops next to each other, one for parts and the other service. Took our power steering unit to get the seals etc replaced. Quick work and friendly - but expensive (for us anyway). Lots of car parts and mechanics along Calle Santivañez. Phone 4588810 or 4584469.

name: Water - 20L Water Cooler Exchange
description: Exchange your 20L water cooler bottles here for 20B. Or if you can find the local distributor it's 15B. Underneath the Victoria Hotel, right on the plaza.

name: Gas Station
description:
Let us fill jerrycan for local price sin factura. Not sure whether we could have tanked, didn't ask. Nice people.
Update Feb 2020. Filled our tank. (100 litres). No questions.

name: mercado artesanal
description: mercado artesanal

name: El lago de los cisnes
description: free camping if you buy some food at restaurant. 40 bol a fish. only park for moto.

name: More like Death Road
description:
We drove down death road and can see why it got its name in the past. Bow it is a nice scenic drive - not so scary as there is almost no traffic these days and only slow scenic drivers.
However this road is as thin as the famous 'death road'. A single lane road perched on the side of a cliff with two way 'bolivian' traffic. Not as green as the other side of the Yungas but with many coco plantations in the mountains it looks like patchwork.

name: hostal austria
description: Good hôtel near the center. They have double,triple, etc. We paid 80Bol/night for a double with shared bathrooms. They offer kitchen, living room, wifi, computer, book exchange. They also offer laundry for 10Bol / kilo (did not tried). We parked the van in the parking lot 5 blocks east.

name: Gas station Varela
description: Wouldn't sell for anything but international price, said there were cameras

name: ANTICafe Chukuta
description:
A cafe with a twist. A really cool hangout with board games, bookswap, food, wifi. 

How this anticafe works, 
12b per hour includes free coffee, tea and mate station and cookies and your own chilling space. Only 4b an hour if you buy food. (which I highly recommend)
It has a designer menu where you can design sandwiches and breakfast. (eg. muesli down to the types of seeds, fruit, yoghurt/milk, quinoa/oat/wheat etc 15bob hmm) 

Real certified organic coffee from the Yungas and local and imported craft beers. 

Really friendly staff both in English and Spanish.

name: on the route to cavern
description: free camping. bath and water. have to walk 1 km from route

name: Cobocaucho - Tyres, Alignment Etc
description: Large and professional tyre and service centre. Specialising in Bridgestone / Firestone. Was 120B for alignment - service while you wait in a nice big waiting room. Baños, wifi and agua available. We didn't book in, just turned up early morning. Really friendly and can refer you to other nearby mechanics if you need further work done.

name: IC Norte Hipermercardos
description: Massive supermarket with everything you could possibly want / be missing. Huge selection of brands. Can buy the 20L watercooler bottle here, amongst other household things. Lots of parking and easily accessible on the corner of two avenues. Bunch of other retailers, cinema, pharmacy and ATMs there as well.

name: flat place by a creek
description: on our way from Brazil through Bolivia on the way to Santa Crutz we were a bit late and did not want to drive to the closest iOverlander spot so we found this miniroad going off the main route and followed it to the creek. here is a smaller clearing. no one around, jungle all around you and plenty of moskitos and krikets. great for a sleepover but nothing else. 4x4 reccomended to get here.

name: TNA Island East entrance
description: Safe entrance to the island. Seems to be less muddy than the western bay. Start of a trail across the island.

name: Hotel Camana Inn
description: Very nice hotel. 120 bol for a private matrimonial room with bath, hot shower and garage (3 blocks from the hotel). Roger  the administator was very nice and helpfull with infos.

name: North Salar Mirador Wild Camp
description: This looks like a construction pull out on the salar side of the road. We parked on the point with a beautiful view, incredible sunrise and quite sheltered from the wind in spots. No services but very quiet and nobody else around. Far enough off the road to not be obvious at night.

name: Hotel Quinones
description: nice hotel with parking lot. 70 for double room. 150 with a/c

name: The Adventure's Brew Hostel
description: Excellent restaurant in the best hostel in La Paz. Wifi great. Sitauted just 10 minutes walk from Cathederal San Fransico and 5 minutes walk from the main bus terminal making Adventure Brew Hostel a must for avid travellers ande Beer lovers alike.The roof top terace and common areas make it a great place to meet people and other travllers. There are a range of private ensuite room and both female dormitory´s as well as standard shared dorm rooms t5o choose from.

name: Jaguar Azul
description: clean. park for motorcycles free. wifi bad. friendly staff. Great ubication. 55 bol pp shared room.

name: Car Dismantlers and Accessories
description: Avenida Siles has loads of car dismantlers with every kind of part you may need. There are also shops with new parts, and tons of accessories (seat covers, mats etc).

name: Talleres Villa Vicencio
description: Really good workshop - the owner Alejandro is super helpful, plus he speaks perfect English and kept us in the loop the whole time. His mechanic Herman does really fast work and knows what he's doing. New and very tidy workshop. We got our suspension redone and an extra electric fan installed for our radiator. Friendly guys, highly recommended. Ph 76989003 or email talleresvillavicencio@gmail.com

name: Samaipata at soccer field (self contained campers)
description: An alternative for those with a self-contained camper: open lot at the soccer field, edge of town. Level but dusty lot. Quiet apart from the typical dogs and roosters.

name: Hotel turistico Poopo
description:
great hotel with shower.
parking for motorcycle and cars
thermal pool 3 bol

name: Sinchiwayra
description:
Cheap and clean with hot gas showers. perfect views. cant get closer to the water. secure parking and is possible to camp in the parking. friendly staff. two double beds and can add another if needed. private shower/toilet.
contact number is 67193392. The sign out the front is on the second level and faded.

name: Sipe Sipe Gas Station
description:
Let us fill up a 20L jerrycan for local price. Entered birthdate as the carnet. Not sure if we could have tanked for negotiated price. 

2022: 5 bobs/liter sin factura into tank

name: Hotel Wilkafer
description:
Expensive at the bolivian standard. 70 bs pp. Shared bathrooms, very simple. 10 bs extra for moto. Bicycle can be stored inside for free.
If you are unlucky enough to end at this town there is not too much option.

name: Thermas River
description:
Lovely spot right by the river with hot water!!! 
Enjoy the birds and sunset.
you have to cross the first stream which is cold water and drive 
Better to walk 300m toward the hill to get to the river.
Follow the track, nice flat grassy area and firepit.

name: Lavarap laundry
description: 20Bop/kg. Really friendly and good and fast job! We tried the other one on ioverlander but prefer this one.

name: Rock and river
description: Beautiful landscape, far away enough from the main road. Close to a river and between some rocks where you can find some wind protection. We saw some farmers in the distance but they left after sunset. Good dirt road to the spot.

name: Tourist Police & information
description: The police here offer information. They were very helpful with enquiries concerning dentist and other health issues; telephone problems; gas and water filling. We will update with the usefulness of their suggestions.

name: Pasalo Bien Camping
description: Beautiful campground at the bottom of the canyon. Definitely more aimed at tent camping but we could park the car on the small parking lot in front of the gate at the street (sand path, no traffic) and use the facilities inside. Nice grassy field with sitting area and BBQ, good bathrooms, swimming pool, very friendly family who owns the camping. We could even plug in electricity with our very long extension. Just follow the signs on the highway which say Pasalo Bien San Pedro - camping 10 km (actually it is 13.5 km from the highway). It's a rough road but easy to drive when it's not raining. The first kilometers are flat but "corrugated sheet" (not sure if you can say that in English), the next are tight curves and quite steep slopes, the last are flat but rough terrain. All in all perfectly fine without 4x4 and we think medium to big rigs can also manage when they are adventurous and not too long. Oncoming traffic could be a problem but we didn't meet a single other car. 25 BOB per person. A hidden gem.

name: EL Rosario
description: Perfect spot!  We ask for permission. No problem at all but later they bring you mango's. Away from the dust.

name: Villamar. Hotel jardines de mallku cueva
description:
We slept on their parking lot for free. Hot showers for 7 persons = 50 BOBrestaurant: buffet

Nous avons dormi sur leur parking for Free. Hot showers for 7 persons = 50 BOB
restaurant : buffet

name: Cordillera Quimsa Cruz road
description:
Road la paz - cohoni-cairoma-rodeo -caxata.
This Road is OK, we did it with our motorbike, good dirt-road. The  part before cohoni is very steep, but we have seen taxis on it. 
very wild and beautiful, lakes, ice, canyon, little pueblos...
 On OSM, a part of the road is missing, but in reality there is two ways.

name: Taller Automotriz auto box specialist.
description: Serviced our land cruiser auto box (which was overheating), cleaned filter and replaced the fan on our after market oil cooler, not the cheapest but very professional and did an excellent job.

name: Isla Mogli - Salar de Uyuni
description: On this place you're able to enjoy the sunset and the sunrise on the next morning at once. It's a little bit windy, maybe not recommended for tent camping.

name: Planta Quora Quora
description: We were unable to have our German cylinders filled here, but only because we didn't have the right adaptor. They tried very hard to help us.

name: 4060m
description: Best diner and cocktails I had in Bolivia, but also the most expensive. 80b for a juicy (and not too cooked!) steak, 35b for a cocktail. Place is new, warm and clean. Closed on Sunday, not sure it's open for lunch.

name: Casa De La Moneda
description: 40b entrance, 1.5h tour English or Spanish. Add 20b if you want to take pictures. Interesting but I was expecting something more animated. Bit expensive.

name: Planta Quimica de Acido Borici
description: No issue for this track. Probably the highest point in the way to Laguna Colorada coming from Chalviri and San Pedro de Atacama. Near of this point geyser Sol de Mañana is worth to be seen.

name: Mirador Aguas Calientes / Laguna Colorada
description: A good place to contemplate the Laguna Colorada from the noth-west side. Possibilty of wild camp, you have just to ask at the ranger at the gate near of the pointview, his name is Edgar, very friendly an he gave us many informations about tracks and about the animals of the parc...

name: Hotel del Desierto Tayka / Campsite
description:
A double in this hotel is very expensive : 158 USD. We ask at the desk if we could park our car in front of the hotel to sleep inside, they agree. It was cold and windy, the owner told us if we were interested by a room at 50 USD with open breakfast (very poor); after 7 days of rough nights...we accepted. 
This special price is lower because rooms are in another construction reserved for the guides of tour operators, at 300 meters from the main hotel. 
Diner : 18 USD/pers. including the vision of a magnificent sunset before and during the meal...
Wi-Fi is not really valid in this place.

name: Empanada Las Carmelitas
description: The best cheese empanadas of the trip so far!! Each costs 7 bol and are baked. Pretty popular with locals. Now there is a sign, red wall, and plastic tables in front.

name: Hostal Eucalyptus
description:
220 BOL for a double with bathroom and breakfast (very good). The owner of the hotel suggested me to park our Defender in his own house (1 km further) for free. 
Wi-Fi is excellent (at least in Room 7) we could update our website, loading photos and videos. At third floor there is a pretty terrace with a great view on Potosi and where you can have a drink there looking at Bolivian sunset.

name: Hostal Beni
description: Secure parking in the nice back yard with river view. 30Bops/pppn for a private room with shared bathroom, 40/pppn if you sleep in the car. Clean, friendly stuff, hammocks.

name: Hostal Sucre
description:
260 BOL for a triple. Park for our car in the garage of the owner 500 m further, in the same street. But take care to be sure that price of parking is included, they tried to charge us 30BOL more when checking out. Otherwise there is an official park close to the hostal, but not free 
The patio of the hotel with its fountain  and geranium flowers is very pleasant. Breakfast in Bolivia seems always the same (even in middle scale category) : bread and butter.

name: Roberto & Lorenzo
description: 2 brothers that rebuild our engine. They are friendly, speak understandable Spanish and did a good Job! Paid 1800 bob for the rebuild, which took a week. Excluding parts etc. Sometimes, like many Bolivianos, you just need to hurry them up a bit.

name: Mechanic Eloy WARNING
description: Mechanic we ended up at when our engine was dead. Seemed friendly at first,  but then he was drunk for 3 days straight. Avoid!
