name: MAX - YPFB
description: With the bidon, just show your identity form. They can have a number and you can buy at the local price.

name: Clinica Dental Saravia
description:
I clean my teeth here for 200 BOL. 
Good work.

name: Caribe Estasion de Servico
description:
*Not for foreigners.
.....
Pulled right up to pump and asked if I could full up (sin factura) Paid Bolivian price for 193liters (718 Bol) gave her a 40 Bol tip.

name: Wild camping
description: Nice cosy spot next to road and the lake. People passed in the afternoon but very quiet after 6pm. Protected from the wind. Beautiful view of the town lights and hill. No facilities but less open then other wild camping closer to town so easier bush toilets ;) Used the wifi at other wild camp earlier in the day.

name: Refugio at Huayna Potosi
description: Free to camp in car park of two of the refugios (middle and bottom). Fairly flat spots and room for bigger vehicles. Toilets available and the refugip also offerred us some water. Really friendly ladies in the bottom refugio. We have them some fruit when we left. Small amount of rock climbing routes along the road, bolted for sport. Can also climb up the mountain (potosi) for approx 70US or 900BOB with different guides. Can find out at refuguios. Chilly at night and can be windy if you dont park in the right spots. 4800m altitude.

name: Daniel's Camp / Parking
description:
Black garage door to the right of the shops. Can park and sleep in the car for 15B pp - there are toilets and a shower there. Also, water, which is apparently potable. We left our van here for 30B per day while we were on Isla del Sol. Very secure. Lots of flat space and room for about 3-4 cars. Rooms available too but unsure of price. Daniel and his family are super lovely.

Dec 2023: 160 BOB for 4 nights including electricity (2 nights storage while on Isla del Sol and 2 nights 2 ppl. in camper).

name: Gas Station Cucuta
description:
***
update 4.5.19
5 Bol per liter sin facture directly to the car tank 
***
Will fill jerry cans for you, as long as you are descrete and don't try to get much. Park past the petrol station as they kept looking back up the road.

name: La Cabana de Sal
description: Really nice salt Hostal in San Juan. Owners are really friendly. We paid 70 for a twin without bathroom, with bathroom was 200. Showers were 10, breakfast 10 and dinner 35. Electricity but no wifi. They let us wash the salt of our car here as well. Nice cosy place to stay after some rough camping -  beds warm and comfortable, good pressure hot shower. We could also use their kitchen to make our own dinner.

name: Peaje station
description: Big unpaved  spot  next  to peaje and  police  station, not  to noisy in the  night.

name: Tupiza, YPFB gas plant,
description:
a friendly van driver from the distributor Popygas took our US cylinder hidden into the plant (invisible for the YPF personal). We meet the van driver at Popygas in the town(see our other entry for Popygas in Tupiza) at ca. 10 o'clock in the morning before they drive with many empty cylinders to the plant. We must wait nearly 1 hour until they were ready with filling all their cylinders - but we got 11 kg  propane for 30 BOL - yeah!!

Don't ask direct at the plant, it seems that they only want their own cylinder!! Ask the drivers of the distributors before they drive into the plant.

In and around the mercado buildings in Tupiza you can also buy empty bolivian bottles for 260 BOL,  high pressure gas hoses for 25 BOL and colored pressure regulators for different pressures. See our other entry.

name: Tupiza, Supergas distributor
description:
NOTE - very likely to only have swap Bolivian bottles.


we do'nt buy or ask here, saw it only on the way to the YPFB plant.

name: Tupiza, Popygas distributor, changing cylinder
description: here we meet a delivery van in the morning, he showed us the way to the gas plant where we met him. There he hide our US-cylinder between the other cylinder and fills it in the plant. We had to wait ca. one hour and get 11kg propane for 30 BOL. See our other entrys...

name: San Juan, Necropolis
description: Ancient cemetery just outside (500m) south of San Juan. 15B/person and absolutely worth the price. There are dozens of mummified human skeletons within the cemetery. The entry includes use of the bathrooms (quite clean) and a self-guided tour of the cemetery and museum.

name: Fuel station
description: Diesel at local price (3.72/L). No questions asked, no limits.

name: CGC - YPFB fuel station
description: Allowed us to fill one 20L jerry can for 80 bolivianos.

name: Flor de Leche La Paz
description: Factory selling good cheeses, reasonable prices. Open daily.

name: hotel el puente
description: amazing hotel in the tropical forest with clean swimming pool , river a few minutes walk with natural pools. 80 bs pp for camping in our motorhome.

name: Park car
description:
A place outdoor to park in La Paz downtown but access impossible for big rigs. At the entrance of park is written "BAÑOS" instead of "parqueo"....
35BOL for 24 hours. 
Be careful with time to check out if early in the morning; don't open before 07:30
Surrounding is poor.

name: Hotel Gloria
description:
They asked 450BOL for a double, then 300; after negociation and spending at least 2 nights in the hotel we obtained a good price : 250 BOL for a double with balcony and fabulous landscape, including breakfast (with eggs, ham, cheese...) and carpark. I think it is an excellent price and not sure they practice it often; hotel was almost empty and the owner was present during negociation. After 2 nights we asked to stay 2 more nights but sleeping in our car (the hotel has a big yard for it) they didn't accept, so we kept the room 2 more nights for the same price (250 BOL).
A really nice place to have a rest after going down the Death Road.

name: Chulumani
description: Just north of Chulumani. Fuel at local price. 3.92 per litre. No problems.

name: Off the road wild camp
description: Stopped here when it was getting dark. Not far from small town (although didn't see this at the time). It took up 6.5/7hrs to drive from Chulamani due to unpathed and forever winding roads (could be worthwhile just heading back through la paz to get better road). There is a big patch of grass to the roght which is open to rd and then there is an open fence which we tucked in behind scrub so we were hidden from rd. Just as we parked up here a local lady came passed and she said it was fine to stay for the night. There is a cemetry/hut type thing to the left. Safe and quiet.

name: Tarabuco
description: Gas station. We fill our tank with jerrycans at bolivian price.

name: Motorbike mechanics
description: Area of bike shops and oil

name: Hostal Santa Barbara
description: Great, clean, friendly place with parking for bikes and one or two large cars on-site.  50 Bs per person including bathroom.  10 Bs for breakfast, 15 Bs for other meals.

name: Camping spot
description: Shelter from the wind and a bag of charcoal waiting for you.

name: Death Road Camp
description: An OK spot, just down the Death Road a few hundred metres. There are 2 large flat areas around here you could camp. Can tuck up into the bank so you aren't visible from the road. We drove down the road early next morning and avoided tolls and any traffic / bikes!

name: Gas Station
description: Gas station right in town. Let us fill up local price. Absolute madness as it was the only gas station in town that had gas that day. Friendly staff though!

name: Mecanico / Soldadura
description: Needed our exhaust brackets welded and a few mechanical tweaks after a bumpy ride from La Paz. These guys were recommended to us. Quick and very reasonable. No name / sign outside. Moto mecanico next door.

name: Gasolinera Cruce de Oro
description: Really friendly. Let us tank and fill our jerrycan for local price no worries.

name: Madidi Jungle Ecolodge TOUR AGENCY
description: This is the office for Madidi Jungle Ecolodge. We absolutely loved our 4 day / 3 night stay with Madidi - super professional and friendly guides, incredible food, lovely cabañas and of course wildlife (including the pet tapir Antonio). It's the same company / community as Chalalan (office across the road), although a little less expensive. Both ecolodges have been set up by and for the San Jose community, with much of the proceeds being used for education, and with the backing and engagement of the community - if this matters to you then definitely choose Madidi Jungle Ecolodge over one of the tour operators. It's an incredible and special experience !!

name: rock formations
description: about 250 m off the main road, up a sandy track. nice rocks. there is a long abandoned farmhouse. careful...soft sand!

name: riverbed
description:
wide riverbed with firm gravel.
not too windy :-)

name: river view
description:
flat spot above the river. there is another one a bit further down which might have better wind protection.
loveley place.

name: Pollos Chifa "Nano"
description:
Tasty Chifa restaurant. 
Chicken comes with fried rice, noodles and fries. Tasted very good!
Cheapest option: 12bs for a big plate.

name: Ixiamas
description: The sold just 10 Liters for 40 BOB. GPS Location is not exact because we had no signal.

name: Tumupasa
description: Got a jerry can (30l) full of gasolina. Local price. Nice guy there.. I think you can also directly fuel your car.

name: Sarahs House
description:
This location is just symbolic. Sarahs House is in the foothills of the mountains next to Ixiamas. To get there just ask any random people in the town everyone nows her. Or ask for the airport. Form there just continue the main road until you reach the first river crossing (could be dry, approx. 10km from town). Turn left just before the riverbed. You will pass a sawmill and two farm houses on your left until you reach at the end of the road Sarahs property. Be aware that the road can be really muddy after rainy days. We decided to turn around and walk. But with dry weather it is suitable for all kinds of cars (bumby road though) or you go anytime with your 4x4.

She has a really nice property in the rainforest. The family has an Amish background but is really open minded and we were surprised to have such a good talk with them. Normally she offers a 4 days stay but you can stay just for one night (like us) or as long as you want. Price is 300 p.P/night including breakfast, lunch and dinner. We were in a room with a double and a single bed. And there was another room like this.
We went to the closed by mirador (1 hour hiking in the mountains). You can also visit waterfalls (one way 2,5 hours) or a lake inbetween the mountains. We also went "fisihing" in the fishing ponds to get our fish for breakfast. I think horse riding is avaible too and some other things.
The family also looks for helpers so if you are interested in working with an Amish family you can ask Sarah. Tel: (591) 73209332 or 68183376, eMail: sarahbeiler@yahoo.com

name: Port to Pampa/Private Boat Tour
description: The port where all the Pampa Tours from Rurre start with the boat. You can just go there and rent a boat for 150BOB per hour. Normally you find someone who offers you something. We did a 4 hour trip with Ibre. Started at 5:30 in the morning. He's a really nice guy. Just ask for him in town or call him 67271537 or 61126892. At the moment there are not many pink dolphins because of the low water level of the river. But it's a great experience though where you can see many animals and the dolphins :-) You can also park and  spend the night there. No facilities but safe because it's in front of the police. Normally the entrance to the parc is 150BOB We didn't pay because nobody was at the office.

name: Tomarapi
description:
Facing the church of Tomarapi and the Sajama. There is a community-run hostel: they also serve meals to non-residents.Menu: soup. Dish (for Christmas s alpaga). Dessert: 45 BOB


Face à l'église de Tomarapi et au Sajama. Il y a une auberge gérée par la communauté : ils servent également des repas au non-résidents. 
Menu : soupe. Plat ( pour Noel s alpaga). Dessert : 45 BOB

name: Palacio Portales
description:
Beautiful palace and botanical gardens. 15Bs entrance per person, includes a guided tour of the house - in Spanish, English or French. Monday-Friday: tours at 16.00, 17.00, 18.30. 
Saturday-Sunday: 10.30, 11.30.

name: lollipop, guesthouse
description:
We were the first guests of Barbro, and she treated us very well! English speaking, secure parking inside (big rigs dont fit), good bed, clean bathroom and a great breakfast  (with pancakes!) we paid 100 bol per person. Highly recommended!
Phone number: +591 73870785

name: Tourist-Info (Uyuni Maps)
description: Tourist info hands out quite detailed Uyuni maps. No Uyuni maps available anymore, but a city map of Potosi and a map over Bolivia.

name: Wildcamp
description: nice leveled spot for a overnight stop. quiet place, next to a small dirtroad,500m away from mainroad

name: Laguna Chiar Kkota
description: we builded a stone wall here. Enjoy the wind shelter for a nice campfire (if you have some firewood with you)

name: Unsafe to camp
description: you shouldn't sleep here. we were waked up in the night from aprox.8 policeofficers with shotguns-not funny... they told us it's a dangerous place to sleep because here are lots of drug smugglers. it's only allowed to camp next to the hotel

name: Alumenda Apartment Hotel.
description: This place is very expensive by Bolivian standards (+$100) but we needed a break from roughing it. Comfortable bed, warm shower and large rooms. A good breakfast is included and there is secure parking under the building (height restrictions). They allowed us to leave our car here for 8 days while we flew to Argentina and didn't charge. I thoroughly recommend although it certainly isn't a cultural experience.... We also stayed at Casa Skyways just down the road (also on IOverlander) which is really great and very reasonably priced (book ahead).

name: Residencial Parqueo
description:
After some late off-road driving we got to a small town called Pucarani close to the Titicaca lake. The only Hostal we found had some space and was ok to spend a night. They have single and doble bedrooms. It's 30 bolivianos per Person ($4.50). Shared bathroom but a quite and safe place. 
Huge closed parking area. You can get simple local food 2 or 3 blocks away.

name: Hostal Piedra Andina
description: Nice, very clean Hostal bit outside of Copacabana. 10mins walk to town centre. Safe parking for Bikes and Cars available. WiFi working well for Bolivia. Only shared, but very clean bath rooms. Breakfast included. We payed 22€ for two in a martimonial.

name: Almacen Alicia
description: Gas @ Bs 7/liter, sweet couple.store with green doors

name: Almacén Paola
description:
Simple accommodation with shared bathroom. Hot showers, moto parks inside, I could use the kitchen. Bs 25 single room.

500 m up the road there is a small creek where you can de-salt your bike. Probably not the most environmentally friendly but I guess any car wash in the area won't use oil absorbers, as well.

name: alcaldía
description: we ask for electricity in the alcaldía and they offer a parking lot in the goverment bulding with a dirty bathroom and electricity. in the morning we have a interviw with the local radio

name: Balneario paraiso
description: We park on the street and ask to the owners to have shower and electricity. they say yes for 30 bls. very quiet área, just in front to the kids park (close at 6pm).

name: Mineral spring
description: Mineral spring. Free potable water. Not the best tasting. Bring Tang!

name: Paraiso
description: Simple single room, cold shower, no internet , plenty parking. 40 bol

name: Electro Mechanic On The Corner
description: Very good fast electro mechanic. Cheap. On a street with many car part shops, mostly lights and accessories

name: El Salvador
description: Simple Hotel. 60bols , 15bols for secured parking. Nice bed, nice people. Not dirty, hot shower. Internet did not work at the time but there was a signal

name: Tienda Sells Petrol
description: 5 Bolivians per litre.  Small tienda with a pharmacy next to it.

name: Corrupt Police Check
description: The normal police check of papers and peaje tickets. Wanted 20bols. NEVER pay a bribe! Put on a frowning confused face no matter what they say. Stand your ground calmly and they will give up. Onward and upwards!

name: Auto Mercado
description: Loads of car stuff shop for tires, lights, seals, seat covers etc etc. For cars mainly. Very convenient.

name: Fuel Station
description:
3.74 bol
 	Gasolina for local price straight into our tank - seems like everyone in the Beni / Santa Cruz is a lot more chilled about the whole foreign price thing. He even offered to fill up our jerrycans too!

name: Rafael -Mechanico
description: Rafael is an old skilled mechanic. Changed my head gasket including having the block sent to La Paz to plan it even(1400bol) his labour was 500bol. Should mention he is 6 times Bolivian national champion in slow mechanics))) If you stay at Jislene Hostal, this is the guy they will recommend .

name: Hotel
description: Matrimonial, 70bol, private bath, cold shower, , fan, FAST wifi, parking for one car. Nice family owned.

name: Ferry To Brazil
description:
Motos 150 bol, cars 300 bol
No fixed schedule or timetable.
A lady claimed I needed fumigation for 50bol to get into Brazil. Incorrect.

name: Laguna Isirere Camp
description:
Beautiful camp right on the lake front. Nice sunset. Lots of grass and flat spots to park. Popular with locals swimming and fishing in the evening. Quiet at night - just you and the fireflies! 
2019: not quiet during the weekend

name: Iriarte Gas Station
description:
Here you can fill up at tank at local
price and spend the night in your camper.

name: Gas Station
description: got diesel here straight in the tank without any problems for the local price. we gave a 10bol tip. we have noticed they are more inclined to give you fuel if you don't need a huge amount.so we try to fill up our tank when half empty

name: San Ramon Gas Station
description: Gasolina and Diesel at local price sin factura. Also restaurant with clean toilets and showers and a shop with food and car supplies.

name: Checkpoint / Toll
description: Police checked our papers and tried to get us to buy the 'Orden de Circulacion' - 50 bol- which it seems others have been told they need to buy around Santa Cruz - we just 'no entiendo' and showed our TIP covered in 3 months worth of Police stamps and he gave up.

name: Police / Toll / Aduana
description: Very thorough police stop - trying their hardest to find something wrong in our papers and looking through our van. Friendly but also tried it on asking us for dollars.

name: Gas Station
description: Filled us up at local price - just entered 'bidon' at the pump, instead of the carnet / number plate combo which doesn't work for us. There's also a 4WD accessories store here which actually has some decent stuff.

name: La Jara Backpackers Hostel
description:
Youth hostel in a big villa with clean swimming pool. Laid back atmosphere, friendly staff, no party hostel. Wifi in communal area very fast. 

Big driveway, can fit multiple cars and probably big rigs.

Dorm beds starting at 70bs, breakfast included. All shared bath. Double room at 210bs. A bit expensive as the matrasses are a bit old, but prices in Santa Cruz seem to be really high...

name: Valle de las Rocas
description:
Useful info: Here is where the road devides to the left or right. Either way is fine because it's a loop. DO THE LOOP!! it's awesome. It took me about 1.5 hours, but driving slowly and stopping for pics. The road doesn't need 4x4, but maybe a good engine because of the height. Not for big rigs since you enter a narrow road for awhile. It's cold at night: 0 centigrade , 32 F

2023: route has gotten worse, 4x4 recommended and high clearance necessary. Expect scratches from bushes from below and the sides. Took us more than 2 hours from the main road and back.
On the way here the road is blocked, because it goes over a farm field, but you have a bypass on the right.

name: santa Anna
description:
Swimming pool with possibilities to camp or park for the night. 30 bs to enter. Then we pay 50 to camp

o

name: Servicentro Seguro S.R.L.
description: This is by far the best mechanic we went to in Bolivia (and so far in South America). Joaquín is the owner - 2x rally champ of Bolivia and spent years working in Germany as a mechanic. He speaks perfect English and German, and Espanol of course. We were recommended this place by Rudy - Sergio of Landhaus' brother in law. Is a very tidy and professional workshop, and Joaquín went well out of his way to help us. Him and his mechanics found (and fixed) things that were previously undetected by many other mechanics (both in Bolivia and Chile). After we left he followed up with us to make sure everything was OK on the road. If it were at all possible, he is the only mechanic we would go to in South America and we cannot recommend highly enough. His workshop is a compete service centre - mechanics, wheel alignment / balancing, lavadero, paint and panel. Deals with all kinds of vehicles. Basically, if you need anything done in Santa Cruz - don't go anywhere else. Phone: 3587671 / 3547016 Email: servicentrosegurosrl@gmail.com Address: Av Roca y Coronado 367

name: mi super
description: brand new mini market store.  nice things, good prices, easy to stop in and stock up on camping goods.

name: yumani
description: part south of isla del Sol. you must pay 10 bls as admittion rate. in the middle you must pay 15 (challa) and other 15 in the north (challapampa). the boat back from the south are at 10.30 and 16 hs. is better go from south to noth because are more hill down than up.

name: Moncho motorcycle shop
description: Motocycles shop with a lot of parts and we find some good tire there.

name: Gas Station
description: Filled with diesel at local price. Handy as it is 250-300km from the next station, uphill :)

name: Motul Lubricants
description: If you need a synthetic oil this is the place to come. They have it all!!! I came for fork oil for my V-Strom 650 motorcycle.

name: motocar
description: This is one of the best shops for big motorcycles in Cochabamba. They have a few parts but some really good mechanics who can fix about anything. They found fork seals for my V-Strom 650 that are the right size but not factory. Carlos Ramos is the owner. Telephone 4297259  Whatsapp 70750386

name: Jaguar House
description: A nice hostel with parking for one big motorcycle or maybe 2 small ones in the common area. The internet is pretty fast when it actually works. Even have breakfast (bread and jam you can buy eggs for 5B's more) 55 B's in the dorm.

name: Parque Mariscal Santa Cruz
description: A nice family park. You can come here and swim in he pools or ride your skateboard on the half pipes. Its 2 Bolivians to enter and you can stay all day and rent the barbecues.

name: gas station
description:
bought gas for 6 B's a liter on the way to see the ruins. 

Update Sept 2019: possible to buy at local price sin factura- negotiating in Spanish seems to help.

name: bush
description: wild camp spot, nice and grassy. It is on an official road reserve so no issues with private property. My rig is 7.5m long and 2.4m wide and access is not a problem

name: sanctuary
description: Old couple take care of the sanctuary, both very kind and helpful. They asked for 10 Bolivianos, and they let you spend the night, there are toilets and cold shower.

name: Free Parking in the city
description: Its a parking in the center its writtem (NO ESTACIONNAR) but neither the police neither the locals matter the opposite they recommended it. During the day its a police guard ats its working for the university next door. Isnt level and lots of traffic during the day he willy alows down at night. Isnt to bad to stay overnight if you have business to do in the center

name: Kultur Berlin Restaurant Bar Hostal
description: A really great hostel with dorms for 55 Bolivianos which includes an awesome buffet style breakfast. They have parking for four or five motorcycles in the lobby. They have a bar and restaurant that is quite good. On certain nights of the week for 50 B's you can have an all you can eat Mexican or barbecue dinner.

name: City Tours La Paz/El Alto by Gert
description:
Gert (a German who is living in La Paz /Mallasilla for 35 years now) offers very interesting and personalized city tours in La Paz. 
Contact: Gert, Tel. +59177554008
gerfrabol@hotmail.com

name: MTB Quad- & Moto-Tours
description: Next to the Hotel/Camping Oberlander. MTB offers a wide range of Quad-, Motorcycle- and Mountainbiketours. We did the 2h Quad tour thourgh the valle de la luna for 200 Bolivianos per person. Worth every penny! Great foto stops and a lot of fun.

name: Aladino's house
description: beautiful and quiet Hostel, near center of these city, very kind people, calle José mostajo 135, wi Fi, kitchen, hot shower, harden, everything so clean!!!!!! 200 bol double room

name: Posada El Riabe
description: For 40 Bol.  For 2 people and pop-up camper. Nice shared electric shower with Great water pressure. No height limit but the entrance is a little tight and bumpy Secure parking on tiled patio. Only 5 blocks to center square.

name: RN4 opposite to Takhata, free
description: a good drivable dirt road ends at some houses and a concrete basketball place, at half of the way just about 1km from the main road at a electricity pole, very quiet,  no traffic,

name: Chullpas beside RN4
description: many easy accessible Chullpas direct beside the RN4, southly 3 easy accessible Chullpas and small parking lot,

name: Hotel Pasarela
description: A Hotel with a possibility for tents and parking for Motorhomes. The facilities of the Hotel can be used, including the Swimming Pool.

name: Delia Gasolina
description: started at 8, but let me fill my moto for 5B if I was fast. only place I could find on the way into town that dropped below 8BOL

name: Illimani view
description: We drove on the road from Cohoni and it was already dark, so we tried to stop right next to the road (it is not easy to find some place as the road is quite narrow and traversing a steep slope) on a small, grassy and flat area. Later on we saw a small hill on the right side and we managed to go further up, but that is possible only for 4WD cars, we would say. Even though we were on a hill, it is quite well hidden, there are also several small rocks, so it is not so visible from the road. Big plus: Illimani is right in front of you!

name: Hostel Casona
description:
Good hostel, we stayed here for 12 days while our car was getting fixed. No garage parking for the car but there is garages nearby. Felt comfortable here, reasonable pricing, comfy atmosphere. Paid 100bs for a matrimonial room with shared bathroom. Matrimonial with bathroom was 160bs (super super nice). Breakfast included (yoghurt, milk, juice, bread, spreads, bananas, tea and coffee). Buy your own cereal/oats to add to make it more healthy. Kitchen available for use however a bit limited, need to get utensils from reception. Good location too :)
50bob/dorm

name: TNA Island Sheltered Camping Spot
description: GPS coordinates logged wrong, the spot is just a two minute drive left of the entrance, look out for the sheltered enclose. :)

name: hot springs!
description: A great little stop in the way to Uyuni! Super hot water in 2 different pools. One is small and the other is quite big. 10 B's entrance!

name: Cocotoni beach
description:
Nice beach with trees 10 m too titicaca lake.
No one, except week end.
Quiet, silence ect...

name: Exito grocery store
description: Biggest market in town with pastas, meat, and other snack items. Even deodorant and tooth paste! Not as cheap as the market but will have everything you need in one stop.

name: Plaza de heros de chaco
description: Parking of the hospital. Not very quiet but a lot of attention and contacts. Shade in the park. We showered in the service station on the RN9, just a few kilometers .

name: Quiet spot in sucre
description: Quiet flat spot next to a sunken mini-park. Of avenue, south-east side of town. Within walking distance of Arte Indigena museum and Marias lugar. Can easily be reached with big rigs. City itself not build for big trucks.

name: San Miguel-Quiroga
description: Big flat open area.Higher part of the very wide riverbed. Mostly out of sight of the road, although not out of hearing. The rivulet rose overnight 40cm, and downed again in the morning. Stil app 1mt above waterlevel. 300mtr north of the village. Afew passers-by, a donkey and a young bull.

name: Mizque
description: Charming sleepy village, with a nice central market and small but interesting antropo museum. We camped at the central square.

name: Lago Angostura
description: Sort of parkingarea close to Lago Angostura and the dam. Nice view. Not very clean, as usual. Next to local road.

name: Galaxie Cave and Petrified Cacti
description:
Its worth the detour! A very unusal cave right next to the salar. Small but very impressiv, next to it a nice grave cave, a mirador and all around lots of petrified cacti! 
No one here but you can switch on the light next to the battery in the little "caja" room. 
Its 20 bol pP and you are supposed to leave the money in the "caja"!
Bathroooms and picnic tables available!

name: 19 de Novjembre
description: A bus company for the locals where you can take the bus from Uyuni to the island of Incawassie on the salt flats for 40 B's. You pay 30 B's entrance to the island and you get a free house to sleep in for the night. Bring your sleeping bag and pillow as it gets quite cold! They have OK mattresses to sleep on for you. There is a restaurant on the island with meals for 50  B's which are quite good but might be better to bring some snacks and drinks with you. Great bathroom on the island as well!!! This is a great alternative to driving your rig through the salt water during the rainy season. We enjoyed it much more than the day tour and it cost half the price!!!

name: Hotel Avenida
description: Private rooms for 50 B's a person w shared bathroom. Right next to the main square.  Hot showers and wifi.  Parking for Moto's in the courtyard away from the street.

name: Rodeo
description: Truly awesome steaks here. Definitely the best in Bolivia and one of the best in the whole of South America. 75B for an amazing steak incl chips/fries, rice, great salad bar, breads, sauces etc. Carnivores don't miss this in Tarija.

name: Angostura - river canyon
description: Drive past here on your way to the Concepcion Valley wineries. Stand on the bridge to see a lovely view of the narrow river gorge.

name: Bodega Valle D'Vino - wine tasting and vinyard tour
description:
Ask for Daniel, speaks excellent English. Small family-run vinyard with a selection of wines. As per most of this region the wines tend to be quite sweet, but it's interesting to see the difference between this and the more up-market Argentinian wine industry in Mendoza and Cafayate.

There are several other wineries for tasting in the village, so it's worth parking up in the square and wandering around them.

name: Taller Jose
description: Good general vehicle workshop & mechanic. we had some welding done here, very friendly, helpful, good price.

name: Military Checkpoint (Permanent Base)
description: Routine check of documents & writing it all down in a book (the usual bolivian army stuff).

name: Urkupina Supermarket
description: the only western-style walk-round supermarket that we found in Tarija. The mercado central in town is great for fruit, veg and a few other things, but here they have the normal range of supermarket stuff, nicer cheeses and some imported things like breakfast cereals (no fresh meat though)

name: Ojo del Inca informal campsite
description: Camping in the other indicated campspot was not allowed. But the real "ojo del inca" lies on this spot. Camping is allowed, but no facilities at all. We paid 20 bolivianos (for family of 5), which is the price for using the thermal swimming pool. For this price, we could camp too.

name: Puente Sucre
description: This must be a nice spot for a wildcamp. The Sucre Bridge is a beautiful and well maintained building that makes me thing about the Tower Bridge in London. We passed here on our way from Potosí to Sucre and used it as a nice picnic spot.

name: Police
description: write your name in a book and you may pass. The officer will raise the boom gate for you.

name: Plaza P.D. Murillo
description:
park in front of the church, next to the municipalidad.
verry quite place after 10pm with shops and "restaurants" arround the plaza.
there is also a public baňo. Nobody was disturbing us.

name: Hostal Oasis
description: A great hostal with very fair prices (35b). Offered breakfast and was much more comfortable than the Hostal Sahara across the street, not to mention much cheaper. Host/owner was very friendly.

name: YPFB
description:
Reported no propane here, just fuel


on the same spot as the gaz station you have to ask and cry abit but they would field up your propane tank either us or local for a 8kg we paid 50bolivianos

name: wild camping next to cimetary
description:
the GPS location isnt right but you easly would find it on maps me.
we sleep in front of the gaz station under the lamp spot. it was a bit busy with traffic but only until 8pm them quit

name: La Pitantorilla
description:
A 100 years old hacienda in an incredible place on the mountain. It's a boarding school which offers accommodation. They can also prepare traditional dishes for you. 

A road from Yotala is unpaved and may require 4x4 as there is at least one small river-crossing and it is a bit steep in places. However we saw a local buses using that road with no problems. Mountain views are very nice along the way. Pure fun riding here on motorcycles :)

The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. They also have a washing machine for laundry and we could use their water hose to wash the motorcycles.

Private twin room with bathroom - 30 BOL pp (electric shower with hot water) 
Breakfast - 10 BOL pp
Lunch and dinner each around 25 BOL pp

name: York Vintage B&B
description: Also, Laundry service available, high-ceiling and spacious rooms. Rooms 204, 205 and 206 share a wall with a discoteca, so if you don't want to have a sleepless night like us, avoid those rooms at all cost.

name: "Camping" no name
description: It has a camping sign, blue gate. Very run down place. But for 10 bolivianos a night, plus the lady was honest and told us there was no hot shower. Safe and close to town . 1 night is good. No wifi

name: Tire Alignment & Balance rotation
description: Friendly family business with all the equipment to do the job safely and right. 90bob for the balance rotation

name: Manco Kapac square
description: Parked right in front of the church by the plaza. Quiet , no one bothered us. Mosquitos after 7:30

name: HiperMaxi
description: Big super market with good parking lot near Santa Cruz de la Sierra

name: Espejillos waterfall
description:
Excellent campsite, with clean bathrooms , showers , shade , water, tables and grills to spend a few days. The waterfall and swimming pools are very pretty, but you MUST come during the week because the weekend is a ZOO and people trash the whole place. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and It was crazy, but Monday morning they had it all cleaned. 5 for parking , 5bob each for entrance, there's also a "toll" half way here and they charge you 5bob as well. Pets are not allowed in the river but they have some cages at the entrance to leave them if you don't want to leave yours in the car. There are also food stalls selling empanadas, hot dogs and other small stuff. Also, the road is good there's no need of 4x4

El parque está excelente, tiene una ducha, baños ,varias palapas con agua, mesas, y parrillera. Hay bastante espacio y sombra , lo mejor es venir entre semana, nosotros llegamos un Domingo en la tarde-noche y era un Zoológico, la gente deja todo lleno de basura y se ve horrible. pero ya el lunes en la mañana tenían todo limpio. Nosotros tenemos mascota y aunque no permiten mascotas en el río hay unas jaulas donde lo puedes dejar, si no lo quieres dejar en el carro. También hay algunos puestos de comida vendiendo empanadas, y hot dogs.  Cobran 5 por persona para entrar al parque y 5 por vehículo, también nos cobraron un "peaje" a la mitad del camino. La carretera está buena no se necesita de 4x4

name: Hostal Graciela
description:
140bol for 2p in 1 room with private shower, television and including a breakfast. Use of the kitchen for lunch was no problem - the place features dormitories as well, they are cheaper. But for that price and including the breakfast we didn't bother. They have A LOT of connections to tours and communities so if you want to get around, just ask!
We went on a walking tour through the city and gave some money for it - it was a good NON-TOURIST view on the center, very private since it was only us and the guide. They speak English....a laid back, backpacker place, clean, friendly, good! a recommendation!!!

name: Alojarmiento Potosi in Patacamaya
description:
A very basic place, but on the way from Oruro to La Paz (or the other way around) where there is not much to choose from. They have rooms with bathrooms and big gated parking lot inside. We could even protect our motorcycles from the rain by parking them under the balcony. Big rigs will fit - no problem. Showers are electric. Price for double room for two people 50 bol.

There's a street food spot down the street 100 meters away in front of the gas station. Right behind the wall, there's a food shop where you can also get fuel for 6 bol/liter.

name: lost village
description: Nearly abandoned village with beautiful surroundings. White church church and two buildings occupied. Pass the bridge and instead of continuing to Tupiza, turn left and follow four km

name: alojamiento terrazas
description: Cheap one in front of the station. 20 bolivianos a night

name: Town square
description: Saw sign that indicated that the road would be close at 6:00 p.m already time to stop for us so we parked in the square right by the school. No one bothered us, kids played until 10pm after that very quiet

name: Parque de las Aguas side street
description: We parked on a dead end street in between the big fountain and the tennis courts. We managed to level our rig (truck /camper) with logs we had and also there were some stones around. Safe & Free :) we opted this after checking out Alberto &a Felicidad $15 dollars a day was not in our budget ..

name: Namas te
description:
Vegan veggie restaurant, 

Tasty healthy food highly recommended if you've had enough of eating menu's everyday! 

There another cool room out the back to sit and the owners are friendly.  brother sister working together

name: Hospedaje Milenio
description: Small hospedaje with private and double rooms. Quiet and clean. Shared bathrooms. 40bs per person. No parking but there is a secure garage half a block away.

name: GLP Funda Gas
description:
If you have a hose with a connection to transfer gas from one tank to the other they will sell you the propane for 22.50. They were super helpful we gave them 40
American tank . They refused to do it at the plant because it wasn't the same "material", it's the same valve.

name: El tejar - parking lot
description: Behind the church we found a safe flat spot to spend the night. No one bothered us. Can ask to use the restroom in the nearby house

name: Supermarket SAS
description:
Very nice supermarket with underground parking lot. There's also a movie theater upstairs. 

Here you can find 20L water bottle or you can do like us and go to Gas station San Antonio and ask them to sell you the liquid for 13bob 
Plenty of ATMs here as well

name: Plaza San Roque
description: Three nights total in this space and no one has bothered us. Safe and quiet.

name: Potosí
description: 13 Bob por 25 litros de agua. Hay que llamar a estos teléfonos y vienen a traerte la garrafa a donde estés! Muy rápido y eficiente.

name: Huge street Mercado
description:
Was there on a Tuesday! 
around the mercado Campero ALL the streets were filled with stands and you can buy EVERYTHING here! an amazing place if you enjoy walking through a very peaceful crowd (I am a tall gringo with a rather big camera...didn't got bothered but met many many friendly faces and interested questions...where are you from, what is your money like etc.) - lots of new food to discover, these streets got it all! from the end of the avenida6augusto on, including sidestreets.

name: La Kantutita
description:
got information about this place by local people as it is a very good and traditional restaurant to eat meat - famous in Oruro are the roasted pieces of sheep. 
The service was excellent, he explained all the menues in detail and suggested the best pieces...the price is between 40bol (ribs) and 50bol (shoulder piece) - the 2 of us asked to split 1plate and I finished absolutely satisfied! (no need for 2 plates, really!)
big piece of perfect meat with rice and salad...and a canella drink. Finisher was a broth soup - a very very complete dish (don't bother for the menu hehe)
The service guy is the son of the owner, and a very respectful and humble man - I suggest this place to everybody who feels hungry and wants to eat local, traditional food!

name: Hospedaje (Blue doors - entel logo outside)
description:
Local people told us about this place, but when we got to the big green door only the boys were home - the parents were at "the festival" and the kids couldn't help us. Send us to Franz Hospedaje.
I have no information about the service here but it is for sure a place where you can sleep. ;)

name: Hotel de Sal Tayka 111USD
description:
went here to ask for information - the room is 111 US Dollar (so obviously out of sight from our backpacking budget) they have international tourists that come with tours from Uyuni....
if you feel like luxury - this i a place in nowhere like nowhere else!

name: Menta
description:
Newly opened vegetarian restaurant, mainly serving delicious burgers (25-35bob) and fresh mixed juices.
Be aware that the portions are on the small side.
They also serve set lunch for 21bob.
They have another branch in the Cala cala neighbourhood.

name: Bienmesabe - Venezuelian food
description: Absolutely right what all the others wrote. Only, the reason for the slow service comes because they make everything 100% fresh! But we didn't wait longer than 15 min for one Arepa. If you go there you definitely have to take the Arepa Chocolate at least once.

name: Eco-Hotel Los Flamencos
description: Expensive hotel with options for parking/cyclists. Beautifully equipped. A treasure on the laguna route. After 4 days riding without shower and very basic overnights we checked in here and did not regret it.

name: Hostal San Pablo
description: Basic but clean place with a reasonable sized room on the main road. woman owner was very welcoming. 70 for the both of us

name: Camping Carlos Terrazas
description:
Just in front of the lake,  the dueño Carlos speaks very well french, he had studied in France and he likes the photographies.
En 1985 obtuvo la codicida medalla de plata de la bienal de fotografia international de arte fotografico.
This man is very interesting. All vehicules access.

name: estación de servicio
description:
We were charged at foreign price 20liters

nos cargaron a precio extranjero 20litros

name: Incahuasi Isla
description: Free, no facilities, good wind protection, volcano view, quiet at night.

name: Las Delicias (parilla,meat restaurant)
description: very decent restaurant if you look for a good piece of roasted meat. They have a salad buffet that cones with the +-50bol plate (meat+rice+fries). They have wifi too (just ask) - friendly service, a good place! we shared the plate because it is by far enough for 2....including the salad buffet.

name: Hostal Elisa
description:
rent a room with 1double bed and 1single bed for 140bol. (2people with children easily enough space)
shower took long but was super hot. wifi is really good and the place has a really really quiet location. Has an inner court with garden.
no kitchen. no parking.
excellent stay as we came late from the terminal bus.

name: Clínica Veterinaria San Francisco
description: Help with animal health certificate near Tupiza

name: lubricantes Santiago de Bombori
description:
Need to grease up? Here is your place . 2bs per crosspins 
Necesitas engrasar las crucetas? 2 bs cada una

name: Hostal ROBYN
description: Clean and cheap hostel. Hot shower, wifi, secure parking. Single room without bathroom is 20 bol, two bed room with bathroom for one person is 30 bol. There are lake view rooms. Parking for car is 15 bol, motorcycle is 10 bol. Owner Carlos is very friendly and kind.

name: Alojamiento La Barranca
description:
Tiene habitaciones. Nosotros pedimos para dormir en la van y no hubo problema. Es muy tranquilo y dentro de todo limpio y económico. 20 bs por persona. Tiene electricidad para la Van.

They have rooms. We stay in our van and dont have problem. is quiet and clean enough. 20 bs for person. Electricity

name: Consulado de Brasil
description:
You can get Brazil visa easily. You need a visa application document and one photo. I got visa almost 1 hour 30 minutes later.
I came here from Ipanari by bus. Nobody checked my passport.

name: Route 41
description:
Tried to drive to Coroico this way.  The road is intermittently paved, with unpaved ravines just outside of La Paz (see other posting).  There is a reason no one drives this way, despite Google showing it as a highway.  At this point, heading towards the junction with Route 3, the hardpack dirt road turns into a muddy, rutted track.  It looks like there may have been construction planned for a highway here at one point, but it seems to be abandoned. If it is dry it is easily passable with a 2WD. With rain/snow it is muddy and might get difficult.

There are many ptential wild spots along this route

name: Calderias Hot Springs
description: Hot Springs 2.5 km off paved road.  10 pesos to soak, closes at 7 pm.  Spent the night for free.  No facilities except several hot streams, water faucet.  Very quiet and peaceful.  Caretaker friendly.  a small stream to cross on the way.

name: Michelle's. Cheap good Menu
description:
Michelle's restaurant. Lovely place with nice owners. Open only for lunch I think. One of the best Menu's I've had in South America. 15 bolivianos for an amuse Bouche (was a little potato pancake with garnish for me), a delicious big soup, a main (chicken, beef, sausage etc) with rice and yuca and a small salad, and even jello for dessert. 

Really good flavour, they throw the meat on the grill out front fresh after you order. Can't beat it for 15 bob. 

Also a chicken place next door and a fish and chips spot across the street, don't know if any good

name: Sumaj Salt Hotel
description: This is a hotel right at the entrance of the Salar. We were planning to spend the night in our car but couldn't find a spot as we arrived well after dark and many tours were pacing by. We entered to ask if we could park our car outside and sleep there and the owner offer us a room for 160$ which was way out of our budget. I told her that we couldn't afford it and that we would sleep in the car if she was ok with it. After bargaining a bit she ended us offering a double room with private bathroom for 35$ (250bol), which we took. The whole building and furniture are made out of salt, it's quite unique of the area. If you go, try to bargain late at night and it's better if you speak spanish.

name: Es Del Mar
description: They accepted to fill our tank for 6Bol with little bargain - as of 5/3/19 guy wouldn’t budge, only with factura.

name: Sajama. North Entrance Gate
description:
Here you have to pay for the entrance to the national park which is 100Bol per person if foreign.

Beautiful national park with very few tourists. I recommend driving around vulcano Sajama and exiting through the second entrance gate. It's a gravel road but can easily be done with any vehicle.

name: Hostel Ciorvia
description: Nice, clean hostel. Very nice proprietors. They let us park our motorcycles in the lobby. Cost was 70 bop each (2) in one room. 5 bop for breakfast. Nice town also

name: Taller de Motos
description: A motorcycle workshop. Max the owner is very helpful and knowledgable. Full array of tools and welder available. We changed our front wheel bearings, Max was there helping with his tools.

name: Landhaus with private garage!
description: Owned by a very friendly german couple, Christl & Georg, who live here since 35 years. The Restaurant is superb, they also serve homemade cake and good coffee. They have an exceptional well equipped garage with all necessary tools to fix a car or a motorbike. Georg would lent me immediately some tools to get our bikes fixed and wouldn't even charge a Peso. We did not stay at this place as we were already set up at La Víspera Camping when we learned about it.  But would recommend it without concerns. Highly recommended!

name: Oticon de Sucre - hearing aid batteries
description: You can buy many common hearing aid batteries here.

name: la willam’s
description:
Gasoline for foreigners 6 Bs. Residents 3.74Bs.


Gasolina no galão 5bs. Para estrangeiros 8,70Bs. Moradores 3,74Bs.

name: Military Check point
description:
checked passport and vehicle import document. 

They check the amount of gas/diesel that trucks have. You cannot take more than 100L if you are unable to prove you bought it at international price so keep your gasoline receipts.

name: Colchani
description:
Alojamiento - 50 Bs just ask at the senora in the artisanal market close to the toilet.
Street food outside

name: Mirador laguna colorada
description: Beautiful point of vue, maybe possible for the night.

name: Laguna Kara
description: Good place for the night, quiet. one large rock for shelter of wind. much flamingos roses.

name: YPFB - Epizana
description:
Price 3.74 Bs. But only 10 liters.


Preço 3,74 Bs. Porém só 10 litros.

name: Salt Hotel - Bella Vista
description:
A very nice little hotel near the Salar. 
They made all their stuff out of salt.
We went their by an organiced tour, so I don't know a price.

name: Lavadero
description: Really thorough wash of car: inside, outside and chassis treatment for 70 BOL. Recommended by a local, our Suzy was never more clean :)

name: Alojamiento Ferrocarril
description: Clean, simple rooms, 30 bols + 5 bols parking for motorbike. wonderful hot shower. Wi-Fi barely usable it is so slow. secure parking in easy to access large courtyard, for cars also. Market nearby.

name: Estacionamiento
description:
Ample parking, near the center and the mercado. You can spend the night although sometimes noisy. 

Amplio aparcamiento, cerca del centro y del mercado.
se puede pasar la noche aunque algo ruidoso.
gratis.

name: El Minero / El Alamo Restaurante
description: This place is a must stop between Uyuni and Tupiza. Great surprise to find this restaurant in the wild West of Bolivia. owner lived many years in US and started​ this restaurant here and two in Tupiza, western theme, great food. Try the pailitas, delicious.

name: Casa Blanca hostel
description: Great vibes at this hostel. Full of travellers, comfy beds and fair prices (5$ a night in a dormitory).

name: Wild camp just outside Padilla
description:
Pull from the road go two thirds up the hill towards the telegraph pole.
Peaceful night sleep and nice views over the valley.

name: Almacen la Estrella
description:
Meet the women who served Che his last meal. An authentic place where we had a meal under candle light and nice conversation (if you can speak Spanish) about Che's last movements. 
Support the locals!!!

name: Che museum
description:
Small museum detailing some of Che's last footsteps. There doesn't seem to be set opening hours but you need to ask for Señora Alerces Flores (??) who holds the key and will let you in. Worth a visit if you are here since there's nothing else to do ;) 

We paid 10bn per person.

name: Hotel San Luis
description: A big private room with shared bathroom for 50 bolivianos. Motorcycle inside the hotel with plenty of space for many more motorbikes. Very clean bathrooms

name: BNB bank
description: bank with atm. accepts visa debit and Mastercard. Used a European debit card with no problems.

name: E S La Huachaca
description:
international price with factura 8.5.
you can ask for 5 o 6 without factura

name: Chilo gas station
description: 4 bob p l to fill up sin factura

name: Cochabamba
description: They dont sell gasoline/diesel to foreigners

name: Cochabamba
description: Only gas is sold at this gas station in Cochabamba.

name: YPFB Ticti
description:
Gasoline 3.74 Bs in gallon (drum, jarry can) using carnet / local person document. We got the document from a person at the station.


Gasolina 3,74 Bs no galão (bidón, jarry can) usando carnê/documento de pessoa local. Conseguimos o documento de uma pessoa no próprio posto.

name: Greengo's Café
description: Classic rip-off restaurant for turists. If you looking for something local don't go here.

name: Es Lido Gas Station
description: 8.6 Bob p l

name: YPFB
description:
Local price 3.74 Bs. Using gallon (Bidon / Jerry can). Using document from a local resident. 

Foreigner price: 8.8 Bs. 
.....
Preço local 3,74 Bs. Usando galão (Bidon/Jerry can). Usando documento de um morador local.

name: Torotoro Guardia Fauna
description: No amenities, but had a little chat with the guard. Said it was all good, even let us use his bathroom in the morning. Very friendly guy

name: Migration offices - new location
description:
New location for the migración offices to extend your visa. Still need a copy of passport photo page, Bolivian entry stamp page, and green Bolivian entry slip. Also need to go to the Bolivian government migration website and register yourself first and print it off (at an Internet cafe). 

Bring originals too. 

New addres: Calle Linares, 136 (plaza avaroa) 

Internet cafe that can print about 2 blocks away on avenida villazon (-19.581954 -65.75777)

Photocopy shop on Arce (-19.581383 -65.756389)

There are loads of copy shops and one printer shop that is closer (but had no electricity while we were here)

name: Photocopy shop near new Migración office
description:
Closest photocopy shop to the new migración offices. Need a copy of passport photo page, passport page with Bolivian entry stamp, and green entry slip. 

After getting 30 day extension stamps you'll need the updated copies of the passport stamp page and green slip with the 30 day extension stamp to bring to aduana to extend your vehicle's permit

name: Internet cafe near migración offices to print registration
description:
Internet cafe near the new migración offices that has a printer (others nearby didn't or was broken), to register yourself on the Bolivian migration website and print off the registration form - the lady at migración told me I needed this before they could do anything for me. No one else mentioned this so it may be a new thing or she just didn't know what she's talking about. 

Across the street is an aduana office but not the right one for vehicle permit extensions, the right one is by plaza bomberos. There is a decent coffee shop inside though that will do a proper espresso/americano and not the typical instant coffee stuff!

name: Cayara Cafe
description:
A decent cafe that does a proper espresso or americano, none of that instant coffee stuff! Didn't try the food but there is food and juices too. No wifi unfortunately. Entrance is the same place as the aduana offices building (this aduana won't extend vehicle permit though) 

Nice washrooms inside the building too just by the cafe/elevators

name: Koala Cafe & Tour Agency
description:
On the second floor. Decent food, mostly catered to tourists, veg options. Good big apple pie, coffee is unfortunately instant. Has wifi, average speed. Slow service like anywhere in Bolivia. 

Downstairs on the first floor below the cafe, is the Koala tour agency, bought their mine tour for 120 bolos, cheaper than the Big Deal mine tours (150) and had a great time in the mines exploring and visiting real miners as they work their craft, would definitely recommend.

name: Multicine Potosi Movie Theater
description:
Only movie theatre in Potosi, shows Hollywood movies most dubbed in Spanish. Old theatre set in an old building but charming, has 3D even. 20 bolos a ticket. Small but good popcorn and only bottled beverages. 4-5 movies playing at any time, most with only 1 or 2 show times per day.

Check website for times.

name: Ypfb Cochabamba
description: We paid local price with a jerrycan (3,72 bol /litre). Need passeport but after it's OK. We taken 100 litres.

name: Roadside camp on the way to Torotoro
description: Quiet at night, 37km to Torotoro.

name: Tarata
description: Bought a bidon across the street for 30 BOL, filled it three times with photocopies of mine and my wife, 70L in total, sold the bidon afterwards for 10 BOL + 10 BOL fee at the woman of the gas station :)

name: YPFB Propan Uyuni
description: Ask at the Gas- Station. On the left side of the Gas- Station is the entrance. The people are very friendly and helpful. They filled up my 2 US Propan bottles (5 kg). But you need an european adapter.

name: Route Information: Lagunas Route/ SW Circuit
description:
The SW Circuit is a world renowned overland route, for which humans and vehicle must be well prepared. See also the pins “Start of Lagunas Route/SW Circuit” located on 701 near the Chilean border and “Route Info SW Circuit (Tupiza-Lagunas)” pin located in Tupiza. 

Key Info: 
-The entire route is above 4000m. Below freezing temperatures occur at night year round. 
-The entire route is dirt roads and tracks across the desert. There are many route options, some of which are on OSM and some are not. 
-Fuel consumption will be higher than normal due to road conditions and elevation, some travellers report up to double normal fuel consumption. 
-There are two main route options: Uyuni to San Pedro de Atacama, Chile. The distance between fuel stops on this route is about 300km from Alota, Bolivia to San Pedro. The other option is the full SW Circuit, ending in Tupiza, Boliva. The distance from Alota to Tupiza is 600-800km depending on route taken and sites visited. 
-The washboard roads are likely to be the worst you have ever experienced. Additionally, tour Landcruisers travelling at high speed turn the road into ruts with a large hump in the middle, even high clearance vehicles may need to drive with caution. Strong/reliable suspension and cautious driving are key to a successful trip. While 2wd low clearance vehicles have occasionally made the journey, strongly consider if this is something you want to attempt if you are driving such a vehicle.
-There is a 150 BOB pp fee to enter the park, and you may encounter community peajes along the way. 

See comments for individual experiences. Enjoy this drive of a lifetime!

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Police and aduana checkpoint. Just checking licence and TIP all very efficient and pleasant.

name: Nice salt desert spot (no salty roads)
description: Beautiful super silent spot at the end of a normal sandy road going into the salar during rainy season. No salt! We camped at the side of the end of the road. You will have the salar all around you and for yourself! Great to see the sun coming up in the morning and going down in evening! It's at the south entrance and you have to pay 10 bols.

name: Lubricantes y Taller
description: Yellow building next to a blue building. Sells gas for 5-6 bol. Paid 110 for a 22L tank. Owner is friendly and helpful

name: Loki Hostel
description: THE party hostel of La Paz, en par with Wild Rover. Seven floors of forms, rooftop bar, events every day, ping pong pool table, wifi, elevators. Fancy stuff. Close to the witch market.

name: Equidistant from trains and town
description: Due to heavy packs, we didn't make it to the abandoned train site and instead opted to stay near the hills by irrigation ponds. While by no means the most attractive part of uyuni, we enjoyed a peaceful, quiet night of rest and found this site very safe-no nighttime visitors. A great option for a low-budget kinda trip.

name: overnight near mineral spring
description:
Good place for the night near a mineral spring bubbling out of the ground.
We even saw flamingos.
If you wanna camp just walk or drive (with bikes) into the plain where you can find nice spots the pitch a tent.
Nice and quiet here. 
LEAVE NO TRASH!!

name: Cristo de la Concordia
description:
A  big Jesus figure and nice viewpoint over Cochabamba. You can drive up
the road, take the cable car or walk according to Wikipedia 2000 stairs from south.

name: Gutierrez hidráulica
description: This place is awesome, the best I've seen for what they do. After waisting 5 days in Diesel La Paz with Pacifico, I was recommended this place by a Local enthusiast. This shop is clean and super professional, with an awesome price. They work on steering boxes, rack and pinon, steering pumps, alternators, starters rotors, probably more things too. They totally replaced the guts of my pump in 4 hours and have testing machines and everything. They work on American vehicles as well. Real local price, and no guess work.

name: alojamiento San juan de dios
description:
nice alojamiento with very friendly people.
they let us use their private wifi, don't know if they will do the same again, but it's worth a try:-)
70 bob for two people, place for two small Motos in the hallway.

name: Ghost town
description: Beautiful church in a ghost town. Nobody here. You could also camp here if you have the guts

name: tres cascades
description:
it's 8km hike along three waterfalls, the last one is at this point, entrance 3 bolivar
take a collectivo up here and just hike back

name: Posto
description: it's possible to fill Diesel or Gasoline directly to the tank for the international price with factura.

name: ES R&G Circunvalacion
description:
After negotiating a lot we got 7 for 5.50 Bs refueling on the gallon (drum). No invoice and car away from the post. .....Depois de negociar bastante conseguimos de 7 por 5,50 Bs abastecendo no galão (bidón). 
Sem factura e com carro longe do posto.

name: En direction des geyser
description:
Track too broken to continue without a 4x4, night and on foot the 2km remaining tomorrow morning 

Piste trop défoncés pour continuer sans un 4x4, nuit et a pied les 2km restant demain matin

name: laundry service
description:
very helpful owner runs this laundry
10-12bobs/kg
took 3 hours

name: mechanico berno
description:
Did a good job for a good price.
Very fast. Has another location also suitable for big rigs.

name: Wild camping on a Soccer field very quiet
description:
Nice soccer field in the middle of the mountains, remote and quiet. Large flat area, small track, little traffic. Friendly locals. We camped there with a huge tent, no problem. 
4x4 required, difficile access in the mountains. Not to do if there is rain.

name: Re-K's Auto clinic in Sucre
description:
All brands mechanical specialist workshop

Gustavo is a great mechanic and a very trusty person

You might have seen him at the Dakar race

He has worked more than 30 years in Chicago / obviosly fluent in english

Great guy- great work! 
really,could not agree more!

name: El jardín de Bolivia
description:
Nice restaurant with a terrace burgers 15-20 mains around 40.

One of the nicest restaurant of copacabana. Very pretty place with good food. The pizzas are extremely good. 35bs / pizza

name: York B&B
description: Can park your bike inside a safe area. Nice clean room, kitchen, and courtyard. This was a last minute find. We paid 60Bol per person. Good Breakfast included with freshly squeezed juice. Family friendly.

name: Quiet spot right of the street
description: Close to Sucre. Little park next to the river. No facilities

name: Solder
description: Fixed our roof rack on the go. Didn't even had to take it off. Only 20 bobs.

name: Mechanic and Chapista
description: There are a lot of mechanics and chapistas in this area. We used these ones next to each other. Bought a tube around the corner at luisito and used the mechanics workplace for 20  bobs. The Chapista fixed a corner of our van for 150 bobs.

name: Ferrocaril, caserne militaire
description:
In front of the entrance of the military barracks on the street Ferrocaril. This road only gives access to the military barracks, if you spend the night (recommended by the point of tourist office) you have a guard in the corner of your vehicle and no traffic (Except for  military maneuvers)

Devant l'entrée de la caserne militaire la rue Ferrocaril  dans un sens donne accès seulement a la caserne militaire, si vous passez la nuit (recommandé par le point office de tourisme) vous avez un garde au coin de votre vehicule et aucune circulation (sauf en cas de manoeuvres militaires)

name: La Luna
description:
Great place with wifi, hot shower, kitchen, 15 bolivianos... What else !??
Very nice owner !

name: Torotoro waterfall
description: beautiful waterfall in a huge canyon. You have to take a guide from the National Park office for 100 bolivianos per group.

name: carwash 'Lavado'
description: Good place to get rid of all the salt on your car after the salar. They have a high pressure water system and clean your car very thoroughly for 20B.

name: Hostal Desierto Blanco
description:
We were at this place to wash our car after visiting the Salar. Due to heavy rain we were forced to shelter in their newly build hotel. Room with private bathroom will costs 120Bs, room with shared bathroom 50Bs. There will be hot water available. There will also be a restaurant. Wifi will be available from October onwards.

Now (2024) : excellent restaurant, hot shower, wifi

name: Hospedaje
description: Accidentaly we asked a guy in town for a hostel, ending up in his own hostel. Awesome place completely made out of salt and very nice decorated. The rooms look very clean and all have a great view from their window. We paid 70Bs total for a private room and shared bathroom with hot water. Next to this we had a 2-course meal for 15Bs pp.

name: Tyre repair Sr. Seferino Berna Estelo
description: In case you get the expected flat tire on the Laguna route, this kind man can help you out in case of a small puncture.  We paid 60Bs. He is located in the little town Huayllajara. Ask around if you cannot find him.

name: Santa Ana Plaza Major
description: Santa Ana looks like abandoned mining village but some families are surviving in this gosttown. Drinking water from the black barrel close to the church. In a ruined alley we found a thinny shop with fresh bread. (hay pan). Quiet special.

name: isla de luna
description:
When u arrive here they ask you for 10bob entrance.
Here is some Inca ruin, but no explanations provided.
So to me, it wasn't very interesting.

name: Autotronica Parisaca
description: The mechanic at Diesel La Paz sent us here for some repairs we needed. Franz gave us a quote for the work we needed done which seemed reasonable. When we picked up the car he tried to charge us almost twice as much as we originally agreed on and wasn't even there for us to negotiate with because he conveniently was out of town for three weeks on the day the van was ready. On top of that he drove our van and it was taken by the aduana because he didn't have the car paperwork. We didn't find out about until we went by to check on the car even though he had our contact information. This wasted two days of work which cost us two extra days in a hostel not to mention numerous taxis and cable car rides. This is not our first choice of mechanics in La Paz.

name: Campero Park - Tarija
description: Near the city center. Quiet. Next to a church and a public bathroom (open till 9pm). Felt safe here

name: Football pitch
description: Stayed at a saturday night here to be on time for the Sunday market. Bit muddy, but best place in town. Cannot leave before end of market.

name: River flood camp
description: Camped next to the river. Very nice drive from Tarabuco. Watch out for floods.

name: Great tour guide ‘Jaguarsirius’
description: Micky is a super nice and funny guy from Rurre offering great tours to the jungle and pampas. we just love this guy and would recommend him to everyone who really wants to get to know nature here.

name: Great food with some wifi
description: Pizzeria Torre Italiana. Very cosy little place with beautiful home-made pizza's and pasta's, mexican and local food. Nice fresh juices as well. Wifi is about as decent as you can find in this town. No problem for whatsapp messages but calls have about 3s delay.

name: Hospedaje de los Andes
description:
Missed the Refugio in the dark. Similar to the other place, but directly on the main road. Had to let myself into the backyard in search for the owner. 30Bs for my own room, shared bathroom. Everything is clean. 

Update: you have to turn from the main road as it is now a bit out of the town. There is a bell on the door and also at window to the shop which is on the corner.

name: Wild camp by river great scenery
description: Awesome wild camp with river just off the F25.  OK for 4x4, bikes and motorbikes. Big rig might have trouble.  Friendly locals in the area who are curious but otherwise completely alone with views of mountains and streams.

name: Place afther Town Entrance
description: Left after the Townentrance. For one Night and 3 Big Rigs, perfekt. Walking Distance to town.

name: Between Hostel and Park Ranger
description:
A Road beside to the Mainroad but, no noise at all. 
Fits perfect for Big Rigs. 
We had a good night with 3 Big Rigs.

name: Tupiza quiet wild camp
description:
More quiet place in town to camp. Lots of space for all sizes of rigs. No facilities. 
The police came to check our passports in the evening but didn't make a problem of us staying here

name: hostel oro Blanco
description: quite expensive, 90 bolivianos per night, but good enough for hot shower and resting.

name: Tarabuco center
description:
place for the night for market "domingo" special tradition

Do not park here Saturday night or you will be in the way for the Sunday Market and asked to leave.

name: Hostal Cruz de Popayan
description:
Double bedroom with private bath for 160 bolivianos with breakfast (egg, bread, jam  and coffee).
They also have dorms (45 bob in 6-bed dorm in 10/23)

Clean and central located.
Parking 3 blocks from the hotel

name: El Fuerte de Samaipata
description: Pre Hispanic ruins. 50 Bob per person. UNESCO listed. Guide 100 Bob for groups of 2 to 6 persons.

name: Back-Stube & Carla's Garden Pub
description: The german owner which is dead and Carla from the netherlands opened this restaurant. You can order cake and typical german or dutch food. Also pizza, pancakes or bolivian food available. Nice location with a good view. Wifi available.

name: Coca Wasi - Casa de la Coca
description:
May 2019: closed when we were there. 
A very nice museum about Coca.

name: New Migración
description: The new Migración is very conveniently located here. We got an extension for two months in two minutes without questions asked.

name: Station gas Copaca
description: We have camp just for the night in parking lot

name: Casona San Lazaro
description: Nice and simple hotel with good vibes and animals, good if you want a chip hotel. For a matrimonial room (bathroom outside of the room) we pay 15 soles/person.

name: La Cúpula Hostel & Camping
description:
Here it is: 2 private rooms with private bathrooms (may not be available during covid, call ahead), 2 shared rooms (same), camping and RV area .It includes: kitchen (for campers, 30 boba to use it), bathroom, wireless internet, breakfast (15 bs - not available recently), some cultural events, laundry (12bol/kg). 
2022 - camping for 25bs/pers

name: After Chaguarani on the hill
description: To go to PN Toro Toro without going to Cochabamba, a few kilometers before Mizque enter left to Tin Tin, its a road paved with stones. Then get the way to Matarani and Chaguarani Grande. You can camp at this point or continue to Vila Vila, Sivingani, Sacabamba, Ansaldo and then Toro Toro. There is another wah trough the Mina Asientos but it was not recommended at this time because it was to muddy.

name: YPFB Valle Hermoso
description: We got gas here for the foreigner price.

name: La Playa Hostal
description: A basic semi-complete three story place for 25 BOB per person including simple breakfast and secure motorbike parking.  Also good for cars and big rigs.  Right next to river but no suitable camping. Very friendly family.

name: Mechanic Potosi, all types of cars
description: Av. Prado San Clemente/7. de Agosto; The turbo loader for our Iveco Daily from Garrett/USA has been changed here, very friendly chief and mechanics; knock at brown wide door beside the gigantografia shop; they have 4 dogs inside - beware of them;  the TL had been partly renewed by the Turbo Diesel Center Potosi, AV. Las Banderas No. 20 just some blocks away - see our other entry.

name: police control
description: coming from Argentina this fixed police control stopped us to register  our vehicle with the paper we got from the border (declaration  jugada) and of course the policeman  asked for a tip of 10 BOL for exiting the city :-)  We pretended  not to understand and he let us go.

name: Estacion de Servicio TOLAR
description:
26 Nov 23 - no gasolina or diesel. 

20 Liter in jerrycan for local price. He didnt want more.

2022: 5 bobs/liter direct in tank

name: Curahuara de Carangas
description:
We parked in a camper van on the village square opposite the church. Calm. No services. All shops in the village except fuels. 

Nous avons stationné en camping-car sur la place du village face à l'église. Calme. Aucun services. Tous commerces dans le village sauf carburants.

name: La chapelle sixtine de l'altiplano bolivien
description:
Carahuara de Carangas We finally managed to visit this beautiful church after waiting for the padre 2 days.
Hours of attention:
08.30-12.30 / 14.30-18.30
phone padre Slawomir: 68331304
phone Secretaria: 73548194

ask at the "Santiago Apostol" Bibliotheca besides of the church

name: Potosi, Turbo Diesel Center
description: they partly renewed the turboloader from Garrett/USA for our Iveco Daily 40-10W; the import parts are very expansive -  repairing the TL incl. parts was 700 USD, but we had no option; very friendly people; also for Bosch, IHI, BorgWarner, Biagio,... see foto, also injector pumps;

name: Padcoyo, parking lot near RN 1,
description:
parkinglot a few meters beside the RN 1 southly of Padcoyo, 
free, no facilities! not much traffic at night

name: at the church
description: drive to the little church, we slept at the Plaza in front, quite at night, portable water on the Plaza

name: pulacayo in front of church
description: Just enter to Pulacayo, park and explore the place. Quiet and save night militari checkpoint at 50 m

name: Resting area next to a River-Juan Fernandez
description: Next to orchard full of peaches. Juan who owns the property guided us to the 7000 years old rock paintings on the families property. Very friendly. Recommended.

name: Residencial montes
description: Small residential at the main plaza. Parked the motorcycle in the hallway but had to take of the pannier at one side to get trough the door (Suzuki DR650). Not very clean but paid 50bs for a private room with bathroom (3 pers. room)

name: In the red valley
description: Just off the main road, there's a road that leads into a valley of red sand and thorn trees. Lot of flat camping space, quiet and out of sight.

name: In front of  Hotel de Salt Tayka
description: We campt in front of the Hotel and could use the Toilet and shower in a room. We just had to eat in the restaurant.The have a menu with soup, salad, main course and dessert.the price per person is 120bs, it was delicious.the people are very friendly and drove with us to a viewpoint of the Vulkan for a "propina"

name: Big parking
description:
The road (track), a vast expanse of mud sometimes 40cm deep, is closed during the working hours of the workers, and the traffic resumes after 18:30, but it is night, so driving is trying and the area of ​​work exceeds 80km so the first flat place  for bivouac is welcome. 


En français : la route (piste) vaste etendue de boue parfois de 40cm, etant fermée pendant les heures de travail des ouvriers, la circulation reprend apres 18h30, mais il fait nuit, la conduite est eprouvante et la zone de travaux dépassé  (80km) le premier endroit plat pour bivouaquer est le bienvenu.

name: Rocky beach
description: Just 3 km out of Copacabana is a small dirt road along lake Titicaca. It is very quiet during the nights. Great views, only lot of trash! Just follow the road for 10 min and pull off to the right, you can sleep right on the beach. 4x4 recomended

name: Laguna wild camp
description: Great wild camp before heading into Cochabamba. Dead-end asfalted road right on the lake and behind a restaurant if you don't want to cook.

name: YPFB
description: only sold at official price. due to cameras  didn't  want to fill jerry can

name: Nature wild camp close to the city center
description: We camped here to go climbing but it's just a great wild camp when visiting the city. This is a dead end road, just drive to the end of the cobble stone part and park. It's flat and you have a bush trail going to the river. The river and trees cover up the noise from the city so you will have a peacefull sleep. There is a hipermaxi 3km away (find it on maps.me) if you want to combine with groceries.

name: La Plazuela
description: Asked the workers to stay overnight at the level spot. The man who watches the equipment lives in the small hut behind the stone wall.

name: Scenic drive in the lake
description:
beautiful views over the lake , any car can go.
can be muddy if raining. You also can go on the isla del sol.
there is a small harbor . Very peaceful spot!

name: Residential Castro
description: A nice little hotel inside the mall looking place near the plaza. 30b. 7b for shower (luke warm). Allows use of kitchen, room is spacious and comfortable.

name: Flora's tienda y hostal
description: Flora is a shop owner who will also let u stay the night in one of her two extra rooms. One room she stores gasoline in so the smell is rather harsh but the other room is great. She told me to name my price and I paid 20b for one night. Bathroom shower no kitchen.

name: Residential sabaya
description: I tried the hotel but they were booked, they referred me to the place next door. Owners are very nice. Charged me 50 w/shower or 40 w/out. Room is clean.

name: Tholas hôtel
description:
We slept 2 nights in this hotel. The day before our departure in the south lipez and the evening of our return. Our camper van stayed in the hotel's closed car park during our trip, free of charge. The owners are super friendly. Hearty breakfast. Wifi good.
