Nous avons couché 2 nuits dans cet hôtel. La veille de notre départ dans le sud lipez et le soir de notre retour. Notre camping-car a pu rester dans le parking fermé de l'hôtel durant notre voyage, gratuitement. Les propriétaires sont super sympa. Petit déjeuner copieux. Wifi correct.

name: Hostal Flores
description: Nice Hostel 140 bls, prívate room with toilet, cafe or tea is offered at morning, they have a small parking for 2 cars ands some motorcycles , the neighborhood is nice not so far from the téléférique, el monticulo and 20 min walk to downtown.

name: Wild Camp @Church
description: Nice quiet place direct at the church and close to the waterfall. No facilities. It seems that no one lives next to the church as the houses are closed with stones. We managed the road from Sucre to Maragua with a VW T3 2WD and it was ok (dry season).

name: Caffe Art
description: Great atmosphere, good wi fi and very nice backyard where to sit. Coffee was excellent and dessert portions were giant (tried the carrot cake and the apple pie that were both excellent). The empanadas were just ok but the eggplant sandwich are delicious. Worth the stop.

name: La Boheme
description: Really nice bar! They have proper cocktails (real gin tonics, yaay), and a happy hour with decent prices (B18 for 1). Happy hour is every day from 5pm to 7pm. Mojito not included. 35Bol which I think is still quite reasonable!

name: La Cocina
description:
Awesome place for burgers, shwarma, falafel and quesadillas. Prices vary from B18 to B26. Good fries too, portion to share for B6. Really recommend this place.

Update January 2020: prices are a bit higher. Raised around 5bol.

name: Banco Union
description: Bank office and Western Union that you can go to to retrieve money if your cards dont work at the ATMs (as was the case for us). It was relatively quick and you need a Mastercard and passport. They take about a 2.5% charge of the amount.

name: Change/Fotocopies
description:
You need photocopie of passeport and immigration stamp, of papers of the car, entry slip. 
Here you can change reales and make photocopy.

name: Cool Mirrors
description:
Mirrors by May 10th 2017 
We did it in a 2wd, no problem

name: Running Chaski Hostel
description: Very nice hostel in centrally located. Cleanest and best designed hostel I have been to. 75 bol for a dorm with breakfast. The breakfast is great. Good kitchen. Big lockers, TV room. Friendly staff. Separate Cafe and restaurant in the court yard. Space for two motorbikes in the hallway during the night, but must be taken out on the street in the morning when the cafe opens. No parking for cars, but a parking garage is located right across the road.

name: Ecco
description: Sold us fuel for 6,50 after some quick and easy negotiation. Two motorbikes

name: Ruta 14. Road Toll and Police Check
description:
This is a road toll station and police checkpoint when heading north. The road toll accepts ONLY Bolivianos. For our car (VW Kombi) we had to pay 10 Bolivianos to Tupiza. Keep the receipt, it will be checked in Tupiza.
The police immediately behind the toll controls passports and vehicle document.

name: Well hidden Wildcamp
description:
Off the road a narrow track down to a riverlet, after crossing head a little right. Level place for 2-3 cars, tents. 
Spacious enough for big rigs, not shure about the entrance road. 
River has verry few water, but that might change with the weather.

name: Cochabamba
description: If you are desperate and don't want to fill with bidon and agree to pay the full price, here they can sell to foreigners!!!! Most can't sell to foreigners because they don't have the system even if you pay the full price!

name: Hotel Cristal Samana
description:
Fancy and very nice salt hotel next to the salar entrance. Room is 125 USD. 
They let us camp behind the hotel for free. In return we had dinner there for 19USD (3 course menu). 
No shower but bathroom. 
Very friendly owner and staff. 
Breakfast is 5 UsD. 
Internet depends. Sometimes really fast, sometimes poor.

name: Hotel Olimpo
description: Ok if stranded for the night in Villazón. 130 BOL for double room and 20 for parking (secure, bigger cars will fit). Rooms not fantastic (but clean) and include suicide showerhead. Breakfast consists of coffee and pan with some marmelade.

name: Munaipata Cafe/Coffee Farm
description:
Cafe and finca producing coffee. You can do a tour for B200 pp, we didn't, but the place is really beautiful. You can also just have a coffee in the cafe. About a 10 min drive from Coroico.

Make sure to contact them before heading there. WA number is on their website.

name: Gomeria / Tire repair
description:
llanta pinchada àqui te repara con amor y profesionalismo

repair your tire hole with love and professionalism

name: Hotel Quime
description: mid-sized hotel in this extremely quaint and picturesque town of Quime. situated at the bottom of the pass between Konani on the F1 and Quieme. This is the most sensational ride/drive we have found in Bolivia. Room in hotel for 2 with private bathroom cost Bols120. Could have slept 3 as there was double and single bed.  Delightful family run hotel.

name: Mi Supermarket
description: Big water jugs 20l for 25Bobs, refill straight on the parking place and give the bottle back, didn't pay deposit

name: Towards Rurrenabaque
description:
First Fuel Station after the rough part to Rurrenabaque, drove in, without negotiations filled full for local price for diesel. Nice girl, tipped, spend a break there, bathroom as well, but didn't use it!

very clean bathrooms with showers.

name: Transmission specialist
description: Don't come here not professional at all!!! Overlanders prices and the works doesn't worth it!!!

name: hot showers
description: clean showers for 7.5 bol. from terrace nice view. parking behind bus station

name: Dunlop Tire Shop
description: Note! If you can get your tyres changed at another place, do so. We had our tyres changed and asked if they would align it. This they did, but when we continued travelling and got on a straight road, we noticed that our steering wheel was crooked. We contacted the company and they indicated that the report was green, so there should be no faults. We had to re-align the car at another garage and they indicated that the alignment was indeed not done properly. I neatly sent the report to Dunlop (Disbosur is called it on Google) and they said they could not read the report, even though there was a clear report with figures before and after the new alignment. They did not want to admit their mistake or refund our money. We were treated nicely in the shop, but once you have made the purchase and something is not right, they know how to find excuses for everything. Very unfortunate as the company looked good and had good reviews, yet being a foreigner they could care less about your problems.

name: Well off the road
description:
As the other place here was not acessable for our bikes because of a high water level in the river we came here. 
Further away from the road (1km), still here it but insects are louder. 
We had a good fight to come here because of muddy potholes and parts of this track, but its a nice place. 
Here the track crosses the brown river.

name: Caracollo Estacion
description: Wouldn't sell us fuel at the pump, but a shop onsite had 10L for cans, pre-filled, and sold us these for 50B each (5 bob a litre).  No identification required.

name: Parking in Yolosa
description:
Large and spacious parking lot with bathrooms and a very friendly lady. We spent the night after a car breakdown. 20 bolivianos for the car or 10 for a tent.
Recommended when it gets dark.

name: Next to Cemetery.
description:
Very closed to Potosi, quiet place, not so bad view, OK for 2wd and tents. Don't try to go further on the road, it's private and the owners are not very friendly but they told us it was OK near the cemetery. free. 
small river a little bit down.

name: Roadside
description: Flat area made of gravel, just side of the road to Potosi. Hidden from the road but not enough far from it to avoid the traffic noise.  Spacious area for all kind of vehicles, make the job for one night.

name: socavon
description:
next to the church you can take a delicious breakfast called "api con pastel", just sundays until 12hrs.

here you can also go to the mine and to the museum

name: El montículo
description:
Después de mucho buscar un lugar plano y seguro en La Paz, descubrimos que se puede estacionar y dormir arriba de la plaza El Montículo, muy cerca de la plaza España donde hay patio de comidas con wifi. bajo el montículo hay baños públicos hasta las 3pm pero el tipo es muy pesado y no dejan lavarse.

El lugar es muy agradable y tiene bonita vista, también hay una estación policial cerca.

after looking for a flat and safty place we parked in El Montículo. its near of España square, and there are public restroom  until 3pm. you cant get a shower there.

This place is nice and has an espectacular view.

name: Samana Wasi Hostel
description: Recently opened hotel. Owner built it all by himself during 2 years, and since 4 months welcomes guests. Super clean, very friendly and helpful and we could camp on the parking lot. We paid 20 Bol pp and could use the toilet. There is a shower, but I guess water is scarce so that wasn't included in the price. You can also stay in one of the rooms, price including dinner and breakfast is 70 Bol. When we asked whether there was a kitchen we could use, he showed us his own kitchen, which is in the area where he lives. So it's not really a kitchen for everyone to use. Really recommend staying here! The drive from Sucre is amazing.

name: Señor Bonifacio - Alojamiento
description: It's a small "hospedaje" in the middle of nowhere. Actually it's more like a room in the backyard of the Señor Bonifacio's house. Tiny room with two small bed. Friendly people who can cook a nice plate for you for 10 bol. Really good fresh camomilia the for 1 bol. Nice place to stop for a night in order to do the beautiful road by day. All the products come from their farm.

name: Tied los Siete Cascadas
description: follow road past here to get to the 7 waterfalls trail

name: Hostel Pachakuti
description: 40bob per person for private room with private bathroom. Hot water from suicide showers, lovely views,  on site restaurant. High up in the village, 20min walk from the port.

name: Roadside Quarry Dirt Mound
description: Just off the main road, 100m off and accessible by our 2wd VW, there are a couple old dirt quarries offering pretty decent view protection from the road. Nothing fancy, but free and quiet.

name: Gomeria + Mechanic
description: Ask for Ramon. He helped us out very quickly with our air filter. He seemed to know what he was doing. 40 BOB.

name: Alojamiento America
description:
Hostel and restaurant. The price was 40 Bs/person in a private room without bathroom. The girl said me it was OK for 30, with hot shower and breakfast included. 
Finaly,  the shower was cold and she wanted that I pay 5 Bs for a hot shower.
And the day after in the morning, she changed the deal and wanted that I pay more for breakfast.
Very noisy,  not friendly! 
Don't go there!!!

name: El Rincon del Jucumari Hostel and Camping
description: Very tranquil camping hostel which has 3 terraces with beautiful view from the edge of the village down into the valley. Motos can pass from the entrance down next to the tents but camper vans wouldn’t fit. 40 bob / night for a tent per person They also offer rooms (70 bob / person including breakfast) Showers are warm to hot. The place used to be called Gecko camping. Super friendly family ran business with personal connection to local guides if you search any.

name: Rurre Agua
description:
Nice lady, selling filtered water from nearby mountains.
We asked if we could fill one 20liter jug in our 2 10liter cans, instead she gave our cans to a guy who cleaned them and filled them up...really nice - 20 Bobs

name: Way to Maragua
description: Amazingly beautiful route to the tiny town of Maragua (check the photos). If you don't feel like doing the 3-4 days hike in the Cordillera de las Frailes, you can easily drive the route like we did. The crater of Maragua is definitely worth a visit, and the road won't disappoint or bore you for a second. It's only dirt roads, and when we drove it, it was in good condition. Don't drive here during rain season (nov - feb I believe) because we saw that some parts of the road got washed away with mud streams.

name: Residential Japon
description:
30 bols single (possibly low season price).. large room. 50 for two ppl. 
nice place. hammocks, communal TV, cold shower, wifi

name: Hostel
description: Stumbled across this place as just happened to spot the sign as looked back from the road. 100 Bol for double room with ensuite. Great view of the lake! Warm shower. No access to kitchen but plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Good option as halfway house to Copacabana

name: Santa Anita roadside
description: Large cleared grassed area at the (unused?) Santa Anita entrance gate. Effectively on the roadside so not tresspassing, but far enough from the road for dust to be not a problem. Could tuck in under trees to get some shade

name: Flat area, hidden by hills
description: Alternative spot, since the other was one was flooded. At few hundred meters very abandoned dirt road lead here alone the hills. quiet night, good option if you want to split the drive from La Paz to Uyuni

name: Hidden wild camp with great views
description: Flat area in the wide open plains, but sheltered from the road. Amazing views on the snowy volcanoes, no sign of civilisation within sight.

name: In the open valley
description: Just in the open valley, amazing views but really really cold. We left water bags on the roof and they were ask completely frozen. Next night maybe a bit more sheltered 😉

name: El Guajojo fuel
description: Boss said no foreigners, but would fill can so gratefully accepted. Attendant filled the whole tank 85 litres while holding my can and a short length of hose to complete the charade while the boss looked on. Paid him 400 B.

name: Private House with bedroom
description:
Family house with bedroom. I paid 30 bol for a whole warm big room with double bed. Very clean. The lady can cook a simple dinner. Very suitable place for cyclists as it is 70 km far from Uyuni. 
There is an old (erased by the sun) signal of restaurant at the entrance of the house

name: Hotel Continental
description: Basic hotel with clean rooms, lots of blankets but no heating. Double no bathroom 130b and single with bathroom is 100b. Free decent speed wifi. Parking with high clearance for 10b. Street to the hotel is a bit narrow.

name: Rest at 3.850m
description: This place is nothing special but if you are starting late from Tupiza or you are to late to reach Tupiza before sunset at this place you can rest below 4.000m. It is close to the road but there is little to no traffic at night. There is also some wind shelter (depending of the direction of the wind).

name: Checkpoint and Tollgate
description: If you pass this gate heading west and go to the ghost town you have to pay BOL15 pP

name: sala comunale
description: we did a tour in bici and arrived in this small village at 6 pm. of course no hostel or so ever, but we were just looking for a place to stay. the guy in charge of the gate opened a public building for us, just beside the chain gate. mattresses inside and even light. we took our shower behind the houses. there are small shops in the village. cars, buses and trucks passing just in front of the windows on the first floor, a bit noisy but safe and dry.

name: Hostal Inka Terra
description: the only cheap place we found to spend the night on this touristic island. normally 25 bs/person, but we could get a matrimonial room for 40 bs. no WiFi but all hotels and restaurants around have it. no hot shower when we were there, even no water in the shower but always some cold water left by. very quiet area and enough bed sheets and layers to spend a warm night. to charge your devices, until 9pm and from 7am. even if there was no other guest, we had to leave the hostal at 10am. the women are nice.

name: Land Rover Bolivia LR
description:
Good LR Mechanic. They can also scan the electronic with obd2. 
Expensive but friendly and good help.

name: Hostal Gabriel
description:
Correctly located on the map.
Same as on Google maps
Motorcycle friendly. Can park in the lobby
Friendly owners also own the shop next door.
hostalgabriel.blogspot.pe

name: RN39 cleared area
description:
Large cleared area on inside of sharp bend. Status unknown, but likely to become a gravel pit, so may not be available in future. Not fenced. 
No amenities. 
Very quiet night.

name: Ruta Nacional 3
description:
An open level place for several tents. 
It's in the inner section of a turn, but a bit Youphill. U hear the road but you are well sheltered from views. Only the neighbours said hi, friendly as usual.

name: Paraiso
description: No problem, but did mention they weren't supposed to fill straight to tank. 60 litres gave 300 Bol. Both happy.

name: before san juan
description: Good place for wild camping with view on the salar. you have good wind protection with rocks.

name: Hostel
description: the hostel doesn't have name outside but is the building left of the little store (3rd from the corner with three stars on the facade). 25 bolivianos per person, not hot water.

name: Hacienda de Kaluyo
description: Fancy hotel. We camped in the garden for 50 BOB pp - bargained down from first offer of 70. Think camping was only possible because there were no guests but always worth a try. Beautiful pool, with baños and an electrical douche close, exterior to the hotel. Nice lake views.

name: Laundry and Dry Cleaning Superlimp
description:
Laundry and dry Cleaning. Laundry is BOL10/kg. Opening hours are daily (Sunday?) from 8 to 12:30 and 15 to 19:30. They do a proper job.
SORRY: The position was not marked correctly in iOverlander. In reality it is half a block to the west on Calle Estudiantes next to the Café Le p'tit Parisien.

name: La Casa de Margarita
description:
Wonderful guesthouse! 
The perfect place to relax and treat yourself. 

The place has a wonderful garden with hammocks, really good breakfast and over all the nicest hosts. 
Margarita and her daughter are lovely and they will help you with everything. 

You can park your car behind the gate as long as it is not too high or you can park outside. The place is at the end of a street. No one drives or walks by and the neighborhood has got security guards walking around. And there is a camera in front oft the house. We parked the Land Rover outside as it is too high to fit inside but we felt very safe. 

They speaks Spanish, English, Portuguise and a bit of danish. 

The rooms are cozy. Everything is brand new and as clean and tidy as you could wish. 
There different categories of rooms and prices vary. Call them or find them
on booking or Facebook. But i think it is best to ask for prices directly.

For us it was more like staying with family as in a hotel. 

Btw: wifi is fast.

name: Public water point in a small square.
description:
Public water point 9 meters off the road. You can park easily. 
No pressure so difficult to use a hose.
You can also sleep near this location on the soccer field in the village.

name: libélula eco lodge
description:
Eco lodge Natural therapies. alternative medicine. accommodation. 

eco lodge. terapias naturales. medicina alternativa. alojamiento.

name: Ovando Norte
description: Santa Cruz - Mercedes Benz/RAM/FIAT/MITSUBISHI Trucks - Repuestos y Servicios

name: Museo De Arte Textil "CETUR"
description:
A beautiful museum 8 room museum that explains (in English and Spanish) music and textiles of 2 local cultures (Yampala and Jalq'a). 
10 BOL pp + 7 BOL for picture taking.

Well worth the visit.

name: Tarabuco Sunday Market
description:
Large Sunday Market in town center.  Everything is for sale: local produce, prepared food, hardware, clothes, traditional textiles and other touristy stuff.  We had a nice time wandering through the streets and learning what things cost.  
Some what touristy in areas but definitely a place where locals shop too. 
Can take bus from Sucre (40bol for tourist bus or 10bol for local), but we drove ourselves out in the morning (10bol toll), pleasant drive.

name: Garganta Del Diablo
description:
Beautiful waterfall off an uplifted layer of rock and high cliff.  Not much water in June.  We were most impressed with view and the great geology here and in the area, all the colors of the rainbow.
Be sure not to miss the actual garganta which is a small cave on the side of the cliff.  Only 100m or so, follow the stone path off to the right side, down and around.  With out the help of a friendly local hitchhiker we would have totally missed it.
We had to pay 10bol pp on the way into Maragua for admission to here and the Cementerio.

name: Cementerio de Maragua
description:
Cemetery on top of a small flat hill over looking the very interesting Maragua basin.  Very pretty.  Graves dating back to the '80s in the typical style, but pretty tightly packed.
Alone this cemetery is probably not worth the trip to Maragua, but if you're in the area stop by.  
The point marked is the relatively flat parking area that is up a rough track from the main road, approx 400m.  From here walk another 300m to the top of the hill.  Wouldn't be a bad spot to camp, not out of sight but off the main road.

name: Mountain View
description: This is a flat site right on the edge of the road in an area where flat sites do not exist. Road was very slow going for us so the waterfall site south of here was not an option. Sheltered and shade and level - and views. Good enough

name: sevenda carbon
description:
Just for those like me who misjudge their fuel consumptiom
Nice old lady has an open drum of diesel behind the red double doors. 5 Bol per litre. She also has Bolivian gas bottles to sell or swap

name: Hostal Samary Wasi
description:
This is a very nice, small family run hostal in Maragua village with three comfortable bedrooms with three beds each. There are also hot (suicide) showers available. The price is BOL70 including dinner and breakfast.
For BOL40 you can stay in your campervan next to the hostal, get dinner and it includes use of the bathroom.
If you search the place in the village ask for the house of Juan Carlos Ventura.
And if you like a guide to take you around the beautiful valley giving explanations to Maragua and show you the nature secretes ask for the owner's sons. In our case it was Carlos Daniel who knows a lot about this area

name: Wildcamping with View
description:
This is a wonderful spot just off the road. We used it for a lunch break only but could imagine to stay here over night as well. It is a large nice and partly flat area with one single tree and a wonderful view. It is visible from the street but there is hardly any traffic.
The road routing in Google Maps and in OSM looks a bit different than the reality but the road really passes this place.
REMARK: The road from Aiquile to Totora (or vice versa) is very beautiful. The road is all cobbled (gepflastert) with stones, goes up and down the valleys and has wonderful views. You can't drive it fast but you can enjoy every bit.

name: Near Ollagüe border
description: Nice and quiet place with an amazing view of the active volcano. Away of the wind.

name: Valle Hermoso
description:
Good Hostal with 4x4 tour service with guide (we don't use it...)
The place is good, clean, quiet, and close to the centre.
Average Wifi (seems to be the same in all the town)
Warm and clean shower 
Price:
- 60Bol pp Matrimonial + private bathroom without breakfast 
- 40Bol pp room with 2beds shared bathroom without breakfast 
Good Staff, we recommend !
(Can park the bicycle inside).

name: Camping Ecolodge Copacabana
description: Big rig friendly, nice garden, bathroom and shower, very quiet, directly at the beach, 20 Min walking to the village, internet (WiFi in the garden), nice manager. Very secure, if you want to leave your camper during the day (excursions, etc.), they close the gate at night but not every night. 30 Bol/per, Kids free previously, though recently it was 50 per, including kids.

name: Hostal Jallalla
description: Really nice place, with a great view of Titicaca. We paid 40 bol per person for a triple room with shared bathroom (60 bol for private bathroom). They can provide fresh drinks (Coca, Fanta, Cervesa..) that you can enjoy on the terrace. Really nice owner. Really hot shower. Clean hotel. Good wifi for the place. You don't have to make reservation before to get to the island, there are plenty of hostel here available!!

name: Canyon Pilcomayo
description:
Beautiful canyon. This spot is on a old part of raod behind a small hill. It is not well-hidden, but outside of the sight. It is not totally level, but one big plus, was not muddy after the rain. We spend 2 peaceful nights here, though during days there are quite a lot of traffic as a curvy dirt road. You can walk down via several steepy ways to the beach, locals were fishing there.

You have to pay toll at the beginning of the road and have to mention a destination. When we said thermas we paid 5 bs and they let us pass.

name: Estacionamiento Coqueza
description: Ideal for spending the night, very quiet, excellent views of the volcano. Hot showers 10 bls and baths included with the entrance to the volcano.

name: Hostal Casarte Takubamba
description: One of the more pleasant hostales we have stayed in on this trip. We paid BS 259, or US$ 40, for a matrimonial with private bathroom. The only thing about this room: there are no curtains separating the shower area, so the toilet gets wet when you take a shower. Breakfast included and you can also use the kitchen. They have only one parking spot for 1 small car. Our Suzuki SX4 barely fit in. Walking distance to downtown.

name: Radiadores y soldadura
description: On the left side when you drive out of cochabamba in direction La Paz. Well equiped workingplace. Small House, the sign is next to the street. Experience for 20 Years. If you need someone to repair your radiador, here is the place. Short behind vinto, driving out of cochabamba.

name: El Tucan - Hostal with large covered patio
description: Not too many great places to stay in Buena Vista, ao we were really happy we found this place. Large covered patio where you can park your camper/car and camp. Bathroom tiles on the floor ;) you can use the washing machine for 25 Bol. Very friendly and helpful owner. He also has dorm rooms and with private double rooms with bathroom. Paid 40 Bol per person. Same price for the dorm bed.

name: Señora Blanca - tours to Amboro
description:
Beforehand it wasn't really clear how we could book our tour to Amboro. It is mandatory to take a guide into the park and also we really recommend it ;) Señora Blanca had been very helpful and charged a really fair and good price. We used our own 4x4 cars to drive to La Chonta, where we could camp for free in our cars, about 500 meters from the cabanas (50 Bol per person per night and really nice rooms with private bathroom), with the jungle sounds surrounding us during the night! We paid 305 Bol per person, including the guide (180 Bol no matter how many persons), breakfast, 2x lunch and dinner. 

The road was really challenging and both cars got stuck during the trip to La Chonta, due to the heavy rain the day before (the cancelled the tour for that reason and postponed a day). But we got out and it was absolutely worth it! I am sure the road is much better usually. The route to la Chonta includes 5 river crossings. You pick up the guide just before the first river crossing and he knows the road very well and guides you through it. 

We did 2 jungle tours with the guide and a 3rd short one to a lagoon with crocodiles. 

In short: go to Blanca, she is friendly and helpful. Try to avoid the large agencies as they barely pay the owners of La Chonta.

name: salar
description: Good wild camp in the middle of a little salar. Wind protection.

name: Urbari Aparthotel
description: Great place to wait out Brazilian visa! Spacious rooms with Kitchenette 318.50 bob pn. Excellent reception service & breakfast.

name: Fuel station
description: No problem to get fuel here. We Just had to negotiate the price from 8 to 6 bol. Price for bolivianos is 3.7 .... (No problem if they got fuel)

name: Police station behind toll station
description: checked papers, had to go into the office an filled up some papers, wanted 70 bol, went back to the car to get the money, he went of to the next car, so we just started the engine an drove by slowly without payment

name: Mayte hospetaje
description:
In her house, Maria has a room that she uses as an hospetaje. It was perfect for us for a stay over , after long days cycling.  We could put the bicycle in her garden. She charges 20bob per person. We could use her shower and kitchen. 
There is no sign that this is an hospetaje, you need to ask at the small tienda at this location for where to sleep. 
Maria is friendly and it was nice for us to stay a night.

name: Hostal Albergue
description: 25bob per night per person. Rooms are spacious and ok clean. No private bathroom. Shared bathroom were not so clean. Fine for one night. We couldn't use the kitchen and there is no hot water in the shower. Basic accommodation . We could store our Bicycles inside the building.

name: Infomacion turistica
description: Maps & info about Province Santa Cruz. Only spanish speaking but friendly staff. Mo- Fr 8~12h, 15~18h

name: Laundry
description: It was really hard to find one in town, here it is... They charge expensive 20bo/kg and open only till 17:00.

name: Alojamiento San Agustin
description:
Small Hospedaje in a nice village. Paid 25bol pp for a room with 4 single beds and a shared bathroom. All very basic and clean-ish.
Have secure parking for a few motorcycles and a car or two but there's a height restriction. I'm sure you can sleep in your car if you ask. Not for big rigs. Very lovely local family.

name: Humerez
description: Basic matrimonial with shared bathroom for 60 bol. The bed had a mosquito net. Room and bathroom were clean-ish. Parking is large and secure and would definitely be suitable for big rigs. I'm sure you can sleep in your car if you ask but I don't know the price.

name: River Wildcamp
description: Really nice campspot on the river. Visible from the road but possible to camp quite far from it. Almost zero traffic at night. One of the better possibilities to wildcamp on this road.

name: Residencial De La Torre
description: Very basic matrimonial with shared bathroom for 50-60bol (not sure anymore). Room were like in a hospital and the bed was very uncomfortable and squeeky. The hotel has a nice roof terrace with view of the plaza. Space to park 1-2 cars and more motorcycles but there is a height restriction.

name: Residencial Copacabana
description:
Basic matrimonial with shared bathroom for 80bol. The bathrooms were quite dirty but the room was quite ok. The upside of this hotel is definitely the courtyard, which was spacious and had a few seating possibilities. The hotel ran out of water half the time.
No parking but we could just get our motorbike inside (after removing all the luggage)

name: Alojamiento Noa Noa
description: Cheapest option we could find in Uyuni. We paid 80 bol for two persons in a room with a matrimonial and some single beds. The shared bathroom was very clean. We could park the motorcycle in the garage. The hotel was still under construction when we were here.

name: Uyuni Wildcamp
description: We put up our tent in the middle of the salar, away from any tracks. Had a really cool night here.

name: Hospedaje Fatima
description: Got a room for 80 bol for 2 people. Room had two single beds and a shared bathroom. All clean enough. She didn't want to make us dinner so we cooked ourselves. Later two cars from tours came in and she made dinner for them and offered us as well. Parking good for bigger rigs but not too many cars can park.

name: Thermal springs Hostel
description:
All the hotels at the thermal springs charged us 60bol pp to sleep in a dorm. This hostel had a small matrimonial and got it for 100 after a bit of bargaining. No window in the room. The woman made us a meal for 15 bol. The tours had pancakes for dinner and we got all the ones left for free. Lovely woman, although she seems a little grumpy at first. No running water and only short periods with power.
The hotels here are almost only used for tours. There are no names on the houses. Just ask around and you'll have many options to sleep/eat.

name: Alojamiento El Arribo
description:
Veeery basic hotel and really rundown. Not clean and not even running water half the time. Room was cheap at 40bol for a matrimonial with shared bathroom. 
There was a better hotel at the opposite of the street where I parked my motorcycle for 10bol. That hotel was a bit more expensive but still cheap.

name: Residencial Acuňa
description:
We paid 100bol for a matrimonial with shared bathroom and ok breakfast. Bathroom could be more clean. Breakfast was quite good with special bread.
We could park the motorcycle in the lobby. Cars stay in front with camera security but not sure if it's safe.

name: Alojamiento El Dorado
description:
This was our first hotel in Bolivia and we were pleasantly surprised. We paid 90bol for a matrimonial with private bathroom. All very clean with friendly people around. 
No parking but we could drive our motorbike inside. (I do recall you could drive in from the back so parking might be available)

name: Cheap hotel
description: Basic, but fine guest house near the center of town. 20bs per person for a double room. Bathroom not included, but clean with cold shower with good water pressure. Near lots of food joints & taxis. You'll know you found the place when you see the two jaguar statues guarding the reception.

name: Hotel Tropical - Yucumo
description:
If you end up stuck here in this tiny transit town, this place is fine. Very basic, 30 bs per person for the cheapest option of 2 small beds, shared bathroom, cold showers, screen windows. 140 bs for 2 in a double room with bathroom. Shared kitchen. ok wifi. Walking distance to all restaurants. Courtyard with plenty of room for big rig or motorbikes. 

After this town, the landscape & road changes dramatically when driving towards Trinidad from winding mountain roads with steep ravines to flat dirt pampas.

name: Residencial Evita
description: Double room w 3rd bed, bathroom, screen windows, fan, oversized TV for 120bs. Cold showers with fine water pressure, no wifi, no restaurant, nearby main plaza. Inside courtyard to park motorbikes. Better price, similar amenities to most nearby hotels.

name: Alojamiento La Pascana
description: If you're stranded here, this is a fine place for the night at 50bs for a double room, 35 for a single. Pretty courtyard, basic rooms with mozzie net, cold showers. Directly across from the church & nearby the plaza and a restaurant. May be able to park along the street. Could likely camp in the courtyard.

name: Integral Médico Clinic
description: Private clinic, open 24/7. 340bs for consultation. Much less wait time than at nearby hospital. Competent, knowledgeable doctors, efficient service, though not rushed. Would recommend Dr. Juan José Plata Ch. Best pharmacies are located walking distance on the street (Calle R. Galindo) near the hospital.

name: Hotel Avenida de Solei
description: Helpful and entrepreneurial host, clean rooms with fan, cold, clean showers, acai juice & chestnut cookies for purchase at reception. Lovely breakfast, medium speed wifi in the lobby. We negotiated to 100bs for a double room w/ shared bath. Set prices are 250bs per double & 110 per single room. Central part of town near the main avenue and happening Plaza del Estudiante with nice street food, restaurants and bars. May be able to park on Av. Otto Felipe Braun, before the Plaza, though we didn't ask.

name: Extrema / San Lorenzo Border
description:
There are only 2 options to cross overland between Bolivia/Peru. 
1) Via Puno / Lake Titicaca 
2) Via Cobija to Brazil then back through Iñapari to Peru. 

It's illegal to try cross overland at any of the small land borders between Bolivia / Peru where there are no immigration offices (for example Extrema / San Lorenzo or Shiringayoc). 

Be careful, because the local police may not know that you could get in trouble (or deported!) for crossing and trying to get an exit / entry stamp elsewhere later.

name: GNV
description: Will sell at 6 B, starting from8 b, directly in the tank.

name: Alojamento familiar
description:
A simply place to have some nice moments. A very nice owner "Juan". 
Some rooms for 2 or 4 people. 
74958601 Entel or 78640407 Tigo.

name: La Masia, Agua Caliente
description: Small Hotel, very clean, nice Whitney very good Place.

name: El Molino
description: About 2,2 km from town is hotel El Molino. Basic rooms and a large (level) campground (though it's not actually a camping ;)). Friendly owners, 50 Bol per person including breakfast. We could use the bathroom of one of the hotel rooms, and slept in the car.

name: hot natural pools for free
description: park your car here and walk 20m down, several pools, not very deep but nice and free

name: Tanil Vinto Salar Access Point
description: Causeway access at the south side of the Salar.  We had to pay 10bol to exit here.  Be careful some of the approaches to the causeway are in bad shape.

name: Taller Aceite
description:
Incredible attention and reasonable prices. International spare parts !!

Increíble atención y precios razonables. Repuestos internacionales !!

name: Camping Franklin in Coroico
description:
This is a camping area (opened in 2016) that you find in maps.me but not in OSM. There is a campground only for tents next to two pools (which were not in use when we were there in 'winter'). Bathrooms are very basic and with cold showers. 
One level up is a flat area that suits for a maximum of three small vehicles. It is quite leveled. There are also simple cabanas.

The price when you stay in your vehicle is BOL 30pp.

The place is simple and a bit difficult to reach as the last part of the track is narrow and steep. 

Take a left here when driving up to Coroico -16.1984015, -67.7291307 (next to the small hut where you need to pay 5 BOB to enter the village). This is a quicker and easier access road, however, the last steep part can't be avoided. 

The owner Franklin is very friendly and helpful.

name: Hostal Joshua
description:
Veggie and vegan restaurant, eco-hostel and camping. Wifi in and out- was snowing at the time though. Warm ecoshower. Normal toilets and eco dry toilets.

Paid 30 BOB pp to sleep in van plus 25BOB for vehicle.

Try the falafel dish, vegan milks, and breakfast peanut butter!

Thank you Carlos:)

Edit: now it’s 40bob per person to sleep in the car.

name: Good place to camp
description: is a good place for camp, there is and abandone house so you can put the tent in the area with not problem.

name: la Chuñuña
description: good place to to stay if you are in the north ofc lake titikaka, is in the central park in front of the church. we pay 25BOB per person, it's clean and have a small view of the lake and for the first time in Bolivia this place have a garden with fllowers.

name: Migration at Puerto Acosta
description: there is a migration office in Puerto Acosto to cross Bolivia- Peru from the north of the lake titikaka, the office is close from 12:30 to 14:30. closes again at 18.30. don't forget the hour time change between here and Peru!

name: Perfect welder Avenida Andes
description: In the main street knock at the green door where there are many tires, you will find Rodolfo. He is the best welder we have met. Perfect and fast work. Good price.

name: Gas Station. La Palizada
description: We asked if we could camp here at the gas station. No problem. Camped here with two bicycle travellers we met. Very quiet night.

name: Pequeña llanura
description: Nice for one nigth. Nice view! Near of de road. Flat area

name: Electrico Amadeus
description: Probably the best taller electrico in Oruro. Very helpfull and could identify immediately he problem with our relais of our second battery. Honest price. Also open on Sunday. In this street you find many battery shops and electricos, but locals pointed us to Amadeus. Recommend!

name: Get a SIM card
description: Here you can ask one of the guys at the taxi stand to buy you an Entel SIM card (was told it gets better reception than Tigo) for 20 Bol. Foreigners can't register them, or buy them (something along those lines.....) Tipped him 10 Bol as he also put the SIM card in, dialed a number (I think *10#) and called from another phone to make sure it was activated. Then you put credit on it from any of the kiosks with an Entel logo, then call *10# to purchase whatever you want (ex. Data was 50 Bol for 1GB) with said credit.

name: Hermanos Cortez
description: Two brothers with a small workshop. We had to few small things done here but most of the time was spend with them looking for tyres, chain spray and other stuff. They spend a whole day working or driving around with me and charged 100bol. They aren't experts in big bikes but you can work on your bike yourself if the work is too delicate.

name: Hostel Uchumachi
description:
Located right on the town square. 30bol for a bed. I have a two bed room and the place is empty. Beds are not great. Owners are very friendly. Wi-Fi is ok at best. Hot showers once you've worked out those bloody electric showers. Kitchen on site too. 

But the main attraction is decent secure parking for motorbikes on site. There is a courtyard under cover to the property. However, if you have really big panniers it maybe a little tight to get down to the courtyard through the normal sized door walkway. I have a Drz400 with soft luggage and had no problems. No extra charge for parking. 

I did check out the Gecko place. Great view but no wifi and a walk back up the steep hill to the town. That place was 35 and had camping facilities and parking which may suit people driving something bigger than a motorbike. 

The town seems very friendly and relaxed. 

Wi-Fi password is portugal78

name: Electrico Pipa
description: Great electrician. Fair prices and does good work. Make sure you get Pipa, not his student.

name: Gustu - Fine Dining
description: We did the 18 course Bolivian meal which estimates to $80 USD per person. Absolutely devine. It took around 2.5 hours to complete. We had alligator, 3 day cooked pork and beef, alpaca, Amazonian catfish and numerous amazing vegetarian options. Like palm tree! Our highlight was literally a palm tree! It was half the price of Central and Maido in Lima and gave them a run for their money. We walked straight in as well for a 7pm meal without notice.

name: Quiet Sidestreet
description: Fancy part of town. Guards on the streetcorner said it was ok to park all along this street. Quiet night. We went to dinner at the Gustu, which should not be missed! (wifi-psw: llamita7)

name: Lavanderia La Familia
description: 10bob per kilo. Same day service. We were really satisfied with the quality of the service. They did our laundry in 2hours just before they closed. (on saturday they close at 14.00)

name: Dakar Servicios
description:
oups...
the correct adress is : calle 4 de obrajes, entre Hernando Siles y 14 de Septiembre. Black door.
GPS location is ok.

name: Huge parking lot
description: Big parking which fit bus size vehicules. Let us sleep in the truck for 15 bs parking for the truck and a motorcycle included

name: hostel, camping and bar "los amigos"
description: Basic hostel with kitchen, no wifi 35 BOB for Dorm room

name: 500m off the road
description: It is a way on a grassland outside an estancia. The grass were 20-100cm high but harmless. From this spot you can drive in about half kilometer to the fence, where enough turn space is. It was far enough from the traffic for us. Someone was walking by in the evening but didn't come to talk. Ok for a night, better than nothing.

name: Picacho WWOOF
description:
An oganic farm in Bolivia. Check their web first: http://picacho-bolivia.blogspot.com.ar
For work&stay you need to register in their google calender in advance. The way to here which starts nearby Santa Rosa is in a bad condition. In between Piso firme and Remanso was absolutely muddy in dry season, that even 4WD stuck. It cost us several days and lots of affords to drive, better take a bus.

name: Riverside Camping
description: Barrio las Palmeras: You can stay at a grass area with north-westen shade beside the local soccer field as well as at the sandy beach of the river. The place is quiet at night, but in the early morning and evening time some locals will pass by.

name: Eguez Motors Mecanico
description:
They recognized the problems immediately, promised the budget, finished on time, and fixed the problems. The first process was checking and listing the belongings together. And here the first time we saw a customer waiting zone (with WiFi) in S.A. The wife of boss speaks little English, she did her best to explain the thing. You get respond via their Whatsapp too: 68938541
sincerely recommend 1 month after repair

name: City wild camp
description: Not bad for a city wild camp. Two blocks away from the main square. It's busy with cars in the day, but after 23h it gets quiet. There's a security guard in the street all night. When we asked him if it was OK to camp here he asked for a fee to watch the car, we laughed a bit and said we didn't need him watching the car, since we're inside and then he pointed us the best place. It's not allowed to park in front of the white building (bank) from 7h to 21h on weekdays, further in the street no problem. Two streets further on the right there's Alojamiento Santa Barbara where you can shower for 10Bs pp.

name: Hotel Tropical
description:
We stayed here for one night in the backyard from the Hotel. We payed 20 Bob including cold shower and agua portable for the tanks. It is safe and quiet.
All kinds of rig can fit (except Unimog ^^)

name: Wild Rover
description:
Hostel near town center.
It has very clean amenities. Beds are ok. WiFi is good. Breakfast is included.
Price are in the attached picture, we paid 82 BOB per night and per person in a 4 bed dorm.
There is also an Irish pub inside, friendly staff and good atmosphere. It serves drinks and food (of course much more expensive than local shops).
A tour agency can explain you some options in and out of La Paz at the entrance.
Computer with internet connection can be used for free.
It has a laundry service as well (20 BOB per kilo).
For us, it was a good option while waiting for our van to be repaired in the nearby Mitsubishi garage.
The main drawback is that there is no kitchen available.

name: Laguna Kollpa Salt Collection
description: Tiny settlement of flat stone houses nearby the Laguna. Big mounds of salt being collected.

name: Laguana Turuncha
description: Nice spot on the edge of a blue laguna in a picturesque valley.  Easy access feo the main road.  Bunch of flamingos out in the middle when we were here in July.  About 6 tour groups stopped by at 9am sharp, but before and after it was very peaceful.  Pretty windy at sunset. There are more sheltered areas down the access road near a gravel pit or maybe in the quebrada, but be careful of soft sand.

name: plaza vallegrande.
description:
Wifi free. in the plaza ..........
wifi libre.

name: Parqueo 24 hs
description:
*Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
.....
A nice place to sleep in your vehicle next to gas station. 15bs per day. its a trucks parking so big rigs can get in. Friendly lady. Bus to town in front (2.5bs)

name: Clinica Del Frenos
description: We were referred to this place to check our brakes as they were squeaking a bit. Pulled up and they looked at them immediately. They didn't find anything wrong with the brakes, but found one wheel bearing that needed replacement. Paid only 20 Bols and they referred us to a mechanic just down the street to replace the wheel bearing. I would recommend this place to others

name: Motor Sport
description: We had our wheel bearing replaced here. Drove up and he started working on it immediately. Took him a couple hours and he charged 710 bols. Overall a good experience.

name: Wildcamp Outside of Tupiza
description: Quiet spot to spend the night with places to hide yourself from the road. Along a river bed. Some trash, but it we didn't see anyone else on a Thursday night.

name: Dirt Road after Flat Land
description: We stopped at the flat area by the road for lunch, but it looks like there's a dirt road that leads to some tree shelter and leveled space.

name: Mirador
description: Flat area to park and look over the valley. You've got a good view of the curvy road you just took/are about to take :)

name: Path Down to the Riverbed
description: There are a few roads that lead down to the riverbed with level land and trees. Not sure about conditions after rain, but in July the road and river looked good.

name: Side road pullout
description: Pullout next to side road that leads to a farm. Relatively hidden from the main road and quite level. Not the nicest campspot, but OK for one night, as there aren't many possibilities on this road anyway. Nice views to both sides, quiet at night, friendly locals.

name: RENATO
description:
Great Agency owned by a friendly local called Renato. 
He proposes jungle tour with a very good price (the cheapest we founded in town). You can ask him what you want and he can manage a good program for you!
We had an incredible experience with him, we were 3, we built a boat with some wood and navigate on the Beni, visit a community before going into the jungle.
The camps and the food were briliant!
Worth to go there at least 3 days, Renato know and can teach you all the animals and the medicinal plants of the jungle.
Definitely a very good experience, if you want to make something different with a real local experience this is a good deal!
Don't forget sun screen and repelent ;)
Tel: 005913 72839429
GPS: -14.43703, -67.525397

name: UNI vida
description: We were told that this is the only place to buy the mandatory insurance for Bolivia if you are staying longer than 30 days in the country. 137 Bol for apparently 5 years.

name: Laguna Camping y Naturalez, Tiquipaya
description:
Beautiful garden of architect Javier Moscoso with remarkable Gaudi-like architecture. Hot outside shower and toilets, electricity, and wifi.
Javier is very friendly and helpful, contact ahead of your arrival through whatsapp . Here you also have the opportunity of camping under the water! There are 4 caves with different themes where you can enter and watch fishes, and all the local fauna life. Taxi into the centre of town is 25-30 Bob. There are also buses passing by regularly (2 Bob pp).

The best way to reach Javier is through Whatsapp: +59174363869

UPDATE: 2023 camping 40Bols pp
Plus 10 bs if you want to cook there using the oven and kitchen. Ask if you want to experience the underwater caves 350bs 

UPDATE: 2024 camping 40 bol pp, kitchen free but use of oven 50bs

name: Iquircollo
description:
After some perseverance they filled up the tank for international price 8,88.

May fill cans for local price if you park away and walk in

name: Riverbed Campsite
description: A decently flat spot for 4+ vehicles. The stream was running decently during our stay. Tents would be workable though the ground is quite rocky. There is a town nearby (Castilla Huma) but we had the campsite to ourselves. We originally planned to camp at the hot spring but there was a chain gate at Castilla Huma and we were told they had closed the road for the night (it was late, approx 8:30pm) and to come back in the morning as they would open at 8am. The riverbed does have a bit of trash but better than most sites we've visited. Access is via a small spur to the north of the main road into town. Drop into the riverbed and have your pick of parking spots.

name: OQHARIKUNA Fuel Station
description:
Local price in jerry can using a friends ID number. Did not need to show his ID or copy of ID.
5 BOB/L directly in the tank.

name: Laguna Camp
description: Camp close to the 2nd lake. Weather is cold and windy.

name: Canon del Inca
description: Incredible place, very nice walk into the canyon

name: Rincon del Tigre Waterfall
description:
This is a high waterfall quite far from the next village (15km) in the middle of the jungle. It is a steep and large waterfall (in cascades) with plenty of water and nice views.
It is 30km one way drive to the falls from the turn-off from Coroico to Caranavi road and you should calculate around 150 min/2,5hr to drive there and back plus some extra time to walk to the falls plus eventually picknick.
Details: On the way (from Taipiplaya follow the blue street signs 'Cascade Rincon del Tigre') there is a checkpoint were you have to pay 2BOL per vehicle entrance fee. Proceeding from there is in some parts a steep and also narrow rough track. From the checkpoint it is about 20 to 30 min (10km) to come here. There is not much space at the end of this dead-end road and turning the vehicle could be tricky if longer then 6m. We would not recommend to go there with large or heavy vehicles (at least at the moment). They are currently developing this place with a banjo and a small shop (planned entrance fee for the access to the falls is 5BOL pp) but at the time of writing it was still under construction (July 2017). So may be one day they will also improve the track to here.
From the parking spot there is a narrow and steep walk starting behind the building. After about 15 minutes walking you come to a junction. The upper left way leads to a lookout at the base of the first visible step of the waterfall. There is quite some water spray in the air but no direct access to the water. The lower right way leads to a nice picknick area with views and onwards to another nice lookout. There is also no easy access to the water. Some steep paths might get you there (we didn't try) but it is nothing for a swim. Both ways take about 5 minutes from the junction to each end.

name: Rivercamp close to Chimate Village
description:
Coming from Guanay heading to Mapiri (that is about 25km away) we crossed the settlement of Chimate. After about 6,5km we came to a river. Before you cross the bridge turn right and take the track to the river bed (downstream, right river side). It ends after about 150m. The place is visible from the road but at night there is hardly any traffic.
There is easy access to the water which is pretty clear compared to many other river we crossed.

name: Perfect View on Iskanwaya Ruines & Aucapata Village
description: If you don't have the chance to visit the Iskanwaya Ruines this is a place with a perfect view on the ruines and the village of Aucapata on the other side of the valley. There is enough space to securely park the car and enjoy the view.

name: Mashaquipe Tour Operator
description:
We can strongly recommend this tour-operator for the jungle tour as well as for the pampas. They offer different length of tours so you are able to choose what fits best to your expectations (Amazon jungle, pampas or both combined) and your time schedule. There are also lots of other options that you can choose during the trip depending on your interests. Just talk to them. They are highly flexible. Or check on tripadvisor.
The lodges are build with traditional materials, clean and very comfortable, the food is authentic and delicious.
Mashaquipe is run by indigenous locals and some of the guides really lived in the jungle for years before they had to leave the area when Madidi-Nationalparc was established. So they know the places by heart. The profit goes back to the local communities and supports indigenous families.
We did the 6 days/5 nights tour (3 for jungle and 2 for pampas) and we had a great time by walking or going by boat learing about the stunning diversity of plants, animals and natural medicine.

name: Turn-Off to Gruta de San Pedro
description:
Leave the main road between Sorata and Mapiri at this point downhill towards San Pedro Community and follow the track for about 1km. You come to some houses where you can park the car and walk a short distance uphill to the entrance of the cave. The fee is BOL20 for foreigners. When you enter the cave (it is illuminated) you reach a lake after about 5 minutes walk. Here you can hire a small boat (BOL2,5 pp) and paddle over the lake. It is nothing really special so don't expect to much. You might see bats (take a flashlight with you) but there are no stalactites or stalagmites.
You can also walk to the cave from Sorata but as the original walking track along the river was destroyed when building the road you now have to walk along the dust road without shade. However we were told by locals that a trip by taxi from Sorata to the cave and back including one hour of waiting while you visit costs about BOL80.

name: Gruta Chu Ssek Uta
description: Cave with a little lake in. Nice place to know. Entrance: 20bs per person. Taxi from Sorata: 50bs. We came walking 11km (nice views). Taxi back to Sorata: 10bs per person.

name: ES Buena Vista
description: Gas at local price with jerrican, no question asked. Make sure you park out of site before showing up.

name: Patacamaya Military Base Checkpoint
description:
Eastbound we got stopped by two young military guys, right in front of their base. We showed them our international drivers license and the toll receipt, they were not interested! 

Immediately the guy started to ask us for 50 BOL per person!!! We kept smiling and saying no entiendo :) and respectfully pointing to our toll receipt. He seemed to be getting a little nervous, eventually after 5 mins and 2 other cars behind us, he let us go!

DO NOT PAY BRIBES!!! We were shocked this was military personnel and not the usual police asking for a bribe.

name: Laguna Parququcha
description: Laguna Parququcha (Flamingos & 5/5 Entel Edge Connection). Very nice flat spot looking over the lagoon. Just asked some farmers if I could camp for the night and they gladly agreed. No traffic at night. Felt very secure. Saw some Flamingos, Cows & Donkeys

name: Frog Concert
description: 50m south of the bridge there is a short easy way down to the river. At the curve there is a leveled area for one car or small camper. The night was very quiet - only about 5 cars. The river water is clear but with algas so we don't taste it.

name: La Pajcha Waterfall( de Nueve Mondo)
description: A beautiful waterfall, officially 100m in height in real 40-50m. The 7km trek to there is a good hiking path with nice scenery and take about 2 hours one way. The routes in Maps.me, google map or printed in town are all not totally correct - best is the Maps.me. Most time there is only one path and if it splits up they join again later. The way starts behind the gate at GPS -18.996215 -64.292662.

name: Central Moto
description: Great place for tyres, oil and other maintenance parts for motorbikes. Guzzi is a great help and knows mechanics, too.

name: Old Village
description: You can camp in the abandoned village. There are wind protections made of stone. There is a water pump with dirty water which becomes better when pumping for a longer time (would be good for cooking or filtration).

name: ProCyles Store
description:
willy is a great mechanic with fair prices. He speaks fluent English and specialised in BWM, Ducatis and Triumphs.
I got my head bearings done and he fixed a lot of other little things he discovered without charging much. 
He also did this all in a day. Bike was ready when promised. Very happy!  
ph. 76402500

name: Alojamiento América
description: Very friendly owners. They have two rooms in their yard. There is also a shop in their house. 35 BOB per person per night.  Very nice and cosy room. We paid 60 bol. for a room with 3 beds (1 double + 2 simples). Owners very friendly. Located in the center.

name: Golden Lubricantes
description: Free oil change. We paid 275 Bs for 7,5 liter of Mobil 15W-40 and a new oil filter. It took a while before they found the filter, but at least we didn't have to go search for it ourselves. They also cleaned up de air filters and the engine for free. Good service!

name: Safe Parking: Galaxia Parqueo
description: Safe parking while in Oruro. Parking lot attached to hotel with attendant. 5 Bols for one hour.

name: Lakeside Camping with Lamas
description: Most quiet and lonely place we found close to town. It is aside one of the old water reserves build by slaves with a great view to the mine at cero rico as well as over the town. Thanks to attitude sickness we spend two nights here to acclimate. The last km road was in bad condition, but we made it at the first try without 4x4 car.

name: Sajama hostel
description: Little hostel, we paid 40Bs per person (2/3 people per room). Possibility of laundry, no breakfast and no kitchen. Only one shower (cold/warm depend if the time) for all the hostel but many toilets. It's possible to have a tour for going to the salar and you can negotiate for the day (130Bs) regular price.

name: Wild camp
description: Large flat area next to the road, behind some low bushes. Not enough to hide you completely. We left Sucre way too late because of a group of angry farmers blocking all the roads and needed a place to stop for the night. It's not great, but does the trick.

name: Mirador Santa Ana
description:
Spectacular 360 view of the crater and the valley. Just walk the path up the hill on the left side of the waterfall. The walk up is steep, but it's worth it. 

The drive from Sucre is very doable by 2WD in dry season. Don't take the last left to the waterfall, but park in town. It's rocky and leads nowhere, easier to walk the 50 meters.

name: Dunlop Tyres for Cars and Bikes
description: Didn't buy anything here, but the shlop has all kinds of tyres in the window, thought I mark it. The bike tyres range from racing to off-road with different models in between.

name: Observatorio Astronómico Nacional
description: At the moment this place is closed due to the Government not paying the staff....

name: 360 degree panorama
description: a wonderful large flat field with a 360 degree panorama! Absolutely quiet at night. It can get a bit windy after sunset but it calmed down after about an hour or so.

name: Zip Line Adventure
description: We camped next to the zip line adventure. The owners are very friendly and offered to use their bathrooms while the zip line was open.  At night we could use the water tap outside and the shelter. Very quiet but  next to the road.

name: Parque Temático Tarija
description: There is a scenarium and we camped right behind it. There are restrooms during the day and water supply of a foccet. There is a caretaker and we asked him if possible to camp, said no worries. Couple of homeless people about 200mts, came by, nice people, harmless

name: Del Fuego Winery
description: Very nice place to visit. They harvest Syrah (great!), Syngani and others... really friendly staff. Free to taste and affordable wines. Owner is very nice, called Weymar Rios.

name: Lavanderia Plaza Lira
description: This is a very good and reliable laundry service. The costs are BOL10/kg and it is ready the next day. If needed they also offer dry cleaning as well.

name: Hotel Las Balsas
description:
This is the only hotel at Puerto Perez. A room with private bathroom is at regular price BOL150 pp incl. breakfast (might be negotiable). The former Swiss hotel is wonderfully located at the lake side. It was abandonded for three years and the new and very friendly owner Edgar is improving the place bit by bit. Showers are hot and rooms are quite nice. The outside of the building still needs some maintenance. The interior is tastefully decorated and comfortable.
They have a huge secure parking next to the lake which is also suitable for big rigs (entrance through a large gate on the side close to the lake). This grassy area could also be good for camping with tents or in the vehicle but we didn't try this option.
There is a restaurant offering tasty trout and you can also get a simple breakfast for BOL15.
They can also organize tours to the sourrounding islands like Pariti, Patapatani, Qiwaya/Quehuaya with ruins and Floating Islands and Suriqui. We paied for three persons, the boat with captain BOL450 and if you like a guide (spanish speaking guide Oscar is highly recommended) it makes an extra BOL100. The tour takes about 4 to 5 hours.
For more details on guided tours check also the entry at Qiwaya/Quehuaya ("Tours to the Surrounding Islands").

name: Tours to surrounding Islands
description:
From this little village you can start tours to the surrounding islands like Pariti, Suriqui, Floating Islands and Patapatani. Patapatani you can also reach by car but it is nice as part of the guided roundtrip by boat.
Best to learn about the history of all these places is by taking a guide. We can recommend Oscar a local spanish speaking guide (phone: 71279345). He is living here in the village and he can give you lots of background information on the Tiwanaku, Inca and Aymara influence in this area. He is also experienced in working with Totora (local reed). He can organize a boat that is required for the trip.
A three to four hour trip will cost around BOL100 for the guide, the boat goes extra (costs unknown).
What to see: Kalauta Ruins from Tiwanaku times and Floating Islands, on Pariti Island: Museum (BOL15 pp) with ceramic findings from religious ceremonies, Suriqui Island: sacred place from the Inkas and beautiful views over islands and the lake, Island Patapatani: village and museum (BOL20 pp) showing one completly preserved human mummy along other sacrifices. When you are lucky you might experience local traditional music here.

name: Museum Kon-Tiki
description:
A small museum that demonstrates the technics of the construction of balsas (boats) made of totora (local reed).
Father Paulo Esteban of the current owner of this place was one of the constructers and builders supporting Thor Heyerdahl, the Norwegian adventurer building several traditional boats crossing the Pazific and the Atlantic Ozean on long yourneys between 1947 and the 70th.
Here you can experience how reed boats are build as well as you can buy souvenirs made of reed or local made fabrics.
If you address (a day) in adavance you can also make boat trips in a traditional 2 persons sailing boat made of reed. The price is BOL300 for a three hours trip.
600m along the road direction of Copacabana is another place the Utama Hotel (no signs just a green gate) with museum where you can get more information about local traditions and reed boats. If you are not a guest of the hotel or restaurant you have to pay BOL35 entrance fee.

name: Camping Restaurant Panamericana Huatajata
description:
This an informal campsite at the Lago Titicaca with bathrooms but no showers. During the day it is the parking for the restaurant. Check with owners at the right side of the orange gate. Enter through the gate and drive down to the lakeside. It is a gravel ground but quite leveled. There is a wonderful lakeview
The price is open and it is up to you. We paied BOL50 for three persons and one night (and they were happy).

name: Procequin
description:
Calle Thomas Frías. No signage. To the right of the house with red door. Knock on wooden door in between large grey garage door and glass windows.  See photos.

18 bol for 20 L Garrafons for you to empty into your tank and return.

name: Parking and start of Cerro Calvario hike
description: This is the start of the hike to Cerro calvario. There is also a large parking lot. Even big rigs can fit. Good hike take about 30 minutes up and great view of the city and Titicaca Lake.

name: Hotel Montaña
description: very simple, 40 bob per person. bathroom outside, no shower, no diner, no breakfast, old mattress.

name: Autotronica electronical parts
description: Everything you need to repare electrical parts of your car! We were looking for a horn and a contactor and found them. Very helpfull people as well.

name: Hotel Vargas
description: good place, new rooms, new matress, 90 bob per perso with breakfast, hot water, wifi. Clean place

name: Mirador Héroes de Independencia
description: Parking area in the Park, just drive in and find a spot under the trees, this was the best nights sleep in Tarije so far after 3 days.....very quiet and safe..

name: Residencial Willis
description: Hostal with basic rooms (clean and good mattress) and shared bathroom (not clean) as well as cabañas and swimming pool. Paid 50 bob for room with shared bathroom. Big secured private parking.

name: cafe CRETACICO
description:
Best cafe in town, chill atmosphere for a refreshing beer, coffee, fresh juice and sandwiches. You might meet Mat from France who will be happy to see you and share with his knowledge and good plans to discover and explore this amazing area. 

Meilleur café de la ville, atmosphère relaxe pour prendre une petite bière, un café, un jus ou un sandwich. Vous croiserez peut-être Mat qui vous sera heureux de vous voir et de partager sa connaissance et ses bons plans pour profiter au mieux de la région

name: Farmersmarked at Mercado Uyuni
description: On Monday (and probably other days) the whole Av. Arce is a really huge farmers' market where you can get everything being grown in bolivia.

name: ducks laguna
description: It is a level grassland around a small laguna behind the hill of Calamarca.  You will be exposed to the wind and the road on the hill around, but only few cars passed by. The grassland itself is easy accessible in dry. But do not too close to the laguna, swampy. We had a quiet night.

name: Residencial Ikandire II
description: Nice residence close to the central mercado. We stay there two time, first was 60Bs for two people with private room and share bathroom and the second time 54Bs for matrimonial bed and private bathroom. Book from booking so the price depend of the value of the dollars. Staff really nice, clean place and towels. Really recommend for Santa Cruz.

name: amazing wild camping
description:
on the way to Potosi,  turn left on a good dirt road (signboard archeological site 3km). 1km after, turn left in a somehow track leading in 800m to some ruins in a large flat area, not difficult.
fantastic view, very isolated.
not as cold as expected (2°c at night) but lot of wind, 3700m high.

name: calle armando alva
description:
nice quiet street near city centre
and most important : flat !
lot of places

name: Piscina Natural - River Water Swimming Pool
description:
Update July 2022: now all necessary facilities including toilets, shower, sink. 10 bobs per car for camping. Highly recommended .

Right by the border in Bolivia is a huge (20m x 40m) natural swimming pool filled with river water. There are no facilities and entrance is free. There is a covered porch and a BBQ you can use. It was very clean and well maintained and we had it almost to ourselves in the afternoon.

name: Hotel Ascension
description: Hotel with a courtyard you can camp in. The owner is extremely nice and didn't want to charge us too much. Ask about how much you can pay and be a good guest! Water and power available. Owner: Seniora Valeriano Pedraza Lopez

name: Local man can tow your car with its tractor!
description: Very friendly and helpfull man, I was complety stuck in the mud not very far from the village. no 4x4 excursion stopped. anyway because I needed a tractor because too stuck! he tried 3 times between 6 pm To 7.30 pm! I gave him 1000 bob, my wife walked untill the village To find help.

name: E.S. Los Alpes
description: We were able to buy at local price here without negotiating in a jerry can they provided.

name: Lanchonete / Bar at Border
description: If you arrive late for customs when leaving Brazil, you have two options to sleep at the border: west of customs there is a small bar that might also serve food. We asked if we could spend the night. They closed at 8 when we were there but offered to keep a light on outside. Alternatively there is a truck parking area east of customs with no facilities.

name: Parador Santa Maria La Real
description: Excellent, look no further, you have found the best hotel (39 rooms). Sublime rooms, warm water, memory beds, excellent buffet breakfast. All for $ 70 for a double room in the heart of the city with terrace overlooking life.

name: Alojamientos Martinez
description: 30 bolivianos x a room, you can gusrdar the bike inside the hotel, very friendly the sister of the owner, cries a little to get the price down, at first they asked me 40 maybe 50 but they did me a favor

name: Camp in the canyon
description: Just outside the village of Rodeo there is a canyon on the left side. you can camp hidden from the road, it's really nice. We personally slept in that main place of the village in the central kiosk. It was nice with light but we discovered the canyon this morning and it's fare nicer. But you've got the choice : the lighty place with few people's around or the quiet wild canyon.

name: Natural swimming pool
description: On our way down on the death road we ended up at this amazing natural pool. After long days cycling and 4 months in South America without any pool it's just a dream ! 5Bs/pers.

name: Santa Barbara
description: The best hotel we found in town. 40Bs for a private room for two people with shared bathroom and CLEAN (the other we looked were awful 😵). On the 2nd floor they have a private part with patio and terrasse. The room D cost 50Bs woth private bathroom outside. It worth it !

name: Casa de Campo
description:
Very nice restaurant in a big old amazing house. I had a fish al Ajillo (garlic) with coliflor pie...very tasty !! My friend took a chicken with honey sauce and French fries, really good as well !! We are used to eat at the market and it's sure that here the prices are not the same (between 55 and 70 Bs the meal) but it worth it ! 
To add, everything is organic, home made at the moment (and so very fresh !!!) and made with very local food  and the French girl who work with the landlady is really nice !

name: La Bella Italia
description: Very nice pizza place with warm staff and home made tasty pizzas. The mini pizza is 25Bs. small 40Bs. Medium 55Bs. Big 80Bs. Much cheaper than in others places (like the crazy monkey bar !). You can dine in (small terrace and tables inside as well) or take away.

name: Thai Palace
description: When you see that they do Indian, Thai and Japanese food you can freak out. But don't...enter this p(a)lace and you will love it ! The sushi of trout are really good and fresh, you've got honest menu from 20 to 40Bs. Mains on the menu are more around 50/70Bs. But take the menu and of you're still hungry take a Naan for 5/6Bs and you'll be good ! This restaurant definitely worth the try !

name: Riverside Camping
description: Spots to pitch a tent by the small river. Eventually accessible for vehicles, too. Nicer flat ground 300mts follow the stream upwards. Many firepits so could be quite popular.

name: Alojamiento Barqito
description: Very simple accommodation. 20 Bs Perfect for cyclists.

name: Hostal Oruro
description: Hostel close to the bus terminal, the huge mercado and not to far from the main place. 35Bs per person for a private room and share bathroom. There is a kitchen but we don't know if we can use it. Wifi but not to fast, clean room.

name: Arcabucero hostel inn
description: Stayed at this place for a few nights, paid 180 bobs per night for the 3 of us, pretty nice spot right next to the witch markets, there's secure parking on the parallel street, only thing is the owner who is a old guy is not that friendly and treats you like you are in 2nd grade, He's a bit of a weirdo as well tried to over charge us for a night.

name: Road to Buena Vista to Espejillos waterfalls
description: Beautiful scenery road for 4x4 with at least average clearance. Would recommend only in dry season. Direction waterfalls to Buena Vista there is one tricky part, where 4x4 is mandatory (we guess), the opposite direction is easier. Jungle and hills all around, almost no people. Average speed not higher than 20 km/h. We definitely recommend! We have Mitshubishi Montero 4x4 and we got through easily.

name: riverbank
description: Small Spot directly on the river just next to the road and quiet at night. But maybe just in Winter time.

name: ypfb
description:
Last gas station before Sucre if you're driving from Oruro to Sucre.
They didn't want to sell me anything, they said the electronic system couldn't register foreign plates! They told me to come back to Oruro to fill my tank!!
After hard negociations, they agreed to sell me just one jerrican (at local price!!)   but you have to speak a good spanish to negociate...
It should be better to fill your tank at the maximum at Oruro if you want to go to Sucre by this road!

name: Yunga Forest
description:
2023 lots of fern trees, free entrance, deteriorated trail, very nice atmosphere.

2017: :all giant fern trees are dead, free entrance, abandoned trail, very disapointing visit.

name: Mirador Volcanes Park
description: Unbelievable views, can drive up only if you have very trustworthy 4x4 it’s very steep and muddy, even in “dry season”. Very worth it. Can walk up the road and park at Bermejo Square marked on the map.

name: Near Rock Formations
description: Very nice and scenic area only 2 km away from highway F4 and good for a night or two. We came to this spot from Tomarapi and the Sajama NP, but this road is a very bumpy gravel road and not recommendable. We drove also the northern park entry road and this one is also really bad, so the only "relatively" good gravel road in and out the park is the south-west one at pos. s18.21466 w68.91651.

name: Pravel pit
description: We left the mainroad, drove approx. 700m and stayed overnight good protected  beside a huge gravel hill.

name: near big funerary towers
description: right beside the highway is a small turn off to three big funerary towers. We stayed here overnight with our motorhome.

name: Imperial fuelstation
description: we filled up our diesel fueltank and could stay over night for free.

name: Schugamotors
description:
Unofficial Toyota dealer. I think they are the only ones in Sucre having a "scanner" to check electronic problems on Toyota cars. They cleaned and repaired the oxygen sensor of the engine of my 4runner. They can repair all kinds of electronic problems on Toyota cars, but sometimes (depending on your problem) they need to order specific parts at Toyota La Paz shop, so expect a 48h delay.
Welcoming and professional, correct prices.

name: Barbara's Cochera :)
description:
Small, family run cochera perfect for those arriving from Peru! The mom Barabara is always there and is helped by her two daughters, Ana and Mercedes. They love meeting foreigners and understand Italian! SUPER FRIENDLY!
