Located in El Alto, it is next to a university (so lots of internet and cheap food nearby) and only two blocks from a teleferico station (blue line) making it very easy to access the city center (less than 30 min) without having to drive there! You can come and go anytime between 6am and 10pm.

The base price is 30B for a vehicle. No showers, no laundry onsite (both less than 10 min away, walking)

Ring the bell on the left side of the gray doors, #77 Arzabe Street :) enjoy

name: Base of climbing wall
description:
Wide open, flat parking area for the rock climbing at Carahuara de Carangas. Nice sunset and sheltered from any wind. Only the hardest climbs are not sketchy but it is a pretty little canyon.

Drive through town towards the rocky cliffs at the opposite end. The parking area is against these rocks set about 200m back from the dirt road on your right. There are a lot of 'murals' painted on them. Ask any local- they can tell you exactly where if you have trouble finding it. If there is barbed wire across the way, it is just for the llamas- you can open it.

name: Opoqueri
description: The little tiendas sell gas by the 10 liters. Ask around near the plaza. Good to know if you are passing through here between remote areas.

name: Orinaco
description: Official pump station off the highway here- visible by its red and blue pumps. It is a bit hidden on the left side.

name: CASA JIWASA
description:
Located in the Municipality of Achocalla 30 minutes from the city of the high and the city of La PazAmplios spaces, gardens, parking, shelter, electricity, water, food service, shop. Friendly serviceReservas al teléfono (591) 71921212



Reservas al celular (591)  71921212

name: Riverside Bridge
description: May be possible to stay here, lots of space, close to the road

name: Apart hotel turquesa
description:
Nice hotel with 2 secure parking places. good and very clean rooms, hot water, prices begins at 180 bol p/p.
25 minutes walking to the center

name: Mega Market
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 
On Sundays about 5 blocks in any direction around the cable car blue line Plaza Libertad station there is the biggest market of town. There is sold realy realy all kind of things new or second-hand: clothes, shoes, any kind of car parts, food, grocery, tools, electronic, dried llamas(Av. Tiahuanacu)… CAREFUL THO, THEY ROBBED US HERE

name: deutsches Konsulat
description: the german Konsulat is at - Calle Manuel de Zudanez 52 - this  road is so little, it,s not poss. to find this one on google, maps me, or so. At the outside from the house is a german eagel sign. The GPS position is maybe not 100% correct, but very close.

name: Baguette About It
description: Be aware that this is not a bar or restaurant, just a small snack (only 4-5 chairs) where you’re more supposed to take away your sandwich and (very expensive but very good) craftbeers (Stier is a very good craftbrewery from Cochabamba, there we paid 15Bol for their beers, and here in Baguette they are sold 25Bol... why...?)

name: Residencial Teresita
description:
40 Bolivianos with moto parking. Clean, secure.
.....
40 Bolivianos con parqueo para moto
Limpio, seguro

name: Brazilian Consulate
description:
This is the place to get your Brazilian visa. You must have your visa before arriving at the Brazil border. The hours are from 8am-12pm M-F for applying. Visas are picked at 2pm. The list of steps are as follows:

1. Fill out online form and print out confirmation santacruz.itamaraty.gov.br 

2. Go to Banco do Brasil: Calle Beni, 245 

3. Deposit $160 USD per person (USA Residents)  into bank account # 7042000493

4. Go to the Brazil consulate. Give them bank receipt, printed online form, passport photo, hotel reservation, copy of credit card or bank statement. They close the door at 12pm so if you get there a little bit before hand they will still process the visa application. 

5. Will take 4 business days to process 

6. Return to consulate to pick up visa between 12-2pm. They will give you a receipt and you show the guards at the entrance and they will let you in! 👍🏼

name: Café Vida (vegan)
description:
If you miss real good cake, they have a very small very great but pricy piece of it! We ate carrot cake (19bo) and pink bowl (30bo), what a lovely treat :) For lunch time they offer soup with bread and hummus buffet.
Mon-Fri 10-19 Sat 10-17 walk into the yard

name: Alojamiento illimani
description: Very simple room with window to interior walkway. Share bathroom. Not every room has an electric socket. Tranquil and clean. 40 bo/ double. Shower you only get when asking before check-in, otherweise they tell you it is broken even if other guests use it.

name: Roadside fuel
description: Gas and diesel out of shacks at the side of the road. Bought gasoline for 6/b.

name: Las Islas
description: We got 20 liters without a local DNI. But depends on who you speak with.

name: Gamboa
description: Nice and cheap hotel right by the market. 35/b for a single room. There's wifi and an electric shower. Room in the courtyard for motorcycles.

name: Gas station ("Acachaci")
description: Sold us gasoline  *without* factura at 6Bs/liter. Also have diesel here but don't know how much it costs.

name: Beautiful spot
description: Beautiful, tranquil, and safe spot with views of Huayna Potosi and Condoriri Massif! We asked a lady herding her cows if we could camp here and she said "sure no problem." Road has some potholes but don't think you need 4x4 to get here (others should chime in to confirm). You definitely *do not* need 4x4 to get to the entrance to Laguna Tuni (also pinned on iOverlander) which is just a couple kms before this. We were originally planning on camping at Tuni but there was no one at the puesto de control. We asked a local and they said sometimes it's open and sometimes not. Highly recommended!

name: Tourist Info
description:
The Guias de Montanas shop was closed so we came here to organize a hike to Laguna Glaciar. They usually offer it as a 2-3 day trek but we read that people do it one day, so they accommodated us no problem. We decided to leave our car at Altai Oasis in Sorata because 1) we weren't sure how safe it was to leave it at the trailhead (...it's totally fine) and 2) you *need* a guide to go to Laguna Glaciar. The trail is not clear. (You don't, however, need a guide to hike to Laguna Challata, which is the first lake you pass on the hike to Glaciar and is only ~45min from the trailhead. So you could easily drive up to the trailhead, camp, and do it all on your own.) We rode in a Toyota Corolla taxi up to the trailhead, so 4x4 is not required.

The hike to Laguna Glaciar was ~8 hours total and climbed ~4,000ft (1,200m). It's tough but if you love hiking you'll enjoy it. We paid 250Bs for the guide and 150Bs each way for the taxi, but you could probably negotiate both of those costs. Enjoy!

name: Challata/Glaciar Trailhead
description: Beautiful and peaceful spot up in the mountains with views of Illampu and Ancohuma. 4x4 not required (we came up in a Toyota Corolla taxi). Plenty of level sites to choose from. From here you can hike to Laguna Challata on your own (~45 min one way) but you *need* a guide if you want to go to Laguna Glaciar (~8 hours total). Trail is not clear. Note: We did not camp here because we wanted to go to Glaciar and had our guide with us but he said it's totally fine to camp there. It's tranquil and far away from the town.

name: Near Lago Tuni
description: The gate to the lake was closed so we asked the woman at Ecolodge Tuni (right across the way) where we could camp and she pointed us here. The road to get here is a great, flat dirt road that passes through the altiplano. No 4x4 needed and I'm 99% sure that even big rigs can make it! (Note: We did not camp here but went further down to the right toward the "pesca deportiva" and wild-camped there (also pinned in iOverlander). Really tranquil and beautiful out here. There is also a one-day hike you can do from Laguna Tuni to Laguna Chiarkhota but we didn't have time. Supposed to be beautiful, though - ask around!

name: Laboratories Diesel Reyes
description: family member of Gustavo up the road .Diesel pumps and injectors diagnosis repairs and recalibration Imaculate workshop Not too happy with electronic controlled systems  very busy place

name: Copy Shop
description: We got our Fotocopias for aduanas here, 4 cost 2 Bol.

name: Gasolinera Tiwanaku
description:
*Please see Check-ins. Gasoline may not be available.
.....
They sold me gasoline at normal price with my drum or plastic container 3.75 x liter.
--
Me vendieron gasolina a precio normal con mi bidón o recipiente de plástico 3.75 x litro

name: Camping Tercera Cascada
description: Basic camping, with running water and toilets, you have to climb a track up to the beautiful spots, camping in the parking lot is posible also. 10 Bs per person + 4 Bs entrance for the cascade.

name: Entre rios - plaza - ATM
description: Very nice little town! ATM at Banco Union.

name: Side road
description: a little off the main road, not to be seen, easy access

name: Rio San Julian
description: Just next to the road, but well hidden...only a few locals where here to take a bath in the river.

name: beside the road (covert)
description: just a possibility for an overnight stay, covert with bushes.During the night it was quiet.

name: plaza in sajama
description: really quiet spot to overnight in the  sajama village main place. really cold at night.

name: lavanderia padsal
description:
lavanderia industrial where you can have jour clothes washed. 
8 bolivianos por kg.

name: jannet y fernando
description:
a family (Janet one the  guide of tiwanaku ruins site and fernando from the restaurant el condor ) opens their home to show how the fabric are handly made, to teach you how to do it... they can also teach you how to process cheese, or ceramics and so...
nice people, very welcoming 
a bit insisting but really nice people

name: jannet and fernando
description:
you can also sleep in their background 
really quiet and very good spot to watch the  sky and stars
no facilities

name: Mercado de Abastos de Sur. Vehicle break ins.
description: Please be careful!! there has been a series of vehicles being broken in to at the Mercado parking...We left the car for 3 min, heard the alarm, ran back but it was to late..Lock Broken with screwdriver, tablet,camera equipment gone...police we're great but can't do anything..some of the women know who done it but because of death threats they won't say a word. The Mercado is a great place to shop, we were there 4 times before this happened..everyone is scared now that no one will visit anymore..so give it a try, just be careful...

name: Plaza Principal
description: We arrived here after several days of rain. Didn't want to drive the Jesuit loop in mud. Camped here for the night no problems. The police drove by didn't stop. Lots of motorcycles however. The park is very well lit all night. Okay for a night nelt safe!

name: Hostal Catacora
description:
Dog friendly hostal in La Paz. Nothing to write home about but it will do.
 Little familial hostel, the women is amazing, she is really friendly. There is hot water, (only in the women bathroom). The wifi is good enough for watch a movie in streaming. Private room with share bathroom for 30 Bs per person.

name: River crossing
description: Pretty huge river crossing we didn't want to chance in our midsize SUV so we turned around. Just a guess- but probably 3 ft at it's deepest, 50 ft long (?) You could see the ruts in the water.

name: ES El Torno
description: Only fill up jerrycans at local price. Not possible to get it directly in the tank (whatever the price/tip you're willing to pay).

name: Plaza Ayo Ayo
description: good place to stay overnight. really quiet and the People here are so friendly.

name: Quime
description: Gasolina 3.99 local price no hassling. First time in Bolivia

name: Police checkpoint
description: checkpoint at the police station in town. cable across road

name: Mechanic Rubsor
description: Our Fiat had some small problems, which from the last bad repair in La Paz, like several strange sounds and missing screws. They solved it in 2 days with computer detector and with lots of patience trying. This small and professional team was recommend from Fiat service, but they also know other brands. Better go there on week beginning early morning at 8, cause' they have lots to do and work only the average bolivia speed. The main mechanic speak easy english.

name: Playa Verde
description:
5 bol/litres of diesel in effect we were able to put our diesel here for 5 bol per liter of diesel. we pay in cash and we don't get a receipt
---
5 bol/litros de diesel en efectivo nous avons pu mettre notre diesel ici pour 5bol par litre de diesel. on paye en espèce et on n'a pas de tiqué

name: Organic Shop
description: There is an organic shop at calle Bartolome 1357 from local farmers offering natural yogurt without gelatine and has normal fat, jam with more fruits than sugar, fresh eggs, coffee, vegetables... All things are quite cheap - not or only a little bit more expensive than the standard food you can buy everywhere.

name: Gas station
description: The actually location is in the round about. 100 meters before this place. Filled jerrycans for local price.

name: Internet Store
description: Fast internet, photo copies and printing. Good place to stop on the way to Brazil.

name: Gas and food
description: Lots of little restaurants and stands all selling gas for ~5/b a litre.

name: Great view behind wall
description: Spectacular place on the old road, just 20 m away from the main ripio. Great views, should be quiet.

name: Cut off curve
description: Very nice place with gorgeous views. Quiet at night...may be closed in the future. Best place ever....

name: Market
description:
Sold as the biggest mercado in South America, but I've been all over Central America, Africa, and Asia too, and I've never seen anything approaching the scale of this place! You can spend an entire day walking around continuously and not see half of it. The variety of foodstuffs doesn't compare to what you'll find in Asia, but for Latin America the variety of stuff on offer in every category is staggering.

Beware there a pickpocketers around! They work in groups!

name: Repuesto heaven
description: this Ruta is FULL of repuestos... lights and panels and easier to park than near Formula 1

name: El morro
description: 120 ltrs 5.5 bol / ltr after negotiation for Diesel awaiting the manager to leave for the day

name: Hike to Laguna Chiar Khota
description:
From "Near Laguna Tuni" it's 8.7 km up here. Easy hike if acclimated (only 200 meters of altitude gain). Gorgeous lake in front of Condoriri.
Several options from there.
- To the right up and you enter an other valley which leads you back down or at the col to the left and you head straight to the first mountain.
- Around the lake where you find behind another small one and the obvious track brings you to a glacier in 400 meters. Very easy walk. If continuing the trail around the lagoon it goes up to the Paso Chakoti (5.152 m). Around 4.2 km and 500 meters gain (without walking to the small lake and the glacier). The last bit was very strength-sapping.
- If you turn left at lagoon Chiar Khota you can hike straight up to the col. Maybe a bit more than a km less then.
Up at the Paso one can hike 200 meters of elevation more to reach the summit of Pico Austria. As my heart was racing I skipped it.
Downhill and back was it slightly longer: Until the end of Laguna Juri Khota the track is easy to find, lots of loose gravel and rocks. Afterwards I wasn't able to follow the track. Nothing clear... Opened OSM and realized I had to hike up a hill again. Juri Khota is at 4,700 (and I walked first down into the valley) the col was at almost 4,900. Very hard to go uphill over clumps of grass without track. I found it up there and lost it again later, already in sight of Laguna Tuni. Headed towards the lake and was after almost 28 km back at start.
Magnificent but be aware it will be a long day.

The street to get to Tuni is a toll road. 5 BOL per car, cashed in Chunavi. Valid for round trip.

name: Iveco IMCRUZ
description:
It's a huge garage. They had around 25 cars of any brand there, working on them. Also they worked on trucks, Jac and Iveco (that's what was there) but maybe on other brands as well. The place is clean, they are organized and professional, were very fast, friendly and helpful. We had only minor things and paid nothing for the hour of labor. We took 3 liters of oil and instead of paying 9 US per liter we paid 6. Have spare parts and know where to get others in case they don't have them.
Highly recommended and we assume one can camp inside the garage if needed.
If someone drives a Mercedes or Volvo truck, next door is the place to go.

name: Bash and crash
description: Dog friendly hostel, 90b for private single room, best place that allows dogs that I found

name: Valle de las Animas
description:
We parked here to hike the amazing Valle. The police at the checkpoint (very friendly) pointed us there to park. Basically cross the road and walk left around the rock formations. Maybe after 400 meters will be the first little dry gulch, which leads up the hill. If you miss it look for another, there are several. The one we took continued at its end (walk a bit to the right) on an old gravel road. Hike up and more and more beautiful views over this stunning landscape will appear. Also up there are several trails and one can spend a day hiking through the individual gulches and find rock pinnacles, a bit similar to stuff we have seen in Arizona.
Also great views over La Paz to one side and Illimani to the other.
There must be another way to the Valle de las Animas as well, but through road works we couldn’t drive that direction.

Valle de la Luna was ok, but this was free, we were alone and the landscape was much more fascinating! We loved it and if you are not convinced yet look on YouTube a drone flight over the valley...

In rainy season maybe impossible and for sure dangerous!

name: Hotel Bambi
description:
ADMIN NOTE: User reports "Bed bugs alert! During my almost 4 years RTW trip this hotel is probably the filthiest, dirtiest and most disgusting place I spend a night. And I was terribly attacked by bed bugs. My legs and partly my back has numerous bed bugs bite. Disgusting! Avoid this place like the plague! "

A very simple hotel. Its owner is a much nicer person than the other two hotels there, we did not sleep here but we asked for a shower, and we charged $ 10 per person.
--
Un hotel muy sencillo. Su dueño es una persona mucho mas agradable que las de los otros dos hoteles que hay, no dormimo aca pero le pedimos ducha, y nos cobro $10 por persona.

name: Calle 16
description:
In Zona Rosa are several quiet streets for street parking. We chose Calle 16 because the road is wide (good for trucks) and to one side there are no houses.
Super calm, even on weekends.

name: Near the bridge - wild camp
description:
After a puncture of our tyre, that we have finished to repair after the sunset, we have to spend the night here.  There is a bridge with a bypass and we park just in the middle of this. 
The night was really quite, after 22 hours really rare passage of cars, we hear just one in all the night. A lot of animals around us, some really strange sound of birds.

name: Villa Mar School
description: As you come into town, can't miss the massive shelter on your left. The principal let us sleep inside one of his classrooms, but was also happy if we wanted to pitch our tents in the courtyard. Note: we were on bicycles and he asked us lots of questions about our trip, may not be as open to those in car/vans. The kids will ask you a million questions. Clean baños, power outlets in the rooms, potable water by the statue.

name: Villa Alota school
description:
On bicycles: asked a teacher if we could camp in the grounds, they showed us to an old classroom and were happy for us to stay the night. Baños in the main building, power outlet in the room. Potable water near the greenhouse sheds, but note that as it's taken from the local stream you will find little bits of grass in it. 

One final tip for town: the shops never 'open', you can press the buzzer anytime of day for them to serve you.

name: San Juan School
description: On bicycles. One of the head teachers let us sleep in the school theatre for the night. Lots of friendly kids asking questions and playing soccer. Electrical sockets, baños, potable water outside. Nice and quiet after 7pm, a few of the teachers live in the surrounding buildings.

name: Hugo's Place
description: Quiet, grasy and flat parking. Nice option to the expensive campings! Hugo and him family are friendly people with two dog-guards for your car ;) They have small shop, so it's everytime somebody at home. You can use the water (clean yor car or make the hand landery). Safe place but not close. 30bol/night. 8bol/night for electricity. Colektivo to La Paz- 1.colektivo to Calacoto-3bol, 2.colek.La Paz-centro(San Francisco)-2,60bol. Taxi- centro- 40bol.

name: Lagoon paraiso
description: Entrance of the lagoon paraiso. Not the best place to sleep in the car (we did was ok) because close to the road and not so level. But a very nice lagoon, 2 min walking (5 bob). Here you can take a refreshing swim! Beautiful place!! And you can camp here with a tent also (this is further from the road).

name: Paraiso Tropical
description: Swimming, bathing, hot shower and sauna for 24bs per person. Only locals come here. Bring swim clothes and flippers for your feet. Clean.

name: Mercado 10 de noviembre
description:
Second floor of the market.
Coffee, tea, breakfast with bread and eggs. Open from 7 to 10 am, and from 3 to 8 pm. 
Very local.

name: Lakeside Camping
description: If you continue driving passed the previous "beautiful spot" in iOverlander and go over the hill you will reach two lakes.  We drove around the first lake and talked to the locals at the house between the two lakes. They were very friendly and said we could camp anywhere we liked.  Dogs barked as we approached but were not aggressive.  Beautiful views of the surrounding mountains. 4500 m. Lakes do not appear on Google Maps (used by iOverlander), but do on OSM..

name: Tica Tica School
description: On bicycles. Slept inside the school's dormitory after they were more than happy to have us. Spent the afternoon playing basketball and volleyball with the kids. Baños, mattresses, agua potable. We didn't have electricity in the evening, came back on at around 3am

name: YPFB
description: Sin factura into a jerry at local price. Left tip.

name: Inti Wasi
description:
50/b for dorm bed (very spacious), 70/b for private. Clean. Very hot high volume electric shower. Right next door to a motorbike mechanic.

There's secure parking for motorbikes.

name: El Buen Apetito
description: 10bol per person. Quick service with friendly staff. We had beef and vegetable soup (huge) for a starter and rice, chicken, potato with a bit of salad for the main. Best value for money ever!!!

name: Alojamiento
description:
25/b for a dorm bed. 5/b for a hot shower. Includes secure parking across the street for motorbikes or a car/truck.

The village itself is very tranquil and clean, with plenty of food options in the evening.

name: Millares School
description: On bicycles. Was a Friday and they were shutting up for the weekend, happy for us to set up our tents under the large canopy. Baños, agua potable and plenty of space

name: Alamein el Trompillo
description: alternative to the pilots club armed military guard at the airport entrance served as security overnight great little plaza food court cinema  and Kiky chicken all close    water tap will be here somewhere for the well kept gardens

name: biocentre entrance
description:
flat grassed area on the opposite  side of the road to the biocentre entrance which has no overnight parking anymore
 ...quiet after dark ...except for rhe wildlife... and out of the city

name: RT9 night stop
description: nowhere found on RT9 that was quiet enough. .. pulled off onto dirt road into agricultural/ jungle.. very quiet very safe very dark grassy clearing next to watering hole. wildlife spotting over breakfast

name: Main place San Matías
description: There are several parking lots around the main place. A bit busy during the evening hours. You can get street food and there is also a pizzeria. We had one, it was good, despite the fact that they forgot the tomato sauce :) Friendly and interested people around.

name: San Matías Immigration
description:
Here you get the stamp for your passport. Friendly staff and really quick.
==============================
This is where you go first to get your immigration passport stamp at the new police station, when entering/exiting Bolivia. we got our Travel Permit here, they wanted 100 Bolivar, but we said we had to go to the bank, eventually he told us to go. the permit is only to Santa Cruz.

name: Next to the sporthall
description: Near to the center but far enough to be quiet. No dust because away from the streets. We spent one very quiet friday night while there was a "fiesta" in town on the main square. No facilities. Free.

name: Hostal de Sal
description: Seems to be plenty of salt hotels in San Juan or are we all talking about the same place with poor GPS localisation? Anyway, this one is located 500m north from the necropolis. Alone with my bike I could negotiate 70Bs for a room with a shower + dinner (soup and salchipapa) and breakfast (bread, butter, ham, cheese, café, tea) that I could aggregate with leftovers from group tables. Neutral service, but they agreed to lock my bike for the night and to cook my eggs for me (talking about chicken eggs of course).

name: camping between rocks formation
description: Easy to find a place protected from the wind. Cold at night though. Dry toilet available,

name: Alternative to Quarry
description: Choice of 400 or more Meters from main road on dirt track. Very quiet.

name: Flat beside road-nice view
description: Just a place, easy to enter, 30 m from the road but no Traffic at night. Very nice views around.

name: Another Platform
description: Next to the road, level and quiet at night. Nice view, nothing else.

name: Quiet spot near RN5
description: Quiet, good Access, nice view. Some rubbish but okay for one night. Hidden from traffic on the road.

name: Hidden from road
description: Few hundred meters after peaje to the left, coming from Oruro. Some friendly  farmers pass by.

name: Wild Camp near Gran Poder
description: Right at the entrance to ayo ayo there is a Basketballfield and other stuff for kids surrounded by walls. Coming from Oruro we turned right and found a very small Lake. We camped here relatively hidden. The area looks like it is completly flooded in summertime.

name: Drawback power pole
description:
Great spot over the valley and far enough away from the street. Our truck was maybe seen from it, but smaller cars will not.
Very windy when we arrived but it calmed down entirely after 7pm.
The only disturbing fact is the giant power pole very close by (you hear the sizzling from the wires).

name: Parque Franz Tamayo
description:
Street parking at this very quiet park (day and night) next to a police station.
The area from Av. Juan de la Rosa towards Av. América and then towards the Palacio Portales seems wealthy. Many streets are very wide, almost no parking.  Weight restrictions.
E.g. check out Pasaje Portales. Enormous broad dead-end road next to the Palacio!

Feels very safe and we had no trouble with our truck entering this place.
.....
Robinet sous une plaque dans le parc et en face du vétérinaire.

name: Secure Parking for long-term stay
description: We left our van in this family parking for a few days. Meanwhile we have been hicking near Villamontes. 15 BOB per day. You can surely negociate if you need to...

name: YPFB Atocha
description: The only fuel station between Tupiza and Uyuni. The very nice, but slightly nervous attendant told us he could only sell gasoline to us for the international price of 8BOB, but I told him we'd prefer 5BOB and without any further negotiation he agreed and let us fill our 60l tank directly as well as 2 x 20l bidones.. Happy days!

name: Near Ruta 4
description: Comming from Cochambamba I had to stop for the night. Could not find any dicent spot comming up the hill. Ask local farmer for permishen, so they know who you are and what you are doing there. Absolutly no disturbence at night or in the morning. You could even pitch a tent. Beware of stepping out of the tent/car at night, there are local dogs running around. They could bite. Very cold at night.

name: Transporter parking lot
description: After a very deep and long search here in Vallegrande when have found this comfortable and quite parking lot near the main road. There is a small house on the corner of the parking lot where the family run a welding shop. just ask for a parking and enjoy your stay. you have 10 minutes walk from the center from here. there is drinking water, you can take it from the tap near the shower that is far from the house in the opposite side of the parking lot. we pay 15 Bolivians for two days.

name: Hotel Balneario Itapemi
description: Nice hotel with a small spring water lagoon. Plenty parking space on grass. Littles Cabañas for resting along lagoon. Bbqs use for free. Has a small restaurante. Owner nickname Rasputin very friendly and ready to help. Cost per car 70 bs.

name: Loma Suarez
description: night quiet flat grassy area for free. Small side road down to the lagoon. only a few  motos passing during the day ....very friendly mosquitos

name: La Suisse
description: Very good swiss restaurant. Markus, the swiss owner, is a friendly guy, who has lived 40years in Bolivia. The dinner (from 7p.m. is +/- 20us$, the lunch +/- 10us$... but amazing! In the front of the restaurant is Suissco, also Markus bar- with terasse (good wifi), good german beer produced in Bolivia and disco (from 9p.m.) for people 30+ years.

name: Lavanderia-Self-Servis
description:
Good clean landery, one machine for 10kg, wash 45min-30bol, dry 45min-30bol. 
Can manage without buying a card. 
easy to park.
free wifi!

name: Hostal Cactus
description:
Nice hostal, friendly staff, kitchen, big rooms, WC cleaned every day.
We paid 80bolivianos for a big matrimonial room.
Downside : few rooms have plugs... but you can load your stuff in the common areas or at reception (secured).

name: Plaza Italia
description: Quiete Park in good neighborhood. We stayed 4 nights, becouse we fixed our refrigerator near from here (refri specialist Jose-73136662). We meat lot of neighbors they go for walk with the dogs  here, everybody very nice and interest what we are doing. The first day came two frienly police mans and wandet to see our passports, but thats it. Save place.

name: Lucy
description: Filled straight to tank for 5bol. He started at foreign rate but after negotiation settled at 5.

name: Wild camp in valley
description: Beautifull spot, next to a little river! Open valley between red hills and mountains. Only some lamas came by and some friendly farmers. Very peacefull!! We love it!

name: Lubricants and Filters Raloy
description: All the lubricants and filters that you need. Even sell injectors cleaners and starter spray (I never seen before)if you buy the oil he changes for free. Nain (the guy)is a great guy even he gifts some llama meat

name: Mecanico Automotriz
description: We put some grease and change some parts. very quickly and good guys.

name: Percy Motors
description: Percy Motors a mechanical workshop. fast and very cheaper.

name: Matías Break and Parts
description: they rebuild all the handbrake mechanism. good price and they have Wifi. Matías the owner is very friendly and professional

name: Torotoro Plaza
description:
With nowhere else to park in town, we stayed here for 2 nights. (We also stayed one night in front of the town stadium, near Guiaventura and the Parque headquarters where you pay your park entrance fee). Really nice atmosphere. Next to Cafe Cretacico (when it's open) and even has a water tap for you to fill up with. Plaza has a few dinosaurs around. Really nice and a pleasant place to stay. 
On another note, this is my fav place in Bolivia. We came for the dinosaurs but there is so much more. Caving, canyons, condors to name a few. If you are a nature lover and thinking of giving this place a miss because it's too hard to get to, rethink it. 
Also note, there are no atm's or banking facilities here and no gasoline/diesel stations either. Bring a full tank and plenty of cash. 100bs entrance per person for the National Park - kids under 12 free. To hire a guide is 100bs total therefore you can split this cost with a group. If you don't want a guide, ask the park ranger where you can go without one. Not many places though. Would highly recommend the services of a guide. We had a fabulous 2 days and I am so glad we came here. Oh, and the footprints were just icing on the cake! I'm not normally a dinosaur fan however seeing 78 million year old velociraptor footprints is super-cool!!

name: BCS (Bolivian Car Service)
description:
Fantastic mechanic located 2 doors down from Comber Auto Parts. You can't miss the big, red doors.. drive up the driveway and to the right at the top. Patricio and his team provided a fast, honest service at good prices. They serviced our brakes, balanced our wheels, and installed a new fan clutch (we purchased this part ourselves at Comber) for 190BOB.

Address: 
Calle Chayanta 753 
(Zona San Roque)
Ph: 6228977 / 69630690

Hours:
Mon - Fri: 09:00-12:30, 14:00-18:00
Sat: 09:00-15:00

name: Hostal Elida
description: Large parking area that should accommodate most vehicles (although the streets are narrow here), very cheap at 50-70b for a couple in a room with private bath and TV, certainly not fancy. WiFi is slow, good location near the main plaza. Super hot showers.

name: Casablanca - very friendly!
description:
A very nice hostel,  4 blocks away from the main square, run by very friendly and easygoing volunteers, with a beautiful court with trees, colourful paintings on the walls and a kind of common living room. Kichen can be used, good breakfast with fresh fruits, cereals, toast and eggs included. Single room with matrimonial and private bathroom (190BOL), double room (160BOL for 2 persons), dorm (75BOL), good Wifi, really hot showers, everything is very clean and unusually maintained.
No parking, but there is a garage near the hostel.
They also arrange tours in and around Tarija for you.

Highly recommended!!

name: Puente Arce shelter
description: On bicycles. Similar to the school canopies, there is a basketball sized shelter here. The owners of the shop on the main road said it was fine to camp. They had potable water. No banos or showers. A crazy lady nearby spends the day chasing her chickens away. Lots of animals (pigs, goats, dogs, cats, chickens, etc.) running about, all friendly.

name: Vacas Alojamiento
description: Speak to the guys at the government building at the top of the square. 20pppn, nice beds, baños, that's about it. The electrical sockets had smoke marks above them so we weren't game. Overall the place was well kept and clean, just very basic

name: Parking lot behind tienda.
description:
After leaving Alberto and Felicidads place (long story, entry added) we drove around aimlessly wondering where to park. We stopped on the side of the road and asked a taxi driver if there was any parking area which did not have restrictions for height. Most parking lots have a very small entrance gate. He took us around to this one. You wouldn't know it's here. Ask the ladies at the tienda out front if you can park in the back. We told them we would like to stay two or three days and they are charging us 15bs per day. They have 2 very friendly German Sheppards and a third puppy. Walking distance to town and convenient. It's a super nice family and although we asked for no services except water, they may have a shower. Highly recommend. We are 7m long, 3.2m high and 2.5m wide. Length and height no problem but we just fit through the gate at 2.5m
No wifi but went to Maya Internet near square. 1bs for 30mins.

name: YPFB
description:
5bol/L sin factura in the tank (depending on the attendant).

Only gasolina! They don't sell diesel.

name: Lavandería Lava Todo
description:
Great laundry service.. 12 BOL / kilo.
We dropped off in the afternoon and it was ready by midday the next day. If you get there earlier you'll probably get it back same day. 
Easy walking distance if you're staying at Alberto's and Felicidad's Camping.

Address: Junín 121

Hours:
Mon-Fri: 08:30-12:30, 15:00-19:00
Sat: 08:30-12:30, 15:00-16:30

name: Bus to Tarabuco
description: Minivans depart from here for Tarabuco.. 10bols pp.. Each van seats approx 15 passengers. Once the van is full, it departs. It takes around 1.5 hours

name: Natural Water Source
description: Clear and cold water flowing out of a mountain from Natural Water Source

name: First Hill of Laguna Road
description: Nice flat place next to (bad) road. Not hidden, but no traffic. Nice surround view. Nothing else.

name: Pampas tour
description:
This spot is great. We organized boat rental through Ivar who was really lovely, a great boat driver and a great animal guide. $150 BOB per hour. Saw everything. 

Able to park safely here where there are toilets / showers etc. We didn't try but imagine it would be super easy to / free to and a nice place to camp! Tables, shelter, quiet, by the river and with running water!

name: outside  Conquistas
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Users report: They are building a new road from after sena to Cobija so there are a lot of detours due to the construction. The new road and all the detours do not take you to Conquistas and this does not show up on google maps or OSM yet. I ride bicycle and was quite surprised when I reached Batraja and was lacking Conquistas and 16 kilometers of riding. Then the locals explained that the road doesn't go to Conquistas anymore. So if you are heading either to Cobija or to Sena beware that you may skip Conquistas and this camping spot due to the detours and the new road."

flat area off the road to Cobija.  very quiet no traffic and police patrol stopped by in the evening ...option 2  is next to Policia post in Conquistas with interested locals

name: federal policia
description:
when you exit Bolivia before the river bridge  finalise all the exit paperwork for you and the vehicle ...  the entry into Brazil paperwork for the vehicle is completed after the bridge in the new building on the right...  " map location"  this is the location for the entry paperwork into Brazi for your paspport
very confusing and not the norm at boarders  helpfull staff and they speak English  ..I was also able to park here for the night noisey busy but safe

name: Villa Bella
description: Nice hotel only a few kilometres past the end of Camino de muerto. Asked if I could camp and she said 50b but got her down to 30b. Hot showers and bathroom available aswell as a restaurant. Not sure how much the rooms cost. Good location in the jungle next to the river which is accessible from the hotel. There is also a nice swimming pool

name: San Miguel school
description: On bicycles. Stayed at the school on our way north. Was the weekend no facilities but open courtyards and basketball court to drop a tent

name: Punacachi valley
description: Near the turnoff to Punacachi there is a single residence (3 houses with a courtyard in between). They were happy for us two cyclists to put up our tent as there is nothing else around. Flat grass was all we really needed. Can get potable water from the river below

name: Tiquirpaya school
description: On bicycles. Rocked up after a long day climbing, director was more than happy for us to sleep in a classroom. Baños and agua potable. Also, you'll get a great audience in the evening as you cook and set up your bed with 5+ viewers looking in from the windows

name: Samaipata
description: It's prohibited to stay on the parking lot at the fuerte. So we found this place a few km before the gate. Very quiet, flat area. Free, no facilities.

name: Entrance to Hellechos Gigantes
description: Beginning of the track to the Hellechos Gigantes (giant fern). We asked if we could stay, no problem. Very quiet, need 4x4 to get here. If rainy, might be very difficult to get here. Free.

name: Mirador
description: After 1h30 of a nice walk, you get to this very beautiful viewpoint. Fern trees and orchydees on the way. 15 Bs/pps to enter the park. Better to come in the summer when the trees are green. It was a bit dry when we were here but nice anyway ! Normally, you have to hire a guide.

name: Road from ToroToro to Sucre
description: Nice flat area near the road, beautiful view (we even see Sucre from here). No facilities. A little bit grassy. Very quiet. After a long road, it was all what we needed.

name: 10km before Charaña
description:
Nice view, about 500m from the road, nice view. Shelter of the herdsman. Water hole on the other size of the track.
When we were here, the herdsman and the alpacas were not there.

name: Parrillada Valle Grande
description: Good place for meat lovers, but they also have a salad buffet.

name: Sol Chaqueño
description: Good value for money. The room I had was quite large with a pleasant atmosphere, enough light, a perfectly working A/C and good wifi. Single 90 Bol., with A/C 140, Double 130 with A/C 150. Safe parking inside the complex, for small and medium size vehicles, max. hight about 3 meters. Only one block from the main plaza. No breakfast.

name: Hotel Padilla
description: Basic Hotel, I paid 50 Bol. for a singel with shared bathroom. Hot water, no breakfast. For another 10 Bol. I could park inside. There´s room for 3 cars. But it took some effort to persuade her. She´s kind of difficult. For plugging in electricity she charged another 10 Bol. Only for normal size cars, max. hight 2.50 meters.

name: Hostal Tarabuco
description:
The Hotel is two blocks away from here, but at this shop at the corner of the plaza I saw the sign "alojamiento" and here you´ll find the owner, a lady, who checks you in. I was charged 30 Bol. as a single with shared bathroom with hot shower, no breakfast, no restaurant. This is true bolivian style, heavy, stiff blankets, bad matress. There´s safe parking available two blocks away (to the other direction), in some kind of christian organisation complex. They charged me 5 Bol. per night for parking, I could plug in my fridge. Only for small and maybe medium size vehicles, max. hight about 2.70 meters.
The Hotel Lady said, safe parking is not really necessary, it´s safe in Tarabuco.

name: Alojamiento San Pedro
description: 6 twin rooms available on the 2nd floor around a small courtyard. Quite sheltered from highway for noise. Shared bathroom on ground floor with shower. Basic but decent for 20 Bol per person.

name: Truck wash
description:
80 BOL for a good truck wash with high pressure. Took 45 minutes in total. 
50 BOL for van.

name: Snack Uyuni
description: Really friendly owner and good local food. Asado beef or chicken, friend chicken or broaster chicken with salad, chips and rice to your liking. Some of the better fries we've had. All served with a smile. $13 BOB for full chicken meal or $15BOB for beef. Definitely recommend. One of the better local restaurants we've been to and superior price than alternatives in Uyuni. Open for dinner.

name: Free Parking
description:
The parking next to the park "La gesta del Oriente Boliviano" is very quiet at night; a bit noisy by the traffic of a street, but more quiet after midnight. The next day it was full of cars, but all was very well.
--
Es un estacionamiento al lado del parque "la gesta del Oriente Boliviano" es muy tranquilo por las noches, un poco ruidoso por el transito de una calle, pero mas tranquilo por la media noche. Al dia siguiente estaba lleno de autos, pero todo muy bien.

name: El Cidral NH Tourist Attraction
description:
Rural Establishment, producer of sugar cane, milk and cheese. Has a very old house to see objects of the time and show how the cheese is made, when the tour is booked, they serve typical food and seasonal juice. It has serpentarium, turtles and a yacaré. There is possibility of camping, bathroom with hot shower. Ideal to spend the day.
--
Establecimiento Rural, productor de Caña de azucar, Leche y Queso, posée una casona muy antigua, para ver objetos de la epoca y muestran como se hacia el queso, cuando se contrata el tour, sirven comida tipica y jugo de temporada. Tiene serpentario, tortugas y un Yacaré. Hay posibilidad de acampar, baño con ducha caliente. Ideal para pasar el día.

name: Loma Colorada Hotel
description:
We stopped by to use the pool, 20 BOL pp. There is a cold outdoor shower we were able to wash up at as well. Also had a poolside beer. Great place to relax after hiking back from the waterfalls.
The owner told us she has a space for parking/camping for 50 bols, but seemed like it was negociable.  Didn't see the bathroom or showers.

name: Cotoca Plaza
description:
Here at the Plaza in Cotoca you can see sloths in the trees. So cute.
Beautiful church on the plaza.
Heaps of places for scrumptious local food.

name: Mini-coal Mine Camp
description: Great spot beside a side road just a few hundred meters off the main road.  Gorgeous view of the lake, peninsulas and Isla del Sol.  A bit windy in the evening.  There are the remains of a small coal mine here. We had one car pass in the evening and two people walk by in the morning. No problems.

name: costanera Bermejo
description: near to the river, some tables, place to do fire, healthy machines, a lot of sunflies

name: Between Sucre and Torotoro
description: Nice flat spot very Quiet with a nice view over the valley.  We did not meet any cars. late in the evening we saw a lorry passing by. The road untill now was not so bad, but 4x4 is needed with low gear. You shall not take this road during of after the rain

name: Carasi
description: We stayed in the village on the plaza. Friendly locals. Little shop for bread drinks and some vegetables. Free parking. For a tent you can stay near the cemetry

name: Condoriri
description: Flat area on a football field in the middle of the altiplano. Away from the road. Very quiet. No facilities at all.

name: Villa Pucara
description: On bicycles. We arrived in town exhausted after riding up from Indepencia. Asked at the school if we could pitch our tents and the director gave us a room in their house. Potable water in the school, along with banos

name: Yacupampa school
description: On bicycles. Asked at the school for somewhere to put tents and they led us to a classroom under construction. Baños, agua potable, and a very friendly town. Two little tiendas that have some fruits and plenty of dry food.

name: Sita school
description: On bicycles. The school director was happy for us to set up our tent under the big blue shed (note that the school is actually further up the hill, see Maps.me). One small tienda in town, baños and water in school.

name: Cheka school
description: On bicycles. Camped under the large blue canopy. School is up a small path, the house of the left has a teacher who gave us the okay. Baños. Agua potable. Big rigs won't get up the path but plenty of space on the soccer field also

name: Irupana 5 de Mayo school
description: On bicycles. Asked the caretaker (everyone else ignored us) if we could set up tents. No issues, ended up in a classroom that was being built. Baños, agua potable. As it was Sunday we had to ask to be let in and out of the locked gates, and leave at 630 as students arrive at 7.

name: Coripata shelter
description: On bicycles. There's a large shelter typical of all schools in Bolivia, near the centre of town. Multiple locals said it was a public area and fine to camp. Has a basketball court and space around the outside. Baños we're closed when we were here

name: Top of Death Road
description: Small town at the top of Death Road. Plenty of grassy spaces to drop a tent or park for the night, the locals seem really friendly. We slept to a new hotel being built to block the wind, the worker was nice. Can be quite exposed to the wind but no trouble finding cover. A small tienda services the area/tourists with very basic products

name: atm & photocopy
description: bank and place to make copies of passport and car registration (needed for the customs) in front one of an other in the main commercial street

name: comercial lutino
description:
bolts  perno y mas if you loose some motor parts this is the place for new bolts
EDIT: Also possible to change oil and oil filter. They also have spare parts.

name: Wild camp at the laguna
description: Big flat area where you can park. No one bothered us. Nice view over the lake.

name: Wildcamp at Llavini
description: Big flat parking, also for big rigs. A bit road noise but we felt us safe. Good option to preserve height problems coming from Cochabamba.

name: Rock protected camping
description: Nice spot protected by rocks on 3 sides. Didn't have any problem with the wind for the first time.still cold at 4600m. No facilities

name: Parking lot to hike to Laguna Chiar Khota
description: 20 bob per person to enter the community. Decent dirt road to this parking lot. Short hike to two beautiful lakes with great views of Condoruri and other peaks. You can also hike to the summit of Pico Austria from here.

name: Río rico
description: Beautiful Place close but hidden from the Road and next to a beautiful river. There are possibilities to swim and to make a fire, also you can hike along the stream. Easy acces for all rigs, in the day there were locals coming by to wash their clothes. We spent two nights here watching the stars in the night and swimming in the day.  Down at the river there is space for one to two smaller cars, a little more up a big flat space. If you come from Tarija turn left just before the bridge 50 km after Camargo.

name: Pollo al spiedo
description: A small take away shop with basic supplies. Friendly people. They accepted me to pay in chilean pesos and change what's left to bolivianos. Very appreciated as it seems there's no atm from San Pedro until here. I changed 30000 clp.

name: BeiCruz Tires
description:
Very nice tire service. Selling new tires for low price from major brands. 
Half the price than in Brazil

name: Puerto Suarez
description: Parking lot along the lake. No facilities, quiet, free.

name: Awesome rock formations
description: We didn’t camp here, but there were super cool rock formations and canyon to explore. It would be a really scenic place to wild camp or to hike. There are Aymara funerary towers nearby too.

name: Paradise!
description:
FREE. Cyclists and hikers only, no vehicular access. Well off the beaten track.
On dry land at edge of pan. Lots of birdlife. Sulphurous springs draining into vlei. 
Water just about acceptable if well boiled but since it's unlikely you'll stay here for just one night, bring plenty of fresh water. 

Maybe my favourite spot in Bolivia!

name: Riverbed
description: FREE. Cyclists and hikers only, no vehicular access. In the riverbed at foot of low cliffs. Hidden from road, good shelter from the N, S and E winds.

name: Nazarenzito
description: FREE. Tiny village but with sports ground for big rigs or multiple options for others. Shelter from wind is a problem except for hikers and cyclists who can access a small abandoned building (no roof) on south bank. Restaurants are small eat-what-they-give-you type and close at 5 p.m. As do the baños and access to clean water.

name: hotel Bolivia Oruro
description: basic hotel with parking for motor. one person 110 Bolivia with individual bathroom. hot shower  breakfast 5 bol extra for an egg. not a very good place.

name: Gas Station Iriarte SRL - Santa Rosa
description: Filled our tank at local rate, no questions asked

name: Gas Station Netanel - Sapecho
description: Very nice old couple wouldn't let us tank due to cameras, but told us to park off to the side out of the camera view and filled our bidones. We filled our tank from our already full bidones right there on site, and refilled them again before we left.. 70L gasolina at local rate :)

name: Huatajata school
description: On bicycles. Asked the gatekeeper if we could stay for the night, no issues. Slept in a classroom, out of the weather. Baños, non-potable water, no electricity. Very friendly guy, not so friendly perros.

name: Hostal Olas del Titicaca
description: Nicely upkept hostel in the middle of town. 30bob pppn for the dorms (4 single beds in a room), but had the place to ourselves. Multiple kitchens. Baños is clean. Overall hotel is really nice. Stored our bicycles for us. Close walk to everything. Wifi dropped out a fair bit, but worked well when on

name: Hostel Mirador de Inca
description: Nice place, 45bob pppn for a private. Cheaper than the other hostels with a view. Looks east over the lake, great spot for a cerveza. Beds were comfy and warm, clean baños but didn't use the showers or wifi

name: No Passage To North And To South
description: The two towns on the island are currently in dispute and you cannot walk to the north from the south. Most of the paths are cut off by rocks and the main path has a group of men who tell you (kindly) that you cannot go north.

name: ES QV2 Gas Station
description: They sell at tourist rate only. 8.68bobs, but all very quick and friendly.

name: Hostal Brisas del Titicaca
description: Great budget option in perfect location. We paid 120bol for 2 people with matrimonial bed and excellent view out over the lake. Private bathroom with hot electric shower. They have a secure parking area that should take most vehicles, height limitation but it was over 3 meters. WiFi was ok.

name: Hilltop
description: 800m from the road, multiple options. Very quiet at night but can be windy. Nice view over the altiplano.

name: Pro-Fix Mecánica - Chaperia
description:
We came here looking for Juan, a mechanic who was recommended by the owner of Anticafe, however Rolando was here, not Juan.. and we think it was meant to be!

Rolando and his team helped us to diagnose and fix a problem with the engine overheating in our Nissan Pathfinder. We had thought it was the thermostat, but knew it could also be due to dust from the roads in Beni and/or the steep inclines at altitude. Rather than leading us into a repair we didn't need, he worked with us to pinpoint the issue and repair it. The service was honest, efficient and well priced. We asked him to change our oil and oil filter while we were there as we were nearly due for this, and he cleaned both our air filter and fuel filter as well, at no extra cost. While we were there, we also took advantage of the chaperia service and had our rear bumper repaired - an old injury from the previous owner.

Rolando has lived in the UK and completed mechanical training in both the UK and North America.. He is a motor enthusiast who loves car racing and also restoring bikes and go-carts.. He is such a nice guy and he prides himself in providing a fair and honest service. What a great find, definitely recommended!


cotacota calle 3, entre alvares Plata y retamas callejon al medio nro 30
Tel: 77266683
Email: profix657@gmail.com

name: AVEX 4x4
description:
many parts avalaible here and accessories of good value including ARB and Engel
friendly and helpful staff, speaking good English
servicing and mechanics also possible

name: No name. Panel beater, Benito
description:
A panel beater (chapista) who was introduced to me by the hostel's owner where i stayed. His place has no name. It's the house with the blue/green gate. Ask for Benito.

He fixed my front shock absorber, the engine splash shield and a hole in the back. It looks new after painting. He can work on metal and some plastic part. Fast and clean job, just one day. Also a friendly guy.

name: Salar de Uyuni
description:
YOU NEED GOOD SUNGLASSES TO GO INTO THE SALAR. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO CYCLE INTO THE SALAR WITHOUT REAL UV PROTECTION... CHEAP GLASSES DON'T WORK. I WENT BLIND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SALAR AND HAD TO BE HELPED OUT BY ANOTHER CYCLIST. I LOST MY SIGHT FOR TWO DAYS AND REQUIRED A WEEK TO RECOVER.

FROM ADMIN:
Please don't add any more wild camping spots on the Salar unless there is something fantastically spectacular about your chosen 20 square meters of salt selected at random from the other 10,582 square km of identical salt. you are only permitted to stay in designated camping areas on the Salar

Dry season from April to October and the rainy season from November to March - dangerous road conditions in the rainy season. Vehicles have been known to break through The Salt and get stuck for days on end. USE CAUTION. 

After the salt lake you will probably wash your car. Be careful with the extremely powerful high-pressure cleaners. A car wash destroyed both of our wheel bearings because the grease was flushed out. We then had to go to Fiat and wait over a week because the parts weren't available here, which resulted in damage of over 600 euros.

name: USD ATM withdrawal at Mercantil Santa Cruz Bank
description: You can withdrawal US Dollars at the ATM of this bank branch. Recommended if you’re traveling to Argentina next as the ATM fees there are very high and amounts you can withdrawal are very small.

name: Visit comunidad with Waldemar
description:
After our official jungle tour, we went with our guide Waldemar to visit his comunidad where his family is living. Waldemar is a great tour guide, he introduced us to everybody from his family and we stayed with them for 2 days, chopping wood, collecting fruits, cooking meals (the fresh fish the dad caught over night), swimming and visiting the surroundings. It was very impressing for us to see this side of the jungle after the very good, but more touristy jungle tour we did before.

Waldemar is also working on a more extensive tourist program where you stay 2 days in the community and then go trekking through the jungle for 3 days. If you want to see the jungle definitely off the tourist trail, contact him: eljungleman@hotmail.com. They don't have yet an office in Rurre, so the pin is not the actual location. 

He is working as official guide for some tourist agencies, so he often is out in the jungle and it might me a good idea to contact him in advance. We paid 400 BOL pP for 2 days/ 1 night incl boat transfer, all meals and guided walks in the surrounding.

name: route to from Peru
description:
road between Migration points Rocky rough road and very slow going but great road through ancient terraces 4x4 /BF Goodridges not needed  but rough in the wet 
....good fun

name: red line cablecar
description: this is the cablecar station to the centre from El Alto if you are staying in the airport parking area ....50 mins away

name: Toyota
description: Official Toyota Dealer & Workshop. Close to the airport (sleep at the secured parking), easy to find (sign reads TOYOSA, Toyota & Hino ).  Made a very professional impression. Plenty of Landcruisers in and around the workshop. Changed our break oil and rear break lining of our HZJ75. did a good job for a decent price. We also needed a new lock and one of the mechanics was kind enough to go downtown en get it from their other location.

name: Residencial Rosario Turija
description:
Cheapest private rooms, ie not dorms I found in Tarija. 60Bs for single. Very clean, very friendly. 24hr hot(ish) showers. 
Quiet location. 
No off street parking - except for bicycles :-)
Owners have pets on premises.

name: Gas station
description: After filling our tank, we asked if we could stay for the night. the gas station is open all night long, but it was surprisingly quiet. they have a basic bathroom, nothing fancy but ok for one night

name: Álvaro gas en Sucre
description: They helped us to get an American gas bottle filled.

name: next to road
description: We camped here, at the blockade from the side from Potosí, because the way (the access from Uyuni) to the other spots were blocked with a rope.

name: Hostel Kontiki & travel agency
description: Very friendly and nice people here. Rooms are very new and clean. Wifi is good!! They have single, double, triples, cuádruples and matrimoniales. Got double room by myself for B/30. If you stay at fourth floor, you got nice lake view! They don't have parking but there is garage near by, B/15 per day. They speak English and Spanish. Also run tour agency, willing to give you all the information you need!!!

name: Hotel Joya Andina
description: Quite nice Hotel with pleasant and clean rooms. I paid 100 Bol. as a single with shared bathroom. Simple Breadfast included. Safe parking for 20 Bol. extra. Fits all sizes of vehicles. Good location near the center. Good wifi. No Restaurant, no kitchen.

name: Aloj. Las Reyes Magos
description:
There´s a little shop on the inside. An older man is running it. I bought Diesel to fill up my jerry cans for 7 Bol. per Liter. His depot is 2 blocks away. There´s no pump to fill up the tank direktly.

And he has gasoline too.

name: Hostal Licancabur
description:
240BS for a matrimonial. 70BS for bed in dormitory. Not one shower works, hardly any time with running water in general.
Super cold, most of the time minus degrees inside the bedrooms.
WiFi 10BS for 10min.
Dinner 40BS

name: Viewpoint
description: Great view on the city, the surroundings and the Monument of the Virgen Candelaria. It´s possible to drive all the way up. A bit narrow for big rigs maybe.

name: Supermarket
description: IC Norte Supermarkt. Big Shop with a good selection to increase your stocks.

name: Calle Infocal
description:
Calle frente al Instituto Infocal. Hablamos con el guardia del instituto simplemente para que éñ no ae asuste. Dormimos aqui 3 noches muy tranquilos y seguros. Puedes pedirle algo de agua potable para beber.
---
Street in front of the Infocal Institute. We speak with the guard of the institute simply so that he does not frighten. We sleep here 3 nights very quiet and safe. You can ask for some drinking water to drink.

name: Est San Javier
description:
It can be charged to the tank if problems at local price.


Se puede cargar al tanque  si  problemas a precio local.

name: Plaza Bermejo
description: We stayed here for one night.  not a quiet place. street very loud.

name: Edgar and Ramiro Sanchez
description: These two brothers have been recommended by a local Volkswagen parts dealer and we were so happy to finally find a trustworthy mechanic around La Paz. They work on all types of cars but are experts in (old) Volkswagen. There might not be space in there workshop for big rigs but the whole neighborhood seems to be super quiet and safe and they would definitely have no problem with working on your camper on the street. It's a blue rusty gate without any sign. Next to it there is a sign that says " bordados" and you will probably see their cars in front of the gate, a beetle and a VW Bus, both white and well maintained.

name: Village
description: We stay for the night on a little place near children game. We ask if it was safe. Very quiet. Potable water

name: Emilio Lopez's House
description:
A user reported on 2019-09-15:Emilio arrived completely drunk and started to beat his wife. She cried out for help because he was strangling her, so I went out of my motorhome and then he released her. A little later the neighbors arrived as well. To cut a long story short, not recommend at all! 
(Please, next time, just leave a check-in instead of filing a report.)
---
Emilio hosted us very nicefully ! Big RVs can enter easily. No height limit. Closed area very peacefull and secured. Water, shower and toilets available. No internet. 
Moreover  Emilio organises tours to visit all the south national park and many other things around. He is very friendly and can do private tour if you want for cheap. 
In addition if you need, while your RV is secured at his home and you're on a tour, his wife can do all your laundry for cheap ! 
His adress is avenue Potoci (sona sud) between calle 25 and calle 27. He should have writen his name on his gate. If your closed to his hoise ask for Emilio Lopez ! 
His has whatsapp : 74234481

name: Sindicato Agrario Pantoja
description: off-long construction sites we found this camping spot. he is a quiet, the Street and the dust are far enough away. there are water and toilets.

name: Wild camping close to Quetena Chica
description: Nice overnight place, perfect for big trucks, away from road

name: abandoned village
description:
definitely possible to find a good place to pitch a tent out of wind. pretty area too.

no water, free.

met someone who grew up there, people with cattle used to live here.

tracks between pisiga Sucre and coipasa,  passing the military camp, in relatively good condition  (we were cycling and had to push only a few times). some corrugation but not too bad.

heading to pisiga sucre,  we found the track really pretty across the green  bushes looking at the big mountains. 

we navigated with maps.me which was fine

name: Centro de salud
description:
on bicycles. staff of Centro de salud let us sleep inside where they store some supplies. no questions asked. there's one mattress, we used our camping gear. we were pretty happy to be out of the fierce wind. warmer inside too. cooked inside on our stove. 

The nurses sleep next door and have to pass through this room to get to theirs. 

were able to charge stuff.

May have shower, didn't ask. toilet closeby with curtain as door

water a bit salty in coipasa!  better to bring your drinking water from pisiga/ sabaya/ tres cruses/...

name: Ford Island
description: Sweet little island that feels more secluded than some of the other islands around here. Small enough to give you the middle of the Salar feel, but big enough to shield the wind and give you a place to poop. Named after me, Ford. My island. Me gusta.

name: North from Arbol de Piedra
description:
A few hundreds meters north from the arbol de piedra, for being more quiet : no 4x4 here ! Almost hidden from wind thanks to the rocks. Early in the morning, we heard the jeep going to the arbol. We would have been disturbed if we would have slept just near the arbol !
Nice to sleep in the desert.

name: Municipalidad de Huatajata
description:
Update June 2022: Water tap in front of the blue and white building.

In front of the municipalidad is a water tap with potable water. we asked whether we can fill our camper tank. the taste of the water is much better than in la plaz. free.

name: VW mechanic
description: vw mechanic, good price 900 bol to take out engine fix fuel tank etc.

name: mechanics along main road
description: Arrived at this place after being towed off the Che road (not a place you want to break down in!!) . Luis the mechanic fixed a blockage in our carburetor. Friendly and trustworthy,  charged 50bob.

name: santa barbara
description:
very friendly owner. payed 5bol/l. for gas-oil - locales pay 3.75. we gave a big tip. now he hopes to see more foreigners!

Update 05/24: Wouldn't top up without the pin, even without factura

name: museum pata patani
description: the road from juan jose perez to here is ripio and slow driving. however you pass really lovely landscapes, lots of birds incl. flamingos. here in the museeum you can see a very good preserved complete mummy found in 2002,  ceramics and more. we were welcomed very friendly. they played for us traditional music, danced with us, children singing together for us. we gave all of them (more than 30 people of the 160 inhabitants in this village ) a tour in our sprinter camper. we were allowed to stay here over night. it was very quiet. we were nit askes tp pay an thing, but we heard about 20 bols pp.

name: chullpas & ruins de kala uta
description: here are rectangular chullpas and other ruins. no one was there. we enjoyed the walk from the village "que waya", but you can go there by car aswell.

name: museo de pariti
description:
very interesting museum. a must see!
entrada 15 bols pp extranjero. its open all the time.  worth going!!

name: Potosi
description:
Nous avons stationné dans la cour du garage une nuit avec deux autres CC
tranquille et sur. Gratuit.
753 calle Chayanta

name: Place of village Qiwaya
description:
We spend 2 nights on this grassy place with view on the lake. During the day we visit differrent islands with the guide Oscar  : 200 Bol for the day for the guide, his small sailing boat, and local meal with egg and dry potatoes. (from 8 am until 3 pm). Very nice trip on the lake without noise. Oscar lives near the place. Ask for him here. His phone nomber  : 71279345. 
Pit toilet and water.
People very friendly

name: Don Pastor y Osmar VW air-cooled specialists
description: VW kombi mechanics, father and son. Much experience and fair price. Expect to seek out some of your own parts! Spanish skills a must! Fixed our transmission and changed starter for 1000 bolivianos in 6 days

name: Internet café Hawai
description: Very fast Internet for 4 bols/ hour. Good service.

name: Hostal Thiago
description: Basic Hostal with safe parking inside. Max. hight about 2.80m. I paid 40 Bol. for a bed and 10 for parking. The bed was good, but there was no hot shower available at the moment. The toilet was rather dirty. No meals available.

name: Hostal Vallegrande
description: paid 50 bob for single room. clean place but old matteres.

name: Balneario Tarapaya
description: On the parking lot of the balneario. quiet and safe. Entrance of the Balneario 4B. WC and very hot shower inside. Entrance 4bol pp

name: Museo Del Tesoro
description:
Very nice museum about minerals and jewelry. And the history of mining in Bolivia.

Opening hours:
MO - FR 09:00-12:30 and 15:00-18:30
SA 09:00-12:30

name: Hospedaje Hispano
description: Neat and clean. Spacious rooms. Electric shower. Average wifi. Large secure open car parking area. 100Bol for double room with private bathroom.

name: Electrician Samuel
description: Small workshop but a very honest and capable electrician. We visited two others before him and all they did was connect the car on scanner. Samuel actually listened to us, thought about the possible causes, diagnosed the issue within minutes. He resolved our starter problem (Toyota 4Runner) and charged a very bolivian rate so we gave him a good tip. He said he also speaks some English. Address Av. Cabildo 2458, mobile number 70390205.

name: VW Mecánico Edgar Montaño
description: Great VW specialist for kombis. Corner of Potosí and Lira. VW emblem in window in front of shop. Fixed a broken joint for us, took me to the store for the spare parts

name: Restaurante Turkiri
description:
A new restaurant eco-hotel (October 2017) with a really friendly owner, Alberto.
Excelent almuerzo for 15 BOL.
He let people in bicycle touring to sleep inside the restaurant for free. 
Bathroom & water. 
Recomended :)

name: RED/ORANGE SKYWAY PARKING
description:
10 bol per day I arrived 730am and left at 1500. Ticket on entry secure parking heaven in the heart of LaPaz no height restrictions and access to both sky rail lines atm . toilets. free wifi. 
it is possible overnight here but I was quoted 50 bol which would be open to negotiations

name: Joy Ride Café
description: Very nice restaurant and bar, delicious local and international food, nice manager, ask for Rene! Cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, reasonably priced. Close to the central square in Sucre.

name: Convento de San Felipe Neri
description: Small church, worth a visit : beside the interior of the church, you can climb up the roof and have a nice view of the city ! Admission 17 bs for adults, 17 bs for kids.

name: Mirador del Crater del Volcan Tunupa
description: Supreme view on the crater of the Tunupa volcano and on the rainbow mountain! Access via the village of Coqueza, take the dirt road on your right after the info point in the centre of the village. You can drive up the mountain to a small parking  lot. It's 1 hour walk to the mirador from the parking lot. Another hour walk will bring you to a second mirador from this point. Admission 30 bs pp. Worth a visit.

name: Punta Arce - toll
description:
Rope across the road, small building at the side of the road. 10B.


This is the wrong location. Got charged 5 BOB here at Millares. Rope across road and additional 10BOB at ‘Punte Arce Shelter’ 18°35′49.18″S 65°09′11.99″W

name: Animal Rescue
description:
Senda Verde Animal Rescue.
Nice place to visit, it's not-for-profit. Has many species of birds, monkeys and other animals. You can also volunteer here.

name: hostal jaqueline
description: little hostal with private matrimonial and very hot showers (150bol/pp). nice place to stay after 7 days on the road. darcy is a very helpful host. you can have a nice soup for dinner and pancakes for breakfast (dinner 20bol,  breakfast 10bol/pp). darcy organises a tour guide if you want to go to the vulcano. secure parking, no height restrictions.

name: veterinario san francisco right place
description: if you want to go to this vet this is the right place - but a few meters away you can find the university’s president dr nelson alfero (veterinarian) calle santa cruz - esquina suipacha . he can give you all the needed documents at once.

name: Casa Del Freno
description: We had to check our brake, we were told to go to this workshop. They charge us 50 bob (!! Only that ! to bleed the circuit, they also clean the air filter and the tyre pressure. (For this good prestation we gave hil 60bob) Very very friendly,  they are also mecanic but for only for gas engine. It's also called Delgadillo motors, la casa de los frenos is grandfather's workshop. Highly recommended !

name: ONKEL.INN WAGON SLEEPBOX UYUNI
description: Onkel.inn is a hotel/hostel located just in  front of the main avenue. Hot spot where all the Tour agencies are located. At our hotel you can find different type of accommodation like: single and doble rooms with shared bathrooms, this kind of rooms are Japanese style look a like and are located inside the train station or main building. We also have suits with private bathrooms inside the main building... But we have a bigger surprise,  actual wagon trains converted into super suits with a little living room,  bathroom and shower,  and the main room. This wagon trains will be your home while you stay with us. Other offers you can find at the Onkel.inn are: wi-fi connection, parking for all our guests, breakfast included for all the type of rooms,  gentle assistance and lots of love!

name: Mercado Abasto Estacionamiento
description: Parking of Mercado Abasto de Vallegrande. You can sleep here although we did not do so. There are free, very clean bathrooms and showers with hot water for 5Bs. In the surroundings you can find a quiet, moderately flat place to sleep.

name: Secure parking
description: Roofed parking under the Municipalidad. 5Bs an hour and 20Bs for 7pm-8am. Max alt might be around 250 cm. Asked for a 24h price but they said that was not possible, so I took my car only at nights there and let it sit the rest of three days in front of Casablanca Hostel with no issues.

name: Four Canyons
description: On the F25 with view in four different Canyons. Here you will find a flat place, even with a big rig. Even if it’s next to the road you will be alone because there is not really traffic...

name: Schiefergrube
description: Down at the river. This appears to be the installation place for the new bridge pillars but as long as the bridge is not completed you can camp and no one will disturb your peace. Because the way down is quite narrow you must try with a big rig, enough space down there is not the problem. By tent you need a good mattress.

name: Police w/ Radar
description:
Got pulled over here on my moto for speedng.

He clocked me at 115km/h speed limit is 100km/h.

I told him I was sincerely sorry and he asked for my license. I went to dig into my pannier for my international one as I didnt want to pull out the one in my wallet and flash the money.

I told + showed him my speedometre cable was broken and I didnt know my speed sorry. He asked for 300bols. 

I said I had no money, no gas and just need to get to Oruro for a ATM.

He finally smiled asked me a few questions about my trip and then let me leave and told me to slow down.

name: Viewpoint Laguna Colorada
description: tried to go around the lake on the north eastern side. Beautiful two track but the ruts were so deep my pegs hit rocks on both sides (KLR650). Was very hard to turn around. In a 4WD you would need high ground clearance, on a bike you would need very narrow pegs or very high clearance. Furth on there was marshy mud as well which I didn't get to. Go around the south side instead!!

name: Titikaka Lake Ferry
description:
15 min ferry (barge) to cross the Titikaka lake. 40 BOB for car or Big rig, 5 BOB for bicycle (after haggling). 20 Bols for motorcycle. 

*Update 05/24: 40/50 for a car / big rig

name: Amigos de Bolivia
description: A tour operator by a very nice lady called Helen. We took a tour to the mines for 100bob each. She speaks a bit of English and really cares about the miners, especially helping the kids that work there, not just making money. She also organises many other tours, so really recommend going there to find out more. If you go there, say hi from the Estonians.

name: between Rocks
description: Place on a hill between rock formations, partially covered from the highway. Awesome view to the canyons and to Sajama volcano. There is a steep track to get up. No 4x4 needed but it can be difficult for big rigs to leave the highway and take the track.

name: Near Macaya
description: We found this place on our way from Sajama NP to Salar de Uyuni. The view to the altiplano is fantastic. At the near laguna there are some flamingos. It is quiet windy here in the evening hours.

name: Coipasa Island
description: We found this place on our way from Sajama NP to Salar de Uyuni. From Coipasa follow the track near the shore on the salt flat. This spot is covered from the strong wind in the evening. Do not continue south from here. Locals told us there is high risk to get stocked in mud. You must go back to Coipasa and take the main road on the Salar. from there you can drive everywhere you like!

name: Scenic road around
description: Very nice route from salar around vulcano. At this time Dec no 4WD need but bumping....i would not do it again but I really enjoyed

name: police checkpoint
description: police checkpoint. Checked our vehicle papers. fast and friendly. Didn't ask for money

name: Hostal " Los Andes Sajama"
description: We park in front of the hotel for the night. The next morning we sent to the geyser with the owner Virginia. 80bol for a 2.5hrs ta the geysers and thermal.  Very quiet at night. We've refilée our 100L wather tank and washed out cloths for 2 bol.

name: Terminal de carga frutas " tagarete"
description: Lots of fresh fruits and vegetables, with local prices.

name: Good mechano!
