description: We had a problem with our kombi after looking to 3 garage to fix it. He was the most efficient, honest and clean garage. He fixed our kombi in the day (we had to move the motor to fix it)

name: Hostel (Llama House) Pirwa
description:
Has safe parking for two big bikes. We paid 210Bob for private room with shared bathroom. Great breakfast included(cereal yogurt fruit coffee and french bread)

It’s got great hot water as well.

name: Cabaña Paradise - with parking
description:
The only place we found that had secure parking. 140bol for private room for two with shared bathroom. Basic rooms. Very quiet spot surrounded by the jungle. Has covered patio and pool(water looked clear but pool needed cleaning) friendly cat and dog. Hot showers, no wifi. 

A little pricey for what it is but good place to relax away from town.

Perfect weather at 6000ft

name: Gas off the F3
description: Was sold gas here for 5.00Bob per liter, attendant also rounded up to nearest liter.

name: near Laguna Blanca
description: It is the only really wind covered place we found here around.  Nice sunrise. It is cold here at night. We had -9 degrees celsius. Lots of tour cars passing in the morning after 8am in direction of laguna colorada.

name: Hotel Punta Kaami
description:
Single room with matrimonial and private bathroom (150BOL), good Wifi, really hot showers, everything is very clean and unusually maintained. 
best host in bolivia, we felt at home. 
In português:  Melhor hospedagem da Bolivia, os donos são pessoas que amam viajar, fazem você se sentir em casa!! tudo limpo, e uma bela paisagem.

name: Bertha Homestay
description: This hostel is the home of a lovely family. There is a kitchen to share, our room was modern and cosy. Shared clean bathrooms with hot water. Parking is included in the price of accommodations and there is room for 2 cars and 4 motorcycles. Spanish lessons are available and the instructors are great. This is a fantastic place for short or longer stays. The plaza is a good 25 minutes pleasant and safe walk away. Sucre is a very beautiful and safe city. We are having an authentic Bolivian experience and we highly recommend staying here. More information on Bookings.com and Airbnb as well.

name: Hotel Roque
description: Looked at the other Hotels in town that were listed in iOverlander. This was the best deal I could find. I got a 2 bed, private room for 50 bols. Shower and banos down the hall... Shower so hot I had to use cold water to cool... Receptionist didn't want to give me wifi password at first since you need to be in a private/ bano room to get it. She finally gave in and gave it to me for free. Its fast. I parked my moto in one of there small garages connected to the hotel. Might fit 3 motos. Big rigs I assume would park on the street. No breakfast. Clean rooms. Ask receptionist for power outlet adapters since they are the two round pin design.

name: Pomani climbing rock
description:
If you come from North turn right in Ayo Ayo ... ca. 8 km dirt road but flat and good, some washboard parts but still ok.
Pomani is a very small village in front of the beautiful rock...here you can find several rutes to climb...i didnt count but i guess more than 50 rutes! All new !

During the day the village was like a ghost town and in the afternoon we found a woman and asked if its ok to park in front of the rock to climb and to rest..(Grassy,dusty field ). The answer was 
"si claro, siga,no problema"

Free climb free camp and of course no facilities. You will spend a quiet night between wall, village,100 chinchillas and cow crap. climb and place amazing

name: Socoser Tyre Balance
description: We balanced our Landrover tyres here. A bit expensive; 50bol per tyre, but the only place since Cartagena where it was possible to balance them at the screws bolt-centered. They also have a variety of diffrent Tyres for Overland Vehicles.

name: 10 bob almuerzo - Brosteria el Yungeno
description: Still 10 bob lunch, good alternative to escape touristic place. Food was good, they usually serve a soup and a main meal for this price.

name: Devil‘s Tooth
description: Very nice and flat spot beside the Devil‘s Tooth rock. Panoramic view over La Paz. The gravel road is very steep and curvy. You need high clearance and if you have a heavy car 4x4. At the weekend maybe a little bit crowdy.

name: Villamar
description:
We ate in the village’s comedor, chicken, fries and rice for 15 bol. And afterwards we went to this wild camp next to the river. Amazing sky, super quiet. In the morning lots of curious llama’s came to us. 
Recommend a 4x4 / high clearance for crossing the shallow river, but others might make it too.
You will see locals on bikes and in 4x4’s leaving to work. Beautiful place. You can take water from the river. No wind ! 
Big rigs can fit here too.

name: Tiwanaku archeological site tickets
description: This is where the ticket office and the two local museums are. Entrance fee 100bob includes the two archeological sites and two museums. Guide for extra money.

name: Pension Familiar. Local restaurant
description: Great local pension with a salad buffet and barbecue. We ask for vegetarian option they made a grate vegetable tortilla! All for 15 bob!

name: Muse I Eduardo Lopez rivas
description: Etnomusicologia ethnographic and folkloric excellent museum for archeological history and carnival. 5bolspp

name: Crystal Tours
description:
Great people. Great tour of the solar- 1, 2, 3, 4 day options. Fair good prices. Really nice family run place. Long one day your approx 10:30 am to 6:30 pm. The Debora met us at the train station late when we arrived and gave information- no pressure just information. Helped get us a really great hotel for the night and also helped with storing our bags and giving us a place to wait until we waited for the next late train. Good food for lunch- very little aceite good vegetables. They will also have rooms for rent starting January 2018. 
Whatsapp +591 63140750

name: Get stickers made here- de sur impresiones
description:
Prices are all the same for getting stickers made it seems. They did fast and good graphic work and had the print job done the next evening. Super nice people and good work. Whatsapp +59165438759 idessurol@gmail.com

There are a ton of graphic print shops on these blocks. Way easier than getting it done in La Paz.

name: Old church in sepulturas
description: Really old interesting church and grounds. Worth the stop if you are making the trip to the pinturas also. Can't go inside. The drive up to feels like passing through a ghost town also. Free. Nobody around.

name: Hostel Posada del sol
description: We paid 70Bol for a matrimonial room with shared bathroom, tv and breakfast included (hot beverage and pan, butter, jam). Good location, hot water, kitchen, wifi.

name: Find the boiling hot springs
description: Park your car here (or continue by car if you are lazy and have a 4wd). Follow up the river for 2-3 km. As it's getting warmer, take bath at 30 then 35, 40 or even 45 degrees. When it is too warm, continue and cross the river 3-4 more times (run through it as the temperature is about 60 degrees) and finally reach the boiling spring with the red seaweed! If the water above the spring is still hot, it meens there is more hot spring. Continue until the river turns cold.

name: puya raimondii-  near comanche
description: here you can find many puya raimondii (largest bromeliaceae with huge flower) and flowering cactus.  just up the hill next to comanche. be carefull and ask as miners are working here (with dynamite). comanche you can reach from el alto on an asphalted road (5bol toll).  at the municipalitat they adviced as to stay overnight at their paza in our sprinter campervan.

name: Takesi Trans Tours
description:
Here you get the Bus tickets to La Paz after you finish the Takesi Trail.  Phone: 71530467
You have to be mental strong to survive the 2 hours rally driving of the bus driver and the scenic steep valley beside the gravel road.

name: Alojamento Tomny
description: Simple but clean rooms with swimmingpool close to the old church and main square. Very friendly owner. Tranquil place after Takesi track. 30 Bol/pp. Pool 5 Bol/pp

name: Refugio Vista Panorámica
description:
perfect spot to stay during Huayna Potosí summit climb. we parked our Montero just outside and could use their bathrooms.  12 bunk beds if you should need them. 

Domi (la seńiora) mostly had sopas and almuerzos for very reasonable prices (please don't expect too much variety on the menu as this is harsh high altitude country and the next market is 20km away). plus she is the sopita Queen;)

Adrian (el señor) is a guide himself and can organize a local expedition to Potosí summit.
but you can also climb independently like us!

they are very welcoming to Overlanders and at the time of this writing they we're building more plane parking spots (no big rigs). 

phone number: 71913144

name: Entel GSM
description: Place to buy local SIM card. Bring your passport. 10 bol for SIM and lots of different options for dara.  SIM and 5GB data was 60 BoB valid for 30 days.

name: barber street!
description: just pick a barber you like. price round 20 bol. we went to maya, really profesionall haircut. for a gent btw.

name: la hormiga animal park
description: a park with rescued animals like apes,tukan etc. its 30 bol pp and you get a tour for 45 min and tell you everything about the animals and plants! we also saw a pineaple plant for the first time! we really liked it! do not forget to bring lunch cuz you can have lunch at the riverside and take a swim! there is also a restaurant in the park.

name: Los Andes station
description: filt up at pump for 5 bol sin factura. really nice guy.

name: Refugio Jacha Inti
description:
Nice refuge for rescued animals (Gato montes, many types of monkeys, loros, aras, turtle, toucan, mandu...) Some of them in cage, some of them free. (20 bs/adult)
Possibility to sleep: double room with private bathroom for 120bs/night for 2 people, 40bs for additional person.
Cheap horse ridding for 40bs/hour.
Possibilities to volunteer. Look on the website

name: Cabezas City (Santa Cruz)
description: A beatiful square near the road. Its  a perfect place for sleep and pass a quiet nigth in a rural zone. Secure.

name: puerto guachi
description: we just talked to the alcalde. tourists & campers & viajeros are very wellcomed. you can stay here overnight safe and quiet and for free . potable water. next to museums del lago titicaca (about tradition & history and steam locomotives which still work)-entrance fee  30 bol, 10 bol local and elderly people.  here is one of the smallest international harbours of the world. the bolivian navy (armada) runs tourist ships at the weekend (to copacabana). visit the church apostel santiago at the plaza in guaqui (open most mornings).

name: Hotel Galavis
description:
60 B for single room with shared bathroom, tv, wifi plus 10 B for parking. Single file parking, see photo's. Drive up narrow ramps to get in.
Incl breakfast, coffee/tea, choise of rolls, ham, cheese and jam.
Room was small and could do with a paintjob. Bathroom smelt, sewer problem?
Some cheap 'restaurants' in the area.
Several other hotels/hostels in this area, some look like the have a garage. The hospedaje next door was closed.

name: Residential Oasis
description: Basic hotel in the village of Miguillas. At the time of my visit this is the only place in town to get a room. Basic fairly clean rooms for 30 bol per person and dirty ones for 20. Shared bathroom with cold shower. Large yard with easy access can accomodate even large vehicles.

name: rio surutu's beach
description: Nice beach, nice river. Fire pit but the wood does'nt burn well. the locals come here to bath during the afternoon but very quiet at nigth. 5min driving from the village on a good dirt road.

name: Estacion YPFB
description: We paid 6 bol after quick discussion. They wanted the foreign price. We ask for 'sin factura' and we were offered 7 bol in Villazon.

name: Roasters
description: Still good coffee and good Wi-Fi. Friendly staff. We spend 4 hours here sitting by our computers. No problem. Spend 95 Bob on 2 coffee, 1 cookie, 1 cinnamon bun, 2 linomades (large and not too sweet, 12 Bob per limonade) and a chocolate croissant. It is not a cheap place, but it is very nice. The cookie are not great, but we had a chocolate croissant that was freshly baked.

name: Casa cultura - museo simon patina
description: The house of Simon Patino is 130 years old. He was a very wealthy man because of mine investments. He is also the founder of the Banco Mercantil. The house itself is still originally furnished as it was when he lived. Really nice and worth visiting. 10bol/adult, 5bol/child. Check the opening times before you go. In the afternoon it opens at 3 o clock. I dont think it is open in the weekends.

name: Bon bar
description: Amazing food- part of a locals recommended list for us. The tostada de Cordera was what we were told to order and it was excellent!!!!!!! Open 2-8 Monday to Saturday. Packed with locals. International stickers on the door. Beer and soda. You won't be disappointed!

name: Auto Mercado - Miercoles y sabado
description: All car related things possible... huge street market

name: Alojamiento Victoria at the plaza
description: Spent a quiet night camped in front of this small hotel on the square. They let us use their bathrooms- nice and clean. Tienda in front. Rooms for 30/40bols pp. totally safe and quiet place to sleep at the border.

name: Hostal Villa Sofia
description:
From 50 B for one person.
Breakfast menu 15 B or 25 B.
There is a kitchen, but I don't know if it's free to use.
Quiet location. Large secure parking area, will fit big rigs.
Cheap, but good restaurant on the plaza, half a block away, lunch 12 B, diner 13 B.
Halfway between Potosi and Tarija, 3 hours.

name: mitayos land hostel
description: hostel under construction open to the public since 2 weeks. we paid 40 Bol pp a night for a double room with share bathroom but we was alone in it. The prices will be more expensive when they will finish all details constructions. really friendly and helpfull receptionist called Rosaria. really good plan !

name: Chorcaza common room
description:
We met the people of the village and in particular the teacher who allowed us to sleep in the big common room of the village. 
No electricity.
There is a water tap outside.

name: Geyser camp
description: We slept next to geysers under tent. the floor is hot it heats the matelat and we were not cold and even hot during the night at 4900m!

name: Paragliding tandem with Germán
description:
Germán Navia Whatsapp info:
+591 76936242
You can go paragliding above Cochabamba with German who is an absolute professional. He's been flying for 23 years and he's still alive. He's a competition pilot, an acrobatic pilot and a very competent tandempilot. I paid 350 bolivianos, which has the taxi included. Highly recommended!

name: Samaipata - Main Plaza
description: Main square of Samaipata with restaurants and shops.

name: Buy a Bolivian SIM card here
description: If you are looking to buy a local Bolivian SIM card, here is the place. Entel SIM card, 10 BOB. Very easy and friendly

name: Grassy knoll next to salar
description:
Quiet grassy field full of grazing alpacas. Great views of the solar and volcano. There are several small dirt paths you can drive down to reach this campsite from the main dirt road. 

We have a dog so we wanted to camp off the solar. This was a perfect spot since it’s grassy, no salt.

name: Parking
description: 10bs per night for parking. No possibility to sleep in the vehicle, just parking. We left our car here for a week and went to Rurrebabaque by publuc transport. Secure & friendly.

name: YPFB
description: Negotiated 20 liters for 100 B straight into the tank. It was busy and he wouldn't (dared not?) do more.

name: El Pescadito
description:
30 B for single, 80 B for double. There were 3 of us, talked the 80 down to 70. The single turned out to be a room with 2 single beds, just like the double, but without tv. No airco. Fan 10 B extra.
Old and worn, semi clean. 
No hot water in shower, but the sun warmed water is just good enough.
Secure parking included in the price. Big rig should fit here.
No wifi.
Parking is around the back. 

TIP. Take a left out of the gate onto the dirt road then right onto the tarmac road. On the next corner you can fill up right into the tank for 5.50 per liter. I went round on foot beforehand and negotiated with the girl when no one was around.

name: Wild Camp site close to the road
description: We were told we weren't allowed to stay at the petrol station so we cycled a few kilometres up the road and found a spot behind a tree in between the road and the fence. There was a regular stream of traffic but once it was dark and the tent was up we didn't have any problems. Far enough away for the town of La Palizada to enjoy the amazing starry sky!

name: Cabana Cayba
description: At the moment there are no cabanas but a restaurant with nice view and good food. We went from Tarija and slept one night here, without costs after we had dinner. The night was quiet and safe. Very nice owner.

name: Sleep + Little shop + houses
description:
Besides the asphalted road there is a little shop and a few houses. There are people living here. Probably mineros. 
You have a quite big spot where you can park even big rigs and sleep for free and enjoy the stars if you are lucky! I was... :)

NOT MANY OPTIONS to sleep between Uyuni and Tupiza!!!

name: Charming Bolivian Restaurant
description: This place with no sign, but you can eat great lunch for 15 B. p.person that include soup, second main dish and refresco :) It is hard to bielive))) beautiful garden, colonial yard and gallery, very nice stuff and really good and tasty food))) that served like in home:))) ah! and it was cool music there: scorpions, pink Floyd, deep purple))))) name of the owner Señora Anita. She told that she has some place for stay... 100 b.she told... we just eat there, so you can ask details if you need. Highly recommended!

name: Golden door house that sells vegetables
description: Friendly.  They had onions, carrots and tomatoes.  and bananas.  We paid 15 Bolivianos total and had asked for a pound of each (they gave us a lot of food!!!).   They also had the local squash/pumpkin named zapoya.  Gold door.

name: Blue door with gasoline
description: just knock on the door.  She sold it for 5 Bolivianos but only had 5 liters at the time, but said she would have more.  Very friendly

name: motorcycle wheel bearings
description: wheel bearings for motos! cheap, but kyoto brand.  Got bearings for Suzuki DR650

name: Gas & Diesel station
description: Local price, which is 4.50 for gasoline here.  They also have diesel.  Pulled right up and they filled our motorcycle tanks at the local price. Guy was very friendly and we got our questions answered about the road (river crossing) ahead towards Cochabamba.

name: Fruit Veggie Cheese Alcohol stand
description: Inexpensive produce and good variety.  Also have meat, cheese and pastas.  They had wine, beer, rum and sangani. Also a restaurant next door.

name: Hay Gasolina / Store with gasoline
description: 6 Bolivianos per liter of gas at shop/house with little sign that says hay gasolina.   The shop is the door next to a bright blue metal door.

name: 180 degree view camp right off quiet road
description: Flat areas for a tent.  Also a large pullout off side of road nearby.  We had motos and were able to ride up above the road where this spot is.  Peaceful.  Gorgeous views.

name: Coca cola y Gasolina
description: Family that sells gas.  6 bob per liter of gasoline.  We needed to use our containers, but they had a funnel. Super lovely family.  Sign on side of road.  We got 18 liters here.  Cute town.  There was a local boy playing a ukelele beautifully.

name: Gate with fee
description: Entrance fee 10B per vehicle (maybe per person) to enter towards Maragua.  She will give you a tourism ticket.  You can then pass.

name: Boulder desert beauty spot
description: Beautiful hideout off the road to Alota village. Plenty of space. Wind protected. Sunny desert location. Far reaching views of the mountains. Dead quiet. Plenty of dry firewood available from dead bushes. Llamas passed through our camp in the morning. Great spot.

name: Dry river bed hideaway
description: Turn off the Ruta and drive down the dry river bed. Plenty of space. Loads of dry fire wood. Very quiet. Cacti and trees and the mountains all around. The further you drive down the river bed, the quieter it is. Sheltered from the wind. Goat herd came by with her goats. Just the sound of birdsong.

name: Gasoline & Diesel at tienda
description:
You will see the full 5 liter  jugs at the store.  She also sells ice.
 
5 liters of gasoline for 30 Bolivianos.

name: Gas Station
description: Sold us gas into our containers at local price.  The gas is dirty, so if you can filter it through a sock or other clothing.

name: Stunning view over the lake (+camping)
description:
Turn in the village and follow the dirt road going down. Amazing view of the sand beach, the cliffs, the lake and the fishing village. Many nice places to camp along the coast. 
The road is not that good and with a 2wd you may not be able to go back the same way. No problem! The coast is nice, drive along it and find another road.

name: One of the nice place along the coast
description:
Very nice coast, sand beach, nice rock formation and cliffs, fishing villages...
Here is one of the many nice spot you can find. Between two sand beach, you can climb the nice rock surrounded by the water to see the sunset on the lake. 

place only accessible by foot, max. with a bicycle.

name: residencia Santa maria
description: It is basic, has WiFi, bathroom, fan in the room, but only that. It has no tv. And it's quiet. 50bs.

name: M&M Elevadores
description: Great motorbike repair shop. We changed our oil here and had the carburator cleaned. Miguel, the owner and chief mechanic is a real pro and very zen. The service is excellent and the prices good. We paid 30 BOB for the oil change, with our own oil.

name: Country house bed and breakfast
description:
Wonderful place ! The owner Javier is extremely warm and helpful. Room from $20USD. Pool, nice deck. Right in the jungle. 

One of the nicest place I've stayed in South America! 

Parking semi-hidden for jeeps, probably possible to park motorcycle in the gated parking. Very quiet neighbourhood. 800m from downtown. 

No wifi...but you wouldn't want it anyway ;)

10/10.

name: Salar View
description: Nice view of the beginning of the salar.

name: Cabañas kewiña
description:
Beautiful, peaceful place where you can rent Rustic private cabanas for 80bs per person per day,  you have private bathroom, you can use the kitchen, you have hot water, electricity with solar pannels.
You can do some hikes frome there, beautiful landscapes, pure air, if you have a gps you can get to the rock paintings of puma machay and incamachay 4hours walk to go and 3 to go back.
There are no restaurants or stores near by, so you need to buy everithing in the city. Maria the owner produce some things like tomatoes, letuce so if you really need them she can sell you some.  
The place is located 45min from Sucre, paved road you can get there in public transport.
Maria: 72896074
whatsapp Sucre: 73408900
facebook: El Germen Restaurante Vegetariano (you can write there too)

name: Entel Bolivia Phone Cards
description:
This is the official office of entel bolivia. Go here if you (and you probably will) have problems finding a chip in the streets, especially as foreigner.
The chip costs 10 bolivianos, staff is very helpful.

name: Salt Flats Entrance
description:
You can definitely drive your own vehicle to this spot to get to the edge of the salt flats. Police told us we couldn't drive into the flats because there was too much water but you can absolutely drive to this location and get the experience without paying $100 a head for a tour. 

It's actually quite deep water just west of this location, so likely your car would never make it far into the flats; however, you can drive up to the edge no issue whatsoever. It's actually a pretty decent gravel road out past the city limit towards the flats. 

We paid a 5bols toll between here and Uyuni.

name: SOAT
description: Univida sells 2018 moto insurance 202 bol

name: Hostal Vivero Sarita
description:
Very good family hostel. Has wifi, kitchen. There are two comfortable rooms for couples and one room for a big company. Have a place for motorcycle. BS 70 por 1 person with breakfast. 150 por couple. You can bargain. We stayed there 2 weeks :-)
Also have a laundry, 15 BS por kilo.

name: Kulturhaus Berlin Restaurant
description: We went there three times for lunch during our week in Sucre. Good food, kind staff and very nice spot with WiFi, music. Salad buffet, soup, main course, desert and drink for 27 BOB (updated 2022).

name: Cabanas Kewiña
description: We were looking for a nice, quiet place to stay in the area of Sucre, for a peaceful week after some hectic motorriding. We found this place at 40 min from Sucre and we spent a fantastic week there in a lovely cabana! It is run by the very friendly and helpful couple Maria and Augusto, who live in a house next door. We paid 80 BOB p.p. per night, and for this we had our own bedroom, bathroom (excellent shower) and kitchen. It is a lovely, peaceful place, with great hikes in the area (the three dogs love to tag along). On Thursdays Maria and Augusto go into Sucre for grocery shopping, other days they should be around. As the gate by the road is often locked, it's always a good idea to call them in advance:  cell nr 72896074; or stop by the vegetarian restaurant El Germen in Sucre, run by their son and his wife (also great by the way!) If you are in the area, this is the place to stay!

name: Paqueo Susana
description: parking normal vehículos. ring once. 15 overnight and 3 bs after 8 am.

name: Dr Pet
description: Very helpful and busy vets in a nice area. Jennifer (speaks good English) and her team Love all animals. They are extremely helpful-Good prices. Can complete all vaccinations, sterilisations, sends tilter test to lab in Germany (that lab provides quick turn around of results and will post hard copies onwards to other countries). All documents you require an be completed to boarder crossing standards.

name: La Casona Hotel Boutique
description: Excellent and charming hotel in the heart of La Paz. Exceptional friendly staff and excellent breakfast and restaurant. Set in a colonial style building only 25 m from San Francisco square. Treat yourself something. Safe parking places one block away.

name: MoToni repairs and maintenance
description: Motorcycle mechanic very recommended. Clean garage good mechanics and friendly. Fixed and revised our leaking front fork on the KTM. Multimarcas. Phone 67306580 - 68224155

name: Poopó
description: Parking in front of the thermal baths and on. Entrance to the baths 3B / p, shower and Wc from 6:00 to 18:00.

name: On top of canyon
description: Take a small track - easy driving- and drive for about 2 km. You will reach a platform overlooking the arroyo and the surrounding canyon . Very nice, hidden from the main road, superb view

name: Aeropuerto Oruro
description: On the parking lot of the airport. Very good Wifi. Wc during the day. The car park is closed at night from 21h (possibly earlier) to 6h. Quiet and on. Free parking. Bus to downtown at the entrance to the airport 1.5b one way.

name: Lucy station
description: In the toilets is water to fill up your tank.

name: Rooftop & Wifi in Eden Hotel Cafe
description: The Cafe in the 10th floor of the Eden Hotel has a spectacular view over Oruro and Wifi.

name: Parque de la Ranchería
description: Nice little park with a small market during day time. Around the park are some parking lots. In the night the place should be quite and there is a night guard. We payed him 10bs to watch our van. 300m from the park there is the possibility to take hot showers (see iOverlander Glaymor).

name: jose hernandez
description: Great Diesel workshop with all facilities for injection pumps and turbo loaders. very clean and good equipped. nice owner. we spent one week in their backyard and they did a great job to replace an repair our totally destroyed turbo charger.

name: Hotel Glaymor
description:
For 20bs you get 1hour showertime (hot/cold) for two persons. It's 12bs for 1 person. It's public, so you don't have to be a hotel guest.
Open from 8am to 9.30pm
Walk through parking garage to the back.  Lunch at restaurant was good too!

name: Morgante "Food & Nature"
description: Italian Food, camping and forest. Porongo great area, unique wild life. 20 minutes from Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Info 591-76601796

name: Gasoline station with parkingplace
description:
Fill up at normal foreigner price , but behind station is a 24 h fenced parkingplace at B 15 per 24 H 
Electricity at the wall . Toilets and cold shower . Clean when we were there .
In the same street lot of simple street restaurants . Very good " carne asodo " , made in front of you .
Chicken plus french fries plus 1 L beer for B 36 .

name: Toroyoj
description: Coming from Tupiza on a dirt road turn right just passed the bridge towards the river. Very nice pebble beach - big and flat - and nice scenery. 12 km from Tupiza. Unfortunately some trash ....

name: Lomas de Arena
description: Entrance is 10 bob and there is about 4 km of sandy road. There is a lagoon and nice places. Possible to camp randomly.

name: bushcamp next to a stream, pucarillo
description: Really nice bushcamp about 20km from Vallegrande. Would recommend a 4x4 or a motorbike. Use google maps satellite because this road is not on the maps. Between mountains there is a small river where you can dip in, big roof for shade,  a few chairs and places to make fire. Close to here is the devils cave with pre incan cave paintings.

name: Voy Tours Agency
description:
Travel agency belonging to Hotel Butch Kassidy. Franklin, a very nice young tour guide, takes care of the agency. He is honest, passionate, and trustworthy. I can't say the same thing of other agencies we talked to... Moreover, price is also more interesting than others ! 
Because we paid a tour, we were also allowed to park overnight in their parking, use the Wi-Fi, and take a shower. Franklin only said we could give a voluntary tip at the end...

name: Cementerio de Trenes
description: In this train graveyard, you will find some rusty steam locomotives and rail cars, which are dating back to the 19th century. The atmosphere is interesting and macabre at the same time. The amount of garbage around the area is rather sad though.

name: Hospedaje Matita
description: 120B for a couple and 50B for single in comfortable clean rooms. Was available to use a kitchen. Green garden, cute parrot, kind owners. Has wifi, but when we where there in all village was working Internet only from automat in one corner close to market (60mb for 1B)

name: Hotel Butch Kassidy parking
description: Franklin and his parents just started to receive also overlanders. You park in the backyard, which is very quiet and safe. It costs around 50 Bol/night for the whole. Very nice family atmosphere. The space in the parking is for 2 vehicle, it can include big rigs, but clearance is around 3 meters high (width is about 2,50 m). In case ypu don't get in, you can always park right outside the gate, it is safe too and you can still open the small door to go back and forth. Kitchen is  big and well-furnished, there is also a huge living-room with sofas and dining tables. Shower is super hot and excellent pressure. The whole hotel is very clean ! Good wifi too, that you can enjoy from the sofa. Downstairs they also have a grocery where you can buy canned or dry food, mineral water, fresh bread.

name: Hodaka Mountain Tour Operator
description: We booked two privat tours to the salt flat of Uyuni with Hodaka Mountain, one for the sunset and one for the sunrise, and both turned out to be fine. The drivers were very friendly in both cases and explained some details about the area. Furthermore, right after the beginning of the tour, we could pick a pair of rain boots from a large selection in a house in Uyuni. For the sunset, the driver drove in a convoy with some other drivers of the agency about 10 km into the salt flat, which allowed a decent view on this natural phenomenon and some good photo opportunities. Other tour operators drive only to the border of the salar for the same tour ... The only downside was, that the this tour was not really private due to the fact that the driver drove in a convoy. But still, it was good experience.

name: Coroico Star
description: Very good organization of the descent of the Death Road with Milo as a guide  - BOL 350 to 450. Website cocoirostar Phone number +591 72 50 56 52.

name: Yucuma
description:
Next to the quiet mercado at night along the road to Rurrenabaque.
No service.

name: Ecobamboo hostel
description: It is a nice and cheap place to stay. We paid 40bol per person for a private room. No breakfast, but upstairs there is a khrishna reustaurant that has breakfast for 10bol and a very big lunch (soup, mais and dessert) for 15. :)

name: Pueblos Magicos
description: Lovely traditional Bolivian restaurant in San Cristobal. Friendly people. Good coffee. Yummy food. Museum attached for 10bols. Only place in town with WiFi!

name: San Ignacio de Moxos
description: On the village square no service, quiet and safe.

name: Casa Huespedes de Isabella
description: Very clean and nice looking hostel. Only 2 blocks away from the main square. Owner is helpful with things to see and you can even book spanish courses via the hostel. Price is 130 bs per night for a private double with shared bathroom. Breakfast included (above average).

name: Trinidad
description: Laundry, dry cleaning. Ready the same day.

name: University of Béni
description: We asked for permission at the entrance to the caretaker who allowed us to park in the precincts of the university. bathrooms;  quiet and safe.

name: Los Jardines  del Cerro
description: A new boutique hotel . I had a look at one room- it is breathtaking . Absolutely beautiful in every detail.  YOu either look at the garden or have a garden in your room. Sauna, their own bakery. 110dollars including breakfast. I had very good lunch, salad buffet, homemade roll, soup, main dish, sweet for 35BOB. Even if you don‘t want to stay overnight don‘t miss lunch,  breakfast buffet is 50, I will try tomorrow.

name: Old bridge
description:
Passed Oruro drive over the new bridge and turn left straight after it. Drive towards the old bridge - maybe 300m. Just before the old bridge a track goes on the right along the river . Nice to spend one night!
can be muddy if it rains!

name: Puerto Pailas
description: On the village square. Quiet from 10pm to 6am.

name: Hotel in Rio Mulato
description:
A small family run hotel in Rio Mulato. Very basic but also cheap. I paid 20 bol for a room. The washrooms were a little dirty and requires a bucket of water to flush. There was an electric shower that I didn’t use, so I’m not sure how good it is or if it costs extra. The owner was nice enough. I was able to store my bike in the locked courtyard. 

This will mostly be useful to cyclists. It was pouring rain when I stayed, and there didn’t seem to be much opportunity to wild camp in the area.

name: Popular Cocina Boliviana
description: Great local Bolivian Restaurant. Fixed 3 course meal for 79 Bol. Local food. New menu for week every Monday. Open for lunch only from 12:15 pm, no reservations, first-come first-served. Arrive 30 minutes early as restaurant fills up right away at 12:15. Food is excellent, beer and wine available at extra cost. Considered one of La Paz’s newest top local restaurants. We had an excellent meal. Staff also speaks English. Cash payment only.

name: Higher Ground Café-Wine bar
description: A really nice Café during the day which serves breakfast and lunch. We had the hummus plata (48 Bol) and the Chicken avocado wrap (35 Bol).In the evening it's a wine bar but serves also cocktails and beer! Hip interior and nice staff. Happy hour from 6 o'clock.

name: Mercado Artesanal & Mercado Las Brujas
description: Here you will do your shopping of Alpaca stuff, souvenirs & so on. Always bargain!

name: Hotel Don René
description:
Very basic hotel with not much service. 20 bol per person. 
10 bol for a 'hot' shower. 
Dinner for 12 bol.

name: Taller Automotriz Asbel Motors
description: A decent mechanic. He noticed that my brakes needed replacing and told me where to get the original parts for Renault( don’t pronounce it in the French way!)

name: HipeMaxi Super Market
description: Big super market. Has place to park your van/ moto (not for big rigs). Can find almost everything.

name: Villa Ganadero
description:
On the village's main square. No services but quiet and safe.
--
Sur la place du village pas de service mais tranquille et sur.

name: YPBF
description: Local price in a jerry can (3.72). Asked for carnet, I said I dont remember, she didnt say anything, just used her own. 80 BOL for 21.5 lt of diesel.

name: Coliseo Toro Toro
description: On the parking lot of the coliseo next to the park office and the office guides, quiet and no services.

name: wildcamp close to the river
description: visible from street, unpaved road leading to some fields. not much traffic, probably none at night. you have a bath in the river. easy accessible with 2wd

name: ATM - 24hr
description: 24 hour ATM machine - works well, we did not have any problems here

name: Salteñeria El Patio
description: Best Salteñas in town (according to some of the locals at least). Had a Salteña de Caldo and was not dissapointed, you can sit down and eat in the small patio inside which has a lovely architecture with a mix of columns and flowers. Salteñas are slightly more expensive than usual (8bs each) but of you want to try good ones I'd recommend it !

name: Street camping in front of German Consulate
description:
Spent 3 quiet nights in this relatively flat street. Friday night to Monday morning, so not a lot of trafic. Felt very safe to sleep here, and to leave the truck here during the day when wandering the city streets.
Curious neighbors sometimes looked from their windows, but nothing intimidating.

name: YPFB
description: They filled up directly into tank for local price, no receipt, no questions asked. They ask for a tip sometimes.

name: Pachame Bicycle Repair
description:
Had a few issues with my bicycle and the super friendly owner Huari helped me setting my wheels right, welding my frame back together, let me use the workshop and even invited me for a beer ! Really great people that know their stuff and get everything fixed with smile.

phone : 74374978 - 4592640

name: hotel Cruz de Los Andes
description: nice place ,Moto parking for at least 3 fully loaded bikes, email them to ask, we found them on booking.com

name: Museo URU
description:
Great place to discover. Possibility to visit few islands "del Lago Titicaca menor" not overcrowded and real authentic. The museum is hold by a really nice Family which explain all culture and construction of embarcation totora because they World with Thor heyerdahl who crise the Atlantic océan in this totora bouts.
We 've slept into the museum and bycicles were into too. But there's a little parking in front of the museum which could fit for a camping-car. 
The owner, Juan Carlos, is nice and know everything about the sector. 
Highly recommanded !

name: ATM Banco Union
description: ATM accepted visa card. Max amount 500Bol.

name: Dry river bed.
description: Wild Camping in a large leveled dry riverbed with lots of bushes for a bit a protection from sight. Approx. 1km from main road, very quiet. Easily accessible even with 2wd.

name: Bolivia Motorcycle Tours
description: Contact Chris through his website to set up camp in his families backyard, right next to their citrus orchard. www.boliviamotorcycletours.com

name: Bolivia Motorcycle Tours
description: The owner actually owns a motorcycle touring business, so he knows his way around a klr650 more than most in Bolivia plus he’s got a nice selection of tools as well.  Contact is through their website:  www.boliviamotorcycletours.com

name: On right side of duck laguna
description: Big Clearing on right side of road. Flat. Quiet n beautiful views of surrounding hills

name: Police and Toll
description:
Inbound to La Paz: police check point. 
Outbound from La Paz: toll station.

name: Govinda - vegetarian
description:
Very good cheap vegetarian food : hamburgers (soja steak), pasta, lasagnas, samosas with very good products.
They have inresistible chocolate samosas!
Each portion is not very big, but you can take several dishes.

name: Residencial
description: Residencial Niemvil. Nice and clean  (above the ice-cream tienda) 60bol pp with shared bathroom /70 with private.  Gas-heated shower, use of the spacious and clean kitchen,  place to wash clothes,  secure space for bicycles or motos, helpful owners!

name: Restaurant with small shop
description:
Small shop (water,  beverages,  cookies etc) 
They sell 2L water bottles for 10bs. They also have snacks. Also we (4 cyclists) could stay in a room for 50bs altogether. Very cheap and perfect for a cold windy night

name: Huallajara
description: In the village of Huallajara there are 4-5 small Tiendas, only two of which appear to be still in business.  Also potable water for sale, and plenty to filter from taps.

name: perfect windbreak before the pass
description: This is a perfect windbreak with views of the lake.  5 tents fit perfectly.

name: Hansa VW garage
description: Location of VW official service and spare parts center

name: Abandoned Road Section
description:
This section of road was abandoned when the road was redone. Just pulled in and rode to a low spot in the red dirt and cars driving by cannot see us because of the hill that is between the new and the old road.

Good elevation for sleep 8000ft

name: Clearing off secondary road
description:
Just before the main road becomes dramatic(youll see when you ride it, the cliffs is very high) turn left at the river and a secondary road brings you to a clearing.

Flat and hidden from min road but users of secondary road can see you depending on the way they are coming.

Decent clearance necessary to reach the flat clearing.

name: Free showers - back of gas station
description: Free showers at the back of this gas station

name: YPFB gas station
description:
New station, charged local prices, no questions asked

(They did round up 4$ ish a liter but not complaining here)

name: Villa Serrano
description: This peddler sells fuel at 4.50 a liter.

name: Little Tienda under The hotel MaNa
description:
This little tienda has really good home made donuts with chocolate frosting for 3bob, cheese empenandas for 1bob and bags of home made chips for 5bob that we also loved.

We keep coming back here.

name: Restaurants el Manantial - 15bob Almuerzo
description: Really good value and tasty lunch special and friendly staff. (12-1.30pm) Hearty soup, bread, main (pork chop and rice) and jelly for pudding. 40 bob for two with 1l of coke. Definitely seemed like a locals place as it was really busy.

name: Todo Moto
description: Requesting place for motorcycles. Not much for big bikes but a lot of small bike parts. Prices are good.

name: Hidden from view
description:
Hidden from view, small entry (abandoned driveway) to the right coming down the mountain. 

Accessible for motorcycles or small rigs, narrow, low tree branch clearance in parts.

Ride all the way to the gate to set up camp.

name: 14 de septiembre
description: Very basic accomodation on the main road. Therefore very noisy. We had a double room incl. own bathroom for 70 bs. Tho it’s basic it’s an ok stop between Sucre and Samaipata. Dinner was fine. Owners daugther wanted to practise her English, which was perfect.

name: Titikaka lake
description:
Durty road in lake Titikaka. A few persons during the day come to fish. Very quiet and secure at night. We ask people of the village and say it's Ok.
beautiful view on the lake and the islands. No facilities but free and you can fish and make fire.

name: Rock quarry by small stream
description: Stay a night here after leaving cochabamba late afternoon. Windy n quiet. Can hear traffic from road but no problem.

name: Two motorcycle repuesto places - pirelli and metzeler
description:
Two motorcycle parts places that carry tires and other bike parts.

The one on the right had metzeler tires and pirelli also.

Very limited selection but they did have a Metzeler Karoo 3 130-17 for 890 bol  and a few Pirelli 140-18 as well

Unfortunately no 150-17 or even 140-17.

Not easy finding big bike tires in this town.

Jfman

name: Benjos garage
description: Good garage. Helpful people. Fixed my broken suspension price ok. Javier et Gustavo are good mechanics. With solution for all.

name: Como en casa (Hostal Asteria)
description: Highly recommanded. Very nice and cosy. Owners very really nice. Garden interior. Beautiful bedroom, hot shower, very quiet. Paid 190 bol. for 4 pers. with breakfast.

name: Hotel Houston
description:
220 b the matrimonial room with private bathroom with very hot shower. includes garage (two blocks) wifi, tv in the room, and basic breakfast. comfortable mattress and radiator for heating. they accept to pay with credit card visa
---
220 b la habitacion matrimonial con baño privado con ducha muy caliente. incluye cochera (a dos cuadras) wifi , tv en el cuarto, y desayuno básico. colchon cómodo y radiador para la calefacción. aceptan pagar con tarjeta de credito visa

name: Pension Jacaranda
description: Very basic accomodation. Two beds and a bathroom. It was ok tho. Room can only be locked from the inside as the owner had only one key. Car can be parked safely. Paid 25bob pp

name: Yamaha moto dealer
description:
Yamaha motorcycle dealer - under the same roof as Toyota and Volvo.

Came across it while looking for tires but did not do business here.

Jfman

name: Tréveris plaza parking
description: parking on the side of a plaza, flat and quiet, no services but walking distance to the center. we stayed there two days.

name: Very nice single track for motorcycles
description:
Amazing single track for adventure bikes. Narrow(3 to 4 feet) track carved off mountain/canyon. Impressive dropoffs and views. The trail snakes down into the canyon. Advanced and technical, small or medium motorcycle recommended.

Treat of thrill seakers.

Big bikes bring talent and good ground clearance.

To reach it get off the main paved road and ride to Pylone on upper two track. When you reach the pylone the single track starts there.

Jfman

name: chipaya tourist hostel
description:
we went here with our sprinter camper (no 4x4). spent a quiet night at the plaza central (toilets in the municipio). we had a guide (only spanish or aymara or their language!!) who showed us around in our sprinter (bad caminos, but transitable): pueblos, dunas, campo....we eat at the plaza (10bols pp). we had to pay 100bols directly to the guide (10.00-16.30). 
the person in charge of tourist organisation is "crimaldo quispe“ mobil: 67245197. you can arrange eg.: artesania 350 bol; musica 700bol; architect 200bol; actos rituales 700bol ....  50 bol pp for room with hot shower (solar), 140 bol pp room incl 3 meals. 
we can recommend to come here!

name: Residencial Charana
description:
In central plaza. Very basic Accom. Double bed was 50Bol. Indoor parking for motos. Street is likely very secure in front. 

The most time consuming “simple” crossing ever. Investigations in Putre and with police along the highway all told us that all immigration and aduana entry and exit could be done in Visviri Ch. Not true for us. We exited Ch in Visviri and we’re told to enter Bolivia atCharana 4 klms away. Got to Charana and were told to go get our room and come back later when there would be somebody that could admit us into the country. Did just that and we’re told at the border that we must go back to the Chilean Crossing and do everything there. Apparently there’s no stamps at the Bolivian Crossing. Back to Chile we go and of course there’s no Bolivianos there. Back to Bolivia. Nobody at at crossing. Went to police station. Explained everything and he told us to come back in half hour. Came back in half hour and were met by somebody from the municipal office that did our immigration. Explained thatBol Adu is actually a big building across from the frontier gate in Charana. Not the small office at the gate.  Of course. Lol. 
Everybody we have met here has been incredibly friendly and comforting but it took us 5 hours to accomplish the crossing. We saw no other people crossing all day. Good luck everybody! :-) Drive from Putre very nice. 10 klm gravel w some sand. Can’t comment on Bolivian side.

name: Toll
description: If you want to go north, you have to pay 10 BOL here. I dont know why, the street to Alota was the most annoying washboard since San Pedro.

name: Hostal San Salvador - with motorcycle parking
description:
On the Bolivian side, basic hostel with courtyard.

50bol matrimonial bano compartido
70bol matrimonial bano privado
10bol to park the bike in "courtyard"

Also I think there is room to negotiate.

Lots of cheap hostels on this street but most without room for bikes.

No wifi

Jfman

name: Lamphaya lodge andino
description:
Nice hostel, clean but cold shower.
30 for shared room, 50 private.

name: Hostal Camino Dorado
description: Super friendly family run hostal. Excellent Wi-Fi, hot showers, no breakfast but communal seating area available and excellent coffee from the Paris Cafe opposite. We paid 70 Bob for a matrimonial. Parking near by - 25 Bob a day, 10 for the night for a motorbike. nicer in vibe than the Posada del Sol!

name: Alojamiento Juan de La Cruz
description: Friendly hostel on the way into the town, 80bob for a matrimonial and space for a couple of motorbikes in the courtyard. Fairly clean, comfy bed, no Wi-Fi and showers are 5bob extra - not tested yet! The town has lovely plazas and a nice feel, not the grim place it's been made out to be!

name: Residencia
description: The village is small and has little to offer, but there are a few places to sleep and eat. The residencia we found is clean and we could place our bicycles insides. We paid 60B for a matrimonial room with private bathroom.

name: sand dune
description: little path on the side of the road to get to the sand dunes, great view, calm, perfect!

name: parking to inca canon
description: nice place to park and hike 3km to inca canon

name: Terraces on the steep slope
description:
There are a few flat terraces to pitch a tent (with an amazing view of the city!) in the trees covered slopes. There are a few trails used by locals, but if you get up early you won't have any problems. I had an undisturbed sleep.
This place is only reachable by foot!

name: Granja camino de la muerte
description:
Farm with camping service, it seems a good place. Do not enter, it has a camping sign.
--
Granja con servicio de camping, parece un lugar bueno. No entre, tiene cartel de camping.

name: Automotivos Car’s Tools Calle Chayanta 721
description: VW parts! Calle Chayanta 721 tel 6623650 we’ve found everything we needed, really helpful and nice man

name: Ramaditas hill
description: Spot 1.5km from main road, good option for overnighting. Take the ripio behind the Ramaditas village. Flat spot, watch out the rocks. Quiet place and great night sky.

name: Entrance to the Ramaditas hill spot
description: Take this ripio on your left when going up hill to reach the Ramaditas hill spot.

name: Hidden spot for cyclists
description: Flat grassy spot by the (dry) stream. Your tent would be hidden from the road, but not your head if you are tall. Tiny bit of water in April but do not count on it.

name: water tap on the street
description: There is a water tap right on the 'main' street next to a red brick wall. Otherwise the Cerdss village is completely empty. Some locals roaming around. Small shop that only has drinks and snacks.

name: Plaza San Pedro de Tiquina
description:
Free water. 

Without money and more km to copacabana, i charged water at a bobbin in the plaza. Find the bobbin, i charged 2 Lts. Nobody say nothing. Find the quill in the corner of the square inside the bushes.

name: Hostal Dom Carlos
description:
Friendly family, warm shower, shared bathrooms, private rooms with view of the Salar. Yes another salt hostel! 
35bolivar per person
tel:+59174417357
Anastasio

name: mirador calanguilla-laguna sakewa
description:
here is a great mirador. on the way description plates even in english, but with the time hardly readable. you will see many birds, eg thousands of all three different flamingo spezies with their youngsters. 
we had no problem with our sprinter van ( no 4x4) to come here. there are potholes , rivercrossings, washboard- but sideways when the “camino” gets to bad. worth a detour.

name: laguna sakewa next to mirador
description: next to the mirador is enough space to stay over night. no one here, quiet, no infrastructure. for entel reception you have to walk up to the mirador. at the lake are thousands if all three different flamingo spezies and a lot of other birds. the way is ripio but was transitable with our ( no 4x4) sprinter van without problems.

name: chullpas de wila chullpa
description: we walked from the polychromas chullpas here. there are more than 25 chullpas to explore. two collered only red, some red and white with rombos, quadratus... they are from the carangas culture dated 1210 - 1380 after ch. no one here.

name: Hotel Oberland
description:
This is an actual campground with all necessary facilities for overlanding. Electricity, potable water tap, WiFi. Location updated, it’s just below the hotel.

Other info at Hotel Oberland. Just a duplicate for long-term vehicle storage.

name: Wild camping clean
description: This place was clean and peace for my tent. Other places are dirty and next to copacabana. I camp One nigth and it is beatifull.

name: San Juan
description: No problem to get fuel in the tank at foreign price con factura. Much better choice than the fuel station on the other side of the road.

name: end of road
description: end of a road not on mapsme, take the right when going down to yampupata, near the first houses, on the way to the antenna. big flat space, nobody around. great view on Isla de la Luna. the best we found north of Copacabana.

name: ketal supermarket shopping center
description: nice supermarket, with several imported items and good cheese and yogurt from flor de leche. guarded parking 3.1m high, free if you show your bill to the supermarket

name: Flor De Los Andes
description: Fantastic restaurant with incredible views, Food was first class everyday (we ate here everyday for 3 days) Owner speaks very good English & plays great music. Highly recommend this place after continually being ripped off & dissatisfied with the restaurants in the square !!!

name: Hostel Kory
description:
Lovely hostel just off the square (30mtrs) we got a matrimonial for 200bolivanos yes their is cheaper in town but this place had sensational views, very comfortable beds with clean sheets & hot water (western standards) it is in same place as Flor de Los Andes so they have Wifi & great food !!
They also have a very large pool & the owner is super friendly & very helpful. We parked our motorcycle in the garage & it had 4 other overlanders motorcycles as well so plenty of room & safe as !!

name: Cerro San Sebastián
description: Incredibli beautiful view of Copacabana, the airport and the impressive Lake Titicaca. One hour walk from the center.

name: Trattoria Satori d' Italia
description:
An Italian restaurant. Only open In the evenings after 17:30. Has a limited menu.
Tagliatelle, gnocchi, pizza, and polenta. Mains around 40 to 50. Red wine 20 a glass 70 a bottle.
I had gnocchi with basil, garlic and almonds. Tender, soft and delicious. Everything is made after you order.
Music is soft Italian or Spanish. Warm and clean place. Not the usual fare.

name: Host San Sebastian
description:
Good mid range hotel in El Alto district of La Paz. Cost 210 bol for double room. Very clean and has very secure parking for motorcycle or normal size cars and campers (height limit about 2.5m).

Location means you do not have to drive into La Paz centre (avoiding massive traffic problems) 
if you are traveling north south. Access to city centre is very easy as there is a Telepherique station (the cities aerial cable car system) about 5 minutes walk away.

name: River pull out
description: Quiet farm road with a pull out for 1-2 cars right next to the river . No traffic at night. Much better than any of the spots on the pass and much warmer!

name: 3 chullpas de curahura de caragas
description: in case you visit the beautiful church at the placa have a look to this chullpas

name: Chaunaca “polideportivo” parking lot
description: After a long day in Maragua we decided to sleep here before hitting the road back to Sucre. We even took a really nice hot shower! Go see Doña Victoria, she works at the Puesto de salud and charged us 5bol each for the shower :) We had a very quiet night here, hope you too.

name: Quinta Grania
description:
Traveller family that now owns a farm, 3 km from Porongo, a town located north of Santa Cruz.

 They offer accomodation for travellers with tent , vehicle or camper. 
Perfect spot to relax and get out the stress of the city, at only 25 minutes north ( there is the possibility to take transport to the city for 10 bolivianos more or less).

Plenty space, lot of shade, kitchen , toilets ,wifi,  hot shower, 220 v shockets, hammocks, BBQ pits , lot of fruit trees and swimming pool. 

You can wash your clothes for 15 bolivianos ( washing machine)
They produce their own products, fresh milk, cheese, fresh fruits and vegetables and more.

Price 50 bolivianos per person.

name: Ferry. Puerto Varador
description: There are two ferries approx 15km southwest from Trinidad. You have to cross the river on a small wooden ferry. We negotiated to 50 Bol. You get no factura and there is no price list, so better negotiate the price before boarding. We have a 3,5t Mercedes Van. If you come late to the first ferry, you can sleep in the small village before crossing the second part.

name: In front of the ferry
description: We arrived here in the dark after the first ferry river crossing from trinidad. So we decided to sleep here. There were a lot of Trucks which spent the night waiting for the ferry next day. The first ferry from here heading west is leaving at 6am. We slept at the left side of the street and felt safe between the trucks

name: Gopal restaurante vegano vegetariano
description:
Vegetarian lunch for 20bs:

*can choose  between 2 soups
*serve yourself from buffet salads (like 20 different options)
*choose between 2 second dishes
*really nice wholebrain bread
*fresh juice (There were 3 option when we arrived)
*desert

really good vegetarian option! 
nice atmosphere as it Is inside ñaupa hostel, which has a little nice garden. 
People really friendly! 

Was an excelent healthy choise for some backpackers with a Lot of hungry ;) 

note: there are other 2 Gopal restaurant on the city:
Rocha 375 (near Plaza colon)
Oquendo 524 (almost Calama)

name: Good place protected from wind
description:
Just off the road there is a flat place protected from the wind. 
Don't know about cars but quite nice place for cyclist.

name: The Carrot Tree
description:
We loved it here! The terrace is beautiful with awesome views of La Paz, the WiFi works great, awesome juices, and delicious food at a very reasonable price. The whole staff was super friendly including the afore mentioned Irish owner. Definitely recommend!
Maps.me showed it in the wrong place but very close to the correct location so look around for the sign. It’s entrance is a little hidden, just off the Main Street.

name: Next to small river
description:
100 metres from the road, next to the river, a lot of flat space to choose where to spend the night.
Some curious, friendly locals came by and told it was totally fine to camp here, it is not private land. Suitable for every vehicle.

name: Safe and Quiet Plaza
description: We stayed here for three nights without problems. Parking and sleeping at this plaza was recommended by some locals because there is military and police. We parked our Sprinter opposite the Hotel Oriental. Free, no facilities. Quiet between 11pm and 7am.

name: Public Toilets and Showers
description: There are showers (3 Bol) and toilets at the bus terminal. Showers are good, high pressure but only cold water.

name: Flower Foutain Tr
description: Ricardo and Norma, the B&B owners, welcome their guests as family guests. The house is clean and very comfortable, with nice outside garden. We had a nice private room with bathroom offering great hot shower. Breakfast is great. Very good WIFI. Located in a quiet and safe neighborhood, you can access the yellow teleferico in 5min walk. You will find around the house many options to eat. Their private parking can accommodate 2 medium size rigs without height limit.

name: Hotel Mundial
description: Decent hotel along the highway. Secure parking on the parking lot besides the hotel (12 bol per night, you can check your car from out of the window). Big room, cable TV (possible to switch language to English), fine bed and very hot shower. Nothing fancy but really okay for one night! Double room with private bathroom 70 bol.

name: Pirane
description: in the village you can choose any street. all durty road but quiet. no problem with people. we stay by municipalitad

name: camargo
description: on the side of the church on the «placita» just in the center of the village. the mercado is next corner. quiet.

name: yotala
description: the other place indicate is impossible for big rig. this one is in the village on the streetside with light. ok if it is late and don't want to go on. safe some cars during the night

name: navariji
description: a dirty road but ok for big rig going down to the village. near the wall of the house, the woman owner said no problem.

name: belen
description: on dirty road behind the wall of a farm. the guy saw us and say it is ok. easy for big rig. watching if raining. on the way back from la paz

name: cochabamba
description: Parqueo next to bus terminal and luna-park. 15bol during the day, 30 for the night. safe. shaddy for some place. Big central mercado begin on the other side of the street. banco union. restaurant. wifi at bus terminal. easy for big rig

name: Es Mundial
description: Allowed us to fill up our 2 jerry cans twice for 6b per litre.

name: Eco Albergue Turistico Suk'Arani
description:
50 pesos by person for the night
Rooms of 1, 2 or 3 persons
Sometimes Hot shower
Meal (soup, plate, dessert) for 15 pesos

name: Riverside
description:
Pretty place with a very nice river nearby. Easy parking. Close to a small village. Llamas and sheep. 
.....
lindo lugar con un río de agua cristalina muy bonito, se puede estacionar fácilmente. Cerca de un pueblito (10 casas) de pastores de llamas y ovejas. 
Allí podrán apreciar aves (patos, y otros que no conocemos el nombre) . hay también montañas tipo cañón.

name: Toll Peaje
description: 8 Bob. If you are coming from paraguay you can change guarani (maybe other money) between the 2 borders (house with small market). We could change 231000 guarani for 251 Bob.

name: On the rn5
description: We found this place on the way to Chile. Several spot close by. All flat, no wind protection. Not really hidden from the road but far enough and really quiet at night. We slept well! No one around.

name: Hospedaje
description: We asked in town and were refered to this 2 story building. Secure parking for cars/motos. 30 bols a night, 10 bols for a warm shower gas heated. Could prob get a big rigg in here, there is no hieght restriction but the town is very quiet so street parking ok. Kiosk across street. Room to eat in, but not cook. Room was spacious, fluffy blankets and sheets. A nice warm night considering the altitude. Toilets clean enough. She sells wine and snacks from the eating room upstairs. Looks like a small restaurant but we didn't ask about food.

name: Military checkpoint
description:
Police check point -
Mornings from Peru to Bolivia
want to see your documents, licence and may ask a few questions. Pretty straight forward.

name: Estación Servicio 20 Mayo
description: Willing to fill jerry cans at 5 bovs. Filled ours twice.

name: YPFB
description: We refilled our Gas bottle for Just 30bol, after spending the whole day looking for a place. super nice guys. Open only from 8am to 1pm.

name: Small village plaza
description: Quiet and simple place for overnigth.  Friebdly people.

name: Parking lot at Gas station
description: We could stay here for one night. They let us use toilet. Very kind people. And we got gasoline 6 bs/l for 32 liters.

name: Estacion de Servicio Cortez
description: Said international price is double the local. At this time, 7bol per litre. No issues filling a Chilean plated van.

name: Road in countryside
description: You can camp along this dirtroad (easy drive) in the middle of the countryside. There are several places where you can park along the road. Almost no one passing, very quiet, beautiful.

name: Refugio
description:
Nice refugio before starting the big climb to Parinacota summit.
Please have in mind it might be locked/close.

name: Small parking
description: small parking at the edge of the road, view of the lake, and the village, very quiet.

name: El Vergel
description:
Very nice family camping and hostel spot. Only accesible by foot or bike or taxi but you can't park inside (there is a river to cross). You could leave your car in the village. David, the owner is a permaculture addict and he made this place very nice. You can volunteer also if you contact him before. The price is 15 bol pp for camping and 25 pp for a room. Shared facilities. Shower is just warm enough. There is a direct path to go there by foot from the village and by bike/car there is a big loop to do. The road is on maps me.
elvergelsoratabolivia@gmail.com
+59167064565

name: Rockformation near Villa Mar
description:
If you do not like the strong wind, go down to the small valley and camp behind the long rock wall. Has also caves for tents
Next to Viscachas.

name: Laguna Bella Vista / Nidos de Condores
description: This place was not easy to find, allthough there are signs. We arrived late in the evening. The place is in a beautiful, open landscape, between the lagoon and the rocks with the nests of the condores. We can see about 12 places with nests, two of them may contain many young birds.At the moment there were no birds arround.

name: Waterfall, Soldado Muerte
description: From the top view point of the Soldado muerte you have a fantastic view into the great cañon. The riverbed and the pasture was tempting to go down. You have to follow the small track from the bridge along the river. But be careful: there are two river crossings with sandy, deep water (70cm) and two narrow passages. But at the end you find yourself in a paradise: fresh, flowing  water, a waterfall of 2m, water emerging from the rocks. Keep this place kleen!

name: Police Checkpoint next to toll
description: First non corrupt police control in many kilometers. Very unfriendly, officer had no name tag, but surprisingly didn't want a "fee"

name: Hostal La Torre
description: nice place with rooms from 100bol, we asked to park our car, Volkswagen Saveiro, and sleep in, did for 50bol for a couple; it's also support small Vans. offered to make breakfast but didn't want to. fast internet

name: Hidden Hot Pool
description:
Nice Hot Pool in the River.
Next to a small "bridge" to cross.
Might be for free, but an old woman showed us the way for 20 BOB each. Didn't mind to pay that as "donation" ;) but as there is nothing around you probably get lucky not to pay anything.
We had the pool for ourselves.

name: Hostel Bellavista Inn
description:
A hostel which is actually more a B&B. There are no shared rooms and no common areas. There is however a kitchen you can use, but what I saw very limited utilities. 

They have no parking, but I could park my motorcycle on the pedestrian area right in front of the door of the reception with 24 hours service and also cameras around the building. 
Plus the naval school is in the street so there are constantly military / MP walking around.
I guess it is quite safe. 

Cheapest room starts at 100BOL, with a shared bathroom and the room is very small. Also, the cheapest rooms are at the highest floor (6th) and there is no elevator. 

Breakfast is from 7-9:30 but it still available at 10 if you’re lucky. Breakfast includes baguettes with egg, jam, butter, bananas, cornflake, yoghurt and tea/coffee. 
 
Shower is hot, but a rain shower, so not very strong beam plus you have to wait a while before “all” the water comes. 

WiFi has it ups and downs, but I could upload my pictures. 

At the moment they’re renovating different floors, started with the lowest (most expensive) and are working their way up. 
However, the rooms are not in a bad state.

name: Hostal masegal
description:
Good place; 35 bol pp
Hot water 
Danger around at night 
Not far from the big market 

Cool pour quelques nuits si vous sortez pas trop de nuit (ou en taxi) 
Super proche du grand marché et du terminal de bus 
Eau chaude 
Chambre avec grand lit mieux

name: wild camp behind cliff
description: A flat area behind a cliff, hidden from the road and by a small stream. We were able to walk our bikes over some shrubs and dirt to find it.

name: Taller mechanico
description:
We have a engine trouble, so local guy towed our car to here. The boss Omar is a good guy. But he could not find out our problem exactly in 2 days and we did not have much time. So we moved to other mechanic. Probably he can do most of things. If you have time, this is a one of the good option.
Paid 300bs to adjust belts and change “tesador” which was broken after visiting Salar de Uyuni.

name: Camona Achá Servicios
description: Very friendly and helpful mechanic. We werde there with our defender and fixed our Problems for a really fair Price. They can do everything. We highly recommend this Place.

name: Wild Camp on Death Road
description: Nice place, flat and grassy, almost completely Hidden from Death Road. Nearby Camping has a sign "entrance prohibited" which we didn't like so We slept here. Quiet and only a little bit dirty.

name: Lago de eden
description: An - apparently - free campground - we entered here late in the afternoon as the gate was opened and nobody to check. Nice leveled spots, there even are some parillas. A bit of noise from the main road but ok for a night and felt safe.

name: Restaurant Michelle Paceńa
description:
Silver gate next to restaurant with Entel signs. 

Selling regular gas in a can at 6bs/l.
No diesel.

name: Yellow House
description: Knock at the door. They sell gas for 5bs/l, out of big barrels with a pump. They also have diesel.

name: Parque Machia
description:
50m in front of the park, at the edge of the forest ... and in front of the parrots 

NOTE! The lady at the ticket office told me that sometime neighbours charged for parking naive tourists! If you arrive in the dark, just park, don't ask anybody! Do not pay anyone. Parking is free if you visit the park for 6bs
--
terrain a 50m devant le parc,au bord de la forêt...et face aux volières des perroquets..

name: Residencial Palo Santo
description: In that hotel they let us bathe in a shower with hot water for $ 10. Very good bathroom.

name: American
description: Oil Change and Lubrication Center. The owner Vivi already traveled a lot and also knows mechanics, very good vibes.

name: Policía corrupta
description: Toll booth with police control. Ask them to tip because supposedly we were missing a stamp from every Bolivian department we passed. Never asked us for these stamps in any police control of Bolivia.

name: Alojamiento 20 de abril
description: Showers with hot water for 8 bolivianos. Next to the terminal.

name: Vidita
description: Here you can buy 20l bottles of mineral water. If you already have the can, it is 13 bolivianos.

name: Puesto de Control de Drogas
description: Here the police stops all vehicles. They told us that it is forbidden to circulate with a can full of naphtha. They wanted to keep the naphtha and we said that we did not know about that law and at the end of a lot of talk he let us put in the kombi and continue our trip.

name: Coop. San José Obrero
description:
Gas station won’t fill up to the tank, only a jerry can and you have to park on the other side of the street. 

Paid 40 BOL for 10L gasoline. No negotiation.

name: Pipeline Service Track
description: Desperately looking for a place for the night, we found this track near the road F7. Quiet, nice place away from the main road. Two flat places: on the top with good view on the street and a bit further down, well hidden. Space for bigger riggs.

name: North side of bridge.
description: There is a nice spot on the northen side of the bridge. Protected from the wind and if you have a filter for water fresh water from the river. Quite and although some locals saw me they didn't say a thing.

name: Northeast of bridge
description: Good option for the night. Trucks pass by till around 11 as the border closes at night. They make huge noise but quite at night. There is option to get water from the river but I filtered it. I hardly could find any wood for a fire. Nobody saw me at night as the spot is a bit under road level. Not so cold as in Chile.

name: Km. ZERO
description: I had quinoa soup and the vegetarian tacos for 25 Bs and both were good. My husband, who had already eaten a trout meal ordered the nachos with cheese which were a bit basic, but exactly as described in the menu. At 8 pm there was live music which we both enjoyed. The staff were very attentive and friendly.

name: Hostal La Plaza
description:
Hostal at the “main” plaza of Monteagudo. 

Staff is not very talkative but still friendly.
Rooms start at 80BOL and are clean and spacious. Mattress is in bad condition, but all the rest was ok. 
Shower was one of the best in Bolivia. Hot and strong.
WiFi has its ups and downs. 

No breakfast, didn’t bother to ask for a kitchen.

name: El Chanar
description:
They have the rates on a billboard. 
8.5 BOB/liter for foreigners, that went down to 5 after negotiation but we were scammed (15L in our jerricane instead of the 20L we paid for)

name: one of the 4 hostel
description: this one is without electricity and without shower. 50 pp

name: hostel
description: hostel restaurant near the place. I didn t try the hostel. 15 bolivar for lunch

name: Hostel plaza
description: basic and more or less clean rooms (check different ones), hot showers and parking in a secured parking lot for 70bol. friendly staff

name: Water at the mercado
description: Lady from tourist info said it is agua potable but we tasted it and it is a little salty. We took some to cook.

name: Lavanderia Suiza
description: Ruedi and Miriam have (next to casa swiss) a small but beautiful place in their backjard for 2 campers. The new bathroom is huge, very clean, hot showers according to Swiss standards. They offer a laundry service. The best for Overlanders: If you suffer from eating South American bread, you get here the best ever served wholemeal-bread you missed on your trip!

name: Su Tienda Amiga
description:
Nice little store/kiosk with slightly lower prices than the other shops on the main road. Very friendly owner.

(e.G. Coke 2 Liters @ 10 bol - most others take 12 bol)

name: cerca de la ruta
description: in bike. small splot for camping next to road.

name: Calm Wild camp near road
description:
Quiet nice spot on the road to la Paz.
Far enough not to be disturbed by the noise of the road.
Good for one night. Access may need 4x4 if raining

name: Hostal Anturios
description:
Good Hostal, place is clean and quiet. 
40bs/pers for a room with 2 single bed. Shared bathroom. 
The room is just on the street so it can be loud at night. There are others rooms with private bathroom for 150bs which are on the other side of the house. 
Wifi is inconsistent. Ask to reinitialize it if it don't work (you have to insist sometimes). 
For the hot shower go to the woman part. 
We were able to use the kitchen and there are chairs and table in the patio !

name: San Xavier Quinta Eco Resort
description:
If you need a holiday from your travelling, this is the place to go. A tropical treasure in San Javier. The Hotel is quite new with rooms, suites and Bungalows for up to 8 people, a good restaurant. The graden reminds us of luxury Bali resorts, is full of tropical plants (with botanical identification) has a swimming pool with a bar.
The whole is of course not free of charge, we payd 440 Bol for a double room 2ppn. You can park your car in the parking lot (still under construction)

name: Pampa / Yacuses
description: We were looking for a place before Puerto Suárez. This is a flat, stable, turning place beside the road to a hacienda. Very quiet, lots of birds (some mosquitos) with space for about 4 big rigs

name: 360 Grados Hostel
description: Super clean hostel situated in the day market which is the best location if you love staying in a busy area. Quiet at night. Hot shower and good wifi available. Kitchen at your disposal. There is also a massive terrasse where you can wash, hang your clothes and chill out on the hammac. A really decent breakfast is also included, with egg, bread, delicious jam, cheese and coffee. The owners and the staff are really friendly. I paid 60 bob in dorm. I recommend!

name: Next to road
description: in bike. a place to spend night behind some litle trees. Very peaceful. we see only some llamas.

name: alojamiento la luna blanca
description:
on bike, very clean and quiet place. We were very well received. near the center and central market.
electric shower, but very hot.
very comfortable bed.
They charged us 40 Bol per person private room and shared bathroom.

en bike. muy limpio y tranquilo el lugar. fuimos mui bien recebidos. cercano del centro y mercado central.
ducha elétrica, Pero muy caliente. 
cama muy confortable.
nos cobraron 40 Bol por persona quarto privado y banho compartido.

name: Alojamientio La Union
description: 25 bols pp. no shower, you can buy breakfast for 7 bols

name: Route Info SW Circuit (Tupiza-Lagunas)
description:
The SW Circuit is a world-renowned overland route, for which humans and vehicles must be well-prepared. See pins at the turnoff on 701 as well as the pin in Uyuni “Preparation for Lagunas Route” for information on the commonly travelled route from Uyuni - San Pedro de Atacama, Chile. 

This pin focuses on the route between Tupiza and Laguna Colorado, where you can head south to San Pedro or north to Uyuni. See comments for individual experiences. Here is what you need to know:
