-The entire route is mainly over 4000m elevation, often approaching 5000m. Below-freezing temperatures at night will be encountered throughout the year.
-Road conditions vary widely depending on season and maintenance. The route is heavily travelled by tour Landcruisers running heavy-duty agricultural tires at high speeds. Because of this, the washboarding of the roads is epic, and ruts form with a hump in the middle that may be 50cm tall. Even high clearance vehicles need to drive with care to avoid dragging differentials and belly pans. Travel speeds may be as low as 10-15km/hr at times. Confidence in your vehicle is key. 
-Unlike much of the classic Lagunas route, most of which is in wide open valleys, the 300km route from Tupiza to Quetena Chico is on shelf roads cut into the hillsides. Not a big deal in dry conditions, but in wet season (which includes snow) they turn into incredibly slippery clay mud and will be treacherous for even the most capable 4x4 driver and vehicle. There are also at least a dozen river crossings along this route, which are inconsequential in dry season but may pose serious challenges in wet season.
-The distance from Tupiza to Thermas de Polques or Laguna Colorada is approx 350km, entirely dirt roads. The nearest reliable fuel from there is Alota, Boliva on the 701, or San Pedro de Atacama, Chile. Depending on route choice, distance between fuel stations may be 600-800 km. Fuel consumption will be higher than normal due to elevation and road condition. Some diesel vehicles consume double normal rate. 
-There are a couple of community peajes along the way, and the 150 BOB pp fee to enter the park. 

If you’re prepared, this will be the drive of a lifetime. Suerte!

name: Hospedaje Cordillera
description: The first of the hospedajes coming from the Laguna Colorada. You will find several hospedajes in a row next to each other. We liked the first one and did not look further. We had a room to ourselves and paid 30 Bolivianos pP. We could use the kitchen in the evening. The tour groups bring their own food and GAS. We could use theirs. In the morning we asked for a breakfast and got hot beverages, bread and scrambled eggs.

name: La Poronga
description: a pretty cool spire with a funny name! you can guess from the shape.

name: Jaldin Bolivar II
description: Old fashionned style hotel. Well situated, this clean hotel has different type of rooms and prices. From 50 bob for a single, 60 bob for 2 people - share bathroom or 80 bob with private bathroom. Good wifi & great staff. (Ps: wanna taste de best Silpancho in town; when leaving the hotel, go right then take the first left. You wont miss the house restaurant on the right, not to be missed!)

name: Gojan mechanic
description: Moto mechanic. He helped us to fix some problems with our bike. He will try to suck your money on everything so remember to set price before job.

name: Hostal Casa Del Sol
description: This is a lovely Hostal in a very quiet location in Copacabana. The couple who run it are lovely and very welcoming. There is secure parking (no height limit but about 9ft wide). We opted for a double room with private bathroom which was about 147 BOB a night. The room was large, they provided towels and the shower was hot (electric shower). Parking is big enough for loads of bikes or about 4 cars. Breakfast is included and you get fresh warm bread, butter and jam plus bananas and as much coffee as you want 7.30-9am. It's a very chilled place, very quiet at night and highly recommended if you want to chill for a few days. Wifi was good and worked nearly the whole day, plus we could watch Netflix and work online without issue.

name: Mirador Death Road
description: because very dense fog, we slept here. not far from the road. some Birds,  lot of Bikers, no facilities, after 5pm we were alone

name: Laguna Celeste/ blue lagoon
description: Very nice place to stay overnight. Beautiful spot with Cerro Uturunco in the back, about 30 flamingos in the laguna. In the evening slight rain, windy, cold. In the morning fantastic weather.

name: YPFB
description: Asked for 6, but was easy to get @5 BOB.

name: Dulce Salada
description: This place is a salt hotel under construction but rooms are available now for 50 bolivianos. Bathrooms under construction but clean beds and beautiful people. It is hosted by angels, a Bolivian family who helps travelers under difficulties at the Salar. If you need help call Leonardo at +59172384462. He rescued our family in the middle of the night at the flat flats. All my gratitud for this family.

name: Rio Yucama
description: Small wooden ferry to the other side of the road to San Borja. We paid 20 bob for a motorcycle. Maximum for Sprinter sized cars or vans…operation time 7:00-19:00

name: Road to San Borja
description: This road is full of animal to see. Crocodiles, birds and bunch of other. Sometimes crocodiles are very close the road. We did this road on a motorcycle 😀

name: Yungas Old Bridge/ Rio Solacama
description: Quite Place 200m from the Road. Not very hidden but we feel very Safe here. Only the Sound from the River. Seems to be a Local Place at the Weekend. We Stay one night

name: Alojamiento in Tica Tica
description: Very basic accommodation: we had a room with 3 beds and a table, with electric light and power. The room was very clean and tidy. Toilet but no running water. Much warmer than sleeping outside in winter and friendly people living here. Also a restaurant at the front (we didn’t go, had standard fast food). Small shop opposite too. Can put bicycles in rooms, space to park vehicles outside on street. 25Bs/pp

name: Dry riverbed camp
description: We tried the spot up the road but wasn’t good for tent camping. Found this place - just space for a tent in dry mud next to the riverbed. Access is down the dirt road just west of the pin and then walk along the riverbed until you see the clearing on the right. Vehicle access would be difficult (dry riverbed) but bicycles and possibly motos would be okay. Really sheltered from the wind, great night sky, only possible when river is dry!

name: Hostel Serena
description: Lovely Hostel, where you can also put your tent in the amazing garden. There are hammocks and outside barbecues. Children friendly with playground and TV with different movies. We camped for 60 ppn. Huge fully equiped kitchen. Extreamly tasty breakfast!!! Fresh pankakes, scrambled eggs, homemade jam, guacamole, smoothie, fresh fruits, integral bread.... Also possible to park your van. Highly recommended!

name: Cruce ruta F4
description: Good spot to spend a night, we had access to a room to put our mattress and bicycles. Paid 10bol/pp. there are 2 restaurants and a shop with all kind of basics (drinks, snacks)

name: ES Don Daniel Fuel Station
description:
Fuel Station where they fill jerrycans for the price of bolivians (3,73 bolivianos per liter). But they just fill jerrycans, impossible to fill up the car tank direcly. 
The coordinates are aprox. The station is at Avenida Circunvalación.

name: Hospedaje
description: 35 (2024) bob for a single room. hot shower and  toilet in separate room. A lot of restaurants near the place. the hospedaje is along the road, also a small shop.  Place for bicycle inside

name: Gas station
description:
Gas station with security at night. Asked if we can sleep, said no problem. Free.
Clean toilets.

name: Water in 20l bidons
description: Here you can buy water in 20l bidons to refil your bottles. 15 BOB for 20l.

name: Residencial El Puente
description:
Paid 50 bob for two people here for very clean room, shared bathroom with hot water and secure parking for our motorcycle. Best place we had for days traveling from Pampa. 
July 2019: paid 80 for 2

name: Quiet place to sleep
description: It’s a very quiet and calm street to park to sleep. There’s only houses, and almost no traffic. We felt safe to park and spend the night here.

name: Street Parking
description:
We went to this Koi Sushi Bar, which is a very nice restaurant with really good Peruvian and Japanese food by the way (very recommended!) and we decided to park here to sleep this night! 
We spoke with the guardian and he said it was ok, if it would be one night only.
It's a very quiet street in a wealthy neighborhood. There’s a lot of Brazilians as well! :)

name: Servicio de Lubricantes Ronaldino
description: The guy does oil changes for about 30 BOB labor plus oil. Not a wide selection of filters and more like the "crank it on til it fits" type mechanic. Claimed the new filter fit but then when we started it up and it leaked agreed to just clean the old one. Not great at using ramps to get the front up either-scratched our van.

name: Nice & quiet just outside Tupiza
description: Coming from the South, turn right on a dirt track in the village of Yurcuma. The track appears as a hiking trail on maps.me but you can definitely drive up. After about 400-500m, a wide spot is available to camp. The terrain is sandy, but not deep at all (ok for 2WD). Not sure if it's recommended for very heavy rigs though. The place is clean, quiet and hidden from the road and the houses. You could probably even find enough wood to build a fire!

name: Ananiac place
description: Hot shower private room per night 30bol per person nice place and central

name: Optica Santa Lucia
description:
Best Optica shop in Bolivia.
He makes glasses by himself. Has the best and newest machinery, best equipped! and offer the best prices compared to other Shops in Bolivia, much cheaper as in the western world. Very high standards from technicians to sales staff and fast!

name: PAPAVERO
description:
Italian Restaurant. Stunning and delicious, real italian food for great price. E.g. homemade pasta with seafood 45BOL, or lunch 3-course-menue for only 28Bol. Owner Alessandra Ciani is from Italy.
Restaurant is in the 2rd floor

Closed until August 2019

name: Pajchapata
description: Nice place for a 1 night stopover. We camped on the football ground in front of the church. The locals were really welcoming. A tiny shop available in the village. You will find tap water beside the church. Enjoy :)

name: Cementerio de Tortugas
description: 30/40 minutes walk from Torotoro. The entrance fees 5 bob (best to have your park entrance ticket with you in case). We visited the site without an ´official' guide however its possible to do so. A boy (Edwardo) has opened us the doors of this fascinating and curious archeological site. He made us the tour like we never experienced before! Truely exceptionnal.... Nothing too fancy but you get to read some interesting informations, visit the museum, watch a video if you wish - 10 mins, go up to the mirador and get to walk along the cemetery with breathtaking views if you go to top very end! Ps: Edwardo got to make you visit the site!

name: Tarata - Capital de la República
description: You got to stop by this well known pueblo for its history, artisanat but also 2 president de Bolivia are from Tarata. Today, you can walk along the charming paved narrow streets and sit in the beautiful plaza. Few sites to visit. Enjoy :)

name: Hotel Baires
description:
Allowed us to sleep in our van in their secure lot and use the shared bathrooms (with shower). 50 B for the two of us, includes breakfast! 
.....
vinimos enero 2023...pero.no dejaron dormir en auto....pagamos habitación.  sencilla pero limpia y con desayuno 280bbs

name: Inti Wasi
description: Nice Hotel considering the town. Big rooms with five beds for 60 bs. 3 blocks up the main park. People in this town seems happy.

name: Mercado (the best in town)
description: You gotta to go off the tourist attractions and discover that huge indoor and outdoor local mercado. Enjoy!

name: Hotel Anahí
description: Hotel Anahí is a nice and clean Hotel in the center. Shared but clean bathroom with warm electric shower. Friendly owner speaks a bit English. Had another place where we could safely park our bikes (there is a swimming pool). Cost 50bol pP. Several local restaurants nearby

name: IVECO Don Walter Martinez
description:
Imcruz Iveco (other iOverlander Spot) could not help us and recommended Don Walter. He has some Iveco spare parts, but not for our old Turbodaily. He improvised and did a very good job. I watched him carefully, but he was careful and seems to know what he is doing.

Its a small Workshop. The door has big blue Iveco logos. Entrance is only from the dirt road from the east, not from the big street...

Price is very fair. We payed 130 Bob for 3h of work and small parts.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Cop asked for license and declaración jurada (the one you get when entering the country). He stamped the declaración and asked for the usual 5Bob bride. I told him I had never been asked to pay for anything else than the usual tolls, and he just told me to move on.

name: Market
description: The biggest market in town! Not to be missed. You will find anything you need.

name: parking next to the road
description: became dark needed place to sleep. nothing special but it was level. noisy till around 11pm. You could put up tent but lots of stones.

name: ES Los Negros
description:
They only allowed us to fill up our jerrycan, wouldn’t put gas straight in the tank. 
We did pay the local price for the cans we filled up (40liter)

name: Police Checkpoint Irupana
description: Cops stopped us when we were leaving Irupana. Very cold until we told them we were not Chileans despite the car's plate. Then very friendly! Asked for driving license, passport and immigration document. They told us not to stop for anybody unless it is a cop. Apparently some people have been robbed. So if you drive in the region, only stop for cops with a yellow shortleeves jacket

name: Termas Del Rosario
description:
This is a beautiful place!! You can shower in termal water!! We pay 5 bs p person and also sleep here!!! Is very quiet in the night!! 
20 bs for private one (1h)

name: centro civico
description: beautiful place to park and sleep at night, facing a square with tables to eat

name: Cosmopolitano Boutique hotel
description:
If you have money to spent, this is the place to go! 
We had a visitor over for two weeks and after two weeks of camping we decided to treat ourselves the day before our visitor flew back home again and this hotel has been amazing. 
The nicest hotel we’ve been to in a long long while. Of course you also pay for it, but the hotel is super modern, has incredible good rain showers, extremely clean and most importantly (for us) they are pet friendly. 
We needed to pay a bit extra for our dog, but they were happy to have her here. 

In the end we paid 1000 BOL for two rooms and a dog (not sure about the actual price per room as the rooms were different in size). 

It seems that the prices on booking.com are a bit lower than what you pay if you come directly. Especially in high season I think you have to book in advance. 

I can’t stop bragging about this hotel. The breakfast was amazing (they can make pancakes for you and they are filled with honey, strawberries, nuts, granola, banana) and the staff was also so nice and eager to help us. Even the cleaning guy was really good and friendly ;). 

We could park our Toyota 4Runner safely in front of the hotel, but if you have a big rig they will sent you to a parking spot nearby (and in Santa Cruz there is a secure parking every 100 meters or so)

name: Alojamiento El Pescador
description: Nice and clean rooms for 30 bos pp. Hot showers and we could park our motorcycle inside courtyard.

name: Hostel Yanacocha
description: Basic hostel, parking half a block way for extra 15(negotiable), warm shower, kitchen, shared and private rooms, friendly environment, central, 35bob/night in shared room.

name: PERFECT Truck/Car Wash or Protection
description:
Great place to wash your vehicle. All Rigs will fit and they even lift it up to clean the underside. They even wash big busses there.
We went here to get an underbody protection (oil+Diesel) before going to the Salar de uyuni.

They did a thoroug 2,5h wash and even did our engreasadores (German: Fettnippel). They charged us 180Bob for our Iveco Truck. Not cheap but definately worth the money in our opinion...

name: Salty Desert Aventours
description: Great tour agency, had a nice time on our 3 day tour. Same price as others for basically same tour. William wàs  our driver/guide...took good care of us. A couple got sick on the trip and he helped them out a lot so they enjoyed it still. Decent food. Were top ranked on trip advisor when we went.

name: YPFB
description: Tried to charge foreigner price in my jerry can. Talked them down to 5 bob/L for gasoline in the end (local price about 3.9). Had a police officer stationed here but he was easy going enough. Filled a 2nd jerry can same price no worries.

name: BANCO FIE
description:
ATM open 24hours.

Possible to  withdraw cash with MASTERCARD  without any fees. (After 1 week looking for it !!! )

We were able to withdraw (2500 bolivianos : 1000+1500)

name: Mirador Muela Del Diablo
description:
Easy access from the ma in road, just turn on a small track. Coming from South there are no signs for the entrance. 
Small camping area with a lot of space for every kind of rig. Also two or three big rigs can fit. not so much leveled but you can find the solution with some stones.
There is also a nice small trekking, all steps, to reach the mirador. it takes one hour. really nice view from the top to see the Chacho.
Area with barbecues and toilet (closed when we stay). really quiet in the night.

name: Dakar servicio
description:
Fernando is a very nice and good mecano. He can work quickly and know what he's doing. He is on maps me : garage mécanique dakar. Phone number : +59170138825
Prices are very correct. 
We were very happy to find him. 
We were very welcome. We can sleep in front of his tailer many nights. The areas is very quiet ( in front of the cimentario;) close to collectivo and supermarket. We had water too. 
We recommanded him !!!

name: Residencial Melissa
description: Residencial Melissa is a very beautyful cheap hotel where to stay. Is located close to the bus terminal and 10 minuts walking from the center. It Is owned by a very sweet and hospital bolivian family. For a single bed room (shared bathroom) they charged me only 50 Pesos Boliviano for night! At the end i stayed one week and they extended my chek out until 1 o'clock AM for free cause i needed to wait the night bus in some place. The room is very clean and quite. The bed is suoer confortable and very large! There is a very big cooling fan on the table that i never use cause i came in winter; otherwise the room was warm enough to sleep very confortable.The toilets are clean and provide with very hot shower (too much)! The free wifi is very good, stable and super fast! There is no restaurant or kitchen inside but just outside there are a lot of place where to eat. Enjoy residencial Melissa and Villamontes!

name: Colcha
description:
*Please confirm location of this place. No road observed on map view.
.....
A nice spot at 4550m elevation. It’s not hidden from the road at all, but there are no tour jeeps between 5pm and 9am in July. If you’re here before 5pm, be ready to wave at thousands of tourists. Good for tents as well.

name: Pic-nic with the lamas
description: One the way to Salinas......Nice place to pic-nic or rest in front of the volcano Tunupa surrounded by lamas. Road can be sandy and rocky.

name: Policlinica Oruro Centro Medico
description: A really good medical centre. 100 bob for a consultation. All services available: cardiologia, ginecologia, neumologia, pediatria, urologia, radiologia...

name: Balneario El Quebracho
description:
To the west of the square next to the christ monument in the middle of the road. Large site with swimming pools. pitching a tent was 30 bob one person and motorcycle. Lots of birds here so noisy at dawn. Power at the picnic tables. Cold showers.  There are cabanas here too but not sure of the price. The place seems to be undergoing refurbishment. Apart from the dawn chorus, nice quiet place to stay.
We are 2m90 and at the entrance there is a welcome sign at 2m70. We had to enter from the exit road. But be careful there are some cables between the trees. We passed but it was tricky!

name: Woods
description: Woodland camping in spot good for tent and motorcycle. Fairly well hidden from the road. No traffic goes by. Cars, vans can park at the side but not as well hidden as further up the lane.

name: River with a view
description: Beautiful wildcamp spot in the river valley just benath the little village Bermejo. Spectacular mountain view, no rubbish, perfect for a campfire.

name: Tienda Doña Victoria (San Juan)
description: Small food store held by doña Victoria, a very charming woman who let us use her table to eat our pic-nic in the coolness of her shop. Here you won’t find any lunch food but some basic products such as rice, pasta, dulce de leche, even wine and beer !

name: ORURO Friendly Lively City
description: ORURO is definitly a stopover for everyone who travels in Bolivia. The city is filled with historical architecture, artworks, very interesting museums and treks. The city is colourful and lively. I keep reading its an unfriendly city: WRONG! The people here like everywhere in Bolivia, are very friendly. Oruro, capital of Carnaval of Bolivia (btw february and march).

name: Lavanderia Salcerio
description: The BEST laundry in Bolivie. Very very friendly staff. They take your clothes in charge for 30 bob/machine (wash and dry). The clothes smelled so nice afterwards. All nice and folded. We def recommend!

name: Calle Apolinar Jaén
description: Narrow road, know in the colony as "Qawra Cancha". Paved street with architectural features. A must seen place in La Paz. Many cafes, shops, restaurants and a folk museum available. A tourist (tickets) information office is also located on the street.

name: Seguros Illimani
description:
*Unfortunately, it is not possible to take out insurance here for a car that does not have a Bolivian number plate.

Insurance for Moto and Cars for Bolivia,  Brazil, Argentina, Chile and Uruguay. 
One month 50 Dollar, 2 Month 80 $- 3 month 110 $. Up to one year. 
After 30 days in Bolivia you need and insurance also for entering Peru. You need insurance in advance. 
Not possible online - you need to go there. 
Documents you need:
Driving licence
Document of your Car
TIP.

Prices for Car and motorbike are the Same. Only damages to other Cars are protected up to 5000$.

name: Peaje (keep your receipt)
description: At this peaje we paid 6BOB to drive on route 11 towards Tarija. We kept the receipt, and when we got to the next peaje 10-12 km before Tarija, we were asked to show the receipt. The lady checked it and we were waved through, without any additional payment :-).

name: Maya Inn
description:
Hostel is at the top of Calvo not San Alberto. Just walk around the block from where it is displayed on this map.

We turned up here without a booking and paid 35 BOB per person per night for a 6-bed dorm. This is the price for 2 nights or more. Only 1 night costs 40 BOB. Basic hostel with kitchen and good wifi. Basic breakfast included. Showers only lukewarm.

name: banco union
description: Bank ATM without extra fee. Worked with my visa Card. could only draw out 500 bolivianos at the time, but worked well & didnt charge extra fee

name: City Sloths
description: At the plaza right off the main road, there are sloths in the trees. If you dont see them as one of the street vendors. A fun stop.

name: Hostal / tienda / restaurant Katarina
description: Good place to relax after a sandy ride with your bicycle if following Andes By Bike. We went on the main pace and talked with Katarina who has a little shop in a corner. She cooked us a delicious soup and lama meal for just 15bob. We bought food in her shop an asked for a room for free and she accepted! We had a big room with 2 mattress on the floor but it was perfect to relax. Very nice family !!!

name: Soccer Field
description: Tranquil option for the night, some kids came to kick with our kids. Quite dusty.

name: Aduana
description:
Here you can make your TIP Extension
You have to come with your Car or Motorbike.
They check FIN and the Plate.
Documents you need:
Driving Licence
Paper of the Vehicle
Passport
TIP from your Car

Fast and friendly

name: Mechanic
description: We went there for our brakes. They where very friendly and helpful. Our brake cylinder was broken so we had to change 4 brake pads. We need 3 days to get new brake zylinder for our Mercedes T2 . (Formula 1 in Av. Ostria Gutierrez #126 has parts from Brazil and Argentina - its on iOverlander). We left our car for 3 days there (couldn't sleep in it) and after we brought them the new cylinder they fixed everything and we paid 600 BOB for 4 new brake pads and the work - very friendly and fair.

name: Bethel: The best lavenderia ever
description:
We had tons of dirty cloths from the dusty roads of North Argentina.
After looking for hours we found this Place.  Maybe the only one in town.
Sweet owners,open all day unlike Argentina.
Original price was 13 peso per kilo but we had 14 kilos and got a deal of 9 per kilo. Put it all at 13 and was ready by 18. 
Highly recommended.

name: Auto Spa
description: Servicio Mecanico, Estetica Automotriz, Lavado intergral de vehículos, Equipamiento para viajes

name: Banana Store
description: I asked the locals behind this banana store if I could sleep here as the rain was about to fall and it was almost dark. They said yes and I got a nice roof and nice wall where to hammock for the night. Enough room to place my bicycle inside too. No windows and a metal door to close the entrance. Next to the road so quite noisy.

name: Limpieza Cristal
description:
10bol/kilo. 
We get the laundry after 2 days back. 
Good service.

name: hotel
description:
Very nice hotel, look for the big sign, you can't miss it. Nice rooms, 80 bob for two beds. 140 bob for 2 beds, a/c and private bathroom. Lots of parking space. They have a store attached, and may serve food as well. Wifi included. One of the best places we have stayed for this price.
The owner and workers are very friendly. The whole town is actually.

name: Puerto Viejo
description:
This was the best restaurant we found in Copacabana. We and other friends tried others which were both really bad. This is a little bit more expensive than the regular price on the street (most menu del dia are $20-25Bol) and this one is $35 Bol. But the food is good, the service is good, the music was good both days we came, and the portion was ok - one day was bigger than the other! And they have a hitter inside and WiFi. 
Recommended! :)

name: Bajo Cerro
description:
This is the official bottled water supplier.
Ring the bell at the wooden door. There is no sign at the door. (See the picture)
14bol for 20liters.

name: Peaje Colchani
description:
Toll. 5BOB for going to the entrance of the Salar (Colchani), 16BOB going to Challapata. On our first ride to the Salar they asked for 18BOB.


Update: car to Challapata 11

name: Hostal Sucursal del Cielo
description:
A small but familiar hostel in the city center. The owner Geraldo is very welcoming. There is a beautiful rooftop terrace overlooking the city. The hostel has three rooms, a kitchen and two bathrooms with toilet and hot shower. Great wifi.
You can prebook through booking.com or call Geraldo at +591 63778558 Great place!
Double room for 50bol pp, garage next door for 10bol per night.

name: Not yet named Hostel / Hotel
description: Located on main plaza and seems like the only place in town.  Very nice people - they let us stay even though the hotel isn’t finished and they were on the way to Sucre for the night!

name: Hidden clearing in the woods
description:
Small dirt road leads 150 meters into the forest to a dead end. Some trash around and obviously a place where locals come to drink beer. But it is well hidden and very quiet at night. Not good for big rigs so don't try with anything larger than a sprinter. Possible to set up a tent in several places.
Only company we got was a few curious cows.

name: Gas Station
description:
We slept over night here during the fiesta, it wasn't too loud. Public bathrooms and shower just across the street. 

Now the road is being upgraded and will likely be MUCH better by end of 2018. in mid 2019 it should be complete. there's a large Chinese camp of workers building it.

name: San Bartolo Soccer Field
description: Quiet place to spend the night, next to school. Friendly locals. Small shop with toilets on the main road around the corner. Some donkeys and cattle around.

name: Crater Mirador
description:
Mirador of the crater
It has gravel parking , lot of space for free camping, abandoned houses, bit windy, near from the village but its looks very very quiet.

name: La Abrita
description: Cozy and warm cabin with two privates (one matrimonial bed) and another big dorm in another building for woofing volunteers.

name: Seres, good Mechanic!
description: We did some minor mechanic work to our car here. Erwin is a good guy. helpful and easy to communicate with. whatsapp is: +591-7153305 email: erwin.seres@gmail.com

name: Electromechanic in uyuni
description:
My starter died, luckily after getting back from the salar. I went to the other electromechanic in iOverlander and the guy was not helpfulFound this place,  the owner is John. He drove me to my car after hours to see the problem, and came first thing in the morning to help me jump start it and drive it to his shop. Charged me 200 BP and helped me with other electrical issues as well. Good service, good attitude! Highly recomended.
He doesn't have a sign outside. It's the red gate left of the entrance to Noa Noa.

name: Amazing viewpoint
description: Once you get here while hiking you won't regret it. You will stand in the middel of red sand, surrounded by red mountains and all the other mountains around this gorgeous area. You will have a fabulous view into the valley and Toro Toro! It's just enjoyable and a lot of fun to hike up there. You can get there from the tag "Entrance to 7 Vueltas for free", for example and then just continue downhill this mountain into a river bed back to the main road or keep going uphill to the next mountain, which is another beautiful spot.

name: Spanish Friends
description: They have separate dorms for men and women only. Price is 45 BOB per person with a good breakfast (very strong coffee, bread, bananas, papaya, two different kind of jam, butter and tea). They also have private rooms for 100 BOB. There is a good and nice kitchen as well you can use for cooking. The lady who opened us the door at 5am is super friendly and kind. The Hostal is totally clean and they offer Spanish lessons. Above average hostal and perfect for low budget traveller!

name: Hostal Norte
description: We turned up without a booking and paid 35BOB per person per night for a twin room (3-bed rooms available for the same price apparently). Very central location. Doña Margarita is the owner, very friendly. No kitchen, but Comida hall is just around the corner for cheap breakfasts, lunches and dinners. No wifi. Clean bathrooms and (lukewarm at most) showers. Can recommend.

name: Abandoned building
description:
Abandoned building close to the main road but hidden and far enough to be quiet.
Some trash, but lot of options to be protected from the wind.
Good place before or after the border, But maybe not a good option in the weekend because some beer cans and other clues make us think it's a party place. But for us, Monday night, it was really quiet!

name: Wild camp next to awesome rock formation and animals cave!
description: Great wild camping spot (tent only), find a small ‘path’ leading down to level ground by the rocks and pick a place for your tent. Area is sheltered by the surrounding cliffs and vegetation. Visible from the road (in daylight) but invisible at night, the road is quiet anyway. It’s down a bit of a hill and about 100m from the road, inaccessible by vehicle (only bicycles/on foot), so we felt safe here. Cool little animals like in the cliffs (in the cave - we don’t know what they are!), and llamas and birds around. Awesome place!

name: big parking area
description: big flat parking area with nice view. hidden from the road when you park in the back. Good Tigo Signal

name: Paceña La Salteña
description:
Really good Salteñas and if you like spicy food they have a Carne Picante that made me cry a little. 
But not quite as much filling as the El Hornito salteñas.

name: Delicious and cheap Tacos (El biloche de Alan)
description: The tacos are good but actually small NOT big. 20bol for one small, we didn’t had enough. It is actually more a bar than a place to eat. But a really nice and small bar with candlelight and lots of locals come here (holds 6 tables)

name: Hostal Choquemaria
description: 40bs by person for a private room for 2 people with shared shower There is no kitchen Checkout 11:30 WiFi low/medium

name: Across from the Mercado
description: We pulled into the lot here late in the afternoon.  There are public banks across the street but they were locked. There are tiendas and a few restaurants.

name: carpenter
description: nice carpenter shop for basic stuff. kid was 15 years old (the hisses son) but made a nice little platform for our bed for 150 bol

name: 6 de Agosto
description:
Hostal really well located, in the main street
I had a cold (no heating device) but private room, with Wi-Fi during reception hours (7am-10pm) and shared baths (hot shower, but cold because not completely closed) for 20 BOB

name: North turn off to Incallajta
description: We came from Tiraque and GPS directed us this way as it's shorter.  Road deteriorates quickly and we turned back to F7 to take the southern better road which is actually called "Camino Inca". Not saying not doable, just be aware you'll probably Ned 4x4.  We only went about 1.5 km up.

name: tire stores
description: lots of tire shops. many sell off-road tires. I got BF GOODRICH AT for $220 each which is about the same everywhere. check for the fabrication dates. mounting and alignment was another 200 bol

name: Plaza de Mataral
description: We'd enough of the construction on F7 going south east to Samaipata.  Stopped here around 4 and locals said safe to park. Lots of dogs barking intermittently during the night.

name: good metal shop (metal turning)
description: if you need metal parts turned these guys are good. paid 40 bol for two parts I needed modified for my shocks.

name: Spot to sleep
description:
Small quiet spot, set back from the road. Ideal for a pose or a night

Petit spot tranquil, en retrait de la route. Idéal pour une pose ou une nuit

name: agua potable de la municipalidad
description:
here is a pump with drinkable water

aquí hay une pompa con agua potable

il y a ici une pompe avec de l'eau potable

name: small place in wild
description:
small quiet place. help out well because everything is private at the lake. 1 big place or 2 places one behind the other

petit endroit au calme. dépanne bien car tout edt privé au bord du lac. 1 grande place ou 2 places l'un derrière l'autre
Pedrodebdx

name: Agua aquí
description: we've found water here. it's in the middle of the place of the village.

name: Euro Taller - Carlos
description: Full-service mechanic swapped my shocks for me. we needed to modify a metal spacer and he drive me to the metal shop and skipped his lunch to finish. I can't speak to his expertise in other areas but it seems like a well run shop.

name: alojamiento
description: very very basic room, very expensive To sleep on a dead matress.... we ask for an other bed cause very hard, like wood,  but  the woman very antipathic....no recomanded. price 80 bol for double room at 3th with shower at the 1rst floor...not clean.

name: Amazing viewpoint
description: This is an absolutely amazing viewpoint. You have a great view into both ways of the valley, standing in red soil with beautiful structure of the rocks and you can see entire Toro Toro. Really worth it to do a little day hike over there and the best is you don't have to pay anything for it. Check Maps.Me to navigate yourself to that spot. Good luck and take care!

name: Private House
description:
If you don’t get gasoline at this location, don’t despair. Ask around. Somebody in this town will find gasoline for you. Expect to pay almost double the local rate. We were grateful to pay the price. Not sure about diesel.
.....
They sell gaz for 5bol per liter just next to the road. a shop with a sign "entel" in blue painted on the wall

name: Plaza Central de Corque
description: Small tienda after the Plaza Central de Corque . Got 40 liters of gas for 6 bol per liter without negotiations. They have diesel as well.

name: Alojamiento Copacabana
description:
Good place for a night with friendly owners (old lady who is very hard of hearing and her sons), pretty quiet at night but seemed quite busy. 20Bs pp or 25 each if you want a shower. Would recommend the showers, really hot and good pressure. Also has good Wi-fi here! Space for bicycles inside the courtyard, probably park a vehicle outside. The beds are very old (saggy thin mattresses and creaky) but have plenty of covers and the room is clean and big enough. We had one on the 3rd floor facing over the courtyard at the back and it got the sun until late so the room stayed lovely and warm. 
If you want a hot shower and a no frills place to stay for a night, this is a good place for the money!

name: Gravel pit sunrise wildcamp
description: Good place to stop on the way to Maragua on the back roads. Gravel pit with lots of flat space for vehicles and tents, and walls give some shelter. It is mostly visible from the road but very safe as only one car went past at 6pm and nothing in the morning! Awesome sunset and sunrise over the mountains from here, you get the sun straight away. Great views!

name: Mecanica 939 - Welding & Fabrication
description: If you need stuff welding or fabricating, this is the place to go. We were recommended to go here by Todo Moto. We had my exhaust and frame welded and two brackets fabricated and the work was good. He can weld most materials and they had special rods to weld two dissimilar materials if absolutely necessary.

name: Los Jardins Del Sol
description:
Just before Sol y Luna on the right. They have cabanas with kitchens and bathrooms. They have several dormitories. They have a covered space for about 4 tents.  They have secure parking and are dog friendly. 

Beautiful views. Many hammocks. A swimming pool. Spring water. 

I asked for meals and they prepared for me excellent food. But I am solo. Rooms include breakfast. I loved my time here, and so did my dog.

Tent 35 bols per person
Dormitory 100 bols per person
Cabanas 100 bols per person

Driveway down to main house is steep but can be done carefully without a 4 x 4. There is room near the dormitory for a car with a rooftop tent. 

Easy walk into town, maybe 30 minutes or less. You can take a taxi back for about 20 bols.

name: Diamond Hotel
description:
Single 100bols a night. Secure Parking for three cars. 10bols a night. Tall ceiling so a SUV with roof top tent will fit. 

Rooms are clean and nice. They gave me a double for the same price. Dog friendly. HBO in English and CNN. WiFi is okay. Hot showers and breakfast, which is good, not great. 

Quiet neighborhood. Pleasant area. Not a long walk to Central area.

name: wild camp
description: We spend here one perfect night. We don't hear any noise, so quiet and such a nice view

name: Sweet night Ascencion del Carmen de Ruiz
description:
On this new road we have sleep with our motorhome near the football place in a field.
It's near all the houses of this little village.
We ask to the people who live here for the permission to sleep here and there was realy nice.
There is some light around this place.
In the middle of the field you have potable water with a hand pump (the village take their water here)

name: Spot Rodero Virgen del Rosaire
description: ADMIN NOTE: a user reported on 2020-01-11: People in the neighborhood tried to send us away in the middle of the night. At 6am in the Morning they knocked again at the door. So we left this place. Overlander are not welcome here.

name: La casa del perno
description:
The place to Uyuni if you need to find a bolt, a nut or something like this....!😉
Romulo Ramiro the owner is very friendly.
Adress Direction Perou between19 and 21 zona de julio Uyuni.
Contact: 73889434
metalpaintconymar@gmail.com

name: Tomatas place for night
description:
In the village of Tomatas.
You have a road on your right just before the bridge when you come from Uyuni.
You'll find two soccer pitch.
When you arrived the one on the right just near school seems perfect for the night but you have a lot of places all around.
We asked at the first house near this place and they were friendly and say no problem to put our motorhome here.
The road to acces is easy.
Big rig friendly .
You see the road and hear just a little.
Very quiet night.
Enjoy.

name: Tranqui Village next highway
description: on the way to la paz a nice place for overnight. right next to the main road but quite. u turn and after 50m at the left side is a little tiny church with water tap for free in the front. we parked behind the church with a nice view on the mountains. we asked people to stay, recommend to do this. it’s kind. they are very kind and was no problem. in the morning some people past and kids too. but really sweet.

name: Free potable water @ Uyuni’s central market
description:
First, the coordinates aren’t exact, but very close from here (patio in front of the medical center - just ask for it). 
On the back of the central market is a tap with potable and fine water - right next to the coca sellers. 
If you don’t find it, ask the ladies (where the « pila » is) in the market !

Perfect to fill in buckets and jerricans, but I think you can’t fill your tank if you have one (not easy to park close enough).

name: Plaza de Belen de Andamarca
description:
You can park in the central square, the residents are very friendly and curious.
It is entered from Santiago de Andamarca (or simply Andamarca as the posters are)
The town is beautiful and you can visit a source of water that sprout from the ground 15 minutes by car in the direction of San Martín. I do not recommend continuing on that rubble since it is not good and the landscapes are not so different. If I did it again, from the wells where the water arises I return to Santiago de Andamarca to continue on asphalt.

---

Se puede estacionar en la plaza central, los pobladores son muy amables y curiosos.
Se ingresa desde Santiago de Andamarca (o simplemente Andamarca como está los carteles)
El pueblo es hermoso y se puede visitar una fuentes de agua que brotan del suelo a 15min en auto en sentido a San Martín. No recomiendo seguir por ese ripio ya que no es bueno y los paisajes no son tan diferentes. Si lo volviera a hacerlo, de los pozos donde surge el agua vuelvo a Santiago de Andamarca para seguir por asfalto.

name: Really Good Local restaurant
description:
Pensión Valencia- Apparently this is the name of this small restaurant, but it doesn’t have any name in front of it. The place was a local suggestion and was so good!! A soup and a plate of chicken with rice or spaghetti and a juice for $12 Bol pp. This was today, they probably the menu of the day every day... Much better than the touristic restaurant, and much much cheaper!!! The presentation of the food was beautiful too.The place is simple, clean, cozy with a hitter and they were super happy when I told them I will put it on this app!! 
Hope you all enjoy too!! :)

name: Off RN1 south of Oruru. Sora village
description: Off RN1 300m to the east in a small village. Drive to the village square and ask one of the neighbors for permission to park for the night. They were very friendly and welcoming. A nice spot if you're on your way to/from Uyuni and you want a secure place for the night.  A little close  to the main road but not much traffic during the night. You have to be self sufficient.

name: Samy Wasi, Galeria de Arte y Café Restaurant
description:
Nice Restaurant, with Patio in old Family house. 
Safe parking on the street in front of the house available for big rigs. The Restaurant opens on sundays .
Culture Center with expositions and traditional Dancing Performance on sundays noon.

name: Beach Camp
description:
Follow the road from the plaza to the radio antenna and beyond. There is a bit rubbish but enough clean spots.
Just some fishermen doing their work at 3 - 4 am. Strong winds in the evening stopped at 10.30pm.
Enjoy a beautiful sunset at Lake Titicaca.

name: ES Volcan
description: No problem getting gas. Cost is 8.6 Bs per litre. they have diesel too.

name: Laguna Qara Khota shore
description:
Beautiful spot at the shore of a lake with the Cordillera Real mountain range in the background. Not much parking except on the side of the road. Space for a couple of tents. This spot is tent only. But If you are in a van or truck there is a couple of really nice spots near at the south end of the lake. The few locals that lives out here were super friendly.
The Cordillera Real mountain range is great for hiking. Just choose  direction and go. We stayed here on a 14 day hike from Sorata to Hyuna Potosí.

name: Terracotta Restolounge and Camping
description:
After a wonderful meal talked with the owner about staying the night. Friendly owner.
They are planning to offer a camping area.
 We suggested to pay 25 bol pp for the night.

 The entrace is a bit tricky as you need to cross a small, if it's not raining, river and then drive up a rather narrow and steep driveway. We made it in a 170 wheelbase sprinter as there's room to turn but we could not fit through the actual gate. We camped outside the gate on the dead end driveway. 
 There is also a working ceramic tile studio.

name: street full of motorcycle shops
description: This area is full of motorcycle parts shops and mechanics. Lots of selection for oil, tires and many other parts, accessories and clothing.

name: Pozas del Vagante
description:
When you arrive to the pozas, across the bridge there is space for one or two vehicles. beautiful area where you can enjoy the sounds of water and birds... we slept one night, the locals didn't mind. 
The road (dirt) was ok in dry conditions but i can imagine it's a nightmare in heavy rain.

name: Quiet place opposite to Luna Verde restaurant
description: We arrived late, had a nice  small dinner with good local wine and stayed overnight on the other side of the entrance absolutely quiet and save.

name: Pontón Palos Blancos
description: 15 Bol one way. Had to cross here since the workers were blocking the main road with gravel piles due to unpaid salaries

name: Hostal Tropico
description: 100 BOB per night. After talking for a while got it to be 60 BOB. Really basic for being called hostal. No kitchen with the excuse that everyone goes out to eat. No wifi or internet. Shared bathroom but don't expect much privacy if the place is crowded. Room is old and one electricity plug next to the door. It smelled like if it hadn't been opened in ages. Straw matresses. It has a huge fan in the ceiling so at least got the air to flow with the thing on and I guess in heat season you welcome it a lot. No parking but you could park in the main square, as for the bicycle I got it inside. Bassically is just a place to sleep and be gone. There may be better options around but I was stomach ill and I needed a rest asap so didn't look for more options.

name: Open space
description: Next to the road. Next to some trees and bushes. No big deal for a night. Can not be seen from the road. No wild animals so far. Quiet as the road is not busy at all. Just lots of mosquitoes and bees. The usual.

name: bush camp next rock wall at rio grande (great fishing)
description: head 1 to 2 km south out of town and turn left down a dirt road. drive up the riverbank for a couple of hundred meters. plenty of firewood and sun to dry your tents at 8h30. we had some cows and horse trotting by. if you catch a Wels catfish, cut them open all along the tummy and crack them open to pull the meet out et voilà tasty filet parts.

name: By a river
description: In front of the gate of the Estancia Alianza. A little bit far of the road. No facilities. Very quiet. Good for one night.

name: Cliff edge wildcamp
description: Reasonably flat spot for tents on a bit of land just off the road, just before small village of Yanani,  slightly visible from the road but it’s quiet at night. More for bicycles and hikers with a tent but there is a small track off of the corner of the road so you could probably pull in just off the road with a car too. Good views of the valley, great sunset, pretty high at 3300m so gets a bit cold but it’s pretty sheltered here with some bushes around, just depends on wind direction! Nice place to spend a night.

name: Alojamiento Anzaldo
description:
Basic  accommodation with warm showers,  big rooms with clean bedding and reasonably comfortable beds. Space for bicycles and motorbikes inside the courtyard, which is really big with lots of tables and chairs. 
You have to call the lady that runs it when she’s not there, but the shop keeper next door told us where she lived as we didn’t have a phone. 25Bs per person. Good for a night passing through Anzaldo.

name: Triller Hostel
description: Basic Hostel with plenty of options (shared or private bathroom). I went for the shared bathroom which was 40 Bol per night. Bed was bad though and the bathroom clean only for some hours after the lady cleaned. Ceiling fan in the room. Rooms with a/c available. They charge 5 Bol for the wifi per device which lasts only the night as they change the password everyday.  It wasn't that noisy as expected considering the size of the place. 14 rooms per floor and 3 floors in my wing. I think they have three wings. Ok for a night or two but wouldn't stay longer here. Location is central to almost everything.

name: Corrupted police officer
description:
The police barrage was a bit earlier (coming from Santa Cruz to go on San Ignacio), but on this road...

There is a check point - normally just check the papers and let you go - but the police officer tried to tell us we overstayed in Bolivia, showing us the date of... our entrance in the country. I showed him the real date.

Then he wanted us to pay for crossing the pueblo. I said it was funny that the lady coming from the other side (a local woman) didn’t had to pay.

Then he said it was a volunteer collaboration. We stayed polite and refused to “collaborate”, even if he insisted.

At least, no passo nada, we just went away.

Please, never “collaborate” with this kind of corrupted cops ! If we go into their game, they will never stop !!!

With a stronger one, say (pick one or combine) :

- that you need a receipt signed with his name and matricule number 

- that you don’t understand well what’s going on and tell him you have to call your embassy, that he will talk with them, and that you do only what your embassy says.

Even calling a random number should be enough to make them give up .

- that you’re a lawyer/attorney (it worked for us once)


Ps : don’t know if we were lucky or what, but it seems that there are many more corrupted cops in the Santa Cruz region than in other places in Bolivia. We had no troubles in Peru, no troubles in Bolivia from Titicaca to the South Lipez, going through La Paz, Sucre, Potosi... But since we arrived near Santa Cruz, we met plenty of them ! So if you’re starting your trip here, don’t bother and don’t worry ! Everywhere is not like here !!!

name: Nanci Bcp
description: Maestro visa and MasterCard 2000bol at once

name: hostel fausto
description: hostel comfort with terrace and kitchen. 60 boliviano with shared bathroom and 70 in private.

name: Cementery parking
description: Parking next to cementery and playground. Watertap on Playground. Level Parking.

name: Laguna Altura trailhead and parking
description: Really beautiful hike to Laguna Altura. The trail is on maps.me but it's well marked. This is the trailhead/parking. Room for 4 to 6 cars. 4x4 recommended as there's some soft sand. Hike is easy with a gradual slope. Took us 1 hour 15 minutes up and 50 minutes back. You'll cross the Chilean border but only vicuñas to check your passport. We just went to the lake and back but if you wanted you could do the whole loop. Highly recommended!

name: Trailhead to Sajama
description: We parked and camped here at the trailhead to the Nevada Sajama base camp. 4x4 recommend. High clearance necessary. There's a shelter we used for cooking out of the wind. You could put a tent inside the shelter. Beautiful views. No facilities. Hike takes 1 hour 20 mins up and 1 hour back. Really easy, gradual incline, and so beautiful. Don't start too early or Sajama will be shaded!

name: Senasag
description: To get exit papers for your dog go to a get 1st and get a certificate of deparitization (internal and external) as well as your rabies vaccine and other health records. bring those here and they will give you a paper to take to Banco Union to pay 277 Bol. make copies of the health records and bring everything back to senasag. then wait an hour for them to make the form which is valid for 10 days. You must specify which border on the form.

name: vet
description:
Decent vet which seemed popular with locals and quite clean.
We came here to have our existing rabies certificate copied into the official Bolivian format. they charged 100 bol which seems a bit silly but I was too tired to argue. 
We plan to go back to have our dogs tooth looked at.

name: Alojamiento
description: Very basic and not too clean alojamiento. 40 BOB p.p. no running water, no TP

name: Hotel Bella Vista
description: Nice hotel. Clean room. Private room with bathroom for 250bob but we took a double with shared bathroom for 180bob. Hot and powerful shower. Off street parking at the front of the hotel for 3 cars. Breakfast included.

name: International Hostal
description:
Parking for one car off the street. Very nice courtyard to sit in. Has WiFi. One block from the square. Private rooms. 50 bols for one person with shared bath. Dog friendly. 

Rooms are reasonable shape. Bedding looks nice. One of the only places to stay in town.

name: Up a steep dirt track
description:
Flat space for a tent or two on top of the hill looking over the town of Llavini. Access is by the steep dirt track just below this point, it would be quite tricky to access for vehicles as it’s really steep and loose, perfect for bicycles and possibly motos too, as tent camping is quite sparse on the Ruta 4 between Cochabamba and la Paz. 

This is a great space looking over the surrounding valleys and even as far as Cochabamba, you get the sun first thing too which is nice. Road noise at night but it’s so far up the hill you can’t be seen by anyone so it’s very safe, no sign of any vehicles or people having been up here.

name: Bala Tours Ecolodge
description: Ecolodge in the middle of the jungle in Madidi national park

name: Tirara
description:
bicycle friendly. location is when you came from Patacamaya on the left .
two courtyards. perfect to protect from the wind

name: Paititi Hostel
description:
40 soles for dorm.
not in the city centre but u can take Teleferico, cable car metro. is near the Cementario station red line for 3 soles
walking back to hostel is a workout as it is situated higher up

basic breakfast. bread and boiled egg and cereal

hot shower
good WiFi
Good for its price

name: Church
description:
Desperate in rain, the town had no hotel
Seek Refuge in the church
Father Francisco welcomed me to camp in his corridor sheltered from the cold. 
if you are on bicycle, or like me on skateboard, you are welcome
and do cook  and share a meal with Father

name: School
description:
The football field was too open for the wind. 
thus I approached the school and asked the teacher. 
he gave me the abandoned classroom.
shattered glass all over the floor but is good for me after some cleaning. just need shelter from the wind

name: Alojamiento
description: No signs so you have to ask the locals for directions. 20 Bolivianos per person. There are a lot of sand storms in this area and strong winds... so if you don't want to wild camp this is a good place to sleep. Safe place to park your motorcycle or bicycle. Running water, toilets and a shower.

name: Mirador
description:
A viewpoint
good place to camp
no facilities

name: Piedras Blanca
description:
80 bob for a dorm room but one of the best hostel in South America. European style hostel.
extremely clean.
beds come with 2 individual power outlets and lockers small and large for backpack.
Many toilet cubicles for use so you don't have to compete for them in the morning.
wellequipped kitchen, lounge and TV.

name: Hotel El Rey
description: Very basic hotel with good secure parking for vehicles. Height restriction probably over 3 meters. We "took a room" for 20 bol PP and slept in the truck. Shared bathroom and shower cold and dirty.

name: Mirrador Flamencos parking
description: Almost leveled parking lot. Great view to laguna colorada. Toilet for 5 bol if ranger is on spot.

name: Mercado Achumani
description: Has everything you need with great prices and products: fruit & veg, meats, dry goods, cheese, nuts, bakery, alcohol and more. Organized and clean place. Banks also across the street. Tipped B5 to parking guy.

name: 7 Vueltas
description: "7 Vueltas" is one of the many sights you can visit, if you are at the Toro Toro National Park. It's a very beautiful dayhike (4 hours), where you hike up into the mountains, you will find fossils and an amazing viewpoint from which you will see the entire valley and village of Toro Toro. But you need, like for all other sights in that NP, to have a NP ticket, which costs 100 BOB! You can also hire a guide, which is another 100 BOB for ONE group. So if you are e.g. a group of four it's 25 BOB for each of you. But if you are familiar with trekking in middle size mountains you won't need a guide. Except you want to get to know specific information about the fossils, environment and other things.

name: Sol y Luna
description: Great bar with good beers on tap and bottles. Good atmosphere and often live music. They had a cultural language exchange on Tuesday night too. Has WiFi. Next to Pacha hostel.

name: Laundromat self-service
description: Laundromat self-service. 20bol the use of the machine and free Wi-Fi.

name: Agua/Water Potable 20L
description: In the brick building with yellow paint and the name "Agencia Oficial" is a little tienda which sells cake, ice cream and potable water. 20L for 15 Bob. 2L bottle for 5 Bob. Also some locals exchanged their bidones/garafones here.

name: police check
description: We were stopped and asked for ID. They then wanted to check inside the van. They sked for receipts for the diesel in the container (bought in Peru). Showed all the receipts for diesel purchased in  Bolivia. They then said it was illegal to carry fuel inside any private vehicle. When we asked to see the rule book, they produced the relevant paragraph which relates to COLLECTIVOs carrying passengers which we are clearly not. That said we offered to put the fuel in the tank, which we did, and were sent on our way.

name: reparation plastique et feu
description:
he replaced our broken tail lights and scratches on the bumper. it's like it's new. amazing, fast and cheap. come here to fix. highly recommended. 

il nous a remplacé nos feux arrières cassés et les éraflures sur le pare choc. c'est comme si c'était neuf. incroyable, rapide et pas cher. venez ici pour réparer. hautement recommandé.

name: Panadería francesa
description:
A great French bakery where you can find everything that taste just like the in France! Not that cheap but it’s worth it!
Staff is very friendly. They said the owner is French even though we didn’t meet him.

name: Hostel Familiar
description: Happened upon this gate while driving by because someone was driving out and there was no height restriction. Asked the guy if we could park and stay, he said no problem. He has rooms for 80 bolivianos each, we camped for 40 each, 5 yo kid free.  Parking on a slope, but he has nice selection of rocks for leveling. Bathroom was clean, let us use electric. He has nice clean pool and nice views from the deck. Only one vehicle can fit .. we have full size Dodge Ram with pop up camper, maybe two small cars could fit.

name: Lili's Hostel - Santa Cruz
description: Nice hostel in central location. For 50 bs pppn ( kids must pay too) you get full access to hostel. Pool, billiards, hot showers, electricity, kitchen, living areas with tv. Wifi is decent,. Breakfast included in price: eggs, bread, cheese, ham, fruit (even strawberries), tea, coffee, hot choc. Staff are very nice. Very relaxed, not a party place (sign expressly saying no marijuana), and quiet at night. We were happy our rig fit...even if just barely.  No height restriction on fence, but the trees and potential cars parked on street just outside make it a bit tricky to get in. But we did.  We have a full-size Dodge Ram 3500 with pop up camper. So it's debatable if this can accept big rigs. Two rigs at most can probably fit.

name: fuel
description: Gasoline at foreigner price. wouldn't negotiate.

name: Cerdas town
description: Small town with a old church. Friendly people.We spent one night in the street near the school. We talked with the teachers, they gave us water. Lovely people.

name: Plaza 10 de Noviembre, quiet and lovely
description:
I spent a week stopped in this square, I quiet neighborhood just 5 quarters from city main square.
Nothing strange happened, and no security problems also. Very well illuminated at night. And Free. : )

name: Tocla Rancho, Small village, with good people
description:
Village is 8 km away from main road. I just went to this cute small village to have a different experience out of town in Bolivia. 
I found very nice people, who treated me wonderfully. Have beautiful places to walk and the amazing and inacreditable Sauna of Nico. Nico also make arthesanal good beer.
Results: I spent a week, I made many friends, and went away full of happiness in my heart and many gifts.

name: Quiet and safe place to sleep near Estadio Olímpico
description: In La Paz is not easy to find a place to sleep in your van. Quiet, safe and flat place. In the roundabout are working and street will be closed until 2020 as people told me, so there is almost no transit and lot of space to park. You must enter on the street wrong way to make it to the place.

name: VW dealer and Taller
description: Not recommended . They were very expensive to finally damage our DPF in stead of saying they did not have any experience in diesel engine in general. If you need anything from VW go to Peru, Juliaca has a good dealer.

name: thorny bushes
description:
just few meters off the highway
a nice camp spot
turn off to the right u find an area.
surrounded by thorny bushes. avoid them of course
nice view of mountain

name: rocky peninsula at bridge with clear water
description: got by to take a bath at noon. the main River is muddy but on the right hand side coming from Sorata there is a great clear creek you can camp at. cross the first arm and you get on a stony island big enough for big rigs. almost no traffic at night so don't bother if you can be seen from the bridge. plenty of firewood

name: abrahams little oasis
description: 50 m after crossing the bridge coming from chulumani there is a small property belonging to Abraham. he has a BBQ to grill on, sink water, showers and even a fridge. we asked him if we could stay and he invited us (even prepared everything for the BBQ) he told us he would let anyone stay here even if he wasn't there. the river is close (50m)

name: close to playground
description: In the street close to the playground, next to the tall walls of the house, we had 4 quiet nights in our van, quiet street, 3 blocks from the main Plaza.

name: Excellent sheltered camp spot
description: When you come along the big open valley through the desert, you will see a load of rocks standing alone on the far side. Coming from the south it will be on your right, from the north it will be on your left. You are completely hidden from passing traffic unlike a few of the other wild camping spots we checked out. We pitched our tent in the rocks sheltered completely on 3 sides and our friend with a roof tent was also well protected. It was at least -10 at night but no wind. Beautiful location and lots of big rocks to tie the guide ropes to on the tent. A little bit of deep sand around the rock area so 4wd recommended or motorbike. Such a quiet area.

name: Fuel
description: We managed to buy 50 litres of fuel from here right next to the lodge. We knocked and asked, they charged us 5 BOB per litre and gave it to us in 10 litre cans. Very nice people and we could have purchased more. Lots of tourist jeeps spend the night here.

name: San Javier
description:
Fairground of cattle. 2 km from the center. Calm and safe. Electricity, bathrooms and water. For us it was free, but it is possible that in the future they charge a small amount.
Contact José (in charge) at the telephone 7 539 2422 or at the offices of the livestock association in the central plaza of San Javier, on the north side.
---
Recinto de la Feria de ganado. 2 km del centro. Tranquilo y seguro. Electricidad, baños y agua. Para nosotros fue gratis, pero es posible que en el futuro cobren una pequeña cantidad.
Contactar con José (encargado) en el teléfono 7 539 2422 o en las oficinas de la asociación ganadera en la plaza central de San Javier, en el lateral norte.

name: Sandy riverbank
description:
FREE. No Facilites.

Access next to south west corner of bridge.

Sandy riverbank (4x4 not required), water clean enough for washing and swimming. Follow track about 300m upstream for privacy.

Enjoy the cows and frogs ;-)

name: Copa Chunco
description:
FREE. No facilities.

Bloody hell, it's windy hereabouts!

Found a spot in the lee of an old, low stone wall and small grove of trees. Level ground. Close to river for that essential wash ;-)

Access from south east corner of bridge. Dirt track runs parallel to river.

name: Tolar place
description:
Just for one night before la Paz.
A lot of light during the night.
And you have a little market.
The place is paved so no dust or mud if there is wind or rain.
But if it's saturday night you have a pub with music (not loud but some music).
The sunday morning you have the market on the place.

name: YPFB - carrasco S.R.L.
description: gasolina for local price. sin factura - no problem

name: camp spot near road
description: nice and quiet place near the road with little traffic. there are some small huts nearby. didnt sleep here but looks fine for the night.

name: Mister Dog Veterinario
description:
When I could not understand what the Senasag guy wanted, I stopped here. She called Senasag to explain my situation and get the information I needed. They know the papers and it made it easy.  Phone number 69821698   And 76191961.  24 hour emergency vet.  

Each certificate you need is 100 bols. Make copies before turning papers in to Senasag.

name: Visa bank atm
description: You can get US Dollars from this atm. I got $300 in twenties.

name: Eduardo yupanqui
description: Didn’t want to sell to foreigners      ..............

name: Banco
description: Small bank. This ATM accepts foreign bank cards and does not appear on google maps! Instructions in Spanish or English. Use the Spanish instructions since it lets you withdraw more money in B$ or $US.

name: hostal danalith
description:
100bs for a triple room, it has wifi, hot water shower and television. the bathroom is shared!

100bs por una habitación triple, cuenta con wifi, ducha de agua caliente y televisión. el baño es compartido !

name: Chiripa, casa Mr. Emeterio
description:
Chiripa is a small village that has Tiwanaku's ruins and a little museum.
Here you can see how lives the people around Titicaca lake, producing many kinds of native potatoes, cheese, crafts with "totora".
Mr. Emeterio and Ms. Domingas will take you to the lake, show how to produce in traditional forms.
Friendly people. millenary knowledge.

name: Water pump in village
description: A grey water pump at the edge of the village, off the ‘main’ road and along the old disused Road we cycled in on.  Lots  of water at end of the dry season, we filtered it just to make sure .

name: Eco Parque Don Pastor
description:
Lovely cabanas y campground. We arrived there for one night and stayed 4. The owners Ricardo and Karin are very friendly. Our children play with there 3 sons.
Swimming pool now, in the future pool for playing for kids, can hire bike, a small adventure par with tyrolienne, football playground, hot shower.

name: next to the football field
description: Quiet overnight spot in a little Village. We asked a local and were told that is perfectly safe and that there are banos in the building close by (we didn't check).

name: quiet place Well hidden
description: super big spot, well hidden from the road. super quiet. the position is the entrance.

name: Plaza central
description:
Main Plaza of Aiquile. We spent 2 nights here, no problem. No much noise at night. The market is crossing the plaza. You have bathrooms there for $1 (no showers).
You have power plug 220v in the plaza lights.

name: Muelleria Gran Poder
description: Very skilled mechanic. We got extra leaf springs for the back and a stabilizer. Fast and very decent price.

name: Camping Las Lomas
description:
This place is a great camping site and a mechanic workshop together, it's very comfortable to spend some days in La Paz and check/fix your truck.  There are big car ramps if you need to change your oil or inspect your truck's underbody, there are also tools and a mechanic that can help you. 
The owners are super-friendly and speak English and French. 
Hot shower, toilet, full kitchen for overlanders, laundry machine, electricity and drinking water are available. And can fill propane!
+591 76550000 - +59177289799

We left our car for 7 days during the trip to the Salt flats and then we spent some days in La Paz city. You can take a taxi to the center (cost 40 bolivianos and take 40 minutes)

name: Hostal de Doña Lupe and Danna
description: Only place in town and nicer than you'd ever expect. Really friendly staff and nice rooms. Rooms were 100pp or 80pp with private bathroom, or 40pp for shared bathroom. The shared bathroom was really clean and the shower was good. 40pp price did not include towels, soap, or toilet paper though. They have a well stocked (although expensive) tienda, but you definitely need to check the dates on everything. They let us use the kitchen in the morning but I'm not sure if that's always available for use. Secure parking for rigs as well.

name: Mendoza gas station
description: The man was ok to refill one tank of 5 gallons at local price.

name: Clinica Wilde
description:
English speaking dentist.  My husband broke a tooth and needed a root canal and an onlay.  Excellent work, friendly staff.  Recommended. 
 $3600 Bol.

name: Taller Arturo
description:
Very good mechanic, fast and honest. 
He was recomended by the hostel La Cupula. 
We were very glad with his work.

name: Challapata Plaza
description:
Big place, we slept in front of the police office. Calm and safe. There is a good family restaurant on the corner of the church with other food than pollo frito ...
In the town, there is another small place with a playground but more activity during the evening . 
There is wifi in some restaurants nearby and we found free wifi at this place too.

name: Picnic area next to Laguna
description: Picnic tables and large flat parking area next to laguna with 100s of flamingos (as of 4 Oct).  There are also very basic bathrooms, and a walking path around part of the lake.  It appears to be part of the area managed by the same people who collect the toll, but there is no fee for staying here.  Extremely quiet, very beautiful and it was a wonderful night.

name: TU SUPER supermarket
description: Supermarket with all the necessary goods and parking.

name: La Casa del Baron
description:
It's a nice place to take a break from the trip,
It has 6 rooms with private bathroom, wifi, restaurant only weekends, but also is available for the same traveler to cook. A large parking lot for Campers. Its owners are very polite and friendly and attentive to resolving concerns. To communicate with Mario you can use the WhatsApp + 591 679 22720. Highly Recommended.
In addition, the history of this countryside house belonged to the Aramayo the baron of the tin, and according to this, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid went by to rob Mr Aramayo.

name: Potosi Service Station
description:
Filled my tank no problem. Local price. Friendly people.
2019: Don't fill any more at local price if you don't have Bolivian documents.

name: Chachacomani church
description: We stoped in the village to collect water, but as it was pouring with rain we asked if we could camp by the church. It’s well sheltered from the wind and has a few flat spots for tents. The village kids were very interested in our tents and bikes and spent a lot of time asking us questions as playing games. A nice spot for the night.

name: Swiss Consulate
description:
The Swiss consulate is in the same building as the Swiss restaurant. We went there to get reliable information about the specific visa situation for Swiss citizens in Bolivia.
Their answer was - max. 90 days each calender (!) year. Longer stays are possible, but such visas are difficult to get.

name: Aguavida Water Plant
description: Water filtration plant. 12 bob a bidon (20 liters). Look for the orange wall and tubes hanging. They can also clean your bottles for free. Doesn't look like a water filtration plant, look for the big water resavoir behind the wall and you will see it is.

name: Riverside
description:
FREE. No facilities.

Map marker is exit from Ruta 25. Narrow, twisty, track down to river where there is plenty of flat ground and trees for shade.

name: Roadside Windbreak
description: We didn't camp here but there's a decent windbreak with space for two or three tents. In sight of the road. It looks like others have camped here though and there is a pile of empty tuna cans, veggie cans, wine bottles, etc. Obviously this goes for any wild camp site, but if you stay here, don't leave your trash behind. Just because there's a pile, doesn't mean anyone is coming to collect it. Ok, I'll step off my soapbox now. :) Still, seems like a good spot if you can't make it up the climb in one day.

name: Riverside
description:
FREE. No facilities. Two wheeler access only. 

Flatish grassed picnic spot, some litter and old fire pits. River smells slightly sulphurous but good for bathing.

name: Cam Fish
description: Only camping, fishing and hunting equipment retailer in town. Good range and prices.

name: biopetrol
description: Fuel at local price with bidon. The guy just asked me the number and last name,  we said our Argentinian's ID number and it was no problem. we parked just in front of the station.

name: Peaceful camp place
description: Peaceful & quite at the riverside. Some big houses the other side. A bit of trash. Good overnight place.

name: Castillo de la Glorieta
description: The scenic castillo is a mixture of different architectural styles and was owned by one of the wealthier Potosí mine owners (~1885). Its worth a stop (foreigners 20Bs/p, foto camera 10Bs), a Spanish speaking guide is included in the price. The coordinates mark the road for entering. Use the right hand road driving through the military guard post.

name: inversiones vallesur sa
description: i fill my water tank for free and without buy diesel. they told me it's drinking water.

name: ypfb
description: we fill our tank for a local price.  very friendly.

name: gorge wild camp
description: In between Taconi and marcoma there is a really nice gorge with very steep drop and little camping possibilities. We were driving in the night and found this flat spot. Decided to stop to not miss the views and found some moonshine singani which we had a few sips already. Time to stop.

name: the real rainbow mountain
description: Truly epic drive. Colors are amazing, spectacular views and amazing rock formations. Worth the detour. Road a bit rough in some places but we did it no pros in our 2wd Chevy van. DO IT!

name: Alojamiento Quechisla
description:
Nice and clean alojamiento, very basic. 20Bs p.p. plus I had to pay 5Bs for the bike (can be parked inside the yard). Felt safe. 

OWNER keeps changing prices and claims the bicycle is an extra tax. Don't bother with this place.

name: Village plaza
description: At the (almost abandoned) plaza of a small village. Safe. Lower altitude. Some noise from the not so busy street.

name: Torre Huayco
description: The canyon views from Tupiza till here are spectacular. Dead end. Good gravel road to drive.

name: Small tourist shop in Julaca
description: Small well stoked shop with snacks, cold drinks and beer. There seem to be a few other little places like this in the village,catering for jeep tourists I guess. When we arrived they had fresh empanadas.

name: La casa del Barón
description: Big colonial house near to the mountains, nice landscape and peaceful.

name: Timichucua restaurant
description: Small restaurant in Timichucua village on right side of the road next to the football field. Spend the night at the back for free. Free use of toilets. Serves simple lunch and dinner. Watch out for the falling mangos though. Great local swimming spot some 500 meters to the north. Also a place were you can stay the night.

name: Mirador Cerro Cholorque
description: Large level place, partly hidden from the road, perfect for a quite overnight stay. Nice view to Cerro Cholorque, 5614m.

name: Ibibobo sports field
description: Just next to the sports field. Quiet place in friendly town. Shade from trees. No facilities. Good 3G from Entel.

name: Soluna for overlanders
description:
This hostel which is run by a German family, welcomes also overlanders who want to sleep in their rig. Currently there is a parking slot for one vehicle. Maximum length about 6.50 meters. Height is no problem. There may be more slots in the future. Breakfast costs 15 Bob per person. They wash your laundry for 15 Bob, but there is no tumbler. You can put the laundry on the rope in the garden. Parking is for free. You can give what you think is appropriate. Good WiFi and flush toilet available. You can contact Torge, the owner, via WhatsApp: +591 72963172.
Please see also our other comment at the hostel Soluna itself.

name: Totora Pampa Chico - pull-out
description: Big, flat pull-out. Okay place for one night.

name: biopetrol
