description: Here you can fill your fuel tank directly at local price, only you have to give the employees some extra money (15 or 20 bols for a full tank). We didn't do this because we only have 30 bols total for fuel, but  the lady told this. With  local price, no problem.

name: San Jacinto Lake
description: Very quite and relax. Just in the river, tall trees. Perfect to relax. The entrance between the trees is not easy but worth it! Our grand Starex Hyundai passed through the trees. There’s a path you can follow. Follow the fish sign to get here

name: First toll
description:
First toll on the road to La Paz from desaguadero border. 
Price : 9 bolivianos
Cash only
Make sure to have some cash because no ATM at the border.

name: Double Coin Tyres for trucks
description: They have all necessary stuff to change big, heavy wheels quickly.

name: Elma's place - great air bnb
description:
double room with shared bathroom for 80bol. 
simple breakfast included
free parking
shared kitchen 
free laundry if you bring the soap.
great place to stay several nights  
possibility To have culinary lessons with Elma, she is a chef. 
We loved the place,very quiet. 
Her 2 children (adults)are super.
thanks you for eveeything,!
it was more than perfect
+59173295820

name: Hostal el Estrella
description: This place has a huge lit up sign you can see from the main highway. It’s almost brand new and might be a love hotel. Parking is under each room. It’s like having a personal garage under your apartment. They lock the huge door at night. It’d be very close to big rig friendly, we have motos so we aren’t sure. But it’s close enough to the other one in this town to check out if your rig will fit and if not go to the other one. We went to both and this one is much nicer. Very friendly Lady said 80, we said 70bob and she took it without hesitation so bargain harder! 2 people with private bano, suicide shower, no wifi. Lots of blankets. Would recommend this place! She might even let you sleep in your car. Town isn’t the nicest though

name: Alojamiento
description: Had to stop because of rain. This one is about 100m from the Alojamiento Panamerica on the same side of the road (which was full). It’s kind of prison like and the beds are made of a big plastic bag stuffed with other plastic bags. 40bob for 2, shared bathrooms (bucket flush). The senor running the place is very friendly, offered us a nice room with a “better bed” for 100bob if we wanted. Secure parking for motos and cars/4WD. Don’t think rigs will fit through the gate. No wifi.

name: Hotel Avenida
description: Hotel in the centre of San Borja. Small rooms, small courtyard and place to hang and relax. Owner is friendly and asked what we would like to pay for a night camping (we have a roof tent). We offered 50 Bolivianos and got a room as well for four persons which we didn't even use. Toilets and showers are basic but clean. Nice place to spend the night.

name: Balneario Tapacare
description:
Update July 2023: could stay overnight. Nice owner…
Great spot for camping and swimming. 
Now charges 100 bob per car per night. Or 10bob pp for the day only. 
For that price you can use an outdoor cold shower and toilet.
The view is great, especially the sunset. The lake is also great for kids due to the shallow water. There is a restaurant which we didn't use and cold drinks. They also have a swimming pool but it was not operational (unclean) when we visited. They have reasonably clean toilets depending on the amount of visitors. The owner also runs a hotel next to the balneario.

name: Megacenter
description: Probably the largest supermarket in town (Urkupiña).

name: Patamanta soccer Pavilion
description:
After asking around I was told tourists can set up their tents inside the pavilion. My bicycle is inside with me.
There are bathrooms. With bucket flush. 
There is a small stall with food just outside. 
The doors are closed by the attendant at 21 an reopened at 7.

name: cobija
description:
We stayed here, it's the best and only place we found in Cobija.
--
hoy nos quedamos aca. fue el mejor lugar que vimos, ya que no hay otros en Cobija.

name: Alojamiento España - not recommend
description: Rooms 40 bol pp, no hot shower, water sometimes not running, place tends to stink a bit... But, there isn't much else in town.

name: Residencial Sillajuay
description:
Nice hotel, clean & spacious rooms but only shared bathrooms. Hot shower. 
Garage available. 40bol pp
In the reception there is also a cybercafe.

name: Clear water from river
description:
Clear water from river. 
maybe helpful for cyclists

name: Immigration Office
description: Small immigration office near the ferry terminal to get your entry/exit stamp in Bolivia.

name: Petrol station
description:
this is the only fuel station between Guayaramerin and Trinidad. they sell the petrol in local price to the tourists.

You can also fin petrol in Porto Siles and San Pedro in this way, but just in cans.

name: Toll Booth
description: Rope in the middle of the road, just before a toll plaza. The police asked for the custom document for the vehicle and charge us a fee 10 bols for stamp behind the document. They didn't give us any ticket for the payment. In the other three police checkpoints they stamp and we hadn't to pay anything

name: Limpieza Lavanderia
description: Laundry close to the center. 10 Bs per kilo. 09.00-12.00, 15.00-20.00h

name: Museo del Convento de Santa Teresa
description: Carmalite convent, 1692, which took over the second oldest daugther of every rich family in Potosi. The guided tour lasts 1.5 hours and gives you an interisting view into the lives of those unfortunate 15 year old girls.

name: Foot of Dam
description: At the the foot of the dam of the reservoir 'Represa Tacagua', right at the water outlet, in a small wooded area marked with a sign 'Area Camping'. Free, quite but no facilities.

name: Artesanías ARAO
description: Small shop with lots of handcrafted alpaca wool stuff. Not overly cheap but the real deal an well worth the price! They moved from their original location - one block down into a small mall-thingy across from a „joyeria“

name: Hotel Plaza (used to be Flores Plaza)
description:
Upscale hotel, nice clean rooms, friendly staff, secure parking for small to medium sized cars (no big rigs). Hot water always available, breakfast buffet, great location for exploring the city (underrated, as rough guide and lonely planet both disparage it as „past its glory“... it‘s actually really charming!

Double room goes for 450bobs/night.

name: off the main road
description: We came here because other place from San Ramon had too many mosquitos to allow us to open the door and get fresh air, and it was dark. 1,3 kms off the main road, quiet during the night. We Spoke with a hunter around 10pm, no problem to stay here he told us. Stop when the path is larger. Few motorcycle at the beginning of the night and in the morning. Just a place to sleep.

name: Quetena Chico public water tap
description: There is a public water tap at the Entel Centro (telecom) opposite of the Centro de Interpretation Ch'aska in Quetena Chico. We filled our water tank there. Water comes with very good pressure, is perfectly clear and has no smell.

name: Classroom
description: On a classroom they have mattresses. One electrical outlet. Light. There are some public restrooms across the plaza.

name: Beliz Inn B&B
description:
Very cute little B&B run by an elderly man and what I assume is his daughter (don’t go into the stables!).
The rooms are extremely clean, have a private or shared bathroom (double with private goes for 310 bob/night) which in our case was spotless. 
The place has a 1-space parking garage where we could store our Montero with roof mounted spare tire and gas tank. Parking on the street is available and apparently safe. 
Breakfast is not outlandish but good and they make eggs to your preference if you don’t come out of your hole just before 9am.
The beds are comfy, rooms are somehow kept warm (no idea how as there’s no heating visible) and there is hot (!) water 24/7. The elderly man is always there to open the door as your key only works for your room. In all, I’d say 8/10 - would stay here again!

NB: images are from before checkout - beds were made up nicer when we came in!

name: Llanteria - experienced, very good tyre repair
description: Go there if you need help regarding wheels, tyres or tubes. The man in this workshop knows his job very well and can even fix complicated things in big truck wheels. His name is Matteo. We had two big punctures in one tube and he first sewed them before he vulcanized patches on them.

name: Facing Viaducto Alfonso Subieta
description: If you are climbing the mountains from Cochabamba or below, and you want to avoid hight sickness, its time to stay at this level of 3260.m above sea level. The old track behind the viaduct offers a good, big, flat, hidden place to stay over night. Ok, some traffic noise. There is even a toilet with running water (depending on rain?) in the back of the canyon. Unfortunately no swimming pool in the upper floor!

name: Batalla de Aroma
description: Behind the Bolivien flag marking the battle field Batalla de Aroma, 1810, one can see big loading ramps. Although the traffic is still audible, this hiding place is perfect for a quite night.

name: Aloj. Lucas
description:
A great hostel to stay in if you come off the Salt flats in the South. I highly recommend stopping at Galaxis caves on your exit to...very interesting and 15 bol. This place has several rooms, all single beds but normally 3 beds per room. Clean and basic. Breakfast included. Secure parking and a small ramp available if you need to look under your car. There is a shop close by that the young boy took us to...it wasn't obvious and we had to knock to get in. They sell beer! 
Hot gas shower - ask the lady to connect it. Shared bathrooms. Meals available on request. Very friendly place. 

I'm sorry I don't know the price as a friend paid however it has to be cheaper than the other places in the area which are quite expensive. It's worth a look anyway. If there was WiFi we didn't use it however I don't think there was any. 

-20.748839, -68.049376 co-ords.

name: Isla “Ali Olio”
description:
Definitely not an island! But since all islands we passed in the Salar had names we had to keep exploring until getting to a place we can name with our own wacky name. Named after the Ali Olio pasta we made here with palm hearts (great dish!).
Its right next to the football ground of the small village Bella Vista. Has stone walls to provide shelter from the wind. Enjoy!

name: Alojamiento of senior Papitui
description: Alojamiento where we stayed with our car with rooftop tent. Has at least one room with private toilet and shower which is reasonably clean. Owners are very friendly. Let us park next to the house and use the shower and toilet for 20 Bolivianos for one night. The room, a matrimonio, costs 120,- which we think is a little bit overpriced.

name: Cholitas Wrestling
description: Here you can enjoy cholitas wrestling. 50bs for foreigners.

name: Hotel mirador
description: Still under construction it they have rooms finished and big secure parking lot. 100b for matrimonial, hot water was hot.

name: Hostal Santusa
description: Simple hostal with a sometimes open restaurant in first floor. Hot water, wifi, comfy beds. Sometime breakfast available in the restaurant.

name: Auto repuestos Gonzales
description:
We changed oil and its filter for 235bs. Including working fee and air filter cleaning. 
Owner is nice guy!
Recommended!

name: Santa Rosa de la Mina
description: Nice clean and quiet indigenous village. Level parking in front of cute church or sports field. Village is guarded. Entrance and parking 5 bl per car. Sports stadium may have facilities. We are self contained and didn't ask. Save, friendly people.

name: Interparts
description: Wide Range of carparts, lubricants and other functional fluids. English spoken.

name: YFPB
description: We were able to fill up with gasoline directly into our motorcycle tanks for 6.50 bol a litre, no issues. We parked outside first to walk in and ask. I couldn't see any cameras here but maybe it's a new station.

name: Servi Cruz - Service Express
description:
Diesel expert in La Paz. All brands, complete service. possible to sleep in your car in a gated area while they do their work. Bathroom and warm shower available.
They solved a problem nobody could down the way from Colombia till there. Did a great job though he never saw a Ford Transit before!

name: INTERPARTS SRL
description: Car Part Store, Lubricants and Functional Fluids.

name: INTERPARTS SRL
description: Car Part Store, Lubricants and Functional Fluids. English Spoken.

name: E. S. Aroma gas station
description: We ask to the administrator if we could spend the night, and he said it was no problem. Very quiet and secure at night because the station is open 24 hs. It has a bathroom. While we were here it had a lock but always remained unlock. Near the bathroom there is a tap where you can get water, we don't know if it is potable but looks clear.

name: Servicio mecanico vw
description:
We were having a hard time to get recommended mechanic to repair the transmission of our Kombi. Juan Riquelme was all the tools and experience to repair vw kombi transmission. He charged us a half of the total price because we did part of the job beacuse we take out the engine and the transmission and after the repair we put them up. They allowed us to stay there in our van for three days while he was doing the repair. It's nice place close to the downtown and there ir a huge market two blocks from there with good prices.
WhatsApp contact call to
+591 71144616

name: Square of Pucará
description: We drove from Samaipata and arrived here late at night. This road is level. The people here is very nice and it's a secure village. We took a shower in the hostel for 5 bols (see the another spot).

name: Hotel Cristal Samaña
description: We arrive here late at night and we didn't want to enter in the salt flat without good clearence so we asked in the reception desk and they allow us to stay here and gave us the wifi pass. Also allow us to use the bathroom. very friendly people.

name: mini supermercado emmita
description: Mini super market with a lot of products and brands compare with other small villages. It has library and cleaning products too. Some meats and cheese in fridge. 20 lts bidon of water at 25 bols.

name: Residencial Tierra Bella
description:
Private room with a bathroom. 50 bolivians per person at night. The parking is high and enters MH. 24-hour front desk.

Quarto privativo com banheiro. 50 bolivianos por pessoa a noite. O estacionamento é alto e entra MH. Recepção 24 horas.

name: Motacucito cueva las lajas
description: they told us entering to motacucito 3km there are caves were you can see all type is spiders bats and animals... really beautiful and people of the village appreciate visitors!

name: great view
description: turn up off the main road. only recommended on two wheels. maybe a serious 4wd. road gets fairly unused fairly quickly. lots of little water crossings. need to go up about 200m above the road to get views of the glaciers but there is a flat spot a little lower down. asked a farmer on the way up the road if I could camp and he said yes. saw one more farmer and he waved at me.

name: At the bridge
description: Just for cyclists or motorcyclists. Coming from Bermejo get on the obvious track to your right before the big bridge. You will get over the old bridge and find a nice grassy spot, hidden from the road. Just a bit loud by the river.

name: Good Motorbike Mechanic Alberto
description:
Alberto is a very good mechanic who speaks excellent English. He serviced our carbs for us and knows a lot about many types of bike. His workshop is at his house in the South of La Paz. Price dependent upon the job. 

What's App or call +591 77297200

name: Hostel Wilma
description:
Hostel with dorms and rooms. 50 bob pp for a bed in the dorm, including breakfast.
Clean toilet and warm shower.
Huge backyard for cars and motorcycles.
Not sure if they would allow camping in a tent, but there’s plenty of space!
No wifi

name: Hotel Buena Vista
description: Hotel looked very neat with nice beds and bathrooms, but the lady asked 80Bol per bed! No option to camp neither parking off the street. Because of the price we didn't stay.

name: Ruta national F38
description: Very scenic road to Tomina (F6)!! Road is unpaved but was well maintained when we drove it. Though with rain some parts become muddy and slippery, which can be a bit scary since it's a mountain road. Driving goes slow (on average max 30km/hr) but it's absolutely worth it!!! Really stunning views, and if you like wildcamping you'll probably find the most beautiful spots around the Rio Grande.

name: Nice place close to the canyon del Inca
description: After an easy dirt road, nice place for all rigs, quiet and beautiful. No facilities but from here you can do a nice 1h long walk to the canyon del Inca (maps.me is your friend !)

name: 3 ATMs (BNB, Banco Union, Banco Bisa)
description:
Three ATMs of different banks (BNB, banco union, banco bisa).
No problem getting cash on two of those, but no US dollars.

name: Footbal stadion near church
description: Nice place to camp, closy to conones Torre Huayco. Not disturbed by locals, only for 4x4.

name: Very nice canyon of Love.
description: Wonderfull canyon, with an arch and unbelievebles views. You need good walking shoes, takes about one hour to visit.

name: Laguna Bravo
description: Nice lake when you visit the Pampas. be aware mozzies. We visited in the wet season. Great spot to break journey from Trinidad to Rurrenabaque.

name: New Aduana complex for TIP extension
description: This is the new place to make the extension for your TIP. Today we have spent the whole day of being sent from one Aduana office in town to the next. All other places on iOverlander seem no more valid. Here outside Oruro in Pasto Grande is a new big complex of the Aduana...only a pity that the employees do not seem to have an overview who is responsible of what...so we spent the whole day in the terrible traffic (at a market day) to drive to four offices for nothing.

name: Camp in island near volcano.
description: Beutyfull plase, nice view to lake and volcano. A lot lams and flamingo.

name: Limpieza Alexis
description: Nice friendly people for laundry. 12bol per kilo. Ready the same day if you deliver in the morning. Perfect on the way from the airport to center of town.

name: Hotel Pacheco
description:
Nice and family atmosphere. Near the main square. Mr Carlos charged 150 Bol and after negotiating lowered to 100 Bol per person the night with breakfast included. The room has air conditioning, ceiling fan and cable TV. The shower is electric. Parking is ample and goes into MH. The wifi is weak in the room.
----
Ambiente agradável e familiar. Próximo a praça principal. O Sr Carlos cobrou 150 Bol e depois de negociar deixou por 100 Bol por pessoa a noite com café da manhã incluído. O quarto tem ar condicionado, ventilador de teto e TV a cabo. O chuveiro é elétrico. O estacionamento é amplo e entra MH. O wi-fi pega fraco no quarto.

name: Lake-Side next to a house
description:
Ran out of daylight and spotted this lake. The family here has a little bar and sells beers to people that come to the lake. No food, only beers. There is a bathroom, cell phone service, and a beautiful lake to go fishing or a swim.
 FREE / Friendly!

name: Silent place for night
description: Nice place for one night, not so windy, good for tents / cyclists.

name: Peñas square
description: We spent three nights here. It's a quite village and the people is very welcoming. We come here to climb but we didn't like the routes because we believe they are not well-equiped, but the rock, the trekking, and the landscape are great. In the front of the police station there is a tap with potable water built by the people of the village. But while we were here it was no water. One block from here there are public bathrooms but the lack of cleaning made it imposible to use. Next to this point in the house with two balconies lives jesus. He is an anthropologie who has a little museum and like to speak with travellers. He told us the history about Tupak katari. Who was an Aymara revolutionarie killed by the spanish in this town.

name: just outside caravani
description: poor spot but late raining and thunder. very noisy close to the road. but okay for sleeping

name: large flat area
description: no facilities firm ground perfect for overnight.

name: Free overnight parking
description: Free overnight parking at the plaza. Right opposite of the police station. Fairly quiet at night. Free wifi. Lots of shops and small restaurants nearby. Suitable for big rigs, no facilities.

name: ST Gasolina
description: We lucked out with a nice supervisor. They wouldn’t pump directly into the moto, but could sell me gas at local price in a bucket. The bucket was filthy, so I said it wouldn’t work. They sold me a bag for 2.5 BOB that held five liters at a time.

name: Typica Café - vintage style coffeehouse
description: Very new place, incredible vintage-style interior! Nicest café we have probably ever been to! They have very exotic coffee machines with beans selection, a huge menu with cakes, crepes, ensaladas, empanadas, breakfast.... They also play good old music like Eric Clapton, 50s rock and not that reggaeton the kids listen to until their ears start bleeding. Lovely staff. Absolutely recommended!!

name: Sauna Piscina Loco Pulpo and showers
description:
warm pool 30°C, sauna and showers for 30 BOB. if u only want to shower it is 10 bob.
they also have wifi. towel (5 bob) or sandals can be rented. Seemed relatively clean.

open daily from 12.00 to 19.00

name: Motorcycle Tyres and Parts
description: A block of motorcycle tyres and parts. Good selection of Brazil brand tyres. Not a tonne of stuff, but you might find what you need.

name: Ingemap Motorcycle Tyres
description:
A brake and clutch car place that also sells Levorin Brand Brazilion motorcycle tyres.
 I picked up a duel sport 130/80/17 rear for 390B.
 A friend who owns Bolivia Motorcycle Tours close by brought me here. He uses them and said they get good millage and its tough to beat the price!

name: Mountain View Estates
description: There is a small track leading off the road by the power lines. We spent a nice quiet night here. There are hardly any options for camping along this stretch of road, so we were happy to find this. Great view as well.

name: Plaza principal
description: A little noise in the morning, very safe and calm in the night to park in the principal park of Villa Tunaris.

name: Chicken, Llamas and Sausage roasting outside, food inside!
description:
There is 3 big chicken roasters outside and three packed little restaurants inside. I came for dinner, 15b chicken, 20b ribs or something, 25b steak. comes with rice, fries and salad bar.
 All places packed with locals, I was for sure the only non-local. you'll probably share a table with others.
 fast, cheap delicious!

name: Alojamiento Famuza
description: A cheap hostel near Bus Terminal. Compared to other hostels in the area, this on is slightly cheaper and shower is included in price (shower is lukewarm). Simple room is 30B, better rooms with TV are 40B. It's a bit run down. Wi-fi on the ground floor near the lobby is fast (don't know about other storeys).

name: Arjamin SRL
description:
Efraim will welcome you for oil change or tyres 
really nice and cheapest oil change in town
125Bs for 5,5L of oil (granel) plus the filter and the work!

name: Small tienda
description:
This is a small tienda with a friendly man who let us fill our water from a hose.  Not sure how good it is, clear but I still treated it with chlorine.

Be nice and buy a few snacks from his for his troubles.

name: Isla D
description:
D is a great letter. We have our reasons to think so, and we're sure you'll find yours too !
Nice little island, where our inner child ran wild, with beautiful views from around and the top, it sheltered us for a quiet night, a stunning sunrise, and a wonderful meal!

name: Nacional Vida Latina Seguros
description: Ne venez pas ici, cette assurance ne couvre pas les véhicules étrangers

name: Aires de Campo
description: This is a beautiful complex with 5 Chalets of various sizes all are modern, cleaned daily and all amenities you could think of are available. Restaurant and spa are currently under construction. The owners are unbelievably friendly and generous and we cannot recommend this place highly enough. A perfect spot to recharge after time on the road.

name: Palacios Xtreme
description:
This is a good place for motorcycle parts and tools but can also find car repair such as air filter spray and tire puncture repair kit. Really nice owner! 
Address: Calle 21 Calacoto # 8331
Cell: 79663657
Phone: 2793432
Email: jpalacios.px@gmail.com

name: Car check point
description: They required first aid kit , declaración jurada . Licence. Fire extinguisher.

name: Parking lot mirador
description: Great spot to camp or sleep in vehicle. Awesome view . Amazing sunset and sunrise !!! 360 view 👌👌

name: Dirección General de Migración Oruro
description: This is the migration office where you can extend your visum. Took us about 10-15 minutes. Very friendly officer!

name: Awesome exploring on motorcycle
description: Really cool dirt roads through little towns and lots of neat rock formations. It’s possible to make a loop by riding to this point, crossing the dry river bed, and riding back on the other side.

name: Hostal Pedro Arraya
description: nice hotel. clean and people very friendly. parking (big!) available at 2 blocks from hotel. doble room with private toilet for 80 $b.

name: next to river
description:
we put our tent right next to the river, since the river seems to be much bigger during the rain season, there is enough space deeper than the area around to protect it from being seen.
to get there follow the road towards the thermals and turn right when you reach the cementary. 
around 8 pm the level of the river increases for around half an hour supposibly due to the basins in the thermal being emptied.

name: school in agua de castilla
description:
we had read on a blog, that it was possible to stay overnight in this school, so we stopped by and asked. later we were told that there are many ciclistas (people on bicicle) who do this.
we were allowed to stay overnight in one of the classrooms and spend a quiet night there. since the pupils are on holiday, we were allowed to stay longer in the morning (during school week: max. 7am)

-- 
please if you stop by, ask friendly if it is possible to stay there and accept no as an answer, the family living in the school is super friendly and will have a good reason to deny your request.

name: Camping spot at a rock formation
description: For cyclists. You will likely need to push Your bike down and up to the rock formation. It's a beautiful place above a valley, very scenic. It is not far from the road, but they can't see You at night and can't reach easily (i.e. I think it's very safe).

name: wild camp along western shore of Lago poopó
description: There are countless options along the road between Copacabañita and Quillacas - just leave the main road (which is paved all the way and in quite good condition) towards the lake (several tracks lead there) - the surface was quite firm even in January (might change in Feb/Mar/April) and you’ll find yourself surrounded by only Llamas,Alpacas&Vicuñas, no one else around and great 360-views. BTW the road is a good option when travelling from Sajaman to Uyuni and there are several nice villages with basic options to buy food - no other facilities.

name: Eurobikes / Triumph / Husqvarna
description:
Main dealer for Triumph / Husqvarna 

Came here to get my Triumph Tiger 800 serviced as I make my way south through the Americas. Can’t recommend the place highly enough. They performed the service as expected but also fixed a whole bunch of other small problems without even being asked. 

When I got the bike back it has been stripped down and given the deepest clean of its entire life. Exactly what was needed after a few days on the Salar de Uyuni. 

Can’t recommend highly enough.

name: Hotel Tayka El Desierto
description: Hotel that allows you to fill your water bottles. Potable, and free!

name: "Perno Centro " Tools and Construction Shop
description: Nice and well sorted shop where you can buy tools, screws and other stuff like a little construction market.

name: Panamericana Repuestos - car parts shop
description: good place for shocks, cylinders, brake pads, gaskets and every else you need in car parts. Very professional staff....bring your parts and they will find it for you. Specialized on japanese cars. But i think they will also help you with other cars.

name: Rectificar
description: Shop for Work on engine like flat the Motorblock, drilling the Pistons and Stuff like that

name: Valle Hermoso II
description: Great hostel in the centre of Tupiza. Dorms and private rooms. Super clean. Friendly staff. They offer free secure parking very nearby for motos and a few cars / rigs. Recommended

name: Hostal Chawi
description:
Beautifully located hostel with cozy roof terras overlooking the mountains. Owner Charlie is super friendly, always helpful and has a ton of information and tips for stuff to do around town. 

We paid 306 bob for a double room with shared bath. The room was spacious, spotless, and the bed was the best we slept in during our 1 month in Bolivia. Breakfast is available for 15 bob, for 30 bob you’ll get a delicious home cooked dinner. Highly recommended!

name: Hostel Oasis Uyuni Backpackers
description: Got to town when it was pouring and the first couple options were full. A bit expensive for what it is in Bolivia, 77 Bob for a dorm bed (no bunks), think he said 150 for a room, but I’m not sure. Inside parking for motos and bicycles. Could probably fit at least 6 motos with luggage if they tidied up the garage. Friendly staff, water was warm. Breakfast buffet for 15Bob, but I didn’t see or try it. Wifi download speed shows 4.12Mbps & upload of 2.68Mbps

name: Ferreteria Nano’s
description: Shop to find screw, chain, metal things, tools...

name: Next to road
description:
We passed here right before the sunset, it is not a perfect place but the view is quite nice, it is hidden from the road (hardly any cars passed by) and enough flat grass-like area for one tent 

we asked the neighbours and they were okay with us staying here

name: Mercado
description:
A large market on Sundays. Lots of staff.

Un largo mercado del domingo

name: Tap water
description: A grifo available for Free in front on the shops

name: Moto taller
description:
This shop is the only one in town I could find parts for my dr 650.  The man literately had an entire carburetor for my bike in his shop.  Definitely the only one in the city.  He charged me a reasonable price I think to for it 2,000bob or 280 usd.  I had another shop install it but this guy seemed like he knew what he was about (wouldn’t trust the one employee though, he was on the phone the whole time when his boss left). 

His name is victor.

name: Police Checkpoint 10Bol
description: Checkpoint where you have to pay 10BOL to receive 2 ingreso-salida-stamps

name: Flat and hidden spot
description: Nice flat area hidden from the road. large enough to fit several rigs or tents. when we were here no one bothered us and we spent a quiet night. some trash but not much.

name: Wild camp at Sahuina
description:
Nice place for quiet night. Nice view by the lake.
People are very friendly, there’s a new campsite and cabañas.

name: Tucumamas Sophia
description: On the right side of the orange mifarma shop is a small entry. when you walk inside there is a small Tucumama Shop. Very Traditional one that works for more than 25 years. And very tasty. Tucumamas are a kind of empanada but fried. For the Filling you can choose between Pollo, Carna, Cheese & Ham (7bs), mixed Seafood, Shrimps & cheese (13bs) or Triple with ham pollo & carne (9bs). You have also different sauces. Very nice but secret place that normally just locals know.

name: Ayo Ayo
description: Water taps in the street. It’s potable according to a local.

name: la primera atm
description: we are traveling from the US with a US card and had trouble withdrawing funds from most ATMs in the city except this one. if you are having the same issue, this ATM worked for us with no fees.

name: Peaje and Police Check
description:
Toll on the way from La Paz to Oruro. There are 2 more prior to this one and each cost s8/9 bolivianos. This one costs 7. Unless you have your ticket from the last peaje, in which case you’ll get a stamp and it’s free.

There is a police check after the peaje where they check your documents.

name: Mitayos Land Backpackers
description: Hostel in a small pedestrian impasse. Bed not very comfortable. It's a bit cold in the room. Kitchen and shared bathroom. Shower not very hot. The area is very quiet but you can hear people talking in the patio from the rooms.

name: Off ruta 11
description: We took this side road off ruta 11 and after 1 km settled at this spot. Almost 360 view and very quiet. Two cars passed in the evening and two in fhe morning Zero at night. The many trucks on the 11 are faintly heard in the distance Beautiful starry night. We were lucky but might be exposed to high winds. This gravel road is a 25 km detour which comes back to ruta 11. There are probably a lot more options for wild camping.

name: La Selenita
description:
Located beautifully overlooking Sucre, La Selenita is a great Guesthouse / B&B that overs private rooms & apartments. Lush garden, comfortable rooms and beds, very hot showers and fully equipped kitchen.  10min walking from center. 

Bit expensive but definitely worth it of you feel like splurging. Paid 330BS per night inc breakfast.  

They also have a private garage which fits our Dodge B250 (L 5.30m, W 1.95m, H 2.25m). Would also easily fit bikes.

name: Pull out
description: It was already dark when we found this good level spot. It’s right on the side of the road but there was very little traffic and none at night.

name: Taller Mecanic VW and others
description: We stoped for a night at Jorge Restaurant (wild spot marked in town, it's a restaurant) and I asked him to fix my wheel, he comes with me here... Seems to be a nice young guy, do a great and fast job, know Kombis VWbus and other cars too, and fair prices... I paid 300bob for Oli change, with clean ( Kombi needs ), a wheel repair, and a little manteined needed... it's ok! I'm happy!

name: Parqueo
description: We let our car for 3 nights here and had no problem. Next to the teleferico (yellow), nice neighborhood. They also have a toilet at the parking. We also asked to sleep in the car - no problem. The gate closes at 11pm. The family live in a house in the parking area. 35BOB/24h

name: museo comunitario calazaya
description: A gem in the middle of rural Bolivia. The dirt road leads past Quinoa fields and a few green meadows with Llamas. We were exploring Tomave from RN5 and decided to drive to Tica Tica when we came through Calazaya. Reynaldo flagged us down and told us about the museum and the hot pool. The museum has basic displays of traditional clothing, music instruments and agricultural tools from the pre-columbian and colonial times. The Alcalde himself came to greet us and explained some of the displays. Everyone was super friendly. While I would not drive there just for this museum if you are exploring the area anyway, it's surely worth a stop.

name: Vinoteca El Origin
description: Definitely the best bar in town to hangout. Good coffee, beers and wine. Great tunes too.

name: Hostal Emperador
description: For 30 bob pp they gave us (2 persons) a room for three with one double and one single bed. Bathroom is shared. The room was simple and alright,  bed very comfortable.  We didn't take the shower, so we don't know if they have hot water, but they said so. Bathroom clean. The family that runs the hostel is very very nice! They offered us a night park for a car for 5 bob.

name: Saipina Toll
description: Toll point on the way to Santa Cruz. Paid 14 BOB

name: Anami Hotel
description:
Very good hotel for the price. Not cheap, but nice big rooms with good beds. Very clean. Nice breakfast. Try to have a room upstairs, they seem better than the ones on ground level. 
We were able to let our car in a open air parking close to it (independent of the hotel) for 34 pesos per day.

name: JP taller Land Rover
description:
It looks like a small garage, but Jeanette, the owner, knows how to run the place. We arrived with our Defender at the end of the day with different problems : brakes, transmission axle, front wheel leak, ... In less than 24 hours, everything was fixed and we could move on. There is a nice stock of spare parts. And if something is missing, her connexions and the LR club works very well to find a solution quickly. 
It’s a place to go with your LR !

name: LRO Workshop
description:
Land Rover & Jaguar workshop. 
We had some repairs to do on our Defender (silent blocks on the steering front bar, electric fan of the heating device) and on overall maintenance. 
All this had be done efficiently and with the kindness of Lucho, the owner. 
A place to go !

Cédric

name: Rocio de Salud. Vegetarian restaurant.
description:
Vegetarian restaurant with healthy and rich food. 17 bolivianos menu with carrot, vegetable salad, peanut or quinoa soup, second to choose humita or stew, wholemeal bread and tisane rate. I found locals, no tourist.
To go you have to enter the passage and climb the stairs in the left hand.

Restaurante vegetariano con comida saludable y rica. 17 bolivianos el menú con juego de zanahoria, ensalada de verduras, sopa de maní o de quinoa, segundo a eligir humita o guiso, pan integral y tasa de tisana. Encontré local, ninguna turista.
Para ir hay que entrar en el pasaje y subir las escaleras en la mano izquierda.

name: Hostal Maria Victoria (~Casa de huespedes Maria Victoria)
description: Nice cheap and clean hostal close to centrum! we paid 80b for matrimonial room. Inside is place for bikes. Outside is place for 2 cars or motorbikes. it is safe area...

name: hostel los andes
description: Bedroom with 2 single beds to 25 bol pp. Hot water, electricity, kitchen.

name: Posada Mario & ana
description: dormitory from 5 to 15 bol pp. Or room with 2-3 single beds or matrimonial to 25 bowl pp. Hot water, electricity, kitchen. Also the possibility to book the ascenscion of parinacota with mario

name: Banco Union
description: Banco Union ATM now in Torotoro! At least one hostel accepts credit card too so times are changing !

name: Roy's House B&T
description:
Don't be fooled by the simple sign and garage door. Behind lies a nice hotel with clean rooms and comfortable beds. Maggie and Roy speak English and took good care of us. As a former guide he knows the area and things to do. Parking is available onsite and a closed lot 2 blocks away. Not big rig friendly though.
Breakfast with French Toast and Omelet? yes please! I'd definitely stay here again.

name: Catedral Drugstore
description: Good drugstore, very polite and professional

name: The lost valley
description: Not sure why no one else has found this. Is a lot more Protected and off the main highway than the other sites in the area. Follow the dirt road, plenty of viable camp spots along the way. Up the top of the road is a house where we asked to camp here and they were very enthusiastic and friendly and more than happy for us to stay. No trees but you will not be seen from the highway. Possible for 2wd and big rigs dependant on the weather. If they can’t make it to this spot there are other flat areas for big rigs and 2wd along the way. Room for all, with plenty of other sites on the road.

name: Santiago de Okola
description:
One of the nicest places around the Titikaka Lake for camping.  Not completely clean (take garbage with you please!) but it is beautiful, you can drive next to the water and set your tent on a green site, friendly people and safe, we spent 3 days here. 
Just find the yellow building (hospital) and then follow the road to the cemetery.

name: Bolivian beach
description: Yes ! A beautiful bolivian beach, no people, no rubish.

name: Dona Prima and Winston
description: this lovely old couple can rent you a cheap room in their family house. Basic but clean! Prima can cook for you. Nice walk on the right side of the salar! bring your own food here! Fresh pan available at the tienda on the opposite side of the main square.

name: Taller de Bicicletas cycle trek El Alto
description: After two taller de bicicletas, this the best mechanic have met. Friendly and very professional, cheap by the way. Perfect

name: Tailer Electrico
description: Nice guy repaired our wipes motor. 2h work, we payed 70BOB. Recomend!

name: Tienda la kantuta
description: You can get fuel here for 6 pesos bolivianos.

name: Family owned little restaurant
description: Next to hostel/camping suma samawi we have here a small little restaurant runned by a very friendly family. They offer almuerzos, sandwiches, coffee,... The portions are big, all fresh and they have the best price in town and a beautiful view on the lake. I have been the only tourist so far. People don’t really do the effort to walk ‘so far’ but it’s absolutely worth it!

name: Hot Showers 10 bol
description:
hot showers for 10 bol. time "10 minutes ".
the accommodation is The Condor. Shower not very strong but very hot.
----
duchas calientes por 10 bolivianos. tiempo "10 minutos".
hospedagem el condor. ducha no muy fuerte pero bien caliente.

name: Vegetarian restaurant
description:
Vegetarian menu. Good food and decent quantity.
Maybe it lacked of seasoning and salt, but it was good.
It costs 17bs and comes with juice, whole wheat bread, salad, soup and a second dish.
We liked it.

menu vegetariano viene buena porcion y comida buena. 
um poco sim sazon y sal pero estava buena.
custa 17bs y viene jugo, un pan integral,  ensalada, sopa y segundo.
Nos gustó.

name: Money exchange
description:
Exchange house where we exchanged Reais with good quotation.
I recommend.

Casa de câmbio que nos câmbio reais com buena cotacion.
recomiendo.

name: Hardware stores street
description:
Street with various hardware stores, there are led tapes and much more...
Well located.

Calle com diversas tiendas de ferreteria, hay cintas de led y mucho mas...
Bien central.

name: Hostel Candelaria
description: very nice hotel with a fantastic view.  Garage for several motorbikes or a sprinter van, 2 kitchens (may ask to chip in a bit for gas if you use it a lot) and a really nice terrace overlooking the valley.  Oscar the owner is awesome and very helpful.  comfier beds.  rooms with view hot showers 40/PP but can negotiate down slightly if you stay multiple days.  highly recommend!

name: Alojamiento Parra Franklin Aguirre
description:
Av Alemania y Av Costanera. 
A private room costs me 40 soles .. and my motorcycle is parked in the entrance.
Wifi is ok.
Bathroom and Baños are apart.
Lucky to find this hotel much cheaper and quiet than in Cochabamba

name: Hostel
description: Actually there is 2 Hostel around here. But this one has discount for cyclists. I talked the owner and he accepted this deal for all cyclists. 30p and included Breakfast,dinner and tea cafe . Room 6 is for cyclists. They have clean toilets, kitchen, electric, and if you want they have water and some snacks. Owner name is Eusebio Saire

name: Uturunku cyclist Camp
description: Before the Road Barrier there is a nice spot for tents. You can rest here one night. There is some rocks front of the tent area you can hide your equipments inside the holes and close with some stones. You can climb easy to top and turn back for lunch time :). After this point you need 15 km and 1200m for 5740m parking area

name: Almacen Las Lomas
description: Good small shop with all the basics. Claudia the owner is very nice. Always cold beer !!

name: Las Lomas Garage
description: We came with a problem in our suspension, we had o broken spring and damaged bushes. They fixed easily and the price was god. This garage is the same place than the camping site.

name: PROSALUD
description:
Medical center, good and cheap. 
Open 24|7

name: Hidden spot at abondand houses
description: Very good spot for cyclists to spend the night. Close, but not visible from the street. Level spot to put your tent (grass). Mid march there was even a small creek closeby, however i think that it will disappear in dryseason.

name: Hidden spot at creek (cyclists only)
description: Hidden and level spot next to a creek. In the evening a few shepherds (sheep, donkeys, llamas, cows) passed by. They said it’s fine to camp here. Very quiet during the night.

name: Nice canyon
description: Nice canyon with view on waterfall, parking spots along the road. Couple of meters walking to the edge of canyon.

name: Hot showers
description: there are hot showers, not very clean, it costs 6 bolivianos per person.

name: Hot and Cold Showers
description:
Public shower, clean bathrooms, costs 8 bolivianos per person, opening hours until 19:30, I recommend parking the car at another place and walking.
-----
Ducha publica,banos limpios,cuesta 8 bolivianos por persona,horário de atencion hasta las 19:30,recomiendo parquear el carro en outro sítio y venir caminando.

name: Money Exchange Houses
description:
at this point a currency exchange
In center

name: volkswagem parts
description: here is a shop with pieces for your volkswagen

name: Camping Las Lomas
description:
There’s no places to refill propane bottles in Bolivia. Marcos in Las Lomas camping site has different adapters and an interesting technique to refill bottles, it worked pretty well for our Chilean bottle.
We stayed in this camping place for almost 10 days like at home....very recommendable

name: ATM BNB
description: Atm close to the camping place, just in front of the super market.

name: Quiet place at a river
description:
After a long day on the bicycle you will be happy to find this spot. It’s an almost level place close to a river. It’s more for cyclists, but i guess a 4x4 could drive down here too. The water from the river is drinkable, however you’ll need to filter it first because of the sediments (grey-ish water). The river should have water year round. Also there is a bigger river 1km south, of which im sure that it does not dry out. 
You are slightly visible from the street for bigger cars traveling north (They have a window of about 2 seconds to spot you while passing by). We spent a very quiet night here. All in all a good spot to rest before the next climb.

name: Flat spot close to the road
description:
After a very long mountain road, we decided to stop here for the night.
It’s a place just close to the road but hide thanks to a little mont of rocks.
Very quiet and a nice view of Cerro Chorolque on the top of the hill.

name: Gas station scam
description: Gas station ES Cotapata. They charge a 25% surcharge to foreigners and try to claim “factura” which we did not request or receive. She filled us up, said “listo”, we handed her the money, and then noticed she filled only 25% of what we requested. We could not do anything to get our extra money back at this point as she would not budge and what can you really do? So watch out.

name: tienda de lubricante
description:
Small store that sells lubricants/oils. Not all types but there are some.

pequeña tienda que vende lubricantes. no hay todos los tipos pero algunos.

name: Lavaya
description: Laundry, good price, on time and friendly.

name: Hotel Titikaka
description:
PEEPING TOM SECURITY GUARD. We pulled up here thinking it would be a good place to camp after crossing the border; it was already dark and this place offered a seemingly secure place to camp with large gravel lot. It’s very run down and neglected but we didn’t have much other choice. 

The security guard was walking around as we were preparing dinner, saying hello here and there. I went for a shower in one of the cabins the owner let us use (we were sleeping in our camper). The security guard knocked on the door while I was in the shower, I yelled “occupado!”. He proceeded to open the door as I am in the shower that had no door or curtain. I covered myself best I could and yelled “no no no!” Three times before he closed the door and had a good look. He tried to deny he saw anything afterwards (though admitted he opened the door and both heard me say occupado and no no no). However there’s no way he didn’t know I was in there since the lights on, it was dark outside, and he would have absolutely heard the shower. Not only that I could see him looking at me. It was surely intentional. I honestly felt, and still feel very violated and it was a horrible first night in Bolivia. 

The owner did not seem to care only said “disculpe madam.” And my Spanish is not very good so I really was at a loss with what to do. NOT RECOMMENDED!

name: Micromercado Tonys / Becca
description: Little shop where you can buy 20l bottle of potable water for 12 BOL (if you return the bottle!)

name: Remachadora a Pala
description: Brakes, fluids, springs. Open on a Saturday. Our inner brake pads were down to metal on metal, so we had them adhere new brake pads (with rivets) as of course we could not find ford parts but Toyota parts are easy to find around town. They do all models. Front and rear brakes cost us 400 bob. ($58 USD). They were friendly and we think they did a mediocre job; they’ll at least take us to Santiago where we can get new brakes.

name: casa de don Lorenzas Reyes
description: very nice place for camping or a room on the way from toro toro to sucre in Tin Tin (just past Mizque. plenty of room for many cars, motorcycles, big rig in secure parking.   kitchen, but no hot water. very nice owner.  call him: 7437941

name: DIAR hospedaje
description: Small homestay , an aceptable option to sleep on the way to you destination. They have parking lot for 2 cars o one big one. Intenet ,shared bathroom and shower (not in the best conditions)

name: The guardian coffee
description: On the corner of the main street, black building. Ok coffee and BEST WIFI we had in Bolivia so far. Super friendly ladies.

name: Llantenro-Good place to change motorbikes tires
description:
20 b per tire
Change manually but efficient
Call Ever Cruz
Tel 72 44 79 77

name: La ruta andina - pub pizza restaurant
description:
Good place to eat 
Almuezo 18b incl. soup, little salade, main dish and drink
Good local food
Owner friendly
Nice decoration

name: Thermals (free, spectacular views)
description:
Start of the road from Quime to some thermals. The government built some concrete baths which the hot water runs into, these are not maintained so are lined by algae, but it's not too bad. The locals were very surprised to see 3 gringos so i don't think it's very common to see tourists here. The views from the thermals are absolutely stunning, this is 100% worth the trip if you are in Quime.

How to get there:
Follow the road marked by this pin (leading Northwest out of town, up the mountain) for a while. If memory serves me correctly one odometer measured 22km from town center, the other measured 24km. This should leave you heading in to a valley. You need to turn left down a small dirt road. There are a few thatched cottages just before the turn off. You'll know you're on the correct path because you will have to open a couple of gates. Follow this until you cross a bridge, then you're almost there. Go a bit further until the mud gets too bad, then walk up the hill. Look for steam coming from the thermals.

Road warning: The road isn't great, and has some very steep sections. 2wd may struggle. 4wd and bikes should be fine

name: water faucet
description: In the town Toledo is a faucet with water. Local said it is potable water.  It is located on the plaza infront of the church.

name: Next to little stream
description:
Grassy area just off the road next to a small stream. Enough space for all size vehicle and tents. Close to the road but not visible. 
There is a path leading through but no traffic. Quiet night.

name: Uyuni parking next to torre del reloj
description:
our car and the car of two french guys was broken here in the same time in the middle of the day in a busy street.
We and the Frech asked before leaving the car the police whether this is a safe place and they confirmed that we can leave the car here (we even assume that they might be part of the game). The police also pretended that this happened the first time here. We do not really believe that. 
However, afterwards they tried to help and were looking for video material. Of course we do not expect that they find someone.

name: Between Julaca and San Juan
description: Camp in the desert 150m away from the gravel road. Coming from Uyuni this was the first dry spot for a long time. (There where salt lakes with water in March). Visible from routa 5, but almost no traffic. Free camping spot big enough for big rigs.

name: Formidable spot with shower
description:
A protect basket field where you can camp if you are in bike and...
- HOT SHOWER : solar shower open and free next to the field. Sooo hot a pleasure in the road.
- Water : from the shower
- toilets : dirty 

For the rigs, there is a field outside, wich is flat and perfect for you. 
Just few inhabitants very kind and curious kids.
Enjoy your shower 😀

name: Beautiful river side camp. Off main route and unseen
description: Between Julo and Negrillos, we were looking for a spot to camp and headed up a side track. kept going and the road turned right into a small canyon with a lovely river running through. Camped on bank. loads of firewood. No one for miles.

name: Next to the road and the river
description:
Difficult to find a place to stay on our way to Oruro.
We finally stayed here next to the road and the river. Visible from the road but no one at night. We spent a quiet and safe night.

name: tec-vial aluminum carpenter
description: these guys can do anything with aluminum.  fixed my panniers in no time flat and asked only 10 bs.  very helpful

name: Lubricentro Villaman
description: I got an oil change with American oil for 170 Bolivianos (with 2.5l of oil). Very professional and fast.

name: Warning: Quinoa Adventure tours
description: Don‘t book a tour with this company. We started late and therefore couldn‘t see all places and had to rush the other places and only had one hour at the hot springs before they closed at 10pm. The boss told different people different departure and arrival times. We ran out of fuel on the way back. Some people paid 600Bob for 3 days, some 850Bob. The boss didn’t tell us that we have to pay an extra 150Bob for the national park entry. You should definitely do a 3-day-tour and sleep one night at the hot springs, but don’t book it here. Our driver was very nice but very tired, too. He couldn’t speak English (despite the boss told us he can speak basic English). The boss was not here as we came back and was not reachable by phone.

name: Pizzeria Villa Esperanza
description: Best pizza of the trip so far, in 4 years! Wood fired oven with 60 different Options. From 55 bob for a Medium size to 95 bob for a Family size. Inexpensive good selection of wine. If you’re staying in the area you must visit.

name: Residencial La Cabaña
description: Really nice and cheap hotel, we payed 108 BOB for a double room with breakfast. They have hot showers. But the receptionist was never really there so it was difficult to check-in and the breakfast was one hour late. But still a god deal.

name: Canyon del Palca
description:
A little road go down from Uni to the canyon. You can park in the main place of the village, and go by foot (around 2h to go down, and 2h30 to go back).
Very nice canyon, with amazing view !

name: Palca bus station
description: Bus station where you can go back to La Paz after the canyon for 10 BOB

name: Start of the trail Vallee de Las Animas
description:
If you arrive from La Paz, you will pass the post control, and after the bridge, take left to park the car. 
You have to go up by the dry river bed and enter in the valley.
Enjoy !

name: El Alto
description:
OK to put diesel directly in the vehicle. No negotiation possible. 8.88 cash payment only. Possible to fill up with water too. Very nice staff
----
OK pour mettre diesel directement dans le véhicule. Pas de négociation possible. 8,88 bol paiement en efectivo uniquement. Possible de faire le plein d'eau aussi. Personnel très gentil.

name: Shower in hostal
description: It’s possible to just take a shower in this hostal (next to the banco union on the Plaza Sucre). It’s coast 8 Bob/shower. We are not sure it’s usual so it’s could be change. Not really hot but ok

name: Up in the hill
description: Perfect night in the hill. windy but quiet. be carefoul if rain.. don't need 4x4.

name: Chinese restaurant
description: Small family restaurant, we had fried rice and noodles, each cost 15 BOB, big portions and fresh vegetables, all in all quite good.

name: Las Cabañas!
description:
40 BOB private room (actual a double bed even tough I'm here on my own)

private bathroom, amazing view and fast WiFi

name: Tapu Filtred Combustible
description:
Very kind staff.
You can get the Bolivian price by filling the tank.
You can also sleep here, there is as well WC and may be shower.
You can fill with potable water.

name: Carpinteria - Muebleria / carpentry
description:
Our camper’s table was broken and we took it here for repair. Very good job and efficent! Highly recommended. Ask for Rene and discuss the price with him. He’s not cheap but not expensive either, considering the quality of the job.
If you have dry toilets you can also get sawdust (aserrin)

name: Domingos Place
description:
The only one in town, he also helped in Colchane because there is no mechanic. He is a good mechanic in traditional things but he don’t have knowledge in electronics. Very friendly and helpful, he only speaks Spanish. A little bit expensive (he is the only one). 
How to find: 200 meters before the gas station on the right side is a parking area for trucks. On the corner knock and ask for Domingo.

name: YPFB
description:
we paid 3.72 bolas for 1L diesel with Jerri-canes. without problems.

on a pu remplir bos jerrycanes de diesel au prix bolivien san problémes. 3,72bob/l.

name: balcon en la montaña
description:
spacious parking, very clean and quiet in the middle of nowhere.very beautiful
---
estacionamiento amplio ,muy limpio y tranquilo en mitad del la nada.muy bello

name: Lagunas Route - Be prepared!
description:
We accidentally did the Laguna Route north to south after taking a wrong turning. Google maps said 3 hours. It probably took us 12. The road is horrible in places. Only trucks with great clearance could do this, and even then you should expect to break down. 

Had to wild camp halfway along and despite a decent wind break, temperatures got down to -10 and our radiator froze...

I’ve attached a photo of a relatively representative section, not even the worst. By the end we were so tired of going 10kmph and constant jolting we didn’t even care about the scenery. Considering the amazing beauty north and south of this road, for us, it really wasn’t worth it. We would recommend the road east of here to anyone doing it again! 

Price for east route additional 25bol pp

name: quiet free camp close to sucre center
description: very nice and quiet place, above the city, but at the same time very close to it. absolutely suitable for big rigs as well as for a tent. dusty ground, might be quite muddy, if it rains. the spot itself is big and has enough distance to the "neighbours" to give a little privacy which usually is rare in cities... we felt also very save over a time period of 4 nights that we have spent here. sometimes the dog gangs have a meeting at night what can be kinda noisy, but normally ends after one hour. there's a small shop near by, that provides you with some drinks or food, if you're in the need of it and one doesn't need to go to the city. by the way also the view from here into the valley is really beautiful! only doubt is about deep hanging calbles over the street, but the deepest ones I estimate, should be at least 3,50 metres high above the ground.

name: No through road
description: Driving from Sucre to Toro Toro. There is a man made fence blocking the road just before you get to the bottom of the river crossing. We had to turn around and drive back to Sucre.

name: Parking Garaje don Guichi
description: Great place to park safely and travel to la Isla del Sol and other trips outside of Copacabana. 15Bob/night for cars and small buses. Number 72092956

name: Restaurant Choriceria Avenida
description: Te best economic and big menu from Colombia to Bolivia. just 20bs menu full. Nice people, clean bathrooms, nice place, delicius food.

name: road in canyon
description: You can enter the canyon with 4x4. Beautiful, maybe good protection for the night in dry season

name: Hostel
description: Nice place and 30b. It has garage for motors and bicycle. Restaurants are one block away. Rice, Chicken, papas 10b.. I also went to hospital near hostel for blood rate check. they gave the results in 5 hours 20B.

name: Grassy spot at small river
description: Next to the road but a step below, so not visible from the road, there is a flat and grassy place for just one tent (on the wrstern side near a small bridge, you have to go to the northern end of the stone plateau). The water is clear but as there are animals around you should filter it.

name: Farmer House at the foot of the hill
description:
This place is just amazing. Jesus and Reina are the owner of this small farm at the feet of the hill. To go there, just pass the Juli Beach spot, there is a board indicating the access of a archeological site on the left. The farm is little bit further. Jesus and Reina are generous and gave us food and traditional oven for cook. There is no shower and no bathroom but there is a water point from the source of the hill, not sure drinkable of not boiled. You can also walk at the top of the hill ( 1h walk ) to get a 360 degree view on the altinplano. If you can chance you can I find the old stone from the ancestor and even some rock painting ! Their big garden is also full of medicinal plant which can be reached and collected if you ask :)  Highly recommended for the beauty and the happiness that you can find here.

They will charge between 5 and 10 soles a night, depends on how many people and car / tent are willing to stay.

name: Ruins
description: We can see the ruins from the road. Protected from the wind. Nice place to sleep with a tent.

name: Khora Gas Station
description: Nice manager allowed 20L right into gas tank at local price. Would not accept tip.

name: Flat area near the road
description: Nice flat area for rigs, just a little to the back you can setup your tent. Some traffic during the day, quiet at night. Save place to stay.

name: Lakeside
description:
Grass meadow right by the river. 
There’s a house nearby which looks abandoned. 
Besides that met only two friendly locals

name: Riverside high up
description:
Close to the river but elevated enough not too worry about springfloods. 
Tent cannot be seen from the road, van would probably show.

name: Residencial Carmen
description:
Matrimonial room, shared bathroom, hot shower, parking, laundry room and wifi at 60 bol for 2 people.

Habitación matrimonial, baño compartido, ducha de agua caliente, parqueadero, lavadero de ropa y wifi a 60 bol para 2 personas. Cómodo para la noche, no tan sucio.

name: Refugio Lagunas
description: celso calle pacaje owner of this place. he is living with his family here.They are really kind. 30b and restaurant is one blok away

name: Next to Lorenzo’s House
description: Next to the highway is the house of Lorenzo Martinez an 80 year old man who lives alone. He tends to his sheep in the mountain during the day and comes down around 5pm. He is really sweet and seems to like the company of visitors. We asked if we could pay him but he said no. We gave him cheese, fruits, batteries and a beer but what he really likes are coca leaves and cigarettes. Nice overnight spot between Potosi and Tarija.

name: teleférico/Iglesia
description: Very safe, flat and big parking lot to spend the night. there is a small supermarket with a sauna for 10bob pp for 1 hr. Close to everything but away from the craziness. Huge, huge, slide with boliviana daredevils included.

name: Hostal Nelly
description: A place in preparation (everything is new), no sign yet (look for the Abogado). Double room with private bathroom for 60b. Great quality (best mattress we've had in weeks! , spacious room with table and chairs, tv, very clean). Wi-Fi is decent, but doesn't have coverage in some parts of the building, because currently they are using one from a neighboring hostel. Charming owner (she made a round in the evening to say good night to every guest!). Breakfast for 10b will be available there soon (there is a big dining room and info about the breakfast posted in the rooms already). When we asked about hot water to make some coffee, they brought us a big thermos in the morning.

name: Camping & Hospedaje La Bolivianita
description: Very nice established Campground right next to the Ruta 7. The entrance street is not leveled. No wifi but cheap (20 Bol per Person), outside kitchen, cold shower and river access. The owner has one dog but don't be afraid - he is okay. And there is a Pizza Oven ;-) Very friendly people.

name: Next to the Mirador
description: We where at the Mirador and asked the guy who works there if it's okay if we sleep here on the parking, he didn't know (ore don't want to or whatever). At our way back we found this place. Quiet at night, some locals for the Sunset.

name: Taller Don Ale Mechanica en General
description:
Good mechanic at the Misiones Route. Helped us with a engine problem which turned out no to be a engine problem ;-) He organized us a transport to Santa Cruz and called the mechanic there. He only speaks Spanish but is very patient. His two friends are very nice and helpful too. The "garage" is right next to his house so he is almost always there. 
Official opening Hours:
Monday to Saturday 07:30 - 20:00 
Mobile phone: 609-09810

name: Big Carpart Shop Saltore
description: Car parts for VW Ford Jeep Chevrolet and others. Very nice guys got a lollypop there ;-)

name: Carparts Napoli
description: They have parts for Mercedes Benz/BMW/Audi and brasilian Carparts

name: German Consulate
description: Here is the German Consulate in the 2nd floor. Opening hour's: 08:00-12:00. If you can't find it (ist a little bit difficult) just ask at the information.

name: YPS Cristo Rey
description: sell gasolina for international price. friendly guys.

name: Honda Lake
description: Amazing spot for camping, no turists at the mornig, be ready for a cold night but extremely beautiful.

name: Cars blessing
description: Everyday but mostly during weekends, cars get blessed in front of the cathedral. It is a really nice and colourful ceremony. I have put a photo of the schedule. If you want to do it with your car, come 20/30 minutes before and decorate it with the help of the people selling flowers and other decorative things. You also got to give 10 bol to the father after his blessing.

name: Supermarket supersur
description: Supermarket were you can find everything. Maybe a bit more expensive.

name: El Curichal - Swimming Pool
description:
Cool hostel, I guess it’s even better in the dry season with more people cause we were almost alone ! :) THE BIG POINT : Swimming pool ! This is just like a blessing to see the pool after a crazy warm and sweaty day/tours :)
- you got dorms (between 45 and 70bs depends on the size of the dorm) and matrimonial for 2 with private bathroom : 157bs but you can negotiate the 150. Mattresses are good and the place is clean
- normally bbq every night but as we were almost alone, nothing for us 
- pool table (not anymore there 2024) in a good shape, beers available at the bar ! 
- the breakfast is included but it’s really small : 2 bread, little “butter” + marmelade, 2 slices papaya and one banana,  milk/cafe/tee, chocolate for the milk. 
- wifi is great (bad in 2024) at the reception, at the bar and the pool but the one in the rooms didn’t worked and we forgot to ask why.. 

He staff is ok it I think the place can be really cool with a bit more people. We enjoyed the calm tough! :)

name: toll
description:
Toll. For Cochabamba we paid 5bv. 
Keep the ticket.

name: Water from a natural fountain
description: Right in the  curve there‘s a natural fountain with good and clean water to fill up in bottles.

name: Camp protected from wind sheltered with a stone
description: Nice place if you get caught by rain/snow, like we did. It’s out of the main road. Super quiet and no wind when we camped, just snow and rain since is quite high altitude 4850m.

name: Down by the river
description: Just a small pullout from the road but very nice, hidden from the road, quiet, no rubbish. Quite easy access even with 2WD. We didn't camped there, just made a break for lunch. Water brownish but ok for bathing. Enough space even for big rigs.

name: Turismo Comunitario Titicaca
description:
Tickets sale to go to the island of the sun and the moon. One day tour. Departure at the port of Copacabana at 8:30 am and arrival at the same port at 4:30 pm. 65bol price for two people. The purchase here is cheaper than at the dock where we were asked for 80bol for two people.

Venta de boletos para ir la isla del sol y la luna. Tour de un día. Salida en el puerto de Copacabana a las 8:30am y llegada al mismo puerto a las 4:30pm. Precio 65bol para dos personas. La compra aquí es más económica que en el muelle donde nos pedían 80bol para dos personas.

name: Finca La Vispera
description: Acepts credit/debit card. Delicious fresh food, organic and lot of different international options, from breakfast, lunch or tea time. "Cafe-Jardin" with a great view of the terraces where all the plants grow and the town. Amazing birds activity. You can also buy some vegetables to your trip. Open from 8am to 5pm. Options from 15bs a cup of coffe, not expesive for the quality the have.

name: Finca La Vispera
description: Accepts credit/debit card. Clean, fully equipped, comfortable Cabins for 2,3,4,5,7 and 12. Very friendly staff. Cabbins Have electric heating for cold weather, great shelters, the concept includes the opportunity to harvest from the organic terraces in order to eat while your stay and also a tea of cortesy per night. Prices from 175bs/night and improves if the group is bigger. Also have a restaurant, herbshop, Free wifi, Laundry service from 10bs for 1kg. Also have a soccer field, places to walk and meditate (like the throne of stone, perfect to see the village, sunset, sunrise).

name: quana pacha clarity of  day
description:
Francesco y Maria are 2 aymara. They built this amazing house themselves and cook great trout. 35 bob for lunch with trout and 35 for one night. They tell you a lot of stories about the island, Aymara culture and the temple. 

WhatsApp +591 6199 2633

name: Alineado Balanceo mecanica general
description:
Small but fully functional and technologically equipped mechanic to adjust the wheels if they’re getting used unevenly.

And if you need to balance the wheels call Grover +59172571968

name: Alojamiento Pinto
description: Located opposite the park or main square. Spacious garage. The owner is friendly and the place is nice. 30Bls pp. In the park there is free WIFI.

name: Restaurant Sol Andes
description: We had excellent dinner (45pp) with a nice view at the lake. We asked to sleep in our van at the parking. No problem :-) the owners are very friendly. We also could use the toilet (no shower).

name: Opposite Plaza
description: Safe Place to park, in front of the police, next to the railroad station.

name: Mesa Sagrada and Ruinas de Chinkana
description: Incan historical site on the north part of the Isla del Sol. A 30 minutes walk takes you to this ruins from Challapampa. Beautiful sunset on the rock behind.

name: Hostal on beach
description: Great hostal right on the beach with awesome view. We first wanted a double room with shared bathroom for 25 bolivianos pp but they offered us a beautiful matrimonial with private bathroom and view to the beach to two sides for 40 pp and we took it. The bathroom is the most modern we was on this trip and the hot shower is great. Potable water available and you can use the kitchen to prepare your own meals.

name: Restaurant Q'uimsa Bolivia
description: Nice restaurante right next to the beach. Even though we were the only tourists in town they managed to make us a great hot soup with bread for supper. Then we asked for breakfast the next day and Valeriana prepared a great milk coffee and bread with Marmelade.. we had to leave in a hurry to catch the boat but I think she was making eggs as well! Great owners and fair prices!

name: Turismo Comunitario (Visit the north of Isla del Sol)
description:
HOW TO VISIT THE NORTH OF ISLA DEL SOL:

Everyone you ask in Copacabana or Yumani will tell you that the north of Isla del Sol is 'closed' for visitation. However the north is more beautiful and has a complete infrastructure to receive tourists (before the boycott that started two years ago the north was receiving most visitors).

Here we tell you how we managed to visit Challapampa and its surroundings in the north:

1. In Copacabana at the Plaza Sucre where all the buses to La Paz leave is a small agency called 'Turismo Comunitario del Lago Titicaca'. -16.1655688, -69.0879274
This agency sells tickets for the community boat that goes 3 times a week to Challapampa (Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday). We got a one-way ticket for Saturday for 35 bolivianos. The boat leaves at 1 pm in Copacabana and arrives around 3 pm in Challapampa. We were the only tourists on the boat. Further a local of the community will accompany you, answer questions and help you to find a hospedaje (you'll want to stay at least one night on the island).
2. On the island: After we arrived we found an good hostel to stay on the beach (Wilka Kutti), left our stuff there and walked to the Inkan ruins in the north (Mesa Sagrada and Chinkana). Also experienced a great sunset over the lake Titicaca. Back in Challapampa we ate a great soup at the restaurant 'Q'uimsa Bolivia'. As there are almost no tourists most restaurants are closed.
3. Return to Copacabana: You can leave Challapampa by boat only Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays at 07:30 am. Another option is to walk to the south of the island (beautiful 8 km walk, take the Inkan steps over the top!). In Yumani there are a lot of tourist boats that take you for 20 bolivianos back to Copacabana (leave around 3 pm).

name: Modern gas station
description: Here we got 40 L of gasoline 'Especial' for local price with factura in our jerrycans (150 bolivianos). Nice guys. We gave them a BIG tip.

name: Isla Cojota - Titicaca
description:
A local island just for yourself, tourist free with just a few friendly locals working some fields, straight view for a sunsight over Lago Titicaca, you can also make a fire and just stargaze in perfect silence. there is a natural water source near the trees. totally recommend!   

Edited to add - access by a narrow causeway road.

lugar perfeito para acampar ao lado do lago Titicaca, isolada de tudo. vc pode fazer uma fogueira e curtir um céu estrelado. rola uma nascente perto das árvores secas.

name: Cheap basic rooms
description: Simple rooms available, I paid 25 Bol for private room, shared bath (only option).  Go to the main plaza and you will see A4 posters for Alojamiento above a chicken restaurant and the shop next door. Enquire there and they will contact the owner. Rooms are one block away from plaza.

name: Train graveyard by car
description: At this point you can drive with your car into the train graveyard. Really good dirt track.

name: Convento San Francisco (Crypts and roof)
description: Here you can visit the Convento San Francisco in Potusi. There are several tours a day. Cost is 20 soles per person and 10 additional if you want to take pictures. The tour is well organized and they spoke a really good Spanish. The view from the roof is awesome. Recommend.

name: Restaurant Maderos (Churrasqueira)
description: We had an awesome menu/cena here: salad buffet, soup and main plate with barbecue meat. They also made us a giant jar (1.5 L) of fresh passion fruit juice without sugar. Nice and calm ambient in a backyard and friendly waiters. Good WiFi too. Can't recommend more. Menu was 15 bolivianos and 1.5 L fruit juice 13 bols. Open 11am to 3pm and 5 to 10 pm.

name: The Alamo - Brilliant USA themed restaurant
description: We came here after the vinoteca place was rubbish atmosphere. Really fun place with quirky memorabilia, and absolutely incredible incredible food. The nachos were so good, and all our meals were fantastic for a cheap price.

name: Hostal Cadena
description: We stayed here in a twin room with shared bathroom for 50 bols pp. The room was not modern but really clean and the beds good. WiFi worked well. Flat TV. Friendly staff. Good shower. It's a small place and they have only a few rooms. We had the only room on our floor and the 'shared' bathroom was in front of our room. Breakfast 10 bols additional.

name: Camp near rock formations
description: On the way north, we were looking for a place to camp. Directly beside the road on the right side towards Oruro there is a large area with rocks. A small path leads to this area, just north of the river. There are several ways to camp here. There are flat, soft meadows along the river. But here you can be seen from the road. If one drives into the rocky landscape, there are different, partly sloping areas where one can pitch one's tent. If one follows the path further, one passes the enclosures of llamas.

name: canyon mirador
description: this is a stunning location, especially if you have a drone. there is a nice bridge & a huge canyon with a walking bridge. looks like right out of a del Toro fantasy land.

name: Restaurant Rancho Grande
description: Restaurant right next to route 5. Saturdays and Sundays they serve local plates like fish barbecue, duck and sun-dried meat for 25-30 bolivianos. They also gave us a nice tasty soup. During the week they only serve caldos/soups between 6 and 12 am.

name: Banos y duchas
description: There is banos y duchas here that you can use. We didn't try it but was writen 10bs. Looks pretty clean.

name: Rock climbing routes at 'Torre de David'
description: I walked the open trail from the monastery to the Torre de David and found several bolted rock climbing routes. Good new bolts (look like stainless steel). Did not find any further information about the routes. Impressive tower to climb.
