name: Hot River free camp
description:
Level parking lot for a few cars hidden between the trees and right next to the hot river. Locals park their cars there during the day and bath in the river for free. We had an awesome quiet Tuesday night. 

To get there just follow the signs to Biothermal EcoHotel. Park before crossing the wooden bridge on the right between the trees.

Swimming naked in the hot river in the night is awesome!

name: Mirador - lookout
description: Wonderfull view La Paz, altiplano, royal cordillera and lac Titicaca.

name: Camping La Donosa
description:
Peaceful place surrounded by nature and water springs, they have a large pool of natural water and the river is at walking distance, no annoying noises, a lot of space for vehicles, no height restriction. You have to cross a small river to get there but it is not a problem for 2WD vehicles.
We spent 4 amazing days with our 2 dogs, the owner does not speak English but is very friendly and cooperative.
It is better to call or write before arriving since the owner is not always at home. +591 71877364

name: grass near the lake
description: very good spot near the lake. very quiet. you see the fishermen going to fish. great view on the lake.

name: Hostal Paola
description:
Just next to the main square, equipped kitchen, big terrace with a great view of the town's rooftops, plaza and surrounding mountains. Very nice owners. Good Wi-Fi. 
100b for a double room with shared bathroom for one night, we got a 10% discount for staying 2 nights.

name: Canyon del Palca
description: At the very end of the canyon itself, there is a road that goes to Palca. It is in the beginning of this road. This spot has a large grass space, trees, and if you are on the wet season, the Palca River. Cold, as all nights in Altiplano, come prepared. The sky is perfect at night.

name: Good mechanic was open on sunday
description:
After we got our engine light on we wanted to get as fast as we can for a mechanic (we was at samaipata and it was Sunday...)
We arrived to miarana and found this nice place that agreed to help us.

Running by father and his son (Braien). He reset our computer and the light shut down (he explained to us that it can happen when the memory of the computer gets full). And then they also helped us to fix a little problem we got in our wheel. They both was really helpful and nice and also professional. 
Maybe the bast option you have in this area.
(Not sure the coordinares are correct - to arrive - take left from the main street just after the Es velez gas station and after 100 m it will be on your left you will see just a house with a lot of car parts and cars that park there waiting to be fixed.

name: Roadside Place
description: Good levelled place beside the road. Quiet at night. Great view, great sunrise. Some trucks parked nearby.

name: Gravel storage
description: One of the rare possibilities to stay overnight in this section of F3. Close to the road there are three gravel storages, but no road machines here. Traffic during the night.

name: Kiosko Las Playas No. 15
description: To the left of the pier you find a number of food stalls serving pretty much all the same menu. Fresh trout from the lake in a dozen or so variations. We truly enjoyed our lemon trout for 25Bs per plate. Along the trout you get chips, rice or salad. Cash only.

name: Jungle sounds
description: This is a flat and clean pull out at steep gravel road. you can hear the sounds of the jungle and a little of ruta3. Not visible from the main road.

name: Warning: Steep & narrow streets @ >4,000m
description:
Take into account that Potosi is built directly into the mountain at around 4,000m altitude. If you have a bigger rig or/and weaker motor you might face trouble driving through the winding and narrow streets of Potosi. 
Also be prepared to stop at traffic light uphill with lots of inclination. This might be known and obvious for some of you, but if you aren’t knowledgeable about this fact, as we were, take it into consideration. We had to turn around at one point (in a narrow uphill road) as our engine refused to further climb the city center streets. The highways (RN1 and RN 5) helped us to manage the city.

name: Copacabana - Alojamiento
description: Classic Alojamiento. Very basic, we paid 30 per person for a room with two beds. Also have a few others around, but we only checked one of them which was closed. Let us park bikes inside, also think it's possible to park a car but not sure.

name: Old soccer field
description: Nice ans safe place for camping, old soccer field very flat. Close to the town.

name: All type of car mecanic - Alex
description:
Alex is an awesome mecanic. He can repair everything in your car and do the maintenance. He spend the all day fixing small things and do the maintenance and explaining everything to us. 
He is a friend of the owner of the camping Las Lilas and if you need something on your car you definitely have to come here. 
The best is to contact him before, as he is working alone in his garage and have lot of clients : +591 77422311

When you arrive in the street, it is a normal house with a black gate and no sign, but the place inside is huge so even big rigs can come. He has everything to work inside. 

He is number one parachutist in Bolivia so he has a lot to tell you. 

Just note that he has 5 big dogs so if you have one see with him if it is fine.

name: Posada la Cabana Josesana
description: Nice posada/hotel friendly owner.  Clean double room with HBO for 100bob.  short walk from Jesuit Mission.   Best thing was cctv watching my bike (inside gate) linked to my tv. No breakfast but plenty of places on the square to eat

name: Moto Venta Geiser
description:
Super professional motorcycle mechanic in Cochabamba. Legit shop. The owner, Fredy, races motocross and his team does very tidy work. Everything here is race quality.

Fredy’s whatsapp: +59171711798

name: Near Lago Poopó
description:
We stayed here during our trip to Sajama-Uyuni. Turn right at Callipampa.
We took a small dirt road to get to the Lake which is now dry. Possible with any type of vehicle. Quite far from the road and the fields, we spent all afternoon and night, super quiet!

Entel 4G

name: Camping on lake floor
description: In autumn/winter there's no lake, just a stream. We camped on a grassy patch which presumably is submerged in spring/summer. Beautiful location, only recommended when there's little wind. We washed in the stream (o heaven!) and took some water for cooking. Few locals waved to us, nobody seemed to mind. *Update: in the evening the farmer that lives nearby came over, thinking we were cattle thieves. After a mildly confusing chat we established the place is safe (no pumas) and he didn't have a problem with us staying. He asked for a tip and we gave him 15 BOB which he was happy with.

name: Crater Jayocota
description: Lovely place to take a lunch or to sleep near the crater. Calm and nobody here.

name: Auto Decor - repuestos Toyota, Nissan, Mitsubishi, Suzuki
description: A great place to get spare parts for Toyota, Nissan, Mitsubishi, Suzuki and more. We needed an air filter, we got an original Toyota filter brought from another of their shop within 15 minutes. Not sure about the exact coordinates, but it is in this street between tercero anillo externo and interno. In this neighbourhood you will probably find everything you need, it was recommended to us by locals and it is definitely the place to go if you have a problem with your car.

name: Nayler gas station
description: In front of the nayler service station, at the side of the road there is a large space where you can park for free and spend the night.  You can even use the restrooms at the station without problems they are open 24 hours.  very quiet, good option.

name: Potolo main plaza
description: We drove here from niño mayu - the road doesn’t showed on maps.me or google - we just asked the locals and they say its ok and actually it was pretty good (better than the way from sucre to maragua anyway...) ! No problem on dry season also 2wD. We drove here after we did the trail to see the footprints and spent the night here in the main plaza

name: Hotel Filigrana
description: Good hotel in the center, quite at night, WiFi, TV, good mattresses, big rooms with hot shower, secure and covered parking even for big rigs, entrance height is about 5 meters, friendly owner, we paid 60 BOB pppn plus 10 for the parking.

name: Tienda Esperanza
description: Nice lady sells gas here for 6BOB. Got 40L.

name: Lago Titicaca
description: In front of the Onkel.inn Hotel, under the trees. Beautiful view of the lake. Even a dog came to sleep with me and take care of the tent. Spent 2 days there. When I needed to go out somewhere I just left the tent closed and told the guy of the hotel, and it was very safe. I asked for water on the hotel and electricity for my power bank. Cold at night as usual in Altiplano. Very nice spot.

name: Free Camping
description: Free spot, with grass, near of Fuente del Inca. Don't need to go up till the end of the infinite stairs.

name: Rio Blanco
description: Great secluded spot outside of town. Out of sight of the road. Good wind protection along rock wall by the cairn and great views on the canyon rim. The gravel road is easy to miss because it goes straight down alongside the river, but it's smooth and wide and can accommodate several/larger vehicles. If you're headed towards Potosi the entrance will be on your left. No houses nearby and the road dead ends a few hundred meters down at the riverbank. Goats and sheep graze around here and friendly kids and dogs come at sundown to lead them home.

name: ugly. quiet. serviceable
description: OK it's not beautiful. Just a wide smooth dirt road to nowhere with pulloffs and some garbage. But there's no houses and no traffic and it's close to potosí. After the mines it looks good.

name: camp next to the highway outside of uyuni
description: Just a dirt pulloff but nice flat space and easy access with 2wd

name: Anglovision Tours
description: Great tour company for uyuni. Did the three day trip with them and it was affordable (120 bs) reliable (they did what they said on time and everything was as promised.) food was good hostels were cold but fine and the crew was just as helpful and polite as you could want. They stored my van for free while I was on the trip. And most importantly, they let my street puppy come along on the trip at no charge! He was able to sleep in the hostels with me and ride on my lap or in the floorboard. They even gave him food at every meal and checked on how he was doing regularly. Super great group. Can't recommend enough.

name: Awesome Church Ruins
description: Neat ruins of a church. No info but it has a great haunted vibe. Can climb the belltower for views of the countryside

name: Gas
description: Foreigners price 8bs but no trouble filling up

name: Hostal Tinkuna
description: We were lucky to find this place after our failed trial to cross the salt plains from south to north by bicycle. It is a very nice salt hostel run by very friendly people. We got all we needed: a room (twin for 50 bobs pp), hot shower (10 bobs pp), shower for bicycles (free), dinner (quinoa, french fries and lama meat; 25 bobs pp) and breakfast (pancakes with dulce de leche, tea, coffee; 15 bobs pp). They also have a small store where you can buy some crackers and cookies. Recommended!

name: Hostal
description: 20 bols. Hot shower, shared bathroom. In the center of the city. The guy listened to very loud music all day. Very dirty kitchen, you'd rather use your own pan and plates...

name: Toyota, Nissan, Mitsubishi Mechanic
description:
Way In: the garage is in the obispado’s house/school/property, it’s located on the left of the hospital (when facing the hospital) 

To find the garage, go through the big open gate, and follow the road, you’ll pass the basket ball court on your left, and the obispado’s house in front of you / on the right side of the road, and then you’ll see 4x4/pick ups and the garage :)

Valerio is the owner and is super friendly and helpful. We did maintenance on your Land Cruiser from 1982 which turned out to change parts in the transmission and he did an amazing job. He can get most spare parts in top 24 hrs and his knowledge is amazing. He takes car of all cars but specialized in Toyota, Nissan and Mitsubishi. 
Don’t expect someone taking care of your car with a computer, neither WiFi or a fancy place. He is a real Mechanic, his hands are dirty and the garage is not clean, but he has everything he needs. He will be happy to invite you for a coffee in the monastery (the garage belongs to it) next door. He speaks Spanish and Italian and a bit German plus technical words in English. 

100% recommended. 

Opening hours 
Monday - Friday 8:00-12:00 and 14:00-18:00
Saturday 8:00-12:00

Whatsapp +595 68583383

name: Place with nice view
description: Nice place away from the street. Big gravel place all leveled. Maybe sometimes they are working here, taking stones. But there are no machines here. Many places, also for big rigs. Some places are sheltered from the wind.

name: In a curve
description: Little spot in a curve. Almost leveled. Right next to the street. But i think there will be not much traffic during the night. It was getting dark and we didn’t have that many choices.

name: Pullout in a curve
description: Pullout in a curve. Good for one night. Visible from the street. Some traffic during the night. Lots of trash. It was getting dark when we arrived and there are not so many options for staying the night. There is also a river nearby. Its ok for one night. Its not so romantic with a tent.

name: Mercado Central
description: Here you can find all kinds of fruit, veg, meat, cheese, bread etc. Really cheap prices. Everything's fresh and lots of variety. The best places for groceries in Uyuni

name: Museo Ferroviario
description:
Very informative, interesting historical and technical items. Huge train station and maintenance location from the steam lcomotive era. They have steam engines, wagons and also diesel locomotives. You see as well the habitations of the employee. Highly recommend and absolutely worth stopping. 10 Bol/pp.
Outside the museum you can camp for free.

name: Koala Hostel
description:
70bol/p in dorm. Really nice hostel. They have also a private room with it's own bathroom ! A lot of books and guides! Tours available. but Big Deal agency is better, I’d say (more ethical!). 
Nice breakfast with fruits and toast and juice... The difference is they have heaters ! So very comfortable to be hot in this city !

name: Pull off upon a hill Ruta 21
description:
The Ruta 21 between Tupiza and Uyuni is a very impressive and nice mountain road. There are a lot of pull-off on the sides of the road, if you need to rest 1 night. Generally not hidden from the road and sometimes access can be difficult.
We stopped on the top of this hill because there is a large gravel area, which allowed us to park ~40m away from road, it has easy access and nice views over the mountains and valleys, flat and leveled spots, nice sunset, good sun exposure, and very quiet night. All vehicles can fit here but not recommended if you’re in tent because it has no wind shelter

name: Taller mecanico Toreto
description: Luis is not very talkative and not very friendly but he works hard. We have a Chevrolet N300, he didn’t know very well this vehicle but he fixed our brakes well, checked the filters and worked 1 hour on the air system and air filter to try to fix a mysterious problem we had, without making us wait. He told us if we still have the problem after visiting the Salar we could come back. Very fair price, honest and serious work.

name: Churacari access to Salar
description:
We were looking for a shortcut toward the Salar to get out of the horrible road from Coqueza and we saw an access to the Salar from Churacari. The path out of the village is not so bad (some holes but no 4x4 needed) but when we arrived at the Salar there was some water and it was getting dark so we slept on this salty and muddy area. 
In dry season, multiple spots to park between the mountains and the Salar. There is no one around - Churacari is a very small village - some mountains protecting a bit from the wind, nice views over the Salar, nice sunset and sunrise, and total silence

name: Abandoned buildings beside railway
description: We were going from Atocha to Uyuni and had a strong headwind. We found this place that seems to be abandoned from 2017. It is an old train station probably. It's the third house from left to right. We put our tent inside a room and we had good wind protection and also a roof. Very peacefull and quite night. We also cleaned a bit the room so please keep the room clean, Take away your trash.

name: On the route to 7 Vueltas
description: Maybe a km from town is a nice relaxed spot on the side of the road, will fit a big rig. Totally chill, no disturbance and beautiful skies at night. In the morning some locals pass with their livestock and that’s about it. Spent 3 nights.

name: DANGER / Don't leave your camper alone
description: Two guys robbed our bags of our campervan (Mac, Camera, lens, etc). The car alarm sounded, but nobody reacted. This happens at daylight 13:30, we left the car just 40 min. We knew all of this info because we searched for pictures on the security cameras of hostels (a lot of them were broken). Police was useless, and we were not the first ones... and worst, we know another locals and over landers with the same robbery method on the same city, so please, be careful. Don't leave your camper alone. PS: We were pretty sad at the time when this occurred and we forgot to left the comment on this app, we hope this GPS location it's ok... It was on Pedro Arraya street, a few blocks from the Terminal.

name: Andres Burgoa: Tours in remote places in Bolivia
description: Andres Burgoa (bolivian agronom engineer) and his team organize tours to some no touristy places in Bolivia. For example we did a 3 days tour on a river with local fisherman in the region of Chimoré. Andres knows a lot about his country and woud be happy to take you to some remote places for an authentic adventure. Write him an email (in spanish) to have a proposition regarding to the season: flaqbu@hotmail.com

name: Into the wild near the road
description:
Super quiet spot in a corner where there are not many.
---
Spot super tranquille dans un coin où il n’y en a pas beaucoup.

name: Wild camp
description:
To land at night in the fields. Quiet spot on future lots to build.
---
Pour se poser la nuit dans les champs. Spot tranquille sur futur lots à construire.

name: Hostal Parinacota
description:
Clean, basic rooms with private bathroom. Showers are with the bolian electric waterheathet.
I could park my car right next to the diningroom.
The owner Gregorio is also a mountainguide.

name: Old road
description: On the road from Tupiza to Tarija it was night so we spent the night here. There is the old road. Perfect for all type vehicule. Quiet in the night, only 3-4 camiones in the other road

name: YPFB
description: They have a computer here to change the price of diesel for foreigners and the signs with the current international rate. They only asked for passport as documentation. Easy place for diesel.

name: Restaurante "La casa Pingüi"
description:
It is a very nice restaurant, clean and tidy. It has some super nice paintings on the walls. The food is cheap and very tasty and the people who serve it are very nice and friendly. They are lovers of bicycles and cyclo travelers. We highly recommend this place to eat.
---
Es un restaurante muy bonito, limpio y arreglado. Tiene unas pinturas super bonitas en las paredes.
La comida es barata y muy rica y las personas que atienden son muy simpáticas y amables. Son amantes de las bicicletas y cicloviajeros. 
Recomendamos mucho este lugar para ir a comer.

name: La estancia veterinaria
description: Our dog got 2 kombi-vaccinations for 60 Bs. Nice veterinarian.

name: Breakfast pancakes
description:
Theres a guy here who sells Bolivian corn pancakes. Good and cheap. Ask for some "miel de choclo", pick up a banana and a packet of honey from round the corner, and you've got yourself a top tier breakfast for dirt cheap.

I bought the last 2 at 11 45 on a Saturday so don't get here too late!

Location may change slightly but the market isn't very big so just have a wander and look for the guy with the pancakes.

He told me he's also open in the afternoon after 4.

name: solar andino
description: solar shop with panels, batteries and charge controllers. The whole street is amazing for parts, batteries accessories and everything you could imagine

name: Buriño
description: quiet campsite with very friendly staff at a thermal bath in beautiful nature - a hidden paradise!

name: Servi cruz mechanic
description:
Very professional garage for all kinds of vehicles. Nice people. We did full maintenance (oil, filters, coolant change) and overall check (fix some small problem as well) for our Chevrolet astro van.
Cost us - 1000 bol

name: Madidi jungle ecolodge
description:
ecolodge in the middle of Amazon rainforest.
you can reach this point only by 3 hour boat, with the Madidi jungle ecolodge agency.

190 usd pp por 2 day 1 night, including guide.

High standing ecolodge, with very good food.

we saw many animals and plants

name: Cheap meal in comedor local
description: A place behind glass door. With blackboard written “se sirve” Cheap and big meals from 10-15bol. You have soup, hamburger, milanesa, lomitas,... with rice and fries and salad. Recommend!

name: Karott (Christian vegetarian restaurant)
description: As vegetarians this was our last option on a Monday evening. When we entered we saw books about religion and family and there was a relaxing and spiritual music, fancy ambiance... but... we must admit this was really excellent vegetarian food, simple and cheap but really tasty! No alcohol of course but a lot of vegetarians options and healthy drinks

name: Goblin bar
description:
Nice place with craftbeers and pizzas. During the week they have a porter, an amber and a blond ale, in the week end they have 2 kinds of porter, 3 amber and the blond beer. it’s a brewpub so all beers are brewed here. Beers are not bad but a bit “light” (and there is no IPA!!!) but the ambiance is really nice, the staff really friendly, and reasonable prices.
Thursday, Friday, Saturday : 8pm - 2am

name: Voy agency
description:
Very nice agency which organize tour for South Lipez and Uyuni Salar.
The price and the organization of the tour are the same than other agencies BUT you can park your van in a secured closed parking in their hostel (Butch Cassidy), have hot shower and a good wifi.
All staff is very kind, it is the most familial agency.

name: Artesanos
description: An Alpaca shop with modern cuts and designs. Definitely worth a stop if you want something less folkloric

name: Villa Unificada Caserio Nueve
description:
We stopped here for the night on our way from La Paz to Rurrenabaque.
The village is very calm and the spot is far enough from the main road.
There are public toilettes and showers for 1BOB.
We visited the very small restaurant at the corner nearby - pollo con arroz.
We felt safe.

name: La Taverne + Alliance Française
description:
Good restaurant French Meals but not only. 25 bol for a very nice veggie sandwich with fries.
Quite expensive but really good food !
It’s also the place of Alliance Française (if you want of French culture, teaching, music...)

name: YPFB Fuel Station
description: $3.75 bob with jerry can, Park around the corner.

name: Corrupt police
description: Parking of foreign vehicles in the square apparently isn't allowed. we were clamped within 5 minutes and forced to wait around until they repeatedly asked for money. Playing innocent, asking them to write down the fine and pretending not to understand meant after half an hour they let us go for free. they were laughing and scheming the whole time.

name: Hotel Mizque
description:
Cheaper of the two places in town. Most deformed mattress in SA. 50b pn. Probably has parking for a car, definitely bikes.

I think there might be another place near the mercado, you'd have to ask around.

name: Hotel Bernal
description: Clean rooms, clean and hot(!) shower (suicide ones) and really sweet girls running the place. Price 40 bol. I arrived with my salt covered bike and they allowed me to use their inneryard to clean it without problem! I could also bring my bike into my room, which I then carried up the stairs since all rooms are on 2nd floor. The inneryard is closed (and possibly locked), so I'm sure you could keep it there if you prefer. Surely morbikes could also be kept there. Totally recommened!

name: Hotel Casa Kolping
description: 3 Star Self catering apartments and standard hotel rooms with the best views of Sucre and the surrounding mountains. Secure parking for motorbikes campers and 4x4 enthusiast. The restaurant has window setting tables views and offers  traditional Bolivian cuisine as well as international plates. We have 3 conference facilities  that can cater for up to 350 people. Based in Recoleta the hotel is close to all touristic locations and is just  a 10 munite walk from Plaza 25 de Mayo.

name: Tica Tica by the River
description: Very nice spot by the river bank for overnight. Quiet, just some Llamas around. Beautiful sunset.

name: Chaqui Hot Spring
description: Local Hot Spring with 4 or 5 differents buildings with differents size of public polls and private bath tube. We paid 4 Bol for a very hot public poll (piscina 3) and also took a shower. The next day we went to another builblack  Also, outside the building there is running hot waters were the locals came to wash their cloths and you also can do. We had a quiet night. It's a god stop to relax between Potosí and Sucre.

name: Bicycle market
description: Loads of bikes, bits and people selling wheels.

name: Mirador Las Yungas
description: Gravel place with breathtaking view over the valley. Possibility to park overnight but it’s just along the road. Free, no amenities except trash cans. There are better spots to sleep along the road, before or after the Mirador, but no such view over the valley...

name: Hostel Mi Ka Sa
description: You can camp or with a van for 15 bs per person and you have room for 30 per person.

name: Riverbed - Millares
description: Decent spot on the riverbed. We went down through Millares and then a bit left. We asked the lady working on the land if it was OK to camp, she didn't mind. Beautiful setting, not too easily visible from the village. Easy to make a campfire.

name: Quinta Gutierrez
description:
For me, the best spot on Samaipata, Aida y Otto are very friendly persons, Aida lives there and she is a great cook and singer (they love to do karaoke), also she is tourist guide. The place has a big grassy field, wifi, laundry machine, water, electricity.

We pay 40 bolivianos per person per night, I think if you want to stay more nights they will offer better price.

name: Thermal pools
description: This is the location of the thermal pool mentioned by another overlander. Even with their instructions it was difficult to find. After going through the two gates and over the bridge, take the left fork, we could almost get all the way there on a moto and the guy we met there said he was going to do some work on the road, so hopefully in the future you’ll be able to make it the whole way. It was only 30 mins walking anyway. Really beautiful area, perfect temperature, hot pools and easy to adjust if you need. We left the guy some money because he was cleaning one of the pools when we arrived, his family owns the land and he lives close by

name: Alojamiento CONCORDIA, (Hotel cristo de la concordia)
description: 80 bolv for 2 pax for private room with toilet,nice place, clean, relaxing, with electric fan and tv, some room has AC, but I don't know the price.natural air is so nice if u stay on the hallway,there is a wifi, at 3rd floor in our room wifi is weak, but in other area like hallway its strong, if u can choose a room choose near the stairs even its on the 3rd floor so u can get strong signal of wifi. there is a parking space, there is a store outside for local food.

name: Termas de Rosario Parking
description: Adding this place in addition to the tourist attraction. You can sleep here in your car. For details about the termas see the other entry.

name: Antonia Castro
description: Everywhere along the way was full, we were desperate and asked around town, the other place on here was also full. Antonio Castro has a house with a spare room at this location. He let us use the kitchen in the morning. 50 for two people. Very dusty room though

name: RESIDENCIAL MAINUMBI
description: very nice place to stay, clean, fresh, and cheap. regular room with shared bathroom is 90 bolv.private room with toilet  and a/c is 169 bolv. the owner is also very nice and gentle.. there is a paid parking near the place, u can ask the owner also for the location.

name: Secured parking
description: It's 4BOB/h for secured parking, they made us a price: 16BOB for 5 hours.

name: Wildcamp after Sucre
description:
Not so much spots after Sucre. We found a spot along a path with no traffic (only 1 motobike in the evening). Dirty road doable with 2WD.
Very calm, far from the road.
Above a river, but no path to reach it, so no water easily accessible.

name: Comedor - gasolinera
description:
Gasoline for 5bol per litre. Good food and economical.
.....
gasolina a 5 b por litro . Comida buena y economica

name: Hostal Para Ti
description: Best place we’ve stayed in Bolivia so far. No secure parking, but can park car or moto right outside your window. Very clean, nice view, microwave downstairs, didn’t see a stove. There’s some stairs that take you directly up to the centre of town, takes maybe 5mins at most. Very friendly owners with a cute little girl. Paid 80bob with shared hot shower

name: Hostal Mirador
description: We didn't want a room in the main square so we walked a little bit and found this hostel with a view over the valley of Sorata. Kitchen with utensils, not too clean haha. 5 or 6 super friendly dogs, and quiet at night.

name: chacaltaya
description:
Chacaltaya used to be the highest ski slope in the world but the glacier melted. In AprilMay there might be enough snow to ski a few meters. Otherwise it's a nice walk to get acclimatized and test yourself above 5000m with a nice scenery. 
The road is very bumpy we made it to this point around 4900m high in a 2WD furgón. Some Toyota minibuses make it all the way to the refugio at 5300m. Our diesel car was just to exhausted at this altitude. We thought the access road from the north side was better!

name: Solar Supermercado
description: The best supermarket we could find in Sucre. It has a wide variety of beer, dry stuff, cheese etc. You have to walk through the grand wooden door and then you can find the entrance a little further behind.

name: Tomarapi Eco-Hostel and visitor center
description:
There is a mark here for wild camping but this hotel deserves its own site.

When we stopped outside of the church two ladies came and asked us if we want to stay at the hostel. We were almost out of cash but we felt we want to give something for this small community so we had dinner here and payed with Chillian peso. The restaurant is super nice and food is great. Still 45 Bol pp for a 3 course dinner. Really yummy! Vegetarian option available. We also bought bread.

name: Surgas
description: Was able to fill our North American propane tank for 22 Bol. We tried the YPFB propane place marked near here but were turned down twice (went in the afternoon and told us to come back in the morning, in the morning they told us they couldn’t fill it). Dropped of our tank here and picked up an hour later filled.

name: Tapiceria Mecapaca
description: Great place to get your seats and tissues fixed or changed by leather! Expert! Number +5912751228

name: Wooden Wasi hostel
description:
Decent hostel. parking for plenty of bikes. They tried to charge 50pn for the cheapest dorm, booking. com said 43pn so that's what we ended up paying.

Breakfast included.

name: Nice spot close to the border
description: After crossing the border late we found this nice and calm place not far away from the main road. 4x4 is not necessary but don't drive to far on the salt flat because it can be very muddy. Good 4G signal from Movistar Chile.

name: colchani
description:
free potable water at a faucet in a sink.
you can fill your tank without problem.

name: Walking Tour
description: Red cap walking tours meet here at 11am and 2pm everyday. 2.5 to 3 hr tour around city center. english. very informative and interesting. Base price is 20 Bob and you can add tip.

name: Next to the ferry station
description: We parked in front of the dining room San Pablo de tiquina.  We spent the night before crossing to Copacabana by ferry.  quiet.

name: Villa Mar Mechanic
description: Our wheel jumped off the axis 2km before Villa Mar so I walked to the village and asked my way around for a mechanic. I found Don Alfredo here (Blue entrance on the corner) who was very kind and quickly helped us find a solution.

name: Biblioteca - Internet
description: Very quiet place to have free access to internet on computers - touch screens, so not easy if you like to write a lot. Facebook is not allowed. Many books too. Free bathroom too. And a nice patio interior. Cultural center too.

name: Atipax hotel
description: the most awful hotel in south America. disgusting owner, dirty, horrible food, no wifi, terrible location. stay anywhere but this dump.

name: Fabricator and Welding
description:
Got a small job done here (aluminium). Not so cheap but it's the most complete machine shop I've seen in South America. Lathes, mills, todos.

There's no sign, but the pin is accurate.

name: Under the brigde
description:
17 km south from Uyuni there is a big brigde where you can camp.
Very spacious and clean. The water is not the best though. Bring your water.

name: Vida Pet
description:
nice veterinarian who gave us a health certificate to enter Brazil (120 B).
officially you need an export paper from the Bolivian senasa but if you travel by land you should be fine without. it takes 2 days to get the paper from senasa.
open from mo-sa, 8-19.

name: Taller Electro Pilo
description:
Eduardo and his team helped us to buy and install a new alternator, they lent us the shower and the bathroom and they also gave us a bag full of tangerines! Super recommendable for his dedication on a Saturday afternoon. They loved that we came and trusted them !!
---
Eduardo y su equipo nos ayudaron a comprar e instalar un nuevo alternador, nos prestaron la ducha y el baño y además nos regalaron una bolsa llena de mandarinas! Super recomendables por su dedicación un sábado por la tarde. Les encantó que hayamos venido y confiado en ellos!!

name: moto repuestos
description: there's a couple of Moto shops here. they close for lunch

name: parking near police and play ground
description: we are sleeping here one night.quiet and safe near the river good option before Brasil...

name: Coca plantations
description: It's not exactly a tourist attraction, but you can see a lot of coca plantations from that point on if you go from the town :)

name: Totora square
description: Totora is a colonial small city that in the past was live and important center of coca production. Nowadays is a historical and a bit cultural with some festival during the year and street market on sundays. Also is a nice place to stop before the Inca Ruins - Incallajta (the Machupichu of Bolivia). The road from Aiquile to Totora is scenic and very interesting,  cobbled by stone but in good condition. A few steps from main square there is a public hot shower for 5 bol and bathroom for 1 Bol. We had a good night here and enjoy the Pueblo.

name: Totora Public Hot Shower and Toilet
description: Public Hot Shower for 5 bol and Toilet for 1 Bol. Totora is a nice historical colonial  city to visit.

name: Guides office parking lot
description: We spend four night at the parking lot of Guide Office and Centro Integral de la Mujer.  We asked for permission at the office. Flat, safe and close of the bathroom and Water (at Park Office next door) and Hot Shower at the Coliseum (5 bol). It's very good place to stay,  close to de downtown and facilities.  The park entrance costs 100 Bol for 4 days and you have to pay a guide for each circuit (100bol and could be split by 6, the limit of the group) and transport if you need. Toro Toro it's special site if you are nature, paleontology,  geology or cultural lover. The road from Tarata is under construction, a lot of dusty and turn arounds, but manageable,  we did with our VW Kombi.

name: Hostal Las Olas
description: Excellent hotel, especially the suites which are each build as separate buildings in different quirky shapes (we had the shell, see photo’s) with a kitchenette and fantastic views over the lake. Each suite has its own little garden with hammocks. Secure parking space for 2 big cars. Price is 52 USD per night.

name: Lavamatico
description:
7 kg wash and dry for 30 Bol. Need to bring your own detergent. Open from 9 till 7. 
It was more like a wash service. The lady said to leave the bags and had it ready folded when we picked it up. 
Was done within 2 hours. Possible to park in front and use the WiFi.

name: Pullout F38
description:
Pullout from F38 little bit hidden from the road.
More or less flat gravel area, good for one or two cars.

name: Crazy Dave's prison story
description: Crazy Dave will tell you about San Pedro prison and how he ended up inside. Every day at 1pm, wonder round the square (not this specific position). If he doesn't find you, just look for the crazy looking guy.

name: Alojamiento Aroma
description:
As of January 2020 she asked 10bol per person and we settled at 15bol for 2.

Hot showers, 5 bolivianos 5 “minutes”, good option

name: Ruta Nacional 2
description:
We were charged at local prices with our 20 litres portable tank twice and they give us a ticket, but they asked for our Argentinian documents.
Sometimes they will say they can't do factura for foreign plate, just ask for no factura, price should be in between local (3.75) and foreign (8.67) per liter

name: Camping by the river on the beach
description: From main road follow the tracks to the rio grande. At the end you will find a beach. Beautiful view and at nights 1000 of stars. We did it on motorbike, maybe 2w will have trouble. Poemas donkeys and cows come and drink here + the condors are seen.

name: Llantax Tyres, Alignment...
description: Llantax Dunlop Tyres shop, good price and very good service. We change the 4 tyre of our van, US$ 65.00 each.

name: Pulga Montañita Hostel and Camping
description: Good, cheap place (35 bob dorm, 20 bob tent, 8 bob 2L water, 20 bob beer, 35 bob wine, 2.50 bob toilet paper) with extensive kitchen, decent facilities (hot shower, clean toilets, music installation, plenty of kitchen utensils), vegetables for sale in the kitchen and friendly staff & owner

name: Nice hospedaje
description:
We were wondering around looking for somewhere as Mochilero was closed. Someone took us here - a nice place with a very well equipped kitchen, common room, hot shower (no water between 19.00-07.00) and courtyard for our bicycles.

No parking space, but they’d probably find somewhere for you. Looks like there’s 3 or 4 rooms. They tried to charge 70BOL for two of us in a double room, but we negotiated down to 50BOL. We had the whole place to ourselves and it was very nice for a night.

No reception - ask at the house on the other side of the field. Name unknown.

name: Near the river
description: Nice placer next to the river. Some houses near. No facilities.

name: Multiservicios Cayo (Gomeria y Taller mecanico)
description: We came with a flat tire and he had the equipment to fix it. It costs 25 Bolivian pesos. They also have a small shop that sells lubricants and parts. It is also a mechanic workshop, we saw a crane and others 4x4 vehicles when we came.

name: Fluvial Tours
description: These guys do Pampas and Selva Tours and i think are the cheapest in town. I paid 700 for 3d/2n, some people paid 650. The tours are all about the same (lots of cruising the river wildlife spotting/swimming, piranha fishing, anaconda searching). the guide (Miguel) was good, although his English wasn't great. The accommodation was fine, but not great, maybe the more expensive tours have nicer accommodation. The food was really excellent, especially the breakfast.

name: Pingui Casa del Ciclista
description:
A perfect accommodation just for cyclists. No beds, but with rooms for to put your sleeping bag. Very quiet place! You can park your bike in the courtyard. No water during the night. Shop available.

**Atención: The DOGS can open doors and PEE IN YOUR SLEEPING BAG! See review below.

name: Restaurant Nativa
description:
A new restaurant in Sucre with traditional-modern kitchen. They have a 6-dish course menu including one drink per dish for BOB 100 pp.
The food is really good, good and kind service, the ambiance could be better  but we can really recommend it. Don‘t miss it!

name: Aduana
description:
Only customs. 'Permiso de circulación' (TIP) IS THE CUSTOMS DOCUMENT !!!!!

The immigration checkpoint is located a few hundred meters before.

name: Dry Riverbed Spot
description:
(ONLY DURING DRY SEASON)
We pulled over from the road on our way to Oruro as it was getting late. This was a dry river bed with wind cover and nobody can see you from the road. 4x4 recommended.

name: River camp
description: I asked the people in town if it was okay to camp next to the river, which it of course was. You have to cross the football field and some dry river beds (there is a sort of road) to get to nice spots. No idea if it's possible to camp here in wet season. It's still close to the road, so some noice, but no dust and you're not visible. Some locals around (to wash clothes in river etc), but left all after sunset. Slept the whole night, so I guess it was a calm&quiet night around. As I'm travelling with a bicycle I have no idea about car clearance or whatever.

name: es sointa
description: I loaded Diesel with drum at local price twice without problem

name: New Moti Mehal Indian Restaurant
description: Delicious curry and naan! Had the veg lunch special- chickpea curry,  rice and naan. Also Butter Chicken option. $35bob each. Not bad view out the window too!

name: Toll station
description:
A few hundred meters before this location we were stopped to pay toll. Guy asked where we were going and wanted to charge us 26 Bobs (til Santa Cruz). We parked on the side and waited other cars to pass then asked them how much they paid. They paid 5 Bobs so we gave him 5 and even got one back. He started to tell stories we didn’t get. 
But seems official (we got a ticket with the date) however the guy probably tries to sell you a more expensive ticket.

name: Lotus
description: Gas station with gasoline straight into the tank for local price. We had to wait a bit for manager to come and she sorted it.

name: Peaceful-donkey River camp
description: At the moment, in dry season, unlimited space to camp. When we got here it was really windy and dusty so we tucked up in the hill between the trees. A lot of driftwood for your fire. Perfect place with crazy scenery. Probably the only camp in Bolivia where you can not hear a dog barking at night!

name: Delightful-Spiders Rocky River Camp
description: Marvellous place to camp out of the towns, cities and dust, although you are visible from the road and a few houses on the other side of the river. Wash some clothes in the water and you'll blend right in! Sneak down here, have a bath in the river, light a fire and kick back with top shelf red wine. You might find a few mozzies and spiders. Life could be worse-remember that!!!!

name: Chicken&Chips Camp
description: Next to play park and basketball court. We parked up for 2 nights no issues and really quiet at night. Well lit. Quite a few chickens here - just bring your own chips!

name: Starlight Rocky River
description: Near a small village there are several tracks leading down to the river. Lots of places to camp in dry season, and a local man told us it's fine to camp here and safe. Lots of wood around and river water is clear today. Beautiful location and lots of stars at night.

name: Alojamiento
description:
there's an alojamiento cv sign in this pueblito. Didn't stay out take a closer look, but it's an option.

The petrol station in town is closed but you can buy gas from the Tienda next to it

name: Alojamiento Abaroa
description:
This place is the very definition of basic. For your 25b you get:
A toilet (well, hole in the ground)
A bed and mosquito net (clean sheets? sure why not believe if it makes you sleep better)
A working lightbulb

Some may call the place quaint, some might call it a sh!thole. 

Wide bikes won't fit inside the front gate.

name: Alojamiento
description:
Cheapest place in town i think. 35B per night. For some reason the girl really didn't want to give me the dorm room for 35, after asking for it about 10 times she gave me the 3 bed (she initially wanted 100 for it). The girl gives like there's not too much going on upstairs. The other staff sit up at night playing music.
Fine-ish for a night.
Most bikes should fit. Street parking for cars.
No breakfast or WiFi

name: Ferry to loma alta
description: Here you can find the "ferry" to Loma Alta. Only motorbikes I think, none of the boats i saw looked capable of taking a car. Big bikes could have trouble turning around to get off. Cost 10b.

name: Cambio de dinero y neumáticos
description: If you want to change bob to real then all at one of the tyre shops in front of the border. This shop definitely can change, others probably can. I got a better rate than the official one!

name: Jungle is massiv
description:
If you're looking to properly enter the jungle this might be your best bet. The road from cobija to Rurrenabaque Is soon to be a highway, and it's surrounded by kms of deforested farm land on either side. If you take this detour from Santa Elena to Loma Alta (near Rurrenabaque) you will see, and be truly surrounded by, real jungle. When i was there i think i saw around 10,000+ butterflies. I was told this is normal, though I'm not sure the guy i was speaking to realised quite how many there were out there. You will hear many birds, but i didn't really see too many. Saw a few Badger sized things of various shapes, no idea what.

The roads are marked fairly accurately on maps.me, though were wrong in a few places. If you find yourself on the wrong path ask a local (everyone was helpful and gave good directions) or follow your nose, you'll probably end up back on the blue line.

There is (apparently) one alojamiento on the route in Bernardino. The gas stations are about 500km apart, but there are tiendas selling basic things, they may have fuel, they definitely have shotgun shells. I bought fuel in the village marked by this pin i think. I bought lunch at one of the tiendas, but don't count on being able to buy a cooked meal.

This pin is marked at the start of the route, where I've marked the ferry near riberalta is the end, you might be able to go further though.

The road is mostly pretty good, but narrow. There are various times when there were deep ruts from when it's been muddy, so you'd probably need good ground clearance. I did see a normal Peugeot 306 on the road, but it was missing it's bumper. When i went it was dry, i would not go near this road in rainy season, or if there's been a lot of rain recently.

Good luck!

name: river spot
description:
There's a nice pulloff on the river side of the road. it's hard to see but it goes down to the river and offers parking that's hidden from the road. Only wide enough for vans but you can do a three point turn at the bottom. Nice and quiet.
Update: turning at the bottom may not be possible. Check before.

name: Inka Pacha
description: This is a very nice hostel in Yumani, Isla del Sol. Great view. The owners, Martin and his wife are very welcoming and really look after their tourists. Honest family that wants to help tourists. You can ask them for more information about the history of the island and they will give it to you! 100 bob for a couple in a matrimonial with shared bathroom. The place also has a restaurant that offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. The prices for the food are the same as anywhere else in the village!

name: Copacabana Harbour
description: Normal price for Isla del Sol Ida y vuelta in the same day 30 bob (50bob 2023). If you want to spend the night there, then it's 25 solo Ida plus you have to pay the boat back from Isla del Sol for 30 bob (not negotiable as it's not an agency boat). The tours that leave from Copacabana only include transport. Be aware that to enter Isla del Sol it's an extra 10 bob, same for Isla de la Luna. Also, be aware that there are local people in Isla del Sol that enter in the boat as soon as your boat stops at the harbour and who start selling themselves as tour guides and asking 25 bob per person for the tour. If you are staying the night in Isla del Sol then don't take the tour, you can discover this things with the local people of your hostel and just visiting around. If you are on Isla del Sol on a daily trip, it's up to you. I mean, it gives you some information but it is definitely a tourist trap. After the tour they also bring you to eat to their family restaurant!

name: Street with several mechanics
description: Found this street full of talleres mecánicos Thanks to a local man in a town who helped us with a ride when our van wouldn't start. Knock on the door of one of the places and someone should come out. Found mechanics on weekend. Spanish ability necessary no one here speaks English.

name: YPBF
description: Local price here. We had to show passport as well but got local price. Depends on the day..

name: Miami Auto repuestos
description:
They are importing Parts from Miami to Santa Cruz. Ordered there some parts for our VW T4 they arrived within a week. The man in the office speaks some English, if you can't speak Spanish contact his brother in Miami: 
Herman Fernandez 
(1) 786 2222390
Herman.fernandez.f@gmail.com

name: Typica Oruro - Café
description: Really nice coffee shop, with a big selection of coffee. They have snacks like sandwiches and empanadas fritas. You can buy coffee here.

name: Ruins old construction
description: Some abandoned houses. Nice spot for camp with winds protect.

name: Small platform close to river and street
description: After the small town Poroma to Toro Toro, there is this beautiful plattform. You have to take a right turn after crossing the riverbeds. This street will bring you to this spots, streets goes only down to the Plattform. Lot of woods for fire place, peacefully down here.

name: Tapwater next to Church
description: There is Tapwater next to the Church refilled our Tank :)

name: Air pump
description: Guy who has a compressed air machine will fill tires for 2B/tire. We only needed air for one tire but I'm sure you could negotiate a deal for all four if needed.

name: Hot shower - ducha caliente
description: Hot shower for 7 Bob per person. clean. really nice people. perfect after cycling and camp. --- Ducha caliente 7 bob por persona. Limpio. Muy acogedores y simpáticos! Perfecto después de mucho tiempo en bici y carpa!

name: Tunupa Volcano
description:
Perfect place to camp at the foot of Tunupa volcano, flat space protected by large stones. 3 hours walking from Tahua.
Water source 2 km before arriving here, small river frozen at this time. After the plane before the last climb.
Further on, at the end of the wide road, about 4600m high, there is a small cabanita with roof walls but no door.
You can climb the volcano from here, but for those who know the mountain, it is a difficult and technical path. ---
Lugar perfecto para acampar al pie del volcán Tunupa, espacio plano protegido por piedras grandes. 3 horas caminando desde Tahua.
Fuente de agua 2 km antes de llegar aqui, pequeño rio congelado en este momento. Después del plano antes de la ultima subida.
Mas adelante, al final del camino ancho, cerca de 4600m de altura, hay una cabanita con techo paredes pero sin puerta.
Se puede subir al volcán desde aquí, pero para los que conocen la montaña, es un camino difícil y técnico.

name: Hospedaje Magnifico
description:
Very good accommodation, clean, large room, friendly people, parking (free for us bikes). 70 bob for double room with private bathroom. good WiFi. without kitchen. Neighborhood alive, is of all barrato. near the cable car to go down to La Paz. --- Hospedaje muy bueno, limpio, habitación grande, gente amable, parqueo (gratuito para nos bicis). 70 bob para habitación matrimonial con baño privado. wifi bueno. sin cocina. 
Barrio vivo, se encuentra de todo barrato. cerca del teleférico para bajar a La Paz. Oh we payed 70bs for a matrimony room with towels included.

name: Casita de Andres
description:
Really nice place to stay, to walk around, beautiful trek! Andres will welcome you really nice. If you call him before, he can prepare food for you. he is also guide of treking. he speak also french.
Kitchen, hot shower and park car or bicycle.
Andres Contact : +591 71274013 --- Hospedaje muy lindo y agradable, en el pueblo de Tuni. Desde aquí se puede hacer muchas muy lindas caminatas. Andres les acoge con mucho cariño. Si reserva antes, les puede servir comidas. También es guía de Trek y tiene buenos consejos. El habla Francés también. 
Hay cocina, ducha caliente y parqueo. contacto de Andres: +591 71274013.

name: Cultura café
description:
Best place to have a cup of coffee. Recently opened, and the family who runs it is really really passionate about good coffee.
We had 2 really good coffees for 18Bs, and bought a 250gr pack for 35Bs. The father even showed us how he makes the coffee, adding carefully measured grams of coffee and milliliters of hot water, such an amazing experience. The coffee is bought from a local area and it's so good!

name: BnB Andres
description:
Best place to stay in La Paz! Andres & his mom are just the best people you'll meet. They know a lot about the city and Bolivia in general.
Beautiful clean house with a great kitchen. Located far from city traffic, but so easy to reach the centre. Markets & good restaurants around. Space for 2-3 motorcycles, garage nearby too. 
For more information, contact Andres: +591 77244655

name: Hostal gover
description:
In an old government building at the corner of the square. 
Started a year ago. 
Shared facilities but HOT electrical shower!
Big double room for 60b. Normal 80b. 
She made fried eggs with bread and coffee of 14bob(2p). 
Nice quiet clean place. 
If you need to call her and you don’t have connection: at the square you can use a local phone(1b) shop closest to to hostal at the right side.

name: next to Street 25
description: Great spot to stay overnight here. It's a green platform at the street with bushes. Quiet place with almost no noises.

name: Typical textiles
description: This shop sells typical Bolivian jumper, blankets etc.

name: A la maison
description:
If you are looking for a quiet place with own kitchen with hot water, living room, bathroom with own heating and hot water. Heathers in each room and only one block away from the yellow teleferic: this is your place. 
Designed by a French man. Kept as much as possible the original items. Supermarkt two blocks away. 
Pasaje munos cornejo 15
We paid 34$. They confirmed that if on the bike you get the same price (or price on booking) 
Secured place for bicycles or 2 motors. One parkingspace secured. 
22413704 or 70677321

name: Toyossan
description: Genuine parts for Toyota, Nissan and others

name: Second hostal on the right.
description:
Clean. Renovated. Shared facilities. Only toilets. No wifi. Friendly. 40 for single room with big bed. 60 for double room 
Bikes on the first floor. 
For dinner: go to the left. Restaurant just before pan Americana.

name: Toll
description: If you are heading north from Yaicuva to Santa Cruz on F9 there is a toll here.  We didn't hit the bank at the border and ended up paying 80 ARG pesos.

name: End Choro trek (cheap transport)
description: From here you can take a taxi to Yolosita for 30bs for 2 max. and from there you can take a bus to Coroico for 5 bs pp or a bus to La Paz .Don’t pay 160bs to Coroico from here.

name: Stairway to Heaven
description: A staircase made of salt in the middle of the salt flats. It's an art installation by Bolivian artist Gaston Ulgade - called "Stairway to Heaven". Supposedly it will be gone once the wet season comes.

name: Plaza central of San Jose
description: Very quiet next to police station and restaurants very safe, 5 bol for a menu del dia. Safe and quiet.

name: Next to bridge at river
description: We had a break here but it would make a good overnight spot if you don’t make it to Rurre before dark. You can get further away from the bridge if you want. To get here coming from the south take the little sandy track on your right 100 m before the bridge.

name: Camino al Bosque de Helechos
description: We spent one night here, the road from here to Los Helechos is only in 4wd. We have a kombi VW 83' and don't have any problem to get here.

name: Nice and peaceful
description: Good place, near the village. Very large spot with grass. Very quiet in the night.

name: Embalse río Quirusillas
description:
You get in from the route through Villa Copacabana, you arrive at La Tuna and follow the path from the square to the reservoir bridge. The road from the route is paved and is in excellent condition.
We spent two nights south of the bridge, on the banks of the reservoir. The water is not drinkable but you can swim and even people go fishing.
To the north of the bridge there is a very wide and flat place, with a big tree and place to light a fire.
On the last day we saw more towards the north, where the river continues, a place that seemed even better. It would be necessary to look for which street you can reach. In the satelite the streets do not appear complete.
A very beautiful and quiet place, some people go to see the reservoir and the occasional fisherman.

Se entra desde la ruta por Villa Copacabana, llegas hasta La Tuna  y sigues el camino desde la plaza hasta el puente del embalse . El camino desde la ruta es asfaltado y está en excelente estado.
Nosotros pasamos dos noches al sur del puente, a orillas del embalse. el agua no es potable pero se puede nadar e incluso va gente a pescar. 
Al norte del puente hay un lugar muy amplio y plano, con un gran árbol y lugar para encender un fuego.
El último dia vimos más hacia el norte, por donde continua el río, lugar que nos pareció aún mejor. habría que buscar por cual calle se puede llegar. En el satélite las calles no aparecen completas.
un lugar muy bello y tranquilo, van algunas personas a ver el embalse y algún que otro pescador.

name: plaza de Mairana
description:
We spend one night here, very calm at day and quiet in the night. 
on the corner in front of electricity company there's free wifi. there's a Water tap on the grass, we drink it and it was ok.

name: next to the river
description:
Coming from the north take the first entrance to the right in Mairana. Follow the road betwen the farms. 
In rain season maybe is not good.
We spent two nights next to the river.
On one side of the road before crossing the river, next to the pedestrian bridge there is place to park a maximum of 2 small vehicles.

A un lado del camino antes de cruzar el rio, al lado del puente peatonal hay lugar para estacionar máximo 2 vehículos pequeños.

name: Before mirador volcanes
description: This Is the place of the overlander description of the mirador, next to the "small tiny house". We spent the night here. From here walk 5 min to the mirador.

name: Alojamiento "Tio Juan"
description:
This is a great hostel. The owners are very friendly and we felt like home here. 

They offer private rooms as well as shared rooms. They have also a kitchen guests can use.

As we were travelling by bicycle we really appreciated this awesome hostel that has an inside yard with a lot of flowers where we were able ro store our bikes. The location is superb, 200m away from the main market and 400m away from the main square which will give you peace and rest since you won't here the music and the noise from the street.

They also offer a safe place to park your motorcycle or your car.

We highly recommend this hostel if you visit Samaipata.

The price is also quite economical; 45bs per person for a private room with private bathroom. 

PHONE: 39446097 or 76013293

name: Tienda
description:
Small tienda which offers coffee! Empanadas and bread. Also has rooms and toilets. Very basic, older than in Toledo. Douches., cold water. You can camp. You can cook. 
67301535 
Hostel and possible camping.  We did not stay as too early in the day but great pan and coffee

name: Hotel de Sal Luna Salada
description: A very nice and seemingly very new hotel right on the edge of the Salar. Entirely made of salt, naturally. Great dining room, very comfortable rooms. The WiFi works great, when it’s on. They seem to turn it off in the night. Use Expedia or some such site to get a good rate if you want a break from hostel dorms or camping mattresses. Of course, the rack rate is outrageous. Plenty of parking for any sort of unit.

name: ATM Banco Union
description: The first atm after crossing the border. Our Maestro card didn’t work but Visa worked fine. Max 500bol.

name: Hidden spot on river bed
description:
In an area where hidden wild camp spots are hard to find we found this this river bed. It’s a nice hidden place close to the road. Because the river is lower you can camp here unseen. To find it: from the main road enter the small track a 100m more south of here, cross the old train trail and turn left till you see the river on the right side. Follow till the river bed.

It’s an easy track to enter this place. Because you’re close to the road you can hear the traffic but at night it’s quiet. 
We camped here in dry season, I don’t know what the river does in rain season but a bit higher up a small tent can camp unseen as well.
We didn’t use the river water for cooking or drinking. It seems clear but I think it runs through a small village more upstream.

name: Migration
description: Got a 30 days visa extension. Bring a copy of passport and the page with entrance stamp.

name: Coffee Break
description: Good coffee (no instant) and cakes, sandwiches. Nice relax atmosphere. Local prices.

name: Gas station
description: Fuel for a local price directly to the tank.

name: Muddy dirt road after storm
description:
We wanted to cross from Uyuni to Chile vie the Ollagüe border station. The Ruta Nacional 5 going south from Uyuni is an unpaved dirt road of decent quality. It leads into Ruta 701 which is also a dirt road of mixed quality. They seem to be currently building a better road (701) which causes a lot of detours into gravel fields (July 2019).
Unfortunately there was a storm briefly hitting the area the day before which was accompanied by some, but not too much rain. The road turned into a field of mud at these coordinates and all busses and trucks got stuck. Since the road was blocked the other cars took a side road which was equally muddy but not blocked. We dared to cross in our front wheel drive minivan and it was terrible. Only with the help of some poor stranded bus passengers we managed to work through the mud in five hours. The mud problem was very local and limited to a two or three kilometer stretch. Afterwards the road was not great but ok. 4x4s seemed to be doing fine if the skills of the driver were matching the cars capabilities. Most got through without any problem, some struggled too. I believe that this problem only arises after some rain (doesn't need to be pouring!) so I would recommend to ask locals in Uyuni about the condition if you suspect a problem. But if you make it to Chile you will be rewarded with an awesome paved highway and almost perfect infrastructure.

The first photo shows Ruta 5 right after Uyuni, the second shows the mud field. The third shows the highway in Chile a few miles behind the border.

name: Hot spring river
description: This camp spot and this river are absolutely amazing! We found it thanks to the other wild camp spot listed, you pull into that spot and come a little bit further down the path and will arrive to a more secluded spot.  This is a locals bathing spot so there is some trash unfortunately but other than that there is direct access to the river and a campground on the other side of the river so it feels really safe! The river right here is just warm, but we swam all the way up it and it got progressively warmer and then hot by the springs! The water is crystal clear and shallow. One of our favorite spots in South America, if you want to have essentially the same experience that you get for paying at a campground but for free, come here :)

name: Sand & rocks
description:
Very quiet place, a bit windy and cold but warm and sunny in the morning!
4wd4 needed because it’s sandy 
Entel signal LTE

name: Tiwanaku Ruins
description:
Ruins with two museums. The museums are not really informative and mostly in Spanish. At the Ruins there are no informations and we were pretty disappointed. For the price definitely not recommended. 
(100 bob entrance)

name: Silen Sur - Escapes mechanic
description:
We were recommended to come here by our mechanic Don Julio Gamarra. Decent exhaust mechanic, fixed our catalytic and added an exhaust support to stop a knocking noise we have been hearing. 
cost 70 BOB in total

name: Gourmet ALI
description:
Doesn’t look appealing from the outside, but you have to go in. Really tasty dishes. The trouth lasagne and the lomo are really tasty.
Not the cheapest restaurant but for that price you have an amazing meal! Really recommend this place. Plus the owner is a friendly and nice man

name: Yotau
description: Local price to bidon. You can rent a bidon for 5bob at a small repair shop right in front.

name: Street parking next to big park
description:
Nice and quiet street. next to park and market where you can access to clean bathrooms.

Pasamos la noche en una calle tranquila al lado de un parque y mercado donde se puede usar los baños. Recomendable

name: Parking lot
description: Charges 5 BOB an hour but we were staying in a nearby hotel for a couple of nights that did not have a tall entry.  Stayed from 5:30 one day to noon on third day and we're charged 70 BOB.  Open 7:30 to 8:30 only week days.  We wanted to leave on a Saturday and owner arranged that we message him and he met us to let us out (turned out tho that another gate to an adjoining lot was open anyway so we could have "snuck out" but didn't). Not sure if you could sleep in your rig.  You'd definitely be locked in at night. There's a big mall nearby.

name: Hotel Ideal
description:
Decent hotel, clean. Double bed with bathroom and breakfast for 180B$ (price for two). Cochera/safe parking for 10B$ (only 3 available and you park in one file).
No kitchen available but we had our own cooker and they let us cook on level 1 where there are two tables!
Just a couple of meters down the road from the Centro Entel where you can get your Bolivian sim card. Don't forget your passport.

name: Residencia at the highway with terrace
description:
Very clean nice hotel. Shared bathrooms with solar energy warm water. Small tienda. 
Huge terrace on 5th floor. 
We could use the spotless kitchen of the owners for 10bob.
Secured place for bikes/motorcycles/ big van. 
I checked all open places in town. This was the best. 
70bob per person for double room. 
You can do your laundry by hand. Probably they can also do it for you.

name: Convento Santa Teresa
description: Cool former monastery of Carmelita orden. 25 bob for a foreigner for a guided tour (don't know if English is available). Spanish tour was quite good and the monastery itself has interesting architecture

name: Mirador San José de chiquitos
description: During the dry season you can come up to the mirador and the dried up Laguna without paying. This is a nice level spot with a cool overlook and some trails around. Space for a tent as well, big rig friendly but the road may be hard to get to. Rough dirt road but if it’s dry you don’t need 4x4

name: Chuvica hostel
description:
After a very long day with heavy and cold wind we decided try to spend the night in a different place than the roof tent. 
Fortunately we found this hostel in this little town....such a nice surprise!!the owner prepared for us a delicious dinner and gave us a cozy room, this place changed completely our day. 
Super clean rooms, stove, shower, breakfast....nothing else to ask. 
Find to Mr. Estanislao or his wife.

name: YPFB
description: We got gas here, directly into the tank, international price.

name: Univida soat
description:
137 bol for Ford f250 truck annual insurance (only annual ). quick process. Only cash

137 bolivianos por seguro anual y solo anual  Solo efectivo. Rápido proceso

name: Rancho Verde restaurante-parking
description:
Great parrilla with big parking lot. Friendly owners let us stay for two nights. Amish market next around the corner (where they buy stuff for land working). Meet is fantastic (I'm Argentine) cheap prices. Big rigs would fit but during lunch time the lot is quite full. You can access to water,cold showers and electricity

Excelente parrilla donde te dejan dormir en su amplio parqueo. Hay baños con ducha fría y acceso a agua y electricidad. Dueños muy amables. A la vuelta es donde compran los amish productos para trabajar la tierra. Muy recomendable para todo tipo de movilidad

name: restaurant lirio del valle
description: Nice buffet restaurant!! Buffet livre, 20 for eat, 10 for can of jus. total for 2 persons 50 B.

name: Military Checkpoints
description:
We were eastbound and were stopped here and asked "to register" and given a chit to hand in at the military checkpoint in 2km. 
Before that one, in only 500m, there's a police checkpoint where they wanted to see our documents again.  In both cases they asked for licence and TIP.  
Then there was another in 18 km at San Bartolo; again we had to register but no chit to hand in elsewhere.  
And yet another similar one at Ascension de la Frontera...

name: Casa Blanca
description: The gas station closed as we drove into town (4pm) so we asked a local where to buy gas and were directed  to this white house. No signage.  The woman in the house sells gas for 5 and sometimes 6 BOB per litre.  We say that because the first 58 litres cost 290 and the next 60 was 360....she settled for 330. We were able to put directly into the tank.

name: Covered basketball court
description: Nice, sleepy village. Friendly locals said we could camp here. They also said we could pretty much camp anywhere we like, but we are on bikes with a tent and there are lots of dogs and farm animals around! Large, covered space with half open walls - you can close the gates securely so no animals come in. We locked our bicycles to the basketball hoop posts. Road noise in the morning, but we felt very safe. There is a flat space by the court where you could probably park if you wanted.

name: Hostal Bolivar
description: Nice basic place. Single room, 35bol with a shared bathroom, 50 bol with a private bathroom. Showers are hot and gas heated, not electric. Garage is occupied by a huge pickup but there is still a place for one mid-sized bike. Look for a blue sign "Bolivar".

name: Hotel Aranjuez
description:
Hotel Aranjuez is one of the most beautiful hotels we have ever seen. It has beautiful gardens, terace, pool and a lot of flowers everywhere.
The rooms are really nice and super clean and the staff is very friendly and nice. Also the food is extremely good. The WIFI is super fast.

The locations is suburb, very peacefull neighbourhood but at the same time close to the city center.

We recommend this place a lot. You won't regret it.

name: Caranavi
description: Small flat ground to park at the corner of a mountain road. Close to the road but almost no traffic. 4WD recomended, steep road, have to cross a small river [on bridge]. The spot is quite wide and could fit 2 cars or a camper.

name: Belmont B&B
description: Only private rooms, twins or doubles. The price for one person in a double 100bob. Parking for 2 cars (height restriction) and several bikes. Wi-fi is fast when it works (50x50). Electric showers are hot when you're get used to them. Breakfast is usual bolivian bread-jam-bananas and it's not possible to exclude it from the price. The room itself is nice, clean and cosy, and the most important, warm. First time on Altiplano i slept without base layer of clothes and cap... There is also a kitchen for free use. Unfortunately no free potable water.

name: Landscape hostel
description: Worn out but dirt cheap. 40 bob in a dorm. Place for one bike (maybe two). They said it's possible to keep a bike and bags for free while i'll be hiking. The hostel is poorly designed, practically no common areas to meet people. Some guys have luck to sleep in a passage room. Not sure about hot water, I'm not in a desperate need to shower in the dirty bathroom. Wi-fi is stable. Lockers available. You can use the kitchen for additional 6bob.

name: Las Lomas Taxi
description: If you’re staying at Las Lomas campground here you can take a taxi that goes from south La Paz to the campground for only 4bs. The service is available 7 days a week from 18:00 to 23:00.

name: Mirrors
description: Found the pools of water that act as mirrors. Quite wet to get to it (water was probably 1 inch deep), but ground was still firm if you follow the tracks.

name: Roundabout
description: When asking for sin factura immediately got 5 Bol p/l Took 140 liters to get far into Brazil

name: lake view
description:
Nice spot after a ferry, close to the road.
Good for spend 1 night or 1 lunch before La Paz

name: Nice place by the river
description: Perfect for tents and bicycles. The locals are friendly and there is a very basic shop next to the bridge. We asked the locals before we set up camp

name: free potable water (Tarapaya)
description: free potable water from main square of Tarapaya. water tap is right next to a small fountain.

name: Namaste Hostel
description:
Great place to stay! The owner Gina is such a great person, and she's so helpful. The hostel is cleaned 2 times everyday. Enough space to chill, hang around, cook etc. Clean bathrooms with THE best shower in South America! Nice kitchen and good breakfast included. 75pppn in dorm/private.
Not much space for parking, but Fabio the owner of the restaurant in front (nice restaurant for lunch, see my other post) helped me put my motorcycle in the downstairs garage of his building 2 blocks away, and for the last night, I left it inside the restaurant to leave early the next morning.
Contact Gina personally: +591 78245453
Gina also wants to start a camping in her home outside the city. So just write to her for more information..

name: Creart Vegetarian Buffet Restaurant
description:
Great vegetarian Buffet restaurant (25pp)
It's the entrance to Namaste Hostel, great place to stay.
The staff is so nice, especially the owner Fabio, who coordinated with us to park our motorcycle in his garage.
We arrived after riding through a snowstorm and the staff received us really warmly and offered us great food even after hours while we waited for the hostel owner.

name: Hostel Céleste
description:
Nice hostel : cheap (40 bob the double room) ; clean ; wifi ; kitchen ; near the main plaza ; Nice staff.
Prefer asking for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor (less noisy).

name: nice place with water excess
description: On the mainroad coming from Tupiza you'll find a little hut to your right. at this point turn left onto the riverbed and follow the path for about 200m where it leads out of the riverbed again. this is a path for a local to its cropfield. just before you enter that field there is a place on your right for one or two tents. campervan might fit as well, depending on sice. amazing views of the valley!

name: Camp in a hut next to toll station
description: the guy who works at the toll station (really nice) let us pitch our tent in his hut 5m away. dirt ground and no facilities but at this altitude the hut with roof provides good additional warmth.

name: getting up to 5175m altitude with bicycles
description: this is the highest point on our way to LA paz with our bikes. 5175m about see level. the route is beautiful and there are people every 10km or so. so no danger of getting lost ;) also water supply and camping spots are widely spread. enjoy :)

name: AWA Rafting
description:
Nice family run alojamiento in the middle of the dschungle. The normal price is 50BOB but we could negotiate. They also offer self made foot for 10BOB per plate. Also you can do Rafting, canyoning and such activities. If you book from La Paz it's 350BOB for the whole day incl. food, transport and everything. Maybe less if you are here. 
WhatsApp:
Nr.:+59174008048

name: AWA RAFTING
description:
here lives a local guide that offers Rafting, canyoning and such activities in this area. he studied in LA Paz and is very professional. Price is 350BOB for a whole day including food, transport and everything. even pictures from a gopro are free :) If you are here you may negotiate. they also offer nice cabañas to sleep. 
see other post for further information.

name: good place
description:
Quiet and safe place, not to close to the road.
Good step between LA Paz and Potosí

name: Toll booth
description:
Needed to pay 10 BOL toll heading North towards Trinidad. Got a receipt so seems legitimate. 

FYI about 1km back towards town there is a police check. He was friendly and professional, no problems.

name: Iskanwaya
description: Here are the ruins (center)..Be aware that the track to the ruins is quite a rough ride!

name: Toll Station
description: Fruit checkpoint! Don’t forget your light and seat belts!

name: Church parking lot
description: At the jesuitic mission they offered us to park inside the gate where a guard is staying 24h. It seems an old wooden fabric garden where we quietly slept for 7bol. Toilet is available and also water to refill the tank.

name: Mirador of Tomina
description: If you follow a small road off the main road passing the stations of the cross, you’ll reach  the mirador overlooking Tomina, absolutely beautiful and peaceful! 2wd accessible. We leveled our truck under the arch. Tigo reception. After a long couple days of driving these mountain roads, you’re welcome ;)

name: Peaceful spot near the dam
description: We found this place after spending the day at the Sunday market in Tarabuco but didn’t really want to spend the night there.
