Maps me can lead you here easily, follow the dirt road and go through the gate which is just there to keep the cows in. Clean and some houses nearby but nobody even noticed we were here. The water in the reservoir is disgusting but the stars here are fantastic.

name: Free potable water at gas station
description:
We asked a police officer where we could get some water and he sent us here. 
Just ask the people of the gas station for water (it’s just next to the bathrooms), we didn’t buy any fuel and they said we could take some water (it’s potable).

name: Behind school in rural neighborhood
description:
Quiet wild camping spot in Potosi.
Just behind a public school, a bit noisy in the morning (not early, usual noise from school) but very quiet at night. 
A few locals pass by (day and night) and just say hi. No issues with neighbors. Very kind people, they gave us some water from the school the day we left. 
We stayed 2 nights and felt pretty safe.
No services, some trash (the “usual” in this area of Bolivia).

The place is on the way to the lagunas, dirt road uphill but doable with 2wd (dry season). 

From this point on towards the lagunas the road is very challenging without 4x4, we made it on 2wd on a 2.4 ton camper but it wasn’t easy.

name: Uyuni wild Camping
description:
First I was a bit sceptical to camp in the middle of the salt flats but it turned out to be one of the most impressive things I've ever done. 
This time of the year it's completely dry and you can drive wherever you want. I just drove away from the big paths 'til there was literally nothing more around me. 
If you want you can even camp without a tent. The stars are incredible. I had zero wind during the night. Just a bit cold, so make sure to bring enough stuff!
More than recommend!

name: carwash
description: Washed my motorcycle for 10 bs. A bit aggressive but cheap!

name: Flat spot next to the river
description:
Close to Coroico, flat spot on the river close to route 3 and the town of Chita Santa Elena. It's just going down from the road to the town and continue the road 300 m. it is before  a bridge where few people pass through the entire night. It is very close to the town so we went to speak in the square with the people of the small market if the spot where safe and if we could bother somebody staying at the spot and she told us no problem and even she told us that we could better go to the square to be more quiet because there is light...(we stayed t our spot)
Definitely, good place to spend a night really quiet and without leaving to much road 3

name: Alojamiento
description: Basic alojamiento. 30bs a night. Let me put my motorcycle inside. No parking for cars. Comfortable, clean room with great view.

name: Capitania de Puerto Riberalta
description: Not an embassy but the navy headquarters/information office for those wishing to travel by river boat. Come here to inquire about transportation up and down the river. They told me going to Puerto Maldonado, Perú, is difficult but possible. More difficult in the dry season, even.

name: Hotel Shimose
description: Wanted 150 bs a night. Talked them down to 130. Still a little expensive for what you get. Wifi is fast, and breakfast is excellent. Secure parking behind huge gate for cars and motorcycles.

name: teatroTres Cruces
description:
we  slept in the teatro of Très Cruces,  it's just a room which was open,  but so nice when you are tired.  you Can found water in the village asking few people living here
good stop between Coipasa and Salina

name: shower, WC and free potable water
description:
a very nice lady (Alexandra) takes care of the indoor soccer court at this location. she actually lives here. 
- clean WC: 1 Bs. 
- clean shower (hot): 5 Bs.
- potable water: free
you can give her a tip as well (she’s actually letting you use the soccer court bathrooms–normally it’s only for members).

name: Street Parking
description: One of the best neighborhoods of Santa Cruz. 24h guard in a quiet road.

name: Patio Design Lifestyle Center
description: Very nice shopping mall with free Wi-Fi and free secure parking. Closes at 10pm

name: Street Parking
description: Street Parking with 24h guard. Very nice and safe neighborhood.

name: Stacion de Peaje
description: Toll operator stamps the same ticket if you came from Puerto Soares, no charge.

name: Blue-Throated Macaws
description:
Chino is a local farmer who owns a huge property in Loreta where he will take you and help you find the critically endangered Blue-Throated Macaws.

He knows the songs of all the different birds so is really good at finding them. We saw the Blue-Throated Macaws (of which there are only 90 in the region), Black-Throated Macaws, Toucans, parrots and many other birds, plus capybaras, alligators, monkeys, armadillo and a tejon.

His property is amazing and he is a super nice guy, treated us like family after we just showed up in town and asked around for someone to help us see the macaws. 
He will let you camp in your van on his property, or can offer accommodation if required.

You can contact Chino via WhatsApp on +591 67967808.
FYI he only speaks Spanish.
If you contact him he will be able to arrange a tour for you, price depends on what you want to do/how long you will stay for.

name: Hotel Rodriguez
description: One of two hotels in the town - it's the cheaper option. We paid 30bob pp for a twin room with shared bathroom. Very basic, a bit old, showers not perfect, only cold. There were better rooms (with shower and tv) for higher price. Lovely and really friendly owners though. We stayed there twice (on the way to Rurrenabaque and back). Spacey parking for motorcycle and cars.

name: Lavado “NOE”
description: Great place to wash your bike after the Salar. They use high pressure hose and soap. Only 5 BOLS and took 5 minutes. Squeaky clean!

name: Lakeside
description:
This is a nice spot, hidden from the road although you can still hear some noise from cars driving past. Next to what appears to be a big man-made lake and lots of jungle around. 
We have seen caiman, capybara, monkeys and macaws here.
Really clean surroundings, no trash at all, so please keep it this way!

name: Motors Velasco
description:
Visited this random workshop because our car refused to start when we were really nearby late at night. It was a relatively simple (but not very obvious) electrical problem, which they identified and fixed next morning for reasonable money (40BOL for fuse, 150BOL for replaced cables and work).

Very nice guys, attentive and honest. There's whatsapp of one of them (Diego) +591 77250991

name: Gasolina
description: Gasolina y Diesel in a road without. Good price. Good option before Sucre

name: Wild camp
description: Coming from Oruro, there is a small sandy road on the righthand side. If you follow this for a couple of hundred meters, you're out of sight of the road and you'll have a nice and quiet camp spot with a stunning view of the milky way.

name: Cosmo Café
description: Belgian, German and International Delicious, fresh and tasty food, even Veggie options. Good place, nice music, lots of German and others variety of beers. Good service and fast Wifi. !!Recommended totally!!

name: Public Toilets and Showers
description: 3 Bob for a shower, 2 bob for the toilet. Showers are very dirty but fine if you wear flip flops and don't touch the walls!

name: Central parking
description: Private parking 8bol/4hours in city centre where is always difficult to find place to park. It's quite narrow but ok for vans. In the corner at the traffic light.

name: Multilantas
description: Good tyre shop. Alignment, new tyres, everything you need about tyre. Recommended

name: Caiman paradise
description: We saw at least 100 caiman/crocodiles here! Some really big ones.

name: Ronald mechanical
description:
Almost the only mechanical in town, very demanded!! Nice guy, he helped us fixing our shock absorber that crashed the day before in the road coming from Rurrenabaque. Fair price.

Casi el único mecánico en el pueblo, tiene mucha demanda!! (Había una cola de gente esperándole). El tipo simpático, nos arregló para adaptar un amortiguador trasero que se nos había roto en la carretera viniendo de Rurrenabaque. Precio correcto.

name: YPFB Copacabana
description: The old station is closed. This is the location for a brand new Ypfb. Unfortunately they said international price only. Try your luck.

name: Fast Internet
description: Great co-working space with fast internet. You can order something at the bar and start fast surfing.

name: Mestiza
description: Very good, not so typical menu del dia for 34 bob. There's a vegetarian option and an option with meat/fish. The food is a bit more sophisticated than what we've had at other places. They also have a lot of fusion dishes a la carte, with an entire veggie/vegan section. Friendly staff.

name: Potable water in the entrance of the town
description: Free tap drinkable water next to the police station.

name: Batallas Square
description: We parked for one night on the square of Batallas on our way to Copacabana... Really good and quiet night...

name: Copacabana
description:
Wash, dry and fold for 15 bs a kilo.
Very nice man had our five kilos done in three hours.

name: horse riding sucre
description:
the place is in wrong location, but you just have to call johnny or contact him on whatsapp to arrange a date (+59176110434). he picks you up wherever you are and drive you to where the horses are (15min from sucre center)
we were there at my dauther's birthday and had such a great time. we had a 3hours tour on the horses through the valley behind Sucre and back. my dauther is 6 years old and road alone with little experience as the horse was docile. johnny is a great guy who has 28years of ecperience working with horses. and the money you pay (200bol p/P) is more than faire for the experience.

name: Millihuaya town
description: If you’re driving between north and south yungas and need a place to sleep this is a very good spot, flat surface in front of the church surrounded by nice people and good views.

name: Jiwaki pool and camping
description:
Great place for camping, super big pool with natural water, perfect for spend a couple of days resting. Clean enough toilets and showers, only 15bs per person. Roly the owner is a very friendly local guy. 
Highly recommended place.

name: Luna Dorada Hostel
description: Hugo, the manager, is a smiling&helpfully guy. Clean place, private and shares rooms. Good dinner and breakfast. Recomended totally in this mini small town.

name: Parking Calle Tarija - free on weekends!
description:
This parking costs 2bob/hour but is really near to the center and very safe!  free at night from 18:00 to 7 at morning.
You just have to pay during the week.
Free on weekends! is the best place that we got in the center and the cheapest!

name: wild camp protected wind
description:
Wild Camp next the warm river, with a proteted from the wind, by the mountain. 
Nice sunset.

name: next the road
description:
Nice view, friendly? local people. good place to stay one night, in the way nacional park Toro Toro. 
save place, a litle bit trafic in the evening and in the morning, but quiet during the night. 
No facilities

name: Parking Spot
description:
Its a big, leveled parking spot right next to the road. It has an official Parking-sign.
The view is truly amazing, but it was quite windy the night we slept here.

name: Near small canal
description: Didn't like other spots on the approach to Torotoro; so found this one. When the road starts climbing up, on one of the serpantin turns, you'll see a side road going along a small 30cm wide canal with running water. We went as far as road allowed (then it gets too narrow, apparently isn't used). Relatively quiet (but still can hear cars on the road, though not much if them), no one bothered us, there're large bushes around to cover the spot a bit. Sky view is amazing :)

name: Lavandaria Suiza
description: It’s part of the campsite and bakery and you can use this service without staing at the place. 1 Kilo costs 7 Bolivianos. Ruedi and Miriam are very friendly and helpful people. They speak german and spanish.

name: Roadside
description: This is a place where we sleep one night. Hidden place from the road. Nice view and has two accesses on the way from Cochabamba to Oruro.

name: La Reforma
description: We spent a quite night at the main square one block away from the main road. The local people are very friendly and helpful and is a nice change in their everyday lives.

name: Mechanical hermanos Pantojas
description: very good mechanical, honest, nice guy (we deal with Erlin Pantojas). we went for a shock absorber issue and after fixing it, he offers review the motor and did a fast maintenance of our van for the same price. trustful, we recommend the place.

name: South of San Javier
description: On a side road to a small community, 500m from the main road. Flat site, also for 1 or 2 big rigs, little local traffic. Quiet in the night.

name: Hotel Marabu
description: New hotel, so everything is still clean and tidy. Big space for cars, rooms without a/c for 100bol, with a/c for 150bol. Hot shower, relatively slow wifi, swimming pool, big rooms.

name: Bike camp
description: heading from northern entrance there is a sheltered place with several tent spots. To reach it you need to get off the road. You can put your bike inside. Placed close to the wall it's not visible from the road. Only two cars passed the road in the evening. Very quiet.

name: Hostel Iguazu
description: Good place to stay near dowtown and touristic center. Expensive but was the only plave that eas possible to park inside our car, 2.5m of height. We paid 200 bols a night. No breakfest.

name: Toll 25Bs
description: Toll booth, 25 Bs per vehicle. Be sure to keep your ticket.

name: Ferreteria
description:
If you don’t get gasoline at this location, don’t despair. Ask around. Somebody in this town will find gasoline for you. Expect to pay almost double the local rate. We were grateful to pay the price. Not sure about diesel.
.....
Nice lady who can sell plenty of gas. 5Bs/L.

name: Residencial Chiquitano
description:
very nice place with big parking at the back on grass. we could park our 2 motorbikes.
we paid 190 for a room with private bathroom, AC and wifi. 
next door there's a small place where you can take your breakfast, people are very friendly !

name: Gravel Parking Area. La Paz
description:
We stayed here on a Saturday night, super quiet. Large flat gravel spot (ok for big rigs) next to stream and a park. there’s a garbage container nearby. streets are clean and safe (security guard 24/7 on a small both 20m from the spot). we talked to the security guard and he said it’s safe and ok to park here. 
it’s a residential area near a park and university, very few cars pass by this street. the spot is next to the street but really quiet. 
There are no facilities, just trashcans. I would say it’s okay for big rigs.

name: Comeval RL. - mechanic
description: Good and fast mechanic, large workshop with metalworks. Can handle all types of vehicles. We fixed our valves of our kombi here. Many 4x4 in the shop. Fixed our problem in two hours.

name: YPFB Palos Blancos
description: Filled our jerrycan with diesel for local price. But told they have a limit of 10 liters (apparently, as a border town), so got 10 liters only. As always, 'carnet' (numero y apellido) needed for their system (we use driver license details)

name: Escuela San Jorge
description:
We travel by bike, I spoke with the locals around the school to put our tent beside the school and everybody was super cool and lovely, they speak with the man who lives in the school and takes care of it who was super helpfull to and left us pass the night in a room.

Viajamos em Bicicleta e hable com la gente cerca de la escuela  para poner la carpa ao lado de la escuela, todos foran muy educados e simpaticos, ao fim hablaran com el hombre que cuida e vive em la escuela (junta escolar) que tambien foi super buena onda e oferecio una sala para passarmos a notche!

name: Above Padillia towards the hill
description: Nice view over the village and very quiet.

name: YPFB Padilla
description: New station. We payed local price. The lady was very friendly

name: Amazing view but bad smell
description: A little parcel on the side of a dirt road with some trees, perfect to spend the night after a day of climbing at Las Peñas. Super quiet, but it seems that people come here to poop so it smells bad. We tried to clean the place but it might be dirt again. Beautiful view of the Cordillera reyal and lot of wood to make a fire.

name: Spectacular Pass
description: If you like spectacular views windy roads you will like it. Not recommended in the rainy season, might be closed

name: Ipati Lake Camping
description: Just outside Ipati near a little lake. We asked the people living there and spent one night there. Dog barking and cock crying included. :-)

name: Quarry
description:
Just high enough above the road to be invisible, there is an old quarry: about 50 by 50 meters of level gravel. People on another small track leading even higher will be able to see you. Quite a bit of garbage around (like every public place in Bolivia).

We cooked dinner here and went to sleep early. Unfortunately, a group of young people came to drink and play music. They left at 2:00.

name: Internet
description:
open Wi-Fi. the router is PCH.
no so fast, but ok to use.

name: Q'antu Hotel: parking up to 2,6 meter tall
description:
Spotless rooms, good beds, hot showers, good breakfast - there's not much to say about yet another downtown hotel.

This hotel has a private, locked parking space one block (three corners) away at USD 3 per night extra.

We paid about USD 40 (and 3 for parking)

name: Time & coffee
description: Atmospheric place with good coffee, 3 mb wi-fi and not-so-gringo prices (10 bob for expresso, 12 for americano). Inside it's quiet and possible to do some work

name: Pizzeria Mundo Andino
description:
Very good pizzeria owned by super sweet señora. 15Bs/pizza, not very big (take 2 if you're very hungry!)
Anyway much cheaper than the pizzas in downtown, and worth going!

name: ES Parotani
description:
They would not give other price than 8,6 B's/L.
Nope...

name: Plaza Principal Huarina
description: It is a good place to rest. The night is very quiet and safe. The place has water in front of the school.

name: AndesXtremo
description:
Best paragliding in town. This family business is awesome. Miguel and his brother Vicente received us in their house and brought us with their mom and dog for a day of paragliding, 1 hour out of town. We flight 40min with them for 450Bob and they were super professional. We finished the morning with a delicious sopa de mani!
They are also offering mountaineering and rock climbing.
http://www.andesxtremo.com/

name: El Carmen Market
description: Big grassy/sandy field next to El Carmen's market. The place is pretty calm after 9pm. People are really friendly. There's a tap of water and toilets in the market that closes around 9pm. We camped there with motorbikes and people everyone said it was safe. It's not beautiful or fancy but a nice place for a quick stop.

name: Toll - Peaje
description:
We came from the border Kasani (next to Copacabana) so we had no "entrance ticket". We had to pay 20 Bs.

05/24: Same direction, no previous ticket 5BOBs with tickets.

name: Hot shower with parking
description: Hot shower with parking. Height restriction 2.5 m. 8 bol p/p.

name: Villa Oropeza
description: Wonderful place. Plenty of space for motorbike(s) in the enormous patio. The owner is a motorbike rider himself. Spacious dorms with lockers. Clean amenities. Really lot of bathrooms. Showers are gas heated and it takes no more then 15 seconds for water to heat as hot as you like it. Two well equipped kitchens. Table tennis. Wi-fi is 3mb but stable and it's hard to find something faster in Sucre. Works for video calls. I stayed more then a week. 53 bob for 4 dorm, 51 for 6 dorm, 45 for 8 dorm. The same on booking. The best option is 6 dorm (it's called "orange") which has a window to the patio so it's the calmest. Both 4-dorms look to the street and it's really noisy. Private rooms look to the patio as well. No breakfast.

name: Florida Car Wash
description: Place to wash your car after Uyuni salt flats. Washed the entire exterior, including under the car for 20 bob. Excellent value, friendly staff and awesome job.

name: TNA Island
description: We looked at the other spots indicated on ioverlander but the wind direction today meant this was a much better option for us. The island is cool to explore, lots of enormous cacti, fossilised coral (?) and a cave. Other posts for here suggest driving directly onto the beach but we wouldn't recommend this - the salt and the beach are both very soft underfoot and there's evidence of vehicles having been stuck close to shore all around the island. Tent campers would have several options on the island.

name: Battery + Solar Shop
description: A small shop on Avenida Illimani which sells solar panels and deep cycle batteries. We were amazed by the price- managed to get a small battery for our camper for under 100 usd which is practically unheard of. The guy also sells these on Facebook marketplace so you can check the stock or message him from there.

name: ES Maria Alejandra
description:
Update 2022: 9 bobs/liter 'sin factura'. They have cameras

We had to fill up our Jerry can and relay it to the van but were able to buy Gas at local rate. Friendly guy manning the place today!

name: Casa de Turismo
description:
Super nice couple that will give you informations for free. Marco knows lot of things about Uyuni and Sur Lipez (especially if you want to do it by motorbike).
They also have fair trade artesania

name: Dollar change Bank
description:
Bank. You can change Dollars to Bolivian if you enter Bolivia.
We changed at good rate.
Monday closed.
Tuesday to Friday 8am to 4pm.
Saturday 7am to 1pm.
Last Monday of the month 8am to 4pm.

---

Para cambiar dólares a bolivianos.
Lunes cerrado.
Martes a viernes de 8:00 a 16:00.
Sábados de 7:00 a 13:00.
 Último lunes del mes de 8:00 a 16:00.

name: Super Filtro - Air Filters
description:
A little store full of air filters.
We got an air filter for our Ford E-450

name: Dog Center
description:
Fully equipted clinic.
X-ray, echografy and tomografy posible.
Vet speaks Spanish, but understands French, Italian and a bit English.

name: Cambio Bolivianos to Argentinian Pesos
description: In La Quiaca there is no currency exchange. But on the Bolivian side of the bridge, there are several 'casa de cambio' where you can buy pesos argentinos.

name: Beyco - Servicio Técnico Automotriz
description: Very good, Bernardino, a nice guy with lot of experience. 4x4 and trucks. Everything,  from America and European. Less Volkswagen he can fix everything! Nice prices..

name: Flooded Road
description:
Due to the extensive work realized by Bolivia to provide a proper road to Torotoro, the alternative road passes by the river bed. First two passages were ok but the third is deeper and muddier. It was too risky with our heavy Van, we had to forget about going to Torotoro by ourselves 
:(
Note that it was still dry season.

FEB 2020: already new road available. no problem anymore

name: Hostal Yo Lin
description: Clean Hostal, got a single room for 20Bob. Hot shower, fast WiFi, a little kitchen but didn't used it.

name: Residencial Nathaniel
description: 120 for a night in a single room. Parking available. Has AC. Comfortable and clean. Building is poorly designed though, as the floors flood during heavy rain.

name: Restaurante Doña Sofia
description: There aren't many places to eat in this little town, but we've eaten here 2 nights in a row. Super friendly owners, cheap food and cheaper beer (mains are 15 BOB, beer is 5). It's local food (chicken, milanesa, rice, salchipapas) but tasty, and the hot sauce is HOOOOOT. Open 7pm - 11pm. There are also shops nearby selling drinks, snacks, swimming attire.

name: Don Santiago llantero tire repairs
description:
basic mechanic and tire shop.
not the best in terms of tools, but we had a breakdown and Don Santiago let us stay 5 days here while trying to find a truck that would load us and our van and bring us to la paz. cold showers on the back. he is a nice man, even prepared us free lunch after a few days!

name: Midtown La Paz
description: Really nice Hotel, very friendly and helpful stuff, nice comfortable rooms, hot shower, fast wifi and the breakfast is delicious (huge variety of fruits, scrambled eggs, bread, butter, marmelade, self-made pie, coffee, tee...). Of course not the cheapest option in the town (70$ for a matrimonial) but therefore a nice place to stay. The Teleferico (cable car) is just 3 min away. Enough parking space for motorcycles or big rigs.

name: Toll booth leaving Uyuni
description: Toll booth leaving Uyuni. They asked where we were going and we said Sucre- toll was 10 bolivianos. Receipt matched price.

name: Change money and buy SIM-Card
description: Shop at the corner (yellow and red house) where you can buy food. The lady working there at weekends is very nice and helped us to register for a tigo Sim-Card. Also she changed our peruvanian Soles into Bolivianos (1 Sol -> 2 bolivian Pesos) which is fair.

name: Football field - only flat area around
description: We were looking for a place to pitch our tent. The area is very hilly and the football field is the only option. We asked the locals if we could camp there and they said yes. In the village are many stores with basic food and two restaurants (rice with fried chicken or egg).

name: Hípermaxi and plaza mall
description:
Good supermarket, easy to access and park with big rig. 
You can change money too in Fassi bank.

name: Fuel Station w/ 24 h parking
description: Here you can stay 24 h for 20 Bolivianos. They have toilets and shower. It is not the best place but good for one night.

name: Official Entel shop
description: This is the official entel shop. Closed between 12.30 and 14.30. Friendly service, dont forget to take a ticket.

name: Gravel alley
description:
Just a gravel alley but large and all truck drivers sleep here overnight. so safe, free and big rigs friendly. we didn't have problems. there's a parking area with toilets and showers here but closed during the night.
a few harmless stray dogs.

name: Dilma
description: Dilma is a very good mechanic, able to understand the issue and find alternative to fix it. Highly recommended, very nice and fair price.

name: Cafe Monterosso (BEST ITALIAN!!)
description: Amazing little Italian restaurant run by an Italian expat. Delicious pastas, thin crust pizza and great wine. One of the best restaurants we’ve come across in South America! It’s actually located in a residential house. There’s a small sign next to the door- just ring the bell. Busy after 8:30pm.

name: Arco Iris Panaderia (best bakery in town!)
description: Awesome bread! Whole grain, german pretzels with cheese, croissants... highly recommended

name: By doña Pachi (Laguna Esperanza)
description: The entrance of Santa Isabel already announces Mrs. Pachy's restaurant specialized in fresh trouts. It is located beside the Lagoon Esperanza. You should drive carefull down to the lagoon through a (some inclined) dirt road. The place offers a campground. All the area is a wonderfull oasis of native birds, butterflies and jungle vegetation to relax and disconnect from the highway to Villa Tunari.The  campground has clean toilets. You can swimm or row (a small boat is available) in the lagoon. In the night fireflies enchant the area.  A beautifull path to a river plenty of butterflies and endemic vegetation starts north of the campground. Ponds in the river to refresh your self. You should bargain the price (10-20 bs p/p at  night).

name: Alojamiento on the left
description: Ok place for one night, very basic rooms but clean and relatively new. Looked better than the Alojamiento on the right side. Quiet place, shared bathroom with electric shower. I paid 30bs for a single room. Was able to park my bike inside the tienda, not sure about parking options for motorbikes or cars.

name: La Polar (cakes and brownies)
description: Nice café, european standard, tasty cakes, brownies and more. 6 Bol for a brownie, 23 for a coffee latte. Good Wifi, clean toilets.

name: Exotic Juices Mariposas
description: The most delicious and refreshing tropical juices we tried during our bicycle tour through Bolivia. You can also put your tent in this nice place with shadow and comfortable chairs to relax. Enjoy 32 types of cold mixes like papaya-maracuya, pinaple-lemon-mint, piña-colada, orange-banana, mango-banana, copoazu and many others. They have alcohol and not-alcohol versions. 20bs for 1lt and 30bs for a 2lt pitcher at your election. They have also fruit salad and fish preparations. There is a nice garden beside the juice-trinking area and a toilete for the visitors. Dani, the owner, is very friendly and sport fan. He organizes water-sky activities at southamerican level in Bolivia. Very bicycle friendly people. They plane to build a campground and were preparing the place to do it at the moment we came.

name: Pizza, Pasta and Croissants
description: Pizza Restaurant with some Pasta dishes as well. We had a Pizza Familiar for 80 Bol, it was definitely enough for 2 persons. The cheapest Pizza for 2 persons is 70 Bol, they also offer small sizes for 1 person. Pizza was ok, nothing special, but worth the price. They also have Croissants that looked very good, but we were to full to try it.

name: Bicycle shop
description: Small bicycle shop at the corner, they have spare parts etc

name: Hotel San Cristobal
description: Clean, decent hostel, 30 bob per person for a room with a toilet. Big patio, safe parking for motorcycles! We left our bike here for 2 nights (paid 20 bob extra for this) while on Isla del Sol. Nice owners.

name: Next to island
description: Lovely little island outside San Juan on the salt flats. Possibility of driving up onto the island to be invisible from the road and get some more wind cover. We didn’t bother as the road going through the salt flats has very little cars and none at night.

name: 5 comentarios
description: In this shop, they sell gasoline for 6,50 bolivianos. Very friendly owners !

name: Copacabana only and very nice mecanic
description: Apparantly there is only one real mecanic in Copacabana. We were really lucky to be brought to him by locals. We lost all our cooling water and didnt know what the problem was. He let us stay next to his house, which is close to the center (toilet is the grassy field, or there are a ton of hostels in town), worked on the car for a day the next morning and fixed the problem. And charged us only 100 bolivianos, we gave more. Very nice guy!!

name: football field (with roof and walls)
description: We wanted to go to the other iOverlander spot nearby, but there was a thunderstorm and it was windy. So we decided to camp on the football field to have better shelter. There are walls and a roof, so we were protected from rain and wind. There were no people around and we had zero trouble staying here.

name: Fuel station
description: Fuel station next to the street. We didn‘t use it, but wanted to list it here

name: Long term storage at Isabela
description: We stayed in the backyard to sleep and decided to ask Isabela for the possibility of a long term storage of 2-3 months. She was pleased to offer us a parking lot for 8bs a day. It was the first time for her and we can definitely recommend this save place as a long term storage.

name: Rio Chico
description: From the maintoad we went over the bridge and took the narrow gravel road until we found this beautiful spot. We have a 2WD Campervan, probably not suitable for big rigs. The place is sandy and protected by bushes. It seems to be an access to the riverbed. Was a very quiet night surrounded by the sound of nature. Some people by feet passed by in the evening. Recommended.

name: Creekside
description: There is a small disused track that heads up this small canyon. There is one decent flat spot out of view of the road, but if you go further in a 4wd you get to the end of the road and it's a bit nicer. On the creek, no one or even foot prints around.

name: Paprika
description: Really delicious food. There is a huge variety of different plates like meat, pasta, pizza, salads... the service is excellent! Furthermore there is a very good cocktail bar as well. Recommended!

name: Wind shelter
description: We asked the local people if we could camp here and they said yes. The village is very small, several houses are abandoned, they‘re good shelter from the wind. There is also a common house in which the people would have allowed us to sleep, but today it was locked. The village doesn‘t have a store!

name: Water source
description: In the small village there is a public water source. Could be a bit salty.

name: Restaurant and small tienda
description: They serve lunch here! Simple but tastes very good. But do not order meat, they will give you fried lama liver and that is disgusting. We were unable to swallow it. We also charged our mobile phones here. The lady who cooks is very nice and talkative, she gave us more and more food and then made a lunch package for the next day. In total we paid only 24 Bol for 2 persons. She offers rooms as well but we didn’t stay overnight. You can also buy soft drinks and candies here, but the other tienda in town has much more stuff. Highly recommended!

name: Tienda
description: This tienda has fresh fruits and vegetables! More articles than usually available.

name: Asarbolsem
description:
Social enterprise, artisanal production, like a factory outlet. Alpaka products at very good prices. They are an indigenous, non profit organization. Nice to buy here.
No sign outside. Red door number 250 with bell.

name: Eco Hotel Gota  Del Chaco
description: Hotel Temático del Chaco with 3 Matrimonial Rooms USD 40,00-50,00 and 2 Doubles and 2 Triples. All with air conditioning. Wifi all places.

name: La Boca del Sapo
description:
Bolivian cooking classes. Moisés is very kind and explains the ingredients and dishes in detail. You can choose between several dishes and drinks. 

The address is Juan Jose Perez #355. If you are coming from the main square 25 de Mayo the street is called Nicolás Ortiz and then the name changes to Juan José Pérez. We don't have a sign yet, but the number is on the door. It is in between the pharmacy San Agustín and Pollos Rikos. You can find them on Google maps and Maps.Me

name: Cabaña Los Tajibos (by Bulo Bulo)
description: Basic campground, fish pond and restaurant drived by Don Marco and his lovely family. You can fish your own fish from a small pond or buy it directly, to be fresh prepared with rice, yuca and salad (30 to 35 Bs). Don Marcos allows people to camp in the site, use the toilete and take a shower, ideally if some of the fresh fishes they grow or some softdrinks (12 to14 Bs for a 2lt bottle) are consumed.

name: Dorbigny Travel
description:
We wanted to book a tour to Toro Toro NP on a Sunday, which starts on Monday. As nothing is open on Sundays in Cochabamba we contacted Dorbigny Travel by Whatsapp (77975379). They answered very quick with offering different possibilities.

We decided for a 3days/2nights tour which included Cavernas de Umajalanta, Ciudad de itas, Huellas de Dinosaurio, el Gran Cañon, el Vergel and Siete Vueltas. For 1000.-bs per person we had all included like transports, meals and accommodation.

We really recommend this travel agency and the described tour to Toro Toro and we are grateful, that we didn‘t drive to the nationalpark with our own 2wd campervan as the road was very bad.

name: secured spot near tiny waterfall
description:
After crossing the bridge and starting the steep walk to Maragua, once you pass the abandoned houses with red roofs, you'll see a waterfall with two high trees. at the bottom, there is a little field surrounded by rocks.

After looking for wood, there is a similar field, super flat, further away along the river, next to a big tree. we were already settled so didn't use that spot, also it looked a little bit more as if it was used for agricultural purposes.

name: Small flat spot next to waterfall
description:
if you are here, congratulations you're doing the Illimani ascent !!
As we wanted to sleep a bit further and higher than campo base, we decided to walk already towards Nido de cóndores. After 40min, you'll find some rivers-waterfalls on your left. before reaching them, spot on the right, down the trail, there is a flat spot for two tents next to a smaller river.
Quieter than the other spots further on the trail, next to the big rivers.
Next morning, just two hours and a half to get to Nido.

Suerte!!

name: Grassy Area
description:
nice grass place, fairly flat - big enough for 2,3 cars. We did a fire, no issue. River is 15m away. Near termales.
When we arrived at Sunday some locals just packing their tents. All locals said that crossing the river and continuing to here and further up is 4x4 only. we did it with 2wd - back wheel drive with high clearance but I can't recommend it.

name: Aqua Termales
description: Here you have to turn left to go to Aqua termales. It is small road from here. 2 gates and I recommend to park before river crossing. Looks nice but came to be really bad soon. 4wd with high clearance should make it.

name: Bushcamp at the laguna
description: Just a short drive from the main road, several flat spot along the shore of the two lagunas. Depending on the spot you‘re visible from the road but not much traffic so we felt ok with staying overnight

name: Mercado
description: Big open market, meat, fruits, everything the traveler needs. Some offer gringo prices.

name: San salvador
description: clean hotel 50bob for a single with shared bathroom suicide showers fast internet but a bit intermittent I parked my Moto at copacabana down the street gave him 10bob no parking on site

name: banco bisa (change bol to us Dollars)
description: We asked in several banks but this one was the only one that was able to sell us US Dollars. We will go to Argentina and it is hard to get $ there so we bought some here

name: Frank taller and tier repair
description: we founded this little taller with a man names frank he help us to fix our tyre that was broke . really nice and kind man . make another mechanic help also.

name: Noi Pizza
description:
The best Pizza on our trip so far. Only fresh ingredients and even the tomato sauce tastes like made out of fresh tomatoes. I am a Pizzaphile, if this word exists. This was one of my top 5 i had in my life! There is also a galley next by you can visit.
Buen provecho!

name: Chostel B&B
description: Double room (matrimonoial or 2 beds) with shared bathroom 102 Bolivianos per night. Doubles with private bathroom 122 Bolivianos. Clean rooms, heaters, hot shower, good wifi. Price includes breakfast (bread, butter, jam, coffee or tea and eggs if you like). Theres a kitchen which can be used after breakfast. Water was ok to drink, but we always cooked or filtered it. You can park bicycles or motorcycles inside.

name: Pampas tour and Accomodation
description:
A really nice couple, Magali and Luis, live here and they let us, 4 cyclists, stay at their house for two nights for free. Luis offers 1-day-Pampas tours where you can see all kinds of jungle animals. We paid 600 BOB for the tour and loved it! It was way cheaper and more authentic than an organized trip from Rurrenabaque. 
If you want to contact them, Magali’s phone number is: +59167318311.

name: Start of Jungle Boat Tour
description: We organized a great 3-day jungle boat tour with locals here instead of booking it online for way more money. 4000 BOB for 4 people, amazing experience, they also took our bikes on the boat. The contact for booking is Luis Aparicio: +59167343877.

name: Hotel Ladrillo
description: We, 2 cyclists, stayed here for a night in a simple matrimonial for 45 BOB/p. The managing woman is very friendly! We even got the leftover pancakes to take with us in the morning.

name: Sport field by Nueva Palestina
description: We arrived at night to Nueva Palestina, biking from Buena Vista. So we asked the teachers of the local school if we could put our tent beside this wonderfull grassy field. They allowed us (for free), and even offered to use the toilets and showers of the school (all night open).

name: Death Road
description: Death Road Start from the Bottom. We started here at 7:30am. Paid a “peaje” of 5bol. Be aware that you will start at 770meters and will end above 3.000m. It was a nice drive! We enjoyed a lot!

name: Hostal Carlos V
description: Nice hostel in the city center. They have shared rooms for 50 Bob or 40 if you discuss a bit and private for 90 Bob or 70 if you discuss. All of these prices including breakfast. Really hot shower, kitchen but only for maté or coffee.

name: Titicaca nice views
description:
Nice little spot, calm at the end of the road, not really flat, but okay for one night. 
A bit trashy. 
Anyway the view for the sunset is just amazing...! enjoy. 
I recommend this place.

name: Gas Station
description: We get some gasonlina for tourist price - 8.68 Bol - Not friendly but we can drive :-)

name: Mountain and river view next to the street
description: Nice place with a good view next to the main road. Not many traffic at night and in the morning. Area were the Andens fox lives.

name: Taller Almendra
description: Excellent, efficient and honest mechanics, 100% recommended!  They repaired the steering ends of my Nissan Patrol for only $ 50 Bolivians.  They performed the work on the day.

name: Museo de los Instrumentos
description: Interesting museum private collection of instruments. Good for kids because you can play lots of the instruments. 10 Bob per adult

name: Public water tap
description: Not many places to find water around here. Here is the villages public water tap.

name: Cascada
description:
At the corner of the main road. 20l for 13 Bol. 
Very nice stuff.

name: Viña del Mar
description: Hostal with different rooms. We paid 130 Bolivianos per night for a double room incl. bath with hot shower. Rooms are badly soundproofed and our shower was a bit spooky starting by itself, however it was a good place to stay overnight. The restaurant serves basic breakfast and for dinner you can order Charki. The owner was friendly.

name: Real Mirador del Inca
description: Don't trust Maps.me the real Mirador is here. You have to take the canyon del Inca and follow the little path to the top. The beginning is really easy and it gets way more challenging after, but it worth it. Made it in a bit more than two hours fast walking.

name: ARB 4x4 Accessories
description: Small ARB accessories shop in El Alto. We stopped to repair our ARB fridge.

name: Near tourist information
description: We slept in the salty desert and came here for preparing breakfast. Nice place in the town center with Vulcan view and a lot of picnic places. Potable water available!

name: Refill refridge gas
description: Here we refilled gas for ARB fridge. Recommended by near ARB accessories shop

name: Agua Calientes
description: Parking along the place central in front of the Iglesias. Quiet .Secure militari around.

name: Entrance of a hidden hot pool
description: This is the entrance gate of the hidden pool. The owner's name is Florentino and his wife is Ines. If you want to visit Hidden thermal pool, contact this number (6)730-6434 first. There's no signal around here, so you need to contact him in Sajama town.

name: Yanapiruta
description: Agustin runs this tourist information point at Tieanaku. He is very frendly and let us stay at this place during night time. There is a big room where you can cook and make a fire at the fireplace. There are toilets and potable water. He also offered to let us sleep inside but we are traveling with our kombi and we slept in the van. All for free. He let us the keys and he left to go his home. Really sweet and helpful man.

name: Condoriri
description:
We've arrived by bike and put our tent behind the community center. In this spot, you are not covered from  rain, but you are well covered from wind. Very friendly locals, they were perfectly Ok with us staying here.
There is water in the main square (with very little pressure, but we managed to get what we needed to drink and cook).
There are (very dirty) toilets.
Not sure if there is access for cars...

name: Side of the river
description:
Super place to swim and enjoy a small quiet moment or stay to sleep. There is plenty of room. It's a little away from the road. The place is a bit dirty and deserves a clean.

---

[FR] - Super endroit pour se baigner et profiter d'un petit moment tranquille ou de rester pour dormir. il y a beaucoup de place. c'est un peu éloigné de la route. L'endroit est un peu sale et mérite un coup de propre.

name: Estación Nimagasbol
description: Fuel station that will fill for foreigners at Bolivian local price. It will depend on the guy. Some are nice here and will serve you, other are not.  Just need to tip the pump guy. Here in Bolivia the price of gasoline for foreigners is more than double that for Bolivians, that's why the tip. In many places they don't want to charge you for being a foreigner.

name: Amazonas- Horse tour
description: Very nice ride with Gabriela’s horses around the canyons in Tupiza. The horses are very well maintained and easygoing, not need to be expert riders. We made a 3h tour and passed by puerta del diablo, valle del inca and valle de los machos. We paid 280bob through an agency but will be cheaper if you contact directly Gabriela in WhatsApp: +591 679 04 682

name: meadow in the hills
description: lovely meadow alongside the stream surrounded by hills. just keep going on the track till you get there. some shallow fording of the river.

name: Toll /Peaje
description: We were surprised by this gate and man demanding money since no one has mentioned this anywhere else, but he insisted that they've been charging this toll for many years. We paid B10 and he gave us a receipt. (He asked for B20 at first then changed to 10). Just adding this here so others won't be surprised.

name: Sullchi
description: There is water at Pila Publica (public faucet). The water is clear and it is not salty. Really good source.

name: Agency The Wholesaler Uyuni
description:
Carmen sold us a different experience than the others agencies;  with real breakfasts, with lama meat, with more water instead of Coca-Cola.  In short, she sold us a dream in addition to the tour itself.  The coach is revealed to be a pumpkin: we left with an hour late after being plugged with groups from other agencies.  The promises made on the quality of the tour have not been kept.  Only the driver / guide Raul was polite, friendly and accommodating.  This agency does standard tour and any different speech is a lie.  I do not recommend this agency.
--
Carmen nous a vendu une excursion différentes des autres agences ; avec de vraies petits déjeuners, avec de la viande de lama, avec plus d'eau au lieu du Coca-Cola. Bref, elle nous a vendu du rêve en plus du tour en soit. Le carrosse c'est révélé être une citrouille : nous sommes partie avec une heure de retard après avoir été pluggé avec les groupes d'autres agences. Les promesses faites sur la qualité du tour n'ont pas été tenu. Seul le chauffeur/ guide Raul était poli, sympa et accommodant. Cette agence fait des tours standard et tout discours différent est un mensonge. Je ne recommande pas.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Just a quick paper Checkpoint. All easy, no problems

name: Welding and Tornero - all metals
description:
The shop where Toyota, Mitsubishi and other goes to make their parts.
welding of all kinds of metal, tubes, pipes, aluminium, iron, otton, bronze, etc. 
not cheap but the guy KNOWS his stuff.

name: Veterinaria La Predilecta
description: Very friendly vet in Uyuni. We came here for antiparasite treatment and clinical exam before crossing to Chile. If your pet has got a European Union Pet Passport and all the vaccines + desparasitación + clinical exam is in there, you don’t need official document from Senasa.  You can also buy pet food and accessories here.

name: Hizo
description: Tap at the edge of the village. Tastes nasty even filtered but not as bad as the water in Coipasa.

name: Parking Area
description: Super big place. The best place in a lot of kilometers if you come from Samaipata. Hidden from the road and surrounded by the nature. Very quiet. Perfect for one night. No facilities.

name: Showers and toilets
description:
Showers and toilets in the Mercado Campesino. Very clean.
Showers: 10 Bs
Toilets: 1 Bs

name: Alojamiento Señora Leono Mujica
description: This is a quiet little village outside the craziness of Oruro. I chose to stay here because it's very peaceful and the villagers are extremely nice. Leono is the woman's name and she is very sweet... she has two buildings with rooms for rent. One building is very new and rooms go for 40 Bolivianos. The other building is much older and simple rooms go for 20 Bolivianos. This place is perfect for cyclists who want to avoid the expensive rooms in Oruro and crazy traffic.

name: Ophthalmologist
description: This is the only ophthalmologist in the city. If you damage your eyes on the Salar... CALL: 71937526

name: Highway Restaurants
description: This area is filled with restaurants and well stocked grocery stores.

name: Bicycle Mechanic - Tonchi
description: A very friendly bicycle shop run by a guy named Tonchi.

name: Road block PMA Desierto
description: We could not drive further as there was a barricade on the road. Seems like a military base. Eventually 2 soldiers came down to talk to us. We needed to write down our information before they let us pass.

name: Near the river - Face to Sajama
description: Good spot near the river to have water. No one around. Nice view on Sajama volcano. A little bit windy.

name: Wind Shelter
description: Perfect for cyclists and hikers. You’re covered from all sides, there is only small passage to go in. No roof but great wind shelter. We fit in 3 person tent and two bicycles. There are other “houses” adjacent to this one but the floor hasn’t been cleared and people use them as toilets (shall we talk about leaving no trace again? ;-)). You will know this one by the “table” made of stones. View of Laguna Blanca. There’s no water source around.

name: Nómada Experience
description:
*Please note one negative review below.
.....
You can book MTB, motorcycle, 4x4 tours and climbing tours too here. But you can also get your bike washed and serviced here or any type of help. Robin Thomas is English and super friendly and nice and has plenty of good stories to tell. we got our bikes washed and dried here after the salar, Robin knows what he's doing as he's been here for a while. we also got oil change and a few bits sorted. 
he's also doing a lot of bike recoveries etc. Anything you need for your motorcycle, he can help. 
His number is +59178773787 or go ring at his door if he's not guiding a tour.

name: YPFB - sin factora
description:
Sold me petrol sin factora 6 per litre.

I tried a few places nearby but this was the only one who would sell fuel sin factora

name: Stone Shelter
description: At top of pass. Good spot for cyclists. Stone wall wind shelter just big enough for 2 tents. Good views! No water (we carried it from Chinguna military camp).

name: Uturuncu at 4960m
description: We wanted to camp a bit higher than the previous camp spot so we’d have less distance to cycle in the morning and found this place. It’s on the right as the road makes a tight right bend. Not quite flat sandy spot big enough for a small tent and slightly protected from the wind by large rocks and makeshift rock walls. Stunning views of Uturuncu and Cerro San Antonio. Perfect for making an early morning push for the summit. Solid tent and warm sleeping gear required!

name: Avenida Belgrano Street of Repuesto
description: here you find all repuestos. also Kombi which was great after the hard times in Argentina. you have Importshops From Brasil.

name: mecanic electronic taller
description: an very nice open mecanic which helped me asap fixing my problem with the kombi. the Kombi mecanic riquelme send me here. he knows alot and explained everything. really recommended honest open guy.

name: Lomas de Arena
description: an spectacular location with sanddunes and Laguna's in the middle of the jungle. You can drive in with your vehicle and sleep where you want. Walking and with tent ofc aswell. Breathtaking and an good place to be and to leave the masses in the city 30km away.

name: grassy place in village
description: we came here and parked first at the plaza. the police came and ordered us into office to talk. we had an nice chat (they are pretty sarcastic) and told us to Seattle down 50m away from the plaza. the village is super nice and friendly, quickly made friends and got invited for dinner. we stayed 4 days cause of the elections and felt more than welcome. bought the best 4 Cocos so far for together 10 pesos -awesome. in generell ist pretty cheap here, good place to fill up :) very silent in the night and no Moto before 8 in the Morning.

name: Rivercamp without piranha's
description:
here we finally found a place to swim in the river. (no piranha's) many super friendly locals and an refreshing river. it's around 10km from the main road but the road is pretty good maintenainced. 
you can park directly next to the bridge or 20m a bit hidden in the bushes. the concert at sunset was amazing

name: silent village camp
description:
an nice silent street next to the river. very nice place for a night. super nice neighborhood,got invited for desayuno and almuerzo! 
if you ask the lady you get water aswell(portable, and very tasty!)

name: Quiet place near to bridge
description: On a small hard packed side track near the bridge, fine to spend a quiet night. Partially hidden amongst the bushes. We parked alongside the track, no issues with 2wd in December. The river has only a little water this time of the year.

name: Tyre killers on road
description: This road has a lot of grey painted metal spikes buried in the gravel designed to puncture tyres. We got 2 punctures here at the same time which caused quite a lot of problems, especially as the traffic is about 2-3 cars per day and this is a very remote desert area. Nearest tyre repair is at the main road 40km to the east. Some soldiers stopped to effectively laugh at our situation, offering the helpful advice to carry 4 spare tyres on this route, as the spikes are hidden along the entire length. Local people later told us that the military is responsible to stop contraband smuggling from Chile... If you come this route, drive really really slowly and follow established tracks, even if that means washboard hell.

name: YPFB- local price fuel
description:
Fuel for local price no questions asked. 
Left a tip

name: Bushcamp
description: Quiet place in the riverbed. x4 with high clearence preferable . Not to noisy because far enough from the road. Of courde only when dry weather...

name: Eucalyptus Uyuni
description:
Great location with ample parking, no height restriction. Single, double, and triple rooms available all with private bathrooms and good hot showers 24/7. Good WiFi, good breakfast, heated rooms, and Milton was really friendly and helpful. There is a kitchen and laundry available and they organize tours too. You can also camp in the parking lot. They’re currently building another level with more rooms, so the parking is a bit messy with construction supplies, but it’s fine. They have a really cool pack of dogs that love friends. Pets welcome! You can also get your rig washed just next door. 

Fun fact- the beds, tables, and lamps are made of salt! Super cool! 

You can WhatsApp them at 72401884, or 61913121. Milton (the main worker) speaks Spanish and English, and his boss also speaks French.

name: Mechanic Felix- Mitsubishi Specialist
description: Felix is a friendly, honest mechanic. His specialty is Mitsubishi’s but he’ll work on anything. Just on the corner across from the cattle. His number is 74302839.

name: Hotel Akapana
description:
Very nice hotel!  They have a Big parking place where you can stay and leave your car! Room for 100 per person 
Parking with hot shower and toilet  30 per person

name: La Catedral ancient cemetery
description: This is very nice big stone formation and in the bottom it have a little cave where you see old momies . You can also climb on top of this formation where you see some Bolivian Flak !

name: Cueva Chiquini
description:
This is a nice cave  next to La catedral But every time it’s closed you must search a man called Abdon colque tel : 74230901 
In the little Indian village before la Catedral You have a house with the big green door , look at the photo here you must announce yourself and the boy with  a motorcycle will go with a key to the Cave And open it! Then they start a little generator and you will have like everywhere   !!  20 boliviano per person enjoy  it’s great!!

name: Water refill at the shop “tienda”
description:
It is possible to refill your water tanks at the tienda right after the toll at the entrance of Vila mar. 
It was free to refill the tanks but we bought for 300+bob in the shop (many drinks, beers, biscuits but nothing fresh). 
Toilets are also at the spot for 3bob

name: Secluded spot
description: Good place to camp in this area if you don’t want to stay in a parking lot. Flat, beautiful, flamingos, vicuñas, and a little hill you can walk up for a view. Hidden from the main road.

name: Dusty Village
description:
In the middle of nowhere, a small dusty village without even a name on the map can give you a room to spend the night. Mattress available, water just in front of the house. Just ask villagers (not all are speaking spanish).
Surely basic but safe.

name: Water refill - ask hotel Andino first
description: We could refill our water tanks there on a tap. Water looks clean. You need to ask the guy at Andino lodge for permission first - maybe have dinner (on our side we had a cheap double room for 70bob)

name: Church, has a tap in the courtyard
description: We camped here in a tent beside the church.  the basketball court was busy.  Not very private but has a water tap.

name: Hostal Letanías
description: Double room with a shared bathroom for $60 bs.  there is room to store bicycles or motorbikes.  nice, clean.

name: hotel salkay
description:
130 Bs for a matrimonial with private bathroom, fast internet, hot shower and decent
 breakfast.

name: Eco Hostal Joshua
description:
Nice relaxed place with dorms, privates, and I believe you can pay to camp...there is also a small section which a rig might fit. Motos can park in the secured courtyard

55b/night in 10 bed dorm, 15s for breakfast, 30s for camping (according to a guy sleeping in his hammock) there is also a vegetarian restaurant on site as well as a permaculture tent.

name: Abandoned Campsite
description:
According to the notes, this place was built in 2002. but apparently was abandoned not too much time time later. There are at least two dorm blocks where you could easily set up a tent sheltered from rain/snow and wind. But caution, the building is in a really bad state and there are roof tiles missing in a whole lot of places. If you are in a worry, or just tired of riding and looking for a place to rest, this could be the place.

There are a lot os specific places to build a fire, (and you could easily use the scrap wood that you find all over place)

No facilities whatsoever.

name: Second Gate with Fee
description:
After paying the first fee (see other post above, 10bol pp) to a lady which gave us a boleto for cementerio and garganta del diablo we arrived at a second checkpoint (road blocked again with chain)... there was a young girl which told us if we would like to go further/passing or visiting maragua we have to pay again 20bol pp for the same: cementerio, garganta del diablo...

We asked her why to pay again for the same, her answer: all the tourist pay! we even didn't want to visit the cementerio, we were just on our way to the dinosaur prints where they charge another 20bol pp btw! she didn't let us through without paying again- we turned around and went to the other entrance near potolo where they charge you nothing to cross...

we really felt like walking money bags and not welcome at all- we decided to not support these kind of behavior! It's a pity because the area is really nice and there are many things to see!

name: Dolce vita
description:
Very nice hotel owned by french speeking couple. The place is clean, nice terrace and shared kitchen clean and well equiped to cook your own food. Private and shared bathroom have real hot shower not sucide one...
Definetly had the nicest stay in Bolivia!

name: Gasolineria
description: We negotiated diesel to 4 bob per litro after some discussions. We said we were empty and had a 150 liter tank so lots of money for him (3,72 bob local price)

name: Hutajata square
description: Very quiet place at the square. With best drinkable water but slow running tap. you see the lake from here.

name: Clinica Gessba (24h)
description: Nice clinic, only 50 bol for consultation with a doctor. They have a lot of different treatment specialists (like physio). They are open 24h.

name: Veterinaria La Mascota
description:
After going to five different vets in Potosi, this one was open, knew about the certificado de salud, had them in stock, was friendly, efficent and cheap! The certificate was 70Bol and the pill for the desparazitation was 20Bol. 

His name is Walter and his WhatsApp is +591 71813986

Fun fact, he also plays guitar in a band, he gave us a cd of his music!

Nice guy!

name: Alliance française
description:
French café in a pretty patio and library where our children could sit for an hour to read a book. Very pleasant!
Slow wifi.
---
Café français dans un joli patio et bibliothèque où nos enfants ont pu se poser une heure pour bouquiner. Très agréable ! 
Wifi lent

name: Hotel La Magia de Uyuni
description:
Great hotel with friendly staff. Awesome breakfast buffet. Had a private parking space for my motorcycle. Showers are good, and internet is above average. 
Paid usd 40 for a night, and had all the amenities from a big hotel chain. The price paid was whilst on high season.

name: Sunday Traffic Delay 3 Hours
description: All the way to Rio seco. Stuck with my moto for 3 hours and got hit 3 times. Pure chaos. Take a bypass or simply don’t come to La Paz. There’s nothing worth seeing here anyway. Take an outside route to Carretera de la muerte and you’ll enjoy ur trip much more.

name: Lonely flat area behind hills
description:
We came from LaPaz looking for a place to sleep before driving to Uyuni. We found this lonely flat area behind some hills, so you can’t be seen from the street, even though you can here the cars. No 4x4 needed, very quiet, only saw lots of bugs in the morning:)
The coordinates are the beginning of the dirt road on your right separating from the ruta 1. Just follow the road until your going down between two hills. Behind the hills you just can camp everywhere or go further down if you want less traffic noise (isn’t much though)

name: Hostal El Pato Donald
description: Stayed on private room with shared bathroom. 40 bol + 10 for a real hot shower. Parked my motorcycle inside the hostal. Clean room, comfy bed. No WiFi. There is a comedor inside, not sure if you are allowed to use the kitchen. You need to have your own toilet paper

name: Ridge between 2 lagoons
description: Beautiful place but windy, overlooking both lagoons, perfect for big rig.

name: Mirador
description: Viewpoint, shaded lake. nice place to rest because although it is attached to the route/track the traffic is sporadic, you can advance more just by walking to have an excellent view.

name: Bike store "Race Store"
description:
A bike store professionnal and helpful. Reasonnable prices for maintenance.
There is an other one some meters after passing the Guillen street. Didn't try but seemed professionnal too. Other stores marked in the area are definitely closed.

name: Comedor laguna Cañapa
description: As cyclists, we ask to the owner of the small house (who collects the toll) if we could sleep in the comedor, a little building with tables and chairs where some tours have lunch. He agreed and we spent a perfect night.

name: Llama Café
description: Good vegetarian cafe restaurant with craft beer options. I’m not vegetarian but enjoyed a falafel plate which is a nice change to the other common food around here. Just opened 6 weeks ago, and the owner is friendly and welcoming.

name: Plaza de Kemalla
description:
We were on our way to the other overland spot and we noticed that it was on the left hand side, on the highway there is nowhere to cross, if you are driving towards Oruro, this place is better. There is even drinking water in the cylindrical cement tank, at the foot of it there is a key. We asked the lady of the only visible place if we could park on the lawn and she gave us permission.

Ibamos camino a la otro punto de overland y notamos que quedaba de la mano izquierda, en la autopista no hay donde cruzar, sentido a Oruro es mejor este lugar. Incluso hay agua potable en el tanque cilíndrico de cemento al pie del mismo hay una llave . preguntamos a la señora del único local visible si podíamos aparcar sobre el césped y nos dió permiso.

name: San Silvestre
description:
If you need a health certification for your dog to cross into Chile, you can get one here. They have odd hours, but they were very helpful in getting our health certification for Chile. The health certification is valid for 15 days, so you must cross before the 15 days are up. 

You have one of two choices -

1. Go to SENASAG to get the “bill”, pay at a Banco Union(with your original passport and get your receipt for $277 BOL), then come to the vet to get your health certificate ($175 BOL), return to SENASAG to get the exportation permit. 

2. Go to the vet to get the health certification, go to SENASAG to get the “bill” and pay at a Banco Union, then go back to SENASAG to get the exportation permit.

SENASAG hours 8:30 - 12:30, 14:30-18:30
Banco Unión hours - only open until 16:30
San Silvestre hours - closed sometime during lunch for 2-3 hours.

They also have a “hotel” upstairs in their vet that is pet friendly so ask if you need a place to stay. They have a parking garage for a car, but not big enough for big rigs.

name: SENASAG ORURO
description:
This is where you get the official exportation permit for your dog.

They recommend San Silvestre Vet services to get your health certification. 

into Chile, you can get one here. They have odd hours, but they were very helpful in getting our health certification for Chile. The health certification is valid for 15 days, so you must cross before the 15 days are up. 

You have one of two choices -

1. Go to SENASAG to get the “bill”, pay at a Banco Union (with your original passport and get your receipt for $277 BOL), then come to the vet to get your health certificate ($175 BOL), return to SENASAG to get the exportation permit. 

2. Go to the vet to get the health certification, go to SENASAG to get the “bill” and pay at a Banco Union, then go back to SENASAG to get the exportation permit.

SENASAG hours 8:30 - 12:30, 14:30-18:30

name: Aries Wheel Repair
description: We had a very bad dent from a pothole in both wheels on our motorbike. Went to a few mechanics and everybody told us we had to change the wheels. Then after some asking around someone refered us to this guy. When he showed up with a hammer and a piece of wood we were realky sceptic. But when he straightend the wheel in his homebuilt machine it run very good again. So we asked him to do the other one too. Great guy!

name: Tinka
description: Awesome hotel with secured parking for 2-4 vehicles...clearance is probably about 2.5-3 meters. We fit easily on our toyota pickup/pop top with surfboards on top. Heated rooms, hot water, great breakfast, wifi...walkable to restaurants, teleférico, etc. Paid $34 usd (on booking.com) a night for a double with private bathroom (with a view of the city/mountains). Super to drive to if you take the toll road around town....

name: Las Pozas Villa Abecia
description: After hard driving days, we spent 3 days here swimming and chilling. Don’t miss this paradise! only for you.

name: Miracolous water tap
description: On the right side of the door of Militar School, there is a free water tap. Just in the grass.

name: Official access to Valle de Roca
description: This is the turn off where you access Valle de Rocas loop and campsites. Definitely need high clearance for the loop because the bushes are tall between tire tracks. Not recommended for big rigs to do the loop. Lots of campsites and really cool rock formations. Took us 1 hour in total.

name: Socoser balancing
description:
Good place for balancing wheels.
Very professional.
200BOB for a complete balancing.

www.socoser.com.bo

name: Leveled, nice and quiet camping
description:
We tried first to camp close to the pools, sorry to say but Baños Chaqui is not clean, so, we decided keep driving and find a green spot. For this spot drive 5 to 10 mins from the asphalt, the intersection is easy to see. 
The owner came to visit us, very polite guy.

name: mirador el limón
description:
nice shady spot for resting. despite its name, its not really a mirador. we spent the night here.

lindo lugar sombreado para descansar. no es del todo un mirador a pesar de su nombre. pasaremos aquí la noche. si quiere puede rezar en la capillita junto. de yapa tiene algo de señal de celular

name: playa de Camiri
description:
shady with access on foot to the river. good place to rest.

sombra y bajada peatonal al río. el agua es turbia pero fresca, buen lugar para descansar al mediodía y evitar el pleno sol.

name: Yadiel Lavado De Autos
description: Car wash: Did a great job on my 4Runner. 20 pesos for exterior

name: Near Queñua Forest
description: There are various small clear areas at the side of this track up to the forest. Awesome view back over Sajama and the volcanoes at sunset.

name: Llama restaurant
description:
In the middle of nowhere, but if you happen to pass there, they serve fried dried llama with corn and potato.
Very good, and very typical.
Cannot find it down in Sorata.

name: Street food
description:
At night, many street food kiosk serving potatoes with beef heart, potatoes with beef tripes, great quinoa hot juice (2,50 bob), etc. 
6-8 bob/portion, good to find food at the same price than in other parts of Bolivia.

name: complejo turístico 3810 (Hostal Titicaca)
description: We are in the middle of the highest navigable lake in the world, Welcome to our little hotel!  Great experience At the Complejo Turístico 3810, nice food, warm water, perfect beds, fair price. We were traveling from Ecuador to Bolivia. We found the location in Google maps and booking, really clean and good service. Andres and Diego took us to the Llamas house and we take nice pictures, they have also kayaks, bicycles and Tours over the lake. They speak English as well and have a nice advice for tourists.

name: Tierra Roja winery
description: Amazing stop for natural wines! This winery is incredible. We toured LOTS of vineyards in the Cinti Valley and this was by far our favorite. Biodynamic, organic, unfiltered, and made with true passion.  Don German will give you a tour of this beautiful property and explain how they grow the grapes with the processes of the moon and nature as well as how he is carrying on the labor of love started by his son Don Cristian. Great wine, very high quality...slightly more expensive than others in the valley but 100% worth every penny. Call ahead to make an appointment with German (who also speaks English) +591 72049958 Do not miss this place!

name: By stream of water
description: Spot by stream of water. Nothing too special, but away from road, super quiet and beautiful stars. I wanted to go to Riverside wild camp spot further up the road, but the road is now completely washed out. Not possible with any 4x4.

name: SUMAJ
description:
Very simple/basic but nice and quiet hostel.
We paid 100bob/night por a private double room.
Kitchen with gaz but not a lot of cooking tools.

name: Cafeteria La Chakana
description: Great food options here, good vibes and a place where you can bring your laptop to work if you need to. The WiFi was very good and the staff let us find a comfy corner to get online. Great location and always packed, it seemed.

name: Tres Cruces
description: by Cachito, New room, very clean, 350 pesos per person shared bathroom or 400 private bathroom. bicycles in a safe place or even in the room. Ask for Cachito at the museum or at the minimercado

name: Hotel Marcus
description: Ok hotel. 100 bobs for room w bathroom, 130 bobs for room w bathroom and aircon. Would expect a little more for the price, but it’s clean.

name: Small river camping
description: Really nice spot for tents with a small stream and some green smooshie grass. Sheltered from the wind.

name: potable water
description:
There is potable water tap.
I asked some local people.
This is a potable.
I leave the judgment to you.

name: Red Beach Paradise
description: Near the river, very good covered from the wind and away from the mainroad. Red sand and amazing landscape. So beautiful! Very quiet and safe. No facilities. Place for two big rigs.

name: Residential Street Parking
description:
Came here as it was getting dark. Didn't want to get ripped off at Hotel Oberland. Super quiet street parking in relatively up market neighbourhood. Lots of flat residential streets to park for the night. Self sufficient only. Maybe find toilets in restaurants on the main street.
No-one bothered us at all.

name: Pahuichi Hostel
description: Very nice, clean hotel. Large, bright, beautiful rooms. 130 bobs wo aire, 200 bobs with. Breakfast included. Couldn’t get wifi to work, but there’s Entel signal. Didn’t bother to ask about it.

name: Cemetery
description:
No hose. On the cemetery square, in the center towards the colored benches, there is a tap. During the day, it is used for watering and the women who run the stands around drinks it. The hose is very long and you can refill from the road. Buy a small kilo of peach or grapes and everyone will be happy.
.....
FRANCAIS
Sur la place du cimetière, au milieu vers les bancs de couleur, il y a un robinet. La journée, ça sert pour l'arrosage et les femmes qui tiennent les stands autour la boivent. Le tuyau est très long et vous pouvez faire le plein depuis la route. Achetez un petit kilo de pêche ou de raisin et tout le monde sera content.

name: Botelho Performance
description: We are a multi-brand mechanical workshop, we do all kinds of work in motor mechanics and suspension. We specialize in modifying or assembling cars for 4x4s and overlanding. For any questions or to schedule an appointment you can call +591 60684978

name: Purple road
description:
it's not really a must-see thing, but since Maps.ME dragged me through this interesting place, it would be pitty not to share with others - it's a pretty good quality gravel/sandy road, where the packed sand is purple ... I mean I've driven on black, white, grey, brown, tan, orange and red sand, but never purple ...
FIY - if driving south towards the salar, there's over 70 km of corrugated road between the purple road and the paved road, so keep that in mind

name: Coroico Street parking
description: After having a stressful time trying to negotiate the busy, steep, narrow streets of Coroico we happened upon this place. Pretty flat, next to a wall. If you park close to the wall it allows even big trucks to pass. Nothing fancy, and no facilities but is closer to town than at the Chapel, or cemetery. With a truck camper Coroico is not much fun to drive around so this was a no brainer.

name: Behind Rocks
description:
As we decided to stop on the way to the volcano we camped here with our car. Its next to the road (but no one passing) and behind some rocks for better wind protection. 
Just an „emergency“ stop I would say.

name: in front of a hospital
description:
We stayed one night on Saturday night for Sunday market.
Here is in front of a house next door is hospital.
We asked hospital staff about staying and safe.
He said here is possible to stay and safe place.

There is an another choice.
You can stay in a parking of the house in front of the hospital.
Overnight is 10 bol, daytime is 10 bol.

If you have a interesting, please check close to this mark
"parking in kind Bolivian House"

name: Parking - Private House
description:
Best place to stay in Tarabuco!

We stayed in front of a house next to the hospital on Saturday night. 
The house which across from the hospital, it's owners told us we can stay in a parking of thier house for 10 bol.
But we stayed out of house for savivg money...
We parked a car in the parking from moring.

Over night is 10 bol, daytime is 10 bol. Gate opens from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. 
Gate is always closed, so we felt very safe.
There are free toilets and water. not potable.
It takes 1 minute to plaza by walking. very close!
We could take some rests in a day.
House owners are very friendly old couple. 
If you want to stay here, it's very easy to ask them.
Because they have a shop next to the gate. Please check a photo.

You don't need to research a place to sleep in Tarabuco.

name: Casa de los jazmines
description:
Very very nice hostel / hotel with a wonderful garden! You can park 1 car and several motobikes inside
Everything very clean and you get a lot for the price (~130 BOL for a room with own bathroom)! Washing clothes is for free! Highly recommended!!

name: Salt Flats Tow HELP
description:
If you get stuck you can call this number for a tractor: +59163720996

I helped a couple in a fully loaded sprinter van get unstuck for 5 days on the beach of an island in the salt flats.  These guys brought a tractor and cable to help.  It was quite the process but we got the job done.  They paid $1000usd 

...ps. DO NOT DRIVE ON THE BEACHES!

name: Shower: Puerto Suarez Bus Terminal
description: Very clean shower for 5bob.  Nice to find on these hot sweaty days.

name: Near Gruta San Pedro
description:
Coming to San Pedro's gruta, at the end of the road, there is a place in front of green mountains and clouds where you can sleep and have a good and calm day. You pass some houses and there is a place where you can park. It is difficult find a good overlander in Sorata, so there is a good place to know.

Llegando a la gruta de San Pedro hay un lugar plano al final del camino frente a las montañas verdes y las nubes, donde podes dormir y pasar un dia tranquilo. Tenes q pasar unas casas y encontras el lugar para estacionar. Es difícil encontrar un buen overlander en Sorata asi que esta bueno conocer este lugar.

name: Beirut hotel
