description: Nice hôtel. friendly staff. 10 ´center by taxi. very quiet and clean.

name: Herrera Automotriz
description: Good place if you have an electrical problem with your car. The place was recommended by Julio Gamara. Just park in the street in front of the shop. They dismantled and washed our alternator, repaired an interrupter on the electrical card of the van and changed our two broken trumpets for 420BOL.

name: Unfinished building
description:
Cyclists/
Quite big unfinished building, only walls and a good roof: no door no windows. Great protected place to put a tent, plenty of space, clean.
The neighbor (there's only one) is very friendly.

name: Dangerous Road
description:
Just so you know, we usually don’t listen to the warnings, or we take them lightly but this time we really got ourselves into a dangerous and very stressful situation, which is why we wanted to put this warning. 

First of all, if you take this road, you ABSOLUTELY need a 4x4. 

Up to Viru Viru the road is ok. It’s a bit narrow, there are a few turns with fallen stones to drive on and there are few dry river beds with high steps to pass but with our 4x4 Toyota Hillux we got through it quite easily. 

Once you pass Viru Viru, going to Rio San Pedro (and eventually Carasi) the road gets really really bad. 

There are 3 barriers, made of tree trunks of different sizes. It took us a bit of time and a lot of energy but took them apart and continued. 

But after that, the road got narrower, and it was impossible to even turn around to go back. 

The mountains’ walls are very friable and there were loads of super big fallen stones (50/60kg) and dead tree trunks on the path. We actually had to break/carry/push them around so we could pass (because we could not turn around) which was very difficult, and strenuous not to mention dangerous. 

We finally reached and crossed the bridge. 

But after the bridge, the road to Carasi is simply impractical for cars, there is only space for motorcycles or bikes. According to maps.me you could go through the river bed, however we tried it on foot and there were a lot of very big stones and the ground was very soft, so there is a high risk of getting stuck even with a 4x4. 

As there is absolutely no one there (no cars, no people) we recommend NOT to try it or at least not in the rainy season and if possible not alone. 

We turned around on the bridge and got back to Sucre as there was no way to continue.

name: Quiet field not far from the road
description:
Big field near the road. 
Good alternative to villages’ main squares. 
Partially hidden and very quiet (traffic dies down after 9pm). The only “neighbors” we had were a few caws, and a few donkeys. 
Accessible with 2wd
Leveled 
No facilities

name: Gomeria
description:
Small gomeria in this little village
Nice owner 
We had two flat tires which he helped us fix quickly For 10 bobs

name: Small familial restaurant
description:
Just a couple of long wooden tables 
You can have a homemade fresh and delicious lunch under the shade of the trees 
It was chuleta when we were here ! :)

name: Next to futbol field
description:
We parked next to the futbol field down to the river. nice flat area to spend the day & night. no one bothered.
be aware of the plants with needles!! 
also possible to pitch a tent as there is a lot of sand 
water in the river is not for drinking - too much sediment

name: Splendid Salteneria & Heladeria
description: Really cool small coffee shop with bloody good tasting empanadas. Also free wifi which is quite fast

name: YPFB fuel station
description: Tiny fuel station, Diesel and Gasolina, tiny store also, unfriendly

name: Es Chullpani
description:
Filled up at local price straight into tank. Foreign plate not even noticed. 
-
Local price without negociation and gave us water for our motorhome tank. Fastest flow we've never seen since the start of our trip (6 months ago ). Perfect.

name: Uyuni lake view point parking a lot
description:
Awesome!!
We stayed one night here.
Very safe place.
Wind was little bit strong.

Here is very beautiful view point of Lake Uyuni and another Bolivia nature!
We saw a beautiful sunset on Uyuni salt lake and milky way after sunset.

Flat and large place.
But there were a little bit fragments of  broken bottles, be careful.

name: Fuel station
description: Nothing special, just a fuel station, selling Diesel and Gasoline

name: Water from waterfalls in the rain season
description: Here you can fill your not drinkable water tank. Water looks fine. There were a lot of similar waterfalls in the rain season.

name: YPFB
description: Very friendly guys sold me 11 liter diesel for 55 BOB. Into the jerrycan.

name: At solar
description: Solar parts shop, fixed our battery charger, lots of solar charging products

name: Mocca cafe resto bar
description:
The best cakes we have had in a very long time in South America and it is very generous  portions. Coffee and other foods also super nice.
And it is on the square to sit and relax for an afternoon.

name: Yenny Pasteleria Cafeteria
description: They must surely have the best sweet cakes in all of Bolivia. Okay, I am exaggerating a bit. But the food is excellent and cakes are really good. And wifi.

name: Deep Mud
description: We have a 4x4 high clearance vehicle and turned back quarter of the way in. I would never do this again. Deep mud ruts and our mud protector fell off as well. Sliding all over - extremely scary

name: At Tourist Info
description: tourist info, medium helpful, but can call the water distributor to bring 20L water jugs for you to refill your tanks if needed. paid 20bols dor 20L, probably a ripoff but couldn't be bothered arguing.

name: Jiang Nan Chinese Restaurant
description: After countless parilladas and pollerias we were in for a change. This is a really great Chinese restaurant. They offer the real Chinese food. Ask for the Chinese menu (the normal menu only has one plate menus) and let her explain the dishes if you don't know Chinese characters. Gongbaojidin, maladoufu, etc..

name: Super taller tecnico
description:
Super garage that fixes our problems by the day (defender td4). Specialized in diesel. Friendly and helpful. His hermano also has a garage (not diesel) a few blocks away. 
Calle Cardenas 50

name: nice mechanic
description:
When I got out of Uyuni Salt Lake, the muffler seemed to have water in it, and the engine stopped.
I had my car towed and the locals brought me here

name: Seyra: Electronic Taller
description:
Seyra: Servicio Electrico y Repuestos Automoviles. 
Recommended from Mario at the Barons House. He said they are a little more expensive but high quality. 
Place looks closed, just pull around the side street and in the big huge blue garage door. Guys are friendly, immediately busted out the test light and multimeter. Place is clean too, got a good vibe about it.
A bunch of tallers and chapas here in the neighborhood too.

name: Behind a house
description:
As the marked camping ground is sadly full of animal droppings (cows, sheeps,etc.) we stayed here. It is behind a house near the river and looks like a parking lot. You can enter from the riverside or from the street of the houses.. 
Nice :-) For us the best free option in town

name: Torneria Suizo all kind of welding
description: Can weld any kind of metal. Very experienced staff. They can work on any châssis or rebuild transmission parts (shafts and gearbox). Ivar is very friendly and very professionnal. Fair prices. Highly recommended!

name: Wasboard road
description:
The place is spectacular but the road between lake Chalviri and Quetena chicl will kill a car. Its is basically at the stage of being undriveable as its washboard all the way. Definitely not a car but a good high clearance car can do.
Stop often to let shocks cool

name: Milan centre
description:
Excellent coffees, cappuccinos and pizzas! The service is amazing. Absolutely well worth the visit.
And free wifi.

name: Pit Stop Cafe
description: Really nice food and coffee, good prices for pretty western standard food, bacon and eggs on toast 20bs, nice latte 16. 10 home made empanadas 65. Argentinian owned I think. Recommended if you want something other than llama and corn.

name: Pico Austria hike
description: Instead of following the gps and passing through Chunavi, turn off later if  you are coming from La Paz. This road is much better - we had to engage 4x4 coming from Chunavi.

name: Ruta Chacaltya. Blocked
description: Coming from La Paz, if you wanted to take a right to get to the lower campsite, you can’t, as it is completely dug up about 100m in. (There’s an immense hole in the road).

name: Greenhouse
description:
Best Hostel i seen so far in South America...hot shower, big and well equipped kitchen, big common area, super clean and the owner speaks english!
when i arrived they had a barbecue so i was invited on the spot.
50 for dorm and 125 for private( in the dorm every bad has electric outlet) with good breakfast.
laundry service can be arranged.
i could park my motorcycle inside the garden...it is possible to fit 2-3 bikes there and 2 blocks away there is a secured parking lot for 15bob a day for cars or you can leave it outside.
restaurants on the street.
quite area.
they have WhatsApp +59179627775

name: La Casa del Telegrafista
description: Super nice place to stay - 100 Bol for large private room, 35 Bol for a dorm bed. Toilet and hot shower is shared, outside in a separate small building. Courtyard with fireplace to hang out. Parking behind the gates for several cars and tonnes of motorbikes. The owners are French and very welcoming. For 50 Bol they prepare you a huge lasagne with salad if you want some comfort food! No WiFi.

name: Bolivia Green Kitchen
description: Very nice vegetarian / vegan restaurant with very nice staff! :-) Dishes between 25-40 BOL and very very tasty!

name: Uni Vida S.A
description: SOAT for Bolivia. 137 Bolivianos for VW Kombi, only one year available. No need to buy one if you stay less than 30 days in Bolivia. Bring copies of passport and vehicle papers.Cash only, easy and fast!

name: Cochabamba
description: Amazing. After getting rejected at 5 gas stations, the refinery station filled our tank full at the local price with just a 10 bolivianos tip. Find the young teenage chap (: not sure if the rest would do it too

name: Entrance of salar
description: Quiet and flat place at the entrance of the salar. No traffic except some agency cars during the day on the « main » road hundred meters away

name: Hillside
description: Isolated spot in the mountain to have wind protection. Very nice scenery with laguna view. Beautiful sunrise over the laguna. Nice sunset with red-pink clouds over the laguna. There is a small track going up. We stayed along the track to have wind protection and flat place. Lot of space for the kids to play outside.

name: Secure Parking
description:
Secure parking in the center of Tarija.
No height restriction.
5 BOB for the afternoon.
You can leave your van several days of needed.

name: Off the road
description:
Quiet place to have a lunch break or spend the night.
There's one car passing by every 2 hours during the day so probably even less at night.
Nice view over the surrounding hills.

name: Between hills and rivers
description:
Cool quiet spot to spend the night right off the dirt road. Great view over the cero Chorolque.
No wind, no traffic at night, perfectly leveled.
We had to cross a river to get there, no water in late February but that might depend on the weather/season.
We have a 4WD but it's not mandatory.

name: Peaceful night with view
description: The earlier campsite had houses around so we drove further on to this nice spot next to the road. No cars passed while we were here, only 3 friendly farmers leading cattle home

name: Welder (Red door), parts store
description: Fixed our ripped off ladder to our rooftoptent. He made a new piece and soldered it. 100 bs. 3 hours. I mean workmanship is so so but if you are deperate, there’s one here. Red door and next to el dinasaur hostel

name: 20L water jugs
description: sells 20L water jugs if you ask, 20bob per jug.

name: CP La Chiquitana
description:
Finally, the new CP of Ruedi, Miriam and Heidi is in operation, ok, still some final work to be done. A big courtyard with big, cool, shady trees, flat. There is space for a least 4-6 big rigs, no restricions. Tents are possible on the sandy gravel ground. With the best bathrooms in Bolivia, warm and hot water (Swiss quality). A common grill place under a roof. Secure behind the big door to the street. A welcoming family and a friendly host. Do not miss the wholemeal bread of Ruedi, it‘s not only famous in the city, it‘s the best you can get in Bolivia. The washing service of Miriam is perfect.
Unfortunately the internet connection is not yet well established in the region. 
The center of the city, the sight seeing spots, the fresh markets, the local food court, restaurants and shops are within less than 
1km. That said, the CP is in the city, meaning, there are some motorcycles around and the rooster of the neighbour will wake you up in the morning.
.

name: leveled platform
description:
Coming from Sucre, the other platforms where not leveled. So we found this one which is leveled. 
just a few traffic. 
Good quiet spot for a night with any size of rig.

name: Plaza Armas 30 de Noviembre
description: Alternative around Oruru for those who are going to La Paz. We spent a quiet night, without noise or curious. It’s a square in front a church in Caracollos.  It’s good just for one night ...

name: With the goats
description: We found it hard to find a good place to sleep and ended up here as we arrived in the night. We parked right next to a couple of hundred goats. Not sure if they are here every night. In the morning the shepherd came for a small talk. Nobody seemed to be bothered because of us. Its a big flat spot. The way from the main road to here is a bit narrow.

name: Moto Tez
description:
A greate place to do repairings on your motorbike.
The owners Rolando and Meli speak English and were helping me with everything I needed. Getting some welding, new bearings, breakpads, turn signals and even stitching on my luggage. I spend here three dayes to get everything nice and shiny again. Absolute recommendation!

name: Toll Point
description: There is suddenly a rope over the street so you can not pass. He wanted 16 Bol for our small camper. Bigger cars pay more.

name: Ojo de agua
description:
Nice tropical hostel outside of coroico center and also cheaper. Very nice view! 

Natural swimming pool and small cascada. Possible to camp also (few places to park).
Breakfast available and mainly a restaurant. Andreas is Italian and cooks amazing pasta and we had also caiman and a lot of incredible jungle food. We highly recommend this authentic place.

name: MUSEF - etnografia y folklore
description: Worth the visit. A great collection of fabrics, clothes, feathers, masks.

name: YPFB with diesel and gasoline
description: Some of the YPFB fuel stations in this end of Cochabamba only had GNV. This place has diesel and gasoline as well, at international price.

name: Old Road On The Trail
description: An old track off main road to Valle grande approx 70 kms before la Higuera. Small rigs. Difficult to turn around but not impossible. Not much available coming from south before this.

name: Grassy Area Off Road
description: Small grassy area approx 22Km before Valle Grande. Exposed to road but weren't disturbed apart from dog from nearby house.

name: Gasolina
description: Place for gasoline. Could not find any other place. The other place mentioned on iOverlander did not have any gas. She directed us to another place which wanted 10 per liter but then had a look and did not have anything. I asked a local and they directed us to this place. Nice lady which had some big jerrycans. She immediately said it would be 6 per liter and we could get 45 liters.

name: Welder Don Miguel
description: Welder that fixes whatever is needed beyond the general things a mechanic would do. His name is Miguel Angeluna and his number 73048527.

name: Earth’s heartbeat - geyser field
description: Safe, beautiful spot for a night with our motorhome. We pulled off the “main” road tracks to find a some what leveled place. You constantly hear the geysers but also a drumbeat-like sound which made us associate it with earth’s heartbeat. One of the most unique places we have ever camped. In the morning a few tourist cars arrived for sunrise. Not more than 6, but this was on a Tuesday.

name: Valle de los condores
description: Official trekkings of this nice valley are managed by a nice family (la señora Julia). Actually you can’t go by yourself, the only way to visit the valley is to go with them with a one day tour or two days tour where you can appreciate a nice walk in the mountains and see condors (depending on how lucky you are they can be far or close). The finca and garden of Julia is really really beautiful, they are welcoming and provide accommodation and food if you need them.

name: Singani Casa Real
description: Really brand new distillery of the most famous Singani, we did a small tour for 15 pesos each including a chilly cocktail at the nice bar.

name: Mercado del puente
description: Good open-air Mercado (on the main street)! Good sonso and typical food;) cheap

name: Purple Cable Car / Estación 6 de Marzo
description: Fastest way to the city center, ca. 15-20 min walking from the airport. 3 Bob one way and per person.

name: Toll booth
description: 12 BOB to drive to Oruro. keep the receipt as always

name: Mirador de la Cruz
description: Nice lookout over the town Rurre und river Beni. 30min-1hr climb from the road, depending on fitness. Go in the morning to avoid the scorching heat.

name: Lavadero. Salar Car Wash
description:
Went here before driving on the Salar.
They washed and oiled the vehicle for 60 bob.
Very good job. They rinse your car with non salted water !

name: Hostal de Sal Los Lipez
description: Hostal in San Juan that allowed us to camp in the space in front for 30Bs ( two people and camper ) with use of bano and hot shower. Has a nice bar/ comedor as well. Manager was friendly.. Quiet location .

name: Burger, cheap and good
description:
A small restaurant in the stairs that make cheap (in comparison with nearby places) and good burgers! There is one option with quinoa burger that is quite good as well.
Around 20BOL for burgers and fries.

name: Direction El Palmar
description: Just a side turn off the main route. On a corner by 2 white signs. Gets off the road. Is flat, quite, and great sunrise. A couple of motorbikes passed in the evening but nothing late. Lovely view. H+ Entel signal!

name: Alamasi Pampa Cliff
description: Great place on top of a cliff on the way to El Rodeo. Off the main route on a rocky shelf with awesome views. Entel signal. No facilities

name: Servicio Tecnico
description: We had to fix our gas cooker. He didn’t have the spare parts but was able to manage it with his creativity. Asked 40BOL for 30min

name: Nómada Hostel y Cafe
description: Very pretty hotel / hostel in Samaipata. We underestimated the drive from Sucre arriving in town late and after dark. We found this hostel on Google, with many good reviews there, and it looked open. Very welcoming young family runs the place and offered us a private room with all amenities including breakfast for 250bob. More than we usually pay, but a really nice comfy bed after a stressful day on the road. Hot water, great bed, beautiful garden, strong WiFi, friendly hosts.

name: Paraguayan Consulate
description: Paraguayan consulate for all those needing visas to head east (U.S. in our case). Very easy process, we showed up around 9am, filled out some paperwork, and were directed towards a local bank (walking distance, three blocks) where we could draw $160 USD and directly deposit it to the consular account. Got some passport photos one block from the bank and returned to the consulate. Returned at 3pm and boom, ready for Paraguay. Very safe, quiet neighborhood streets all around, we parked one night with no problems and are now on the road.

name: Next to the road, but quiet
description: We just spend one night here to go to the death road next day. It was quiet, hidden from the street and a nice view. No facilities and also no flat ground, but good for one night, after leaving LaPaz, or also before entering LaPaz.

name: Quiet night behind the village
description: Very nice spot between uyuni and potosi. Big flat area, far away from the main road, some traffic on the side road.

name: Police check point
description: Checked our driver's licence and our tax ticket for the maintenance of the roads (paid at the frontier crossing).

name: Near park
description: Beside a park. A lot of traffic. Road wide enough to park our motorhome. Banos.

name: Aquatic center
description: Complex with cabanas, children playground, swimming pools with waterslides, restrooms, showers, cloakrooms and a little food stand. 4 Bs/adult, 3Bs/child from 4 to 10, free under 4 years.

name: Auto parts and accessories
description: A lot of shops along this part of road. These co-ordinates are the end of shops when you come from the north.

name: Lavanderia Janus
description: 12Bs/kg. Same day service. 8.30am to 8.30pm. There is another lavanderia on the other side of the road.

name: Roadside
description: We stopped here after trying to stay at a car park ("calle Lanza parking lot" but a detour put us in trouble in tiny steep roads) and the fuel station (where park is no longer possible) without success. This place is near the center, flat, and the road is wide enough. Quiet from 10.30 pm to 6.30/7 am. Noisy before and after (traffic and people). We spent 2 nights here, nobody bothers you. It's in front of a school.

name: balneario acuario
description: aquatic center, water slide, baby pool, children's pool, restaurant, children's games, parilla (50 bs).  entry for 2 adults and 2 children under 5 years 30 bs. sauna  (10 bs / pp)

name: Animal shelter Jacha Inti
description: Shelter for injured or abandonned animals. Hold by a swiss couple. 20 Bs/adult and 10 Bs/child. You can see toucan, horses, parrots, monkeys... Playground for children.

name: Tierra Libre restaurant
description: Good restaurant. Good pasta, tapas, flowing "au chocolat"... We didn't try meat or fish. Very pleasant courtyard. Credit card accepted.

name: Lavanderia de ropa
description: Never in her shop. You have to wait until she comes back or try to call her ! 10 Bs/kg. Same day service. Clean but not well folded.

name: Street Parking
description: In the shade in the morning. Quiet. Very little traffic. Good night.

name: Veterinaria Safari
description: They were able to do serological rabies test mandatory to return en Francia and Europe. 1250 Bs for blood sampling + 87 US$ for mailing in a agreed laboratory in Germany + 43€ for the German laboratory.

name: Plaza
description: Plaza quite austere because almost without greenery, but beautiful. Very quiet. Friendly tradespeople. Pretty church. Low signal wifi.

name: Hacienda 7 Cascadas
description:
What a wonderful place. It's an old Hacienda set at the side of a river less than 30 minutes drive from Sucre.
It's not officially a campsite, rather a place with rooms to rent. Bol180 for a matrimonial with private bath, Bol50 per person in skated rooms. I asked about camping in an rv and she said that's fine. Large, flat, grass area just outside the walls. No services outside, but super chilled.
I was given access to the hacienda ground which are just so peaceful. 2 small pools (one was empty when I was here). Volley ball court, football, swings, rope ladders, table football, lots of grass, covered areas to sit or sling a hammock, lots of trees, bird song, bbq areas, even a pizza oven I think. Was given access to a clean bathroom with electric shower, tp, and hand soap. Bol30 for me alone. Bol50 for 2 people. I was the only one here mid week. No WiFi, or cell signal (entel). Just what the doctor ordered.
Reasonable dirt road to get here. The last junction is over a small ditch with a bridge, then down a fairly narrow steepish track and at the end you cross a river but it is a ford so should be fine for most vehicles when the river is low. 
Call on 78660133

name: CLINICA Lausanne
description:
Great international clinic with very professional and bilingual staff.
They work pretty fast (we got our lab test results back in about 1h) and they make sure to follow up on your medical case.
We went there during the Coronavirus outbreak and we felt so lucky to find this place (after 2 unsuccessful visits to Prosalud).
Opened 24h

name: "Alojamiento" Hospedaje, Huarina
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no accommodation until Huatajata (68-70 km). This had several expensive tourist hotels ($50 - $90) which I avoided. Hotel Titicaca at 75.9 km was similar. It was nearly empty but the guy would not drop the price below the standard 280 BOB (about $41). I continued on to Huarina and decided to stay at its only hospedaje (81.3 km). I stayed here for 1 night. Although basic, it had a hot shower in the bathroom next door to my room. This was spacious. As no sheets were provided I decided to pitch my tent above a mattress and pillow which I had first placed on the floor. (This was to keep out bedbugs). I slept fine in my sleeping bag.

This was a worthwhile if basic place to stay. Nice family. Pros: Very good value for 25 BOB ($3.50), plus 5 BOB for large table and chair. Large room 1 floor up with 2 bunk beds and 1 plain bed. OK lighting, 220V outlet. Space to pitch my tent. Shared bathroom next door. On-demand hot shower, sink, TP, soap, mirror. Bike stayed in courtyard. Cute 5 yr old Alice. (She brightened my day). Cons: no sheets, only blankets, so I pitched my tent and slept in my sleeping bag. (I had a good night). No towel.

For more details see Day 140 of my blog.

name: Death Road Wild Camp 1km SE of paved Hiway F3
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride I saw no formal accommodation after departing El Alto, although there must have been places between 11.2 and 23 km. One could camp for free at La Cumbre (36.3 km), but it apparently dropped to -10C at night. At Pongo (51.2 km) one could apparently also camp for free, at the church several km off-route down in the valley. Thereafter there was only wild camping. I found a flat area to camp 1 km down the Death Road. Tomorrow I discovered one could camp for free (donation) at the village of Chuspipata 1 km further down the Death Road, and at several other locations lower down. All had water.

Today I camped at 68.8 km. (Turnoff from paved F3 was at S16.28750 W67.83061, but there was apparently a smoother access road about 1 km further E on the pavement). I hid my tent behind piles of gravel. It was not visible from the road. No water. This Wild Camp was OK, although lower down on the Death Road were better options. Pros: Ground was flat and smooth enough. My tent was not visible from the road. It was very peaceful, with no traffic noise from the paved hiway. There was some view of the mountains. My site was only 50 m from the Death Road but traffic was very light so no problem. Cons: no water.

For more details see Day 144 and 145 of my blog.

name: Albergue Yolosa
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. Today there were several places to camp on the Death Road. Camping was free except at the end, at Albergue Yolosa, where it cost 10 BOB ($1.50) pp. In the village at 1.0 km was a large open space for camping, with bathroom and water faucet. One had to walk 20 m for views. At 3.9 km was a clearing with space for several tents (photo). No water. Good views. At 20.8 km (Mono Zipline) cyclists could camp under cover in the outdoor seating area (photo). This place had bathrooms and water. Good views.

I stayed at Albergue Yolosa for 1 night. This hotel was relatively new and was a community-owned project. Clearly they were still learning how to run a hotel. Price for my ensuite matrimonial room was 70 BOB ($10) or nearly 2x that of my room in Coroico, yet it was of inferior value. This room had space for my bike. (There were tiny rooms for 40 BOB).  I felt it worthwhile to help the community. The standard may improve once more people come and stay. The alternatives were expensive accommodation at Senda Verde and at one other upscale hotel up the river from Yolosa. (This I did not visit. I was told about it by a villager).

Pros: large pleasant courtyard with table and seating. Ensuite. Large plastic table and plastic chair (upon request). At 70 BOB it was the cheapest accommodation option in Yolosa. One could camp for 10 BOB pp. Cons: no TP, towel or soap. On-demand hot shower suffered from intermittent water flow so one had to turn in nearly full on for the heating element to work. The temperature was then too low to be pleasant. Instead I boiled a liter of water and used this to wash myself. Bed sagged in the middle and was a bit short, such that my feet pressed against the end. (I am 5 ft 11"). Lighting was rather dim. No internet. 220V socket was worn so my 220 V kettle’s plug would not make contact unless held in place.

 For more details see Day 145 of my blog.

name: Mud Hut 7.6 km SE of Charapaxi
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride there were no hotels. One could camp for free in Charapaxi (9.7 km; no bathroom) and also in the covered cancha at 13.0 km. There I did not ask about a bathroom but it was on the edge of town near bushes.

Later on, at 17.4 km (1 km past high point) I found an abandoned mud hut with metal roof, door and 4 walls. 2.2 x 4.0 m inside. Space for one 2-person tent, 2 bikes & loose bags.  I pitched my tent inside. The hut provided protection from the wind and was hidden from the F25. Comfortable and peaceful, with worthwhile views. Recommended. 

Water: none near the hut. Natural surface water was common on the ascent but did not look potable until higher up e.g. at 10.5 km. Best to bring 4 liters pp from Charapaxi, to last until the Village of Sita 3.5 km into the next day.

For more details see Day 158 of my blog.

name: Pongo Bus Shelter
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride I saw no formal accommodation. At my destination, Pongo, I was given permission by a friendly lady, Lucy to camp in the open soccer field 30 m below her tienda (no bathrooms but lots of bushes), or inside the covered bus shelter next to her tienda. I chose the latter, as it was threatening rain. The shelter had a roof and 4 walls, with an open doorway. It was 2 x 3 m inside. It was large enough of my 2-person tent and two bikes. Log seat on long side.

This was a good camp spot. Pros: I had shelter from the wind and rain, and a seat inside on a log. I could lock my rear wheel to a pole inside the hut. I found a square 0.7 m long brick chimney outside, which I rolled inside and used as a table for my laptop. There was a secluded wooded area on the north side for a potty hole. There was  a water faucet on N. side of school, 10m from Lucy's tienda. See photo. There were 2 small tiendas nearby (bread, UHT milk, junk food). Cons: it was fairly busy from early morning to late evening. Many buses and trucks stopped by. No bathrooms.

name: Mud Hut in Huañacota
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride from Pongo, there were a few possible wild camps en route. In Huañacota, I had intended camping in an abandoned mud hut with 4 walls but no roof. However, I happened to stop at a water faucet at the first new house on the left, and the owner Porfirio came out to chat. He said I could camp inside his old mud hut opposite. This had 4 walls, a roof and a door. It was a much better and warmer camp spot than my intended one (above), especially after Porfirio had rigged me up with a makeshift table and chair. By 17h00 it had begun to snow. I was so glad to be under a roof!

This was a good camp spot. Pros: roof, 4 walls and a door provided protection against the snow and a warmer overnight. Enough space for my 2-person tent and 2 bikes. Water faucet opposite. Good stock area out back, with reasonable privacy, for potty holes. Porfirio rigged me up with a chair and a makeshift table. Cons: The doorway was 0.5 m below the street drain which made it tricky to carry my bike in and out. Easier with 2 persons and no panniers.
Note: to ask permission to camp here. Knock on Porfirio’s new home which was across the road. See photos.

For more details see Day 165 of my blog.

name: Town Hall, Chuquichambi
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no hotels. At 48.3 km was a possible covered camp site for many tents. At my destination (63.2 km), I met the mayor Dmitry who offered to let me camp in the Town Hall. He let me use a  Building was on the east side of the plaza and was diagonally opposite a fairly well-stocked tienda (bread, bananas, tomato, carrots, eggs, misc.). The plaza had comfortable seating. Friendly folk in the village.

This was an excellent place to camp. Pros: modern room in Town Hall, next to pleasant plaza with bench seating. Small (2m x 3m) but adequate room with 220V outlet and good lighting. Optional mattress available. Bathroom, washbasin and flush toilet 5 m away. Upon request the mayor loaned me a 1 m x 0.8 m steel desk + plastic chair. Room was lockable from inside. Good lighting and 220V outlet. Space for my bike (two at a squeeze) and my 2-person tent. Good value at 20 BOB ($3) which I offered and they accepted. Cons: room was a little small but OK. No shower.

name: Casa de Christobal, Choquecota
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride,  I saw no accommodation. I stopped in Choquecota to have a break. Originally I had planned to continue to Turco, 45 km away. Realizing that the poor road surface made it unlikely I would reach there before dark, I asked if I could camp in Choquecota somewhere indoors. (The village had no hotel). Christobal offered a room in his home, which I gladly accepted. Note: the Municipal Building was being remodeled and they said it too would offer camping in the future. Ask folk in the plaza.

This worked out OK and was much better than camping outside where I estimate it reached -5C. I was grateful to Christobal for inviting me to camp inside his main room. Pros: space for my tent, gear and bike (2 bikes possible). Table and chair for updating my blog. Lighting and 220V outlet for electronics and boiling water. Water faucet outside. Cons: the only bathrooms were 300-400 m away, out in the cold (they had 3 small walls but no roof). Water faucets were frozen until mid-morning.

name: Alojamiento Antonio, Cosapa
description:
Cosapa had only one hotel, the Alojamiento Cosapa. It was overpriced but was preferable to camping in the rain. I was given a med size room, rather messy and dirty, with a king bed and desk. Messy shared bathroom. Cold shower. All on ground floor. Bike stayed inside my room. 50 BOB ($7.50). Power was off all afternoon, evening and the next morning.

This hotel was overpriced and I would not stay here again. Pros: any port in a storm. Better than camping in the rain. Bed was comfortable and warm. Cons: Walking to the bathroom was hazardous for all the junk lying around. Bathroom and bedroom were messy and far from clean. Cold shower. Desk was awkward to use as knees did not fit under it. Room was worth 25 BOB, not 50. Note: Tomorrow, at the junction with hiway F4 (9 km +100 m from Cosapa), I stopped to check out Alojamiento Nevada Sajama. Rooms were clean, modern and spacious (room for 2 bikes inside), with a shared hot shower and 3 beds, for only 20 BOB pp. Next door was a pleasant restaurant and a store. Had I known about this place, I would have cycled the extra hour in the rain to stay here.

name: Primary school classroom, Mogachi.
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no accommodation. There was none in Chachacomani or Mogachi. The former had camping inside a church building but no public bathrooms. Mogachi had a primary school and I was allowed to sleep in the sole classroom. Water faucet and pit toilet were outside. Comfortable camping.

Ask for the principal Euforia or for the teacher Betsa. Kind folk both. Juan at the tienda near the entrance to town can help locate them. The classroom was warmer than outside and I had tables and chairs. No power as it was off owing to the high winds of yesterday.

name: Alojamiento Doña Marta, Julo.
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no accommodation until Julo. Marta ran a small alojamiento. On site she ran a tienda with mandarinas & platanos, peanuts, eggs, fresh bread baked by Marta 18h00 daily. I had a large room, 2 soft beds, 3 pillows, table & chair (upon request), storage shelf, coat rack, 220V outlet. Shared bathroom with towels, soap, TP, on-demand hot shower. 50 BOB (US$7). She had 5 rooms. Bike stayed outside my door. Doña Marta also baked bread. 

I enjoyed my stay here. Pros: spacious room, 2 beds, table and chair, 220V, hot shower. Cons: no top sheet (but I was OK with just the blankets).

name: Doña Sylvia’s empty room, Negrillos
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no alojamiento. Negrillos had none. Dona Sylvia ran a small restaurant. She let me camp in her spare room next door. A kind lady. This had 220V outlet and lighting. Negrillos had fast 4G internet which I used with my SIM card.

This was a good campsite. Pros: It was warm enough inside the room, which had a table, lighting and a 220V outlet. Water faucet outside. Bathroom in primary school 50 m away, which needed flushing with a bucket from Sylvia. Cons: room was under construction, and floor was messy. Not sure for how long this room would be available for camping. (Sylvia said it was to be a new bedroom for her family). Ask Sylvia anyway. She was a good source of information and was helpful. Note: she served me dinner last night and refused payment. Today I left her 30 BOB ($4.50) for the use of her room + electricity plus the dinner.

name: Wild Camp 55 km S. of Coipasa Village
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, I saw no accommodation. In village of Villa Victoria, I was told that cyclists could camp inside the classrooms. I stopped earlier and wild camped.

Today I wild camped at 55.5 km. The WC was 150 m S. of the gravel road to LLica, a few km west of Tres Cruces. I stayed here for 1 night.  I much enjoyed my overnight here. It was scenic and peaceful. The sunrise was glorious. The downside was camping in the sand, which gets into everything. I thought it one of my best WCs in Bolivia.

Water: I carried 4.5 liters today from Coipasa, which lasted until tomorrow morning, when I refilled in the Village of Villa Victoria. This had a well-stocked tienda.

For more details see Day 185 of my blog. http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/doc/SAm19tim
---------------------

name: Wild Camp 1 km W of Laguna Cañapa
description:
I was on a solo bike tour from Ecuador to Ushuaia. On today’s ride, there was free camping at the Mirador (16.1 km, S21.35908 W68.02614). I saw no other official camp area, but the wild country after 21.6 km offered many places. I had intended continuing to Laguna Hedionda, but when I arrived at Laguna Cañapa I was so enchanted with the beauty of the place that I decided to wild camp there. No camping was allowed near the Laguna. The local guard said I could camp about 1 km to the west, in front of a ridge. There was a smooth sandy space for 1 tent, which was flat enough. This faced E with good views so it would catch the early morning sun (which it did, at 07h10 the next day). No charge to camp.

Today I wild camped at 36.9 km. Turnoff from the laguna's main gravel road was at about 36.4 km onto gravel track up a slope on right. I stayed here for 1 night.  

I much enjoyed this wild camp. Pros: I had it all to myself. I awoke to the soft light over the mountaintops and the Laguna. I felt completely at peace with the world in this scenic place. Cons: ground was a little sloping.

Water: The Mirador (16.1 km) had meals, drinks and water for sale, at high prices. I stopped here for a 2-course vegetarian lunch (35 BOB). Drinks were extra. Thereafter I saw no services. Today I saw no potable surface water. One could ask jeeps for water, which I did once. Later another offered me water which I accepted. Guests also gave me snacks and some fruit.

For more details see Day 195 of my blog. http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/doc/SAm19tim

name: waltico's Castillo
description: beautiful spot in a gated community. Between El Alto and La Paz. Amazing view of the mountains surrounding La Paz.

name: Parking  Constantino Morales
description: Good guarded parking if you need to go downtown

name: La Orilla
description: Very good and tasty and Fresh food. Nice owner. Recommended. Different prices from 28 bols for a Burgers to 58 for other meals.

name: Parking for big rigs
description: 3 pesos for on hour ... secured. Lot of place

name: Parking to stay a few hours
description: 20 bols for the night ... We only stood 5 h a day. Nice woman closed and secured.

name: Comedor Rodriguez
description:
Very tipical market, here you can eat as the local people. Very cheap, 10/15bs for soup and main course.
It's VERY TIPICAL, hot and dirty :)

name: Gas Station Urkupina
description: Great service, local price, good diesel, friendly staff.

name: Hotel Balneario Villa Rosita
description: Hotel 3*, a lot of parking for campers, good meals

name: Hotel Balneario Villa Rosita
description: Hotel 3*, a lot of parking for campers, good meals

name: Hotel Mitru
description:
One of the best, coolest hip hotels in Tupiza. Rooms are spacious, clean, tv, good wifi, restaurant, pool, tours and everything else. The staff and owner are topnotch.
Safe parking onsite. We paid about 20-30us per double room. You should chat to them as they will negotiate a little bit.

name: Bus Pickup point - Dinosaur track park
description:
This is the open bus pick up point to go to the Dinosaur track park. 15bs p/p return, and it is the easiest to get there and back from Sucre.
Absolutely worth the visit. Dino tracks on a vertical wall
Bus leaves 9am and 11am

name: Parque Tropical Manantial
description:
Calm and big place with amenities for camping. The place is situated around one kilometer before the toll coming from Cochabamba. We camped one night at 15 BS per person. Doña Olga is very kind and helpful.

The place has a natural swimming pool from the river going through the property. The water is super clean. There is space for camping, bbq, hikes in the property to reach another natural swimming pool.

name: Hotel Mirador - Camping available
description:
Clean hotel on the right just after the bridge coming from Villa Tunari. Nice, grassy, clean campground with shadow from trees. We paid 30 BS per person to camp. Swimming pool and hamacs. Possibility to cook with your own camping gear.

Hotel limpio a la derecha justo después del puente viniendo de Villa Tunari. Bonito, herboso y limpio camping con sombra de árboles. Pagamos 30 BS por persona para acampar. Piscina y hamacas. Posibilidad de cocinar con su propio equipo de camping.

name: Bosque de los Helechos
description: Entrance of the hikes to visit the Bosque de los Helechos. We had to pay 15 BS per private property that we crossed. It is not possible to go without a guide since the helechos are in private properties. We luckily found a guide directly there for a short tour of 2h. The road is blocked from this point. It is only possible to continue on foot.

name: Parqueo Central (3 Bs / h)
description: Safe parking very central, it’s not easy to find a free parking in the narrow streets of Potosí, we found this place good to visit the Center, 3 Bs per hour.

name: Valle de la Luna Parking
description: Outside the entrance there is a small parking right on the street looking at the valley. We arrived pretty late and we decided to stay here waiting for our laundry to be ready the next day. Few cars during night, we felt really safe.

name: Fast laundry 10b/kg
description: We left our 5 kg of laundry at 5 pm and pick them up the day after at 11am, clean, good smelling and folded! Nice service and really fast. Recommended! 10bob/kg

name: La Mansion Club Campestre
description:
Really cool old hotel with nice courtyard and swimming pool. Mauritiozo is a wonderful host and grill some of the best steaks in Bolivia.
Rooms are basic but clean and well kept.
No wifi currently. The town  is a close 10min walk and there is wifi at the pizza place and coffee shop.
Camping is possible.

name: Hotel Camp Complejo Ecoturístico Madidi
description:
The only proper hotel in this entire area. Proper rooms with good beds, its clean, new and a really nice place to stay when doing this loop.
Owner is Olvar and Sabem super nice people. Send them a watsapp before coming.They also have a restaurant on site, pool.
Price is 180bol for matrimonial and 200 for two bed room. Camping is 50bol or such. 
These are good decent people please don’t pull a typical overland begging bowl stunt and beg for discount. Their pricing is good and food is more that enough for what you pay. 
They are also incredibly friendly and helpful.
Mabel or Olvar +59173048041
Also on Google maps

name: Brown building hotel
description:
Good for a sleep over. Chinese lady is owner quite friendly, 100bol per person shared bath. Not cheap but cleanest of the lot in town. Parking is 20m away and 5bol per moto.
There is plaza wifi for 2hr reachable from inside the hotel. Hotel has no wifi.
Ring door bell or just hammer hard and long on the door for them to hear you.

name: Fuel from cans
description: Small shop sell fuel from cans for around 7bol per litre. Not sure about diesel but there are diesel cars running around so I sure diesel will be available.

name: Cafe Madidi
description:
Locally brewed and roasted coffee. Good stuff. The place will looks like it is closed but they are open 7 days a week from 8am to 7pm.
It is a very nice place to drink some really good coffee.

name: Inca brain
description:
Locals call this the Brain of Inca Cerebo Inca. The rock looks a bit like an open brain and they hold ceremonies here.
The road is a bit rough going up and caution should be taken.
The views from there are quite spectacular

name: Ritzi
description:
Its just a hotel at the plaza, good just for a night stay. Park bikes in the courtyard and its all quite safe.
Cars can park in the street no problem. 180 for a double room shared bathroom. The place is run down and typical mining village quality but good for a nights stay

name: Spot with a view
description: This spot is on the “road”, but with a lot of space and a nice view of the green surrounding forest. Very few cars passed by. You are alone in the forest, we took good water from the river/waterfall 1km down the road, where the pool is. Nice and quiet place to stay in the middle of nowhere.

name: Wild camp
description: Along this small unpaved road there are some spots where you can spend a quiet night. Not far from the main road and safe.

name: Trutcha restaurant
description: Great fish dishes and a great view. The owner is a super friendly guy and welcoming to foreigners. Its worth the stop

name: Wild camp with view
description: You take a secondary road hidden from the main road, and you have a flat area to camp with a nice view, not stunning, but good, safe and quiet for a night, and you don’t have to go down to the riverbed.

name: Hotel Wara
description:
Clean and comfortable place. There is a secured parking for your car. Breakfast is simple but does the job. We paid 100 BS per person for a private room with private bathroom and hot shower.

We came to the hotel to relax and enjoy the swimming pool. Unfortunately, the swimming pool was reserved the afternoons from 2pm to 6pm for swimming lessons... We were not told when we booked. Ask before booking!

-----

Un lugar limpio y cómodo. Hay un parqueo seguro para su coche. El desayuno es simple pero es okay. Pagamos 100 BS por persona por noche en una habitación privada con baño privado y agua caliente.

Vinimos al hotel para relajarnos y disfrutar de la piscina. Desafortunadamente, la piscina estaba reservada por las tardes de 2 a 6 pm para clases de natación... No se nos informó cuando reservamos. ¡Pregunte antes de reservar!

name: Villa Abecia alternative
description: I came here after being parked at the pozos (marked separately). It was quiet there but right under the mountain. It began to rain so i bugged out to avoid rock falls there. This place is a huge, flat area, just outside the village by the sports area, and above the (incredible looking) football field. Large, flat, quiet, outside the village. 2 minutes from the pozos. Better entel signal. No services

name: Taipiplaya and Rincón del Tigre
description: It is not really well indicated, but roughly at kilometre 60 from Coroico, turn to the right to go to Taipiplaya and Rincón del Tigre.

name: Potosi / Tupiza break
description: I didn't camp here but pulled off for a break between Tupiza and Potosi to stretch my legs and make a coffee. Track starts before the guard rail on the highway to the left heading north. I only followed it 500m it so but its a decent flat track and seems a good place to camp for the night. Flat plateau with lots of trees. Electricity lines head somewhere further down, so there must be civilization. Worth checking out and updating for anyone who stops here to camp.

name: Quiet one nighter
description: This is a good one nighter between Sucre and Camargo, just before Cachi springs. About 4km from the turn off. There's a track off to the right where you can also stop. This is on the left (heading south), before the double hairpin. Looks like a place where people quarry sand or something. Big, flat area. Various levels to choose from. You'll probably be visible from the road to traffic heading south, but when night falls, it was fine, and not much road noise inside the van. Very tranquil.

name: Shower in hostel
description: This hostel let you have a shower for 10bob per person. They have a patio with two bathrooms and showers that you can use and take your time.

name: crismo copy
description:
Great place to print and bind at super nice unbeatable prices
We printed and bound our daughters' school year. Super fast! 

Super endroit pour impression et relier à des prix imbattables super sympa
On a imprimé et relié l année scolaire de nos filles. Super rapide !

name: Puente Padilla
description:
Large, flat, grassy area just by the bridge. Turn off is at the Padilla end of the bridge. Seems to be used by people to have bbqs but fairly clean. Some road noise in the day but not a busy road.
Good for a night and a few day hours in the sun.

name: San Isidro
description: nice lake with flat areas for parking, there's a playground for kids. in theory there's toilets and other services but everything is out of service. is a great place for spend the night far from the busy highway. Early in the morning somebody came to charge 30 bs for the car.

name: soccer field
description: súper clean and flat soccer field, nobody care about us sleeping here, we went first to the beach but is trashy, so we decided move to the soccer field. Maybe this place is very muddy when rains, take care.

name: Garden
description:
Moderator Note: Please be aware that this is apparently private property. It may not be available on a regular basis.

Nice, green and open area. View is great. Works for every size, very friendly owners. 
Wild camping in general is not recommended in this area due to the environment and a lot of criminal activity. 
We asked the owner and she let us stay on their ground.

name: San Antonio de Lipez
description:
Pulled in after dark. Asked if there was an hospedaje and we were directed to one at the edge of town. There was a room with 5 beds, a kitchen, dining room, and normal toilets.

Paid 50$B per person.

name: Cercanías a Betanzos
description: Place to spend the night. It is cold. Close to the river. Sometimes it is not clean. --- Lugar para pasar la noche.  Es frío. Cerca al río. Aveces no esta limpió.

name: Alojamiento  de la Federación de trabajadores de la educación
description:
An inexpensive place 30 to 40 Bolivians.  Rooms in a precarious state, sometimes dirty. --- Un lugar económico 30 A 40 bolivianos.
Habitaciones en un estado precario, aveces sucias.

name: Ruta Nacional 5
description:
Large flat area off the main route. Used to be a dump for landslide rubble I think, but huge area. 
Very quiet, day and night. 

Large enough to get 150m away from the road, very little traffic at night.

No facilities. 

Great views.

name: Flat area
description: flat area with beautiful view to the salar and llamas,  very close to the town of Coqueza, silent and peaceful.

name: Hacienda Quespi Llajta
description: New Hacienda opened in April 2021. 4 rooms with various number of beds. Also offer camping. We were the only people here and the first they had coming in a camper van. We could park right in front and run a cable for electricity. Great shared kitchen, living room with open fire. Swimming pool and BBQ area with pizza oven. Nicely done out. We paid 50bs pppn to sleep in our van and use the facilities which included breakfast. We also arranged lunch and dinner in advance. Just arrived so will comment on that soon. So far, so great though.

name: Dry Poopo lake
description: One of the most amazing locations during our trip in Bolivia. 20 years ago this point was under 6 mts of water, today it is a dry-white, flat surface thanks to the global warming and big mines from the area. We drove around first and saw many wild animal like ostriches, llamas, foxes and eagles. Take care with the surface: it could be tricky and you can get stuck in the mud. Nobody around to rescue you. it's June and we got -12 degrees during the night, the stars were simply amazing and the silence supreme!!

name: Pariguaya
description: super nice green flat area near to Pariguaya town, great view to the mountains, nice people and safe, good place for spend 2 or 3 days, kids love it.

name: flat and impressive view
description: amazing view from here, we saw a couple of condors flying around for hours, a little bit windy but the incredible view to the mountains.

name: Limoncito main square
description: flat and quiet place close to the Highway, good for spend a night during the road to Sucre.

name: Alojamiento Charazani
description:
Rooms up to 5 beds. No shower. No WiFi dd. Electrical outlets. Good blankets. No kitchen. Price 20 bowls pp.
---
Chambres jusqu'à 5 lits. Pas de douche. Pas dd WiFi. Prises électriques. Bonnes couvertures. Pas de cuisine. 
Prix 20 bols pp.

name: Residencial MI Tierra
description:
75 Bols pp. Expensive for the service. Shared electric hot showers. No kitchen. Housekeeping not done daily in the common areas. Very friendly owners.
---
75 bols pp. Cher pour la prestation. Douches chaude électrique partagées. Pas de cuisine. Ménage non fait quotidiennement dans les parties communes. Propriétaires très sympathiques.

name: Centre de salud
description:
New health center. Do not rely on old signs. It is on the hill opposite the old one. Possibility to buy drugs and medical supplies.
---
Nouveau centre de santé. Ne pas se fier aux anciens panneaux. Il se trouve sur la colline opposé à l'ancien.
Possibilité d'acheter des médicaments et fournitures médicales.

name: Albiergue. Casa Verde
description:
2 large dormitories with 6 single beds. Gas cooker. Shared shower and WC, no electricity during our visit. A chimney. Large living room and dining room. Official price 40 bols pp. To open it, find the park warden. In the street of lagunillas which goes down towards charazani, one of the first tin gates on the left.
---
2 grands dortoirs de 6 lits individuels. Cuisine au gaz. Douche et WC communs, pas d'électricité lors de notre passage. Une cheminée. Grand salon et salle à manger. 
Prix officiel 40 bols pp. 
Pour l'ouvrir, trouver le gardien du parc. Dans la rue de lagunillas qui redescend vers charazani, un des premiers portails en tôle sur la gauche.

name: Tienda
description:
Grocery store with basic products: pasta, rice, potatoes, squash ... But also candle, wood for the fireplace on request. Very nice.
---
Épicerie avec produits de base : pâtes, riz, patates, courge... Mais aussi bougie, bois pour la cheminée sur demande.
Très sympa.

name: cabanas comunitarios
description:
Several small houses with single beds. Ours had 6. Electric shower, electricity, running water. A kitchen but not enough to cook. Very calm, not cold. The keys are to be collected at the village tienda. 40 bols per bed.
---
Plusieurs maisonnettes avec des lits simples. La notre en avait 6. Douche électrique, électricité, eau courante. Une cuisine mais pas de quoi cuisiner. Très calme, pas froid. 

Les clefs sont à récupérer à la tienda du village.

40 bols par lit.

name: Tienda
description:
Very small stock when we were there. Pasta, soda, cigarettes, lollipops, cookie. Possibility to eat on site for 10 bols the plate. For us it was trigo soup, very good.
---
Tout petit stock quand nous y étions. Pates, soda, cigarettes, sucettes, biscuit. Possibilité de manger sur place pour 10 bols l'assiette. Pour nous c'était soupe de trigo, très bon.

name: fontaine sous le tank d'eau
description:
A fountain with a tap, possibility of putting a garden hose on it.
---
Une fontaine avec un robinet, possibilité de mettre un tuyau d'arrosage dessus.

name: robinet dans le village de mineurs
description:
A free access tap. Located in the village of mine workers.
---
Un robinet en accès libre. Situé dans le village des travailleurs de la mine.

name: gasoline (and bread soon)
description:
We asked for a place to buy gas all over the main street. We were shown green, blue, orange gates ... Until we got here where he sold us gasoline for 6 bols / liter. A house under construction which will be a future bakery.
---
Nous avons demandé un endroit pour acheter de l'essence dans tout la rue principale. On nous a indiqué des portails verts, bleues, oranges... Jusqu'à arriver ici où il nous a vendu de l'essence pour 6 bols/litre. Une maison en construction qui sera une future boulangerie.

name: Cut road
description:
At this crossroads, take the left road coming from quetene grande. This road is cut. First by 2 small mounds that you will cross with a smile on your face, then by a huge impassable 100 meters from the village. Impossible to circumvent. Facebook: Together Elsewhere Otherwise Uyuni and Sud Lipiez in 4x4 rental with autonomy and family (among other adventures)
---
A ce croisement, prendre la route de gauche en venant de quetene grande.

Cette route est coupée. D'abord par 2 petits monticules que vous franchirez le sourire aux lèvres, puis par un énorme infranchissable à 100 mètres du village. Impossible à contourner.
Facebook : Ensemble Ailleurs Autrement
Uyuni et Sud Lipiez en 4x4 de location en autonomie et en famille (entre autres aventures)

name: Speed bump
description:
Many vehicles are scraping on this speed bump. Our jimny 4x4 did not pass. A bypass is possible inside the village.
---
Beaucoup de véhicules raclent sur ce dos d'âne. Notre 4x4 jimny n'est pas passé. Un contournement est possible à l'intérieur du village.

name: Marco Polo Tours-Guide en français
description:
New location for Willy's agency. A very good guide who offers tours of the mines, but also other tours. A miner who loves his mines, and who shares it. A safe visit, which shows the technical, cultural and societal aspect of the Potosi mountain. Visit in the morning as in the afternoon. My miners work mainly from Monday morning to Saturday morning, from the age of 15 for those who have questions. Price of the visit 70 bowls per adult, 60 for children, plus 30 bowls of gifts bought at the market to distribute to the minors encountered. A superb visit.
---
Nouvel emplacement pour l'agence de Willy. Un très bon guide qui propose la visite des mines, mais aussi d'autres tours. Un mineur qui aime ses mines, et qui le fait partager. Une visite en sécurité, qui montre l'aspect technique, culturelle et societale de la montagne de Potosi. Visite le matin comme l'après midi. Mes mineurs travaillent principalement du lundi matin au samedi matin, à partir de 15 ans pour ceux qui s'interrogent.
Prix de la visite 70 bols par adulte, 60 pour les enfants, plus 30 bols de cadeaux achetés au marché à distribuer aux mineurs rencontrés. Une superbe visite.

name: Macanica "Ruben"
description:
Because of the hole on the road we had a problem with the Van. The boss is kindly came to fix. Pay attention to look at what they do and do not go for a tour while waiting. Set the price before the work begins.
.....
A cause des trou sur la route nous avons eu un problème à la direction du van, le patron est gentiment venu réparer. Faite attention de bien regarder ce qu'ils font et de ne pas aller faire un tour en attendant, et fixé le prix avant qu'il commence à travailler.

name: Churrascaria
description:
A super good churrascaria, for 60bol you have a super good piece of fillet. They take you directly to a small barbecue to continue to grill your meat as you wish, or to heat it up.  local and natural fruit juice, super nice staff and free wifi!  We are delighted!

une super bonne churrascaria, pour 60bol vous avez une super bonne pièce de filet que l'on vous emmène directement sur un petit barbecue pour continuer à griller votre viande comme vous le souhaitez, ou la faire réchauffer. jus de fruit local et naturel, personnel super sympa et free wifi! au top on c'est régalé !

name: Free Wi-Fi in the street
description: Free Wi-Fi in the street. I don't know where it comes from, but it works.

name: HM Hôtel
description:
I do not know the price of the rooms but I came here to ask for a shower. 15BB per person with the towels provided as well as shampoo and soap, the woman of the very nice welcome. Hot water. The showers at the train station no longer exists because the station is closed.

Je ne connais pas le prix des chambres mais je suis venu ici pour demander pour une douche. 15bb par personne avec les serviettes fournies ainsi que le shampoing et le savon, la femme de l'accueil très gentille. Eau chaude. Les douches a la station de train n'existe plus car la station est fermé.

name: La Torre
description:
the woman was super nice and there are a lot of different things to eat her pleasurable!  all kinds of Italian pasta with tomato, bolognese and roquefort sauces, even lasagna and vegetarian pasta.  The pizzas on our neighbors' tables also look very good!  cocktail, natural juice, beer, and fruit smoothie with very affordable prices!  (40bb lasagna, 35bb mozzarella filled ravioli with cream sauce, 10bb fruit smoothie, 8bb natural juice per glass) I recommend!
---
la femme était super sympa et il y a beaucoup de chose différentes a manger sa fais plaisir! toute sortes de pâtes italiennes avec sauces tomates, bolognaise, roquefort, même des lasagnes ainsi que des pâtes végétarienne. Les pizza sur la table de nos voisins avez l'air aussi très bonnes! cocktail, jus naturel, bière, et frappé au fruit  avec des prix très abordable ! (lasagne 40bb, raviolis fourré mozzarella 35bb avec sauce à la crème, frappé au fruit 10bb, jus naturel 8bb le verre) je recommande !

name: Tupiza Tour
description:
This agency is great. We have been around 4 days and 3 nights in southern Lipez and Uyuni Salar. The guides are adorable, the stoves are great and cuisine is good.  On the last day we slept in a salt hotel all for 1050bb per person if you are 5 people. They have found people who wanted to work with us so that we can pay less. They are adorable and really caring. I recommend this agency!
.....
cette agence est super. nous avons fais un tour de 4 jours et 3 nuits dans le sud de Lipez et le salar d'Uyuni. Les guides sont adorables, les cuisinières sont super et cuisine bien et le dernier jour nous avons dormis dans un hôtel de sel le tout pour 1050bb par personne si vous êtes 5. ils ont on trouvé des gens qui voulais le faire avec nous pour que l'on puisse payer moin. ils sont adorables et vraiment attentionné. je vous recommande cette agence !

name: Close to the bridge
description: Just After the bridge from Tarija, turn left and go down. We spent one night here, not too much traffic on the bridge, safe.  close to the river and in front of the "canyon". Nice view, nice spot. Van ok, 4WD ok, but not Big rig suitable

name: Peace place
description:
Leaving the city Palos Blancos, we turned right in the second path that starts with sand (indicated on maps.me) we drove a little before putting us under a tree, the atmosphere is really quiet, the feet in the sand (there is not much Hide from the road without any passage. We were safe, I love the place !! ok for the van and 4wd but not for big rig ..
---
En sortant de la ville Palos Blancos, nous avons tournés a droite dans le deuxième chemin qui commence par du sable (indiqué sur maps.me) nous avons conduit un peu avant de nous mettre sous un arbre, l'atmosphère est vraiment tranquille, les pieds dans le sable (il n'y en a pas beaucoup pour ne pas rester coincé avec le van) avec des cactus et au milieu de la végétation. Cacher de la route sans aucun passage. nous étions en sécurité, j'ai adorer l'endroit!! ok pour les van et les 4WD mais pas pour les Big rig..

name: Balneario Caigwa
description:
This place is really cool. There are two large pool with slides and great place where this rest under the trees in the shade. The owner speaks English and is super nice! He pretends Ruben, he studied in the US so he speaks great English. Following Covid he lost a lot of money and do a lot of promotion for people arriving, we got typical cocktails for our coming. 15bb for two people it's really great! I recommend this place!

Cet endroit est vraiment cool. il y a deux grandes piscine avec des toboggans et de grand endroit où ce reposer sous les arbres a l'ombre. Le propriétaire parle anglais et est super gentil! il s'apelle Ruben, il a étudié aux USA donc il parle super bien anglais. suite au covid il a perdu beaucoup d'argent et fais beaucoup de promotion pour les gens arrivant, nous avons obtenu des cocktails typique gratuitement pour notre venu. 15bb pour deux personnes c'est vraiment super! je recommande beaucoup cet endroit !

name: Viluyo
description: Plenty of clean fresh water to refill your tanks. It belongs to the community, so therefore please ask in advance before loading.

name: Sports center parking lot in Vila Vila
description:
Parking lot next to a sports center, close to the entrance of the city.
Visible from the road but far enough to be quiet at night.
Safe place.

name: Shop sells  Gasolina
description:
Green house in Alota's main avenue (see picture). 
Ring the bell - as usual here. A nice lady offered us 7 Bos / liter of Gasolina. We had 25 liters.

name: Bodega and Camping Valle d'Vino
description:
After doing a fine wine tasting there, we realized that the Bodega is also working as a camping. As we enjoyed the place as well as the area, we thus decided to stay for one night.
Space for 2 to 3 overlanders and tents. Not completely flat but OK. 
Toilets, hot showers, and a very nice view on the wineyard for 60 bols for 2 persons.

name: Cristales Joyas de Sal
description: Nice hotel. Still under construction-not presently, so quiet- has one floor operational. Really well furnished. Sparkling clean, good breakfast, secure parking for motorcycles and maybe 2-3 cars. Owner agreed to keep our travel stuff for couple of days while we go around light. Our huge room was 56$.

name: Babbling brook nr old shepherd hut
description: Smaller dirt road up the valley approx 200m off the main road next to river valley crossing. Small flat clear area between the bushes by the river. Good for our small tent and motorcycle, or a car/bike would be fine. Partially visible from main road, but very little traffic, if any! Near old little shepherd hut, but no signs of life. Road carries on up the valley so possibly other spots more tucked away, but we felt happy here. Lots of llama poo so didn’t filter water here. Peaceful scenic place for the night and welcome break after washboard road heading west to east.

name: Alineado y Balancio, tire repair
description:
150 bob alignment
40 bob Balancing for one tire

name: Gasoline for 6 bob/L
description:
White House, knock at the door and the guy has gasolina de sale for 6 bob/L.
No outside sign, the house is next to the school's sport field

name: Super mecánico ! Romero servicio técnico automotriz
description:
Jorge is a young but talented and super friendly mecánico.Able to fix everything, from electronic to hard mecanic
He helped me with the steering rack, I was losing oil and didn't have power steering for the last 300km. Fixed my 12v socket as well. I highly recommend
phone : +59160277162 (but not always fast to answer)
If you tell him that you're travelling he'll make his posible to work fast

name: Large flat area next to road
description: Large flat area next to road, close to Camargo. Accessible by any type of vehicle. Partially hidden from the road. Good to spend the night, but you will hear the traffic.

name: YPFB Gas station
description: Gas station where we have been able to feel our 20L tanks with Gasolina at Bolivian price.

name: Loma de Centella
description: Guest house, camping and recreational area 5 km from Porongo. A place to rest. Pool, cabin, court, two guest rooms. Mandatory reservation at 74655500

name: Kumara
description: Really good family run restaurant. It was full of locals, so must be very good. Some people were even waiting in front of it. Almuerzo was for 10 BOL and we hardly could roll out of the building anymore due to the size. Very nice service - definitely recommendable.

name: Cactus Garden
description: Nice place before the big city starts. Many cactus and some trees to hide. Beautiful view over the valley. You can still hear the busy road though. We found it much better than camping at the river in the nearby city.

name: Beautiful Mirador
description:
We searched for a place to pitch our tent, what is definitely not easy in this area. Finally we found this fantastic place. The dirt road leading to it is not easy, however the first part, right after you have left the main road, was the worst, when we were there. So if you can manage that part, you will be probably able to make it. On motorcycles it wasn't a big deal though.
There was a cow fence right in front of the site. We just opened it to pass and closed it again behind us. In the morning we met one person caring of the cows. No problem, that we camped here.
The view up there is fantastic. The sun stays here very long, since it's not in the valley. It is almost quiet, but you can still hear the main road down in the valley a bit. Unfortunately there's also garbage around, since people seem to camp there/ had made a campfire.

name: Hostal Bolivia
description: Nice and cheap hostel well-situated to reach all necessary places before crossing the border to Argentina. They have a big inner courtyard to sit/relax and park vehicles. Staff is nice and friendly, internet works well, shower is nicely hot. Rooms are ok for the price - don't expect 5-star accommodation and cleanliness. For us, totally fine though. Cheapest double room was 90 BOL with shared bathroom, 120 BOL incl. bathroom. We asked for the cheap room and she gave us an upgraded room for the cheap price.

name: Hospital Ruben Zelaya
description:
It was a bit complicated, to get a PCR Test done in Yacuiba.
At this hospital, you pay a bill of 550BOL and get a receipt and with this one you get the Test in another clinic, from 7-9am only. No bill means, no PCR Test, so you probably need to wait another day.
If you have an accident, this is the public hospital of Yacuiba.

name: Red Municipal de Salud de Yacuiba
description:
In this clinic you can get a PCR Test done. From 7-9 am, you get the result at 2 pm. What is important is, that you need to pay for it in another hospital, in advance, in the Emergency Room, so it's busy! I marked the other hospital too, better go there one day in advance, if you don't want to spend another day in Yacuiba.
People are very friendly so, and gave me a lift to the other hospital in the ambulance car.

name: Serena Hostel Camping
description: This hostel is also a great camping spot with a wonderful view. Toilets, shower, wifi, breakfast, kitchen… 60bob ppn. There’s a lot of info on the hostel spot but I wanted to add it as an established campground ! For tents, I don’t see how they’d take vans or others :/

name: Mecánico de Tarija
description: The young mechanic did a good job. Because it took more than one day for fixing our car, he let us sleep here.

name: Hostal Campíng El Milagro
description: A beautiful and warm family place where you can spend a night. they have two rooms with 4 beds, a small kitchen with a clean bathroom with hot shower. Not expensive and also you can ask for a place for your tent, Macaria is a sweet lady who may cook if you ask and also she can show you how to make bread, and some other local appetizers, Plácido uses to be a guide to see some condors but at this moment he is not offering that service but he can explain how to get there. WhatsApp +59171895324

name: Kellkata
description: really surprising spot with archeological sites, we discovered "petroglifos" next to the river, nobody around, pure nature. Quiet night listening the river.

name: Mamanaca
description: Nice and very very quiet square on the way to Tarata. We were able to park on the side of the square with no problem. We asked if we could use water from a plot of land and people told us that there was no problem.

name: Eduardo Eguia Hospital
description:
As long as a PCR covid test to cross the border is still needed, after a day long search we found this hospital that got us tested. Testing is only done after 11:30 - 13:00, and 15:00-17:00. Results after 30 hours, cost: 550 Bob. per person. Phone: 65462534

,

name: El Pueblo del Pique
description:
Great local restaurant specialized in Cochabamba cuisine. Accessible prices - well served individual plates and there is a VEGETARIAN option
Specialized in Pique Boliviano - dish from Cochabamba!
Very lovely owner and great service! We had a Pique Macho and a Pique Vegetariano - both were simply delicious.

name: entel sim card
description: Here you can by a entel sim card, according to the locals it is the best brand in Bolivia.

name: Banco Bisa
description: Here you can have US dollars or More than 500 Bolivian as the others bank DO. direct from the ATM

name: Ruta 14 riverbed
description: Easy track off the road in a curve. Coming from the South, it's a sharp turn, then left after about 50 m. Great place for all kinds of rigs, right on the riverbank

name: On RN 5 close to TicaTica
description: In the riverbed. Turn off the road about 100 m from the sign "Rio Chaqueni" (before, if you come from Potosí, at the end of the curve / after, if you come from Uyuni). Wide, level, might be windy, little traffic. Beautiful scenery. Good for all kinds of rigs.

name: RN25 behind Licoma
description: A flat spot right beside the road. Good for big rigs. Quiet at night

name: Hotel Colonial Tumusla
description: Tumusla is a wonderful valley of peace, silence and excellent climate. Isaac and his wife run the only hotel of the village. The room is confortable and clean. Private bathroom. 70 Bs with breakfast (eggs, bread, tomatoes, coffee or tea). Excellent dinner for 20 Bs.

name: Nino Salvador
description: The hostel is located in a quite corner of the village. I park my bike inside, but there is no parking for motorbikes or cars. The bed is not very clean, it seems they don't change the sheets for each customer... There are other two hostels few meters ahead, but I didn't check it. I paid 50 Bs for a room with a double bed. They told me they have also shared rooms for 30 Bs. Shared bathroom. No breakfast. There is a nice area to make a BBQ.

name: Hotel Villa Imperial
description: This is the only place for sleep in Kucho. Very basic rooms. Nice owners. Apparently there is no shower. I washed myself with a bucket of water in the garden. Hygiene nonexistent. 20 Bs.

name: Old road  permanently closed, turn right
description: Due to landslides old road is permanently closed. Coming from Oruro turn right here.

name: Old road closed, take left road.
description: Old road (the only road which is drawn in maps.me ) is permanently closed due to landslides. Coming from Torotoro NP take left road.

name: Sky lake hostel
description:
very nice place, comfortable, nice breakfast, very well located, very friendly owners
---
muy lindo lugar, cómodo, lindo desayuno, muy bien ubicado, muy amables los dueños

name: Just off RN with view of Salar and Uyuni
description: Level space right on highest point of the last pass before descending towards Uyuni. Some broken glass on the ground but no problem. Quiet, since road is not very much travelled during the night. 10 min to town, much preferable to any other point in town, it is worth driving out here. Enough room for several big rigs if you travel as a convoy

name: Welding
description: Welding specialist, recommended by Don Mario (see my other entry under "Taller mechnico"). Welded casing of rear differential, 80 Bol.

name: Alota outskirts
description: Quiet place right outside Alota, close to the soccer fields. Leveled, grassy, windy, but absolutely quiet. Room for all kinds of rigs, tents might find wind protection at the corral walls.

name: El Chapaco
description:
Excelentt food and good price. People here very frendly.
Ask for Chorrarilla

name: Infront Police Station
description:
We first stop atthe main square of EntreRios, then i ask to the police if that was a nice place to stay.
They recomended us to park just in front of the police station.
Very calm place just for one night

name: Camping de la Señora Lourdes
description: We provide a big space with a yard and access to a bathroom. It is located at 5 blocks from the Center of town, which makes almost everything within a walking distance. to contact us please call the number +591 73671121  via WhatsApp. Lourdes speaks some English, and she does speak Italian.

name: Mecánico T Wilmer
description: These guys helped me diagnose and take out my alternator. The regulator had died and I had to have another mechanic in town install an external regulator because this guy didn’t know how to do it. He was very helpful though. His number is 59169790103

name: Clínica Automotriz Le Mans
description: This guy helped me fix my alternator. He is mostly an electrical mechanic, but very skilled and helped me in my time of need. Lots of people go to his place. See photo for numbers
