name: mountain view with the Vicunas
description: take a little turn off and just drive till you cant see the highway. good hard all weather ground with predominant wind from south. little noise from the highway but not enough to keep you awake.

name: Diesel Castro
description:
great place who works with diesel cars.
Diego has a great staff and they are well know about they're job

name: Hostal Piedra Andina
description:
Casa de Piedra is located at the same place as Casa cultural y el almacen. 
The owner built the hostel in his backyard. It was finished just before the pandemia in 2019, in 2022 everything is new. 
It offers the following services : 
- double room with private bathroom (hot shower)
- dinning room and a kitchen fully equipped
- possibility to park motos and bicycles in the backyard

The owner and his family are very friendly.

name: Chirapaca - museum
description: Large grassy area, that serves as parking lot for visitors of the little museum and church. Surrounded by fields, next to a hill with viewpoint at the top. Far enough from the road and the small village to be really quiet. Friendly local people that passed by, told us no problem to spend the night here. The side road to this place is paved almost all the way. At arrival, some cows were grazing around us. One of the few clean places in Bolivia, please keep it that way!

name: Wild camp near the river
description: Nice place beside the river with place for several vehicles. Some locals were down here on Sunday, very kind. From 9pm on we were alone and had a quiet night.

name: nice very old mud church.
description: At this place next to the big road you will find a nice very old abandoned church. when you come from Cochachamba 200 m. Before this point take a trail at your right you will cross a small creek and after find this church.

name: church
description: An other nice mud church with a tower this time it is coming from LA Paz and it it just next to the road

name: Close to Church Plaza Iglesia San Roque
description: Quiet side street (calle Trinidad) from the other place close by, little traffic. Seems even better than the plaza itself, as it is not as narrow.

name: Diesel
description: Here you can have diesel for 6 bol / litre from a small shop which make also lavado.

name: Bus Station parking
description:
Only for the day parking lot. Next to the bus station. 
No height restriction, ok for a 6m van, probably longer vehicles won't be able to turn inside.
2,50bob/hour, open till 22hs.

name: Peñas pueblo
description: Pelase don’t buy gasoline in this little pueblo. They mix it with water (it happened to us)

name: Break-in
description: We left our big truck here and went for lunch to the other side of the streed. The truck was 30min parked and someone tried to break in at the front door. Our lock was damaged but they don't get in. Don't let your camper alone!

name: Poopo Viejo
description: Large flat area along a dirt road leading to the Poopo Viejo cemetery. Far enough from the road to be very quiet and not to be seen easily. Out of sight from the village. In the evening the traffic on the main road became very quiet. We didn’t hear anything during the night, but enjoyed the beautiful sky with so many stars. On the dirt road where we were parked, no cars at all from the time we arrived (around 5.30 PM), the first vehicle passed at 8.30 AM. Park away from the road, to avoid dust when a vehicle passes. Good coverage of Entel.

name: River Crossing - NO Bridge
description: Attention!! According to the GPS, there should be a bridge for crossing the river BUT it is not built yet! Possible to cross during the dry season, but don't even think about it during the wet season.

name: Laboratorio riserpa/ Covid tests
description: You can have the Covid antigen test here for the border crossing to Argentina. (We made an appointment for the next day 15:00, but then they were closed.) So, we did the test in Villazon ( see entry there).

name: Clínica Montesinos
description: Here we got the Antigen test for the border crossing from Bolivia to Argentina. 15 minutes. 150 BOB pp. Even open on public holiday / Good Friday.

name: Casa de Huéspedes Ciclovia Sucre-Bol
description:
Price: 65bs per night per person for single room. 35bs per night per person for shared room.
This was a really nice place!
I loved the view and tranquility of staying in this part of the city. 
I received help with what to see and enjoy in Sucre!

The place has: Single rooms, shared rooms, WiFi, shared bathrooms, hot showers, shared kitchen, good bed

name: Potosi
description: We entered the fuel station, asked for the smile price of 6 Bob/litre. No problem. But they asked to tell nobody 😉.

name: Boiling hot termas vents
description: Here are the hottest water vents going into the river. You can find a very nice temperature if you scout the river flow.

name: Water at YPFB (Not for drinking)
description:
Water available at the YPFB.
 There are a couple of taps with water from the lake. They don't recommend it for consumption (cooking) but ir was the only place we could fill our tanks. Either way, other places (public bathrooms) told us their water wasn't for consumption either. I guess all the water comes from the lake and each establishment treats it for their own use.

name: Near Road
description: Small way behind trees, lots of space for any car, silent at night, only some cars or trucks at night on the main road

name: Cochabamba
description: You can leave your car safely here if you want to go to "La cancha" for example. Fit big cars easily like van or shuttle bus. Price is just 6 bs/hour.

name: Tarata, just outside historical center
description: Rather quiet spot(s) along the riverbank outside the historical center. Level, little traffic, lots of space for all kinds of rigs

name: Suspension specialists
description: Right on the corner of Capitán Arzabes and Ruben Benavides: "venta pernos y muelles" selling parts of and complete suspension kits (leaf springs), Oliver across the street applies and fixes. Friendly, fast and reasonable prices. Had one layer of suspension added plus the remainig ones newly bent. Recommend!

name: Lucy - Repuestos y lubricantes
description:
We found this was a good option to do our 10kkm maintenance. 
We refilled all our liquids and changed motor oil and oil filter for 342 bolivianos. 
We also bought an additional 1 liter of oil and asked for the air filter to be pulsed with air. All included in that price. 

Fast and friendly service.

Bonus: asked to have a quick inspection of breaks, suspensions and motor.

name: repuestos Martínez
description: Shop specialized in break part for cars and many other small parts. the shop owner is so friendly! recommend.

name: Copacabanita east of Ancavi
description: Close to the other two sites, but on the shore of small laguna. Police came by, very friendly, no problem camping here, told us if we had problems they'd be right at the crossroads. Nice chat, wished us a good stay.

name: Quimome
description: At the town square of Quimome, a small, dusty and quiet village. At arrival a friendly man passed by, we talked with him, no problem to stay here overnight he told us. Sound of the Highway and be heard at a distance, but not too much traffic.

name: El Nido del Flamenco
description: It is a hotel but I talked to the owners and they were more than willing to let me park in their parking lot and use all their facilities (wifi and bathroom) for 20Bs. And they are pet friendly.

name: next to the church
description:
Possibility to put tents next to the church. We asked for authorization to a men. Large garden, wind protect by the church and water tap.
Very quiet.

name: Puerto del Diablo
description: Quiet place 2minutes away from Pueto del Diablo and start of the Cañon del Inca trail. Some picnic tables but otherwise no facilities. Acessible with 2WD and big rigs. Good cell reception (Entel has 4G)

name: Awesome place next to river
description: Very beautiful grassy and flat area next to river. Only 100m from the road but not visible from the road. One house on the other side of the river but we didn't see anyone during our entire stay. Water not drinkable, but ok for a quick bath. Enough space for several cars or tents.

name: Asian House
description: The Asian House is a very good place to rest after the Salar or to get prepared for it. Very spacious, clean and comfortable rooms, with very hot shower. Budget-friendly at 120 bol per night for a double room and tasty breakfast included.

name: Taller los lipez
description: Welding and tires, the guy did a very good job for a fair price.

name: Hector mecanico y electricidad
description:
we broke down in the middle of nowhere ... but it was without counting on the kindness and know-how of Hector and his wife.
Certainly his garage is rudimentary but he had all the skills to dismantle and reassemble our complete clutch after going to buy it in Potosi.

Icing on the cake, we were able to sleep at his place during the time of the repair.

Thanks again Hector and Beatriz for your welcome.

name: Minuteman Pizza
description: Very nice pizza here. The American owner Chris is very knowledgeable about the area/roads and he's a nice guy to talk to. Stop by for the latest updates and of course dinner opens after 5pm. Inside Toniño hotel

name: Casa de cambio vieli
description: Changed here € and few dollars for normal international rates. Only pristine banknotes and no small cuts.

name: ENTEL Mobile phone
description:
Entel has the best Bolivia coverage.
This is the dedicated Entel store.
No shop in Copacabana will give you directions to Entel!
10bob for SIM
13gb for 100 Bob
They register your phone, take your passport

name: MM bicicleta
description:
awesome little bike shop/bicicleteria. Ramiro is such a sweet heart, he has quality bike parts and takes really good care of his customers.
you can get in touch via whatsapp easily: +591 70427286

name: Govinda (indian veggie / vegan restaurant)
description: awesome daily menu restaurant with vegan and veggie options. 15bs for the "small" menue and 20 for the big. soup, salad, main, bread and desert.

name: Laundry Garfield
description: several services offered depending on the time to collect your laundry: fast (12 bolivianos per kilo), normal (10 bolivianos per kilo), super fast (15 bolivianos).  The laundry is clean and smells good.

name: Corazón de Jesús
description: Only hotel in Porvenir. Quite expensive, 100 bol for matrimonial without air conditioning, 120 bol with. Private bathroom, and good wifi. We were said there are cheaper rooms, but all occupied at the time. Place inside to park motorcycles. Quite clean, there is a lot of fungus on the walls and ceiling though. Wouldn't recommend if you have different option.

name: Hotel Nichkito
description:
Nice hotel we found online.
With "genius" discount it was 146bobs one night, plus 10bob for parking in a garage (can fit about 2-3 cars). Our room (with private bathroom) was nice random clean, with am electric heater, although it was quite cold when we came in, it heated up a bit by the morning. Comes with breakfast of toast, eggs, cereal, etc, nothing crazy but not bad. Has WiFi too. Also shower was nice and hot, good water pressure, and no suicide shower. 
Definitely recommend for Uyuni!

name: la gomeria de Ivan
description:
Ivan helped us change tires.  he did a great job and fast.  he then offered himself for us when we had a problem.  he is very kind and reliable
+591 67914417

name: Residencial Nelva
description: One of the 3 or 4 accomodations in Santa Rosa. 100 bol for a room with two double beds and private bathroom, 80 bol if you're a couple and gonna use only 1 bed. Clean, nice and quiet. I believe it's the best option in town. There is space inside to park motorcycles. Hot water. No wifi.

name: Lavadero Vale Car Wash
description:
A place to wash your car after the Salar!
Open on Sundays! From 8:30am to 18pm.

They took their time and did a great job: removing the salt with dulce water, even oiling to protect mechanical parts and washing the bodywork with soap.
We paid 70 bols for our Toyota 4Runner, and we got a free drink 😋 Friendly service!

name: Cerro la cruz
description:
It is a white cross on top on a mountain. Beautiful views of the city.
If you come from south follow the highway until you see a very small white/yellow chapel on the right hand side. There the path starts. It is not really easy to find the start of the path, but if you ask the locals, they will help you. It is quiet a steep path, but only takes 30min or less to walk up.

name: Mercantil Santa Cruz
description: ATM to withdraw cash with a foreign (Belgian) card free of charge. I think the limit is 450usd.

name: Banco FIE - maestro/Mastercard
description: after trying 4 banks including Bisa, this was the machine that I could actually get cash from. horrible rates I am sure but with Bolivia being this cheap we will live

name: Unduavi
description: Right behind the police checkpoint, after the last hut (baño publico) coming from La Paz. "Emergency"-stop after nightfall. Not too much traffic during the night.

name: Pensión Vallegrande
description: A restaurant and pension in Mataral. They have simple rooms with shared bathrooms and a traditional kitchen. Rooms are at the back around a small courtyard so no road noise. We could safely place our bicycles in this courtyard during the night. We paid 70b for 2 persons for one night. The woman who runs it is friendly, a fine stay overall!

name: Park - Villazon
description: Ideal for if the border took a while. No amenities but very low traffic and some tiendas nearby.

name: Hostal Bolivar
description: Freshly painted, spacious rooms in different types. with or without en suite. 170bol for a quadruple (2 double beds) en suite including breakfast. Hosts are lovely, help with local gasoline.

name: Pizzeria El Mana
description: Great place for a tasty pizza. quick service, clean and good amount of toppings.

name: heladería los cocos
description:
This place is a brand new hotel with amazing coffee and ice. The rooms are great.
But it doesn't show from the outside, so just go in and see. We stumbled on it on our search for some coffee. And afther some chatting with the owner she gave us a tour.

name: by the river bed
description: Fine place to camp without water. Turn south of the main road (in the corner) and follow dirt road for 350m till you're at the river. Plenty of horizontal spots to pitch a tent. And just far enough of the road to not be bothered by traffic noise.

name: Formación Ecológica 'El Sapo'
description: Nice rock formation on the side of the highway. We didn't use the road that the signs leads you to but instead found a small pathway to this spot next to a pirca. Not quite leveled but easy to fix with some stones. The noise form the highway is hardly noticeable after 8pm so we had a good night sleep. Cats were super happy.

name: nice wild camping close to town
description: nice place, for those who, like me , find hard the acces to the camp place around the lake.  accesible for 2WD, not so much trash , have some trees for shades ! beautiful view and hike on the city, you can hear the noise from the city but it's not disturbing at all. have a little river, but i didn't use it because of the pollution around . not the best but definitely not the worst . nice 4g entel signal

name: La Casa Del Cafecito
description: La Casa Del Cafecito - gourmet cafe with self-contained apartment style accommodation  (two). This place is the best in Aiquille! Expect European-style coffee, scrambled eggs, good music and a really nice owner who speaks perfect English (lived 20 years in England). A really nice getaway in a town which is traditional Bolivian!

name: Challwas
description: This places serves fish in the weekends! So good! Home cooked on the BBQ. The fish is fresh, the owner takes it from te place where he works during the week. The owners are really friendly!! Only open from 9.30 till 15:00!

name: Quilima Lakeshore
description: Absolutely beautiful, quiet and sage place right on the lake below Quilima. Follow the dirt road through the village, the last 200 m are quite rough. 4x4 recommended, but not required, except in rainy season. Wide area for camping, but careful: soft and hard sand patches - check on foot beforehand! Yesterday i pulled out two family cars wiith my winch 😎 entel coverage

name: Sauna Spa Entre Cielos
description: Really good, clean showers for $6bls !!! you have you own space plus the shower! They have  Maybe 10 showers! and wifi !

name: Chiguana to laguna route - very bad roadcondition
description: Absolutely avoid without 4wd and high clearance.

name: Plaza Calvin
description:
Huge space for any size, trees, some shade, at night very silent. 
even my cat Calvin felt secure and was walking outside ;)

name: The Sparks Electric car
description: excellent service, Mr. Vicente is not only an expert in vehicle electricity and electronics, but he is also an honest and reliable person, his prices are very good, Mr. Vicente repairs almost all the vehicles of the tourist agencies.  100% recommendable

name: kris bike bike shop
description:
Telefonie number wit WhatsApp 72183096
Kris bike shop small bike shop

name: Plant In You - Vegan Food
description: Super awesome place with amazing breakfast bowls, salads, bruschettas, ice cream, cakes.  Also sells tofu, cheese, yoghurt. lovely people

name: Red House
description: This place offers simple rooms, we arrived at 16:00 and they made a room ready for 70 bol (35 pp). Perfect after a day of biking. It’s the red big boulding alongside the road. (Left side If you come from aquille). The bathroom was moderate, go in the one which is on the groundfloor, this one has a better pressure level!

name: Public garage
description:
Nice garage, we pay 35 bob for 24h.
Secure .

name: Scott mecanica
description: Good garage , fast , efficient, professional.

name: beautiful quiet place with lake view
description: negociate more off road, but doable with an 2wd , you LL find this little place , more quiet than the others around the lake. 3g entel signal good.

name: water tap in peaje
description: At the toll booth, we asked where to find water. the lady showed us a tap right next to the toilets.

name: Mi Chola
description:
Very nice culinary experience :)
3 amuse bouches 
2 starters
2 mains
1 dessert
=120bob
Menu changes every week, friendly staff.
There is an other option with only 1 starter that costs 100bob. The place does not look fancy but the food is worth it. We read on TripAdvisor that the chef worked at Central in Peru (best restaurant of South America).

name: mecanic welder
description: good mecanic who fix our broken exhaust pipe. good job

name: Tambo Salinas - Cafe & Restaurant
description: Very nice and cosy place to get super rich breakfast, lunch, dinner or just a coffee. In addition you can find complete touristic information about the region. Wilma and Enzo will welcome you with open arms. For us, it's been the perfect place before crossing the Salar de Uyuni on bicycle.

name: hidden camp in sand dunes
description: found an open part of the fence and went behind the dunes. flat sandy ground perfect for a tent. barely visible from street and very quiet.

name: tienda with bread and coffee
description: small shop with coffee and empanadas and bread.

name: tienda
description: even though we were told in the village that there is no tienda we found this one right at the very end of town. it has everything one needs and they also cooked us some food. very friendly owners!

name: stone houses
description: stone ruins a little up the hill. we camped inside the church where exactly one tent fits well. nice view and completely abandoned. flamingos nearby.

name: great view
description: a little above the road, just walk along the hill, flat and perfect for tents, great views, from far visible from road however

name: Cabañas El Porvenir
description: Wonderfully peaceful cabañas scattered around a farmhouse with a beautiful lush & well kept garden and amazing views (including sunset).  Wake up to birdsong and nothing else. Plenty parking. No wifi but decent Entel signal. Only 10 minutes by car from quint San Javier, Ñuflo de Chávez.  Some cabañas have a kitchen, our smaller one not but they provided a small electric plate stove and some utensils to cook a basic meal.  Price around B/s250 for the smaller cabaña including a decent breakfast with farm eggs! We were lucky to have the company of the owners and most hospitable hosts, Oscar & Marie Carmen, who treated us like kings. Highly recommended for a good few days of relaxing and taking in the beautiful surroundings.

name: Hotel Limbania
description: Very welcoming, sparkling clean & comfortable hotel with fan, decent wifi, parking & use of basic kitchen.  We paid B/s120 for a double room. Excellent value for money.

name: Road to Valle de la Luna
description: Incredible canyon and mountain view at the start of the route to Valle de la Luna from La Paz. You will have breathtaking views of the Lunar Valley rocks, canyon and the extremely impressive 6462m peak of Illimani. Definitely worth a small detour to see it!

name: Wild behind red mountain
description: Nice spot with trees to put tents or go with a little camper also good for big rig outside the trees. Only possible in the dry season. Nice sunset with red mountains.

name: Hostal Wilma
description:
I went here for a room first but they have a huge backyard, where you also have access to showers and toilets, so I asked for camping. 
It’s 30BS for one person and one van without breakfast 
40BS with breakfast. 
Wifi doesn’t reach the backyard. 
Dogs are allowed.
Nice and safe

name: Motorcycle Tours Bolivia (nomada experience)
description:
You can book MTB, motorcycle, 4x4 tours and climbing tours too here. But you can also get your bike washed and serviced here or any type of help really. Robin Thomas is English and super friendly and nice and has plenty of good stories to tell. we got our bikes washed and dried here after travelling on the salar, Robin knows what he's doing as he's been here for a while. we also got an oil change and a few bits sorted. 
he's also doing a lot of bike recoveries etc. Anything you need for your motorcycle, he can help. 
his number is +59178773787 or go ring at his door if he's not guiding a tour.

name: Chita water tap
description: water tap, potable water.........local led me to it and it seems anyone can use it.

name: Shop to Complete receita federal
description: When we missed the web page to complete the receita federal to enter Brazil (if car not working on mobiles and tabloids). In this shop, they complete it on their computer, print it and add all necessary copies for 30 bobs. Nice people and with some basic Spanish you can fight your way through.

name: Street Parking
description:
Relatively wide street between Terminal de Busses and Stadium! 
Stayed one week for flying Paraglider!

name: pedre sal rustic hotel
description: Definitely recommend! the owners are super nice, and the rooms are clean & cute. The hotel has a lot of local decorations and is partially made from salt. There are many blankets, warm water, and heaters to keep you warm throughout the night. However the wifi is often not working.

name: flat spot next to river
description: Beautiful and quiet, next to river, little road going down, left side of the road just before bridge coming from nuevo mundo

name: A côté du théâtre
description:
Translation:Flat place next to the theater, sheltered from the wind. Visible from the road, little traffic. No houses around.

Place platte à côté du théâtre, à l’abris du vent. Visible de la route, peu de trafique. Pas d’habitations aux alentours.

name: Near the road between Quila quila and San Juan
description:
Translation : Inside a big bend. No traffic at night. 4x4 and ground clearance not necessary. Watch out for the thorns for the tires.

A l’intérieur d’un grand virage. Pas de trafic la nuit. 4x4 et garde au sol pas nécessaire. Attention aux épineux pour les pneus.

name: Las Lavandas Josiane
description:
Josiane loves to receive overlanders in her big garden. You can use all her facilities, hot shower and toilet in her workshop and an outdoor sink. Plenty of opportunities to relax in the garden. Samaipata is a short 10 min walk with bars, restaurants and shops. We payed 50bobs per night and 300 per week. It's necessary to call or write her in advance, but no worries she's super lovely and speaks Spanish, French, German and English!
+591 60097367

All RVs wider than 2m should check upfront. We’re 2.5m and wouldn’t fit due to narrow entrance lane and trees.

name: Next to the road behind the Mountain
description:
Get out of the main road and take the way to the right when you go towards Tupizza. Drive 1 or 2 km then you will find lots of spots behind the small mountain quiet and flat.

Sortir de la route principale et prendre le chemin à droite quand vous allez direction tupizza. Roulez 1 ou 2 km puis vous trouverez pleins de spots derrière la petite montagne au calme et plat.

name: Side of the road
description: We stayed here one night after failing to find a place to stay in potosi. There’s a relatively flat spot off the side of the road to the left on the dirt road. It was cold, but relatively quiet with few cars passing at night. And no one bothered us.

name: Near village
description: Was trying to find cover late after cycling all day in a dust storm. Found this spot near the village that offered decent wind coverage from the NW winds. Space for a tent, probably other spots in the rocks around here. Life saver

name: In front of Lake Titicaca
description: We slept for two nights here and left the car during our stay in Isla del Sol. Had no problems. Beautiful view of the lake. Only space for one or two cars. There is a restaurant in front (Tairi Uta) with good Wi-Fi that works here.

name: Sauna Piscina El Vergel
description:
Sauna (dry or humid depending on days) and swimmingpool (only summer). also hot showers.
shower costs 10bob
sauna (incl. shower) 20bob. 
mostly locals using it.

name: El Cafecito, San Javier
description: Small restaurant and Café (not serving lunch nor in the morning) great homemade meals.

name: El Buen Gusto
description: Good food, family owned, rural, at the main plaza just 100 m from the jesuit church. Good folklore music

name: water tap at park
description: Water tap inside fenced in park but possibility to park right next to it and put hose under fence. Clear city water here in the center

name: tienda with trucha, cerveza and potable water
description: Water tap right next to parking lot to fill up the water cistern, very clear and good mountain water

name: hot clean showers for 10bol
description: Hostel Naupa House offers showers to travelers for 10bol

name: Las Misiones Apart Hotel
description:
Relaxing, very calm hotel with small swimming pool, just beside the church. 
Great breakfast

name: DonAcho
description: 10 Very Clean simple rooms with private toilet & warm shower. A/C, TV and good wifi, calm place at main square beside the jesuit church. 1 pers. At 1 double room: 100 BOL

name: Don Yuri
description: Private accommodation/house with two bedrooms and private bathrooms. Calm, green, place with a small garden.

name: Immigration Tarija 2022
description:
Immigration office for visa extension. 30 days easy, 10 minutes. 1 copy of main passport page and 1 of entry stamp. 7h30 - 15h30. 

At the start, he said I needed to come back 2 days before expiration. I insisted and he asked the boss and I got it no problem (8 days before expiration). Friendly staff.

name: Residential 4 de Noviembre
description:
94 rooms. About 40 rooms with A/C and prívate bathroom. 150 single a 260 double. The shared ones are pritty clean 60 bol /pax 

Family for 6 pax: 520 BOL. 

No breakfast. 

Tel. Cel: 75387267

name: Hospedaje Jatun Mayu
description:
Basic but nice hostel along the road, run by a family. 
There is no signage for now (they are waiting to have more money to do a "pretty" one), but when coming from the south, it's the wood door on the left, a few meters after the bridge (see pictures). The owner's name is Raoul.
There is one 3-bed room, and two 2-bed room.
- 40p for shared room with shared bathroom
- 120p for private room with private bathroom
Possible to eat there (dinner and breakfast), but I didn't ask for it so I don't know the prices. They allowed me to cook in my room and gave me hot water for free. 
Electric showers (I was able to have a really short hot one), no heaters obviously. 
The place is simple, but clean and the owner is really nice, he makes sure you have everything you need. 
No secured parking, but I was able to park my motorcycle behind the house.
 Be aware it can be busy with the 4x4 tours.

name: Lupito Cocina Vegana
description: Absolutely fantastic vegan food with a daily rotating menu. Great service as well. Ate here five times while in La Paz and never had the same thing. Weekday menu is 24Bs and Saturday menu a touch more.

name: Gas station el oasis
description: Gas station close to the center. Allowed us to stay for the night. Toilets and showers 24h. Noisy, but if you're in need it will work. Since there are no options anymore at the lagoon.

name: Kacha Kacha
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User reports the blockage was just before the Kacha Kacha village up North on the road you take to Access this village and the riverbed 

We took this road from Sucre following komoot tracks to go to Toro Toro and Cochabamba. a lot of rocks on the road up near the village. 
Impossible to pass by car, impossible by bike, we had to take all our luggage and walk across the rocks. doable but  it took us 2 hours and it's a bit dangerous. 
Ask in Sucre or toro toro if the road is open.

Possible to download and follow another track from bikepaking.com

name: La Pascana Coffee & Restaurante
description: Fresh fruits and continental breakfast. 25,- bol a nice breakfast

name: Phone repair
description:
Very good repair-shop for apple products like iPhone and iPad but also android. 
Very reliable. 
Also sells apple products

name: Refugio de Colibries
description:
A huge nice garden and small forest with hummingbird feeders. At this time of the year there are five species of hummingbird (in early December 10) according to Raul, the owner, and his wife. Over the span of a year they count 21 different species. 
The best time to see hummingbirds is before 10am and after 4pm.
Bring your own drinks and food. 
Entrance fee is 25 BOB per person (06-2024).

name: Alojamiento La Llegadita
description:
Good place. Private room with baño compartido. I put the motorbike at the neighbour place (same family). 40 BOB

There are 3 alojamientos next to each other. People in town are friendly.

name: Laguna Esmeralda
description: A nice camping spot next to the Laguna in the cloud rainforest. It has a big green open area to park your car and two little buildings with toilets. In the weekend it can be more crowded.

name: Cash machine (ATM) - Bancofie
description: Convenient place to withdraw cash in Bolivianos after crossing the border from Argentina. Bank accepts Visa, Mastercard and others. No transaction fee.

name: Eco hotel
description:
Nice option to sleep on the road between Oruro and Sucre.
80bol for a private single room
Basic breakfast included 
Hot shower (solar)
No wifi
Possible to put motorcycles inside the beautiful patio 
There is a kitchen but I'm not sure we can use it. I had hot water for free. 
The room was not the cleanest, but it's very quiet, cheap, and Maritza, the owner, is really nice.
Coming from Sucre, you just have to follow the blue hotel pannel and turn on the right 
2 lovely cats and 1 lovely dog to welcome you

name: Quiet River Spot
description:
I checked out the other river spot and I suppose you can park there but you need to ride a curb and there is lots of activity there. Better to come here. 

This used to connect to the main road but was washed away so it’s no longer a through street and can only be accessed from one side. Super quiet and private. Stayed for 3 nights. Close to town.

name: Mecánica Todo Auto
description:
Super professionals, we recommend it 100%. They let us stay the 7 days living in the workshop. Amazing people. Marcelo the owner, is an amazing mechanic.

Español
Super profesionales, lo recomendamos 100%. Nos dejaron quedarnos los 7 días viviendo en el taller. increíbles personas. Marcelo el dueño un mecánico increíble

name: hidden place next to the main road
description:
you can easily find it if you follow the soil road, but due the trees the tent is not visible!
in the morning there is truck sounds, but was the only camping area we could find in the region, it's very protected
4g reception is great!

name: El Chiquitano
description:
While all almuerzos are essentially the same, every once in a while you eat one that just hits different. This is one of those places. The quality and flavor is just better than 95% of almuerzos I’ve eaten. Perfect yucca, sweet plantain, brown rice, salad of more than shredded lettuce. 

Costs 15 Bs, so a little more than usual but worth it.

name: Ridge View
description: Nice ridge view. Perfect for tenting and a good view of the lake. Not much wind protection but it is beautiful and hidden from the main road.

name: plaza cerca del shopping
description:
Hermosa plaza!! muy seguro y linda zona. cerca del shopping y a 4km de la plaza de armas. 
---
Lovely place. Very safe. We stay here for two nights.

name: Chinoly
description:
If you liked my last lunch recommendation on the Missions Route then you’ll surely love this one. Recommended by the couple that runs Lavandería Suiza, this place serves up excellent quality food and actually offers something different for their almuerzo. 

Today I had feijoada, which heading south I’d never seen on an almuerzo yet in Bolivia. Also, plantain soup which wasn’t familiar to me. Nice change of pace to have something different and still very tasty!

name: Tiny Village, Plaza
description:
We asked some locals for if we could park and spend the night. No problem, very friendly and curious, we had some good conversation, than cooked and slept. 
Just a quiet and secure place. In the middle of the village.

name: Hoterma
description:
hotel and camping on the banks of the pilcomayo river.
good amenities, shade, electricity, water, tables, moderate internet. price to match.
good place to stop before crossing into paraguay.

name: Hilltop Clearing
description:
Not much on this road except for making a circuit of the Jesuit missions route. However, if you find yourself on it this is an excellent spot for the evening. 

Hidden from the road, this cleared hilltop gives you excellent panoramic views of the sun setting over the jungle. Plenty of space and easy enough to get yourself level. Entrance is from a road just east of this marker. 

P.S. Nice cool breeze as well!

name: Brazilian Buffets
description:
In this area is a concentration of Brazilian restaurants that specialize in the 15 Bs buffet. The really nice thing about the buffet is the excellent selection of really tasty vegetable dishes! So nice to have different flavors AND veggies. 

If you’re staying at the park this is a no brainer. Also, in the building of this entry is a solid pizza/pasta place priced for the college kids.

name: InterToyo Land Rover Parts
description: We bought a new clutch, slave cylinder and transfer case seals for our defender here. Good service and knowledge.

name: Laguna Capina West
description: A good place to spend a night before park entry. The road north is a newly made gravel road with no washboard! Alternative road to the Laguna road. small pullout to protect our van from wind. Nice view over the laguna.

name: free WiFi
description: there is free WiFi for 2 hours once a day

name: Gravity Bikeshop
description:
Great bike repair shop ! We arrived with a brake problem (lack of fluid) and a broken gear cable and Cesar changed everything in less than 30 minutes!
Better to contact Cesar in advance and he will tell you when to come (Cesar Orihuela  +591 70541772).
The gate is always closed, but just knock on the number 3050!

name: Hidden from the road
description: Ok place to spend the night. You are close to the main road but hidden. Some cars were passing by, but it was quiet during the night.

name: Cloud Forest
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.


On this road there are multiple places next to the road where you can park your car. We slept on this spot. It was flat enough and far from the main road. Only a single car passed by.

Just north of the entrance there is a soccer field where you also can stay if you want more space or a more flat place.

name: Parque de Uyuni
description:
we spent two nights here parked in this square, very quiet. Very friendly people, and a tap with water next to the Children's Games.
---
pasamos dos noches acá estacionados en esta plaza, muy tranquilo. Gente muy amable, y una canilla con agua al lado de los Juegos de niños.

name: Jesuit Church San Xavier
description:
open Monday to Saturday 9:00-12:00 and 14:00-18:00 and 
Sunday 10:00-12:00 and 14:00-18:00
entry 20 Bs for foreigners.

name: Jesuit Church Conception (UNESCO)
description:
open from Monday to Saturday from 8:30-12:00 and 14:00-18:00
Sunday from 10:00-12:00 
entry 25 Bs for foreigners 
First buy a ticket in the museum at the plaza on the right side of the church.

name: Small restaurant
description: Great place to stop for lunch, we had some pork and chicken with potatoes.

name: In the forest
description: If you don't want to sleep near the town like us. This was a nice place to overnight. During the day lots of traffic, but we had a quiet night here.

name: Corner from the road
description: If you are coming from the F25 and don't want to continue. This is a fine place to spend the night. Close to the road, but enough open area to park your car and even more cars. We stayed here a few nights to search for birds in the area.

name: Dentopia (Good Dentist)
description: It’s always a bit of a crapshoot finding a dentist and while not the cheapest this is a very good one. Very modern equipment, clean office and fantastic dental work. 250-350 Bs for a cleaning.

name: Termas Urmiri
description:
Spa in private rooms, we recommend coming in the week that there is no nadie. 5 bolivian pesos a half hour. The landscape has arrived here very beautiful.
Termas en habitaciones privadas, recomendamos venir en la semana que no hay nadie. 5 pesos bolivianos la media hora. El paisaje hasta llegar acá muy lindo.

name: Plaza Urmiri
description:
We spent the night in this plaza, a beautiful pueblito surrounded by mountains. The super nice people, there is a water tap in the plaza
Pasamos la noche en esta plaza,un pueblito hermoso rodeado de montañas. Las personas super amables, hay una canilla de agua en la plaza

name: Gas station Tres Cruces
description: Oh my god soooo many Mennonites coming here to fuel up their barrels. Anyway, good place to stay for the night, there's a little shop, there's toilets, on the right side somewhat dirty (wear flip-flops and you're fine), cold showers, but good water pressure. And since it's 35°C now, perfectly refreshing temperature. Water tap outside, did dishes there.

name: Car accessories
description: We were searching for aerovisors for our Toyota 4Runner. After a long day of searching, this was the store that had them for us. We paid 260BS for 4.

name: Hipermaxi and camping store
description: Big supermarket with big garage (2,5m height) but also a camping store with doite gas bottles.

name: toll/corrupt police
description:
we were stopped at this toll station by corrupt police.
He checked all our documents. as all was clean, he tried to destabilize us with other documents from his imagination. as he saw we were not afraid, he suggest we "participate" to help us. we hard to give him 20bobs to have peace and before he checked all the motorhome.
he seemed very unfriendly and determinated.

So, be careful, this road full of corrupt policemen..

name: Ruta 3
description: This was a part of the road earlier going round the hill, later the road was straightened so now it's just a relatively flat rocky ground. The remaining part of the hill protects you from the road noise, although you can still hear the cars. Way better than putting a tent by the road. Very clean for Bolivian standards.

name: Comunidad Campamento minimarket and comedor
description: There are two small shops in this town to buy some basic food and drinks. There is also a place where I had lunch, not sure about other meals. The road here from San Ignacio is in good shape and accessible by all types of vehicles.

name: Alojamiento - Casa de Ana
description:
Unmarked house offering room. I stayed inside the house with the family. 20 BOB. Baño compartido. Very friendly people. It is very basic, but a nice experience with a family. 
They can also cook a meal. Rented a wooden canoe/boat for 20 BOB for the day. Parking space near the house. Tiny village so it is secure even if in the open. 
Nice to swim in the lake and to go bird watching. 
Negative point: plenty of trash along the lake shore and in the village. People don’t seem to care about it even on their land.

name: Sonhando Acordado
description:
Informal campside next to the gas station, in front of a house and next to the road. Safe and silent at night.
Toilet dirty in the gas station and Wi-Fi we had no access to the password. 

Camping informal ao lado do posto de gasolina, em frente a uma casa e próximo da rodovia.
Seguro e silencioso durante a noite.
Banheiro sujo no posto e não tivemos acesso ao Wi-Fi.

name: Hostal Travelero
description:
They have parking inside the hostel, fits a couple of motorcycles, and one Kombi-sized campervan. We drive a Mitsubishi L300, which is slightly bigger, we had to demount our jerry can from the roof to be able to fit. We paid 50 per person per night, breakfast included.

There's a pool, fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms with shower, it's super clean and the staff is super friendly.
We ended up staying 5 nights, every day very chill atmosphere!

Laundry is 40 per 10kg, drying happens on the clothing lines in the back.

They have a six week old puppy running around which is a rather big bonus as well. I would love for someone to upload pics of her when she grows bigger! 

Definitely recommended!

name: Pulga Burger (Evenings only)
description:
Normally a burger place isn’t worthy of putting a recommendation but this place makes an excellent burger and fries starting at 6 Bols. 

Discovered it because of the large crowds that gather outside it every evening. 

Flavor wise it reminds me of an In-n-Out burger from the US.

name: Next to the river
description:
Not a fancy place, but if you go just over the hill you are not visible from the road. We had a quiet night. Perfect if you want to stop and only spend the night.

Enjoy!

name: By a small road
description:
A small spot by a small road up the hill, about 8x4 meters. Cars pass really really, had a nice talk with a local woman, who told you can go to the nearest house if you run out of drinking water.
About 100m above the main road, so almost no noise from it. Although some of the passing cars here greet you with a honk, but that doesn't happen often.

name: Wake up backpackers hostel
description:
Very nice hostel close to the center. The owner is very nice and helpful.  They have private rooms for 140bs or dorms for 50bs (with very good breakfast)
They have warm showers (not electric but real shower) and a collective space with sofas, tv, Netflix and travel books... 
possible to use the kitchen 
they have a small room where we could store our bicycle (safe place) 
Very nice place !

name: Estacionamiento Feli
description:
We spent 10 days in this parking lot, very safe and we were made available with water by the lady. At 15 bolivianos per day.  Yellow and silver cable car about 15 blocks (we always walked there and it was quiet) and 4 blocks downtown with large supermarket. 
----
Pasamos 10 días en este estacionamiento, muy seguro y nos disponibilizó de agua la señora. A 15 bolivianos por día.  Teleférico amarillo y plateado a unas 15 cuadras (siempre caminamos hasta ahi y fue tranquilo) y a 4 cuadras centro con supermercado grande.

name: Parque Urbano de Roboré
description: Very pretty place. So quiet.  It has a faucet with running water. It's ok to spend the night

name: Panorama (with parking)
description: There aren’t too many option with parking around, we went to check out Cabanas Pardise (down a muddy road) but could get into the driveway due to the mountain of mud! They must have recently graded the road. Anyway, found this place for 180BOB for 2 persons in a decent sized room with private bath and breakfast. Hotel also has a pool and most important, secure parking for the motos or vans (no height restrictions).

name: Side of road
description: Just a large pull out on the side of the road. A few semi-trucks overnight here as well. Nothing glamorous. Sadly, lots of trash. :c Seemed slightly quieter than parking in the town itself. Fine for a night! There is a restaurant with wifi. We could see the network, but didn’t eat there. Bathrooms for 1Bol.

name: Oruro
description:
A ton of roadblocks throughout the city. You’ll have to navigate through the street maze to get around. Expect long delays, U-turns, and dead ends. Hopefully it is temporary.

Use the ring road to bypass most of the city.


We were here in Jun 2023 and the situation is still terrible. Try to avoid this city!!

name: La Vizcacha Errante
description: Delicious and creative restaurant. They have local and vegetarian dishes with quinoa. The portions are fine and the price is low. Staff is also really friendly and the restaurant is nicely styled.

name: Near the soccer field
description:
Just a fine place to overnight. You are hidden from the main road and there is a big open area just in front of the soccer field. You can not go any further then this point, because they blocked the road with huge stones. For us this was the best place to stay the night in the area. It is not near houses or stores. So you will have some privacy. When we were there we saw no other persons. The entrance from the main road is a little small. We fitted with our Toyota 4Runner, but broader cars will not fit.

Enjoy!

name: Hospedaje
description:
Passing through today I noticed a small but cute hospedaje right on the edge of the Laguna. Had we known about this we might not have camped on the side of the road near Quime… anyway, we didn’t stop so I don’t have much info other than it looks decent from the outside (fairly new I’d say) and would be a good option for cyclists or moto travellers that don’t want to pitch a tent at this altitude.
It’s looked safe enough to leave your motos parked next to it, off the main road by about 200 meters.

name: Car wash & anti-rust treatment
description: Really hard working guys here! We stopped to get our car layered with an anti-rust solution before the salt flats. Thorough rinse, then the anti-rust solution,  followed by a full wash. 50bol for our Chevy Express! Took about 30min

name: Camping de Cesar
description: The owner is a very nice person. He charged us 20 bolivianos to spend the night. Includes bathrooms, showers with plenty of water and kitchen. It has power next to the parking lot.

name: SIM cards incl registration
description: A couple of stores that sell SIM cards for your phone. We bought Entel at the Multicentro with the blue outer wall and big Entel logo. They will do the registration for you, we were connected immediately.

name: hotel colonial
description:
I'm traveling by bicycle. I stopped at this hotel for the night. relatively cheap. the owner didn't like it because I put the bike inside the room. and the wi-fi that was good at night. in the morning it didn't work
----
estou viajando de bicicleta. parei neste hotel para passar a noite. relativamente barato. a proprietária não gostou porque eu coloquei a bicicleta dentro do quarto. e o wi-fi que estava boa a noite. pela manhã não funcionou

name: Fairly quiet street
description: Near the corner with the fresh produce street, it's a pretty levelled spot, and very quiet at night. There's a baño publico around the corner. We also spent some nights next to the football field, and one at the plaza, preferred this spot. It can get super windy next to the football field and the plaza had a bit too much traffic going on.

name: Estacionamento San Clemente
description:
Parking near the stadium, in a red gate. Mr. Jorge is the owner, very kind and helpful. The space is uncovered, not very large, but we managed to enter with our sprinter and could spend the night inside. If you ask, he can provide water. We paid 40Bs for 24 hours.
---
Estacionamento próximo ao estádio em um portão vermelho. O Sr. Jorge é o proprietário,  muito gentil e amável. O espaço é descoberto, não muito grande, mas conseguimos entrar com nossa sprinter e passar a noite. Se vc pedir ele poderá te fornecer água. Pagamos 40Bs por 24h.

name: el jardin hostal and campground
description:
Nice and cheap hostel, wifi comes and goes, basic kitchen, hot showers, lovely garden.

dorm:40 bob's pp, camping in a tent:25 bob's pp. There is a driveway where you can park your bike or minivan. We slept in the van on the driveway but it needs a lot of leveling, we paid camping price ( 25 pp) for this.

name: Playa Arenal
description: We got led to this place from a local woman. It seems to be the beach from the locals. It's the place of dreams. Near the scenic creek next to the mountains and jungle. Woman collecting wood, children fishing with nets, not more. In the night there was a lonely fisherman for a while, else only frogs.

name: Sheltered cave in isla mogli
description: Sheltered cave, leveled and good Wind protection. direct View in the Salar. think this is a perfect spot If you are traveling with a tent.

name: Sacrament Mirador
description: This is a concrete toilet block with a viewing platform which has a roof.  The toilet doors are locked, but you can set up a tent on the viewing platform.

name: Jumampi
description:
Very nice restaurant  in the centre of the city on Avenida Sucre, just before the plaza de armas. You have to enter a small alley to get there. 
Menu del dia with great soup accompanied with delicious bread. They also have a vegetarian option when asked as main dish as well as a  a desert. 
Friendly staff and fast internet!

name: Official police checkpoint and peaje
description: Official police check point. Only wanted drivers license, and they sometimes check vehicles. They were very friendly and even spoke some English.

name: Betanzos near kids park
description:
in front of the kids park, at the beginning of the town. noisy during the day, due to the road traffic, but quiet between 22-7am.
people friendly and curious, in particular the kids of the Park : they asked us and we organized a visit of our motorhome for about 20 children of the town !! 
finally, a good option for us for a night on the road between Sucre and Potosi..

name: Samaipata
description: This is beside Hostel Siles.  New place, nice rooms with different number of beds. I had a private room with double bed and private bathroom where they asked for 100 Bol but everywhere you have to haggle. The bed was really good, hot shower. And garage for my motorbike. Max 2 bikes/cars can park in the street. Very good wifi. Quiet and friendly people.

name: Roadside camp for bicyclists only
description:
I'm travelling by bike and as it was getting dark I found this place next to the highway. Pay attention to the fact that it only serves for tent and bicycle

Portuguese
estou viajando de bicicleta e como estava já anoitecendo encontrei esse lugar ao lado da rodovia. atentem ao fato de que só serve para barraca e bicicleta

name: Parking Lot next to Bus Station
description:
Some mini van-drivers also appear to overnight here, overall very quiet parking lot, more leveled than the mercado one a bit further or the plaza.
You can use the toilets of the bus station, 1bob incl paper. 
10 bol dor staying overnight.

name: Ferry crossing
description:
We took this ferry around 11:00. There are many boats. Just ask around and the shipper will direct you to his boat. We paid 70bs and asked locals later what would be a normal price. They confirmed 60-70bs is normal :)

If it's raining a lot. The ferry will be closed, because there is a steep sandy road to go the boats and it would be too slippery.

Good luck!

name: La Pascana
description:
Nice option for an almuerzo in town. It's a bit pricey, but what do you expect in this middle of nowhere town;) We took a sopa with vegetables and a main with pacu, rice and bananas. 

Recommended if you want to eat something when it is too hot to do anything else :)

name: Parking
description: Open parking. Payed 5 bolivianos for the night for my motorcycle.

name: Short Ferry crossing
description:
A really short Ferry crossing for 15 bs.

Enjoy!

name: Little bakery
description: They sell the standard pan available at the street market, but also small white bread rolls that are particularly good! 5bol a bag

name: Rock Tree
description:
This is where the rock tree is! The rock formation is okay and fairly underwhelming. We didn’t find it worth going out of our way for. 

For rock enthusiasts, you are able to exit the park and re-enter to see this (or other) attraction. Just have your ticket stamped with “returno” by the guard when leaving.

name: The place where Che was captured
description: it's a very serene spot, with only a big star in stone on the ground, with some benches in stone around it. Not spectacular but I like having been here. On the main road is a sign "sendero quebrada del churo", leave your rig there on the side of the road, walk through the wooden gate and walk until the last house, there's a friendly old man living there showing you the way, albeit mumbling. On the right side of the house on your left side, you start descending all the way down here. Use this point as your reference. We crossed some other fences, but there seem to be multiple trails so you might not. Viva la revolucion!

name: Plaza Chaqui
description: Parked in front of the church. Asked a couple of locals and all said it's safe and tranquilo here. Very quiet night, so they were right. We tried to ask the police for permission (one block from the plaza), but no-one opened the door on Sunday. When open you can use the bathroom in the municipality building.

name: Aduana
description: The new place of the Aduana in Tarija, Bolivia.

name: Dolphins and nice view on the river
description:
We spend the afternoon here to search for dolphins. We saw many in the water :) Besides, it is also a nice place to have lunch. There are some trees for shadow and you can walk down to the river. During the weekend locals also use this place to relax.

Enjoy!

name: Pensión Churrasqueria
description: Super cheap, decent lunch ("almuerzo") for 10 bol. Very basic, large enough to host an Azerbaijani wedding.

name: Ruta 1 Side Road
description:
Beautiful spot. Just discovered puma poo and some bones after camp setup. If I don’t edit this, I was taken into the night by wildlife. 

Edit: We survived! Nice quiet spot, only one car drove by. Really cool salt and moss formations. Got down to -3C at night, but warmed right up in the sun in the morning. Wind wasn’t too terrible in our RTT.

name: Alojamiento Tucurpaya
description: Basic accommodation in nice village with some restaurants in the square. There are small private rooms and shared shower and toilets

name: YPFB
description:
Directly in the tank for local price. There is a watertap, but the water looked a bit brown. 

The friendly lady also offered us potable water. So we filled a 3l can with it. 

There is also a trash bin to throw away your stuff. Hopefully that will not end up in nature.

We gave her 10bs for her help.

Good luck!

name: Puerto Ballivian trail
description:
Nice trail into the forest. We walked it a few times and saw four species of monkeys: White-eared Titi, Azara's Night Monkeys, Bolivian Red Howler and Brown Capuchin. At the river side we saw Pink River Dolphins. The restaurants ask tourist prices (40-50 bs per plate). We asked the nearby restaurant if we could camp here. They said it was no problem because it was public property. 

Enjoy!

name: Tauca
description:
near church there is a kiosque were there is point of water
the habitant said is potable

name: Origenes - traditional dance show
description: 8-10pm Th-Sat, there is a traditional dance show. Amazing choreography, dancing and costumes. Really special experience! You can get dinner and drinks with the show if you’d like (dinner not that great). Reserve in advance online. All info can be found here: https://origenes.com.bo

name: Tupiza Tours
description: Very good place with good information on guided tours around Tupiza and Uyuni (including the salt flats). 3-5 days tours that go all across the Lopez area. Very friendly staff!

name: Cardozo Automotriz
description:
TO BE AVOIDED!
They replaced our head gasket, without remarking our pistons were broken! :( Resulting we had to reopen our motor... in an other place!

name: Between the cacti - for cyclists
description:
Nice flat place near the road, between some cactis with a good view. Hidden from the street, a little bit noisy, but no much traffic in the night.
A bit windy, but ok. No water. The ground is hard - we used a hammer and steel nadels andis was ok.
Entrance only with bicycles, maybe possible with motobike (a deep dig beside the road).

name: Hostel Florencia
description: Lovely hostel in Copacabana where we stayed having crossed the border from Peru on our bikes. There's plenty of room to store bikes and motorcycles, and they have space in the courtyard for vehicles too (maybe not too high). A private matrimonial room for two people cost 70 BOB, including a basic breakfast of bread, jam, fruit, and tea/coffee. The showers are really hot and the shared bathrooms are clean and equipped with soap and toilet roll. The room we had was beautifully decorated, spacious and practical with a comfortable bed. Only downside is lack of kitchen, but there was plenty of space for us to cook on our stove.

name: hotel
description:
I'm traveling by bicycle. as it was raining a lot it was not good for camping so i found this hotel.nice room. pity there is no bathroom in the room and it is also a bit expensive.$80 bolivian pesos
------------------------
estou viajando de bicicleta. como estava chovendo muito não estava bom para acampar então encontrei esse hotel.bom quarto. pena não ter banheiro no quarto e também um pouco caro.$80 pesos bolivianos

name: Taking this road to Chile
description:
Be prepared to be very remote on this route to Chile. To go thru the national park, you will need 150 B per person. You will not have cell phone service. You will be freezing cold. You will not have access to gas or ATM. You will be on a washboard road. 

We made a couple mistakes that cost us both our gas and our cash. After chatting with some of the tour guides, we realized we weren’t going to make it and had to turn back. Good luck!

name: Elevate Coffee
description: Incredible specialty coffee roaster run by a gorgeous couple. All coffee from local farmers in Bolivia. Great place to get a proper coffee and buy beans for your travels. Very cool spot and great atmosphere. Open Monday - Saturday 9 am to 1 pm.

name: Casa de Huéspedes Utasawa
description: Small, basic but friendly guesthouse in Tiwanaku. Secure parking in the courtyard for motos and bicycles. No wifi, lukewarm water but friendly owner (Maria), well located in the centre of the town and feels safe. There’s breakfast. About 50BOB for a room.

name: Elevate Coffee
description: Incredible specialty coffee roaster run by a gorgeous couple. All coffee from local farmers in Bolivia. Great place to get a proper coffee and buy beans for your travels. Very cool spot and great atmosphere. Open Monday - Saturday 9 am to 1 pm.

name: Simons Permaculture Farm
description:
This is a volunteer-run Eco farm that is mainly a learning centre for Permaculutre, that has space for campers and possible bungalow to rent if you ask in advance. Really cool vibe and friendly folk, bathroom/shower, animals, gardens. Turn off the main Rd between shops on a dirt road, follow past houses down a hill(easy for any vehicle) and you’ll see the blue buildings on your left.
Call or text Simon whatsapp: +59167470247
English/Spanish spoken.
Unsure of price as new to app, but recommend, such cool people!

name: Gravel pit Kiesgrube
description: Right next to the Road in a Gravel pit. A little Protected from the Wind and Weather. Good for one night.

name: Pato Motos - VW y Más
description: Leo and Tacu are brothers that are super welcoming to travelers and great mechanics. Leo has a kombi and ambitions of overlanding. They let you park in front of their house and are available to help with any issues you have and even teach you how to fix any issues going forward. The auto shop is down the road and I'll add a post for that location. This is the location of the house where you can park and sleep.  There's a blue gate with a VW logo. You can contact them via WhatsApp: Leo - +59177231513 Tacu - +59174055099

name: Drug trafficking area
description:
Several sources warned us that drugs trafficking takes place in this area (along the border with Brazil). Drive only during daylight and stay the night in a village, probably better not to wild camp.

Road conditions: all dirt road with stretches of washboard. We averaged 30 km/h with a 2wd camper.
From Santa Cruz we took ruta 4 (all asphalt), then ruta 17. There had been rain and the first 50km of the 17 were quite muddy.

name: Small tienda serving almuerzo
description: Small tienda with a good two course almuerzo (soup and main). We paid 34 BOB with some snacks. The senora was very friendly.

name: CULTURE & BIKES (Death Road Bike Tours)
description:
Tour company offering tours to bike the death road.

The tour was not bookable online, we messaged them and got two spots for the day after tomorrow. 

Tour was okay, we paid 300 BOB for a only front-suspension bike with hydraulic brakes. full-suspension was 450 BOB pP. (After doing the tour we should have paid more for full-suspension, it‘s worth it). Additionally, 50 BOB pP have to be paid for park entrance. Guide spoke very good English and explained well. Bus following us played very loud music while we were biking, which was a bit annoying. Both guides took many pictures and videos of us, which was necessary since the breaks were mostly too short to make pictures yourself. Also, guide was not aware of what was included in the tour and asked us. Most of the tour was as promised, but towels/soap for the shower after were not included, contrary to the tour description, and we had to pay 5 BOB pP for towels. Lunch was at a camping place with hotel. After we ate it, one of us got food poisoning and the other stomach pain. Maybe this was just a one time thing, but in our hostel someone told us they did a similar tour and also got sick because of the food. But we didn‘t ask which tour company they chose. So maybe bring lunch yourself to be on the secure side. Snacks (avocado, bread, bananas) were bought when we started and were nice.

name: Salt Hotel Camping
description:
Nights are very cold here ... so i asked the Salt Hotel if they offer camping as well and give me a power connection for the night! 
we agreed on 30Bs for the night! 
good warm sleep!

name: Lavanderia Roxana
description:
Simply the best lavanderia in town, with the nicest lady owning it. I found the options on iOverlander disappointing so I went on Google and found Roxana. She also does pick up and delivery. Her number is: +591 70321507

For 10Bob per kilo your laundry will be the cleanest it has ever been, cause low and behold, you can ask to use hot water, our dish towels were spot free for the first time in six months. Oh and it all will smell so great...

Not only that, but she used to work in a hostel and has a really big heart for travellers. We ended up parking in front of her house for about 10 days, we could use her wifi, and whenever she was home, take a shower and use the baño. And she's just really fun to hang out with. The street is not levelled but nothing a few blocks can't fix.

Oh and she also has the cutest dog and three cats. 

Hiiiighly recommended! 

Please say hi from Ben and Annie :)

Address is Avenida Benito Maria de Moxos 98, almost right next to the TDH burger place (nice burgers with well-baked (!!) fries for around 20bob). 

The house can be recognized by the little water drop (see photo), knock on the brown door or leave a message on WhatsApp.

name: YPFB
description: Generally only sells at international price with factura. Some have gotten 6 BOB/L sin factura later in the day.

name: wild camping with great view
description: We didn't see much places on the map, then we looked for one ourselves near to sucre. This spot is a paradise, up the cerro with a amazing view on sucre. Only 20 minutes north driving from sucre, take a gravel road on the left, go up, cross the village, and at one point you'll see a little path going up, go here and there is a flat grass area with stunning view on your left. We asked the lovely family who own the farm at the end of the path if we could stay they said yes it is a communal road with a large smile and even invited us to park in their farm, but it wasn't flat.. Very quiet if you don't wake up the dogs of the neighborhood at night!

name: Pato Motos - VW & More
description: Leo and his brother Tacu are mechanics sent from heaven for travelers.  Leo has a European Kombi and plans for overlanding in the near future.  They helped me do a general cleaning and maintenance for my Toyota 4Runner engine and changed out brake pads. They only wanted me to pay for the parts and cleaning supplies, but I also paid them for their work. Incredibly welcoming and kind people. See also the entry for their house, which is nearby. They allow you to park and sleep there while in El Alto. Here are their numbers: Leo - +591 77231513 Tacu - +591 74055099.  Highly recommend for any auto issue you may have in Bolivia.

name: Park and Juan Carlos
description: Stayed one night in the park, which was very calm and peaceful. The weather is perfect here. In the morning we met Juan Carlos and  his wife, and they were very kind and welcoming. They offered for us to use their bathroom and told us we could mention them in the app as they'd love to meet more travelers. As we had recently used the facilites in the Hipermaxi nearby we didn't accept the bathroom offer, but chatted with them a while. Very nice people. Here's their number +591 7374 7720. Feel free to reach out if you're in the area. Juan Carlos speaks a little English, but mostly Spanish. He's also a coronel of national security in Bolvia so he's a good contact to have if you come across any issues while traveling throughout Bolivia. The house with the pink walls in the photo is their place.

name: Overnight at Death Road
description: Good place to spend the night of you want a safe, quiet night with an awesome view. The farmer next to the place said no problem for us staying there. There are just some wild black bees. But no problem.

name: La Cintena Restaurant
description: Stopped here on the way to Tupiza from Tarija for lunch. Good meat BBQ almuerzo for 25b!

name: Laguna de tajsara
description:
Beautiful lake with hundreds of flamingoes… the road from Tarija to this spot and then onto Yunchara is paved and in perfect condition, few cars just perfect in every way! The dirt road onwards from there to the junction F14 is some of the most scenic and perfect dirt road we have come across in Bolivia! 
I highly recommend coming this way when going between Tarija and Tupiza or visa versa. Yes the dirt road is narrow but it’s in great condition and not used that much… if you have issues with heights and precipices, maybe avoid, otherwise don’t miss it, it’s awesome!!!
Oh yeah, lots of wildcamping options along the way for tents or vans. Perfect in every way!

name: Waterfall Cuevas
description: 3 small but super nice waterfalls in this parc. 20 bob entrance. Super easy and fast hike to all 3 of them. The first one has a jump platform. Water is chilly. Weekends a lot of local people hanging around.

name: Sheltered camp next to road
description: Camp by the side of the road, perfectly sheltered from the wind by a man-made rock wall. Perfect for cyclists with enough space for a 2-man tent.

name: Next to the river
description: A nice grassy area to sleep. It is lower than the road and you can drive a bit further away from the road. You are not totally hidden, but in the dark we didn't mind.

name: Next to old Bridge
description:
This is the only place we found with water in the river. All the others river spots where dry. It is partially hidden from the road, vut we can still hear the trafic. Some locals came by to have a walk along the river, and when we arrived, on a sunday afternoon, a local family who was camping here for the weekend was about to leave. We camped next to the ruins of the old Bridge and the huge cactus.
This is a sandy road, so we didn't go down the river as the falily yold us they got stuck. But doable with a 4x4 as there were one down there. Felt very safe! Entel signal.

name: Wild camp near to a dry river
description: This in the middle of the bolivian plateu (altiplano). Theres no river now. is quite..on the way to sajama for alternatives routes. Bike

name: Next to Rosario town
description: Is in between some walls of sand. Used to be a river, depends on the season. I didnt want to stay at the town but further there was no protection from the wind which is really strong. On the way to Sajama.

name: Chocopampa Village
description: This is the house of Rosa. But Im pretty sure in the front school or any yard has a space available to put the tent. is quite hard to get here and no places on the road. Beautiful bolivian little village.

name: Pichaca School "Okoruro"
description: This is the town's school. The wind outside is so strong I ask for a place to camp and they offer me a salon. Really nice people. Nobody marked this route before is georgeous land, but really hard conditions.

name: Thermal baths
description: These are beautiful thermal baths. The owner Doña Micaela is a really nice lady. Views to the Sajama and all others nevados.  They have rooms and food, you can also put the tent. I enjoyed so much

name: Trans Cabrera a Salinas de Garci
description: Here you find the mini buses to Salinas de Garci, Tahua and all this route near to Uyuni.  30 or 25 bblvs pp, depends on the kind of bus.

name: Side road with open area
description:
This place is a little bit further from the main road. You take the side road uphill and find on your right a grassy open area. It is flat enough for a normal car and you can pitch a tent next to your car. Great mobile signal with Entel.

Enjoy!

name: Unividad seguros
description: Place to get soat, we paid 140 for the rest of the year. Its now october. We drive a gmc savana 2007. Fast and friendly staff

name: Pull out
description: A nice flattish area to overnight next to the road. You can park your car here and pitch a tent. Some traffic during the night but it was ok.

name: Next to the main road
description:
Nice place to stay the night. It is near the main road. During the night it is difficult to see that you parked your car here. There are not many options on this road. So this one can be nice when it is late.

Enjoy!

name: Manjari Express (Comedor Vegetariano)
description: Delicious comedor with menu for 25bs. Its ran by a very kind Colombian guy. The lunch comes with sopa, segundo and a refresco natural.

name: Cafe La Plata
description: By far the best coffee around, extensive selection menu. Even have different bean blends to choose from. They also have fresh cakes and light lunch/dinner options. Well-presented old colonial building inside. Worth it if you are a coffee lover.

name: Near rocks and boulderfield
description: Clear from winds. Just outside of hizo (you can fill up water there.  Bring your climbing shoes and boulderpad because the limestone is sharp and looks amazing for climbing.

name: Artes Gráficas Yael
description: Simply a place to get water as you need it.

name: Alojamiento Mayli
description:
Small and basic Hostal, has safe close parking for motorbikes and cars, i got a single room with TV and shared bathroom for $30 Bs

I good for 1 night and continue travel

name: Residencial AMILJAIM JHOS
description: Small and basic hostel, the customer service is terrible, the lady who attends the hostel speaks badly to the customers. I paid $35 Bs for a single room without a shower and a shared bathroom. Paso Hostel. The bathroom Suck. Parking included for cars and motorcycles

name: Quiet camping spot next to the lake
description: We decided to add this lovely camping spot even though there were already other ones checked in in the same area. The "beach"/"tortuga isla" area where you can find the other spots might be super busy as it's a touristy place, mostly for locals. (we think there is an entrance fee between 8am and 5pm). We arrived on a Sunday, around 5pm and it was still full of people bathing, playing music, relaxing, etc. Not quiet at all. So we decided to go a bit further where you can see big trees on your right. Perfect spot. Quiet, unreachable with a car, only with bicycles. View on the lake (and the sunset!). Protected by the wind thanks to the big eucalyptus.

name: Hostal Samy
description: Good hostel, paid 100bol for a matrimonial. Very hot and nice shower. Not super clean, seems like they don't have guests very often. Spacious rooms, owner is nice. We had a little leakage from the bathroom. There is a place behind a gate where we parked our bicycles, seems like that might be used for cars or motorbikes as well.

name: Near Tiwanaku in wildfield
description:
Good place for one night in wildfield near Tiwanaku. A little bit of circulation in the evening but not at night. Clean. Cows in the morning.

Bonne place pour une nuit. C'est un spot dans les pâturages proche de Tiwanaku. Il y a un peu de circulation le soir mais aucune la nuit. C'est propre. Le matin, il peut y avoir des vaches dans le champ.

name: Cafetería Anny
description: Perfect place to stop for some food before or after crossing the salar. We had breakfast here of egg sandwiches with tomato and plantain and they were delicious. The owner is very friendly and keeps a record of all the tourists passing through!

name: in the bush
description: quiet and safe place. didnt find the other iover spot. full of place in the ripio road check Screenshot of mapsme

name: Countryside road
description:
Nice and quiet place to enjoy the stars.
Just off the main road.

name: Sandy Hill Crossing need 4x4
description:
Steep sandy hill to get to Laguna Kara. Don't try unless you have 4x4. Might be able to make it with my 2x4 4Runner but my friend in a kombi definitely can't pass.

Update we were able to go down and around the sand hill and found hard pact tracks to go up. Made it down to Laguna Kara for the night. Leaving towards tree de arbol was also lots of steep and sandy tracks, but was able to tow my friend in his kombi with my 2wd 4Runner

name: Isla Incahuasi
description: You can drive from the north as well east entrance directly to the Isla Incahuasi. Beautiful Island with a lot of cactus. We drove from the east entrance via Dakar Monumental to Isla Incahuasi and further to Coqueza (north entrance) with our Ford E350. The road is bumpy but possible without 4x4 (dry season). Just follow the visible road.

name: Toilet and shower
description: Clean bathrooms to use. If you make the hike up to the mirador Volcan Tunupa and you pay the entrance of 30 Bols then you can use the bathrooms for free. If not you pay 2 Bols.

name: On the way to canyon del inca
description: Nice place 5 mins driving from the city center, on the way to canyon del inca with a scenic landscape and amazing stars and milkyway. We've been to this spot 3 times and always felt safe. There are a few dogs but they are not bothering. Easily accessible for all tyoe of vehicules.

name: Ciclomundo bikeshop
description:
It was a bit hard to find high end bike stuff in La Paz. We found this shop with decent stuff - sealant, tyres, giant and specialized stuff. They sell jerseys and kits too. Staff is super kind and helpful 

They have mechanical/taller service too.

name: General pando town
description:
Small town with 3-4 tiendas with basic stuff: bread, oats, some fruit (No paltas when we were there), pasta and some energy drinks. 

There’s a small park with a big covered kiosk where you can camp. We asked in one of the tiendas and they sent us to the towns president/leader. Very kind guy!

name: Canquingora town
description: Covered kiosk with walls and some wind protection. Two tiendas with basic stuff

name: Jayuma llallagua town
description: Small town with small salar. Camping at the capilla or the school. We just passed by but chatted with folks there and they were super kind. Water from neighbors and 1-2 poorly stocked tiendas

name: Spigot in Cantua plaza
description: Two spigots in the middle of the dirt plaza. There’s also a covered kiosk and a very poorly stoked tienda. We purified the water just in case

name: Ulloma - kiosk
description:
Very friendly folks here! Covered kiosk with access to two spigot right next to the kiosk

Two basic tiendas

name: BCP bank.
description: Bcp bank. With a revolut mastercard you can take money without paying commision.

name: Hospedaje Latitudes Huayllajara
description: This hostel had a warm shower for 15bol, not all the hostels in this town have this. 100bol for a matrimonial with shared bathroom. The duena is nice and friendly. She also has a small tienda when you ask for it. We could store our bicycles inside. At night the tour groups arrive. There is a nice comedor where we were allowed to cook our meal and eat while the tour groups were waiting for their meals :) There is no sign outside the place that this is a hostel, we just asked around. 20bol for a nice vegetarian lunch

name: Sajama checkpoint
description: You can ask at the hostel to get the key for the church. It costs 10 Bol pp and is really worth it. Beside you can see the documentation center of the village and in the hostel you can also find handcraft made things from Lamas and Alpacas wool from the community. The village is small but much nicer than Sajama in our opinion. Really worth the drive from Sajama.

name: Simple meals
description:
This was the only place that was open at 6:30pm - we ordered the menu, it came with a soup, a plate with rice and egg and a cup of tea. It was 15bs. If you don’t want the egg you could get cheese. They also cheese, a piece for 10bs.
