The restaurant is simple and it also has a small store with some snacks and beer and other basic stuff like cookies, juices and toilet paper.

name: Tienda  Sajama Théodora
description:
Small well-stocked tienda and restaurant. Lady running it is super nice. Bread and cheese sold too. She's also the owner of beautiful Thermal baths in the thermal area (see the iOverlander point "Theodora Thermal baths".)
Theodora's number is : +59173229327

name: Chambi taller
description: The mecanic indicate in overlander had moved to La Paz. We found this one by asking the licals. He did  a complete revision, we arrived before he had finished and we could see that he had take apart everything and he showed us what piece he changed. He was great the only thing is that he didn't respect the deadline.

name: Hotel colonial
description:
Nice hotel for 340bob for a triple room with private bathroom, swimming pool and breakfast is inclued (no breakfast on sunday). There is a secure parking. Height restriction : 2m20.
——
Hotel 3 étoiles. 340bob pour une chambre triple avec salle de bain privée, piscine. Le petit-déjeuner est inclus (pas de petit-déjeuner le dimanche). Ils ont un garage (hauteur max : 2m20).

name: Casa Chica Corasón Grande
description: Cheap lodging, very good attention from Rosita the hostess, hot water, and parking for motorcycles.

name: Rio Copabera
description: We tried to get to the futher ones but there is now a gate wich is closed all time. We took the way back and saw a small road made by the locals that lead to the river. We parked there 5meters away from the water not really visible from the road. We forgot to take the localisation but it seems to be here.

name: Riverside
description: Big flat area, coming from Potosi just after the bridge on the right. easy to find. next to river for cleanup. Road is nearby so we heard trucks during nights but very few. quite but not perfectly hidden with the little bush.

name: Joaquin Tapicería Jimenez.R
description:
Joaquín done a fantastic job on repairing my motorcycle seat. 
Has 35 years experience.
Works from home. 
Good price. 
Paid 50bvs to repair my seat.
Excellent job, very happy. 
When you arrive you will see a white building. He is inside. 

If you can not find just ask neighbours they all know him.

name: Next to the Pilcomayo River | Al lado del Río Pilcomayo
description:
We spent a night on the banks of the river in front of the Tuunteytas hotel. We talked to the owner and he told us that it was a safe place.

The sunset looks beautiful and it is very calm. There are no services of any kind.
.---
Pasamos una noche a orillas del Río frente al hotel Tuunteytas. Hablamos con el dueño y nos dijo que era un lugar seguro.

El atardecer se ve lindo y es muy tranquilo. No hay servicios de ningún tipo.

name: Lavado (Car wash)
description: Quick, good-quality and cheap local car wash. The guy is trustworthy and hardworking! Highly recommended. We paid 30 BOL

name: Car wash
description: Good place to wash your car. They do the outside and also the inside. Nice folks. Van for 30bob.

name: Wi-Fi Corner
description:
We spent 3 nights between 2 kombis parked on that street because of the free WiFi and it was excellent. 

Street a little busy, but all the people passing by were nice and kind, and greeted us. We were opposite the shower which was great, the laundry which was a great price, a bakery and the free wifi worked well. 

We parked in front of a Repuestos de Motos store that closed, so we didn't disturb the trade. We felt very safe and calm, all the residents were very kind. The bakery owner even offered us hot water.

In the same place there was a space with a shared kitchen for rent, as well as a bathroom (1BOB) at Duchas Paraíso. Great place!

Passamos 3 noites entre 2 kombis estacionadas nessa rua por causa do Wi-Fi gratuito e foi excelente. 

Rua um pouco movimentada, mas todas as pessoas que passavam eram simpáticas e gentis, e nos cumprimentavam. Ficamos em frente à ducha, que era ótima, à lavanderia, que tinha um ótimo preço, a uma padaria e o wifi gratuito funcionava bem. 

Estacionamos na frente de uma loja de Repuestos de Motos que fechou, então não atrapalhamos o comércio. Nos sentimos muito seguros e tranquilos, todos os moradores foram muito gentis. O dono da padaria nos ofereceu até água quente.

Nesse mesmo lugar havia um espaço com cozinha compartilhada para alugar, além de banheiro (1BOB) na Duchas Paraíso. Ótimo lugar!

name: Church Parking
description: Small church where I was told I could pitch my tent. Far enough from road and not much traffic. Larger rig would fit if needed.

name: Camping Shop
description:
This place is a small camping shop. You can buy back packs. Camping gas 
Propane Gas for small gas stoves other little bits and pieces

name: Lake Titicaca
description: Very quiet place, only a few cars pass here daily. You can safely park next to the road, levelled spot not hard to find. There's a wooden bench in front of the lake you can relax on. We had this strip of the beach to ourselves. Lots of food stalls about a 20min walk, 5, 10 mins more to the center of town. You can have your car blessed at the basilica, don't forget to give your ride a hat!

name: Parqueo Witches Markey
description: opposite the witches market, no height restriction, huge parking lot, safe overnight. Paid 30 Bols

name: Flat camping spot
description: Flat camping spot next to a dry river bed and surrounded by mountains. (cyclist info --> not really any other spot before and some more climb ahead.

name: Hostal Rosita 1
description: Hard to find something cheap and rather clean. It was not perfect but the price was fair compared to others who also make you pay an extra 10 bob for the shower. Here the price was 35bob pp, shower included. You can also try the Hostal Rosita 2 a fit further. No wifi. Same street, one block down the street at the corner (left) you found a small tienda with fruits and veggies. And even a bit further after the second square, at the other corner on the right side, a slightly bigger tienda selling things cheaper than in other places (blue building).

name: MOTORCYCLE SHOP WITH TYRES
description:
Very nice little motorcycle shop. 
Has alot of thing for motorcycles. 
Has tyres batteries all parts for small motorcycles

name: lake titikaka (sanca jahuira)
description:
we followed the dirty road that goes to the lake, there are places to camp, with beautiful view. 
we asked a local if we could stay for the night, he said it was ok but not on the place next to the houses, because people pass there to go to the field/lake. 
some people passed in the morning, no problem. 
we had a good night :)

name: Kiosk for camping
description: Looks like a good option for camping in a tiny/safe village. Tienda nearby. Water tab but no water when we were there.

name: Camping spot protected by building
description: Camping spot option next to a huge abandonned new building, unfortunately closed. Good protection though and a bit outside town. A tienda with everything needed nextdoor. Also a tab with water at disposition.

name: Villa Victoria
description:
a tiny pueblo where all its people are very helpful. We ended up here because my partner had his sight damaged due to the salar de coipasa where we biked all day (WEAR SUNGLASSES!!!).

 we arrived at 6:30pm the pueblo was completely empty so we just camped in front of the school. the next day my partner couldn't cycle bc he couldn't see anything and there was no car to ask for a ride to Llica where there's hospital. but the people from the village got us a room to rest, drops and cream for the eye. we spent the rest of the day recovering there.

the lady who owns the only tiny tienda in town (very basic stuff) also offered to cook us some food. everyone very helpful and nice!!

name: Tarabuco - Old Train Sation
description: Flat place just few hundred meters away from the main square. Big quiet spot which you can enter and leave when the market is open. Friendly people around.

name: La casa de la baterías
description:
Found gel cell batteries, for a solar panel. Lot of brands and different V and A.

Found baterías de gel, for solar panel. Lot of brands and different V ans A

name: Chaperia y pintura
description: Nice place if you are missing a bumper or need a repare with plastic fiber

name: Tienda
description: Good tienda with lots of biscuits and sweets but as well pasta, tuna, ice-creams, beverages.

name: For [moto]cyclists: Unfinished building
description: Unfinished red brick building without roof but great windshelter. Good spot to break up the distance between Uyuni and the start of the Lagunas Route or if the afternoon headwind gets too gnarly. Two rooms both with enough space for at least a two person tent, a bit scattered with building material inside but I cleared out one of the rooms. Quiet night, morning sun. Only minor anoyance was the little wetland I crossed to get to the house but your feet dont get wet.

name: Ciudad Encanto - 4x4 only!
description:
Nice  place to stay, you can hide from the wind with the rock formations.
Nobody but us.

Access by car, but only by 4x4 with good clearance, even though a part of the road is new. The road is not easy!
We went there from Tupiza, but you can also access it from Laguna Colorada. 
Depending on the road conditions, you might have to cross large sandy areas and cross rivers. You should avoid going there in the rainy season or without a guide.
We used OSM maps to find the way.

name: Delicious and cheap lunch
description:
Good restaurant where locals go, in a nice frontyard atmosphere.
they serve arroz chofa and pasta chofa for 15bs and delicious lasagnas for 20. Veggie options of everything available. Good wifi. Large choice of fresh juice.

name: Kiosk with snacks
description: This is the only tienda around. It’s very simple - only has some snacks, beer and bottled water.

name: Hostal Loma Jara (good!)
description:
Bed for 40bs and that price included:

tea time (6pm - cookies and several cups of tea), 
dinner (7pm, soup and pasta), and 
breakfast (6-8am, pancakes and granola). 
This was a fantastic deal! The staff was very kind and they let us store our bikes in an empty room they had.

We were 4 and got a room with six beds with a private toilet. No showers available but you can bathe at the hot springs. We filled up our bottles with clean potable water from the spigot inside the hotel.

We were there in mid November/22 and they were building a new section up front so from the outside the place looked messy, but the rooms are clean and there’s couches to sit around. Would recommend!

name: Bus company 6 de Octubre
description: Good bus company for night bus to Sucre called "6 de octubre". 70bob p/p one way.

name: Police checkpoint
description: You need to stop here and show your papers and prove that you paid the toll in order to be allowed passage. Only in the direction of Coroico.

name: YPFB
description: We managed to get 20 liters sin factura (3.75 bol/liter) with a copy of our passport/driver licence.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Get out of your car, go to the police office with your Toll ticket, and get it stamped. No fees.

name: taller automotriz Marvi
description: We went there to paint our car door, nice job, fast (one day). It cost 550bs for 1 door, it is a good price and an honest job from what we saw here in lapaz. We went the on the recommendation of Marcos of camping Las Lomas. A friend went there to change brakes and other part of his car.

name: Cataratas El Jardin de las Delicias
description: Paradise in the Middle of the jungle. waterfall, fresh water, you have to park at the entrance. no sign but follow the path, Walk about 20min. and enjoy !!! you can find the road on mapsme... Not for rainy season !!!

name: Checkpoint
description:
Recebemos um papel para ser entregue na saída de São Vicente.

Got a small paper to show/hand over at the next checkpoint.

name: Hotel Oasis Chiquetano
description:
Small hotel, paid 250 bolivianos for 2 persons, with AC. There is an option of 200 bolivianos, but no AC.

Wi-Fi is only good near the reception.

Breakfast included (coffee, one slice of cake and a toast cut in half)

name: Bio-Sushi
description: what a surprise to find this place! very very good sushi!!! open only the weekend. this place have also a swimming pool, open every day!

name: Presa de colas Wila Khara
description: Small flat pitch approx. 50 meter above the level of the dry lagoon. Last few kilometers on smooth gravel and last few honderd meters some small rocks. Not suitable for big rigs. 2WD is easy to do. Quiet night and great sunrise overlooking the lagoon.

name: Laguna Qllpaqucha
description:
Large public space in front of Salina de Cochabamba. It's a big flat field with a few cows grazing, lots of birds. The neighbor is a very kind gentleman. At this time of year the lagoon is completely dry, but even if there was water, it is salty, so there are no fish to catch. There is a 3G signal from Entel, even if it is bad. 10 minutes away is the village of Vacas, where the internet works better, there are markets and a tap to get water. Very safe.

Grande espaço público em frente à Salina de Cochabamba. É um grande campo plano com algumas vacas pastando, muitos pássaros. O vizinho é um senhor muito gentil. Nessa época do ano a lagoa está completamente seca, porém mesmo que tivesse água, ela é salgada, então não há peixes para pescar. Há sinal 3G da Entel, mesmo que ruim. 10 minutos para trás fica o povoado de Vacas, onde a internet funciona melhor, há mercados e torneira para pegar água. Seguro.

name: Taller de radiadores
description: We had some trouble with the radiator coming from Coroico. They helped us out in a couple of hours for a good price. Can recommend.

name: Hotel Martinez
description:
200 Bolivians at night double room, private bathroom, Wi-Fi, breakfast included of very good quality, you can park the motorcycle at the reception. Discount if you are a motorcyclist as the owner, we pay 180 Bolivians for two. This option is much better than the hotels near the former terminal where prices are between 120-180 Bolivians, with shared bathrooms, without parking.

-------------------------------------------------------

200 Bolivianos la noche habitación doble, baño privado, Wifi, desayuno incluído de muy buena calidad, se puede parquear la moto en la recepcion. Descuento si eres motociclista como el dueño, pagamos 180bolivianos por dos. Esta opcion es mucho mejor que los hoteles cerca a la ex terminal donde los precios están entre 120-180 bolivianos, con baño compartido, sin parqueadero.

name: HOT SPRINGS INCUYO AGUAS THERMAS
description:
Nice hot springs 
little Rock pools 
very warm 
rough road to get in 
pools are about 1km further from this GPS POINT

name: Alojamiento Gutiérrez
description: 60bol double room, shared bathroom, wifi and parking for 4 motorcycles. We decided to come here because the other only accommodation available in Confital had no electricity, Wi-Fi, or hot water, and it cost 120 bol.

name: Quarry camping spot
description: Camping spot in a quarry. Only place found before the village to put up our tent and be protected by the wind. (travelling with bicycle!)

name: Houses between the rocks
description: Some old houses built in the rocks, very cool looking.

name: Jin Repair Shop
description:
Had a water pump problem on our Defender, Jin and his family were very helpful, letting us stay in the car and use water/electricity and bathroom for the two days that took to fix. Had to go to Cochabamba to get spares.

Charged 200 bs for the repair and 500 for the parts.

name: quiet place
description: Hard to find a good spot! After pass several bad spots or no more existent spot, we found this one ! Only 2 min from the main road, the access is easy and big flat space! Wind protected and no noise from the road! The view is not bad! We travel with a big camping-car so don't be afraid about dirt road.

name: Hotel Villamontes
description:
The hostel in Villamontes offers showers at US$2. Room with shared bathroom $15, double bed for two people.

El hostal en Villamontes, ofrece duchas a 2 dólares. Habitación con baño compartido 15 dólares, cama de dos plazas para dos personas.

name: Reineke Fuchs German Restaurant
description:
wide variety of beers and typical german food (sausages, soups, schnitzel, desserts - mostly meat, but also some veggie and vegan options) - check out their homepage for the menu

typical gasthaus athmosphere (but latin american music), very friendly staff, middle to high prices

name: Cabaña Apolobamba
description: I spent 3 nights here, it's a good base for exploring the area, it's covered from the wind and next to the river.

name: Mercado 8 de Diciembre Chasquipampa
description: Great farmer's market with plenty of fruits and veggies. The ladies are super nice and you can have a bite onsite if you're hungry.

name: SIM cards at Entel Main Office
description: If you want to by a bolivian chip, that's the place to go, very friendly and helpful, even if your spanish is not so good... bougtht a chip prepago, there are a few options (days and gb), you give them your passport, pay and they install everything for you

name: YPFB Patacamaya
description:
It has a faucet and we were able to carry water in drums.
.
Tiene una canilla y pudimos cargar agua en bidones.

name: Tienda without name sells garafons
description: Potable water is hard to find in Bolivia so I was happy to see that this tienda sells garafons for 20bol. Watch the road for tiendas, she had a garafon outside covered by cardboard. If you can't find it, just ask around. It's on the main road and easy to park. We could fill the water into our tank on the spot so no need to swap garafons.

name: Juan Valdez Café
description: Café with high quality coffee, many desserts (cheesecake, muffins, brownie, cakes, juices and sandwiches...) Came here three times in two days :friendly staff, good wifi

name: Hospedaje Luan
description: We stayed in a private room with shared bathroom for 40 Bol per person. There were other people who were here with a tour. We could not have dinner here, so we went into the village

name: Abandoned building next to the road
description: This building at the crossing is empty, did not finish building it. it's trashy outside and surprisingly clean inside (dusty floor), many rooms to put your tent, you're hidden from the road and protected from wind and rain, was kind of an emergency stop for me, but i actually liked it here

name: small riverlet with fresh water
description: Filled up my bottles before cycling further down, very fresh water

name: Alejandro Ortiz Mecanic
description:
Alejandro is a fan of vintage cars and a great mechanic. He helped us with our 1986 van which had broken down. He and his workshop mates worked all day and in the end they didn't accept any pay! He said that the payment bothered him and that he had done everything just to help us. The same with our friends with a 2007 kombi, they fixed it and didn't accept payment. Great people, they helped us a lot and our car was excellent. This is the workshop's address, but you can talk directly to him via WhatsApp: +591171107672, and say that Ana and Anderson from Vibe de Dois said hello!
---
Alejandro é um fã de carros antigos e um grande Mecânico. Ele nos ajudou com a nossa kombi 1986 que havia quebrado. Ele e seus companheiros de oficina trabalharam o dia inteiro e no fim não aceitaram nenhum pagamento! Disse que o pagamento incomodava e que havia feito tudo só para nos ajudar. O mesmo com nossos amigos com uma kombi 2007, consertaram e não aceitaram pagamento. Ótimas pessoas, nos ajudaram muito e nosso carro ficou excelente. Esse é o endereço da oficina, mas você pode falar diretamente com ele pelo WhatsApp: +591171107672, e diga que Ana e Anderson do Vibe de Dois mandou um ola!

name: Villa Viscarra Road
description: On the road from Chaguarani toward Villa Viscarra, the road is damaged on one side, and has become very narrow, with steep banks on both sides (see picture). We did not try to pass with our Ford E150. Should be ok for smaller cars. There is a muddy side road around the damaged part, so it should be ok for 4WD.

name: Shower next to the Adalia Restaurant
description:
We stopped at the Adalia restaurant to try to negotiate a shower. However, the bath is in a green gate next to the restaurant. Jorge received us very kindly. He charged 5 bolivianos per person. Very hot bath.

Paramos no restaurante Adalia para tentar negociar um banho. No entanto, o banho é em um portão verde ao lado do restaurante. Jorge nos recebeu com muita gentileza. Cobrou 5 bolivianos por pessoa. Banho muito quente.

name: Dentist Centro Odontólogico Bascón
description: Best dentist in town. Went there to clean the teeth professionally and a friend went there due to a pain in one teeth after being at the other dentist in town (no recommendation for that one). This dentist cleaned everything nicely, fixed the broken teeth & made a fair price.  A professional clean is 200bob.  Opens from 3:30-8:30 pm.

name: LAVADO FULL LIMPO (CAR WASH)
description:
Here is a proper car wash with 3 boys who can hand wash your car. 
They can do motorcycles also. 
very clean place 
concrete floor not sand or rocks like some. 
good prices

name: On the road to Comunidad Esperanza
description:
We tried both spots by the lagoon/lake but we either couldn't fit or couldn't get out of the car because of the hundreds of mosquitoes. We drove the road all the way to the community, we asked people if we could park for the night and we found a plat spot right by the road.
Super quiet, plenty of jungle noise (parrots, hummingbirds, hurling monkeys...) and we saw capibara.
Please don't leave anything behind you (trash, toilet paper...)

name: Police / Toll
description: Police checkpoint before the tall heading to Trinidad. They asked for driving licence and TIP, checked our entry date, asked a couple questions and eventually let us go.

name: El Mirador
description:
We got gasolina in the tank at local price, they didn't even ask for our ID/driving licence.
The bathrooms are very clean and there's a shop and a small café that serves food. 
Open 24/7.

name: Fundacion Salud Rio Beni Clinica
description:
When to this clinic for stomach problems, we wait 30min to see a doctor, he was nice, and they have a laboratory on the same place, you don't have to go somewhere else for blood or something else sample. Wait for 1h for the result. They give us the prescription and the Officine is right on the corner.
Recommended!
Price 80ps for consultation
350 for blood an test samples

name: MT service ford
description:
Went there to change the fuel pump, the price for the spare part and the obra de manos was 1000bs. they work fast 1/2 day to change it. The owner Furbi agreed that we post its number on this app : +591 77766660
They are Ford specialists

name: grassy flat area
description: Large flat grass area, suitable for small or big rigs, just aside the road. Nobody except cows and a gently woman in the morning. Great view as well!

name: Uyuni - Tacuru Restaurant
description:
very nice restaurant with local food, Pizza & Pasta (home made) 
nice service

name: public toilets and showers
description: 3 BOB, very clean showers! 1BOB for toilets. Great to cool off in the hot jungle days. Next to the building live a few families on the streets with young kids. We gave the kids coloured pens and paper and they were really happy with that. Maybe bring some toys or food for them :)

name: Ramos Competicion
description: In this place you will find a very friendly and very professionnal mecanico. The boss Alvaro, will help you for every needs. They did a very good work on our Chevrolet motorhome. we had a big problem with brakes, After 4 mecanico in 3 different country and no one able to fix it... they did!!! this is the number of Alvaro fill free to contact him! +591 70765227 . he will change the place of is garage in few month but not far from this location. 2min.

name: E.S. Dayana
description: Possible to fill your tank for the national price sin factura with a little tip for the guy working there.

name: buen descanso hostel
description: Great hostel dorms single rooms shared shower coffee tee free fridge available big market fruit vegetables right outside space for bikes in court yard very friendly staff and not as pricey as in town food available around hostel and it's a save area

name: Nice town square with flowers
description:
A very nice town square filled with trees and flowers in a quiet village. The kids come to play, the elderly come to chit-chat, very laid-back atmosphere.
There's drinkable water and an Entel Wifi hotspot (2 hours for free).

name: Duchas en la calle
description:
Public bathrooms and showers.

14 bolivianos the 30-minute bath for 2 people.
6 bolivianos for 10 minutes for 1 people.

Relatively clean, spacious and warm. worth much

Banheiros e duchas públicas.

14 bolivianos o banho de 30 minutos para 2 pessoas.
6 bolivianos o banho de 10 minutos, para 1 pessoa.

Relativamente limpo, espaçoso e quente. Vale muito a pena!

name: Banco fortaleza - no fees up to 3500 bol
description: We tried 5 different ATMs and this one finally worked. it's even free and has a high limit (3500 bol).

name: Hostal El paraíso de Maty
description:
Hostel in Villa Tunari. Good location on the road. A touristy and quiet place to spend the night, within walking distance to the market, park and restaurants. 

Hostal en Villa Tunari buena ubicación en la carretera un lugar turístico y tranquilo para pasar la noche, caminando se llega al mercado, parque y restaurantes.

name: Water Spigot/ Pileta across from Hostal
description: Tap with water in town next to Salar Uyuni

name: Big clay pit for tents
description: there are some old brick factories here and in the big, unused clay pit north of them there is plenty of space to camp ... it's close to the road, you can hear traffic, but you are not visible, as your are about 3 meters below surface, no houses or dogs around ... flat, open area for tents

name: Sauna Nilo Dorado
description:
Excellent place for a bath. We were charged 45 bolivianos for 1 hour of showers. We were between 2 couples and we were able to shower each couple separately within that 1 hour. Com sauna. Clean.
---
Excelente lugar para o banho. Nos cobraram 45 bolivianos para 1 hora de chuveiros. Estavamos entre 2 casais e pudemos tomar banho cada casal separado dentro dessa 1 hora.  Chuveiro e sauna juntos. Muito limpo.

name: Hotel Los Pinos
description:
Guanay is known as the bolivian La Vegas, you will see why. This place is out of the busy center and all the party during 7 days a week, Guanay is super noisy.... bikes, bars, drinks, trucks... etc. 
The owner let us to stay at the parking area, is flat and there is shower and bathroom.

name: Los Sauces YPFB
description:
Friendly pump attendant, filled directly into the tank at the local price, gave a nice helping hand.
---
Pompiste sympathique, rempli directement dans le réservoir au prix local, donné une belle bonne-main.

name: Tambo Señoral
description: Good local restaurant to eat a K'alaphurka, a big typical soup (beef or veggie) served with a smoking hot volcanic stone in the bowl. It was delicious!

name: Primavera
description: had a very good almuerzo here, the place looks a bit unfinished and raw, but very friendly people, 12bs

name: Tiendas
description: there's a few tiendas here, this one has quite a lot of things in offer

name: beside Rio LaPaz
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Flash floods reported in this location. Please use caution 

after passing the Bridge ( coming from south) there it is a small track leading to flat areas beside the river.
A Caravan of donkeys loaded with mangos came out of the valley - they were very friendly.

name: big flat place
description:
a big flat area in ground of an abandoned hall of Chinese mining workers. 
we asked locals and they agreed to stay here overnight.
little "jungle" nearby

name: Hostal Ariana
description:
I paid 60 Bs / night for a simple room with new furniture and a shared bathroom. Good wifi, warm showers, clean amenities, close to Mercado Central. Should be able to store bicycles here, though you'll have to haul them up some stairs

Issues: Noise: Loud pump that turns on every time some uses water, loud doorbell, other guests woke me up early in the morning. Cannot wash clothes here, though laundry services are a short walk away.

name: The real Aduanas for extending TIP
description:
You will need copies of all documents including a letter explaining why you need an extension and proof of that excuse. In my case I had an injury and could not ride my motorcycle so I provided a note from a doctor. Other examples would be a note from a mechanic or any proof of your circumstances. If you can't physically bring your vehicle, you can show them pictures that show the VIN and license plate.

DO NOT OVER STAY YOUR TIP IN BOLIVIA. They WILL impound your vehicle when you try to leave. It happened to my friend last week.

Note: the other location downtown is not correct, and even the person commenting with a different address is incorrect. It is an aduanas office but you cannot extend your TIP there. This ONLY can be done at the airport location.

name: military base
description: potable water tank on a military base by train tracks

name: Roadside
description: Where the road crosses a dry river turn left and ~100m after there's a small stone wall in the bushes which makes a decent shelter from the strong wind.

name: SENASAG
description:
Here you make the documents to travel with your pet abroad.

The certificate costs 277 bolivianos and takes 48 to get ready. Requirements in the attached photo.

Aqui você faz os documentos para viajar com seu pet para o exterior.

O certificado custa 277 bolivianos e leva 48 pra ficar pronto. Exigências na foto anexa.

name: Servicio de frenos - Break repair
description:
very nice and competent break repair ,"Robert Iño" 
he fixed our breakes (new blades, we  had with us) immediately and cheap.

name: Toll point
description: Here’s an official toll point and charges you 5 BOB

name: Alojamiento Bulo Bulo
description: This hostel in the middle of town looks à bit shabby on the outside. But inside it’s fine. Rooms are clean, shower is good. We paid Bob 180 for a double room. Bikes can be parked inside and a car too.

name: VIDAL LUBRICENTRO
description:
Found this fantastic shop that sells oil and coolant for everything car and motorcycle. 

Very clean workshop. Lovely lady at the counter. 

You can buy the products you need and they do it or just buy the products. 

Extremely clean and well organised. As good if not better than Europe standards. 

Good prices.

name: TORNERIA (LATHE TURNING SHOP)
description:
Any Lathe work you may require. 

very good work 

lost the lid to my tool box made me a new one. 
not cheap buy professional older men not kids.

name: Adriazol Servicio Caja y Corona
description: Had a problem with the gear shift, got this adress from a friend. Drove there unannounced, they made room for us by pushing another car out into the street. The owner suspected the problem was the gear shift oil, he couldn’t do the oil change the same afternoon because he had to finish another car first. But he let us stay on the premises for the night, safe and guarded by 2 lovely dogs. Next morning they changed the oil, problem solved, 600 bol for 4 liters of oil and the work. Nice people, can recommend!

name: agua en la estación de servicio
description:
After loading our diesel drums at a Bolivian price without a problem, they let us load our water tank from the motorhome without a problem. They are very nice

después de cargar nuestros bidones de diésel a precio boliviano sin problema nos dejaron cargar nuestro tanque de agua del motorhome sin problema. Son muy amables

name: Imcruz Suzuki Motorcycle Service
description: Imcruz has many places in La Paz. Finding the ride one for a service of our 2 Suzuki Vstroms was quite an endeavor. Nice people, some speak good English. Prices okay.

name: Thermal Bath Sajama
description: Nice warm thermal Bath in the open air. With view on the Vulcan. Nice people. 25 Bob pp, it is worthed. You can also sleep in your van here.

name: Natural Piscina
description:
Good spot to enjoy natural pool beneath small waterfalls. 
It is just off the road and has some flat spots to park your car and spend a night with a refreshing dive into one of the pools. 5 BOB per person to entry the pool. 
The road is nearby, so you will hear cars passing.

name: Hostal Lopez
description:
Friendly hostel 50 bob, could park my moto inside the reception.
Nothing too fancy but does the trick

name: Ocuri church plaza
description: Didn’t make it to Sucre before nightfall, so we stayed here for the night. Small place, no amenities but friendly people. Quite night (Dogs barking).

name: El Mirador de La Guardia
description: DANGEROUS PLACE AT NIGHT. AVOID THIS PLACE

name: Grifo de Agua
description:
Water tap at the gas station. perfect to fill the water tank of the motorhome (only for washing dishes). We did not get fuel at Bolivian price but we asked permission to fill the water and they let us without problem.
.....
grifo de agua en la gasolinera perfecto para llenar el tanque de agua del motorhome (solo para dicha y lavar platos). no conseguimos combustible a precio boliviano pero pedimos permiso para llenar el agua y nos dejaron sin problema

name: river crossing
description: we were staying at Casa Grania and headed west from there to go to Sucre. Via Google maps, you must go all of the way back to Santa Cruz to cross the bridge there. which is like 30km in the wrong direction. the host said this river crossing is possible, and it was. even motorcycles crossing here. it was pouring rain all day, 3 days ago, and the river in it's deepest spot was maybe 30cm. hard bottom, no rocks. a little bit of soft sand in the middle section but not deep enough to be a problem. crossed in 2wd. the south bank exit was steep that might be tricky if it was currently raining, but not an issue when dry. the north bank is flat and easy.

name: Hostal Dulce Salada
description: Nice Hostal, Señor Leonardo let us stay at the back, sheltered from the wind, for the night. Didn’t need any facilities as we are self-contained, but showers and toilets are available for a fee. Had a nice talk, he is very welcoming, and this is more or less the only useful place at the entrance to the Salar.

name: Ruta 6 Roadside
description:
Flat spot hidden from the road by a rock formation, access not sure for 2wd and very rocky so no tents. 
..... 
Terrain plat caché de la route par une formation rocheuse, accès difficile pour une voiture normale et très rocailleux donc compliqué pour les tentes.

name: Lavado Auto Angel
description: This is a car wash that also offers a parking service. You can wash your van and fill it with water. The owner Angel is really nice, we had a good chat with him. Our camper was like new with the washing.

name: Parking lot
description:
Very central location, has water, electricity and bathroom, the administrator is very friendly, you can take public transport in front. Pets are allowed. Our camper is very cheap and we paid 8 soles 24 hours. For small camper 5 soles 24hours. Big camper can fit. Economic and good. Close to the historical center 3km.
-------------
Lugar muy central, posee agua, electricidad y baño, el administrador es muy amable, puedes coger transporte público al frente. Permiten mascotas. Nuestro camper es muy gandre y pagamos 8 soles 24horas. Pará camper perqueños 5 soles 24horas. Caben grandes camper. Económico y bueno. Cerca al centro histórico 3km

name: Mercado Municipal Casta Hurtado
description: Typical food market with stalls for fresh fruit, vegetables, meat and dairy products. Stalls for cheap cooked food as well upstairs. Has 2 entrances so it's easy to walk through.

name: Ajayu hostel
description: super clean very welcoming place.  have a parking for motorcycle and may be car also paid 25 usd for the night. the place have a nice kitchen and nice garden. it is very close from the SAS supermarket.

name: Codo de Los Andes
description: This is the beginning of the trek known as Codo de Los Andes, or sometimes referred to as Che Guevara route. we did a tour from samaipata and walked from here to Cuevas, about 11km. it's a one way trip that was pretty interesting, but from here to the top is about 1km of very steep hill and the view is incredible. kind of like the area around Machu Picchu. we didn't pay much money for the tour, but you can do this awesome bit for free without having to negotiate a taxi back to the mountain to get your car.

name: Samaipata Tours
description: lots of places offer tours in this town, but we went here. we heard you needed a guide to enter the Amboro national park to see the giant fern trees (I'm not sure that's true as when we went on the hike we saw other people that looked like they were unguided). prices ranged from 320b per person for a private tour or if you got into a group of 6 or more then it was only 160b each. the lady at the counter was super friendly and helpful (no English) and instead of taking our money for a private tour she offered to switch our days around to get us on the cheaper days which meant we saved enough money to do another tour. the Codo de Los Andes trek was awesome! the first km is pretty grueling uphill, but the next 10 are all down hill. no shade at all so bring a brimmed hat, sunscreen, and plenty of water. people on our trip didn't bring enough and ran out as it started raining really hard and slowed us down.  The other trip with the giant ferns was less impressive but it was still super cool to see these fern trees that are 800+years old. our guide both days understands a lot of English but didn't speak much. he was very knowledgeable about both areas and kept a good pace.

name: Canion del Sora mirador
description: Mirador of Canion del sora. Great view. Small spot to park.

name: Samarikuna Hostal de Sal
description: Unbelievable place. Hard to find a place like this in Bolívia. Bedrooms with private bathrooms. Hot shower. Matrimoniale 350 bolivianos. Double, same price. Breakfast included. Dinner 50 bs. WhatsApp: +59173136092 - Wilfredo Beniz.

name: Tienda JR
description: Small tienda just by the road. Good selection of sodas, water, cookies, … Also instant lunch available, which is prepared with hot water, served by the owner of the place. Good option if you don’t wanna eat at the restaurant on the other side of the road.

name: El Camionero Hotel
description:
A roadside hotel, nice enough for the price. Matrimonial room for 50 BOB, shared bathroom. Shower was HOT.  No towels, soap or toilet paper though.

Bicycles fit comfortably inside the room. The rooms are along the edge of a huge lot so plenty of space for campers or big rigs.  WiFi is ok, LTE data connection with Entel.

name: DON'T use the ATMs here
description: They switch off and keep the Creditcard inside. We talked to some locals and they told us, that it is always the same f***...  DON'T use the ATMs! They are in front of the Hipermaxi supermarket.

name: TONYS TYRES
description:
If you want tyres changed or tyres repaired or punctures repaired come here. 
He knows how to change tyres and tubes on big adventure bikes. 

He speaks perfect English and is very good at his job. 

He is located next to all the motorcycle shops so you can buy your tyres from there and get him to fit them. 

lovely man highly recommended.

name: grifo a pie de calle en la ypfb
description:
Translation: There is a tap almost at street level, we have had to ask for permission because it is from the service station. They give you the stopcock for the faucet, with the hose we have been carrying we have been able to load without problem

hay un grifo casi a pie de calle, hemos tenido que pedir permiso porque es de la estación de servicio. ellos te dan la llave de paso del grifo, con la manguera que llevamos hemos podido cargar sin problema

name: Facing the lake with Flamingos
description:
After visiting the Hot spring, we came to this spot facing the lake. After sunset, there is soooo much wind that stopped around 10 pm and was a very calm and quiet night. Remember that we are more than 4,000 altitude and the night can be a little troubled if you are not acclimatized. Even in January, we got the temperature close to 0 at night.
______

Depois de visitar as Termas, viemos para esse lugar para o entardecer com vista para o lago. Depois do por do sol, há muuuuito vento, que parou por volta das 22h e foi uma noite muito tranquila e silenciosa. Lembre-se que estamos a mais de 4mil de altitude e a noite pode ser um pouco conturbada se você não estiver aclimatado. Mesmo em janeiro, pegamos temperatura próximo a 0 durante a noite.

name: mister cafe
description:
Esteban place is called Mr.cafe
Here we sell Frappuccino, juices, empanadas, etc.
the para-para is a milkshake and bitter with a little alcohol
the Frappuccino is Cold Coffee with a Little Milk and is served with milk cream and chocolate
Esteban place is located on Calle la paz between Calle Joaquin de La Sierra and costanera
---
Esteban lugar se Llama Mr.cafe 
Aqui vendemos Frappuccino , jugos para para, empanadas etc.
el para-para es un batido de Leche y bitter con un poco de alcohol 
el Frappuccino es Cafe Frio con un Poco de Leche y se serve con crema de Leche y chocolate 
Esteban lugar se encuentra en la Calle la paz entre la Calle Joaquin de La Sierra y costanera

name: calle ancha en Oruro
description:
We spent one night on this street to continue our trip the next day. It is a wide street with plenty of parking. next door there is a hospital and opposite the military barracks. quiet although with some traffic.
---
pasamos una noche en esta calle para seguir viaje al día siguiente.es una calle ancha con mucho aparcamiento. al lado hay un hospital y enfrente el cuartel militar. tranquilo aunque con algo de tráfico.

name: Parque de Lagunas
description: Coming from the north, this is the entrance to the national park Lagunas The fee is 150 B.

name: Potosí Residencial
description: Small and basic Hostal, safe parking for motorbikes and cars, I got a double room with TV and private bathroom for $50 Bs without breakfast.

name: Residencial Santa Cruz
description:
Motorcycle guard service, free courtesy cafeteria, wifi, private bathroom
----
Servicio de Guarda de motocicleta, cafeteria libre de Cortesia, wifi, baño privado

name: very dirty road
description: 4x4 needed! we had to turn  back because of large holes etc

name: hotel hacienda colonia
description:
Hotel finca with beautiful and large green outdoor space, games, swimming pool, shadows, restaurant, wifi and camping is possible. It is a small oasis in this area. It also has private access to the caves at additional cost.
----------------
Hotel finca con hermoso y gran espacio exterior verde, juegos,  piscina, sombras, restaurant
 cuenta con wifi y es posible acampar. es un pequeño oasis en este sector. tambien tiene acceso privado a las cuevas con costo adicional

name: Electronic & mechanic - Sem & Re
description: A very good garage, so friendly. Miguel, Richard Roman helped me with my electronics problem  . I arrived late in the day and the continued to work and fix the issue at night. Very cool. We drink a beer together after. Very cool people

name: EXPEDICIONES SOL ANDINO
description:
In front of the Expediciones Sol Andino agency. the guy who helped us was very friendly, he told us to sleep in front of the agency, he gave us internet (medium speed) and helped us to get diesel fuel at the price for nationals (20Litros for $90, Bolivians with gratuity included). at night there is a little noise from cars but after 10 pm it is quiet. It is close to the police station. we feel safe here. at the agency look for Wilson who is very friendly and attentive. we took the day trip to the Salar for $170 Bolivianos.

em frente a agência Expediciones Sol Andino. o rapaz que nos atendeu foi muito amigável, nos indicou para dormir na frente da agência, sedeu internet (media velocidade) e ajudou a conseguir combustível diesel no preço para nacionais (20Litros por $90, Bolívianos com gratificação inclusa). a noite tem um pouco de barulho dos carros mas depois das 22h fica silencioso. está próximo a delegacia de policia. nos sentimos seguros aqui. na agência procure pelo Wilson que é muito simpático e atencioso. fizemos o passeio de um dia para o Salar por $170, Bolívianos.

name: Hostal Dairsson
description: Nice hotel/hostal close to the centre. Matrimonial with private bathroom 80Bob pp, 160 for matrimonial. Secure room at front for our bicycles . Place is super clean and ladies who run it are v friendly.  Hot shower. WiFi was terrible at first but decent in the evening. Came here because Avenida was full- Oro was 90pp and Hotel Julia 100pp when we checked around.

name: ES Gas-May
description: Happy to fill in @6bob/l. Diesel and petrol

name: Mercantil Santa Santa Cruz ATM
description:
Only cash point in Uyuni that doesn’t charge to use! All others charge 55bob or only accept visa.

It was open on a Sunday.

name: Alojamiento Copacabana
description:
Decent alojamiento - 70 Bob for a doble room. 10Bob extra for a hot(electric) shower. 
Whole place is pretty clean, can’t complain.
No WiFi

name: Gasolinera Flores
description:
Good service. gasoline at national price. straight to the tank

Buen servicio. gasolina a precio nacional. directo al tanque

name: Along the road Santa Rosa-Trinidad
description:
This road is very calm, very few cars pass by and along it there are many spots that are suitable to overnight. One is near some small lakes, too. Very bucolic. You’ll spot many birds, cows and we even saw a deer.
Make sure to check if there is no water hidden by the grass.

name: Hostel Valle Grande
description:
Nice clean hostel. Lots of rooms. 
Very tidy. Shower not so great. Little basic kitchen bit no fridge. 

They sell cold beer and coke. 

Paid 130bs for a room with 3 beds as where are 3 people travelling with motorcycles. 

Was told a bed in a shared room was 60bs a night. 

Nice out door garden and patio to chill under if raining.

name: No cash with Master/meastro
description: in Tupiza you cannot get any cash at ATM's with a Master or Meastro card. Take some cash before or change it, although exchange rates here are worse than else because it's not as touristic (according to locals)

name: Next to the Laguna
description: A nice and quiet flat place not far from the main road. If you don't like to stay in Villa Mar and need a rest from the laguna route this is the place to go. With approx 4000 meter you can sleep well. Can be very windy so not for tents.

name: Toll station and Police Checkpoint
description: Normal Toll station (9BS) for the road and directly after the station the bolivian police wanted to see the driving license.

name: Best mechanic in Bolivia (INCLAN)
description:
The best and most dedicated mechanic in Bolivia. They have dealt with large diesel trucks of the electrical companies of Bolivia for over thirty years and are therefore experts on diesel vehicles and engines. He also has a great number of parts easily available. And if not, he can order them from Santa Cruz. Don’t hesitate because it is a bit out of the centre of Sucre, definitely worth it.

Marco Antonio is a very friendly guy and worked through his holiday with his team to fix the engine of our van in only two days, after several other mechanics found it to complex. He cleaned the injectors, adjusted the valves, calibrated the diesel pump for the altitude, and more. He did so for a very reasonable price.

Marco was also in contact with Guillermo for us, the best mechanic in Salta (see the iOverlander entry there). With these two mechanics covering this stretch of your trip you can feel very secure.

name: Yuruma Roadside Comedor
description: A little row of comedores with food and refrescos. Perfect spot for us - halfway up this giant hill towards Villazon!

name: Casa de Camping Outdoors Shop
description:
An Outdoors/camping shop with huge selection of gear. One of the only outdoors shop in southern Bolivia (Oruro and Uyuni no longer have camping shops open) 
They stock butane gas canisters too which we were worried about finding- 40BOB each. 
Owner is super nice and helpful in finding what we needed.

name: San Ignacio de Loyola Cathedral
description: Very pretty Jesuit church at the big square.

name: San Miguel Cathedral
description: Another pretty Jesuit church - Catedral de San Miguel. There is also a nice square with shade from big trees. Good place to relax a bit. Very calm

name: linda vista
description: perfect place for one night in the hills. if you drive from Ventilla to Macha or vice versa this is an ideal place to sleep. a solid flat underground, near the main street, but you don't hear the cars. windy in the late afternoon.

name: Missiones Jesuitas San Rafael
description: Another one of the jesuit churches, very nice drawings and it’s free to visit. It was open and we just went in.

name: Restaurant Muy Bueno
description:
Super delicious lunch, including soup and juice, 12 Bolivianos, recommended.
......
super rico almuerzo. sopa segundo y jugo. en 12 bolivianos, recomendado!

name: Hotel JJ Cruz
description:
Big and basic Hotel, has safe parking for motorbikes and cars, i got a simple room with shared bathroom for $50 Bs more. 
Lo necesario para pasar la noche, cuarto privado con baño compartido y parqueadero amplio por $50 Bs.

name: parque historico Santa Barbara
description: it is a big gravel area in front of the monument dedicate to "Victoria de Santa Barbara" we come here late afternoon After 100 km of dirt road, in the rain, this was an excellent option to spend the night. Quiet, only 2 trucks have passed all night. You are visible from the road, no service.In the morning we take a walk in the , sames abandonet park. Lot of mosquitos .

name: City Tour Vamos Juntos
description:
Vamos Juntos is a social organization whose goal is to improve the living and social situation of the shoe blakers and their families. During a 3-hour alternative city tour,  a shoe blanker will guide you through the old town. In addition to the historical part, you dive into the daily life of the people. The tour goes through the witches market, where the guide tells a lot about the myths and superstitions of the Bolivians. If necessary, Vamos Juntos staff will translate into English or German. We was really impressed.
www.vamosjuntos.de

name: Paradise VITALIS
description:
Super nice green and quiet spot to spend a night or more in Santa Cruz (gated).
Great to relax from travelling. 
Good for any kind of vehicle or tent. 
Also big rigs fit.
Laya and Walter are super nice and welcoming people. Speak German, English and Spanish. 
Laya is a professional therapist and yoga teacher. So, if you need to relax from travelling and want to have some yoga classes or a massage or Physio-Treatment- with a great nature atmosphere- that’s the place to be.
They have shower, bathroom, water for your tank and also two guest rooms with private bathroom for rent. Pool and Wifi also available.
Close to town (~20 km) which you can also reach via Taxi.

Parking and/ or tent per night 100 Bs (for up to 3 pers.). Each additional person more pays 20 Bs extra per night.

Room for max 2 persons with private bathroom (shower & toilet) is 250 Bs/ night

Can highly recommend!
You can contact Laya prior to arrival via WhatsApp (+591 77396829).

name: New Road to Uyuni
description: Do not trust Google Maps or the signs in Tupiza, they lead you to an old and very bad dirt road. Just follow the paved road, which is kind of new and apparently not yet in maps or correctly signalled.

name: Parking lot during the day
description: You can park here, behind the Stadion. A guy was there when we came and left, we don't know if he is watching the cars all the time, but was good for us. No height restriction, enough space for also big rigs. 5 BL per hour.

name: Diesel Nacional
description:
Most probably the best bar / bistro in La Paz. You literally enter here in another planet. Everything from the ground to the ceiling is made of recycle plane / car / trucks and many other metal parts. Very nice atmosphere. Also the parilla is a must as they have beef from Argentina ! We highly recommend, even just for the visit of the place and their toilets. The owner spent 20 years building this piece of art ! 

It is open Monday to Saturday, only for the evenings. Close on Sunday

name: hôtel Loma colorada
description: one km from the center of coroico , quiet place with swimming pool ( not used) 120 bolívars included breakfast, simple room with private bathroom.owner friendly. large parking for for my motorbike and safe . I recommended

name: Water at the soccer field
description: there are two water taps . We ask the locals if potable and they say yes.

name: Riverbed tent island
description:
The side arm of the riverbed that leads to the Canon del Inca is bumpy but not too sandy, so you just turn off the „main“ arm. Follow along to the only big tree. There is space for one 3x3 tent. Shade and wind protection given. Don’t know how the riverbed is with rain.
Around the area are a few more flat spaces to set up a tent but not too protected. Would wird for a car too I guess.
Very calm, no one passed, but a few old cans and toilet paper. Seems some people come here from time to time.
Lovely space in the middle of the beautiful scenery.
Tigo service.

name: Pro -Fix Mecanica Chaperia
description: Mecánica Chaperia moved 2 years ago and is now in this place.  We can confirm the very positive comments of the old place.  The boss Ronaldo studied in England, speaks fluent English, his colleague René lived in Germany for several years and worked at Mercedes Benz in Sindelfingen and speaks German.  He repairs all brands of cars, including trucks.  We had a problem with the cardan shaft and the brake cables.  Even if there are no original spare parts in Bolivia, the team will find a solution.  During the repairs we were allowed to stay safely on the site.  He helps with all questions, such as where to buy a diesel canister.  Ronaldo can be reached via WhatsApp.  +591 77266683

name: Taller de motos YA1000
description:
Great motorcycle mechanic. 
Had my motorcycle steering head bearings removed cleaned and regrese. 
Also repaired the clutch cable. 
70bs is total. 2 hours. 

Clean tidy and organised workshop. 

phone number 67306580 - 76697668

name: Rock by Road
description: Cleared and compacted gravel area behind a big rock that is 2WD accessible from the highway. There's a small abandoned 6×4mtr brick structure for some wind protection or to camp in when it's raining. Ground is not level but good enough. No garbage. Nice views. Almost completely invisible from the road. Road noise during the day, quiet at night. Good (Entel) cell reception.

name: Calle Villavalda - Safe place
description: Safe place to park and close to the center.  We had permission from local resident Tuqui to leave the car in front of his house.  The street is flat, but as it is narrow, it is not suitable for large vehicles.  Tuqui +591 72421815. (He even let us sleep here, but there are no amenties.)

name: Swimming holes Coimata
description: This is the entrance to several swimming holes along a river with a few small waterfalls and natural pools perfect to cool down in on a hot day. The further up the river you walk, the quieter it gets.  Entrance is 2 BOB/person. Probably busy on weekends.

name: Hostal Bolivia
description: Nice hostel near to the City centre. Hot showers, WiFi, aircon, parking place for all sizes. Breakfast included. Clean place, nice courtyard. Also available on booking.com, I paid 75 000 pppn.

name: Mirante de Saipina
description: it's a Mirador, it's not really a spectacular view and rubbish around the gravel parking lot, but ok for spending the night. We spent a quiet night even it was close to the Ruta.  Only a few trucks passed at night.  In the morning the traffic increased.

name: Cerca de plaza heroes del chaco
description:
Spot safe, with shadow, next to the square

Lugar tranquilo para dormir, con sombra y seguro, varios puestos de comida, y almacenes cercanos. El mercado central se encuentra a 600 m

name: Hostal Perla Negra
description:
Clean hotel. 150 Bs for a double room with private bathroom or 130 with shared bathroom. Shower is hot. 
Both options are with breakfast included from 8am-10am. 
We could park the motorcycle inside the garage, it’s quite small so only space for one. 
Few minutes walking from the center. Hotel is close to the Teleférico.

name: Es Campero
description: Diesel directly into tank. The attendant asked for Bolivian ID, I replied that I don't need a factura. Paid local price.

name: Toll puente Arce
description: toll peaje puente Arce. one of more tolls in this road

name: Hotel El Camionero
description:
We tried to sleep in the parking lot, but we weren't allowed to.  We went back the next day just to have a shower.  We paid 10 bolivianos for 20 minutes in the shower, and we were able to take the two of us together.  The water was hot, and the bathroom was clean.
______

Tentamos dormir no estacionamento, mas não nos permitiram. Voltamos no dia seguinte somente para tomar banho. Pagamos 10 bolivianos para 20 minutos de banho, e pudemos tomar nós dois juntos. A água estava quente, e o banheiro limpo.

name: Casa Blanca Hostal
description:
160 BOB for a double room with private bathroom. Shower is hot. 
It’s pretty basic for the price you pay. Breakfast is included.

Their dirty cat peed all over the motorcycle and luggage. Asked the owner to clean it but he didn’t really bother. 

Safe parking inside the hotel though for 10 BOB extra but the cat is just disgusting. 

Also lots of noise all night long.

name: Suma Uta
description:
Nice hostel/Motel. 

80bs per night Inc Breakfast. Nice breakfast. fruit and pancakes. 

very clean. nice owners very friendly. 

very good beds. very comfortable with new mattress. 
Small restaurant.

name: Ruta 20 - Tarija to Tupiza
description:
We only managed to drive part if this road coming from Tarija. Had to turn around 4 or 5km after the small village Impora.

The road is all gravel/soil in pretty good condition, and most parts are wide enough for 2 vehicles to pass each other.

BUT, when it rains, the steep parts turn into crazy slippery slopes. We saw several big trucks getting stuck on their way up and 4x4 vans sliding around. Luckily we managed to turn around and slowly slide/drive downhill to safer parts again. We drive a 2x4 Mitsubishi van. 

It's a beautiful road when it's dry, but take care when it rains.

name: GAS FROM HOUSE CIUDADANA
description:
Can get petrol only here from a plave that repairs tyres. 

sold us 10L for our motorbike. 

6bs per litre

name: Padcaya
description:
Super quiet and safe, very small town, 2 box by walking you have mercado and restroms 

Lugar super tranquilo y seguro  para dormir
Pasamos 2 noches aca. Muy lindo pueblito

name: Soccer Field
description:
DON'T GO THERE AT NIGHT - OR AT LEAST BE VERY CAREFUL!!!

We arrived in the evening and were really lucky - although we spent a quiet, but windy night, in the morning we found plenty of spike strips/tire shredders - not sure about the english word, but someone intentionally spread a lot of processed metal to destroy the tires of the arriving vehicles. Probably not against campers, but still - drive carefully! Added some photos.

Still a nice place to spend the night close to Potosí.

Dirt soccer field.  large space.  it is visible from the road. Little traffic during the day and no traffic at night. if you want, you can find more hidden places down the field near the río.  (if dry)

name: San lorenzo next to the river
description:
We spent a quiet night despite being next to the town's casino. There was a bit of noise until 11:00 p.m. but after that, it was super quiet. Little busy street.
Super safe 15 minutes from here by car there is an incredible waterfall CHORROS DE JURINA
In a hardware store you can charge electrical things for 3 bolivianos
---
Pasamos una noche tranquila a pesar de estar a lado del casino del pueblito. Hubo un poco de ruido hasta ls 23 pero después super tranqui. Calle poco transitada.
Super seguro a 15 minutos de aca en auto hay una cascada increible CHORROS DE JURINA
En una ferreteria te pueden cargar las cosas electricas por 3 bolivianos

name: Lavanderia Lava-me
description: Very friendly and quick, clean, dry and everything within 5 hours. Costs 10 bol per kilo.

name: Official Customs/Border parking lot
description: You are forced to park here as you are not allowed to cross thr border without the paper approval from this parking lot run by the city. You even need to do this if your rig/motorhome is to big to fit through the gate. Cost is 5 bolivianos. You park here walk to aduana/Migracion there you get your running paper with the 4 stamps. Then you return here. Your running paper is checked and you receive another paper with your number on it. Eventually you have to wait at the parking lot until your number is called. Then you can drive to the border area.

name: Puente Fisculo
description:
Viewpoint with good space. We stopped for lunch here.
---
Mirador com bom espaço. Paramos para almoçar aqui.

name: Road Condition RN10
description: This is the beginning, where the RN10 turns into a dirt road until the border to Brazil in San Matias. Usually the road isn't too bad, but it can become very muddy with rain. We were on motorcycles and it was ok, although it was rainy season. However, one shouldn't expect to have a smooth and easy drive to the border on this stretch of ~250km. The road has big potholes and became quite muddy for us in some parts - that makes all vehicles go slow. 2WD usually should be ok, unless longer rain doesn't turn the track into a mud massacre. The police will also warn you not to drive in nighttime on the stretch along the Brazilian border due to drug trafficking. So either start driving very early in the morning, or plan to spend a night in on of the little villages, that are told to be safe.

name: Residencial Panchita
description:
Nice little hotel in Saipina if you need a stopover. Private room for 60bs, en-suite baño with shower, parking available for motorcycle (not sure about cars, the garage is small). Fairly basic, but certainly acceptable. 

The owner said normally WiFi is available but was not when I stayed due to technical issues.

name: Lavandeira El Jireh
description:
Excellent service, clean and smelling clothes delivered in 1h20.  We paid $48 Bolivianos for a medium-sized bag.  open from 8:30 am to 7:30 pm without closing for lunch.

Excelente serviço, roupa limpa e cheirosa entregue em 1h20. Pagamos $48 bolivianos por uma bolsa tamanho médio. aberto das 8h30 as 19h30 sem fechar para o almoço.

name: Tarabuco
description:
large street close to the main square we stayed there the night of the quiet Saturday. 

Rue large à côté de la place principale nous y avons passé la nuit du samedi vraiment tranquille.

name: Clínica veterinária Castro de Padilla
description:
Excellent service, complete clinic, we did x-ray and hemogram exams on the spot in our pet. The consultation cost $30bs and the exams $120 bs each. Super attentive and careful veterinarians with our little one.  
-------
Excelente atendimento, clínica completa, fizemos exames de raio x e hemograma na hora em nossa pet. A consulta custa $30bs e os exames $120 bs cada. Veterinários super atenciosos e cuidadosos com nossa pequena. super recomendo.

name: Área plana
description:
We slept one night here because we were caught in the night. It's a large flat area on the side of the road, nothing else but it suited us just fine!
----
Dormimos una noche aquí porque nos agarró la noche. Es una gran área plana al lado de la ruta, sin más pero nos vino bien!

name: Sauna y Duchas Janett
description:
Excellent, impeccable cleanliness and easy to park.  we paid 16 bolivianos for the couple for 1 hour.  highly recommend.

Excelente, limpeza impecável e fácil de estacionar. pagamos 16 bolivianos para o casal durante 1 hora. super recomendo.

name: Valle de ls rocas
description:
Quiet place, flat with the nice view but all lot windy.
Buen lugar para pasar la noche y escalar! Super tranquilo con bastante viento! Pero hay bastante reparo con las rocas

name: CASA DE CAMPO LA QUIMERA
description:
We had the most amazing stay at this Hostel/Bodega. 
We are traveling with kids in our truck camper, and after some difficult days after passing the border from Argentina, We found this paradise.
A small Hostal and Bodega with space for vans and even a big rig. Very friendly owner (Marcelo) and his helper (Paulita), Working there.

We parked at their parkinglot behind the hostal and you would be able to get electricity here also - We though rented a family room at the Hostal (440 bol pr night for 2 adults and 2 kids)

There is a swimmingpool, amazing breakfast in a small rooftop-tree with a view over the wineyard and river, excelent trekking possibilities in the area and of cause a lot of Wine/Singani tastnings.
Marcelo, said we could use the hostal as we wanted to. We felt at Home and used their kitchen.
Paulita even washed our clothes, but said no to payment (maybe because we already paid for a room)
When we left after 4 days of rehabilitation, we asked if we could put the place on IOverlander for others to come and park and pay a little for using the facilities - they said they would be happy if others passes by. You would not have to rent a room, but pay something for using the facilities.

name: entrada parque national carrasco
description:
Here you find the road to the office of the national park 800 meters from here. There is a small bridge which we did not dare to cross with our truck. So we walked from here.
The ranger told us you can enter untill 14.30 h. and that the walk was about two hours. Than we had to pay 100 bolivianas pp., which we thought was far to much, so we didn't enter the NP.

name: Aduana
description:
This is the place for your vehicle customs. The other 2 entries here don't exist anymore. 
They wanted copies of our passport, Bolivian immigration stamp and vehicle documents. Copies can be made at the little shop on the other side of the immigration office in the port building. This Aduana doesn't make copies for you.
Opening hours are Monday to Friday 08:00-12:00 and 13:00-17:00

name: Roadside
description:
Large pull out close to the road.
Spot is a bit hidden behind a large hill.
Beautiful view, especially at sunset.
Had a quiet night here as there is little traffic.

name: Tunnel Camp
description: Wild camp for motorcyclists or cyclists, in a small tunnel right by river. Good wind cover. On the south side of tunnel there is another smaller unused tunnel to the right, blocked off for 4 wheel vehicles but can enter on 2 wheels. Good private camp spot. Can access river clear water further down. Can hear cars during day but traffic light to non existent at night. Does the trick for a free spot to stay.

name: Road washout by river.
description: Can pass with motorcycles or 4x4.                                        .

name: Butch Cassidy Museum
description: The Butch Cassidy Museum. This is the town San Vincente where they say Butch Cassidy and the Sundance kid met their end.

name: Dugout
description: Some shelter from wind in large dry dugout. Quiet at night, no traffic. Clean.

name: Belvédère La Colina
description:
Private Belvedere with pool 30 bob for the night and 20 bob to use the pool. Very quiet place with a very nice view of the city. Nice grassy area with palapas. 
----------------
Belvedere prive avec piscine 30 bob pour la nuit et 20 bob pour utiliser la piscine. Endroit tres tranquille avec une tres belle vue sur la ville.

name: Next to the squere (plaza)
description: Quiet and safe, the people local is very frendly. La casa del cafecito is the best place to drink some coffee!

name: Alojamiento
description: cheap place with small rooms. My room is very humid. 20 Bolivians for a private single room. Shower not included (10 more bolivians) place for bicycles. No wifi

name: Club Clasicos Volkswagen Oruro
description:
Omar é bombeiro voluntário e Presidente do club Clasicos VW de Oruro.  Nos conhecemos no aeroporto e ele nos ajudou diversas vezes com informações sobre a cidade. passamos algumas noites estacionados em frente sua casa. Se necessita de algo pode entrar em contato   
Omar +591 77159789

Omar is a volunteer firefighter and President of the Clasicos VW de Oruro club.  We met at the airport and he helped us several times with information about the city.  we spent a few nights parked in front of his house.  If you need anything, please get in touch.
 Omar +591 77159789

name: Lubricante Llanteria
description:
Conseguimos abastecer gasolina ao preço local aqui, pagamos $6 Bs por litro, recarga em galões. 

Gallons to the local price here, we paid $ 6 bs per liter.

name: Other gravel pit (secluded)
description: We couldn't access the other gravel pit. It's blocked by debris. If you drive a bit further down to the village (coming from Oruro) there's a road leading back, you'll pas the first gravel pit on the left. Afrer about 500m there's another beautiful gravel pit. No seriously, views from the top are really nice.

name: Mountains View
description: Very good place for all rigs. Quiet and good view. A Lot of stars in the nigth , online sheeps in neighborhood.

name: In front of the park
description: Very quiet at night, and safe! Because the military and the police are very close! At 7 am a little noisy

name: Old Buildings Camp Spot
description: Camp Spot mid-hill, perfect for cyclists tired from all the hills. Some old abandoned, roofless buildings here that we set our tent up in, providing some shelter from the wind and easy anchors for tarping. Small stream down the bank with decent water flow in March. Some highway noise but definitely died down over night and wasn't a bother. Felt safe and wasn't bothered by anyone.

name: La trufa negra
description: Good restaurant with specialities and also normal plates like spaghetti, burger, meat or fish. From 39 to 89 B, but really tasty we tried the silpancha !! Good spot, good vibe. Waitress so nice !

name: Pollos Rincon Latino
description: Especialist in chicken (pollo), i payed 15 bolivians for a chicken and potatos. Good deal.

name: Next to Sports Center
description:
We parked next to the gym, where there is a public bathroom and a tap with drinking water. Be careful not to park in the middle of the volleyball court or soccer field. They are often used by the villagers, who might even invite you to play with them!
Very quiet and safe, like the whole village!

name: Very sandy track
description: There is like 30km of sand and other place is rocks, a lot of river crossing but mostly are dry. Maybe in raining season and probably after the winter is much more dificult to cross. Very slowly track. I did with a 250 motorcycle fully loaded and was ok, but not easy.

name: José
description: José is a really nice man and he seels a lot of things at his house (gas, aceite). Diesel 6bsb. Yellow house in the photo.

name: Karusa garage
description:
Excellent garage in Santa Cruz. We went there 5 years apart, always well served at fair prices.
Tel whatsApp +59177010100
---
Excellent garage dans Santa Cruz. Nous y sommes allés à 5 ans d’intervalle toujours bien servi à des prix corrects.
Tel wathsApp +59177010100

name: Conception
description:
In the street just near the church 

Dans la rue juste à côté de la mission tranquille et sur.

name: small plaza de village
description: for one night between la paz and vallee de la lune. quiet and feel safe. not rallye nice

name: Tour Guide in La Paz
description:
Gert is a recommended Tour Guide for La Paz. He has a big knowledge of the cities La Paz and El Alto. Don't miss him! He will take time for you the whole day. Tour can be either in spanish or in german.
WhatsApp: +591 775 54008

name: Tinguipaya
description: Flat place just in front of the bridge before entering the village. Little trafic during the night.

name: Tinguipaya
description:
coming from Llucho pretty good eartway when it is dry. Over 4600m, sometimes like the 'camino Nor Yungas' (camino de la muerta). Little trafic. Nice landscape. It seams that the street to F1 after the bridge is paved
.

name: Hotel Mandioré
description:
Very nice hotel in El Carmen. Surprisingly nice. Doesn’t look like much from the outside, but the owners are super kind and helpful and the property is in great condition. There’s even a swimming pool. 

Secure parking, hot showers, good WiFi, great breakfast. Matrimonial (two persons) for 250bs. Not the cheapest, but it’s a very nice place!

name: Café Banais
description: very nice café with, good small things to eat, salty and sweet, jugos, good coffee... Fast internet and clean toilets with everything

name: Las Churapas
description:
Quite nice hotel in San Jose. Feels almost like a resort. Nice rooms, good WiFi, parking inside. Pool as well. Very friendly staff. 

250bs for a matrimonial (two person price) with bathroom en suite. Breakfast included and it’s good.

name: Flat area Great view
description: Beautiful views quiet flat area to camp, no facilities, very little traffic, you can hide from view of the road.

name: Alojamiento Paz
description: Simple accommodations, AC, private bath, secure parking. Friendly staff. Good for a night. I paid 150 bol/night.

name: Hotel Turista Chileno
description:
Probably the best hotel in Yapacani. First one we went to was cheaper but no AC or seats on the toilets. 

This place is fine. 130bs for a private room with aircon, bathroom, WiFi, and secure parking. No breakfast. Room is fairly large. 

Be aware that the city apparently has a street market in front of the hotel on Sundays. It was interesting to bring my big KTM through the middle of it all…

name: aduana checkpoint
description:
First time in 13 months SA they checked our tip.
There’s also a toll here.

name: Biopetrol
description:
They gave us the 5Bob per liter today. 
(Price was 8bob for foreigners)

name: Residencial
description:
The lady is not so friendly and refuses to negotiate but it was late and the botanic garden is not an option anymore and the room is clean. 
150 for a 3 beds and private bathroom and fan. Rooms are hot and noisy. 
Spot for one car in the private parking.

name: Near the rocks
description: Just pull of the road. There are rocks on one side which offers bit wind protection. We stayed one night, super silent spot. only one truck at 7 pm passed then no single car passed within the night. When we arrived a little bit windy but during night no wind. Also be prepared for temperatures below zero

name: Roots Coffee Rurrenabaque
description: Really nice place for drinking traditional bolivian coffee. The owner is really passionate about it and can give you the best explanation about the different types of coffee that you get here.

name: Gareca taller mecanico
description:
Translation: Here you will find very professional and available people. We changed the handbrake guides and the straps. very honest price

aquí van a encontrar una  gente muy profesional y disponible. cambiamos las guayas del freno de mano y las correas. precio muy honesto

name: night in the canyon
description: safe and quiet at 30m of the road. no water on february

name: Moto Repuestos Arancibia
description: Motorcycles mechanic. Rolando welded my a broken part and replaced a tire at 40 bob, really nice and was a reliable guy

name: Parque Achumani 36
description:
We slept two nights in this square and after 2 weeks in La Paz, this is the best place we found. We had to stay in this neighborhood for a mechanic and we found this square which has a place that looks like it was made for a van (so it doesn't overflow on the route). Flat. It is also a quiet and safe neighborhood, looks good. There's a guard in a stall in the square. There are basketball grounds so there are often children.
.....
Dormimos 2 noches en esta plaza y la verdad que después de 2 semanas en La Paz, es el mejor lugar que encontramos. Teníamos que quedarnos en este barrio para un mecánico y nos encontramos con esta plaza que tiene un lugar parece hecho para una van (para que no desborde en la ruta) bien plano. Además es un barrio tranquilo y seguro, parece bien rico. Hay un guardia en una caseta en la plaza. Hay terreno de baloncesto entonces hay a menudo niños.

name: duchas
description:
nice clean hot modern showers. 15 Bob for 15 minutes. there is also a sauna at 25 bob. until 22. Super!
--
duchas bien limpias calientes y modernas. 15 Bob por 15 minutos. también hay sauna a 25 bob . hasta las 22. Super!

name: Lava autos
description:
We washed the Kombi and had the suspension greased for $50 Bs.  fast and attentive service.

Lavamos a Kombi e fizemos o engraxe da suspensão por $ 50 Bs. serviço rápido e atencioso.

name: Veterinária
description:
Veterinary in El Alto, we made consultations, sparasitment and the documentation for the Senasa required for the Border of Peru. Very good attention. Whatsapp +591 67061829

Veterinária em El Alto, fizemos consultas, desparasitação e a documentação para o Senasa requerida para a fronteira do Peru. muito boa atenção. 

Whatsapp +591 67061829

name: Saunas Luz del Mar
description:
Excellent double sauna and showers for $30Bs.  Open every day from 9 am to 9 pm - on Saturday afternoons it is very busy, preferably in the morning.
Whatsapp +591 63888358

Current promotion 2 complimentary soft drinks at the end of the bath and every 3 baths the 4 is free.  We used it several times and it was great.
---
Excelente sauna e duchas doble por $30Bs. Aberto todos os dias das 9h as 21h - aos sábados a tarde é muito movimentado, de preferência aos horários da manhã. 
Whatsapp +591 63888358

Promoção atual 2 refrigerantes de cortesia ao final do banho e a cada 3 banhos o 4 é grátis. usamos diversas vezes e foi ótimo.

name: Down the road
description: Down the road, small entrance through the bush and you can walk down the small valley to be invisible from the road (thanks to the trees). There is a house not far but they can't see you. Good for one night for my fellow tired hitchhiker/hiker. A small tent is better as it's not very flat. The next village toward Cochabamba had a weird vibe.

name: Next to small cafeteria
description:
Next to the small shops/cafeteria on the right side of the road (coming from La Paz). I asked the last cafeteria (where I had a nice cheap dinner) and they let me put my tent next to the building. They said I was safe and I felt so with the kind neighbours coming to chat with me (plus the curious dogs). BUT it's right next to the big road and the traffic doesn't stop during the night (lots of noise and light).
