& there's an outside tap on the cafeteria's side of the building, with clear water (probably non-potable without filter though)

name: Family comida
description: We had lunch here. Best chorizo we had so far in Bolivia. 20 Bs pp. Chorizo comes with a small salad, potato and maiz. Run by a nice Family. super atmosphere

name: Camping at restaurant
description: This is not just a restaurant, it is also a campsite. We have been here for lunch on our way back from Torotoro. Wished we could stay, looks fantastic. Beautiful garden, christal clear pool and such a nice family. Clean shower and bano. 4g Entel Signal

name: Plazuela del estudiantes
description: Good place for the night. Nice neighbours, very friendly. Place is not super quiet, lots of barking streetdogs. Public bano nearby, we did not use. Entel 4g

name: Lavandeira Lava Velox
description:
Excellent service and good attention $9 Bs per kg of clothing. Takes 1 day to return.

Excelente serviço e atenção. $9 Bs por kg de roupa, entrega em 24hs.

name: Hotel Samana Wasi
description: Good place for rest, clean rooms, excellent owner, great kitchen

name: Cafe Libanon
description: Very nice and simple Cafe with WiFi. the owners Name is Mariano. He is Argentine from Cordoba. muy amable!

name: BIKE CENTER
description: Excelente lugar para biciviajeros y motoviajeros que requieren mantenimiento o arreglo de sus bikes, es recibido por su propietario quien te da una atención de lujo a ti y tu transporte de viaje!!!

name: Rummy Hostal
description: Nice hostel with dorm rooms and private rooms. We payed 140 bs for a private room with shared bathroom. 75 bs for dorm. We saw that motorbikes can be parked in the patio. Good showers and breakfast, using the kitchen is possible. Wi-Fi was ok. It is possible to store luggage here while visiting the uyuni salt flats.

name: Plaza cancha de futbol
description:
Excellent place to stay in Santa Cruz, very quiet. We spent 12 nights and the people from the neighborhood gave us water.
------------
Excelente lugar para orar en Santa Cruz muy tranquilo. Pasamos 12 noches y la gente del barrio nos dio agua.

name: Almuerzo y cena
description: Excellent meal for 5 B's (soup) and "Segundo" (second plate), milanesa (chicken) with rice, onion and beans for 10 Bs. mandatory.

name: Landslide. F25
description: Road is gone. There are more landslides before and after, but this one is not even hikable. No way around it either. Road looks abondoned as of Apr, 2023.

name: Storage before Salar tour
description:
We left our motorhome in this place for 4 days. This is safe place.
This is a Brown Gate just side a black wall. Beto is very friendly, you can call him at this phone number : +591 68376424. 
he is an Edwin Cardenas friend (guide of the tours).

name: Fresh Bread
description: At the corner of the main plaza, blue door. Fresh bread everyday after 4pm

name: Asomil - tire shop
description: tire shop in Tarija. they were the only ones who had our tire size. they also do balanceo y alineación. the owner is very nice and the prices are fair. don't hesitate to negotiate a bit.

name: Mami Yoya Restaurant
description: excellent choice and lovely familiar place! you can eat a roaster chicken with fries potatoes, rice, onion and noodles (yes, all in the same dish). all for just 10 B's!! you must to came here.

name: near the river
description: very Nice place near the nice river. nobody. amazing view. very quiet

name: Soccer Field
description: we spend several nights on this side of the court because the other overlander point is on the entrance of field and people came early in the morning. on the other side of street there's a clean grassy area (next to the home for children's). we stayed on the "semana santa" weekend, so, was a little noisy with several places with loud music. but nobody bother us.

name: Keremba
description: Keremba is a cultural sports complex with plenty of space for camping. There is a kitchen for cooking, swimming pools for bathing and they can take walks to the jungle to see animals, medicinal plants and bathe in the natural waterfalls.

name: Salt Statues
description: There are about 15 salt statues, 10 Bob per person. It's nice! Certainly worth the short drive to see them.

name: Villazon main Plaza next to tourist info
description:
Stayed here 1 night. 

Parked just next to tourist info where there are like 4 parking spots.

Not very quiet during the night, but had no problems.

Public toilet in the building next door a bit more to the north on the other side next to food stalls, costs 1Bs.

FIE bank has an ATM nearby, charges no fees.

name: Guide francophone
description:
We took a Franco-Bolivian guide (speaks perfect French) to take a guided tour of La Paz. He took us to see the Valley of the Luna, then a visit of the city with passage to the cable cars.
Great guide, highly recommended.
His name is Inti and his WhatsApp is +591 69747761
--------
Nous avons pris un guide franco - bolivien ( parle parfaitement le français) pour faire une visite guidée de La Paz. Il nous a emmené voir la Vallée de la Luna, puis une visite de la ville avec passage aux téléphériques.
Super guide, on le recommande fortement.
Il s'appelle Inti et son WhatsApp est +591 69747761

name: La Tabla - Steak Restaurant
description: Brilliant steak restaurant with super friendly staff and nice sit in facilities. They have a variety of local cuts at good prices. They were super friendly, gave us tips of places to go around the area, really nice to our dog and even gave him some left overs. Nice artisan beet too. Would totally recommend.

name: Nice hostel to sleep (first building on the left side)
description:
When we arrived late with the bike the owner came to us. She offered a shared room for 40 bob pp, she gave us a 3 pers room. 
This place is huge and obviously also for tours, but we where the only one there. We could use the kitchen and eating/rest area for free and could place the bikes inside. Hot showers 20bob, electricity in the evening. Very friendly owner.

name: Near Multicines Plaza
description:
Omar and the Oruro Volkswagen club received us kindly and guided us to get to know the city. They took us to beautiful restaurants and to see the Virgin and the mining museum. We also went to Cochabamba in public service and we left our kombis in a safe place that they gave us. Very grateful for everything. Thanks for such a nice experience!
.....
Omar y el club Volkswagen de Oruro nos recibió atentamente y nos guiaron para conocer la ciudad. Nos llevaron a lindos restaurantes y a conocer la Virgen y el museo minero. Además fuimos a Cochabamba en servicio público y dejamos nuestras kombis en un lugar seguro que ellos nos brindaron. Muy agradecidos por todo. Gracias por tan linda experiencia!

name: Churrasqueria la chapaquita
description:
Translation: Barbecue Grill Restaurant. You eat very well and cheap. All kinds of meat and fish. Neat and clean. The staff is very friendly and polite

Restaurante de Parrilla Barbacoa. Se come muy bien y barato. Todo tipo de carnes y pescados. Aseado y limpio. El personal es muy amable y educado.

name: Street next to the square
description: We were looking for a place to sleep from Potosi to climbing spot on way to uyuni, and all failed. Went there your have to pay 1 Bob to enter to the city. Wide street for all type of rights, free wifi, and quite calm even in Friday night. Police station is just opposite of square.

name: Agua here, need to ask.
description: I've found faucet here. Just knocked the doors and asked without problem. You need hoose 5m to get into car

name: Great rock climbing location
description:
About 90 routes, from 5 to 9a.

Guide https://montanasdeunavida.wordpress.com/2016/06/06/churata-escalando-en-el-eden/

name: Repuestos
description:
Found here tail lights for Toyota 4runner after searching several other places. Parts in stock but they also can order parts to be available the next day. We had a choice between original parts and much cheaper Chinese alternative.
Very kind and efficient!

name: Martin's Workshop
description:
Martin's workshop is a very simple place but he and his team of 4-5 mechanics have a very good knowledge of basic mechanics. We broke down in the middle of La Paz, and 2 of them came to us within 30min, they picked me up, drove me back to our van, help us diagnose the issue, got our car running and we're able to drive to their workshop where they could fix the problem. 

After asking in many places they were the only workshop working on a Saturday afternoon and they stayed until 9pm fixing our issue. Total commitment to getting us back on the road rather than shutting and leaving us stranded until Monday. 

Our issue was a dirty carburetor and they took the whole thing apart twice! to clean it and get it working again. Mitsubishi L300 1992. 

Again the place is basic but their knowledge, dedication and commitment make up for it. Needless to say their price was more than fair and we even gave them a good tip for their hard work in the late ours. 

His number in case you need a mechanic in La Paz is +59161101559. 

Not the easiest place to get to as it is up in the hill and it might be tricky for very large rigs but for our high top van it was perfectly fine.

name: desierto de Dali
description: the desierto de Dali is a desert full of volcanic rocks with surrealist shapes. nice little stop on the road.

name: perfect spot for the sunset on the salar
description: nice spot to view the sunset over the mountains on the salar. to get there, go through the dirt road after the toll and from there you can exit on the left to go on the salar. there was still a bit of water on the salar which allowed us to have a great view with the reflections on the water. you will see tours go there too, so just follow the landcruisers.

name: Hospedaje y Comedor La Isla
description: This is an excellent place to spend the night and/or have a meal in the middle of the distance between Villazón and Tupiza. Nicely run hospedaje and restaurant with a friendly owner. The rooms are very clean (50 BOB per person with shared bathroom; there was nobdy else there, so it was like a private bathroom for us). We visited on a Sunday and they served chicken soup, picante de cabrito and asado de chivo. We tried the first two and they were delicious. There is a small on-site shop selling drinks and snacks, and they also have sheltered parrillas that people can use. Highly recommended.

name: Hospedaje Bodega Valle de Vino
description: 80 Bol for a single room with space for parking. I did not like the wine but it had a nice patio and outside area. breakfast was separate for 15 Bol.

name: Simcard Shopping
description: Many shops here where you can buy simcards for your phone. Entel or tigo.

name: No Name restaurant
description:
I had lunch, and it was the first spot I was able to find in hours. Around the plaza is another restaurant, but it was closed. From the 3 meals on the Chalkboard, they only had one. They have no coffee, but they made me hot water since I brought my own powder.

Cheap and nothing spectacular but at least I found something to eat that day

name: New Aduana for Bolivia and Paraguay
description: We crossed the boarder from Paraguay to Bolivia. We had to do the Migration documents in the old building of Paraguay. For the Aduana we had to come here. Here you can find all the offices for aduana, veterinary and other things from Paraguay and Bolivia.

name: La Torre Tours Tupiza
description:
We did a 5 day 4 nights tour with this agency. Starting from Tupiza, climbing Uturunku (6008m), Lagunas Route and then Salar de Uyuni and back to tupiza in a 4x4.

The whole experience was 10/10. They also got us a safe place to store our camper for free and let us use the toilet and shower in the hostel. 

Basically they were the only company in Tupiza with good website and reliable information - route, conditions, prices, - and had the best reviews on TripAdvisor and Google. They were super responsive and spoke fluent English!

We communicated with Carlos and Roberto and they were very flexible and attentive. They also have a hostel in the centre of Tupiza and know many places around if you ever need anything.

Also when we spoke with the guides they told us that La Torre Tours has been the best company for many years - being fair, paying regularly and having like 15 guides constantly employed - so you know you really get the best standard.

So our tour - it was really well organized and we always felt safe and comfortable. Like you do get into some super remote places, but with a nice big 4x4 Toyota Land Cruiser and a very experienced driver (we went with Roberto Gutiérrez) with more 10 years of experience we always felt safe and on top of things.

Accomodation was basic but ok, food was also basic but tasty and enough, and places along the route were crazy beautiful - one of the prettiest we've ever seen.

Uturunku was hard because of the altitude but local guide Marcos was friendly and knowledgeable and we all made it to the top! 

And now our driver Roberto - also 10/10. He really knew his car, knew the ways, cooked and took care of us always. Always would he stop whenever we wanted for pictures or toilet or whatsoever. Also he explained a lot about every place we visited. And he was funny and in good relations with other guides along the route and would always get us the best rooms in accomodations etc... Like he was always driving pretty slow and safe - we saw a lot of cars on the way that were going way to fast for those conditions. And we heard people have died in this Uyuni tours mainly because of drunk and fast drivers. So it really makes sense to fo with a reliable agency.

So really, the whole thing was beyond our expectations and for this price it's really a bargain you're getting. I absolutely recommend this agency and Roberto in particular. Ask for him if you can. 

Just one thing to beware - you're almost constantly above 4000m, sleeping on 4400 sometimes - so you should be acclimatized a bit or prepared for the altitude, it's still a stress for your body 😊

name: Outside the road F4
description: Big space for camping at the entry of a wild forest. Nobody around, only beautiful forest quasi untouched. Entel signal, OK.

name: The best spot for coffee lovers! Elevate Coffee
description: We've found almost by accident Elevate Coffee! If you are into V60 and you are real coffee lover, you have to visit this one. Many GEISHA coffee, people who live for coffee, amazing talk, amazing coffee, amazing beans to buy.

name: Lavadero edward
description: 3 lavaderos in one street. 30bl. Cheap good and very friendly.

name: Red Skull Motorcycle service
description: was reccomnded this place when looking for a place to change my tires.  there is a tire changing place next door to the moto mechanic that has the mechanic take off the wheel for them to change.  don't know if the mechanic is great but he had a bunch of Harleys and bigger cruisers in the shop so he at least knows bigger bikes.  seems like a good guy.  paid 50 Bob to the tire change place and 50 to the mechanic to change 2 tires.

name: Riders Bolivia moto brand name parts and tires
description: great motorcycle store with tons of gear and some tires.  lots of big name brands of gloves, jackets, helmets, luggage etc ie givi, Revit, etc.  they had a few tires in but ordered me Mitas E07s from Cochobomba, got here the next day.   The owner Eric speaks perfect English, he added me to a Bolivian moto Whatsapp group that helps foreigners on motos while traveling in Bolivia and could not help enough with anything I needed or suggestions for routes.  highly recommend, even if they don't have it ask if Eric the owner is around and he'll help you out.

name: Pocoata Plaza Principal
description:
We stayed one night right at Plaza Principal at this small town of Pocoata as it was getting dark. 

We stayed at the northern side, opposite of the church.

It was pretty vivid until like 9-10pm and then pretty quiet during the night.

No problems whatsoever. Public toilet nearby.

name: Aparcamiento Campo Coliseo
description:
Sport stadium Parking Lot. Closed enclosure, closes at 9:30pm and opens at 5:30pm. You can stay in your van at night.
24h incl. night 20 Bolivianos. It's perfect for visiting the city. You can take a minibus that takes you to the center for 1'5 bolivianos.

name: Restaurant Green Planet
description: Excellent local restaurant, super clean, serving delicious food. We had the set lunch (both meat and vegeterian options) and it was great in terms of taste and value. The most nutritious food we had for a while. Highly recommended.

name: Possibility to camp behind a local house
description: The nice man that used to rent a room here did not have availability when we visited. It looks like he rents to miners. After explaining that we were very tired (on bicycles) and as it was getting dark and cold, he kindly let us camp behind his home. When we tried to pay him, he said that he did not want any money. We still gave him some money the morning after as a little thank you. He was very friendly and nice and he also offered to refill our water bottles before departing. Clean spot, some wind protection, hidden from the road. Hard ground, most likely only suitable for free standing tents.

name: Mamá Pancha
description: this place is not on Google. but the Aji de Fideo I had was good for the price. menu with prices are on the picture

name: Rock tower
description: excellent place! far to the route, quiet, beautiful view. no service at all. big flat place. try to not dump garbage. we pick up some bottles and trash. collaborate!

name: Flat spot with view near Irocota
description:
Great big flat spot with amazing view. You can see Sucre from here.
Had mobile internet here.

name: Quiet street
description: On street parking good option for a night. Parked here to go to a restaurant and after realising there is basically nowhere to stay other than the airport which shuts early, spent the night here. Is a quiet, small but wide residential street, police station just on the corner, slept well - nice and quiet and safe and not much activity or passing cars

name: Estacionamiento felipa
description: There is an iOverlander record here under short term parking, but you can stay in your vehicle as long as you need to, as we did for 2 nights 40b per night, access to water, safe and secure for big rigs. leaving this as a camping spot so others can find it if they are using filters

name: Near Refugio entrance
description: We stayed here a night in our Truck (8t) with an other overlander just next to the road. Just 2 cars were passing by. Very peaceful and quiet. The road 5 km to this point has a lot of washouts, is doable when its dry but we recommend 4x4 because of the steep parts. The mirador is small but very beautiful.

name: ALMACÉN MAMANI
description: Very small shop where we bought some vegetables and eggs before approaching the laguna route. They have a few other simple groceries, snacks and soft drinks.

name: Api con pastel
description: Go here for breakfast. It is hidden in the marker. You can have the drink api with pastel! Wauw soooo goood! Do not miss this!

name: Masterfix (also old cars)
description: German (the owner) and his team are really nice, honest, and knowledgeable! We had a really strange issue, our car stopped after half an hour to work. We went there because our car still has a carburetor and we were told that every mechanic around would go to German. So we went there and stayed two days. The carburetor and the tank were cleaned. It was done step by step, and everything was measured (pressure and heat) also during some drives. We also got a complete new pump for gasoline, which is now electric because we would not get the right part here in Bolivia. As it was a complete new installation without the old pump for gasoline, we still had a problem as we try to leave La Paz, and it was Sunday. Nevertheless, German and his team helped us because he really wanted us to continue our journey. We are really pleased and happy to find this workshop!

name: Flat spot on road between Torotoro & Carasi
description: Nice big flat spot next to the road. great views. had a little bit mobile internet reception.

name: Parking lot
description:
There's a big space between the avenue and the hospital with flat ground. Change the position sometimes. We spend several days here and the main square. On weeks there's a little kids movements because the kinder and the school near to this point.
Quiet at night also on weekends.

name: plaza del avion
description:
Safe place in front of a square, to spend a quiet night

Sitio seguro frente a una plaza, para pasar una noche tranquila

name: Quehua tienda
description:
Small tienda in Quehua. Was open around lunch hour. Sells at least:
- soda and other drinks
- tuna
- candy and cookies
- Quinoa or rice

Location is on the square, right next to the train track

name: Tienda en Carlos Machido
description:
In the street behind the church there are two tiendas. Both sell at least:

- Eggs
- Drinks
- Candy/cookies

On the “main square” close to the church there is also a tienda, which should be slightly bigger, but was closed when we were there around lunch time.

name: Tienda Kilpani
description:
3 tiendas in a row. We went to the middle one where they sell at least:

- Crackers
- Marmelade
- ice Cream/cookies/Candy
- noodles 
- Tuna or Sardines
- Drinks/beer

The neighbors have signs saying they sell bread, chicken and other types of meat

name: With view on the witch street
description: Nice modern hippie bistro. Here you can drink wonderfull coffee. Eat yukaki chips and cakes and drink the local drink singanu sour

name: La paz
description:
Parking near Teleferique Vert at 3200 meters 50 B 24 hours
----------------------
Estacionamiento cerca de Teleferique Vert a 3200 metros 50 B 24 horas

name: Coffeehouse, its in retro style. Do not miss this!
description: Its an old house, wich is a coffeehouse. The interior is retro. Old tv, old couches. You have the feeling you are in the year 80. Super cook en nice. The menu is amazing and cheap! You have all coffee combinations where you can think off! And smoothies snacks whatever you feel like. They have amazing wifi so you can also do some work. Very chill vibe. Being here its like an inspiration to start this myself to. Wauw!

name: Next to road with view
description: Big Pullout next to the road with amazing view. Almost no traffic when we were there. Entel LTE.

name: In the fields
description: A wonderful quiet spot in the middle of huge corn fields. Good spot for the night, some farmers went by on horses

name: Achacalla
description:
Free quiet and safe parking
Aparcamiento gratuito y tranquilo

name: Next to the route
description: you can see this place even with maps apps. is a entrance just in a curve. plenty space almost flat but for stop, is perfect. beautiful 360 view.

name: Guztec motors
description:
Felipe did a really good job. 
We had some play on the front suspension of our Toyota 4runner. He fixed it and showed us the used parts including a leaking shock. He also replaced our rear lights + found the origin of an annoying noise when riding on bumpy roads (fixed that as well). 
No idea of he is expensive or not, but this was a lot of work + the parts are expensive anyway + I am sure he did it good (writing this now after 1 week riding the car on all kinds of roads).
His nr +591 74407024

name: City sloths at the plaza central
description: City sloths roaming in the trees up above. They are high up and therefore hard to spot. We got very lucky at the plaza at Cotoca near Santa Cruz when one came down from it's tree; here in Trinidad we only saw them from a distance. Maybe you'll have more luck.

name: Taku and leo. Travel helpers
description: Taku and leo are volunteering guys who will let you sleep in front of there garrage. Give you free parking and give you advice for the city. They were so sweet. They showed us restaurants, walked us to laundry place. Showed us street carnaval. Helped us with our cardoor. They are also meachanics. They are 2 best friends from heaven. They dont want anything in return super cute. We slept here 4 days in our van. Super safe and quiet. The neighbourhood is very nice. Shower around the corner. If you have a tent you can maybe sleep in their garden. Just ask. Say hello from us. Dewi and Bjorn. Taku: +591 74055099.

name: Next to lake
description: Here you can camp. Enough space. Lake. There is a  school so in the day time full of kids. Evening quiet. There are some supermarkets and some restaurants.

name: Balneario Itapemi
description: This is a nice Natural swimming area and a Hotel (cabañas), 2 km on a dirt road from Guarayos.  80Bs for us and the Truck. Water was okay for Natural source, cold shower and toilet of Bolivian standard. Our daughter had fun in the playground and in the Kids pool.

name: Banana’s: vegetarian/vegan food
description: Restaurant is located on the 1rd floor. They serve vegetarian burgers, tortillas de verduras, milanesa de soya, salad with falafel. Burgers with fries, salad with falafel. Food was really great and the staff very friendly. Two hungry cyclist were full after 1 burger p.p and a shared salad. Highly recommended.

name: Valle de la Animas - official road?
description: I think this is official road to Valle de las Animás. Not sure if it's worth any detour as some roads are in 45 degree up to here. Lady come and ask for 20 bop as this road is private... Not sure about that. No ticket and so.

name: checkpoint
description: This was our first Checkpoint in 15 months SA where the officer was not satisfied with our copie from the drivers license, wanted to see the original and the Passport. very friendly

name: Toll Station - Puerto Suárez
description:
Official toll station for Ruta 4 direction Santa Cruz. 

We were asked how far we will drive and told the lady until Santa Cruz. We then paid 22 Bs. and got a ticket which confirmed the section we paid for: Puerto Suarez - Pailas. 

!!! KEEP THIS TICKET, as you will need it to pass all following toll stations. You don't have to pay again but will receive a stamp on the ticket.

name: Sunset Travel Rurrenabaque
description:
Very nice and cheap 3d 2n Pampas tour, very responsive and eco-friendly.

We did a 2n 3d tour with them. Reserved via WhatsApp. They were quick to reply and spoke good English (at least via WhatsApp). 

Tour was good, I think that very similar as all the others. As all of the agencies hire like 7 lodges in the same area and do the same stuff. Level of comfort seemed pretty much the same. 

We did planned activities like sunset bar, piranha fishing, anaconda hunt and swimming with dolphins. 

Animals - we saw a lot of them. There are also 3 or 4 (1 really big,) caimans hanging just around the lodge. So many birds, monkeys (3 different species), turtles, dolphins... Well worth it.

Anaconda - we went to a little island with other groups to search for anaconda. Guides found one and then they forcefully pulled it by the tail and caught it, so some turists could take pictures. Our guide wasn't a part of this and was sad by what was going on. But apparently not much fan be changed, I don't know. 

Mosquitoes were like crazy - biting through our thick hiking trousers as well! So really get good maybe army pants and put a towel or something on your chair below your butt and back, so they can't sting you from behind - will already make a big difference. Also take thick socks.

There are no soft drinks or beer at the lodge, so bring your own if you need to. Food was good and enough.

Our guide was Jose and he was a really cool guy. From a local tribe with plenty of knowledge and experience and good English.

Overall a great experience, just the drive back was a bit bumpy and in a car in a bad state, that could be way better.

I do recommend!

name: YPFB Huanuni
description: i came here in my motorbike. they didn't have the system for international price so they just filled up directly into my tank the local price

name: Hotel Rio Ibare
description: We used this Hotel as a campground for 24h. You find a bit Shadow under the palm trees. paid 80 Bs for 2 and the Truck. Owner was helpful. Pool could be nice but really dirty. Also showers (cold) and toilets. Noisy in daytime because of Traffic, quiet at night

name: Alojamiento Cordillera
description: 120 BOB a night. rooms clean and shower warm enough. guy seemed a bit odd but thought I'd add to ioverlander since I struggle to find any other options when I arrived here in the dark.

name: stunning viewpoint
description:
It is a stunning viewpoint. Sadly these days you can probably only reach there with a guide. 
Best to buy the ticket at the office first and ask where you are allowed to go with / without a guide!
I got in a little bit of trouble, due to hiking here alone!
 Finally I only had to pay the park entrance fee and fuel for the guy who "caught" me. But they threatened me with jail and big fines at first....

name: Aduana Frontera Avaroa
description: Few buildings and spaces to park on the Bolivian side of the border. It is possible to find shelter from the wind. Toilets and showers advertised in one of the buildings open 24 hrs (when we were there, it was closed, due to the owners vacation).

name: Mario's and Letias comodor
description:
A nice and relaxing comodor run by the so very lovely Mario and Letitia who lives in the house next door. They are both super curious about foreigners and really like Belgians due to a former friend from there who worked in the town. I had the place (room of 2 bunk beds and 1 simple bed) for myself with access to a nearby bathroom with clean toilet and warm shower (clean but dusty) all for 30BoB. There might be a possibility for food if needed. Electricity is available but lights are sometimes flickering so not sure how strange to voltage is. Potable water in the bathroom or 500m away at the village's communal tap (there should be another one at the small cozy plaza too). 

I did not intend to overnight at this very unknown place but have been showered in hospitality by its inhabitants and can only recommend others to partake in this cozy and less known part of Bolivia

name: Fondo de Bikini
description:
Laundry 5 bolivianos / kg. friendly staff.

Lavandería 5 bolivianos /kg. Personal amable.

name: Plaza
description: We stayed here for the night. Its just against the Police Station so it felt very safe. Noisy at night because of the motos. People around very very friendly

name: Hot hostal shower
description: 10bls for 15 min. They do not check the time. Water is burning hotttt

name: Lake view and swimming
description: Very nice. In the daytime and night. In the daytime you can go for a swim. Walk to the little city. Beautiful sunsets and you can make a fire. Was very quit in the night. You can also put your tent. Look foto!

name: Road Fee
description: The street is blocked with a chain and you have to pay 5 Bolivianos or 2,50 Soles. We did not had any money left and they let us through.

name: Salto Velo de la Novia
description:
Little trail in the forest leading to a nice freshwater pool and waterfall. Locals come here to hang out, so pretty crowded and noisy on Sunday. But a swim in a cold basin on a hot day is always a good idea.

10 BOL pp entry and 10 BOL to park your car. There are cold showers and clean toilets for 2 BOL at the parking area.

name: Hostal Rumi Wasi
description: Hostal where you can also camp (there is place for 2-3 tents). We paid 10bob for a tent and 10bob pp for a decent hot electrical shower. You can also get a dinner or a breakfast for 10bob pp.

name: Hostel Yossy
description: A nice place to stay before or after a tour in the selva/pampa. Room with private bathroom for 150 bs (2 adults and 1 kid). Very clean. And a communal patio with a hammock and a kitchen! The most important feature - 2 blocks away they have a secure place to park the campervan for the next 5 days for 10bs/day.

name: El sabor del cumpa
description: Off the main road that bisects Samaipata, to the the quiet side. Big bright orange poster. Very local food place that only opens Friday and Saturday nights. Owners are a lovely couple, when we visited they had charque or Kara (both involve tons of grilled meat). 30bobs per dish & 30 for a bottle of wine. Fresh lemonade: 3bob a glass.

name: Surtidor Paragua
description: No problem to get gas. Tanked straight away, no questions asked, as if we had a local car. Did not have to say a word. Great!

name: Burbu Clean Laundromat
description:
Small and super friendly Laundry with Self Service. 6 Washing Machines and Dryer.
After you start the Washing Machine you can go away and after 2h your clothes will be dry and folded.
20-30bol.


Perfect If you make the Documents for your Pet at Safari Veterinario.

You can park at the Street

name: Residencial Casarabe
description:
Spacious rooms with AC. Ensuite bathrooms for 150bobs, shared ones for 100bobs a night. No WiFi. Cleanliness and comfort, well, like other accommodations in this part of Bolivia. But good for one night! In the morning a street seller had set up his booth up the road by the corner of the football pitch and offered tasty empanadas & peach juice.
Parking in their garden, big rigs can fit.

name: San Pablo
description: Good place to spend a night when you drive from tupiza to the laguna route. Whe ask the people from the government building if it is ok to stay here for one night. Its a plaza and you can park around. Church is near. Quiet at night.

name: autobalan - alineación y balanceo
description:
stopped here to fix the balanceo and alineación. quick work. nice people. paid 150bs for the 4 wheels.
WhatsApp: +59169992410

name: No name shop
description:
Well stocked shop, good place for a cyclist to stock up  rice, pasta, tinned fish and more
No fresh veges.  Coca leaves.

name: Gasolinera
description:
There is a water tap. They tell me that it is drinkable, that they drink from there. It is easy to access
--
Hay un grifo de agua. Me dicen que es potable, que ellos beben de ahí. Es de fácil acceso

name: Natural pool : Pozas de Santiago
description:
Pretty waterfalls that have formed with time natural pools in perfect circle. Locals says thats the Inca shaped it. The trails start at the landing of the airport and goes for maybe 3km in the Forest (that you can maybe do with your 4x4 with patience bc the road is damaged) then 2km on the rocks. So 10km goes and back.
The place is really pretty and worth the easy hike !

name: Trail to the Cuevas de misrendino
description:
This is a hudge cavern on the top of the mountain of Santiago. You can walk in the bled of the river inside the cavern and cross different massive chamber. At the entrance there is a big waterfall where you can have a cold shower after the walk. Super impressive spot 
Along the way there is hundred of cool bloc of stones to see and a natural bridge made of cale. Just before the cavern there is also a giant cave where you can see paintings on rock made by people from the ancient time 
The trail is 6km to go so 12km in total. Easy walk

name: Begin of the trail to the cuevas of misrendino and the waterfall la colina
description: Begin of the trail to see the bridge of stone, the paintings on rocks, the cuevas of mirendino and th waterfall la colina

name: cascada velo de novia
description:
Great very little trek (1km) to the waterfall where you can swim in. There are even changing rooms at the top.
Worth a small detour, people of chochis are very friendly

name: Hospedaje
description:
Another basic Hospedaje at this location. 2 story building in front of the football field. No signs.
Paid 120 BOL for a matrimonial with clean, hot showers. No Wifi, but good entel connection. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and spent many hours looking for a room in this village. The owners of all the other hospedajes were not at home. Finally someone showed up at this place at 6pm just before sunset.

name: Alternative and easier route
description: The road to the north of this pin isn't on iOverlander or Google, but it's there. This is how the tour guides get out to the geysers in one day. The road has several spots with washboard, but it's very fast. From here you can get to the 701 in about 5 hours. If you go left, this is the classic Lagunas route and is very rough and took us like 14 hours. This whole loop if you go down one and come back the other is about 500km.

name: Inicua sports field
description: We stayed here next to the soccer field for the night. Very quiet after the kids finished to play soccer. Good for one night, suitable for all kind of rigs. Entel 4g

name: Queso Mizque Tres Molinos
description:
New place, at first, we stop to buy cheese and peanut butter but after talking with Gabi, she proposed us to park for the night in the parking. 
She’s very happy to welcome travelers. 
Nice and new shop, very large and flat parking. Bathrooms available too. 
Warn Gaby before arrive otherwise it could be closed. 
Whatsapp +59168584342 
Please buy some cheese to thanks her !

name: Hostel Jutalla
description: Here you can sleep in a room with two beds with very hard matresses for 10 bs per person. Toilet is shared with the family living here and not very clean. Nice people.

name: Azangaro
description:
There is free water.
Hay agua gratis.
Há água grátis.

name: Hillside spot
description: Follow the little used track from the main road. quite bumpy and rough in our 2wd van but check conditions. this small pull in is enough for one van, we levelled with rocks. very quiet, nice views of mountains and town. No one passed us while we were here.

name: water fall : chorro san luis
description: beautiful water fall with large area to swim in the middle of the forest. pintura rupestre in the rocks around. we have follows the instruction on maps me to get there, the trail is only for 4x4 i think

name: Diamez Hotel
description: originally a venue place that has also hotel rooms. you park your car or motorcycle inside the building on the dancefloor on front of the stage.  i had an electrical shower.  cost was 120 BOL and 10 for parking. hotel room and bed were proper

name: Big Deal Tours Garage
description:
We booked a tour to the Mines with Big Deal Tours and they let us stay in their garage for free. We ended up staying two days and also visited the Mint museum. 

The place is very safe, has clean toilets and sinks, sockets and it is warmer than outside. They offered us to use their showers as well, but we didn't try them. It's also possible to stay in their yard instead of the garage.

The Tour was very good, our guide Wilson was great, he is a miner himself and also has the humor of a miner. He speaks very good english. You can contact Big Deal Tours at: +591 71835516, ask for Wilson:)

name: Médical health home
description: general medical center in Copacabana. they also have a number on the door for emergencies.

name: Aduana office
description:
At this location is the aduana office. Very hard to find and a very strange place. Its inside the enclosure around the train tracks. You have to enter through the opening in the gate.

Only necessary if you are there with a vehicle. They didn’t really check anything about the vehicles.

name: Camedino Energy - Maquitec
description: Specialized in panel solar. Very professional and reactive. They changed our panel solar for only 150€ for 2x150wz I recommend +++.

name: Taller mecánico Churqui
description: Went to these mechanics to fix a stock plastic skid plate that broke after I hit a low flying bird. One of their mechanics was really helpful and drove with me to a few other places to look for a replacement plate. Ultimately he took me to another mechanic who works with plastic and repaired the skid plate - later they installed the repaired skid plate, all of it for 30bobs. It wasn't a difficult job but they have definitely been most helpful!

name: Wild place near field
description:
We stayed one night here before La Paz.

 No road noise at this distance. 
Quite far from the cities. 
Quiet at night. No amenities.
We settled down at nightfall and we left for sunrise.

name: Hostal Los Faroles
description: Very good Hostal. Fast wifi, hot showers, great breakfast. Nice covered patio that is heated in the winter so pretty warm compared to other places. Only negative point is that the kitchen is only for the staff to use to make breakfast (eggs).

name: near road 6
description: Spot just next to Route 6 hidden behind a big mound with a nice view of the mountains.

name: communautary tourism Dragon Dormido
description:
We spent 3 days and 2 nights in complete immersion in Maru's family, in the community of the sleeping dragon.. The opportunity to discover a different tourism, community and along the beaten track. their cooking, been introduced to agriculture and weaving. We were able to discover the fabulous landscapes of the region through beautiful steps, especially on the head of the dragon...
If you are attracted by this kind of responsible and community tourism, far from mass tourism, you can contact Inti, a Franco-Bolivian guide from La Paz who can organize your stay (WhatsApp: +591 69747761)
we stayed there with our motorhome

_________________________

nous avons passé 3 jours et 2 nuits en immersion complète dans la famille de Maru, dans la communauté du dragon endormi.. L'occasion de découvrir un tourisme différent, communautaire et lon des sentiers battus.. nous avons vécu a leur rythme, découvert leur cuisine, été initiés a l'agriculture et au tissage. Nous avons pu découvrir les fabuleux paysages de la région au travers de belles marches, notamment sur la tête du dragon... 
Si vous êtes attirés par ce genre de tourisme responsable et communautaire, loin du tourisme de masse, vous pouvez contacter Inti, guide franco bolivien de la Paz qui pourra vous organiser le séjour  (WhatsApp : +591 69747761)
nous y avons séjourné avec notre camping car

name: two very small tiendas in town
description:
El Oro is the last place to restock on supplies before tackling the big uphill towards pucara. there's a big next to her football field that the locals use as their well by disconnecting the pipes and filling their buckets or bottles. 

there's a few houses on the way up the hill but it might be difficult to get any help at all from them.

name: Riverside Spa Camping
description:
Big flat area for all kinds of vehicles. Access to river that looks clean but smells a little. We spend two silent nights here. No dogs. Little road noise. Good 4G reception with Entel. No rubbish.
Enjoy and take your rubbish with you.

name: Pull out
description:
Quiet pullout more or less behind a hill 50 m from the main road near a watering pit for lama’s. Flat. Some lights from installations nearby. 
In the morning you will be visited by loads of lama’s who come drinking. Please respect the animals and let them be...don’t scare them.

name: Llanteria
description: Good quick service with the right equipment. They changed our tyre for the spare and fixed our punctured one. (We are with a high clearance motorhome, so was a bit of work)

name: Ex Combatientes square
description: in this place, the Classical VW club, every Thursday meets in the square with all VW family cars. we felt so comfortable and welcome. also, you can overnight here. the club invite us to dinner choripan and disert and give us some gifts.

name: Cruce Luribay - no foreigners
description: no way to sell us gasoline for foreigners. just Bolivian cars

name: Tienda
description: Well-stocked tienda with some vegetables, pasta, canned food, snacks, etc.  Even sells a little bit of hardware.  Open from early in the morning till noon.

name: Below ruta 3
description:
We were looking for a place to spend the night with our campervan after driving the first section of the "death road" (8km down & up again). 

At the other spot "Next to the main road" we felt too exposed. So we chose this side street which is easily accessible and offers some options to park (probably not for  big rigs?). 

You are below the main road here, slightly visible still and there was a little "noise" from the trucks passing by. But we felt safe and had a peaceful night. 

OK Entel signal. 

A small stream of water is crossing the road and continues in the valley. 

Tents may find shelter next to some ruins here.

name: Hotel Cosmos
description:
Every simple option to sleep in this village was closed, when we saw a hotel sign at the Cosmos Restaurant. We asked around and behind the restaurant there was a hotel. We could park our Motorhome safely behind a gate (no height limits), but after that not much space was left for other vehicles. We are not sure if the hotel is yet to be finished, it was kind of messy. Room was nice, spacious, clean, with attached private toilet. Showers are on the groundfloor. We paid 120 BOL/2p.

June 2023: We could park our motorhome in the garage and sleep in the car for only 20 Bs.

name: Carbon Naranja Grill Bar
description: The best place I have eaten in nearly 4 months of travelling in South America. Genuinely incredible food. Grilled vegetables, amazing meat, pickles and salsa. And lovely people. And massive Singari cocktails that are unbelievable

name: BancoFie ATM
description:
my friend and mine's had a USD7 charge. We went to BNB
--

Free cash withdrawal for Visa cards. Withdrawal up to 3000Bob
--
Retrait d’argent sans frais pour les cartes Visa. Retrait jusqu’à 3000Bob

name: Tesla Universal
description: Good electrical mechanic. Bolivian young guys. Hard working and good price.

name: La Paz informal camp site
description: This place is a quiet and safe. No facilities.

name: Wok fusion Chinese restaurant
description: Good food/ingredients , large quantities , reasonable prices..

name: Salar
description: Nice place to stay. No services. Secure and beautiful.

name: Pull off RN5 near creek
description: Pull off RN5 to a soccerfield. Area before creek is fairly level sand, passing through creek terrain looks more level. Creek looks easy to pass but we didn’t want to try it with our motorhome. Close the 5 and thus visible from road, but for us not an issue. We had a quiet night. Traffic was slow and died down after 22:00. There is also a railway but we didn’t have much trains

name: Public Parking Nuflo
description:
Simple public parking.
Pro:
- All concrete surface
- Entrance for big rigs (two gates; one quite high, one without height restrictions) 
- Very close to main plaza
- Allowed to stay in motorhome over night
- Has a toilet
Con:
- No view protection from the streets (it has a fence, but no walls)
- Very noisy (day and most of the night)
- Toilet is very dirty

name: Alojamiento
description: Simple clean accomodation next to the place where some buses arrives. Paid 30 for a bed, has warm shower. Bikes could stay inside the building. Outside alojamiento is written and also bag guarding. Cheap restaurant are nearby.

name: Clinica Veterinaria Hocico Spa
description:
In order for us to travel to Europe with our dog (from Colombia), a blood test had to be done. The blood had to be sent to a recognized laboratory in Germany. Mrs. Andrea Vargas and her team have done this several times and knew exactly what to do and also knew the laboratory in Germany. We felt extremely well taken care of and would recommend the clinic to all travelers! 

We paid for the whole paper stuff and the consultation incl. blood collection 500 bob. We were in contact via Whatsapp all the time and they accelerated the process at the SENASAG.

Thank you very much for everything!🙏🏼

name: 360 view
description:
Along the road to the entel tower.
No windshelter, but not really visible from the main road and no farms or dogs nearby.
360 view on the valleys below

name: Military Checkpoint
description:
When driving past the laguna you go through a military checkpoint. They looked through our car, searching for drugs or arms, they said it's a common smuggling route. They also said that it's not allowed to drive with jerry cans here, because the border is so near, even though we told them that we are not going to Chile. After some talking and us wanting to go back and find another route, because we needed the gasoline for the planned route, they let us through. Maybe an additional problem was that we have a Chilean plate, but they didn't mention that. So if you do have jerry cans, I would suggest you go around the laguna to avoid the military control (I hope there is none).

Update - easy, quick check of passports, no looking in car, no mention of our visible Jerry's.

name: Hotel Melody
description:
Most friendly and comfortable Hotel in Quime I would say!
It seems to be the only Hotel in town which offers Wifi. There is a huge green area and swimming pool in front. You could camp or park your vehicle there. 
Roberto is a very helpful, considered and communicative host.
He let me cook some simple food and hot water. His son and wife were as well always charming. 
The prize was about 80 BOL for one person,  I guess for 2 people you can get a room for 100 BOL and camping may be around 30 - 40 BOL.
I highly recommend this place and would always return there!

name: Amelia Hotel
description:
The hotel itself looks nice and inviting.
But the lady who runs is it is a nightmare!
She always found a new reason to make me feel less comfortable:
1. Pay for towel (acceptable though)
2. Don't use the dining area, especially not while turning the lights on!
3. No use of shared shower for cheaper rooms
4. Don't put things in the refrigerator, because it will contaminate her butter!
5. General phrase: "Are you leaving tomorrow?"

The prize that was negotiated and agreed was obviously not suitable and therefore she tried to find something else every day.

Better go to Hotel Melody across the road!

name: Panorama road from La Higuera back to Road Nr 38
description:
On this road you can make a circle from La Higuera back to the road nbr. 38.
The views are great and the road is ok to drive.
If you stay in the Casa del Telegrafista in La Higuera ask the owner for a route description as only OSM maps show this route

name: abandoned over the clouds
description:
Flat are for all kinds of vehicles and tents. Nice view over the clouds. no wind. abandoned building next to it. next to the road but quite. Phone signal okay.

no trash. some locals and dogs walked by.

enjoy and take your trash with you.

name: ISAB Servicios Automotrices.
description: An automotive mechanical service, repairs, oil change, maintenance. 7am to 7pm (call Fernando on +591 78898874)

name: Garaje Tarija
description: Garage, not very pretty but a safe place to spend a night or leave the car parked.  It costs 15 Bolivianos a day.

name: Aguas Termales
description:
Very nice owner Theodora offers you rooms, meal (25 bol /person for soup + meal + tea), and/or a place for the night for your vehicle AND small but great natural thermal bath. nice views, warm water (15 bol per person). llamas everywhere and nice nature side to camp or sleep in your van ! 
if she is not here, you can find her in her tienda in the village of Sajama (labelled "Tienda Sajama doña Théodora").
There is a small path (closed with a cadena) and you see a few small houses 100m further down. the route is also available on maps.me 
Her number : +59173229327
Her son's numéro : +59173738781

name: Hotel Glorioso
description:
Simple hotel, but with good structure and cleanliness. Great service! we traveled with a camper and it was great to find this hotel, which is one of the few that has parking without height limitation in the region. We paid 250 bolivianos for a double room.
--
Hotel simples, mas com boa estrutura e limpeza. Ótimo atendimento! viajamos com um camper e foi ótimo achar esse hotel que é um dos poucos que tem estacionamento sem limitação de altura na região. Pagamos 250 bolivianos por um quarto de casal.

name: Old soccer field
description: The place is an abandoned soccer field with flat grass. Nothing special but quiet and no dogs. No water. There is a tienda a few meters before who sell water.

name: Quinta Piray
description: Very good cabañas, ca 1.5 km outside the city center. Sweet host. Nice beds, good kitchen, hot shower, nice terace and barbecue facilities. Secure parking, no hight limits. Indoor swimmingpool. Ca 50 dollar a night (cabaña for 5 persons).

name: Restaurant La Floresca
description: Truck Stop behind a restaurant. Not nice but a safe and calm place for one night. We paid 15 BOL. There is also a toilet. The restaurant serves food.

name: hostal sol y lago
description: really nice place with little cabanas and rooms. great views over the lake, secure parking. they have 3 dogs, 2 got along super well with my pup, the boss dog and mine got into a little fight and then the pecking order was sorted. cabañas stay warm at night because the walls are so thick. wifi is ok, but went out a couple times briefly. 10/15 minute walk to town, or 2 minute drive. really enjoyed my stay. paid 100bob for the cabin, room was 80bob.

name: Hotel Arenal
description: Nice hotel, right in the city center, with a big (no height limit) secure parking place, also for motorhomes. Just a 5-minute walk from the main square. Big and bright room, hot water, nice swimming pool and barbecue area.

name: Next to Parque de la Autonomia
description: A taxi told us to park here for the night. We had a calm night. There is a police station 15meters from here. This is also the place to take the teleferico to see Jesus. There ae toilets for 1 bs in the park.

name: Review Ruta 25
description:
Feed back of the long road 25 from Cochabamba to F3. 
Its 480 km of pista. The side of the road of cochabamba province is in incredibly good shape with fabulous landscape of the mountains and traditional Bolivian way of life. Its all about going in top of the mountain and go down, cross à river and start climbing an other mountain. The other side of LaPaz Province is a nightmare lol. Sometimes very damaged sometimes ok, always pratiquable but very long and exhausting. We did all the road in 5 days with most of it at 20km/h, driving 4-6hours per day. There isnt a lot of nice place to sleep. And there isnt gaz station everywhere and a lot of them were out of diesel when we were there. We did it at the beginning of winter so no mud at all but incredibly amount of dust. We never needed to put in the 4x4 mode. I think we didnt enjoyed the road at the end of cochabamba province because of the dirty, dusty, damaged road. And we would never did it again lol

name: Ruins Sora Sora
description:
Very interesting old ruins of a church a courtyard or something and other buildings.
Unfortunately no information at the place itself… 
Also good place for the night. Road noise off course but parked right behind the church not too bad

name: Hospedaje 5 Noviembre
description:
Friendly family.
Basic rooms.  Toilets part of pay public baño. No seats. 
Showers separate, didn't use .

Watch out for dog poop in the court yard at night! Their dog roams all day but comes home at night to eat, poop and sleep. 
60 Bob for matrimonial room.

name: Casa Deutz. All parts for Deutz
description: This is the best place to get spares for your Deutz Truck/engine. Phone: 71839727

name: Big flat space next to old church
description: Good flat space behind the old church. Only a bit off the road, so some roadnoise. Close to a river, but water looks very unhealthy. Behind ruins also possibilities for high clearance vehicles.

name: library la petite bibliothèque
description:
Kids library with books in Spanish and French. Chess games. Good vibes only ! Free for locals and tourists. 
They sometimes have workshops and I understand can sometimes use volunteers for these workshops. The place is ran by Israel who does an amazing job.

name: Prívate House "Mamita Sonia"
description:
Is a private family home.  Mom Sonia and her family offer a barbecue, bathroom, WiFi, hot water shower, large green space with some trees to set up a tent or park a motorhome.  40Bs per person **It is necessary to coordinate by phone +59178036326 before** and Sonia is a cook and you can order delicious meals at a very good price...

Es una casa de familia privada. Mamá Sonia y su familia ofrecen, Parilla, baño, WiFi, ducha agua caliente, espacio grande y verde con algunos arboles para armar carpa o estacionar motorhome. 40Bs por persona **Es necesario coordinar por teléfono antes** y Sonia es cocinera y se pueden encargar ricas comidas a muy buen precio...

name: Tucumanas (vegetarian options)
description: Small red newly opened shop where a nice woman sells tucumanas (similar to empanadas) with cheese. You can choose from pineapple, corn and ham filling. She makes them from scratch in front of you. Very delicious! 5 bob

name: Frenos y Embreagues
description: Good and quick brake service. Cleaned our rear brake cylinders and replaced brake pads.

name: Alojamiento y Camping Comunal La Higuera
description: When we visited the Che Guevara Museum, the nice lady who opened it told us we could camp right across the street at the Alojamiento. There is a clean toilet and warm shower, but it came with a really big spider, so we did not try the shower. Place is beautiful, quiet and surrounded by the mountains. 30B for 2 persons and a motorhome.

name: Hotel Parking Lot
description: Between Hotel Santa Maria and cemetery. We asked at the hotel to sleep in the motorhome which was fine. Could not use the baño of the hotel. Quiet place.

name: Bicycle shop: La bicicleta Urbana
description:
Well stocked bike shop
Found here: Squirt wax, 26" presta tube, 26x2.00 tire.

name: COA-Cycling
description: Workshop only / Recommended by a friend who had his chain/cassette replaced. We went there to service/clean/grease our bearings and they did a great job. Picked up the bikes the next day. Price was 180Bol for 2 bikes.

name: Ruta Nacional 2
description: This is a tiny shop at the top of the first climb. lovely elderly couple, really need our support. great place to stop for a Sprite and waffers (cost less than £1!!) sitting in the shade :) nice views too :)

name: Club Hipico Los Jardines
description:
We took a ride with Ariel, a very friendly guy that offers horse-riding tours from 3 / 5 hours (100/200 BOB) or two days (700 BOB with food and hospedaje).
Ariel has a lot of experience. Classes in horse-riding / jumping etc. and has experience as well with therapy for horses. Takes good care of the animals.
Contact him via WhatsApp +59174207393 for more information.

name: Finca Vallejos
description: Nice place, 2 pools, lots of outdoor space for the dog. wanted 350bob but he dropped to 200. Good spot just outside of Sucre. no food, but they sell beer. food in the town 2 minutes away.  wifi is horribly slow, and there was no hot water, though they say there is.

name: Ruta Nacional 25
description: Paragliding spot. Very flat with amazing views of Cochabamba. Not visible from the main road, but visible from the smaller road.

name: Car Wash
description: A good car wash after the salar here. around 1 hour for our pickup for 60 Bob.

name: Santa Pacha
description: Hotel close enough to the centre, we paid 16us$ (110bob at this time) for a matrimonial room with shared bathroom. The place is clean and the owners are very friendly, we could park our motorbikes inside but contact the owner first as there is not much space. The room and the showers were a bit cold. Simple breakfast included in the price. Better to contact the owner to make a reservation and not use booking.com, as two couples made a reservation through the website but the owner couldn't see it (?) and they were pushed back.

name: Alojamiento Peca
description: Nice lady and her mum that are building up this place. Now rooms with two separate beds, matrimonial, and building in the appartement. Very kind and clean. 70BOB for 2 pers. Hot Showers

name: Hostal Licoma
description:
Modern build hotel partly still under constructions. The lady who runs it has her shop right next to it. We paid 120 BOL for two and shared bathroom. there was no parking but the lady told us just park our motorbikes right in front of it on the street. all was safe.

a grocery store is opposite of the street and Street venders sell food.

name: Alanoca mechanic (Javier)
description: good guy I was looking for a prevention checking and two places charge around 800 BVS. Javier charged me 400 BVS for checking and cleaning engine. also breaks and general things. his number 7127606.

name: Hostal la Moneda
description:
Nice Hotel with big Garage (just Cars and Motorbike). Plenty of rooms, large beds, perfect hot shower. Breakfest is on the 7th floor with a great view over the city and the Mine Mountain. Breakfest is good. Nice staff.
Paid 200 bol incl. Garage and Breakfest for 2 persons with 2 motorbikes.

name: La casita de Chiki Luis
description:
Luis has a small flat available for cyclists. Also in warmshower or couchsurfing, he agree and glad to be in iOverlander. 
His casita has toilets, warmshower, little kitchen and a small bedroom with a small bed for two persons. Bikes can be stored inside the flat. We paid 10 bolivianos/person. Luis is very nice and funny. This place was perfect after few days in a tent even though it is a bit cold.
Ask for Chiky Flores downtown or write directly to him: 
+591 73851100

name: Warning: Dangerous xenophobic people
description:
Emergency camped here on a Saturday evening. Many cars passed this street as it connects to a village.
At 11pm a car stopped. 4 drunken aggressive  people came to our pick up camper and harassed us "no es lugar de turistas", "que hacen gringos aka" 
The situation was extremely  scary, our worst experience in 5 years travelling Latin America and wild camping. They clearly intented to beat up my husband. Told him to come out of the camper. He refused, made the bear spray ready and started calling the police. They mistook the bearspray as an explosive. 
Our luck was that in our truck camper they were not able to bypass me siting in the entrance. Bolivian culture doesn't  allow to harm woman. We didn't  thought we would make it out of that situation. 
Without the threat  of bear spray and the police they would have never left. 
We are still shocked. 
Don't wild camp in Bolivia.
Don't  come to the wild camping spots nearby this warning. They would do the same with you and you might be less lucky. They made clear that this is no place for tourists. You should plan to drive the route La Paz - Uyuni without a stop as there is no safe place to camp in between.

name: Big Flat Spot
description:
Big Flat area beside the road, not visible from the road. Plenty of space for big rigs or 5+ cars or tents. Some noise from the road.

We took lunchbreak here.

name: Hotel Velasco
description:
Stopped here with our two bicycles when Tree Cruces was nothing. Clean hotel, several options (with our without own bathroom, matrimonial / two / tree beds).
WiFi available and it works well. Shower was kind of warm. Place to store our bicycles inside. We paid 100 bol.

name: Great wildcamping spot
description: Very few options to stealth camp in this area. Mountains are too steep and every flat area is a field or someones house. So the best option in this area is to ask someone which we planned to do until we found this great flat spot. On the inside of the hairpin there's a track leading to the river below. Halfway down there's flat area. More or less out of view with some wind shelter and noise canceling from the river. Space for 2 tents or even a big rig. We came on bikes from Rio Sacambaya the night before. There's even decent entel signal here.

name: El conquistador
description: On the road from Cochabamba to Vila Tunari we where looking for a quiet place to overnight. We drove on an asphalted road into the mountains and found this open air restaurant. It is a troutfarm where you can eat fresh trout. We asked if we could overnight with our campervan after dinner and that was ok. Perfect night, very quiet in beautiful envirement.

name: Hospedaje Salcoqueza Jesús
description:
After being in Tahua, where every hospedaje was closed, we went 8km further to Coqueza. We found only this hospedaje open. There is room for about 20 people. All is made with salt. Warm shower. There is a kitchen that we were able to use with our own stuff. We did not understand if it was always the case or because they did not have enough food to make us dinner.
50bol p.p in a double room or 150bol with mate, breakfast and dinner. Nice place !
74232300 or jr.alanes@gmail.com

name: Carwash - Lavado auto
description:
Good place for rigs to clean. Thorough clean (no showroom clean, but that is not what want so no problem) of our motorhome

We have a big high motorhome and we are usually too big/high for most lavados. Or the slope is too steep. We had been searching for a while for a good place.

name: San Cristóbal SRL
description: Water tap in San Cristóbal petrol station.

name: El Sutó Apart Hotel
description: Spacy appartements with Kitchen, livingroom, bedroom and Bathroom. 3 Beds are minimum per appartement. Clean, all new, aircon in the bedroom. 280 bol per night. Bit outside of town so it's quiet. Enough space to park Motorbikes and Cars.

name: Parking
description: In The very city center, guarded 4-stories building, high enough to enter with our van. Price only 1bob/hour, closes at 21:30. Perfect if you want to explore the city.

name: El Tábano Pub
description: Popular local place to eat Caiman and other river fish.

name: Via San Jose de Chiguitos
description: Not always...bad service. We waited for 40min to be served, they didn't care and filled 5 more cars which just arrived. Got tourist price even we didn't drive to the Pump - Parked outside to fill our fuel bladder (no problem to pay the Tourist price as we are tourists).

name: senasag - pet export
description: Here are senasag offices to obtain pet export certificates that are not on Google Maps. The building is named "el ceibo", the office is number 22, 1st floor (you can ask the security guy at the entrance). They will ask you to come with the zoo sanitary certificate and all the papers, the export certificate takes 48h to emit.

name: Coffee Bike Cafe
description:
A great coffee place in Sucre with specialty coffee. We arrived by bicycle and the owner - an old professional cyclist - was very enthusiastic about that! 
He told us the people by bike get a 10% discount and we even got a little present of chocolate with coffeenibs. So cute!
Easy acces by bike and place to park it. No vegan milk options.

name: Titicaca Zipline
description: The longest and most extreme Zipline in America, and the third longest in the world, flies over Lake Titicaca at more than 120 km per hour

name: Quinta las Posas
description:
Huge grassy place with trees at the back of some cabanas.
There is a swimmingpool with a terrace and lots of showers and toilets.
We payed 100 bol for a night for 2 and a camperg and 80 bol for a good meal they served for us at the terrace. There is a pond and many birds.

name: Casa de Sal
description: What a great hotel in this dusty village. Large rooms, comfi beds, heating, hot shower and friendly staff. They aranged a save parking space at the neighbours for our motorhome (3 meters high). 63 U$ a night, 2 persons incl. breakfast.

name: Tiendas
description: There are 3 small tiendas around the main plaza.  One can find bread, eggs, pasta, toilet paper, water.  No fruits or vegetables.  Lots of candies and softdrinks.

name: Milluni Lake
description: great spot next to the lake with amazing view to the mountain Huayna Potosi, flat parking that belong to the locals, better if you ask permission at the police control  just before the intersection. Super quiet safe at night.

name: Residencial Luna
description: tranquil place next to the local bus terminal. dorms (3 single beds in a small room) for 30bs/pp, 70bs for a single room. really good value, stayed here two nights satisfied

name: Hamburguesas La Calle Brava
description:
Small restaurant at the street corner. They serv Burgers, Lomitos, Chicken and some kind of Steak with egg, fries and rice. 
We needed to wait +/- 35min but the food was verry good, fresh cooked and tasty.
60 bol for 2 persons (Lomito and steak called especial with a bottle of Soda)

name: Hotel Parador Santa Ana Chiquitos
description:
One oft the best Hotels so far in Bolivia. Big room with fridge, big shower (hot water), comfy beds. Everything verry clean and new. They tske really good care about the facilitie. Verry attentive employes. Breakfest with lots of different bred, jam, butter, eggs, juice, coffee, hot chocolate milk and more.

Space to relax for a day.

250 bol for double room incl. breakfest.
We could park our motorbikes inside because there were not many guests.
They really care about the stay of their guests!

Whatsapp +591 76619537

name: CHURRASQUERIA San Julian
description:
Fast and good service. 25 bol for small 30 bol for big plate of meat and rice. You can get salad on a buffet as well.

I'd come back any time

name: Tires and alignment
description: Here you can change tires and also balance and align. conveniently close to Barbara's cochera. Mostly Chinese tires however.

name: Inexpensive Motel
description:
More a motel than a hotel, no breakfast. Large building with a yard for safe parking. Double bed room with private bathroom. Good quality but water worked only in the evening because the water tank on the roof was not filled up when I arrived.  
Stable WiFi. 
Paid 60 Bolivianos as of May 16th 2023. 
On the satelite image you can spot the place by the big tree in the yard.

name: ATM Banco Fie
description: Works with foreign credit cards. No fees.

name: La Cocina - new Location
description:
Good Restaurant serving crazy good Burgers and other dishes (also vegeterian).

Verry nice and clean location, looks all new built. Service is excellent.

name: Espacio libre del municipio de Camargo
description:
It is clean and cared for land belonging to the municipality of Camargo. It does not have water or electricity facilities, but it is quiet and safe. A few meters from the main square and ample to park any type of vehicle.

Es un terreno limpio y cuidado perteneciente al municipio de Camargo. no tiene facilidades de agua o electricidad pero es tranquilo y seguro a metros de la plaza principal y amplio para estacionar cualquier tipo de vehículos.

name: El Muelle
description: This place is a paradise, it costs 10 Bs per person, 20 for the car, very uncrowded, which makes it even more special, internet Mobile 4G Tigo

name: La Martina
description: The place in Sucre to find sourdough and integral bread. In the morning the bread is sold around 10h. They also have sourdough Napolitanen pizzas

name: Flat spot under mango trees. Cyclists only
description: Not many possibilities in this area coming from the river. On the right (north) side of the road is a small trail leading to a flat spot above the road. Entrance is a bit east from this location. Best spot is under the third mango tree. We needed to unload to get there.

name: Residencial Pilar
description:
Nice and cheapest hostel found in Coroico. 60 Bol for a double room with shared bathroom. Also shared rooms available for 30bol pppn.

Humble room but worked for us. Bathroom is not so clean though.

name: CAPI Centro Cultural Samaipata
description:
Brand new cultural centre in Samaipata next to the archaeological Museum (Calle Bolivar).
Beside expositions and theater performances for all ages, they offer language courses for locals. Possible to volunteer. 
Goal is to bring everybody (Bolivians, extranjeros residents and travellers) together.

Cafe with the best bananacake, brownies, coffee, thee,.. 
Well worth the visit. Cafe opening hours not fixed yet. Probably from wednesday till sunday in the afternoon.

Owners speak several languages and will be very welcoming and happy to see you!

name: Isidoro's
description: Best and cheap place close to the Bus Terminal. 100 bol for a double with shared bathroom and 120bol with private bathroom. Friendly staff. Clean Bathrooms

name: Hot shower -8BOB
description:
Not dirty.
Hot
Friendly 
8BOB for 15minutes 
Baño 1BOB

name: Taller Motos Africa Twin
description: Nice little workshop with two working places for motorbikes. The owner was really friendly and customer orientated. He seemed to work very careful to do an excellent job. We did just an oil change on our CRF300. I'd come back any time

name: Supermarkets Fruits, Ice and Salchichas
description:
Supermarkets on the main square in the high part of Yucupampa with an amazing selection.
I chose the one on the opposite site of the public water pipe - probable potable. Also, a Restaurant on Waterfall/higher side right of a Supermarket

name: Residencial Moroni - Alojamiento en Cochabamba
description: Very nice and friendly owner (Luis). He cares so much about the guests and helps out with everything he can that you have an awesome stay. Everything spotless and comfortable. Greatest breakfast we had so far in Bolivia. No problem to park a car or several motorbikes right at the house inside the gate.

name: Hotel Utama
description:
Clean & comfortable hotel with outdoor but secure parking, laundry service, spacious rooms with lake/city view, close to the center and harbor. 
They have a storage room where you can leave your stuff while you go to Isla del Sol. We could also leave our motorbike in the secure parking lot with our stuff while we went to the island for a night.

Very good breakfast for an extra 25 bob/pp with eggs and pancake, fruits, cereals, etc..
Laundry is 20bob/kg.

name: Restaurante la cascada
description: Restaurant with surprisingly many options to eat. We had vegetable soup with fries and a huevo sandwich. Nice waterfall.

name: D'asporto
description:
Excelent Pizzería.
....
Abren a eso de las 17 horas y tienen dos tamaños de pizza el mediano (60 bolivianos) y el grande (80 bolivianos). Si uno quiere pedir dos sabores diferentes (mitad y mitad) aumenta 5 Bolivianos al precio. El sabor espectacular, ya que es en horno de leña y preparada en el momento, además el lugar ofrece un ambiente muy agradable. Super recomendado.

name: Residencial Jardin de Florinda
description:
nice Guesthouse with separated house with rooms. Big garden to relax, secure parking for motorbikes and cars, great breakfast.
We had a double room with privat bath for BOL 200.00

name: Local cooking experience
description:
An incredible highlight. The experience takes place with a Bolivian family. We immediately felt like we were at home away from home. Prior to arriving, we were asked to choose a dish to make:

Koko de pollo 
Pique lo macho
Empanada de santa clara 
Papa rellenas 
Tucumanas

Allergies, vegetarian and vegan options are available.

Once we had cooked we sat down and ate together. 

I can’t recommend this highly enough!

Contact one of the daughters, Lorena to book. 

+59169686019 (Wsapp)

name: Old School comics bar & more
description:
Cool bar/restaurant with many comicprops. 
Menu with choices like piquePacman, BarbaPapa, cookieBoob, ... 
Nice to visit, even without children.
While waiting for your food, you can look around or even play old Nintendos (dont know the name- See photos).

name: Cabanas San Felipe
description:
Lovely place here at the edge of San Felipe. Tiny houses in absolutely brand-new conditions. I spent here one night. The houses are equipped for up to 5 people. They have a pool and new banos. Worth a stop!
It starts at 150 pesos per person per night.

name: River Crossing
description:
We tried to cross over here instead of riding the Ruta 25 from Irupana to Coroico.

The road down is rideable with Motorbikes and 4x4 getting more and more narrow further down.

We couldn't cross the river with our CRF300. It was more than knee deep with medium current. Stones in the water are all verry slippery. I guess with a good 4x4 it's no problem.

name: Hotel Tamampaya
description:
This hotel has loads of space outside for vans and tents. We paid 40bob each to pitch our tent (for an hotel room they wanted 100bob each, doesn't look worth it). 
Nice view and clean enough. 
Google maps and maps.me don't recognise the road to get to here, it's not on the ruta 25! Basically when you arrive at the village you have to cross a bridge that will bring you to a parallel road to the 25. Just ask around, people know this place

name: Cafe Namu
description:
Great Korean restaurant. Meals around 30 Bol. Be hungry before you go because you will get big portions!
Very nice to have another option besides the Bolivian almuerzos (which are nice, but after a while it is nice to have something else).

name: Mec PS. Puerto Suarez
description: only mecanic in the region who could solve our problem with the crankshaft sensor. Car just stopped in the middle of the road when it reached over 1500 rotations pm.

name: Joselo old VW specialist
description: Recommended Volkswagen Kombi and Beetle mechanic, worked on our front suspension. He had time on a friday afternoon

name: Off Road
description: Very nice super quiet place with a nice mountain view. Perfect for a small van, Landcruiser or Landrover. Nice for tents too.

name: Skatepark
description:
Best skate park in Cochabamba. Nothing big, but well maintained. 
opposite on the street, you'll find a skateshop that sells boards and accessories.

For 10bol you can hire a board for 1 hour

name: Teresa's Camping
description:
Teresa and Adolfo are lovely and kind hosts who were very welcoming to us. 
They have a spacious area at the rear of the house used for car parking but they also accommodate camping. 
There is a dedicated new outdoor toilet with shower which is always clean. 
Their house is in a very good location, less than a 5 minute walk to the blue cable car teleferico of University UPEA, a quick and fun way to travel to the centre of La Paz. 
Good location for acclimatizing if you plan on hiking around La Paz. Safe location beside university UPEA with lots of food options/atm/etc. 
Quick working Wifi. 
We also stored our van here for 2 weeks when we were away. Overall, great place to stay when you are visiting La Paz. Address: Jose Arzabe 2014, big red gate with bell to the left. Teresa's Whatsapp number: +59160112880

name: Mountain Water
description: A very little ,waterfall‘ comes out of the mountain directly at the road. Looks very clear. We were filling up our bottles here.

name: University Comedor 10 Bol Salad, Soup, Main
description: University Comedor 10 Bol Salad, Soup, Main. Not always Veg

name: Fabian mechanic
description: We recommand 100% this garage hold by Fabian. We had multiple motor and wheel issues on our Mitsubishi L300. They we're really friendly, they checked the whole motor to be sure nothing was missing, found other problems too and explained us everything while we watched them during the process. It took 5 whole days of work for everything, we were able to sleep in the van, use toilets and Wifi. It was also very cheap compared to the other garage we found in the city.

name: Land Tower
description:
