Our friends Jorge and Anguelly have water, free parking and electricity on the road, they are very friendly with motorhomes, they have security cameras. Our friends support us with water, electricity and secure parking.
---
Nossos amigos são Jorge e Anguelly tem água, na estrada estacionamento gratuito e energia, eles são muito amigos das motorhome, tem câmeras de segurança. Nuestros amigos nos apoyan con agua, luz y parqueadero seguro.

name: Hospedaje San Augustin
description: We found this beautiful gem in a serious need of a spot for the night. This place doesn't really function as a hospedaje anymore, but some kind of retreat center for a religious group. It has two cabañas and a bigger flat area for tents. There is a young woman living here taking care of the space. She was very kind but definitely doesn't receive guests that often. She let us pitch our tent and use the bathroom in the cabaña. We even had a warm shower! In the morning, she asked for 20Bs/pp. The way down is a bit steep.

name: Julia Plaza Hotel
description:
Beautiful and comfortable hotel. It has heating, Wi-Fi, hot water in the shower, cable TV, garage and includes breakfast.
There are rooms for 180 bolivianos and 200.
There is 24 hour admission.
---
Precioso y cómodo hotel. Tiene calefacción, Wifi, Agua caliente en la ducha, cable tv, garage e incluye desayuno.
Hay habitaciones de 180 bolivianos y de 200.
Hay ingreso las 24 hrs.

name: San José
description: Limpieza SAN José. We paid 8bs per kilogram.

name: Eco Camping El Nido Del Uchi
description:
A very nice little campground run by a very very nice owner. 
20bol pP per night. You get cold showers, toilets, a nice pool, nice views, a lovely garden and agua potable. 

To get here, you must take first the small road from the main road to Villa Hermosa’ and then drive a little bit until there is the sign to the Camping. Here you have to drive left and keep yourself left on this road. This road up to the place is a bit steep & tricky, but we did it in the dark with our 2WD VW Crafter. So if you keep it slow, you will manage :). But don‘t know if bigger rigs like Unimog or something would be able to do it? 

Down on the sign for the Camping there is also written the phone number of the owner so that you can contact him before you go up the road in case he is not there (he works in a hotel nearby) or something. 

For us it was a real relief that we found this place, because around here there are not many nice possibilities in our opinion. 

So if you want to relax a little bit before or after La Paz … this is a very good place for it! 

We were there completely by ourselves - it was like a little paradise for us. 

Enjoy :)

P.S.: Entel Reception is also good here

name: Banco Fie
description: Only place where you can withdraw cash with Visa/Mastercard more than 500bs.  All other ATM didn't work!

name: Sobreruedas Bike shop
description:
Bicicletería. maintenimiento. reparación. repuestos. accesorios.
we did a check up before el camino de la muerte. 40bol for brakes check up and wheel spoke.
we needed a new tire in 28 and she had not a lot but we find a good one (gravel type)
su número 68189660 or 72041779
very friendly!

name: Lake Embalse Represa Tacagua
description: to see a few hundred flamingos. At the end of June, the lake withdrew sharply. Approx. 200m from the dam wall, you can drive the vehicle up to approx. 50m to the water

name: Anata hostel
description:
Nice hostel in the city centre, very close to teleferico. We chose it because they let us park our motorbikes in the courtyard (it's not very big so message them first), they charged us 30bob for leaving them there (no matter how many nights you stay)
We stayed in a private room with bathroom (195bob), the hostel seemed clean. 
We liked that it was very quiet but it's probably not the best place to meet and chat with other people. Breakfast is included and it was good. There is a terrace with a nice view
unfortunately there is not a kitchen, just a hot water station

name: Entel
description: Here you can buy an Entel simcard. They are clearly used to foreigners here. Fast, friendly and helpful. Really good deals. Free open wifi in store. Didn't have to wait long. Bring passport. Bright blue building, can't miss it. Smaller vans can park there, a bigger vehicle can find a place at the main square.

name: Ruta Nacional 3
description: Exit from the road, icy water but what a waterfall.

name: Porto Suárez
description:
Beautiful place, right on the riverside, great for fishing, quiet to sleep, area monitored by the army, very safe and quiet, with many macaws and many animals. Restaurants and markets nearby.
Beautiful sunset. It's worth spending a night.
.....
lugar lindo, bem na beira do rio, ótimo pra pescar, tranquilo pra dormir, área monitorada pelo exército, bem seguro e tranquilo, com muitas araras e muitos animais.
restaurantes e mercados bem próximos.
e pros Brasileiros a operadora vivo e claro pega em alguns pontos do local.
lindo por do sol.
vale a pena passar uma noite.

name: Achakana Restaurant
description:
Delicious food! This is the  place if you want something else besides hamburgers or chicken. The young chef Antonio with his guys are working on something new! Fresh and healthy cooking with a touch of Bolivian traditional food. They care where the products come from. Homemade limonades too. Menu with 3/5 rounds from 50BOL. Or 8 rounds for 80BOL.
Bonus: they sell sourdough bread.
Took a taxi from the center for 15BOL

name: Road to Toro Toro
description: We got 10l gas for 60Bs in our jerrycan. Diesel/gasoline. It's a good spot to purchase gas before reaching Toro Toro. The man is very nice.

name: Achakana Restaurant
description: The restaurant sells sourdough bread. Outside they have a sign with ‘hay pan massa madre’. Paid 15 per bread. It was delicious, even after two days. Great chef and it is worthwhile to visit the restaurant too.

name: faro - lighthouse
description:
Beautiful view over the city of Oruro.
We are passing time waiting for the museum Simon Patino to open and found this peaceful place.

name: Car electrician
description:
We had problems with the pre-heating system of our Mercedes Benz Sprinter. Reynaldo helped us a lot! Sadly we could not fix the problem since in Uyuni we could not find the spare parts. He did not charge us anything! He is really helpful and he knows what he is doing. Highly recommended. 

His number is +591 71182416

name: Willka uta
description: We had breakfast here, a sandwich with avocado and cheese and a cheese omelette served with soup, fries, rice, vegetables, two coffe with milk and we paid 42bob in total. Everything was fresh and nice

name: Mineralwater Quelle
description: Source with drinkable mineral water. We received the tip for staying overnight from the host of the Tampo Salinas restaurant, which accompanied us personally. is a safe and sheltered place. about 500m outside the village. Cold in the morning in the shade.

name: devant magasin d'animaux
description:
Translation: Do not stop in these cities we went to eat for lunch and we come back to the truck we find 2 tires punctured with knives nice locals!!!!

ne pas s'arrêter dans cettes villes on est aller manger pour le midi et on reviens au camion on a retrouver 2 pneus crever à coup de couteaux sympa les locaux !!!!

name: antifreeze additive for diesel
description:
Perno centro, torre Montecristo. 
Here you can find antifreeze additive for diesel fuel. It will help to start a diesel engine at these cold and high altitude, as Bolivian diesel is not the best quality.

name: Lavado After Salar
description:
Small, family-run car wash. Presumably open every day as we came here on a Sunday. They gave our entire truck camper an extremely thorough wash. Excellent work and only cost us 70bol. 
It was a Sunday we arrived at 4pm, they closed the doors after us, we were the last ones.

name: Vétérinaire
description:
This veterinarian takes care of the senasa documents in order to cross the various borders. The price is 800 bob per dog (including 297 bob included for the senasa). It's a bit expensive, special foreign rate, but practical. You still have to wait between 3 and 4 days to obtain the certificate legalized by the senasa.
Ce vétérinaire s'occupe des documents senasa afin de traverser les différentes frontières. Le tarif est de 800 bob par chien (dont 297 bob inclut pour la senasa). C'est un peu cher , tarif spécial étranger, mais pratique. Il faut quand même attendre entre 3 et 4 jours pour obtenir le certificat légalisé par la senasa.

name: inside the rock
description: One of the big rock formations has a built in shelter. You need to climb up the rock

name: At the ruin overlooking the river
description: Beautiful place. Space for several also big vehicles. Amazing view. No dogs, no garbage. Many birds.

name: Access to the river and lots of space for camper and tents
description: Great and so far the only good acces to river. Beautiful route through the deep valley.

name: Efectiva
description: The best change we found in Bolivia in the last month.

name: Sofia y Camila
description:
The exact location maybe + -  1 block, but it is very hard to miss the sign. ;-)
The elderly lady is kind and can offer rooms with air condition as well as a simple, but cozy and clean room with shared bathroom for about 50 Bob.
There is always hot and cold water available, as well as Wifi. But kitchen use is not possible. It is reasonably quiet, except on the weekends, when you can hear the nearby clubs all night.
There is some space for parking, but unfortunately not for camping.
If you like camping go to Magali+Luis  at the exit of the village!

name: Villa Agustina
description:
Camping and hotel with swimming pool in a beautiful mountain. 71997857 can call Beto.
---------
Camping e hotel com piscina em uma linda montanha. 71997857 pode chamar o Beto.

name: ES Ballivian Petrol Station
description:
Petrol straight to the tank, local price, maximum 100bob per car. 
Been there twice in two days. 
Friendly staff, surprised but happy about our tips.

name: Gomeria
description: Gomeria sells small quantities (i've got 20 liters) at 5 bolivianos

name: Hostel Piedra Branca
description:
They let you shower, use the wifi, and the kitchen for the day for 20 BOL. 
Showers are hot and clean. 
Can recommend.

name: Tienda and helpful lady
description:
You find a little tienda here to buy the basics. Also this lady, named Sabina and her husband, helped me out on a very very cold night with a place to sleep in their living since I couldn’t find something else in the village. (There should be 1 place but no one was there)
She told me she also had one time a couple putting a tent in their place. It’s not that they have alojamiento, but in case of emergency she might help you out.

name: Roadside
description: A tap containing water. Unknown if potable, I drink all water in Bolivia through a filter just in case. But water looks clear.

name: Roadside
description: More water if you are riding between Potosi and Sucre. Again drank through a filter. Careful you don't twist the tap too far. It came off and I got very wet putting it back

name: Volt ElectroMecanica
description:
Big mechanic shop. Good mechanics help us with various issues. All the team is really helpful and friendly. 
They can do all kind of job mechanic, electric, paint…
The only issue in Oruro is find the parts.

name: Macha
description: Wildcamp on the town square opposite where the busses stop. Had a quiet peaceful night after the last busses departed around 8pm. nobody hassled us. There's a public toilet available (1 Bol) in the corner of the square nearest the bus stops.

name: IE Simón Bolívar
description: This parking free, possibly water, neighborhood very nice.

name: Novocar Chaperia
description:
Panel Beater 
Vehicle body repair, Rust removal, Spray painting

name: Finca La Esmeralda ( Coffee Tour)
description: Coffee producing family, an interactive tour where the activities of harvesting coffee fruit, pulping, drying, artisan roasting and ends with a coffee tasting and a sultana (derived from coffee). whatsaap +591 69303315

name: Coffee Shop Copacabana
description:
Inside this Restaurant, the wifi ist working very well for uploading videos! 

They also have fancy coffee :) 
And the food also looks good!

name: old bypass of the new bridge
description: At some of the new bridges there are old sort roads leading around them. We stopped at one of those old roads and slept directly next to the street for 2-3 hours. Not a single car used the road, because all of them drive on the new bridge.

name: lubricantes Ramos
description:
lubricant store but sells diesel at 6 bol per litre!! very kind
---
magasin de lubrifiant mais vend du diesel à 6 bol le litre !! très gentil

name: lubricantes el viajero
description:
lubricant store and sells diesel 6bol per liter
---
magasin de lubrifiant et vend du diesel 6bol le litre

name: Pisada del sol
description:
Nice small hostel with 5 rooms, with our without private bathroom. 
30 Bol/bed with shared bathroom. 

We saw a lady from the mainland selling clothes to the owners of the hostel which maid us realise that people here dont have a lot of options. We just gave some of our 'old' clothes of our children away in La Paz, but i now realize that it could have been more apriciated here.

name: Albergue Turistico M Chac Marc
description: Big hotel/hostel with many rooms. I got a private room with private bathroom for 50 bolivianos. They may also have shared rooms, according to an advertisement by the front door. I didn't try the shower as I was told it was cold. The whole place seemed a bit new/under construction, so maybe this is just a temporary thing and more services will be added later. For example, it was also stated by the front door that breakfast was included, but this was not the case when I was there. Anyway, extremely helpful and nice staff and a great place to stay the night!

name: small shop
description: very basic small shop. ask around and they will open it.

name: River Site in Guanay city
description: Square next to the river next to the Bolivian Navy, a quiet place with a residents' association that authorizes you to stay there for a day.

name: Alojamiento Ciudad Termal
description:
A very good accommodation for travellers! Simple and economical but with new air conditioners working excellently. we always sleep in our motorhome but the high temperatures made us look for an economical alternative. 150 BOL per night and we were allowed to leave the next day at about 7pm. if one stays more nights they lower the price, if we stay one more night they left it at 80 BOl and the third night at 60 BOL. We slept with our puppy in bed, it has bathrooms with shared showers and a small kitchen for shared use. Very friendly owners!
.....
un muy buen alojamiento para viajeros! sencillo y económico pero con aires acondicionados nuevos funcionando excelente 😂 siempre dormimos en nuestro motorhome pero las altas temperaturas nos hicieron buscar una alternativa económica.. 150 BOL por noche y nos permitieron salir al día siguiente como a las 7 de la tarde.. si uno se queda más noches le bajan el precio, si nos quedamos una noche más nos lo dejaban en 80 BOl y la tercer noche en 60 BOL🤙 dormimos con nuestro perrito en la cama, tiene baños con duchas compartidas y una pequeña cocina de uso compartido. los dueños muy amables!

name: Cementerio
description: We had a quiet night on the opposite side of the cemetery. Under a big tree so lots of shade. There is a water tap.

name: New YPFB station
description: The only place in Yungas that had diesel. We could buy it for the official international price. Friendly staff.

name: Abandoned house
description:
We camped next to this abandoned house, after you exit Patacamaya heading west (RN4).
Neighbors told us that the place didn't have owners, and it provides shelter for the wind. A bit close to the road though, and a lot of barking dogs in the area

name: Rendez vous hostel bike friendly!
description: A very bike friendly place. Holds a bit the middle in hotel and hostel. There is a shared kitchen, fridge, living, two terraces. Breakfast is nice and more then pan con marmelanda. ( with yoghurt / fresh fruits etc). Rooms very nice and big nice beds. Only thing was that shower was not hot water reliable. But if you don’t crave a very hot shower all the rest makes it really worth going here. Also laundry for 16BOb per kilo. For a room of three we paid 39 a night via booking.

name: Inca Home Expeditions
description:
We made a full day Tour with Vidal, the owner from Inca Home Expeditions. This was the program:
ISLAND OF THE MOON & ISLAND OF THE SUN (northern part) & FLOATING ISLANDS AND WHITE BEACHES.

Full Day Tour 08:45 a.m. to 05:45 p.m.
 Pick up from the hotel.
 09:20 am departure from Copacabana.
 11:00 am arrival on the island of the Moon.
 Visit to the island of the Moon 1 hour.
 12:00 pm departure to the island of the Sun.
 13:30 pm arrival at the island of the sun.
 Visit to the ruins of CHINKANA 1 hour and 20 minutes.
 2:50 p.m. departure to the floating islands.
 15:50 pm arrival at the floating islands and white beaches.
 Visit to the floating islands and beaches 1 hour.
 16:50 pm departure to copacabana.
 5:45 p.m. arrival in Copacabana.
 The tour includes.
 Tourist transport.
 Entrance tickets on both islands.
 Guide.

We were happy with Vidal, he speaks perfect English and is very helpful. You can contact him on WhatsApp +591 64103031.
We had to pay 120Bs  per person.

name: At the river/stream
description: Good place for a night in dry season. Looks like trucks are filing up water here. There are more spots if you drive trough the river and up the gravel road. BUT careful you might get stuck in the mud. Dangerous to camp here in rainy season???

name: Hotel Tacaural
description:
Great basic hotel. 50bol/pp incl breakfast (simpel but good enough).

Rooms very clean, staff nice and helpful.
Parkinglot for a lot of cars.. when full it feels like a Tetris game.. but it does the trick.

Dont forget to go up on the roof. Really nice views over Rurre and the river Beni.

name: Parque Guapilo
description: Park at a lake with a nice promenade, baños and playground. You can stay outside of the fence, directly in front of the entrance of the park, which is closed by night. Enough space for everyone. Bit bumpy road, if wet could be slippery.

name: Laguna Marquina
description: Flat parking spot above Embalse Marquina, only 4x4, Calm and beautiful landscape, marvellous panoramic view over the mountains

name: between park and school
description: safe place for the night. you can't hear or see the  main road, but some moto's drive by regularly during the night. it's at the municipal park with a playground. nobody bothered us. good cellphone reception with Tigo and entel. a few shops an restaurants nearby. just a spot next to the road.

name: Rau Moters Smash Repairs
description:
I need to have my car resprayed as it was suffering from sun damage on the roof and hood. 

I also did some side damage to the side of the car due to the small parking spots in Chile. 

I had the car repaired for only $1,000.00 $US. Bargin

name: Tienda
description: small tienda (house is white with blue stripes and yellow door)

name: self service with very big machines
description: good lavandería where you can do it yourself or drop of laundry. They have regular machines but also a few big ones, up to 26 kg. this was the only place we could find where we could wash our feather duvets. big dryers as well. washing took 25 min, drying 55 min. WiFi and toilet available. you don't need any coins you just pay the owner. one price for washing drying and soap. free street parking available but there wasn't much room when we were to there. the white teleférico stops close by.

name: El Shaday
description:
We paid 140bob for a matrimonial with private bathroom (they originally asked for 160)
Has WiFi, air conditioning, hot showers and potable water. Enough space (locked) to park at least a couple of cars 
The place is nice and the owner was kind but a bit expensive for the location

name: Alojamiento el Campesino
description:
Room with a shower (when I was alone, it was cold, but they could repair it) and with a shared room, it is a dirty place, but it does the job of sheltering from the cold, very cheap, 15bs
---
Sitio con ducha (cuando fui yo solo fría, pero capaz que lo reparan) y con habitación compartido, es un sitio sucio, pero cumple la función de resguardarse del frío, muy económico, 15bs

name: YPFB
description: we got fuel at local price in the tank, super friendly people

name: quiet next to football field
description: We spend one night here. Remarkable quiet between 22.30-07.30, before and after  that also not much noise. It's a little dirt patch next to the road in front of a small football field. We first drove to the I overlander spot on the other side but there you have to park on the road. Well lit area.

name: Calle al lado de hotel Mai suites
description:
illuminated street next to hotel and company guarded day and night safe place for large motorhomes
-----
Calle iluminada al lado de hotel y empresa con guardia día y noche 
lugar seguro para motorhomes grandes

name: Texas Camba BBQ
description:
It is a family home, Albert and Freda (the hosts) offer a private and safe space within the city of Santa Cruz with bathroom service, WiFi, hot shower, kitchen. in a large space to set up a tent or park a motorhome. $40 Bob per person. They can also offer you different experiences in barbecues or meals since they are a chef, they can also guide you to tourist places both on pavement or where you need a 4x4.
..
Es una casa de familia, Albert y Freda (los anfitriónes) ofrecen un espacio privado y seguro dentro de la ciudad de Santa Cruz con servicio de baño, WiFi, ducha con agua caliente, cocina. en un espacio amplio para armar carpa o estacionar motorhome. $40 Bob por persona. también te puede ofrecer diferentes experiencias en parrilladas o comidas ya que son chef, además  te pueden guiar a lugares turísticos tanto en pavimento o donde necesites un 4x4.

Reservation required in advance. +59170849959

name: Perla Amazonica
description:
We paid 150bob for a matrimonial with private bathroom (but I think they have cheaper options with shared bathroom)
The hotel is really nice, has a big parking, air conditioning, the room is big and clean and even has a fridge. A simple breakfast is included

name: Moto Moto - Taller de Motos
description: It's a workshop for motorbikes. They dismantled the exhaust of our bike and went to the neighbour to do a welding on it. Quick and effective.

name: Roadblocks by children
description: The side of the road is full of children who are trying to close the road with a rope. At least 10 ropes over the road. Kids probably won't be dangerous because they didn't threaten to throw rocks. But just be aware. Also extreme poverty in that area. Many beggars also on the side of the road.

name: veterinary Arca de noe
description: went for a health certificate for export papers. quick and professional. 170bol.

name: senasag sucre
description: very efficient for export papers! had them ready in half a day (the person in charge was traveling afterwards, so they may have rushed it). the only caveat is that the banco Union to pay for the papers is in the center => you may want to check-in here first to get the "orden de pago" before heading to a vet in the center, especially if you come from the North. also, buses B and 80 (at least) connect here and Mercado central for 2 bob, the area is referred to as "piscina olimpica" area.

name: Entel Store Wifi
description: Free wifi at entel store. They have a courtyard with benches and shade specifically set up as a wifi zone next to the store. If you go on the 5g free wifi it's super fast, downloading videos in seconds.

name: Silvia's Spanish School
description:
A small Spanish school run by Silvia that also has other teachers. This school was 5-10 BOB cheaper per hour than others we found and our lessons were fantastic. 
Silvia has 15 years experience and was so patient and helpful for me. My partner studied with Carla and she had so many crazy stories and amazing recommendations for the city while also teaching him a lot.
There's lots of flexibility, you organise lessons as you go.
It's 40 BOB one person for an hour. 
I believe it's 35 BOB per person for a group lesson.
Highly recommend!!!

name: ATM Banco Fie
description: ATM from Banco Fie. Works with international credit cards and no fees.

name: Punto de lavado
description:
laundromat with two 5 kg washing machines and two dryers.  excellent attention from the owner.  20 Bowls for washing (or 25 with detergent) and 20 for drying.  open from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. but it leaves between 12 p.m. and 2 p.m.

laverie automatique avec deux lave linge de 5 kgs et deux sechantes. excellente attention de la propriétaire. 20 Bols pour laver (ou 25 avec lessive) et 20 pour sécher. ouvert de 8h du matin à 8h du soir mais elle s'en va entre 12h et 14h. 

lavomatic con dos lavadoras de 5 kg y dos secadoras.  excelente atencion del dueño.  20 cubetas para lavar (o 25 con detergente) y 20 para secar.  abre de 8 a 20 pero sale entre las 12 y las 14 horas.

name: Rooftop hostel, with parking for vans!
description:
Hostel with parking option, even for bigger rigs, yeah!
Parking is inside their closed inner yard, locked from the street, but you can enter the car from the hostel. 2 cars, no height limit. 20bob/day.
Otherwise standard hostel, private double rooms, dorms for 4/5/6/8 people, every room with bathroom. Kitchen at your disposal. Great rooftop bar, where they serve breakfast, dinner (poke bowls, burgers) and of course beer and drinks. 
Close to the center and close to the highway if you come/leave by car. 
Prices depend on the room type, cheaper if you reserve via WhatsApp: +59173036122. 
Staff speaks English. Option for laundry of course, 15bob/kg, ready the same evening if you bring it in the morning. 
Opposite the bus station, which was noisy during the Independence Day party, otherwise nothing special. Lots of restaurants and street food nearby.

name: Mountain View
description: Huge flat spot to stop. Big enough you can get away from the road, which is quiet anyway. Fantastic views. Cold due to altitude of course.

name: Balneario El paraiso
description: We were totally surprised to find a place where we could have a swim in two nice swimming pools. The guy at the entrance was very nice and we were the only guest at a Friday afternoon. Perfect water! Entrance 10Bol each, kids 5Bol. (Opening hours: 10-18) He even sold us two beer, we could refill water and we stayed in front of the entrance for the night. The sunset was amazing. A very nice place!…

name: Termas des Polques
description:
We slept between some houses, we asked first. the nights here are cold, -9°c , so be aware.
For the termas, it costs only 6 bolivianos and you can stay the whole day inside the water which is great. 37°c!
the sunrise is the most beautiful that we saw, with all the mist from the water (pics). They have facilities here, breakfast,  dinner... don't know the prices as we didn't eat here.
they also have paid wifi.

name: peaje to leave the park
description: there is a toll to leave the park after laguna colorada going towards rock three, it costs 25 bol. It doesn't make sense to have a toll here, so be prepared.

name: Linduchini
description:
We had a delicious lunch just in front of the park where we slept over night.
Family owned home made delicious food.

name: The Hills (horse tours)
description:
3h, 5h, 7h and multiple day tours with horses in a very beautiful region.
Ricardo is very friendly and will show you very beautiful places.
Contact him via WhatsApp +591 (6) 370-0588

name: Mercado Central. Nr 17
description:
Different restaurants on the 2nd floor of the supermercado. We came several times and preferred number 17.

Great food for great value. This lady does it all by herself. Every day the menu changes a bit. Today for example, you can have sopa de mani, spaghetti bolognese, Milanesa de pollo, bife con huevo, pique macho, ... 
Typical Bolivian food.

Here you pay for 4 people the same as you do for one in the tourist restaurants...

name: Camp Santa Rosa
description:
Camping for motorcycle. 
Green meadow behind the House, Not visible from the street. Water and WiFi Internet. Shower is possible. quiet Location in residencial Area. Buena Familia. posiblity to Park motorcycle during boat Trip.

name: Hotel La Orquidea
description: It's right off the main highway, but has a very large inner courtyard surrounded by a wall. Really nice relaxing setting: lots of ornamental plants, couple birds, really nice covered patio areas with nice quality outdoor furniture. The rooms are good size, clean, comfortable beds and bedding. Hot water, ac, fridge, TV, Wi-Fi ( a little weak in room but doable). Secure parking, fairly quiet. Nice setting. 150r, bargain down to 100r for one person.

name: Tienda
description: Small tienda with drinks and snacks, basic necessities

name: tool
description: there is too, peaje, here, don't know how much is it as we used the same peaje ticket that we had from uyuni

name: E. S Gas Petrol
description: Gasoline at local prices... Great service... Give the service man a good tip.

name: Topgear Boliva Starting Point
description: For Topgear fans. This location is where Topgear started their Boliva /Chile adventure. Oh! Have a look on Google maps for the exact location.

name: Extensive Road Works
description: For around 200km extensive roads works. The danger is travelling at night on this road is not recommended due to poor signage and extreme dust causing poor visibility.

name: Abapó  Riverside
description:
Riverside wildcamp. A sandy road from town brings you to a left turn that descends to the Riverside. During July the river was not full so there is room to camp.
I came by bicycle. Small vehicle will be okay but not big rigs. The Riverside is hard packed sand or dirt.

name: CEYA Automecanica
description: Very good mechanic in Sucre. The car will be kept in inner courtyard, and gate can be opened only when thr owner opens it. So very safe spot. Room for higher SUVs and caravans too. We were really happy with the service. Great communication, always kept us notified about the steps. You can chat with him via Whatsapp. We didn't give him a very easy car to fix, but somehow he managed to find us the spare window from Santa Cruz. Overall really nice and honest guy. He also speaks English. He checked the car thoroughly, flushed the radiator and changed coolant, changed braking pads for 2 wheels and had all the wheels aligned. Also replaced a window. Altogether 1380 BOB (parts+work). I can't even see where the pay for work fits in this bill - very cheap.

name: pto almacen
description:
We stopped by the river here for one night.
A few houses and stalls. It was quiet at night and pleasant view over river in the morning. Overlooking riverboats and ponies grazing.

name: Orange seats
description: Nice (typical) restaurant. We had carne al pimenton and it was delicious. Great food for a economical price. Nice to have something else besides the numeros chicken restaurants.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police check point. They just asked for our papers and let us go

name: Supermercado da Dona Constância
description:
We slept on the street next to the Dona Constância Market.  She authorized it.  Quiet street facing the highway.

Dormimos na rua ao lado do Mercado da Dona Constância. Ela autorizou. Rua pacata e de frente para a rodovia.

name: Casapan
description: We are totally surprised to find a very good bakery. You can have breakfast, brunch or by good stuff…the story behind the shop is even better. A very nice Bolivien guy lived in the US, came back and is educating kids now here at the bakery. Wifi and they even let us fill water…

name: Waterfall shower
description: Coming from la Paz, park on the left side of the road just before the bridge, there s a wider spot. There s a small rocky path going from the bridge to the right, 15m or so, down to the shallow pool beneath the 20m waterfall. Cold, but what a shower!

name: Sur Backpackers
description: Nice clean, secure, quiet place in safe neighborhood. Very nice hostess. Private rooms, shared clean bathroom.

name: Avenida Gran Chaco
description: Wide avenue, next to a square (Plaza Sebastian Pagador), with small drugstores and markets around.  A well-lit and busy place during the evening, but quiet during the night.  We felt safe.

name: grassy field
description: A grassy field close to Rio Grande. Level, some trash. Cellphone reception with Entel and Tigo. Several other options along this path. Very quiet. Also possible to camp directly at the river but these spots are also used for fishing and there was trash around. Can be driven with a regular car. Probably not available during the rainy season.

name: quiet, shady, good cellphone reception dry riverbed
description: Only in dry season. We needed a quiet place to do some work and this was it. Shady in the afternoon. Good cellphone reception with Tigo, reasonable with Entel. Quiet night, nobody bothered us. No 4*4 needed.

name: Hospedaje Condor
description: Very nice, clean, friendly place. Bicycles parked in courtyard. 90 B for room with hot shower and shared bath, dinner, and breakfast. A bit tricky to find and no sign, but just knock on the door.

name: Mirador Killi Killi
description: Amazing view point. You can try parking your vehicle outside right in front but space is scarce. About 20 min easy walk from Estación Teleférico Naranja Villarroel.

name: Riverside
description: Here around 30 July during dry season. I don´t know the accessibility during a higher water level. There are several places even for biggest rigs. Clear water, good for taking a bath. You can hear the road far away.

name: Silent place
description:
This place is only for small campers (high 250cm, width 220cm) because the way is overgrown. But there are several other places and one, a few meters earlier, with a large open space and clear way for biggest rigs.
Very quiet place. During the night you can only hear the countless insects and frogs. Water is quite shallow but okay for taking a bath.

name: Traverse lodge
description: Really cool are, after exploring many days in Bolivia we came across this beautiful place to park our truck, people is really friendly they give us a little tour around the property and got to see alot of animals, they have a small facility if you wanna sleep inside but you can also camp. Text David before you arrive if you wanna have food or a room. +591 73553945 ( English/ Spanish)

name: Arrested by the police
description:
I got arrested in the night with three other travellers by the police. For the start, we had bought a beer and yes, drinking in public is illegal in Bolivia. This is what they used to pick up on us. 
By two masked officers we were made sit on the sidewalk for about an hour. Then we were put in a civil car, not a police car, and taken to a police station nearby. Even though we were driven around the city for a long time. At the police station we were put in a cell and after a while seperately informed that it would be eight hours of detention and social work or we could pay a "fine" and leave. It was said to be 500 BOBs. We had to sign a prefabricated statement and put our fingerprint under it. I was not allowed to read it. We were not told the names of the officers who had arrested us, nor were we given a copy of the statement, a ticket or anything in writing. 
I had only 460 BOBs in cash but that seemed to be enough as well. I could leave and walk back.
Detainee number four did not have any money on him. He said he would stay the eight hours. During the night he was brought to the head of the station several times. Every time asking lower amounts of money. Moreover, he was not allowed to sleep. Anytime he fell asleep an officer put a bright flashlight in his eyes. Sleep deprivation is internationally regarged as torture.
During the night more tourists kept on "arriving". The same show. Seems to be a business modell with the Santa Cruz Police. 
In the morning he was allowed to leave. 

 When in Santa Cruz or Bolivia in general be extremely careful around the police. The police force seems to be highly corrupt - see the other warnings in ioverlander - and targeting tourists. Do not give them anything to pick up on.

name: Parking and BBQ of Chorro de San Louis
description: Amazing waterfall and pool about 15 minutes from parking. Ideal for over night. Lots of garbage at the parking but pretty clean at the waterfall. No dogs. Very quiet if nobody else is here. Road in ok condition no trees and wide enough, so very big rig friendly.

name: very poor air quality
description: In the dry season the air quality in Cochabamba and the surrounding areas is really very poor. If you have asthma and or allergies I would advise to avoid this area. It is incredible dry and dusty here. Lots of unpaved roads. All the dust mixed with exhaust fumes, the burning of trash and industries cause a very thick layer of smog above the city. This is the first time in three years of travelling that the air quality is so bad that I needed extra medication. It's probably not so bad in the rainy season.

name: Estancia el abuelo
description:
nextto the road, no facilities, quiet PERFECT FOR NIGHT

Pedimos permiso en las casas y nos dejaron dormir debajo de los árboles sin ningún problema, lugar lindo y tranquilo! sin facilidades

name: Hotel Porvenir Villa Loza
description: It‘s a Hotel, where you also can eat local food or have a breakfast. The peoble are very nice and it was nice to have coffe with fresh juce and bathroom after wildcamping.

name: EcoPetrol
description: You can have diesel and Gasolin. We could have the Price for 5 Bolivianos for a liter. Just say you would to have with a bille.

name: Eco Bubble excelllent laundry
description: Really nice laundry. The best in 7 months of traveling. They washed the colds with cold water as asked, clothes smelled good and nicely folded. Went there twice and both times perfect, ready for the evening.

name: Startpoint of Cerro Pabellon
description:
Nice hike with an amazing view from the summit. you gain around 400m of altitude, summit is at 5210m. Trail is most of the time unmarked and very rare
stone mens. So you should have some hiking expierience in wayless terrain to find your way. but there is No climbing like the alpin Grade I or II, just hiking. its best to walk to the sadle and go Up the West ridge and easyly slide down the scree on the south. we called it corazon ruta because of the picture on the gps. duration around 2h up and down.
with some expierience you can reach this place with 2wd or push it even a bit higher to the sadle.

name: River Camp Spot
description:
Whilst visiting Chino in Loroto, he brought us out to this spot to see the river. Lots of space places to camp with a great view of the river which has dolphins.

The locals were really friendly to us.

Small tiendas in the town to buy essential items.

name: Alojamiento El Valluno
description:
clean enough place in the centre of a small village with 3 restaurants.
showers were not warm but okay.
40 Bolivianos each. No WiFi

name: Chino’s House
description:
We visited Chino to see the blue throated macaws. After camping at the ranch where he works for a few days, he invited us to stay at his property. Toilet, cold shower and electric points available.

Chino and his family made us feel so welcome and we enjoyed trying their homemade cheese.

name: Brujula - Print your stickers here
description:
2Bs per sticker.

Digital graphic designer print shop.

You can park in front of it, wide street.

name: Hostal Gadiela
description: Brand new hostal located on a quiet side street.  A few meters away from the blue cable car station.  University district with many restaurants, cafés, small food stands and shops.  Secure parking for 2 cars or several motorbikes.  Suicide shower and good wifi.  Different room options, i paid 80 bob for a large room with double bed.  Ideal for those coming from the north (Peru) and do not want to drive into or through the city.  From here you can also get to the death road relatively stress-free.

name: coca uta museo/ Museum Coca
description: There is a little museum, it‘s has a lot of information with picture. Really good! You can have all the information in english and german. 15 Bs for person.

name: Tent sleeping place
description:
good place to sleep in the tent on a bicycle trip. 
approximately 200 Meters beside the road, and there are nearly no vehicles on the road. 
Sandy ground

name: tent sleeping place
description: nice place to sleep in the tent with nice view on sajama. about 10 Minutes with the bicycle from the Main road.

name: Hostel in Corque
description:
Hostel to sleep in the village. Looks like it is still in building up process but our room was nice. 
bathroom is only available in the ground floor at the moment but was okay for us.
So perfect when you need a brake of wild camping

name: Hostel Vivir Bien
description:
Hostel in the Center of Orionca. big White house on the left of the street. 
we asked the Lady in the little store 20 meters before the hostel, so she called us the owner.
Nothing special but totally okay to stay for one night.

name: Tent Place on Bicycle Trip
description:
next to the road but not visible from it because its on a hill. 
Far away are two farmer huts but I think they are not able to see you because of the distance

name: Tent sleeping Place on Bicycle Trip
description:
nice spot next to a quiet road.
nearly no visible because its behind some bushes and in a hole

name: Caranavi
description: Gasoline station selling to gringos. Directly into tank.

name: El Alto
description: If you go to el Alto, take good care of your valuables. We were robbed by a professional gang! The locals never take their valuables on el Alto. Make sure that you don't have your valuables in your pocket!

name: robbed here
description:
We left kitchen items that we had used the night before under the van and they stole everything from us. It is not dangerous but there homeless

Dejamos utensilios de cocina y fuenton de ropa que habíamos usado la noche anterior debajo de la camioneta y nos robaron todo. No es peligroso pero hay gente viviendo en la calle, al parecer no son confiables

name: Wonderful Tent Sleeping Place on Bicycle Trip
description:
approximatly 1.5 km away from the mainroad and not visible.
On the road to the spot was no car the whole evening and night.
Nice View to Sajama mountain

name: Bus a Potolo
description: Turismo Trans - bus a Potolo (Maragua, Inca machay, Pumamachay, Inca trail, Niñu Mayu), bus leaves at 9am

name: Western Union
description:
Western Union office. 
Sucre city Center

name: AVOID THIS CITY
description: avoid this city at all cost. we had to fight to finally get diesel in a bidon. it is dirty, polluted, full of trash and debris. Even buying groceries was problematic. people are unfriendly and won't help you. traffic sucks as do the roads. there's is nothing here worth visiting. the whole area around it is also ugly, dry and covered in trash. we loved Bolivia until we came to this area. Basically the area Oruro-cochabamba-chayanta is awful.

name: Stolen during dinner
description: We met a couple here, who were robbed in the evening! They were eating 20 metres away from their car and could see the front of their car. The robbers broke the door and took all the electronic equipment. Never thought this would happen in Copacabana!

name: Taller Tori
description:
Taller Tori is an inconspicuous workshop without a big company sign. 
By chance, I stopped there with my HZJ 105 Toyota Land Cruiser, because there were people working on cars. My Toyota had recently started to make rumbling noises on uneven roads. Of course Tori had no original Toyota spare parts, but with outstanding improvisational skills he was able to replace the crushed bushings of the front stabiliser.
The price was fair.
Highly recommended!
Adress: 536R+8FQ, Trinidad

name: Free Wifi
description: Wifi sponsored by Entel. Free Wifi spot at the edge of plaza. I don't know how far it reaches out into the square. I was standing right in front of the office.

name: hostal la Kantuta
description:
This is the most beautiful little guest house we stayed in during 6 month in South America.....beautiful location and view over the lake.
Great breakfast. 
everything works!
We paid 200b for 2 people

name: Alojamiento at the petrol station.
description:
Nice, basic but clean with hot showers and slow WiFi.
It's a bit noisy but the best in town. There are 2 other hospedajes/hotels but they are very basic and not very enticing.
This one is clean and presentable. 
There are a few shops and restaurants in the small town. A Pharmacy and workshops along the roadside.
Very nice couple who run the place.
we were two cyclists and we kept our bikes in the lobby area upstairs utside our room which is behind locked gates.
40 Bolivianos per person.

name: slanted sideways,under streetlights
description: Went to look the other spots .most are on steep roads in coroico. this is only slanted sideway which makes it ok to sleep in the camper overhang. bright steetlight and not in front of houses or shops.600m walk to plaza.no services.3G. not bad for the night .

name: Moto Mecanica Yiyo
description: Antonio the mechanic did a service on my China bike.  Obtain all necessary spare parts.  Changed the brake pads, new sprocket and chain.  He works conscientiously, professionally and he asked a fair price.  Anytime again, highly recommended.

name: Dry season and 4x4only! Good Entel reception
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Flash floods reported in this location. Please use caution 

Wide riverbed, near the entrance of a canyon. Still clear water in the river leading in to the canyon. Very quiet and safe, nobody bothered us during the 2 days we spend here. At this place you are visible from the road above. The road is very quiet, 2, maybe 3 cars ph during the day. There are other places in the riverbed, take your pic. On the sandy area it would also be possible to pitch a tent. Plenty of room. No trash, no stray dogs, no cattle(poop). No cellphone reception with Tigo, but good with Entel. Any size of 4*4 vehicle(s) will fit. There are several entry points to the riverbed. We drove in at -19.01757, -65.50364. The last photo is from the entry point

name: Nueva Jersualem
description: A wonderful shop, for everything your heart desires! Necklaces, rings, earrings, stones... etc. if you love these things! Just go there and enjoy!

name: Cabaña campestre los pozos
description: Restaurant on the river that specializes serving fresh fish. Nice setting, nice people. My fish plate with a Fanta drink cost $55 Bob

name: Kory Wara
description: What a surprise the small fine Hostal Kory Wara.  A bit old, but still nice.  Small courtyard where you can park two cars or several motorcycles.  Basic ensuite rooms and best of all, a super hot solar shower.  A dream after the dusty track.  The owner Patricia very nice.  There is also a drinking water tap in the yard.  And all for 40 bobs.

name: Shortcut in Bolivia
description: This shortcut in Bolivia and crosses a lower pass (4500m, rather than 4800 on the other side). However, this is a smuggling road, so locals recommend taking the long way. There's a lot of camino going on with pilots cars. The mixed road is between hard ground, land and sandy roads.

name: big plaza.small town
description: had to stop.late night ,looking for something away from the freeway.quiet night.very cold!didmt hear or see anybody.some streetlights around

name: Altiplano
description: Large quiet space on the altiplano, a few peasants with their animals and a basketball court in the middle of nowhere. View of the mountains. Access track in good condition. Space for several big rigs. Good mobile network

name: mini supermarket
description: Small basic supermarket which has basic health care items, cereal, milk and ALCHOL

name: quiet side st.
description: i went to the other mark near here but is on main rds-  more quiet herewhere i slept, and there s some lights.no facilities but ok for a night

name: Anxious residents
description: Some locals were afraid I would put their children into the camper and kidnap them. Very aggressive atmosphere that could quickly turn nasty. In an emergency, I would not have had any service with Entel to call the police.

name: Only dry season
description: Dried out lake offers place for many campers and tents of all sizes. Only during dry season, I have been there end of August. Some corners are well hidden but you can still hear the rumbling trucks over horrid rippio. Shadow is rare and depends on the time of day. Almost no mosquitos, at least at August, but hundreds of butterflies at day and huge moths at night. No service with Entel.

name: At lakeside
description:
Nice spot for up to three smaller campers. The road is only a few meters away and  depending on the wind direction it is not realy protected from noises and dust.
I don´t think swimming might be a good idea because of lots of gators. But you can hike around the lake a little.

name: Rim of San Ramon
description: After visiting San Ramon you can stay over night near the river with all kinds of Campers, even biggest rigs. Easy access during rain. You can even find a little shadow between the trees. Only the roosters at 3am and the barking dogs are annoying. Like usual for Southamerica.

name: Shady lakeside
description: A shady place for up to three smaller campers between palmtrees. This nice place lays a few meters from a large lake, but because of the reeds and swamp there is no access to open waters. This spot may be kind of pet friendly, nonetheless keep an eye on your dog. I found several remains of gators and a huge skeleton with scaring teeth. There could be living ones in the nearby lake.

name: Under bridge
description:
A full scale sunny place for any number of travellers with biggest rigs. The locals are curious and friendly. Greetings to David, the lemon-seller.

There is almost no hiding spot. You can watch everything from the bridge. And depending on the wind direction it could be dusty. The nearby river is aligator infested. I would not swim. Not the slightest service with Entel.

name: Between dried out ponds
description: This place is 100m off the road but you can still hear all the big trucks. Okay for one night. Because of limited turning space between dried out ponds only for four smaller Campers. Shadow is not available for campers but tents could find some between the trees. Poor service with Entel.

name: TALLERES VILLAVICENCIO
description:
Good team. Good work.
Had my brakes and steering fixed here.
Not the cheapest.
We could sleep in our motor home.

name: Mecanica de Motos y Accesorios  LOAYZA
description: Good mechanic for motorcycles, clean work and fair price.  Lots of other mechanics and parts shop next door.

name: Next to the church and the basket court
description: Next to the basketball court. Flat and quiet place next to the church and the basketball court. Friendly neighborhood. Big rig ok . Water with a slow flow to fill the tank. Slow cellular throughput

name: Restaurante Santi Madero
description: This place has amazing meat. Really recommend the Picanha which is served on a skewer. Definitely as good as you would expect to get it in Brasil - they even serve Forofa as a side!

name: Lavaderia de Ropa ATENEA
description:
An inconspicuous laundry without a big company sign. You can only recognise it by many washing lines in the garden. Or ask in the neighbourhood. I paid 30 Bs for a small tub of tropically sweaty laundry.
Done within 12hs.
Adress: Av. Plácido Méndez y, Riberalta, 2W3P+GQ Riberalta
Pone: 73956467

name: Restaurant Rosa
description:
Good local food for 12bob.
Nice and very friendly family.

name: shop next to the bridge
description: next to a shop where I bought a few things.the owner said I couls park just outside or at the river banks.said "nothing happens" here relatively quiet .since the road is just up there.but not bad for the night

name: Helados Uziely
description: Best (helados artesanales) ice cream in town.

name: Bar de Ari
description:
A terrace place where they sell beverages. The owners, Ari & Sida, are very friendly and helpful. You can park in their courtyard, use the bathrooms and showers. 
It is a very quiet and safe place.

name: Next to the river
description:
we spent one night in this spot in our trip from Santa Cruz to Villamontes.
is ok for one night. 
Very quite and feels safe.

name: Hostel Miguelina
description: Quiet hostel to relax, clean and friendly man who works in it. 40 bolivianos ppn, the rooms are with TV and the WiFi it's pretty fast on the second floor where we were, but I think on the first works fine also. The WC is shared and clean, but we were the only ones on the second floor, so it was just for us. There is hot shower, but real one. Also there is small kitchen, place to wash your clothes and hang them to dry, nice balcony and place to store bicycles or even moto. Perfect to rest from cycling and totally recommend the place

name: Car wash lavado fumicado
description: Did a really good job! Really precise and careful with our stickers we have on our campervan. Even did dry or campervan afterwards. Kind people!

name: Alojamiento Alex
description: Cheap, clean place to stay in Uyuni.  Large, secure car park, also possible to sleep in the van or big rig.  Good suicide shower, clean toilet facility.  Very good WiFi.  I paid 50 bob for a room with a shared bathroom.

name: Taller de Motos J & C
description: Small motorcycle mechanic shop, for small things on the motorcycle.  In Uyuni it is difficult to find a cheap and good motorcycle mechanic.

name: lubricantes ibisa
description:
lubricant store and sells diesel at 6 bol per liter
magasin de lubrifiant et vend du diesel a 6 bol le litre

name: sports club
description: small place set back from a main street, only for parking, no noise after 10 p.m., rather quiet.  sports club at the bottom, traditional music regularly, pool club in the car park and children's games.  no wifi, no water, no bins, no electricity.

name: view point Pucara MIRADOR
description:
view point pucara, perfect place, quiet, wonderful views, near the town
---
mirador de Pucara, hay un cristo , techo y bancos, Vistas inigualables muy tranquilo y cerca del pueblo

name: Hostal Casa Grande
description: The place is beautiful, the hosts Ivon and Alfredo are exceptional and very warm. The place has a very special atmosphere. It is a whole tourist complex, featuring a very cute cafeteria (Cafeteria Internacional) with home baked amazing cakes, the hostel which is about 40 bob per person, clean and warm, adobe rooms and a tourist agency. Secure parking for 10 bob more. Warm showers.

name: A little off the road
description: This area is far enough from the road to avoid dust and headlights. But you can hear the trucks in the distance. This spacious place offers nothing but an undisturbed night for all kinds of camper vans and tents of unlimited number. Not even mosquitoes or service with Entel.

name: Small place
description:
Due to the extensive road construction and extensive swamps, it is quite difficult to find a campsite on this stretch of road. Therefore, this place is not too great. But it's okay for one night.
A maximum of two smaller campers fit on this parallel track, where you are halfway protected from dust behind bushes. You can't hear anything from the big main road. No service at all with Entel.

name: campsite for bicycles only
description: Nice place above the laguna. Good wind shelter. No water. Only reachable for cyclists but we think you have to carry the bikes a few meters

name: Wild camping between some hills
description: While looking for the „entry“ to the other wild spot we found this space. Although it’s dry right know we would recommend 4x4 to reach this spot. If you don’t have 4x4, you might not be able to get around / behind the hills, but you you will definitely will find a flat spot closed to the tiny road. To reach this spot you have to „pass it“ first, and then follow the next tracks on the left and make your way back / around the hill.

name: Cactus wild camp
description: Turn right at the gate with the YPFB letters and you’ll see a secluded spot for camping. We spent two lovely days here and didn’t see another body. Just what we needed. Breathtaking sunsets, views over the cacti hills and sightings of green parrots. One downside: there are a lot of annoying flies during the day but they seem to disappear around 4pm. (If you have a nimble 4x4 vehicle like a Jeep Wrangler there is another flat spot at the bottom of the steep hill.) No signal with Entel.

name: Unofficial fuel sale
description:
Moderator note: Be careful buying fuel from places that are not fuel stations. Entry may have been made by seller.

Private person selling gasolina and diesel.
Price for gasolina was 50 bob/10 l.
Contact in advance: +591 63651900

name: Residencial
description: Nice place to have a rest, 100bob for double room with private bathroom and 80bob without. Hot showers, nice garden to rest, WiFi, big and secure parking for bikes, motos and motorhomes. Quiet place with good location

name: Estrecho de Tiquina
description:
English :  Easy crossing the lake at this place, it costed 40 Bs, just be on the queue for the boats, you dont need to go to the boleteria.

Français : pour aller depuis Copacabana jusqu'à La Paz en restant en Bolivie, il faut passer par là. Nous nous sommes garés et avons demandé au type de la Bolleteria qui n'avait pas l'air utile, nous avons demandé directement au gars d'une barque sur laquelle il y avait déjà 1 moto et 1 van, il nous a dit de venir tout de suite, 50 Bols la traversé, les barques partent quand elles sont pleines.

name: Tienda entrada de Luca
description: Little shop at the enter of Luca when you come from the south. I was there at 10 am it was open. There is water, bread, dulces and a lot of food.

name: peace place next to the salar
description: Really peaceful place next to the Salar de Copaisa. Really quiet and beautiful to see the sunlights. I spent one night here in a tent

name: rock enclosure in front of a little river
description: Really nice spot for camping. It's a old little enclosure for llama with rocks all around so perfect to be protected from the wind. And you have a really nice view on the little river.

name: Charquekan
description:
Little restaurant where they serve only a typical plate from here : Charquekan.
It's deshydrated llama's meat with rice, andines potatoes and egg. 15bob

name: Hostal Buena Vista
description:
Really nice hostal with private room and private bathroom for 60bob/night. The room are clean and you have space for your stuff. You can also put your bicycle inside if you want but the village is quiet and safe so I left mine outside without any problem during few days.
You can have a breakfast for 20bob and a dinner for 25bob. Each one is really complete and sufficient.
You can use the kitchen and the fridge if you want to cook for you. Just do it when Carmen finished to cook (after 8pm for dinner)
Carmen and Francisco are really kind and helpful.
Francisco is also a mountain guide with who you can do the différents volcans of the area.

name: Casa Quinta - San Luis Las Lomas
description:
On google maps we found casa quinta - san luis las lomas without any reference. If you google the name you find a facebook page with number. Send them a whatsapp. Beautiful spot alongside RN7. 
100BO for room with shower and kitchen. 70 BO to camp (both prices for 2 people). 

Friendly neighbor who is Swiss / Hungary and speaks Spanish, German and little bit of Spanish. Very much recommended!

name: Hotel Raúl Orlando
description:
Large hotel in the centre with secure garage parking large enough for all vehicles.
Friendly staff.
50BOB for a room with shared bathrooms or 90BOB for room with private bathroom. 
Good option for a base if you need to sort out issues crossing the border like Insurance for entering Argentina, migraciónes or Aduanas.

name: Tyres galore
description:
A whole street of a huge selection of tyres for sale cheap since they are so expensive and limited supply in Argentina and Chile.
If you might be due for tyre replacement soon, you might consider buying new ones while you are here before continuing.

name: Sandy road
description:
Really sandy road, could be a nightmare for heavy bycicle.

The habitants of Sajama advise to take the road a little more in the south who follow the river.

name: Plaza Cívica
description:
Nos pareció el lugar más lindo y tranquilo de la ciudad. Hay espacio para mascotas. 
Por la tarde suele haber movimiento pero a la noche dormimos súper bien. Seguro. 

Quiet and beautiful place. In the afternoon there are people but at night we slept well. Safe.
Good place for pets.

name: Quiet River Spot
description:
A quiet spot away from the main road next to a little stream.

One or two trucks past in the night, but no barking.

In the morning a few locals came to chat and invited us to their house to try their lamb. Sadly, we had to get going, but they were lovely.

Good cell and Starlink signal

name: Water from volcano
description: Next to the small blue house there is water which flows through the concrete bath. The locals told us it's from the volcano and it's clean. They drink it directly but for the tourists it is recomended to boil it. Because the water is warm they use it to wash the clothes.

name: Canilla en plaza cívica
description:
En el medio de la plaza, en el sector verde que tiene 5 mástiles. Ver foto!

In the middle of the square. Green area with 5 masts. Look at the photo!

name: Checkpoint and more.
description:
This is a checkpoint with a rope across the road. The guy will NOT come to the  car. You have to take your TIP and registration in to him. He will stamp the TIP. Then he will drop the rope. 

There is also a toll booth. Save your tickets and they get stamped at subsequent stations. 

Also soda pop, snacks and a senasa office.

name: Williams- NO FOREIGN sales
description: Watch the low, angled roof. They refused to fill USA vehicle.

name: Basilio central plaza y municipal
description:
This small, dusty village is a great place to rest for the night. There is large, flat, semi-shaded space in front of the policia, sala de eventos and plaza. Next to the elementary school.  
No fees. No services at all. Must be self contained.  
Bring a little something to donate to the school, police or community center please. (Office supplies, a fan, books, balls, toys, be creative) 
Respect this cute space and it will remain available to others.

name: Museo Guaraní
description: A small collection of Guarani artifacts. Very knowledgeable guides volunteer to tell some history.  It is very hot inside (even in winter) and not extensive. They also have authentic Guarani items for sale to help support their work.  Honestly- nice idea but not worth the time.

name: Museo Artecampo- arte originario y popular
description:
A collection of the best of the best artists from over 40 villages around the Eastern side of Bolivia. Not a large collection, but very beautiful. No parking at museum. May have to park on the corner and walk less than a block. 10 B pp. less than one hour. Guided in Spanish or self guided. Beautiful garden area. 
Note- this is affiliated with a tienda downtown where they sell the work of these artists and more.

name: Quiet park near university
description: This area has a few embassies and many nice homes and apartments.  (We rented in the tower for just $25usd per day with AC, wifi and washer.) Parked the rig at this park and we joined by another travelers. Neighbor were kind and curious- or didn’t even see us.  Stayed parked here for four nights. No water. No bathrooms. Tiendas nearby. Ice cream across the park. Fruit trucks come around. Restaurants walking distance.

name: Veterinaria Alemania
description:
Speaks Spanish and German. Understands basic English. We did not have an appointment, just rang the bell and housekeeper got the doctora.  Her adult son treated the dog (ear infection) and she supervised. Took less than 15 min and cost 60BOB. Including medicine to continue for one week. 
Found them on Google. Glad we selected them. See photo for contact info.

name: Tire assembly, balancing and alignment
description:
Serviteca Jaimito
Garage specialized in alignment and balancing. This is the only possible for balancing and alignment for big rigs in Sucre. We have a big rig of 8 meters (26 feet). You just have to ask them to take out their board so as not to rub underneath. 180 bob for the whole. 8am to 6pm

name: Uyuni gás station
description: Drinking water at the gas station. Low pressure

name: Near the big bridge.
description:
At the north end of the bridge, there's a track leading East and West. Part of the eastern track has fallen away leaving a narrow path wide enough to ride around for Motos and cycles. There's a large selection of flat open spaces, some hidden by the bushes.
For vans, turn West for a wide, flat parking area.

name: Garage Lavadero car wash and water
description:
These guys washed and vacuumed our truck and camper for $120B. Then filled all our water tanks. We walked over to a coffee shop.  
Note- other water spigot was not working so we found this.

name: Liriuni Agua Termales Parking
description:
We visited the hot tubs and parked overnight in the lot.  
Water can be enjoyed in two public pools or pay extra for a private room with bath. Toilets and showers on site. Also a few little shops selling basic snacks and some cooked food stands. May be busy on weekends. 

Route options- 
Dirt adventure : go through Okosuro. 
Cobblestone adventure : go through Vinto

name: Behind a launch ramp!
description: This was the area used during highway construction.  Huge open space. If you drive around behind the ramp it is a wind break and muffles the highway. And you are hidden.  Please bury your poop and take all your trash. There are no services here at all. LTE cell service. Any size rig or even a group will fit here.

name: Salar uyuni near the flag square
description:
5km away from the flag square and Dakar monument. Next to the way to IncaHuasi Island. 
No much traffic during the day. 
The sky was full of stars. It was an amazing experience. The most beautiful and increíble sky that I've ever seen.  Really cold!! I recommended came only if you have heating 

A unos 5km de la plaza de las banderas y del monumento Dakar. Al costado del camino que conduce a la isla IncaHuasi. A pesar se Hebe muchos tours No hubo mucho tráfico por el día. 
Increíble cielo llego de estrellas, fue el mejor que vi en mi vida. Impactante! 
Muchísimo frío! Recomiendo si o si calefacción.

name: Turismo Claudia - Mine tour
description: Great experience! We did a tour with Wilson today. He has a good sense of humour and speaks very good English. When he is not booked for a tour, he works in the mine himself. Therefore he could tell us a lot. Very interesting! We were a small group of 4 people, he always took good care of everyone and considered each individual. First we went to the miners' market, then to one of the mines we had chosen and finally we could see how the material is processed. We paid 100 BOB per person and the tour lasted 4 1/2 hours (instead of 3). Would book here again.

name: Poopo swimming pool
description: Swimming pool, shower and sauna (we didn’t try it) close to the main square of Poopo. Entrance 5 Bvs. Shower 4 Bvs. Open 6 am to 6 pm.

name: Maestranza Rochamel (wheel repair)
description:
This is a professional wheel repair shop.
Not cheap but highly recommended when you need any repair for your bended or broken wheel.

name: Maragua Crater - Sucre
description:
This is the number of a private guide, that takes you to Maragua Crater along an Inka trail, beautiful mountains and waterfalls. 
+59178670552‬
The usual tour is one day and includes following: 
1. Transport
2. Specialized Guide (english and Spanish) 
3. Food and Water 
4. Tickets 
4. Visit local People (Jalq'a Culture-textils) 
5. Visit to Throat Devil (beatifull waterfall)
Price: 380bs. per person.
He can also arrange secure parking for you and more days of hiking are also possible. 
We had a great time with him and he is for sure cheaper then any other company in Sucre.

name: Quit safe night
description: You can sleep next to the plaza very nice! There is free drink water, very clean everywere.. super good place to sleep

name: Fill it up
description: The buckets in the plaza gives drinkingwater to the village. We asked if we can take it and they said yes offcourse!

name: Pantanal Boliviano
description: There is a 4x4 track through the bolivian Pantanal. Starts in Robore, Santiago de Chiquitos, Santo Corazon, San Fernando, Candelaria and ends in Las Petas. It is only a dry season drive, an even then you will find a lot of mud pools and deep sand. There you will see a lot of Birds, Apes, Caiman, Capivaras, and even the Jaguar. The hole track is about 400 km.

name: Free truck shower
description:
The gasstation has showers for those you have to pay but in the back there is a building with banos on it. There are free (little bit) cold showers. The truck drivers use those. Its not clean but its oke. You can hang your clothes and towels wich is nice. 

Its 37 degrees and we were happy to cool off for free.

name: Monet exchange and nice shop
description: Very good exchange rate better than Ibibobo, small shop with a lot of food, fruits and sweets that we haven't seen in one month in Bolivia. Super friendly man. Exchange rate here as of current date: 1.05 bolivianos/ 1000 guarani. Recommended place.

name: Auto Lavadero
description:
Car wash with undercarriage wash to get all the salt off your car. They took 100bob for two 4x4s so 50bob per car. Cheaper than in Uyuni.

60 for single  4*4 exterior only.

name: Ruta 23. Roadside
description:
Near old bridge, river, lot of places. some trash
------
lugar perfecto en el puente viejo. muchos lugares planos donde estacionar, corre el agua del rio, los vecinos muy amables

name: Nica’s Resting Place
description:
We went to SicaSica hoping to see the church. A huge fiesta was going on with music, lights and fireworks. No peace to be had near the village.  We found this quiet spot to spend the night and say goodbye to Nica. We cannot hear the village noise, unless the wind shifts. Located behind a hill. Near a wash. A few campesinos pass by but just wave.  Say hello to dear Nica- the street dog from Nicaragua that spent five years traveling with us. 
Plenty of room. Fast LTE cell.  No services

name: Next to the Vivero Verde
description:
Nice and quiet camp spot next to the vivero verde under a tree.
Very friendly owners. Introduce yourself and they will be very happy in giving you water to fill your tank.

name: Nina Tuleda Cambio
description: Exchange office. Exchanges US dollars and euros at standard rates. Fast and reputable. Nina Tuleda is located right at the crossroads, but somewhat hidden behind dense trees. Don´t know opening times. It was everytime open, when I wanted to change something.

name: Very good welder
description: Got recommended to come here by the torno down the street. Pepe is a really nice guy and does a very good job. Did a quality repair on our suspension, listened to what we wanted and did everything to a high standard.

name: Taller Mecanico
description: Good mechanic, solved my brake problems for a very fair price

name: Everything you need
description: This street had everything. The best saltenas restaurant and on the other side there is a hugeeeeee inside market with fruits, veggies, shampoo, phone things. Everything what you look for. Nice because its inside and cold. Very cheap! Just ask how many bols you want and they give you veggies and fruits. Its cheaper if you do it like that. We learned it from a local!

name: Must visit
description: Very nice hotel ish place. They have a creative ground and with pool! Big! Papaya trees, animals. Edwards is pleased if u will visit, stay, ask for tourist things and whatever. Here is his number . His wife speaks english! You can also just use the pool, shower, wifi, for a little bit of money. +59171122494

name: Incachaca
description:
Beautiful spot in the middle of Nature !! Big area, with an amazing view of the surrounding mountains. We asked a local woman if it is possible to camp and she said “of course you can camp here”. During the week we were all alone, on the weekends there are a couple of people and toilets, kiosks and a small restaurant on weekend). There are a couple of very small hikes (one to a small river where you can have a cold bath ). A couple of dogs, cows and sheep came to visit us :) 
You have to drive 3.5 km on a gravel road to get there (manageable with all kinds of vehicles). Signal is working but not the best. 
Absolutely recommend this amazing spot!

name: Saunas y duchas Sagitario
description: Family run sauna and showers. Private cabins for 1, 2 people or for a family with steam sauna and hot showers. Very clean. 10 Bobs / p. Open 9 am to 7 pm. Recommended.

name: Gomería
description: If you’ve been on ruta 10 this is a good stop. We stopped here to refill our tires after letting out the pressure for the ripio. They only asked for 5bol.

name: Close to Challapata
description: We had to stay in Challapata for a couple of days. We spent four nights here at about 500 m from the village. There is a level place on the side of the road to park for the night. Convenient for a van with high clearance or for a 4WD car because the road is not so good. Very quiet in the night ; late at night or early in the morning, people go to or come back from the field. All very friendly. If you continue further on the road, you will find other possibilities to park for the night. Many cultivated fields, stay on the side of the road even in dry season. If you continue 3,5 hours on this road, you’ll reach Potosi, said a man to us.

name: Taller Chapa Y Pintura
description: Marcelino Pari is a very nice guy who sorted out our door after a minor accident. Huge workshop, I imagine he would let you camp if necessary. He spent a whole day 8-6 fixing our door and respraying it. Only charged 300bs. Absolute bargain and good quality job.

name: Plaza Principal Aurora
description: Came here late at night looking for a grocery store and decided to stay here. Locals said it’s safe to park next to main park/plaza and there is a police station two blocks away. It was well lit and almost no cars after 9pm. Dogs could play in the park but not inside the fenced green area. We slept very well, it was very quite. Next morning there is big local mercado right across where they were selling fresh fruits and vegetables. The market had really clean public toilets for free. Overall a safe spot we felt.

name: Casa de la libertad
description:
Museum on the history of Bolivia's independance. There are several rooms which shows different moments of the history of Bolivia.
You can do a 45 min guided visit uncluded in the entrance fee (in spanish, and Mayenne un english). Really interesting, because there is no many explanations if you do the museum on your own.
Entrance costs 30 BOB for foreigners, 20 BOB for Bolivians including the guided visit.

name: Estacion de Servicio Internatipnal
description: Price 'con factura' 9 Bol., price 'sin factura' 5 Bol. Very good service

name: Hostal Captus
description: We needed to acclimatise a bit lower than city center so spend a night at Hostal Captus. Friendly lady helped us at the reception. They have a garage but we could place our bike inside the hotel in front of the reception that is staffed 24h (they did not fit in the room but that was allowed). 180BO for 2 people with private bathroom, wifi, hot showers and breakfast included. Rooms are clean (towels included)

name: La Represa
description: Flat spot at small lake with a lot of birds

name: YPFB
description: Filled with gas for foreigner price: 8.70 bolivianos.

name: Roadside - Maragua
description: Small parking space above the village of Maragua, road towards dinosaur tracks. No amenities but very nice view of the 'crater'. Internet connection ok.

name: Hotel Asai
description:
The cabins are a bit old, but with air-conditioning and hot water. The staff is really friendly and helpful. Our Entel sim was expired and they helped us by getting new ones and activate them. We had some things we needed in town and they explained very well where we could find it. We paid BS225 per night in total for two people including breakfast. They serve coffee and potable water all day long. There is a parking lot behind the gate. WiFi was sometimes a bit slow, but worked most of the time well.

Enjoy!

name: Veterinaria Uyuni
description: Dr Carlos Ramos was able to get our dogs the health certificate and the senasag documents done from potosi with in 2 days. It was 277 for Senasag document and 200 for dog health certificate, parasite vaccination and the services for documentation done from potosi. We saved alot of time and they were super efficient. The bank lineup at banco union to do the fees payment for Senasag can be huge so get this done early in the day.

name: Canilla de agua / Water tap
description:
Right in front of the cemetery there is a tap and you can connect the hose.
We asked a couple of neighbors and they told us it was good to drink.
.
Justo frente al cementerio hay una canilla y se puede conectar la manguera.
Le preguntamos a un par de vecinos y nos dijeron que era buena para tomar.

name: At the river
description:
Nice place 300mts away from the town. If you need drinkable water, in the center of the main square there is a "pila" where you can fill your bottles. Cold at night. Good place for pets. TIGO works a bit. Better ENTEL. 

Lindo lugar a 300mts del pueblo. Agua potable en el centro de la plaza principal hay una pila donde se puede cargar. Buen lugar para mascotas. Bastante frío por la noche. TIGO funciona apenas, mejor Entel.

name: Adilbar gas
description: Couldn’t find gas at any of the spots listed in town. This man adilbar gave us 40 lt of gas for 6 bol. Attached is photo of his house

name: Alojamiento la Gran Estacion
description:
Alojamiento la Gran Estacion is just behind the main street. We found most of the hotels/hostals a bit expensive (200BO+) and found this place. We paid 50BO per person per night so 100BO for double room. Shared bathroom, wifi and relatively warmish showers. No breakfast or kitchen. We could safely park the bicycles inside the hotel (rooms too small). Friendly owners (familia).

Parking for motorbikes. I do not believe the place is accessible for campers (have not checked if there is another entrance).

name: Hotaru Uyuni (Japanese)
description: Nice place where they serve Japanese dishes, vegatarian options too! 45BOB per dish, cold beers too.
