name: Autronic Car Mechanic
description:
We arrived here in the morning and they helped us immediately. David and his team solved our problem and we were back on the road again. There is not a big sign outside, but there is a big field within the gate. 
They have a lunch break between 12 and 14:30.

Good luck!

name: Gas station with Local price
description:
After we said we would give him a propina, we've got gasoline directly in our tank for local price.

Good luck!

name: La Molienda
description:
Nice restaurant with WiFi and inside with fans. Main with soup is 20Bs. A 1,5l can with refresco is also 20Bs.

Enjoy!

name: Perfectly quiet spot behind/on a little mountain
description: We found this very nice spot while searching around 3200m for acclimatisation. This is behind a little mountain, so the noise from the road is just a bit. Its really dark, cold, no persons around. To come here, follow the street 200m more. Entel signal sometimes 4G

name: CAMBIO: Despensa Caacupe
description:
CAMBIO + Minimarkt: Despensa Caacupe

change Guarani to Boliviano with fair rate.

name: Sim card
description: at this shop we could buy a Entel SIM card and the guy registered it for us. Price was 40 BOB. when the card is registered, just go up the street and turn right into Calle Sucre, there is a shop were you can top up money. at this location you cannot put money on the card. then just call *10# and you can choose which data package you want to purchase

name: 2 trees with a lot of shade an quiet place
description:
If you want to rest in the shade of two large trees, this is the place to spend some time.
Safe (military post is your neighbor) and quiet.

name: Water from locals right hand from centro de salud
description:
20BOL/200l potable water.
Say hello and ask for water, they will be very friendly and helpful.

name: Amazing spot with 4G Signal
description: amazing quiet spot with entel 4g signal. dark and very quiet

name: Road to Laguna Machu
description:
This roads leads to Laguna Machu. There is a small restaurant where you can buy a drink and where they serve lunch on the weekends. We paid 10 bolivianos to enter the road after the restaurant, which seems fair to the people that maintain the road. The road after the restaurant is unpaved but well maintained and includes a small river crossing. A few parts of the road are a bit more rocky and there is a small river crossing. Four wheel drive is recommended but might not be essential.
Beautiful views on the way, great day trip from Cochabamba.
You can park your car at the Laguna and hike to the Tunari Peak from there, but we didn't do this ourselves.

name: Plazoleta Serrate
description:
Excellent place to spend the night in Santa Cruz de la Sierra. We found it super safe. We left the motorhome all day to go exploring. There are no services. Very nice residential neighborhood, with friendly neighbors.
Excelente lugar para pasar la noche en Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Nos pareció super seguro. Dejamos el motorhome todo el día para ir a recorrer. No hay servicios. Barrio residencial muy lindo, con vecinos amables.

name: EcoVet
description: Small but good veterinarian. Went here to vaccine our adopted dog. The vet was very nice with our dog and made her very comfortable before the injection. Very helpful with us too with good information.

name: Douglas Mecanico
description: Went here after recommendation of Javier from the Laguna Camping. Had a problem with a brake which was vibrating since a few days, which Douglas resolved quickly. Also did an oil change. Honest price and very nice interaction.

name: Hotel Villa Tropical
description:
Hotel with very large outside area for cars, vans or tents. The toilets are not the cleanest in the world but still okay. There’s an access to the river. The place looks very pretty and natural, with big trees and grass. We paid 35bol per person. Nice place for our dog too! 
Only sounds of birds and insects. Good Entel signal (LTE).

name: Baño publico
description: Potable water in the yard of the public toilets in 1 de Mayo in Tarabuco.

name: Free wifi
description: Free wifi in this park. Look for "Cocha-Wifi" and follow the instructions.

name: Icla
description: Diesel and gasolina in bidon available. Diesel : 5 bolivianos / l.

name: E.S Suticollo
description: The first gas station while leaving Cochabamba where we managed to get gas. The gas stations before all asked for a 'pin' number which we don't have and which we are not managing to get from the SIVETUR website. We got gasoline here for the international price, they also have diesel.

name: Free Street Parking
description: Free street parking, for any size rig, level, on 4 lane concrete road, behind.large mall with lower level grocery store, Blue.sky tran station 2 blocks away, Entel service center 3 blocks away.  We had no safety issues.  Mall has ATMs and pay bathrooms.

name: Mercado Central - various food and goods
description:
The usual mercado central. But since there are no actual grocery stores around here, this is it.  
We found some fresh cheese and some mozzarella. Good selection of veggies. Frozen and fresh meat. And also breads. There are also places serving juices and meals. Not huge, but had all we needed.

name: HOSTAL QUISSAL
description: HOSTAL QUISSAL recently renovated all rooms. There is no sign but you can ring the buzzer of a red door. Beautiful salt hotel. A room with shared bathroom is 50BO pp and if you want a private bathroom you pay 100BO pp. They have hot showers, two sockets in the room. We could bring our bicycles in the room. Behind the gate is room for motorcycles as well. We paid 30BO pp for 2 course lunch, same price for diner and you have different options for breakfast 10BO pp for basic breakfast (butter, jam and egg plus bread) and 25BO pp for more extensive version (including juice, cheese and ham). They also washes our clothes (pay per kg). Definitely recommend as a place after the Salar to rest and then start the Ruta de las Lagunas!

name: Tourist Area Free Street Parking
description: A nearly level spot in the tourist district.  Free street parking, wide black topped road. Numerous ATMs and tour companies within a few block.  Overnighting OKed by 2 different Policewomen.  Four laundries within 2 blocks,  our's was done for 10 BB a kilo.  Many food options nearby.  3 sky tran stationsh nearby.  1 BB for nearby public bathroom, and 10 BBs for hot showers at hostels.

name: Other lakeside spot
description: Nice leveled gravel spot just on the lakeside. Very quiet, a car of locals stopped by for a half hour taking photos and chilling. No services, the water is muddy, you can have a nice walk along the lake or up the hill.

name: ATM Mercantil Santa Cruz
description: No fees for my German Visa credit card. Don't know what the upper limit is, I could withdraw 1400 Bs in one go.

name: Parque Lincoln
description: Free Wifi. Nice place with playground and trees.

name: Small Tienda
description: Small tienda in San Augustin. They have spaghetti, cookies, tuna, instant noodles, toilet paper and drinks (cola, beer, water). Might be that they serve lunch later in the day, but given that we were there for breakfast, I can not confirm. Good point to restock some things before going to Alota.

name: Soccer field wild camp
description: There are three large fields down the little road from the main road. Leveled, pretty, silent. Any size of truck can fit. Not really sheltered from the wind. Enteñ LTE coverage.

name: Dolphin Tower
description:
We slept here 2 nights. Safe and quiet place. 
Behind dolphin tower poster there is a water tap. We talked with the reception boy and he let us refill our bottles. He was friendly and recommend us some places to visit.
The sun goes down behind the building! So early in the morning the solar panel do not charge. 
The street is not really flat. But it was ok for us. 
Grass area for pets!

Dormimos acá dos noches, fue súper tranquilo y seguro. El ambiente es familiar. Atrás del cartel dolphin tower hay una canilla. Hablamos con el chico que está a la noche (conserje) y nos permitió cargar nuestros bidones. También nos recomendó lugares para conocer. 
A la mañana bien temprano da la sombra porque el sol sale detrás del edificio, pero después ya hay sol para los paneles. 
La calle no es del todo plana pero la inclinación para nosotros estuvo bien (frente a la veterinaria es la calle más plana).
Es un buen lugar para mascotas.

name: Between Candelaria and Icla
description: Not easy to find a place where to park for the night along this small road between the two villages. We used this one for a night. Not the best, close to the road. Not the worst, nice view. Quiet during the night.

name: Near RN1 Pocohata
description: Close to the rn1, large space in the openfields.  Quiet, very little traffic.  perfect before or after La Paz.

name: Along the road
description:
Good place to spend a night and to acclimate before the acotango's ascension. The spot is flat and there is a place for only 1 vehicle. The road is doable by any vehicle, this is ripio but if you go slowly the is no problem !
Night very quiet, and superb view on the altiplano.

name: Central place Lagunas
description:
In the little central place of Lagunas'village. The spot is flat and can welcome 2-3 vehicles. Night very quiet, not so much inhabitants when we were there.
There are small shops in the village where you can buy some stuff.

name: Arriba de la mina de azufre
description:
Nice spot to acclimate before hiking to the Acotango summit. The spot can welcome 4-5 vans. It's not very flat, but for one night it does the job ! Very calm day and night, some tours passed at the end of the night to go to the Acotango.
We did the Acotango from here. It took us 5 hours to climb, and 2 hours to come back. Worth the walk, the view at the summit is absolutely incredible

name: Free Roadside Park
description: Level parking lot between road and river, for any size rig or tent, has trash cans, jogging path, and close to fuel station which will sell fuel to foreigners (unlimited quantity).  Free safe place outside of city.  Stone head of Zepita at one end of pullout

name: Free Open Range
description: A flat spot for any size rig or tent on the open range near the main paved road.  No services, exposed, nobody near you.  Paved turn off makes it easy to exit the main road.

name: Club de bienestar
description:
very nice little coffee shop at the end of the town heading south. They are very rare. It is super small, we almost missed it. but happy that we spotted it. it is run by a very nice and kind lady who is in for a chat. Her coffee is from Mexico.

enjoy!

name: River and cliffs
description: Large clearing under trees beside the river and quiet

name: Riverside wild camping
description:
Peaceful wild camping spot by the river. Even in the dry season, with most rivers completely dry, there was a lot of water in the river. Perfect to refresh in a very hot day. The first 20 meters of the access road from the main road are somewhat narrow but then it’s easy. One small sandy part but we easily overcame it just talking some speed before. 

The place is on gravel, small pebbles and sand. You can park in the shade of some thick and tall bushes. One friendly stray dog came to pay a visit. No one passed in the whole afternoon and evening. Windy in the afternoon but it tends to calm down to a nice breeze in the evening and night. 
Entel LTE coverage.

name: calm flat spot
description: we spent a calm night with our tent there, the barrio is very quiet, people can see it from up but we had no complaints. you can park your van there too and it's safe. cons: when its 10am its really hot there bc no trees nearby :(

name: Marios's Camping and Cabañas
description:
Cheap place to make a base in Sucre.
50bob for a private room even cheaper for camping but I didn't ask.
10 minutes walk to the centre.
Secure parking for a couple of motorcycles in the entrance.
Nice rustic setting in a central location.
Kioskos and Restaurants nearby.
WiFi about 2mbps
Mario lives onsite but might not hear the doorbell. Best send a WhatsApp beforehand. +591 71156660
There are some nice reviews on Googlemaps

name: Illimani Tarija
description:
Seguros Illimani sells a third party car insurance for MERCOSUR to foreigners with non Bolivian license plates. The costs are around 300 US dollars for one year. No other insurance company in Tarija wants to sell insurances to foreigners anymore. Make sure to have one before you get to the border of Argentina.
Adress: Calle Gral. Trigo No 365 Tarija
Entre Virginio Lema y Alejandro del Carpio

name: Vila Vila Tienda
description: Small tienda with water, soft drinks, snacks, instant noodles, bread, coca, entel phone credit. Just down the street there is another tienda with the same selection.

name: Tres Gigantes Gas Station
description: They will sell at international price w/ factura 8.68/L and may negotiate a price sin factura.

name: Mercado Central San Cristobal
description: Fruit, vegetables, drinks, recharge your phone credit, some handcrafts. Clean public toilet. There is even a small food court upstairs, almost every sold out at noon though so get here early.

name: Mechanic 4x4
description:
Couldn't start the jeep after carwash the mechanic came down and with a bit of back and forth we diagnosed the problem together... I'm an idiot basically, don't lock your car whilst it is being washed, the alarm will block it from starting. Fixed in 10 minutes for 50 bob.

In the workshop they were working on pickups, 7.5 ton trucks etc. I'm sure they could repair any issues with big rigs.

name: Baños Aguas Termales Catavi
description:
Hot mineral water (calcium and sodium) from natural source. Can use mixed pool, separate pools or private pools.  We rented a private for 20Bop. It included a large pool, natural sauna cave and shower. Wood mats on floor. Trash can. Dry shelves. Seemed pretty clean. Water was almost too hot to tolerate, yet somehow we stayed an hour and feel clean and great. Wear flip flops, bring towels, drinks, snacks, etc. Good cell service. Curious onlookers outside the private room- not many foreign visitors.  
There is a pinned climbing rock just around the corner. Grab your gear! 

Lots of free parking for any size rig just past the taxis. Also a cute playground. Llamas grazing. A filthy river and a dirt road- we drove about a half mile to sleep. 
Nice simple stop for us. Big rig and pet friendly parking.

name: Café’ Time & Coffee
description:
A very pleasant restaurant with unusual and delicious sandwiches and drinks. Plus lots of different coffee.  They even sold ground-to-order beans to go (we have not found good coffee at grocery stores). A huge, outdoor space with shade. Indoor dining. Clean baños. And a great view over the city. 
This is next to the Recoleta
Monastery and the original plaza. Parking is very limited. We walked up here.  Enjoyed dining while waiting for the museum to open.

name: Close to the cemetery
description: We didn’t want to drive after the bath in the Rosario Aguas Termales. Very nice. Just a few people on Friday afternoon. One kilometre from the main road. Quiet. Flat and large place. Nice view. Easy access for any vehicle.

name: UE Chaquilla
description: Drinking water from a tap in the small garden in the middle of the square close to la UE Chaquilla.

name: Bar de Ari
description: Aris wife has washing machine and can wash your clothing.

name: Gomeria RN4 Tambo Quemado
description: Inflation station sells diesel and gasoline.  Diesel 7 bol/liter.

name: Unsafe to camp
description:
We parked at the other side of the road about 500m from the spot. At 9.30 pm armed anti narcotics police woke us, they were pretty friendly once they had established we were tourists and not smugglers. They bid us a good night and told us to keep the doors of the jeep locked all night.

At 1am we were woken again by a different patrol who told us to leave and go down to the village to sleep. Too dangerous out here, lots of thieves. They obviously hadn't spoken with the previous patrol and were far less professional. We complied and drove down to Villamar for the rest of the night of very fitful sleep. 0/10 do not recommend.

name: Toll plaza
description: At night, we arrived and spoke with the police who advised us to sleep here. According to them, there is no safe place on the road ahead. Safe and quiet night.

name: Parque Lincoln
description: We slept here for two nights on a weekend. Very quiet and safe. Free wifi. One block away there is a gas station with bathrooms and showers

name: Wildcamp on rough road
description: Stayed 1 night. Stopped here because it was very late and other wildcamp spots turned into nothing. We parked on the middle of the road but it seemed like it isn’t being used much so we took the risk. Nice jungle sounds all around, quiet. Reception with Entel.

name: Uvairenda Bodega
description: Really nice winery with an amazing view! You can try some local wine here and get some food. There are some tours available to visit the winery but you need to book in advance. Dirt uphill road, but doable. We walked there from town.

name: Aguas Termales- Hot Springs
description: These are called Talulah and also Purunquilla.  It appears to be under perpetual construction.  Currently three indoor tubs and one outdoor tub. Toilets. Showers (but no water to them). The whole inside is extremely clean and odor free. The outside is dusty with piles of rock everywhere. Admission 5B per person.  Parked right in front. Could probably sleep here, we just may try it.

name: Laguna Yapi
description:
We arrived to this lake with our van, the road is sometimes very sandy but doable with our 2WD. the lake is dried but very beautiful.

Nous sommes arrivés à cette laguna avec notre van, route par section très sableuse avec un peu de patinage (nous avons un 2WD) mais nous y sommes arrivés ! Laguna à sec mais très jolie.

name: Nice camp before Laguna Capina
description: We were running late and saw this particular spot protected from the wind. Nice view on the mountains. Quiet night!

name: Off Route 14
description: Flat level gravel lot, nobody around, just off Route 14, has little traffic at night.  No issues during our stay.  Route 14 in downtown Tupiza was shut down by political protesters so this free site was home for the night.

name: Deep sand to Laguna Colorada
description: this is the deviation to laguna colorada. there are some parts with deep sand. coming from the main street to laguna is down the road, so just speed up. coming up is really hard, i would not try it with 2WD

name: Hotel Jardin
description: Checked in here after being chased from the restaurant / hotel next door. Very friendly staff, big pool, Wi-Fi, lake access and pricey but good restaurant. Allowed us to park next to the pool in front of the lake for 50pp and nigh,t incl. use of all facilities.

name: Path to Brazil
description: Large open area on the left side of the road (coming from San Ignacio). Very close to Brazil, although no official border here. Not completely flat but managed with levellers. Super quiet, barely any traffic. Far enough from the road for any dust. No reception.

name: gasoline and diesel from canisters
description: finally diesel! 7bol/ ltr. i used a water seperstion filter, no water found in the 60 l i bought

name: Riverside
description:
Grassy area on the river. Popular with locals during the day.
Lots of trash about.
Semi hidden from the road.

name: Banco Unión- pay vet and SENASAg
description:
If you are getting pet papers completed in town, this is where you must pay the fees for the vets services and the senasa paperwork. 
Check hours on Google. Arrive early to stand in line! (We lined up at 7:30 on a Saturday- took over an hours to get in) 
Bring passport and slip from vets office.

name: Hidalgo Tours- the best!
description:
+59172203914 WhatsApp 

This was the best tour we have ever attended.  There are a ton of agencies in town, and we did not shop around. But we can wholeheartedly recommend this one. 
The pre-travel communication was fantastic, fast and accurate.  Allowing us to leave our camper at the trains and bring our dog on the journey was a very special part of the entire process.  We are thankful she was allowed to go, which made it possible for us to go (we could not leave her in our camper for 9 hours) And she had a lot of fun also.

The guide and driver arrived on time and were friendly and happy from the first moment of HOLA! 
The auto was clean and seemed safe. The driver, Jose. was cautious and yet relaxed.  He made a special stop when requested and waited patiently nearby at all scheduled stops.  
Our guide, David was amazing. He made the entire day just perfect. His English helped us feel comfortable, his humor and good nature made all of it very fun.  
The two of them took care of us like family and loved our dog, Pacha as if she was theirs.   
The tour included a traditional lunch on the Salar. The food was so delicious that we ate until we were stuffed. And there was extra for them to eat. The table setting was beautiful and added to the special ambiance.  
During the hikes and stops, David was patient with our old, slow walking and yet captured beautiful photos of every opportunity.  The day ended with a table of snacks and a bottle of Bolivian wine at sunset. Just perfect. 

+59172203914 WhatsApp in English. Discuss dates and packages. This agency works through the very classy salt hotel.

name: Vainilla coffee and bakeryshop
description:
Businesses come and go quickly here. This one is open when others are gone. Even on a Sunday.  
Wide variety of coffee. A few cakes and baked goods. 
Even a breakfast and sandwich menu. 
Cute, clean place. Good wifi. No bañó!!
Closed on Monday

name: By dry torrential riverbed
description: Amazing views, nobody there besides some locals and a lady with goats and few dogs passing by. Spent there 2 nights. Many cactuses and hummingbirds. Entel LTE. Going towards Uyuni on the right up towards the mountains (before the small bridge). 2WD friendly.

name: Entrance to the Inca canyon
description: Car park near the Inca Canyon. Nice and quiet place. No 4x4 necessary.

name: Mechanic - remachado de frenos
description: Workshop of “El Chileno”, he remade our brake pads as the original pieces are impossible to find around here. He did a good job for 200 Bs. This been said, he made us wait 5 hours in front of the workshop for something he initially told us he could do right away. So if he tells you “quickly” don’t take that seriously.

name: Entry of cañon de Duende
description: Quite place, easy access with a 4x4 along the river dry in winter. Be careful if it rain. A little difficult to be flat, but enough stones to make it. The canion is worth the visit.

name: Parqeo of the laguna Tajsara
description: We were parked 100m before this parquing at the previous Ioverlander point and a Parque guard came to tell us to move here. The price is 70 Bol(8dollars)/person. We arrived late and left early. If we had known, we would not have approached the lagoon! There are enough free places everywhere in these mountains.

name: Senasag Office
description: You can find here the senasag office (don’t try to go the one close to the peaje outside of Tupiza, they don’t issue the necessary documents). We went before to the Clínica Veterinaria "San Thiago" (they issue the health certificate for you for 80 bob). Afterwards you come here and then go to the banco Union to do the transfer and bring the receipt back to the office to then issue your document. Mind that the senasag officers might not be there all the time since they are sometimes out in the field. It takes 2 days since the document will be sent from Potosi (first day you hand in the vets document, do the transfer etc, and on the next day you can pick up the document around 9 am). You can text the officer Martin beforehand ‪+59176963900‬. Costs for the document is 277 Bolivianos.

name: next to jungle/ river
description:
beautiful large and levelled spot next to some lakes with a great view and a lot of birds. in the area are a lot of grassy areas to park (also right next to the river) but they use some of the places to throw trash away. this one is pretty clean. please help to keep it like that and take your trash and toilet paper with you. 
some locals came by to cut ‘schilf’ and were friendly. no one bothered us. great entel LTE signal.

name: Wow Healthy Food Cafe
description: Great café !! A lot of vegetarian options, they also do breakfast/brunchs. Open from 7am to 11pm. We had the burgers(veggie&meat) and it was amazing !! We paid 30bol for a burger with fries. Good wifi also.

name: El Mascaron Tours
description:
We did the Potosi mines tour with them. 
Not the most expensive, not the cheapest either, but great attention, the guide was an ex miner who could answer all our questions, we had good and clean gear, and they accepted credit card.
220 bol.

name: Candelaria Cafe
description:
Cafe, stairs to get to it. Terrible attention, just tried breakfast, wich was mediocre.
But good wifi connection, and they don't mind you arriving 8 am and staying the whole morning working.
Tv with music in the background. Not too loud, but would be annoying for an online meeting.

name: San Juan Necropolis
description: To overnight outside the village, we parked on the east side of the necropolis next to wall to try to be protected from wind. Toilets closed during the night. A guy said we can stay without any problem.

name: Near Bermejo River
description: When heading south-east on Route 1 you will cross a small bridge for Sausalito Creek.  15 meters after the bridge to the right (south) is a 100 meter dirt road that dead ends at the Bermejo River.  If you see the 1041 Km marker you have gone too far.  Camp on flat areas near Route 1 or at the river.  Free, safe, quiet, no homes in sight, no services.  Big rig and tent friendly.  Space for 4 rigs.  Friendly locals used area to access river for cooling of in the river.  2WD is A-OK.

name: Laguna de tajzara
description: A very remote place forgotten by the traveller’s but with plenty of things to see in the reseve : Nice sand dunes, very large flamingos reserve(hundred of them), remote villages, cactus Forest, hiking on the Chapaq nan path and more. wild camping permitted close to the villages. Still remote. People are shy, respect them.

name: Road to/from calderillas
description: This road is close because destroyed in many places. No possible to drive even with a 4x4. By foot only

name: gated jungle spot
description:
We tried to find a nice spot near the city to escape the trouble. We ended in this ‘gated community’ which is not yet one. There are already all the streets and signs but no one here. We talked to the security guys to the gated community right on the other side of the road and they said we are free to stay inside as no one is watching this place. Feels like a real junge inside with lots of different birds and trees. We saw a lot of mango trees and as it’s the time right now we were abe to pick a whole bag of mangoes! We don’t know how long this place will stay like this but it’s super special and worth the visit.
Please take care of the spot and don’t leave any trash or toilet paper behind.

name: Hostal Universo
description:
Very nice hostel with super friendly owners. Definitely a little on the fancy side. We could store our bicycles in a little room.
They have a nice breakfast buffet included and a kitchen where you can prepare your own meals.
Without private bathroom it's 60 Bo p.p. with it's 90.
Was totally worth it for us especially since in most other places we found it would've been complicated to store the bikes because there were narrow stairs.

name: Wawas pet hotel
description:
Wawas pet hotel is a huge hotel to leave your pets safe! It also has emergency services, a clinic, a hairdresser, etc. We left our dog one day when we went on a hike and it was really great, we recommend!
---------
Wawas pet hotel, es un hotel enorme para dejar a tus mascotas seguras! también cuenta con servicios de emergencia,  clínica, peluquería etc dejamos a nuestro perrito un día cuando fuimos a hacer una excursión y la verdad que super bien, recomendamos!

name: CUADRAPACKS/MOTO TOURS
description:
Excellent place! We did two tours... we rented a quadrapack (quad) for 2 hours touring the Valley of the Moon (200 bol for a couple) always with a guide in front and then we rented a motorcycle (Suzuki dr650 or kawasaki klr 650) to do the highway of death All the equipment was excellent, the treatment from the owner was a 10, we paid about 630 Bol for the motorcycle all day, it included all the equipment for both me and my wife... the motorcycle was cheaper than doing the famous bicycle tour and above everything is much SAFER to do at your own pace on these motorcycles.. we recommend!
-----------
excelente lugar! hicimos dos tours.. alquilamos un cuadrapack (cuatriciclo)por 2 horas recorriendo el Valle de la luna (200bol una pareja) siempre con un guía adelante y luego alquilamos una moto (Suzuki dr650 o kawasaki klr 650) para hacer la carretera de la muerte, todo el equipo excelente el trato del dueño un 10, pagamos la moto unos 630 Bol todo el día,  incluía todo el equipo tanto para mi y a mi esposa.. salio mas económico la moto que hacer el famoso tour de la bicicleta y por sobre todo mucho MAS SEGURO hacerlo a tu ritmo en estas motos.. recomendamos!

name: Wild camping by the river
description: On bicycles. We found a nice flat camping spot near the river. Go down from the village and just before the bridge there is a flat space on your left. Some locals might walk by on the small trail.

name: AUTOTRONICA TRIVAL
description:
Specialist in injection and electronics. In the photo there are all the services he performs. My diesel Ducato lost power and he solved the problem.
------------
Especialista em injeção e parte eletrônica. Na foto tem todos os serviços que ele faz. A minha Ducato a diesel perdeu a força e ele solucionou o problema.

name: Rinaldos Organic Vineyard
description:
Rinaldo started planting his vines after his retirement. 
He welcomes overlanders and gives an inview to his project with organic vines and vision. It‘s a private and quiet place. Be a good guest! Just for small vehicles. If you don’t meet Rinaldo call him +59177541383

name: Track off the main road
description: Along the road going from / to Uyuni there are not so much place to stop around here. This track leads to remote , quiet and flat spots where to Sleep. Drive 2 or 3 km from the main road and you will find a spot. 2 wd can also take it. Little Water in some places in the river bed.

name: Laguna cachi
description:
Magnificent spot, with a view of the colorful mountains, the laguna and the pink flamingos.
----------
Magnifique spot, avec vue sur les montagnes colorées, la laguna et les flamants roses.

name: Laguna hedionda
description:
Favorites out and about: spot on the edge of the lagoon with a view of the pink flamingos. Lots of wind but great site.
-----------
Les chouchous en vadrouille : spot au bord de la lagune avec vue sur les flamants roses. Beaucoup de vent mais super site.

name: Taller Gómez
description:
Mechanical workshop specialized in gearbox for Volkswagen 
....
Taller de caja de cambio Volkswagen kombi 
Teléfono: 60263415

name: Plaza 25 de Mayo
description:
We stayed several nights here, super safe and also with a water tap!
.....
Nos quedamos varias noches aquí, súper seguro y además con canilla de agua!

name: Street Parking
description:
No facilities. Safe. Next to police station.
.....
Espacio abierto donde se encuentra la policía , seguro, sin facilidades

name: Plaza Principal de Puna
description:
Parking at the plaza, safe, many places to buy food.
.....
Estacionado en la plaza, seguro, varios locales donde comprar comida.

name: Plaza 6 de Agosto
description:
Potable water at the plaza.
.....
Agua potable en la plaza.

name: Mirador de Chochis
description: incredible view both at sunrise and sunset, beginning of the path, 50 meters to the left of the entrance to the waterfall, sign at the entrance.  1 km to reach the watchtower.

name: Mirador de Ñuflo
description: Nice site accessible preferably by 4x4, magnificent view of the city, very flat.  some motorcycles or vehicles at night.

name: Piso Firme - Parque Kempff
description: Entrance to the national park, the others being closed for the moment, Florida will open perhaps in 2024. No tourists, incredible immersion in this village at the end of the world.  access in 8 to 9 hours by road from Santa Rosa only in 4x4 (even though we saw simple cars).  2 activities to do: in the dry season, bella vista where a path accesses the lake 3 hours by boat from Piso Firme then 3 to 4 hours of walking one way;  in the rainy season, access to the waterfalls, by boat (3h to Bella Vista, 2h30 to the entrance of the Pasauna River then another 3h by boat to the first waterfall, and finally 3h of hiking to  'at arco iris. We stayed at Bella Vista, we saw many animals: nesting turtles, pink dolphins, otters, capybaras, howler monkeys, spiders, capuchins, many birds, and fresh traces of jaguars that came to eat turtles at night. as said before, no tourists so need to organize everything upstream, food, drinks, guide for the boat, for the trail, see on site in Bella Vista. contact on poso firm Dario Rocha + 591 74376576 or Don  Ulisses + 591 72640068. Experience out of time and off the beaten track

name: Challapampa View
description: Beautiful view over Challapampa at afternoon and sunrise.

name: View over Challapampa
description: The most beautiful view of the island, 360°! Just above the trail from north to south

name: Canyon de Palca from Uni
description: This is the parking area to get inside the Canyon by foot. Best to do with 4 wheel drive. Really. beautiful

name: GOVISTA
description:
150 bolivianos for 1 week
with a pool
simple rooms without beds
private bathrooms

name: Quiet River Spot
description:
A quiet river spot on the way to Sucre from the crater. 

No traffic in the night. Lots of stars. 

Drive past the quary and continue for about 100m.

name: Hostal Florida
description:
Hostal - 10 min Walk from Bus Terminal 

Prices 10/23:
3 Bed dorm - 30 Bolivianos 
Hot shower, WiFi, no kitchen Spotted

name: Cafe Vida
description: Great vegan/veggie restaurant, it’s on iOverlander somewhere but wrong place, since had to move after the pandemic. Great food, great value, friendly staff! Would highly recommend, 35bob for almuerzo, soup bread and Hummus, main dish and a juice.

name: YPFB Fuel Station
description: Ypfb fuel station who filled our tank directly with Gasolina for 5 Bolivianos per liter.  We asked nicely and they were very kind.

name: Calcha K
description: At about 1 km from the village… in the middle of nowhere. Nothing but the llamas will come and see you. Quiet.

name: Cafe Khotisuyo
description: We were looking for good coffee and found it here. they also have excellent croissant, pain au chocolat and bread.

name: Meat Shop
description:
Here you find high quality processed llama meat, filet, sauseages, burger, charque. Everything is delicious (at least for us). Wilson, the owner, is lovely and if you are in a little group, he will let you try his products which he will cook for you within some minutes. 
Better to call him to be sure he is there or to arrange an appointment as he is on " ferias" most of the time. Cell. +591 71232193.

name: Dry riverbed with trees far from road
description:
Nice place ! We spend a day and a night here. There is a huge dry riverbed, with plenty of little and medium-sized trees, so you can find a little shade. You can go further in the riverbed (more or less according to your car, it can be very rocky) to find a good spot close to the trees or to even be truly isolated in the middle. The place is rather beautiful.
The access is easy for any kind of vehicule. You are far from the road and any human presence : it's very quiet and it felt safe. We only saw a tractor going down the riverbed during the day and coming back during the night. 
I think it's not a good idea to go to the riverbed during the rainy season, but you can stop just before. 
Entel signal is working. No trash around.

name: In the middle of herds of llamas
description: We stopped here on our way from Sucre to Uyuni. Just a few hundred meters next to the RN5 is a beautiful and quiet place to regenerate. Hundreds of llamas were grazing just a few meters away from us. A short hike into a nearby small cañon is recommended.

name: Entel office
description: Office of Entel where you can buy sim card, top  up and activate sim. We were helped by English speaking lady.

name: Wancollo SPA
description:
This is not an official hotel. Rooms can be rented in the former spa. I paid 30bob per night. At night you are alone in the building. It's absolutely quiet. The kitchen can be used.
It is best to contact Monica beforehand:
+591 73029775

name: IMESUR
description:
Imesur foundry, Manufacture of general parts for vehicles, industrial machines, in steel, iron, aluminum, bronze and parts in general according to drawing or sample

Fonderie Imesur, Fabrication de pièces générales pour véhicules, machines industrielles, en acier, fer, aluminium, bronze et pièces en général selon plan ou échantillon

name: Hospedaje Arbol de Piedra
description:
Very good hostel ! We took a matrimonial with private bathroom : very nice, pretty, very clean, confortable. The shower was the best we had in Bolivia : hot and strong. Towels, shampoo and toilet paper included. It was 300bol for the private room and food : tea + biscuits, dinner and breakfast (total for 2 people). The food was simple (soup + pasta with sauce) but copious and with some efforts and it was good. The owner, Fermin, is very nice, friendly and hardworking. We first met him taking care of his lamas around another laguna and we were happy to discover its place. If you want to contact him : +59172371714
We totally recommend this Firmin,
p.s no name in the hostel, but you can find it in maps.me (it's the last of the village if you're arriving from south.)

name: PALACIO DEL NIPLE
description:
In this store you will find all the hydraulic connections, hydraulic hoses, ferrules for pressing the hoses, hydraulic adapters, quick couplings… and Gas 

vous trouverez dans ce magasin toutes les connexions hydrauliques, les tuyaux hydrauliques, les ferrules pour presser les tuyaux, adaptateurs hydrauliques, des raccords rapides … et gaz

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100063892990254&mibextid=LQQJ4d

name: Taller trochero
description:
Excellent place to go to repair your vehicle. Carlos, the owner, was very kind. I was able to sleep at the door of the workshop while my spare part arrived. It is the same workshop that the guys from Americando were in
Excelente lugar para ir a reparar tu vehiculo. Carlos el dueño muy amable, pude dormir en la puerta del taller mientras llegaba mi repuesto. Es el mismo taller que los chicos de americando estuvieron

name: Don Loncho
description: The exhaust of our LC80 is a bit loose. This guy welded the brackets within an hour.

name: toll
description: Toll booth and police checkpoint. Paid 15 bob for Rurrenabaque. And could pass without showing papers.

name: Canyon. Roadside
description: Stopped just by the road. Hard ground so no problem for 2wd. Llamas came by in the morning on their way to water. Beautiful view and quiet night. Around 9am, some tour guides drove by and happily waved to us.

name: Mashaquipe Tours Eco Lodge
description: Established campground as part of the jungle tour with the excursion company Mashaquipe. Has platforms for beds, a dining and kitchen area, running water for showers and toilets, and a few hammocks for relaxing. You are truly immersed in the Bolivian Amazon with the birds, cicadas, butterflies, and rustling trees. We are keeping an eye out for other interesting critters.

name: Rock Formations. Ruta 9
description: Beautiful rock formations next to some lagunas. There are trashbins so I assume it‘s a tourist place. It’s nice to explore a little bit around and follow some of the trails here. I don’t know if you can take a bath in the first laguna but it didn’t look too nice to hop in. Also I think you can spend the night here as there's a levelled area before the bins ( but it's next to the street and not really hidden). Enjoy and please don’t leave trash or toilet paper in nature.

name: Cafe Del Mundo
description: Just an amazing café !! Loads of different options (vegetarian also). All day breakfast/lunch and huge portions! Highly recommend !

name: Comanche. West side of Road
description: A tap in the middle of nowhere, maybe linked to a spring? We filtered it just in case

name: Callapa
description:
(GPS coordinates are approximate.)

Opposite the Centro de Salud there is a tap (which wasn't working when we passed) and behind that near the fenced off area there is another water tap. Best to boil/filter the water.

name: Bakua Pizza & Tacos
description: Good pizza, big tacos, really big servings, Italian-owned. It’s not the absolute best food you’ll ever eat, but the price is right and there aren’t many better options in Rurrenabaque. B+. Giant table-sized pizzas are less than $10, (medium for 2 people is more than enough), unlimited choose your own toppings. We ate here a shameful amount of times while stuck in town.

name: Parqueo Periodista
description:
Parqueo close to city center.
2 bol/hour, 10bol/night.
It's possible to stay overnight in the car, no WC or shower.
Very flat

name: quiet place next to the tunnel
description:
Here is a good place to sleep next to the road. It's near to a tunnel which is still not in Google or OSM. Place is flat and you only hear a bit of the road which is around 200 m from here and some animals.
During the rainy season it could be a bit dangerous because of falling rocks. We had 4g here with entel

name: Surtidor de Chaparral
description: local price without asking. super friendly staff. we left a good tip :)

name: Wild camp under rocky shelter
description: Enough shelter for at least two small tents. Great views over the Salar. Was slightly muddy crossing from the centre of the Salar to here so if coming from the north would be best to head west way before the ‘stream’ where the flamingos are. It was raining when we were here so was perfect shelter from the wind and rain.

name: Hôtel biotermal and hot springs
description: Amazing place with plenty of trees with lots of birds and animals close to the hot water where to dive anytime. Lovely bar by the canal , kayak rental available . Swimming pool, hamoc and beautiful trees all around. Very beautiful spot. Food is ok and bedrooms for a correct price (400 bob for a double bed + bathroom.

name: Checkpoint Bolivia/Peru
description: Soon after the border where you arrange all your papers, there's a checkpoint. We made the mistake of standing in line with all the trucks. You can just drive up to the checkpoint, passing all the trucks. They'll check your papers and then you're good to go. (This was from Peru to Bolivia but looked the same on the other side)

name: Certified Landrover Specialist
description:
WhatsApp:  +591 67540000
Landrover specialist
Simple garage, very competent work! We recommend!

name: Hostel near Laguna Colorada
description:
Basic, old, not the cleanest, cold but probably the cheapest.
We had a triple dorm for us two (there are no matrimonials) and paid 30BS pp. Additionally 15BS pp for a hot shower and 15BS for using the kitchen/gas bottle.
Enough parking space in front for all kind of rigs. 

(don‘t know the name of the hostel)

name: Condo abandoned train station
description: The whole village is pretty much just crumbling ruins except one or two elderly people still living here. We asked if we could camp somewhere and decided upon the old train station because it was one of the more intact ruins and was good shelter from the insane wind.

name: Gas station Bollivian
description: We asked a local where we can fill up our watertank and he showed us this water tap behind the gasstation. When you stand in front of the gasstation you have to go right. there you can see toilets and behind them there’s a tap which you can use. The gas station was closed on the day we were there but if it’s open I think you should just ask the workers friendly if you can fill up your tank.

name: Hotel Colcha K
description: Simple Hotel, no sign but locals directed us here. Green facade. 40Bs per person per night for a simple room, big covered courtyard to securely store bicycles and wash the salt off (no hose, just tap and buckets). Kindly let us cook in the owner's kitchen. Shower was weak and reasonably warm at no extra fee. Free electricity, no wifi. Owner is also a baker so fresh bread was available.

name: Camp sheltered by fault line
description: Completely hidden from road. As you just start to descend off the little saddle after the first open flat of the lagunas there is a large flat area about 60m away off to your left hidden from the road by a low ridge of rocks. What appears to be a fault line heads ESE and has formed some beautifully sheltered pockets from the wind. Viscachas hide amongst these hollows but are shy. We could fit one large 2p tent well out of the wind or several small 2p tents spaced around in pockets would work too. No water

name: Mountains view by the water
description: Going towards lagunas and mountains on the left side just by the road. There is a water source (probably coming from mountains) a few meters further away from the road. We tought it was looking clean enough to drink without boiling and we didn’t have any problems. Stayed here all afternoon and then slept and nobody said anything. Few locals on bikes and cars looked at us like we’re aliens but most of them just smiled and waved at us or honked. LTE at location. Would stay again! :)

name: Mountain water
description: There is a water source (probably coming from mountains) - concrete sink with pipe a few meters further away from the road. We tought it was looking clean enough to drink without boiling and we didn’t have any problems.

name: Centro Équestre Lucky Luke
description:
A very pleasant experience with Edy and his horses. We have done a 16km walk as a family and with beautiful landscapes (similar to western movies).
Edy is a very good person who takes great care of people and their animals. They can arrive with confidence and enjoy.
Edy: (+591) 74224625
-----------
Una experiencia muy agradable con Edy y sus caballos. Hemos hecho una caminata de 16km en familia y con paisajes hermosos (parecidos a películas de western).
Edy es una muy buena persona cuide mucho a la gente y a sus animales. Pueden llegar con confianza y disfrutar.
Edy: (+591) 74224625

name: beach camp next to Río Beni
description:
Huge beach next to Rio Beni. Enough space for every kind of vehicle. We found a small spot wind sheltered and a bit hidden in the reed. But this is only big enough for small campers and tents. 
Some locals came by to clean their vehicles, fill up their watertanks, wash their clothes or take a bath with the kids. All of them were friendly and welcoming. Also some fishermen prepared their boats to go. 
Quiet night except of the passing boats :) When we were there it was super windy and dusty. It’s possible that you can’t enter this spot in rainy season. 
Please take your trash and toilet paper with you and keep this place clean.
Quiet good reception with entel.

name: Hostal Penas
description:
Nice hostal on the main square of Penas.
Here you can find information about rock-climbing in Penas.

Dormitorio 50bol/night.
Shared kitchen/bathroom.
Camping 15bs pppn.

There is also a cafeteria on the right side of the building, only open during weekend. Very nice queso !!

name: Mountaineering/Trekking La cordillera experience
description:
"La cordillera experience" is a kind of tourism agency, it take part of Perroquia of Penas, which aim to develop tourism in the region. They work only with real and local guide.
Very nice vibes.

Their offer guided trekking, guided mountaineering (huyana potosi, illimani...) and rock climbing.

It's possible to rent mountaineering gear and rock climbing gear, good material for fair price !

See their website for more informations :
https://es.lacordilleraexperience.org/

name: Well stocked shop
description: Grey shop at the end of town. Best stocked by far including bread and veg

name: Rock climbing Penas
description:
Very nice rock climbing spot !
Lot of routes for every level (more than 100 !!), nice rock and well equipped !

Topo is available at the hostal or cafeteria on the main square, or ask to "La cordillera experience" at the perroquia on the main square. 15bol

It's possible to rent gear at "La cordillera experience" (see the ioverlander post).

There is also a camping at this spot only for tent, for camper, it's possible to stay on the main square.

name: Alfonso's storage
description:
We leave our van here during 20 nights for 20 BOB per day.
You can park here in a closed area, you pay the same price if you sleep in the van or not.
No facilities and bad entel reception.
The storage is located on the N°1643. There are 2 boats drawn on the doors (see picture). Know hard with a stone on the metalic doors and Alfonso or his brother come to open.
You can contact Alfonso by WhatsApp for more informations : +591 76231400.

name: Wild camping at village entrance
description: We stayed at the hidden spot a bit further down the road but after half an hour a policeman came and escorted us here. You can park wherever you feel. Big area, level, and more social control and thus safer according to the officer. Felt safe indeed.

name: Sirk'i Qullo peak campsite
description:
-16.38522 -68.00238
This is the beginning of a beautiful trail to the Sirk'i Qullo peak. It goes from this point to a lake. Should check the trail in Google maps but it's an easy trial 2wd cars with good clearance can make it.

The end of the trail to Sirk'i Qullo peak and a great place to camp next to the lake. Very quiet and peaceful place to be.

name: Alojamiento Cocapata
description:
80bs double room with private bathroom
60bs double room with shared bathroom (I had to pay 70bs because I am a foreigner I think because the price is written in the office of the guy and I didn’t see it before paying…)

name: Derelict school/ community centre
description:
Decent dirt road to be able to drive our 2wd Sprinter over.
Basic playground (swings).
Tap and basin to the rear.
No one around when we were there.

name: Santa Cruz de la Sierra Botanical Garden
description:
Awesome place to see sloths, monkeys, cayman, turtles and tortoises.
Bs 10 per person. Campervan was free.
Heaps of BBQ areas and picnic spots.
A great afternoon.

name: Frenos ASB (white with blue writing)
description:
The father and daughter team removed a large screw that had punctured our tyres and repaired the tyre. The whole process took less than 10 minutes.
Only charged Bs 40 too.

name: Pirai Cabins (heaps of local restaurants)
description:
Heaps of local restaurants serving great food. We had a delightful breakfast at Cabaña Totai. Fair price too. 
There was horse riding and quad biking at the end of the street.

name: SOAT EXPRESS online
description:
SOAT EXPRESS online via WhatsApp:
+51 947 350 208
a) connect to SOAT EXPRESS
b) pay with Credit/Debitcard
c) get your SOAT online

name: River gulley tent spot
description: River bed intersects road, follow it down and you will find several spots big enough for a 2 man tent. Reasonably sheltered from the wind, and mostly hidden from road. Quiet peaceful night here, very little traffic.

name: Mechanica general Roly Fren
description:
After driving through the mountains your brakes clould use some replacements. We went to this place. Seems alright. They replaced the brake pads( pastillas de freno) of out landcruiser 80. Paid 700 bob for both front wheels.
Open on saturday. Sign on photo says what else they do.

name: San Jorge
description: Diesel: 50 litres a 5 bs without bargaining. No problem.

name: Entre Rio’s
description: Big flat grassy space. Close but hidden from the road. Not too much garbage. Some cows.

name: Bird’s songs
description: Middle of nowhere on the side of dirt road. Not the most beautiful landscape but very quiet. Plenty of wonderful birds songs in the evening and in the middle of the night. A good place if you have to overnight between Villa Montes and Santa Cruz.

name: El Refugio
description: Coming from Villa Montes, we wanted to stop for the night before reaching Santa Cruz. Quiet place on the side of a sandy road. The neighbour of the house nearby said there is no problem to stay here. Careful, it rained during the night. Fortunately we had a 4WD vehicle to go out the next morning. I believe this would have been impossible on the wet sand path.

name: 4x4 garage - G Auto Centro cars
description: Friendly Toyota and 4x4 garage managed by Gueri Alvarado - fast and good work , Honest price. Often busy but helpfull for travellers passing by. Gueri Knows Well land cruiser and others cars and is helpfull.

name: BancoFie
description:
ATM for maestro and visa. 
Also a ecofuturo bank across the street. But did not try that one.

name: Itcar Motors to be avoided
description: Itcar motors was recommended by Rolando, owner of camping Colibrí. I unfortunately cannot really recommend to go there. The guy is nice but 10 days later, almost nothing was done on my car. Furthermore, the little work which has been made wasn't good quality work and I had to go somewhere else to get the job done/redone properly.

name: Outside Casa Sayana
description:
Relatively quiet street for Samaipata with the motorbikes wizzing passed. We haven’t found anywhere that they don’t. 
Wifi from the hostel

name: restaurant Raoul
description:
A suggestion from the guard/guide at the necropolis. A 'tranquilo' restaurant with good food. Nice family with 3 daughters. Very, very basic. Bring your own beer.
When we were there, there were no restaurants open in St Juan. Only this place was. It is visited by the locals from the town. The owner Raoul serves chicken from barbecue. With rice and salad, 25 Bob pp.

name: Next to restaurant and waterfall
description: Quiet and safe next to restaurant. Just hear the sound of the river and falls. We ate at the restaurant, good cheap food and then had a refreshing swim in the waterfall. I would avoid this on the weekend, the restaurant owner said it gets busy because of the waterfall.

name: Nice place at the river bed
description:
Taking the entrance to the gomero tricentenario, just driving down to the river bed. 

At the time we were there, there was no water at all so that we could sleep in the river bed which was nice (little wind and no mosquitos --> nice after a very hot day) but they is also a spots before the river bed. (then may be not for big rigs).

 It is not visible  from the road and some 100 m away so that it is fairly quiet. 
ah, and there is also the tricentenario gomero which is nice to see (5 Bol.)

name: Sabaya
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does not mention water is potable. Use caution.

I camped here and in the morning a man shows up and tells me how to make the water work. it's pretty simple. 5m next to the water tap is a valve in the ground (red stones In the picture) which you're must open first (turn it to the left).
The water tastes a little salty.
I drank the water and had no issues.
Please close the valve when u done

name: YFPB Morelia
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: The fuel attendant has to keep track of license plates. Selling under the government imposed (foreigners) price implies fraud. Use caution.

He started the negotiation at 9 bol/liter, we ended at 7. We were sent here by another gas station that didn't want to sell to us.

name: Hospedaje Sarabia
description: Nice place with plenty parking space. You have to enter via a gate. But we fitted with landcruiser and rooftent. app.2.40m. And located in the centre of Sucre. Very friendly owner, who is interested I  receiving more foreign guests. So, although you can find him on booking.com, now also on iOverlander, due to his available parking space.

name: Ollita y Barro
description: Local joint that doesn’t have a menu, just serves what they made that day. Super tasty food, super cheap (10B), super friendly staff and cold beer. What’s not to love

name: Sheltered wild camping next to road
description: there are two big holes in the ground that are perfectly sheltered from the wind. you can even drive in with a car or a motorcycle. there is enough space for more than 5 tents even. no one can see you from the road. ot fets very cold though as it is on 4900m.

name: Moto Bed & Breakfast Bolivia
description: This is the best place for motorbike travellers visiting La Paz. The hostel is an apartement that belongs to Oscar, a real legend! A former rally driver and a fellow biker, with a lot of interesting storys and a really nice guy. You will be at the right spot. Perfectly located to visit the famous death road and visiting the beautiful city of La Paz. Just call Oscar and you will be in good hands. his phone number is: +591-762 19905

name: Roxana’s Homemade Queso
description: We enjoyed each of Roxana’s fresh, aged and strong cheeses. We would highly recommend a visit to Roxana’s if you are missing scrumptious strong cheese. We haven’t found anything so good in the markets. She welcomes and makes travellers feel at home, sharing her internet, shower, bathroom and cooking with everyone.

name: Abondon Farm Camping
description:
There are a couple of old houses (ruins) which give some good wind protection. it's a little close to the street but nobody could see me and it was only 2 cars in 12 h. In the morning u get the sun shining on your tent which is a nice wake-up call. 
Many birds around. Without wind it's very quiet. 
The only downside of this place is the trash laying around.

name: Ciudad de Piedra Pumiri
description: Incredible rock formations, called city of stones pumiri. You can enter and explore the place, it's free, nobody charging, at least this time.

name: Visa Extension -Sucre
description:
This is where you can extend your visa and get an extension stamp in your passport.

Open 8:30-12:30, 2:30-6:30
Monday-Friday

You will need:
-A copy of your passport photo page
-A copy of your entry stamp into Bolivia 
-The address of where you are staying and date when you will leave Sucre.

We are Canadian and only got 30 days at the border. It took less than 10 minutes for 2 of us to get an additional 30 days stamped in our passport.

name: Next to the church
description:
You should spare one night to this place, in the morning you'll have a wonderful view of the mountains and in front of the road a lagoon with flamingos. Next to the village but peaceful. 

Você deve dormir pelo menos uma noite por aqui. Pela manhã a vista é espetacular, com as montanhas em volta e uma lago cheio de flamingos em frente. Fica próximo a vila mas é super tranquilo.

name: Hotel Amazonico
description: We left our van here while we went to the jungle for a few days. 10Bob per day. Also stayed in their room when we returned. Basic no fuss room with sufficient shower and comfy bed but we were so exhausted after sleeping on the jungle ground for a few days any bed might have been comfortable.

name: Su Salud! Vegetarian food
description:
only vegetarian an vegan food. big menu for 33 Bol
also possible to buy tofu and vegan ice cream

name: Wild spot with water
description: wild « grassy «  area next to the river with clean water. Need to filter to be drunk

name: Alojamiento local
description: Found this one signposted next to the road (blue sign). Very basic and friendly 40 bob accomodation. Plenty of space to leave bicycles in the little courtyard.

name: Gasoline and diesel
description: We checked the other two gasoline pins and neither had gas/there were no people. Locals directed us here. She only had 3 liters of petrol left but she had jeeeycans with diesel. 6 bol per liter of gasoline

name: Restaurant in Yellow Building
description: Small restaurant in yellow building opposite of hot springs. Served us scrambled eggs, bread, and Nescafé for breakfast. Pretty nice after a couple of days on the road!

name: Deep river Xing just northeast of Quetana Chico
description: There was a deep river crossing just northeast of Quetana Chico in mid-November 2023. We are on motorcycles and just about made it through but the water went over our front tires entirely. This river crossing seemed unavoidable if you’re driving west from Tupiza, as we were doing. Saw a 4x4 cross it seemingly easily. Failed to grab GPS coordinates when we crossed so the ones indicated here are just approximations.

name: Pizza&Pasta Matoni, Santa Cruz
description: delicious and big pizza, 100% italian. To recommend!

name: Futuro SRL - Pintados Industriales
description:
Remko Tas (Spanish/English/Dutch speaking), owner of this company has plenty room for (big) rigs. Welding services can be done at the site. And he can also help you with finding technical solutions/addresses. Site is situated close to the airport.
It is not an established campground, but you can also stay over for a of couple nights. The sanitary is very basic. Busstop on front of site; 2 bob to city centre.
Get in touch with him via WhatsApp: +591 71620319

name: Down in the Canyon
description:
Small pull-off from a side road that goes down into the main canyon. Awesome setting with view to volcano and birdwatching on the marsh right next to camp spot. Nice guy came by on a bicycle on his way to his fields in the morning and had a friendly chat. 

The portion of road that comes directly down into the canyon from the main road to the west is narrow and washed out and for a small 4x4 only.

name: Camiri  Hotel las Tinajitas
description: we were allowed to stay at the back parkinglot of the hotel. quiet, secure, may use the pool. They lock the gate during the night. 150bol/car and two of us incl breakfast

name: big flat and quiet spot
description: big spot, some 100m from the main road. Only few cars passing by in the evening, very quiet at nicht. Very few rubbish (at least as we were here) and no house at sight. Lots of lamas passing by in the morning. 4G Entel signal.

name: Hotel Petrolero
description: Nice clean hotel with fast wifi and friendly owners. It includes breakfast and they have ac as well. Paid 150bs for a matrimonial but it was worth it.

name: Utah
description:
Wow this area reminds us of Utah. Wide river valley, red cliffs, mountains in the distance. 

Small gravel pit affords a bit of wind protection. On the map it looks like it's on the main road, but the river crossing and road have been moved to the south, so it's quite a ways from the road.

name: Cañon del Inca
description: We stayed three nights right in front of the small recreational area at the entrance to the canyon. Very calm and scenic. Sometimes at night noise of wild dogs. You have to drive all the way down the gravel road that leads across Puerto del Diablo. There is a latrine available.

name: Carwash
description:
Really nice carwash with ramps. Can accomdate any size vehicle. Recommended by 4x4 guide in Tupiza, who said at other carwashes in town you are likely to "lose things" 

40 BOB for Undercarriage and exterior on Toyota pickup. Did a nice job. 

Really nice shaded seating area with tables and chairs too!

name: Tienda
description:
Small Tienda with food and drinks.
Its the only one i found in town, but it was a holiday and everything else was closed.
Owners are nice.

name: Water Tap next to the entrance of the Church
description:
Theres a Water Tap next to a dumpster.
I almost missed it. Local People used the Water and i did too.
The Water tap is 4-5m left of the gate when u enter the Church area.
Had no issues drinking the water the next days (filled 6L)

name: Swimming Pool camp
description:
A good spot away from the La Paz - Caranavi highway. Directed by locals to this swimming pool, lots of grassy space on the football field and a sheltered area with charging points too. Arrived on my bike but plenty of space for motos and campers too. Paid the guy working here B10 as a propina, he said overlanders have stayed here before. Was here on a Saturday but still quiet. River access too. 
To get here cross the bridge off the highway and carry on about 400m

name: Close to ghost village
description: Nice and flat place to stay for the night. It's very close to a small ghost village with a very nice church.

name: Water Tap infront of small military kitchen
description:
There are some Soldiers stationed in this little town, infront of their "House" is a small Tree with a water tap next to it.
Haven't tried the water taste. I only used it to wash myself and some other things after i crossed the flooded salar de coipasa (4-5 afternoons of rain left the salar with a 2-3cm waterlevel).

The Sergenat shared the soldiers lunch with me (Noodle soup) so u might get lucky as well :)

name: Tienda in Aqua Rica
description:
Theres a small Tienda with basic food and drinks.
 i only bought water and cola for the next days. very friendldy and interested people. seems like not many people come across here

name: Bridge over Rio Mauri
description:
There's a really long walking Bridge here.
I crossed it by bike which gave me some Indiana Jones Feeling. 
I would not cross it with a Motorbike (loaded), I already felt unsafe with my loaded Fatbike.

name: Taller mechanico La Solucion
description: Since Sem&Re did not have time for us, we ended up at this place. They helped us with our leeking steering nuckle (LC80). Known problem,so we had our own parts with us. Just needed a secure working spot with solid jack some tooling and cleaning possibilities. Probably good mechanics for the basics. At least friendly and helpful.

name: Salt mining
description: Random salt mining. Worth while a stop to see the process.

name: al lado del camino
description:
A beautiful place to camp on the side of the road, the landscapes are amazing and the river runs 30 meters down the cliff, there are no services or warehouses!
----------
un lugar hermoso para acampar al costado del camino, los paisajes alucinantes y el río corre 30 mt abajo por acantilado, no hay servicios ni almacenes!

name: Comedor sobre la ruta
description:
*we travel by bike* the dish costs 12 bs and the sandwich 8. The lady and the family are very friendly and travelers often stop here. Next to it runs a small stream with water from the beautiful hill to cool off after the tremendous climb coming from Villa Montes. He offered us a place to rest next door and drinking water. The food and views, exquisite!
---------
*viajamos en bici* el plato cuesta 12 bs y el sándwich 8. La señora y la familia son muy amables y suelen parar viajeros por acá. Al lado corre un arroyito con agua del cerro hermoso para refrescarse luego de la tremenda subida viniendo de Villa Montes. Nos ofreció lugar para descansar al lado y agua potable. La comida y las vistas, exquisitas!

name: al lado del camino y del rio
description:
Beautiful open place for free camping, between the mountain river and the road. Super quiet and with spectacular views
----------
Hermoso lugar abierto para acampar libre, entre el río de la montaña y el camino. Súper tranquilo y con vistas espectaculares

name: gas in tank
description:
Moderator note: Place deleted because it is in the wrong location.

Possibility of buying gasoline and diesel only in 20 liters tank in a tienda that sells stuffed potatoes and empeñadas.  Very nice, 140 bob for 20 liters

name: Corner shop that sells gasolina and diesel
description: They would only sell 20 litres at 7Bob. No room for negotiation. The lady tried to get her husband to reduce the price.

name: YPFB
description:
Gas station on the official ANH list that is supposed to sell to extranjeros. We paid international price and we were able to fill a jerry can as well. Short line for gasoline, long line for diesel.

(Bolivia currently has major fuel availability issues and many of the iOverlander fuel station tags are old and inaccurate. Each town only has 1-2 stations (only 40 stations in the entire country) that are legally obligated to sell to foreigners. The others won’t sell to you.)

name: Municipality room
description: Quiet town worh some basic small shops. If you ask to the municipality they will let you a room close to the (now under construction) market. Quite clean. In the municipality there is fast wifi. Password: ***passwords not allowed*** And a friendly cat.

name: Techo de chapa libre
description:
Tin roof without walls, it can be a good shelter from the rain for those traveling with a tent (Vans also fit) and 100 meters away there are some stalls that sell all kinds of groceries.

_______________________

Techo de chapa sin paredes, puede ser un buen resguardado de la lluvia para quien viaja con carpa (también entran Vans) y a 100 mt hay unos puestos que venden de todo comestibles.

name: Alojamiento Samarikuna
description: After reading the iOverlander comments for the other hotels in town, we tried here. Matrimonial 50pp with private bathroom, clean, quiet, "suicide" shower, but we couldn't get it hot. We put the bikes inside at the bottom of the stairwell.

name: Place to get tire fixed
description:
We couldn’t find the other person mentioned in the other tire repair pin so when we asked in town we were sent here to Don Luis.
He fixed the tire(we thought we had one hole but he found three more small holes in the same tire).
The shop is behind the “cozy bar “(shop with Tienda and Shop written on it in red).

name: Gasolina de casa
description: Small tienda with very good prices for gasoline. She did it for 5bs per liter.

name: Historic abondoned town
description: There is a small historic village here which is in quite good shape with almost no trash. The buildings don't have roofs anymore but perfect to pitch a tent in a house because you are guarded from the wind. Only accessible with bicycle or motorcycles!

name: hotel panturani
description: super simple and basic hotel. we payed 100 bobs for a matrimonial with private bath. super simple shower but hot. we ended up here because the other two options in town and ioverlander were closed! no wifi. we could storage our bikes in the restaurant (no service).

name: Lavadora with foam
description: Here they cleanes our motorcycles. They used foam which was necessary after Salar. They also used a high pressure washer but were careful with it. Paid 50bs for two bikes, she said 30bs for one bike

name: Polideportivo camp
description:
Village polideportivo, attached to local school. Villagers happy for me to camp here. Would be good options for motorbikes as well as cyclists. Also uncovered football pitch next to the covered space. Water available by the toilet blocked. Toilets locked. School starts at 7.30am. 
Village is all tranquilo for the night, friendly people.

name: Plaza
description: Nice and secure place to stay. Police station here

name: Flores Posada
description:
Posada under construction but there is a place for camping.
With water and energy. Bath under construction. They asked us 25bob per day.
Better contact Mr Flores before by number: 
72220502
Beside EcoLodge

name: LAJMA Village Center
description: Just at the village Center, few Meters from the Road. The local Police Said it‘s ok to Park for the night. No facilitéis. Some Stores around.

name: Guy to sell gasolina
description: Asking the villagers, they told me a door to call the gasoline. A man opened me and sold me 20l at 5bob/l. Really super nice and perfect before crossing the salar

name: Restaurante La Fortaleza
description: Very nice Restaurant with good food for a good price. The atmosphere is very nice and the owner is very friendly. We can highly recommend the restaurant

name: La Pizzeria
description:
Very good Pizza! Freshly made. 3 different sizes.
Grande 42 BOB 
Media   22 BOB
Personal 11 BOB
These prices apply to most of the pizzas. Some are a bit more.
There are only 2 or 3 tables inside but a few more outside on the street. However, traffic is bad and noisy.

name: East Colorado Road closed for Birds
description: Road on the east side of Colorado closed due to birds. We’re going to try going around the lake to the north.

name: Detour to Laguna Colorado from East Road
description: This is the start of the detour from the east easier road to Laguna Colorado. The other two roads on the map north of here are closed due to bird activity along with the road on the east side of the laguna.

name: abondon Village/mine
description:
plenty of building and walls to find cover from the wind. 
nice views on the Salar and mountains south. cool place to explore

name: old railcompany building
description: The former Chiguana train station is abandoned. one room inside is in okay condition to pitch a tent. it's a great windshelter. U might be able to pitch 2 or more tents.

name: fountain next to military base
description:
the water tank next to the rail roads was empty. but I found a fountain where u can get water through a bucket.
the water taste is good. the soldiers seem to use the water as well.

name: Camping Epifanio Flores
description: A brand new campsite with cabañas that was under construction in December 2023 we visited it. Since it was not officially opened we were invited by Enrique, the guardian of the place, with a voluntary fee. We paid 25 bolivianos for one night and we had a clean WC  (but with no doors), drinkable water to refill and a hot shower that was not connected yet. Very friendly people in a promising place for the future and very affordable at the moment, clean and well fenced. The two dogs are also very friendly. Right next to the beach of Titicaca (avenida Costanera) as you can see on the map.

name: Parqueo "MAGUI"
description: Great location in the centre of La Paz for 30Bob per day (no negotiation on longer duration). Hot showers, toilets, wifi and heaps of information - just need to ask the extremely engaging attendant. He lives to the rear of the parking lot. Get his WhatsApp if you want to get back later than 23:30.

name: Laguna Colorada
description: I asked the ranger at the National Park entrance where to camp and they sent me here. it's quite good wind protection at least from 2 sides. I spent 2 nights here and when the wind stops, it's much nicer. there is slow Entel service here and you can get water and snacks in the tienda. the stars at night are amazing. it's very quiet. there was nobody at the refugio in 2 days. maybe it's closed.

name: small building in the main square
description: small building in the main square close to the shop. it has two doors and two banches inside. it is open covered from the wind and warm. perfect for two persons.

name: nice camp for tent next to river
description: nice camp spot for several tents. pretty flat. also space to park the car (several and big rig too). cold at night, but sky is magical!

name: Lubricentro Jardin
description: Original oil changer shop. Top work. Friendly owner. Big Rigs specialist!!!!! open from monday to saturday from 8.00 to 12.00 and from 14.00 a 18.00

name: Plazuela Uriondo
description: Really nice, safe and quiet place to stay in Tarija. Next to everything. Water to fill the tank in the  park. Restaurants all around  for barhroom acces. Public bathrooms aswell nearby. Public showers in the tematic park 10/12 blocks appart.

name: Tyre repair 40 BoB
description: After the usual flat tyre, we went there following recommendations from locals. Ask 40 BoB, which seems fair to us, so we did not negotiate

name: Laguna Verde
description: A really nice lagoon and ‘campground’. A huge amount of fruit trees and little rivers everywhere and you are allowed to pick as much fruits (achachairu, bananas, avocado, Cacao, Pacay, coconuts…) as you want and eat it :) Also there is the Laguna Verde where you can go for a nice swim and rent some tubes tu just relax in the lake. There are also some ligs in the lake which are super fun. We payed 10Bol per person and 5Bol for the tube for one day. Really nice owner! Absolutely recommended:)

name: Mirador Laguna Vinto
description: We passed the point which is marked as Mirador on maps.me because no leveled spots there and went a little further to the end of the Laguna and found this little turnout, which was almost flat. Great views in the morning, Lamas came to drink water directly beside us, a big group of Flamingos also came very close. No other people here. No facilities but excellent Laguna-feeling! Only some tour-jeeps passed in the morning after 10am.

name: next to waterfalls
description: Theres a tunnel and a street passing beside the tunnel. There’s a lot of space to park for a night and super nice waterfalls to visit. Please leave no trash or toilet paper behind and help to keep this place clean and beautiful:)

name: Wiñay Inti Lodge
description: very good clean establishment, the manager came to pick us up at the port, a few steep stairs to arrive 15 minutes later at the hotel, room with a view of the lake very clean, hot water shower comfortable bed large terrace, very friendly owners we recommend, reservation  overnight per booking 60 USD

name: La Tipa Café Bistró.
description: Excellent organic and fresh bread with seeds, also a coffee, nice for breakfast, and they also rent bicycles.

name: Tienda LA VALENTINA (COCA Machucada Las DUQUES)
description: 20L bottles at the tiendas here, great for heading out of La Paz to Death Road. 20 BS per jug.

name: Pedro’s Shower and Sauna
description:
Next door to Big Deal Tours. Hot shower and sauna. Clean. Hot shower with a towel. Several private stalls. 

Pedro is a nice guy and he speaks English. 

We paid $15b each.

name: Hotel Comunal
description: You can have a hot shower in the Hotel .. 10bs pp but after a dusty day its definitely worth it .. we slept also in front of the hotel before going on the uturuncu next day

name: Virreyes Hotel
description: Great hotel. It is a colonial-style building, that has been renovated completely. Parking for our motorcycles in the parking under the hotel. High vehicles wpn't fit, regular cars should be okay. Fefinately recommend,  one of the cleanest places we stayed on our trip.

name: Peaje
description:
There is a toll/peaje here. 
5 bs for route to Trinidad. 

03/05/2024: 5 bs for route to San Borja

watch out: corrupt police right after peaje

name: Mercado Central
description: Anything and everything food related. Meats, fruits, vegetables etc and more. Open air market. Sit down and eat or take away. A great experience.

name: Queseria Suiza
description: restaurant offering Swiss specialties, adjacent to the cheese dairy. beautiful setting, beautiful menu, the food is very good. that changes a little after long months of travel…

name: Hotel Gran Poder
description: Nice Hotel with very friendly owners. We had dinner and breakfast here. We asked if it is possible to sleep in front of the door. It was a very quiet night, some traffic in the morning.

name: explanada en la montaña
