description:
Translation: The path is quite well marked and reaches a level cement esplanade about 50 meters from the route. The views are beautiful and at night you can see all the lighting of Tarija. We travel by bike but it is good for mobile homes, even large ones! Beautiful place and super quiet

El camino esta bastante bien marcado y llega a una explanada de cemento nivelada a unos 50 mts de la ruta. Las vistas son hermosas y en la noche se ve toda la iluminación de Tarija. Viajamos en bici pero va bien para casitas rodantes, incluso grandes! Hermoso lugar y súper tranquilo

name: Papote
description: Great sandwich place. Burgers are on the menu. The popote is the specialty. Think bbq brisket. A nice English speaking couple runs the restaurant. Highly recommend….

name: Cementerio
description: Super quiet place beside the cementery. There is water.

name: Huge plain parking
description: Beside the river and a school. Great place to park and stay. Super windy

name: Hidalgo Tours
description:
tour agency for salar excursion.
these are the right coördinates
a private tour almost $200  from 10 till 20 hour. incl good lunch and sunset drink. english spoken guide. very good, our guide Ariel was exellent,  recommended!

name: Servicio Tecnico Automotriz (Ford +)
description:
Mecanic with a lot of knowledge about Ford. Did a great job changing the break pads and spark plugs on our Ford E350 for 450 Bolivianos (+tip). A mecanic like this is hard to find. The sign says he also works on Dodge, Jeep, Chevrolet, Mitsubishi, Toyota, Nissan and Subaru. 
Contact Whatsapp: +591 63056850

name: Lavanda Fresh II
description: Reliable Laundry right on the plaza. I brought a big bag of awfully dirty laundry, picked it up the next day and payed 4000$.

name: Family Place
description:
Quiabaya. Casa Murillo. Basic and very nice homestay. We used the family bathroom. Hot shower. Nice clean dobble room. 40 BoB per person with safe parking place in the garden. For many motobikes. No breakfast. But they will offer it in the future. Old sweet dog ;) 
Lovely small town. Many restaurants and  minimarkets. 
Knok on the black door or ask at the nearby plaza.

name: Quiabaya
description: No problem to get fuel for our motobikes. But only with jerrycans. Local price. 4,5 Bob per Liter

name: Hostal Santa Laura
description:
Clean, basic Hostal. 140Bol dopple room with shared bathroom. No breakfast. No wifi. 
But nice garden. Quiet place. And big secure parking for cars and motobikes. They sell cold beer and water :)

name: Veterinaria San Thiago
description: Dr. Alfredo was excellent, he did the health certificate for our cat to cross into Argentina. The certificate costs 100 bolivianos now. You can contact him on WhatsApp +59178737634 before you go, to make sure he has the form (certificado zoosanitario). He mentioned sometimes he runs out of it and has to buy them again from Potosi. He gave us several recommendations for parasite meds for our cat.
Plenty of fuel. Very friendly National price. Also jerrycan.

name: Lubricantes
description: We could buy here gas by 6 BOB, no problem. We bought 40 liters from a nice girl

name: 4 Llamas Camp
description:
Great campsite. Flat with a beautiful view. Some wind late afternoon and into the evening but calm and nice after midnight. Spectacular morning sunrise. 

Has 3 bars of 3g and unlimited Starlink. 

Good hiking and rock hounding. 

Very quiet day and night. Saw 4 Llamas and nothing else.

name: Flamingo Central
description: A flat pullover that’s a great place to hang out and view flamingos. Calm winds early in the day make for a pleasant experience. No crowds at all. Had it all to ourselves. A perfect place to contemplate the vastness of Laguna Colorado.

name: No Fear Adventures - Death Road Bike Tour
description:
Best priced bike tour we could find, particularly for the dual/ full suspension - highly recommend paying the extra.
Guide spoke English and was knowledgeable on the area.

name: Next to RN6 on a small river
description: Coming from north, just after the bridge turn left. Ca. 1km dirt Track to a dead end road. Hidden from the street. Motorcycles, cycles and small rigs can easily enter. Very quiet and surrounded by trees. Very clean and some water. Flat ground and good for tents

name: gomeria
description:
The owner of the tire shop let me park on the side and gave me energy! He charged 70 Bob, expensive, but it saved me from the heat!

O dono da borracharia deixou estacionar do lado e me deu energia! Cobrou 70 Bob, caro mas me salvou do calor!

name: Llanteria
description:
llanteria, they were very quick in repairing a flat tire of our Ford F350SuperDuty! Very friendly, paid 40 BOB. 
There is no sign of the workshop, it is between "Freeland" shop and "Milestone"shop (they sell new tires). No phone number, but if necessary try to reach "Milestone" shop next door via Whatsapp +59171856840

name: Autopartes 'Lucho'
description: We were looking for new windshield wipers and drove past this place. A really nice older man was there and could help us right away, he also had a variety of wipers. It seems to be a well liked place also by locals. Definitely recommend when you are looking for some smaller car parts.

name: Airplane Graveyard
description: Eight former airliners sit behind a fence, rotting. Good for a ten minute stop for some photos.

name: Supermercado
description: This is a Supermercado and a small warehouse. You will find here al lot of things. One Restaurant nearby and parking is also for big rigs.

name: Gasolina - At House
description: Only place to fill up around here. Took us ages to find. Knock on door 15

name: Vidcla Seguridad Car glass
description:
produces and installs all kind of windshields, mirrors etc. Whatsapp before coming is recommended so they can check if they have it on stock. For our Ford F350 windshield it was a 2h service for 1300bs. highly recommended!
Whatsapp: +59177110742

name: Salt Hotel
description: we stayed in our camper at the salar. were allowed to use a clean and hot shower here, 20 bol per adult, 10 bol per child. nice service, friendly.

name: Mavi Hotel
description: Luxury but cheap hotel with big and safe parking lot, near the plaza of Mizque. Double rooms start at 160 BOB. Opened only in 2020, all rooms and facilities look still very new.

name: In front of the Titicacasee
description: Very nice place right on the lake. There are no facilities on site. But very nice in the evening and in the morning. It was very quiet. Nobody bothered us.

name: Almacen Mamani - sells gasolina
description: little shop, you need to ring thebell, someone will come to serve you. sells groceries, and household stuff, almuerzo and if you ask (!) they sell gasolina. bring your own can. 7 bol/l. very friendly! recommended

name: El super 8
description:
Nice hotel runs by a super cool family. As a bicycle traveller, it was a great place to park our bikes, moreover close to our room.
Double room with AC, queen bed size, private bathroom with hot shower, breakfast included 180 BS. 
There's some family rooms with many beds too. 2 patios. Good wifi. Close to city centre but not too busy.
Very pet friendly !

Would definitely recommend this place.

name: Wild camping river side
description: A place to camping wild side very small river

name: informal bivouac
description: Lahuachaca bivouac at the bottom of the village not far from the sports field, not glamorous but quiet apart from the dogs...

name: Great camping for all vehicles
description: Nice, flat area with good gravel road access off the main highway. Suitable for up to 5 big campers and multiple tent sites. We tented it and had all the locals drive by, honk and wave. Some stopped to take photos with us after we invited them. Great hilltop knoll for sunset hike. Peaceful and quiet. Alpaca herd nearby. One of the best options between Oruro and Potosí.

name: Very beautiful church in Urmiri
description: Very beautiful church in Urmiri.  Beautiful place for photos with old doors and gates.

name: Ferry across Rio Yata.
description:
short ferry over rio yata.
crosses regulary
price 20bob

name: Plaza chachuela esperanza
description: We spent one night with view over the river, felt safe, Entel has signal, quiet village, restaurants nearby

name: San Simon Soccer field
description:
There was a landslide on the main road, so, we had to find a place to spend the night. Take the intersection to San Simón, then drive until the cemetery and turn left, drive 300 mts and you will reach the soccer field..... so beautiful!! We woke up with a loud choir of birds. 
Beautiful spot, we were so lucky.

name: Alojamiento Gabrielita (Familia Eguez)
description:
Maybe 6 rooms with or without private bathroom. 
Very hot (metal roof), not clean at all.
But seems to be the only option at site. 
As we are travelling by bicycle with our dog, we couldn't drive 50 km more to find something else. 
The owner charged us 120BS for the room with bathroom.

name: Restaurant Camping Las Piedras
description:
Nice place to camp, under the shade of the trees, water, electricity and lights, tables, bbq, clean hot showers & WC. Wifi available at site !
25 BS pp
We travel by bike with our dog and the place was perfect ! 
Good restaurant too.

name: Ferry
description:
ferry leaves regulary, fit 3cars or 1 big truck 
for a landcruiser cost 50bol

name: M3 and M HOUSE
description: A place to camp, with spectacular views located in Sorata, Cohajoni community

name: Parroquia San Clemente
description: Nice and safe place. We spend three nights. Quiet from 8pm to 7am. Close to the old city.

name: Room behind family store
description: When you're on the main square of Chaquilla and have the UE Chaquilla in your back, on your right hand side there's a small shop it's a purple building. The abuela owning it doesn't speak much Spanish (mainly Quechua I suppose) but her grandchildren will help translate. They rented me a room for 25 bolivianos. It doesn't smell great but there's 3 beds, a toilet with running water and electricity. Decent Entel coverage. In the morning I got woken up by an impressive amount of flies

name: Centre de salud
description: Large space in front of the salud d’alota center. very quiet, no service, for any type of vehicle, free.

name: Oasis
description:
this place is nice to stay if you travel between san borja and santa rosa.
grassy area and some lagunas where u can see capis and more.
-big flat space
-animals 
-nice sunset and rise
- surrounded by palmtrees
-no rubbish, please keep it this way!!
-no traffic during night (because of ferry)
it's anyways worth the road if you like animals. For us coming from pantanal, was a bit similar, saw caymans, jabirus, coatis, kingfisher, tejus, tucans and other birds.

name: Banco Union
description: We easily obtained money with our Canadian debit card. Looks like there is a special outlet for foreign currency cards.

name: Camping el Kanguro
description:
Recent place opened 2 months ago.
Nice and clean infrastructures (showers, WC..) as everything is new.
Nice access to the hot river.

However, it's expensive for what you get. 50 BS pp / night. 

For me, the biggest bad point is there's no drinkable water at site, even for sell !!! You can get soda or beer but no water. As it is a bit far away from town, you have to organise your water. I use to filter water everywhere but was not sure about this thermal one (intestine issues ?)...
This place could be crowded by locals on Sunday. It was Tuesday for us, unfortunately loud music at night by owner and friends/customers close to our tent..

name: Alojamiento El Rodeo
description:
Basic and economical place to spend one night. 
Room with fan 50 BS pp / night. Shared bathroom. Just hot inside because of metal roof.
At least a nice patio & garden, safe place to park bicycles & motorbikes. Owner is friendly.

name: Mercado
description:
Mercado with tables to eat, typical Bolivian food. Great to find in between El Carmen.
Cheap and generous food (2 plates chicken / beef + 2 big lemonade 30 BS)

name: Alojamiento Don Mario
description:
Basic hostel, you enter in a corridor and there's some rooms.
Room with fan and share bathroom 100 BS (we were 2 pp), 170 BS with AC and private bathroom and hot shower.
Not the cleanest hotel I've ever been but at least, no busy, secure, we could have parked our bicycles in the room, pet friendly, wifi, and well situated to center.
Good one night stop before crossing the frontier with Brazil. 
Friendly owner.

name: HiperMaxi
description: Excellent selection of food and many other household items. Modern. Air-conditioned. Easy access off highway. Lots of parking space. It's very difficult to find a good supermarket in this part of the world.

name: Ciudad Italia Camp
description: Very quiet and reserved place to camp, not in the sight of cars that pass through. well protected from wind.

name: Soccer field in Rurrenabaque
description: Nice place to sleep. Close to the river and in a soccer field

name: Seguencoma B&B (with garage)
description: Big apartment with 3 bedrooms (with double beds), 2 full bathrooms and full kitchen, lounge, private secure garage, wifi

name: Mountain shelter
description:
Once you arrive at the laguna Chiar Khota, you can see a first shelter where you can stay. 
Keep walking on the path on the right of the Laguna and you can either camp outside, or sleep in the refugee which is few meters after. 
There is a kitchen with some ustensiles and a table and chairs.
The view is absolutely stunning !

name: Plaza Franz Tamayo
description:
Good spot to park a car/motorhome. Restaurant assured it was safe, and it felt like it. Decently quiet at night, but some of the usual noise in the morning.
Police said it was OK to park. Bathrooms closeby were closed, i found one the next morning at the bus station, 4minute walk.

name: between the thorn bushes
description: nice secluded place. silent at night, plenty of space for multiple vehicles. not sure about big rigs because the turn from the highway is quite narrow. follow the path to the cemetery and go left 100m before the cemetery. drive 200m further up the hill and pick a spot behind your favorite thorn bush.

name: Bienvenidos a Surima
description: As explained in a comment about the other place, the red building was closed/not receiving people when we got there. We asked around. At first we went to Daniela's place which is real luxurious (pool etc) but some kids started partying hard at 22h, felt like we where in a club. Luckily we had eaten here (red restaurant with red tables and chairs outside) and spoken to Patricia who told us she had a room for us. She is really lovely. Paid 30 bs pp, toilets no running water as in the rest or the village.

name: Hotel Granny
description:
Nice hotel with secure underground parking for cars and motorcycles. Not for big rigs.
Super comfy beds, nice breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, jam, fruits and cereals. You can eat as much as you want.
It's not really cheap, but with a bit of negotiation, I got a single room (with french bed/matrimonial) for 170 Bs. per night. Also it's perfectly clean and it has bathrooms with showers separated by sliding doors so the rest of the bathroom stays dry when you shower.
Given the location, the excellent parking situation and the quality of rooms and breakfast I can totally recommend this place.

name: TELPEL
description: First he said I could get the fuel only in a gas can, but for whatever reason when I opened the gas can and told him 2.4 litres, then he said he could fill up the tank directly. At the end I payed the local price.

name: Calle carandaiti
description:
I spent a night parked on this street, the night was very quiet, there are almost no vehicles.

The places say it's safe, there are more cars from the neighbors outside the houses.

Pase una noche estacionado en esta calle, fue muy tranquila la noche, casi no pasan vehículos. 

Los lugares dicen que es seguro, hay más autos de los vecinos afuera de las casas.

name: Au bon pain - Panaderia frances
description: Nice bakery. We loved the Croissants and the Baguette.

name: Residencial Urupe
description: Cheap hotel (single 40, with private bathroom 90) close to the Plaza. Che stayed here too, see picture. Old, simple, but clean and friendly staff.

name: Tupiza rail station
description: Just behind the train station, along the rio, and on the side of the small canal.

name: Caravanna
description:
CARAVANNA: new place in Cochambamba for all kind of motorhome, bikers and tents. Situated in Tiquipaya, 3 blocks from all the shops and restaurants. Huge market on Sundays of fresh vegetables, fruits and all kind of meat. Public transport (Trufi) nr 106 to the city center and to the famous market La Cancha. The place has electricity, water and good wifi.  There are WC and warm showers. Laundry service. 

Dogs are welcome but you have please to inform the owner Anna.  Anna is from America  and she speaks perfect English and Spanish. She is super helpful and friendly. Please contact her before coming here . 

ONLY WRITTEN MESSAGES to Anna : +591 77986543

Or contact Roxana ONLY in Spanish : +591 79962965.  

CHECK IN TIME ONLY TILL 19.00 hrs.

Disadvantages: too many dogs in the street. Sometimes it is SUPER LOUD with weddings and music from outside.

name: great tour guide ‘Jaguarsirius’
description: Micky is a super nice and funny guy from Rurre offering great tours to the jungle and pampas. we just love this guy and would recommend him to everyone who really wants to get to know nature here.

name: Laguna bravo
description:
Beautiful place to spend the night in nature, when the level of the lake goes down you can reach this area. Very quiet place, without human dangers.

Hermoso lugar para pernoctar en naturaleza, cuando el nivel del lago baja puedes llegar hasta esta zona. 

Lugar muy tranquilo, sin peligros humanos.

name: Quiet site with Flamingos
description:
Since the other place nearby might be to sandy, we decided to stay here. No Problem with 2 WD Campervan. 
Quiet day and night. Some friendly locals. 
Amazing nature, we loved it to watch those Flamingos and other birds around. 
A bit of Entel signal.

name: Tupiza Municipality
description: Good WiFi, in the town municipal building. The signal reaches the benches in front as well.

name: road to dinosaur footprints
description: this road is impassible at this moment, rainy season. muddy and slippery, impossible to keep your car on the road. you can drive up the mountain to the last hairpin but don't go further. also the straight part past the last hairpin till the top of the hill is extremely slippery. from the top it is 3km to the dinosaur tracks. i needed 4x4, low gear and diff lock to get out of the mud and not slide into the ditches when i drove back to Maragua. local tour guide with proper 4x4 didn't risk it either.

name: Discovery Colored Lagoons tour agency
description: We used this tour company for a day trip on the Salar. We did a private tour for the two of us and our dog. Was a positive experience and don't hesitate to recommend them, especially if you want a private tour. They picked us up at the train cemetery where we camped, and basically let us decide the itenirary for the day. Our driver only spoke Spanish, but they offer English drivers for an extra fee. Left at 10am and returned around 7pm. Had a private lunch in the middle of the Salar, and wine in the evening. Total cost was 800bob. They do offer group tours and multi day trips on the Laguna route also.

name: pizzeria bambini's
description: On the main square of Putana there's a small door next to the Entel main shop. The pizza's are quite good for Bolivian standards and it is really nice to have sth else than broaster chicken!

name: Jose's Bosque
description:
José, or Sepp, is a German that has been living over 30 years in Bolivia. He has a beautiful piece of land in the middle of the forest near Buena Vista with a huge amount of different plants and trees and monkeys and another animals coming by every day. We also saw puma prints and a video of it on the camera trap. Sepp knows a fair share about his forest and protects it every night from illegal hunters. He also does day and night tours on his huge properties. We saw different species of monkeys, tamandua, armadillos, tarantulas, etc. We also made our own chocolate with his cocoa plants. 
You can stay at his place in one of the guest bedrooms and share the bathroom and kitchen. All very clean and tidy, although he sometimes seems a bit chaotic.
It's ideal for travelers wanting to experience the forest and it's a very good alternative for those traveling on a budget compared to the big agencies. 
On the road there you have to cross a small bridge for max. 3.5 tons. But you can also get there by mototaxi (15 bob) or taxi (30 bob). And big trucks can be left in a save parking lot in Buena Vista.
There is also entel and tigo 4G signal. 

Just contact Sepp via WhatsApp on +591 74665999 he'll be more than happy to help. If you can't reach him ask at Queseria Suiza, the owners know him very well.

name: Gisselle Tours
description: Very professional 3-day tour in the salar and south. paid 750 B.s for 1 person. food was good and the drivers Jose and Airo were really friendly and great. Highly recommend.

name: SERVICRUZ - Best reliable mechanic safe neighbouroud
description:
We went to 6 different mecánico, we were looking for a serious but not to expensive and reliable mechanic, we are so happy we found this place. 
We did a lot of different stuff and left our van for a week there super friendly always keeping us to date.
really recommend this place, it's always very clean and they did a super job.

name: K'alaphurka Doña Mecha
description:
lovely restaurant, very modern design and serving traditional local cuisine, such as K'alaphurka - thick spicy corn soup, with a hot rock in the middle of the bowl that makes the whole dish pop like a volcano!
18 B.s, very tasty and plenty for 1 person.
according to Google Maps - closes at 15:00 everyday

name: ATM Banco Ecofuturo
description:
Mastercard accepted. No fee. Maximum unknown, but I withdrew 1000 bob.
I tried Fie, BNB, Santa Cruz. They all charge 7-8 dollars.

name: Hostel Residencial La Cabaña
description:
The cheapest place we found. Quite busy here. 35 bob per person in a dorm with shared bathrooms. Wifi is usable but not stable enough for working. It's cozy in general. We slept warm these days. There's a kitchen and warm showers.(Sometimes cold for me) 
Cash only. Close to the center, market and agencies.
Twin rooms and another type of rooms  are also available.
Parking on the street. It seems safe. No camping.

name: Ferrocarril
description: Not easy to find a place to stop on the N4. We slept one night at the edge of this small path not far from the road just on the other side of the railway. Take the earplugs. The road is not far! The train will not bother you much, the one that passes during the night will however make you feel like you are on the railway, so close it is. Shadow under the tree.

name: taller special Volkswagen de Don Marco
description:
This mechanics was recommended by a kombi's owner 300km far away from Oruro! Don Marco is
very kind and helpful, very professional. We had to do the motor (chambers of pistons, anneles, etc..), it spends more or less 20days because of strikes in the country and motor's pieces needed 10 days to arrive. For old and new car, especially Volkswagen, I recommand Don Marcos and his employee Jose, very kind too.

name: Cesare Hotel
description:
Very clean
Parking secured also for big rig.
With breakfast we paid for a doubble with privat bathroom 320 BOP.

name: Valle de la luna
description: Nice place to stay for a night at the entrance of the Valle de la Luna. Quiet. Not far from San Jose de Chiquitos.

name: Dona Lupe Hostel
description:
It is in Jirira just before entering the salt  lake.
On this side of the lake you cannot rinse your car.
The owner Dona Lupe is a very nice lady.
We camped here with our Toyota Landcruiser Motohome and could use the toilet. 
Rooms are rated at 50-100 BOP.
We had no time to take Photos of the rooms but our impression was a clean place.
She gave us here card with here contact details. 
She is on Facebook Hostal Doña Lupe.
Phone 60437992, 68311620, 63637918
Spanish only

name: desperation camp
description: it is an ok location for one night. we really needed a campsite after being kicked off the site on ruta 4 by the lovely local tribe chief. this place is better than the road side places on the route. it's quite far from the village so very quiet. difficult to completely hide your vehicle but if you arrive in the dark like us, no one is going to come from town to bother you. there are several spaces along the path, just pick any. don't follow Google instructions to reach the place. it will direct you to a blocked path. drive to the cemetery at the edge of town and continue from there on.

name: free WiFi from taller de motos
description: free WiFi from Taller de motos Alex, next to the gas station.

name: Museo comunitario
description:
This place belongs to señor Augustin who is an archeologist and artist. He runs this place as a museum for artifacts, shop with souvenirs, toilet but it's kind of a hub for a lot of informations about Tiwanacu culture. so if you don't mind staying at simple accommodation you'll get a ton of history, informations and if you will a great guide. Augustin lives here all his life and took part in many excavations around the region.
The place is very much DIY. There's place for a tent (10Bs), hot shower, toilet with a sit :), double room (50Bs), kitchen to use.
place with a character and somebody to talk to if you're into archeology :)

name: Aduana Nacional Bolivia
description:
Crossing from Bolivia to Chile by bus, I didn't get in this building. But there's free WiFi for the Bolivian exit registration. 
A long line starting before it's open at 8am. 
Restaurants, casa de Cambios, SIM card stands and baños nearby.

name: Aduana Bolivia
description: Access points are limited and easily to be full. Slow, but it's the only free WiFi we found.

name: Center Parking next to abandoned school.
description: Parked here for 4 days during Carnaval. Quiet at night, no forbidden to park signs, next to an abandoned school. Right at the center, perfect spot!

name: Dembol Rover
description: spare parts store for Land Rover and Deutz. Its owner Daniel is a Land Rover fan. very friendly and helpful and honest. Ask For Daniel

name: Plaza del Cementerio
description: We slept one night in here surrounded by trucks. We felt safe. There is a water tap in the gas station, not sure if it is drinkable, but we filled our tanks with it anyway for shower and washing dishes. There are several street markets around the plaza.

name: Delma’s polleria
description: Small polleria, dinner was 40 with Coca Cola. The lady will prepare breakfast in the morning if you ask. Hot tea with bread, butter and jam. Rice, chorizo, potatoes and veggies. Very nice lady!

name: Hotel Camana Inn
description: The owner of the hotel will give you bolivianos in cash, you can transfer him with VISA. 4% fee.

name: Plaza Alonzo de Ybañez o Plaza 6 de agosto
description:
Free wifi in the plaza. Quite fast, allowed us to do some videocalls and download movies. 
The name of the network is SUMAJ ORCKO

name: Center of Sahuiña
description:
We spent one night on the church square, in a quiet, flat location.
----------
Nous avons passé une nuit sur la place de l’église, au calme, emplacement plat.

name: Pradera
description:
Place to park and camp, quiet.

No noise from cars, dogs, people, etc.
----------
Sitio para parquear y acampar, tranquilo. 

Sin ruidos de autos, perros, personas, etc.

name: Checkpoint
description: They just want to see the drivers ID and where we are going. Seems important for them where exactly you go, because you’ll get a ticket and we payed 9,50 Bs.

name: Terra bike shop
description:
Taller de bicycles, Personal Bicycle Repair Studio, the owner speaks some English.
Address: La Plata 1460
WhatsApp Phone: +591 75715737

name: Secure parking lot near centre
description:
We stayed here two nights during the carnaval (its amazing) 
We asked if it was okay to put up our roof tent at the parking lot and they were fine with it. Because its a very busy parking lot during these days you have to leave your keys. Everything went well and we paid 120 bob for two days of secure parking including staying overnight. On the left is a toilet you can use.

name: Salar Uyuni
description:
Wild in the middle of the Uyuni salt flat, an incredible experience
---
Wild no meio do salar do Uyuni, experiência incrível

name: Orilla de río
description:
Riverside 100% wild, free. The road passes through a gravel deposit, which is why the entrance is closed with a chain in the afternoons (I think at 5:00 p.m.). It is closed on weekends, so we decided to go in on a Friday, spend the weekend on the river and leave on Monday. Nobody asked us anything. Some locals came to wash clothes, others to bathe, all very friendly.
---
Orilla del río 100% agreste, gratis. El camino pasa por un deposito de ripio por lo cual se cierra con una cadena la entrada en las tardes (creo que a las 17:00). Los fines de semana queda cerrado por lo cual nosotros decidimos entrar un viernes, pasar el fin de semana en el río y salir el lunes. Nadie nos preguntó nada. Algunos locales llegaron a lavar ropa, otros a bañarse, todos muy amistosos.

name: El Pueblito Hostel
description: New hostel with friendly & local owner, Sergio,  who speaks fluent English and Spanish. Pulled my motorcycle into the garage. Has space for about 4-5 more motorcycles. Residential neighborhood with street parking for vans/trucks. Full kitchen, free drinking water, dorm beds and private rooms. 50 Bolivians/night for the shared room. Hot shower. Good location 2 blocks to supermarket!

name: NATIVE SPANISH SCHOOL
description:
I went to Spanish lessons for more than 1 weeks and I can highly recommend this school. The teachers are very competent and friendly. I enjoyed the classes very much. Private lessons possible. 
Beware that one of the teachers comes late almost every day with excuses. The quality of the lessons are perfect, the class room and the organisation is rather unorganized.

name: Hostal Progreso
description:
Nice place. parking for several vehicles.
Great places to sleep and rest. Very quiet. 80 or 100 Bolivianos for a matrimonial room with shared shower and 120 Bolivianos for private shower. Wifi is working well. Hot shower

name: Hawa del Sur
description:
The place to reload your oxygen bottle
Cel 68704864 even on WhatsApp

name: Laguna Chalviri Lonely Spot
description: This is a lovely lonely spot at the Laguna with lots of flamingos and vicunas around. The color of the lagoon in the evening sun is beautiful. No wind cover, but the wind died down around 10 pm.

name: Dry even during rain season
description: We parked here next to the road to the mines. In February, it was muddy everywhere, and it was very hard to find some place which is not muddy. This one was the only one we found in this area. Next to the road, but not much traffic. We had a quiet night.

name: My Spanish School
description: Here is the place where Mirian, an excellent Spanish teacher, gives you privat lessons. Here WhatsApp Number is: +59172899948. She does a very good job and I can recommend her.

name: Espacio libre
description:
Leaving Tarija 15 minutes away is this very safe and quiet area, perfect for spending the night and sleeping inside your car or putting a tent.

Silent with no vehicles passing by.

Saliendo de Tarija a 15 minutos se encuentra esta zona muy segura y tranquilo, Perfecto para pernoctar y dormir adentro de tu auto o poner tienda de campaña. 

Silencioso sin vehículos pasando.

name: Abandoned restaurant, Nice view
description: Very nice spot, You can see snow Montain and the lake Titikaka, a beutiful sunrise. it's a little dirty, but it is a good spot, before or after La Paz

name: Lavanderia de ropa auto servicio J&R
description:
Self-service laundry place, the only one we found in Cochabamba that worked on saturdays until late and sundays too. 
You can do it yourself but you can also ask the guy in there to move the clothes from the washing machine to the dryer too. 
S:20bobs M:25bobs and B:30bobs
Dryer for 15bobs

name: on top of the world
description: beautiful spot with breathtaking view over the mountains next to la paz. the way up here can be challenging (especially if it’s raining a lot) but the view will be worth it. no 4x4 needed :) to get to the spot you habe to drive a few meters on grass. if you’re not willing to do it there is an other nice spot on the hill (but there is some toiletpaper) please keep nature as beautiful as it is and take your trash and toilet paper with you

name: Orilla del Río
description:
Quiet and safe place, we slept one night on the bank of the River, it can be accessed from the road to the river.------------

Lugar tranquilo y seguro, dormimos una noche a la orilla del Río, se puede accesar desde la carretera hasta el río.

name: Inca trail wild camp
description: Accessible by foot only. Relatively flat grassy area to put your tent if you hike the camino Inca in two days. You can acces the river from here.

name: Petrol station
description: A good quiet place to spent dla few night. Toilets open 24/7, much cleaner that toilets in the next station. Kind staff. next to the station there is a space for about 4 buses/tracks.  see photos

name: Landhaus El Fuerte
description:
The owner, Bolivian/German, Sergio let us use showers, bathroom and refill 60l with potable water for free. The showers are fantastic!!
we didn't spend the day but stayed for lunch (which we obviously paid).
a beautiful place

name: Estacion de servicios Los Bibosis
description:
A good place to sleep among trucks. not too noisy even though it's just of the main road.
Toilets and showers avarage but ok for free opened 24/7. We didn't refill so not sure how much they charge. Kind employees.

name: Good showers at the petrol station
description:
Good showers at the petrol station. for free, open 24/7
not the cleanest but spacious. shared. Good water pressure. refreshing in the heat!

name: David Chávez's house
description:
David is a nice 57y.o man who kindly invited us to his property. he has got a huge terrain with cows, horses and dogs. with lots of trees. he is happy to welcome travellers once in a time.
you can park anywhere, there is lots of shade. 
you can use the washing machine and kitchen if you share lunch/dinner with him (sometimes you cook sometimes he)

he respects your privacy and space, if you tell him you need to work he doesn't interrupt  you. 

he has got 3 dogs, two very old and chilled, one a bit dangerous but he keeps him on the leach if people are there. we have a dog and spent a week there and all was ok.

the road to him.from Portachuelo (about 20 mins ride) is a bit challenging when crossing the river. if there is too much water it's not possible to cross. if it's dry then it's fairly easy even for our 2WD sprinter van. 

David is very kind and lots of wild animals are seen there.

make sure to visit AFASI foundation which takes care of wild animals which had been victims of illegal smuggling. it's just 15km south from David. it's a great day visit!

name: AFASI Foundation
description:
AFASI foundation is an amazing place which takes care of wild animals which had been victims of illegal smuggling and domestication. 
They are always happy for visitors who pay 25bol entry fee to gain some financial aid for the place. 
it's not really a tourists attraction, you can't buy any food or drinks there (even though they offer you a lemonade to drink). it's not set up for tourists really but it's so worth visiting! 

It's is runned by a Swiss-Bolivian couple. they have parrots, toucans, pumas, wild cats, lots of monkeys. the enclosures are big and they continue on enlarging the cages. 

you get to learn a lot there, also about the sad reality why these animals can't life in freedom anymore. 

!!Just don't follow Google maps indications on how to get there unless you have 4x4!! also, even though they do receive visitors, they do not have a reception, so just let them know you are on the way and they send you the best indications on how to arrive depending from which side you are coming!!

Urs's (the owner's) number is
 +591 68910745

https://www.afasi.org/

Watch on YouTube "Afasi documentrary January 2024"

name: potable water at the petrol station
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User does not mention water is potable. Use caution.

Potable water at the gas station. they let us refill our 60l tank. accesible for big motorhomes.

name: ES Muyurina
description:
Lots of space behind the petrol station for several track to sleep. quiet and safe. 
outside shower but didn't have water.
toilets dirty

name: Laguna Las Conchas/Azul
description:
in the map the laguna is called "de las conchas" but the locals call it "laguna azul" 
when going north on route 9, passing by Santa Maria, about 3km after you see a white sign on the left side of the route "Comunidad San Pedro", enter and followed the gravel road for about 7km until you reach the only car access to the laguna. 
it's safe and quiet (only lots of noise from animals :) ) and clean.
laguna not transparent but clean enough to take a bath. it's not deep though. 
entel internet barely working. 

we spent 2 nights. lot's of mosquitos!!!!! but we did just fine with a repellent and a spiral. then they didn't bother us. 

if it's raining a lot the road can be a challenge for no 4x4 vehicles.

name: Potable water at gas station Oasis
description: a tap with a long host on the side of the station, easy park to refill, not blocking the way. they gave us permission to refill.with no issue. water is good, potable

name: Petrol Station ES Rio Maniquí
description: Great place to spend the night. lots of space to park. clean bathrooms and showers 24/7. very kind staff. water not potable!

name: Puente Tirina
description:
Fantastic place on the road to Sucre.
Flat gravel pit next to the river but high enough in case if heavy rain. Trees for shade. No trafic at night. 
on the other side of the road are some grassy spots to pitch tents.
Very nice locals came to say Hi in the early morning.

name: Welding/ soudure
description:
The most known welder in town. Excellent work, fast and cheap. The place is so clean and organized . 
Very good adress - le soudeur le plus connu à Tupiza- . Excellent travail

name: Mermelada Artesanal
description: Irene makes super tasty homemade jam. Great flavors like kiwi, papaya-maracuya or orange... The jams can be tasted in advance. Highly recommended. She sells more or less out of her living room, if the door is closed just ring the bell.

name: Toll booth
description: Here there's someone holding up the rope and you need to show/buy your toll ticket. The locals all seem to donate something, but as the use wasn't explained we did not

name: Almost at the lake
description: Unfortunately the streets to the lake/swimming pools were in a really bad condition, so we weren't able to go there with our van. We now parked the van near the entry gate of the lake. Cars and low vans can enter through, but we are too high for this. However, the spot we now found is underneath some trees (yes shade!) and it's quiet during the evening, just some motorcycles passing by.

name: Garage selling diesel
description: We were sent to this place where we could fill our tank and bidon from their big bidón for 5 Bol/liter.

name: Taller de artesanía Expedito
description:
Here you can enjoy a woodcraftmenship workshop lead by Roberto Añez.
He makes various pieces of beautiful wood craftsmanship and he is willing to learn you as well! We created a replication of our Camper and a memory to never forget!
Can very much recommend this place.

You can find the place at Epeditos Eventos sign.

You can reach out to Roberto +591 78 155 33 5. Making a reservation is not required, but if you like to be certain he is here it can be helpful.

name: Mirador Illimani
description: Breathtaking views, to the left the Illimani and to the right you can see El Valle de Las Animas from the top and La Paz at the back of it. If you continue going up the views will get better and better.

name: Valle de las Animas
description: It could be both, the start or the end of Valle de las Animas trek. In our case it was the end of it, just follow the riverbed down until you arrive where all the microbuses are. This is another stunning view because you get to see the formations from the bottom.

name: El Momentito
description: Great place to stay at the night. Distant from the RN1.

name: In frontal the Lake
description:
We stayed at this point, but you can go further ahead because this entire part of the coast is very quiet.  We liked it here because Mr. Daniel who has a hostel provides hot showers for 15 bol and you can negotiate, he also offers parking if you want to go out to the Sun and Moon Island and leave the motorhome safer.  We stayed several days.  On weekends there are always more people but in general very quiet.
------
Nos ubicamos en este punto, pero te puedes hacer más adelante porque toda esta parte de la costanera es muy tranquila. Acá nos gustó porque el señor Daniel que tienen un hostal facilita duchas caliente a 15 bol y puedes negociar, también ofrece parqueadero si quieres salir a la isal del Sol y la luna y dejar el motorhome más seguro. Nos quedamos varios días. Fines de semana siempre hay más gente pero en general muy tranquilo.

name: Plaza Principal Chua Cocani
description:
After passing the ferry we stopped here to spend the night.  We really liked the place because it is very quiet, the street is very wide and there is water to supply the tanks and bathrooms that can be provided at the health center or the municipality.
-------
Luego de pasar el ferry paramos acá para pasar la noche. Nos gustó mucho el lugar porque es muy tranquilo la calle es muy amplia y hay agua para abastecer los tanques y baños que pueden facilitarte en el centro de salud o la municipalidad.

name: Taller Electromecanico Euro Trucks
description:
A good technicien all sort of trucks. 
We had engine problems and Richard solved it in a few days with new VW parts from La Paz. We travel with a MAN TGM 13.290

name: Awesome Handcraft Market
description: In this street there are several Handcraft Markets on Saturdays and Sundays every week! Ask for the leather stall from Robert and Nayra. Nayra learned the leather handcraft in Germany and makes unbelievable leather Bags for a good price!

name: Surtidor El Arroyo
description: After 10 gas stations in Santa Cruz not willing to sell to foreigners without PIN, we found this one. We were able to fill up directly in to the tank for local price. Left a tip.

name: Barro Biking tour operator
description:
We did two tours with this company: 
1. Huayna Potosí: we booked it through the company but here I let you the guide’s number as if you contact with him directly it’ll be cheaper. He’s a really nice and experienced guide and made unique our experience. 
Fabricio +591 (7) 157-3531 
They let you all the material needed: piolet, grampons, clothes, sleeping bags, backpacks… but I’d advice you to take your own bag with you as the ones they have they’re a bit old and they don’t have rain cover. 
2. Death road: really nice experience, totally recommended, guides are really friendly and even if it’s long it’s all down so perfectly doable for anyone.

name: Hostal Sajama
description:
Eliseo, the owner of the hostal, is a tour guide. He took us, with his 4x4, for a nice 4h tour to the volcan, the forest and the geysers.
very nice and friendly, safe driving offload.
His phone: +591 71509185
We didn't stay at the hostal but had a nice lunch there.

name: Churrasqueria el Rodeo
description:
Excellent restaurant to eat, great variety of good quality meats, excellent service and Álvaro, the owner, took great care of you.  They accept credit and debit cards.

Excelente restaurante para comer, gran variedad de carnes de buena calidad, excelente servicio y Álvaro su dueño lo atendie muy bien. Reciben tarjetas de crédito y débito.

name: Public Shower at Full Adventure
description: Public shower, 15 bols, no time limit, , good condition, nice people

name: Vizcacha rock
description:
Here you will find picnic tables bordering a rocky formation all in hollow, holes and cracks, very pretty. In these rocks you will have the chance to see vizcachas, a small animal reminiscent of a cross between a rabbit and a squirrel. There are also a lot of little mice. We spent the night there. The towers stop at this point.

ici vous trouverez des tables de pic nique bordant une formation rocheuse toute en creux, trous et fissures, très jolie. dans ces roches vous aurez la chance de voir de près des vizcachas, petit animal rappelant un croisement entre un lapin et un écureuil. il y a aussi énormément de petites souris. nous avons passé la nuit là. les tours s’arrête à ce point.

name: Surtidor Campero
description: Let me fill my motorbike up with out paper work twice.

name: Potatoes fields forever
description: Flat platform one km from the main road. Easy access. Visible at 360 degrees but what  is the problem! Nice view over the fields. Quiet.

name: Ferretería Fernandes sells gasoline
description: Just ask in the Ferretería Fernandes to get fuel. We paid 6 Bolivianos per liter and were happy to get fuel this easy :) We could buy as much as we wanted.

name: Port de Tiquina
description: Just go and ask the guys on the boats, they will take you to the other side for 40bolivianos

name: Next to the zoo
description: Good place to sleep, just next to the zoo fence, on a big area. No facilities, except good Tigo reception. 50m off the street, but not too much noise. Close of the Valley of the moon

name: Iglesia San Cristobal
description:
To the left of the church there is a large gravel area where you can park. we spent 3 days there without being disturbed. it’s close to the market and the center which is just on the other side of the church. at the square near the church there are water taps where we filled up.
----------
à gauche de l’église il y a une grande surface en gravier où vous pouvez stationner. nous y avons passé 3 jours sans être dérangés. c’est proche du marché et du centre qui est juste de l’autre côté de l’église. au niveau de la place proche de l’église il y a des robinets d’eau où nous avons fait le plein.

name: Lavaya
description: Good service. In one day ready. 14 Bob per kilo

name: Stone fields forever
description: On the side of the dirt road, you can park. Not far from the main road and easy access. Just take your ear plug as there is traffic in the main road even in the night. Very nice view over the fields.

name: Migración Regional Uyuni
description: We were sent here to get our visas (US Citizens) after the Ollague border didn’t have the right visas. Second floor, Monday to Friday 8:30-12:30 and 15:00-18:30. Hard to find, wouldn’t have found it but for the officer expecting us and waving out the window.

name: On the old railroad
description: From Sucre, 16 km before Tarabuco, turn right onto an old train track. After 50 meters you are completely out of sight of the road. Internet 3G. Very quiet night and beautiful view.

name: Playa Blanca
description:
There is a “parqueo gratis” before this point but we didn’t like the entrance to it nor the spot so we just parked in here, better terrain and views. Nobody told us anything and the kids of the village were happy to have us in here.
Quiet night, just some dogs barking.
We also parked in here and went walking to Playa Blanca (2bolivianos the entrance pp and you have to leave at 6pm). 
There are no facilities, not even trashcans.
The path from Copacabana to here totally doable with a 2WD.

name: In front of Lago Titicaca
description:
We slept in here for 3 days, quiet and safe. We even left the motorhome alone while we were running errands through Copcabana. Even if it’s in the touristic center it is quiet and calm and there are great views. 
There is a water tap outside the hotel estelar, just ask permisson and they’ll let you fill your water tank. There are baños publicos at the end of the road, have to pay some bolivianos.
There is enough space for big rigs. We have been three motorhomes T the same time

name: Hostal Tierra de Mendez
description:
This is the best hotel/hostel in San Lorenzo, that was operating at that moment! The prize is fair, simple kitchen, hot water with good pressure, huge dining or chill out area with sofa. 
You may have to clean yourself a bit, as the cleaning lady is useless and the owner does only sometimes care about the cleaning. Most likely you can be alone in the big hostel, as people usually do not overnight in San Lorenzo 
(for whatever reason!?!?).
It is closed to nature and much quieter than the city. 
Though there is a mainroad in front that can be busy at certain hours, but not too bad.

name: Flat spot in front of the mountain
description:
Here is a flat field next to the road, qlong the old dirt road. 
Easy pull of for all type of vehicles. 
No wind shelter but there is grass to put a tent. 

The view of the Cerro Chorolque is incredible and the sunset too. 

No signal with Tigo

name: Plaza Josefina Goytia
description: Small parking area right on the street and next to a park. We had a quiet night and the area seems safe. There is some minimal noise from the highway (anillo) during the day but not a big deal. There is one spot by the northwest sidewalk of the park (on Teniente Parada Street) where you can get some refreshing shadow and less traffic. No facilities at all.

name: Park Entrence
description: The cost per person is 150 bolivianos, we can paid with euros because we don't have bolivianos

name: Camping Futuro SRL
description:
Remko Tas is the owner of the company and has plenty of room to camp, from tents to big rigs. There are places in the shadow; under trees or below one of the shelters.

Remko is very friendly and speaks Spanish, English and Dutch. He can help you to arrange things for the motorhome if needed. Also, welding services can be done here.

For camping the sanitary is very basic: toilet and a cold shower. There is a picnic table available where you can chill. 

We stayed a week and it was a lovely quiet stay.

He also has one cabaña that can be rented from May onwards, with bedroom, kitchen,  bathroom and airconditioning!

There runs a bus to the city center which stops in front, costs 2bs. 

Camping: 70bs per night / per camper
Cabaña: 250 bs per night

Remko's phone number is: +591 71620319

name: restaurant
description: Great little restaurant in the middle of nowhere. great menu del día really tasty and friendly owners. very clean toilet!!!

name: Pigas fuel station
description: Filled into the tank without any questions for 3.72 bs. Very friendly.

name: A punto grupo automotriz
description:
General mechanics
Electricity
Painting
Specialists in 4x4
Luis is in charge and has a price for travelers.

+591 68921944

Mecánica general 

Electricididad

Pintura 

Especialistas en 4x4 

Luis es el encargado y tiene precio para los viajeros 

+591 68921944

name: Hostel Avaroa
description: This place is a Hostel (bedroom for 50bs per person, shared bathroom toilets and kitchen) and have a huge swimming pool. It’s also a casa de Ciclistas, you can camp in the patio of the swimming pull and use kitchen shower toilets, WiFi and pool for 30bs. Milton is a cyclist and can give you tips for the road.

name: In the descent to Sucré
description: Possibility to park on a level place for big rigs. Next to the road, but very quiet during the night. Felt very safe because we didn't see anybody. No amenities. Claro 4G good.

name: Military base
description: We asked to fill up potable water at the military base after they checked our passeport (we took about 10L). nice kids!

name: Water next to comedor
description: We didn't check but the intendant of the eco lodge flamingos at the other side of the lagunas told us we could find potable water here next to the comedor.

name: Big Deal Tours - Mines of Potosi
description:
We did a Tour with Pedro to the Mines. He and his brothers are miners himselfe. He speaks perfect English and is very motivated to give you a inside view to the life in the Mines and in Potosi. We paid 150bol for the tour. After the tour we had beers and dinner together. Would definitely do it again. Was nice to talk after the tour. We stayed with the car two night in the backyard of the office and were allowed to use shower and bathroom. Great experience!! 

contact: +591 71835516

name: Real Toyota Garage! Official toyosa
description: Is the only place in the city, (or country) for Toyota, where they really have an idea what they're doing. for service, spare parts and what else you need. they have lifts, and work, only mecanic that looks like in europe. we made a small service on our hzj78 landcruiser, liquids and greases. and they're really frirndly, helpful, uncomplicated and fast. totally recommended

name: Great spot in the river bed
description:
Beautiful, quiet and comfy spot in the middle of the river bed.
You access it by a dirt road that goes out the main road. Only ok for 4wd!!
I guess all the river bed might be under water in rainy season. In dry season some water runs in the river (I was in the end of March)

There is plenty of flat space for campervan.

name: Nice spot along the river
description: Good spot where you can almost not be seen from the road. Clean water runs in the river. Only accessible on foot or with 4wd.

name: Caffecio restaurant - WiFi
description: Super good restaurant, really cheap and cosy place. There's wifi too. The burger is 18 bob with fries. Pastries are very nice too. Wifi password : caffe6312

name: Free thermas
description:
Free Thermals ! There are multiple pools ranging from small to large and cold to hotter. This GPS pin leads to a cute one, it fits three and it's a nice 35c.
How to get here; If you enter the little town of Chiquilla (if I spell correct) follow the main road across the square, and follow the long dirt road alongside the Laguna. you'll go uphill after, enter another village, turn right before, and you'll see a sign "Thermas 1KM" and just go in there. Road is a good dirtroad, no need for 4wd or high clearance, enjoy!

name: Car Wash - Lavadero
description:
Thorough car wash of our sprinter van. 40 min, high pressure and foam. 50 bolivianos.
We also filled our water tank.

name: Club Volkswagen Oruro
description:
We spent a night where Omar was a super and friendly host, he took us to see the central part of the city, he took us to try the typical dishes of Oruro.  You can park your car next to his house/workshop and the night is quiet and safe.  Before arriving, contact him +591 77159789.

Pasamos una noche donde Omar fue un super anfitrión y amable, nos llevo a conocer la parte céntrica de la ciudad, nos llevo a probar los platos típicos de Oruro. Puedes parquear tu carro al lado de su casa / taller y la noche es tranquila y segura. Antes de llegar comunicate con él +591 77159789.

name: salar entrance
description: very Nice option if You can't go in to the salar (too much water on rainy seasson) the sunrise was beautiful with Nice mirrors on the water. You can Rent boots here for 10b and walk in to the salar.

name: Nice camping spot close to a river
description:
Just below the dirt road there is a flat area, 30m from the river (clean natural water).
Great view.
No one uses this dirt road. Super quiet.

name: Checkpoint with aduana, police and toll.
description: Our number plate was checked by the aduana. Police let us pass without further check.

name: Yuraventura
description:
Yuraventura, a family run adventure park who offers tree climbing, ziplining and River Rafting. If you book the full day (200 Bolivianos, all included) you also get a free lunch, which is freshly homemade!
They have a Restaurant and artesanal beer. 
Showers, toilets and power outlet (to charge phone, not to plug in your vehicle) available.
Right at the time we were there, they offered a fruit tour in their huge backyard, where Josué Jr. told us a lot about the different fruits, and we got to taste and even take some fresh fruits with us!
We would definitely recommend visiting this place; as an overlander you might also sleep there, which we did - just ask. We paid 10 Bolivianos per person to stay overnight.

name: El Nido del Flamenco
description:
Ana is very nice, and we could store our campervan here securely inside the gate without issues. There is indeed only space for 2 or 3 campers, but she can make extra space on the main alley.
The max with of the gate is 320cm, so you will most likely fit without issues.
Payment is based on tip, we have given 30 BOL per day, and she was happy. Very fast WiFi that reaches to both parking places and you can take water if you like. Can recommend!

name: Beautiful view on the 3 volcanos
description:
Here is a flat place to sleep with a beautiful view on the three volcanos. 
The owner of the estancia came to see us and said it was ok to sleep here. 
There are many lamas around. (He owns more than 350 lamas). 

Very nice sunset, sunrise and starry sky. 

Entel and Tigo signal

name: River crossing on the road to the thermas
description:
Big river crossing on the road to the thermas
Approximatively 30 centimeters depth and Arena. need 4*4

name: Collapsed Road
description: The road has collapsed, probably due to heavy rain not far beyond the public baths. Bicycles and motorbikes can pass but cars and campers no way. We parked by the collapsed road for the night.

name: Great and beautiful spot for a tent
description:
20 meters from the dirt road (there passes almost no car), there's a flat area of grass. No access for cars.
Gorgeous view on the mountains. Not any noise.
There's no river so you have to carry the water you need from Maragua.

name: Electricidad Automotriz Alex
description: Electric and electronic workshop for vehicles. They have instruments and scanner

name: tuercas fuertes
description:
Mechanic specialist in Suzuki. We repaired the steering pump and steering box + did the timing of the engine and they did a good job for an honest price.
 Phone number: +591 78622927
They're close at lunch time between 12:30pm to 2pm.

name: Cacapi Albergue El Rosal Dn PRIMO
description: There are mass camps, dinner and breakfast if you walk Takesi Trail. Or you can pitch your tent. Simple but ok with a nice view. No road to here! WhatsApp number +59174056358, also on Facebook

name: Quiet place next to the river
description: You can drive to the river by car. During the day there are people bathing. it is quiet at night. the water is clear. I was there for two nights with my tent and motorbike.

name: Wild spot in a field on top of the mountain
description:
Accessible only with 4wd or by foot. 
Plenty of space to camp, the only thing is that it will be hard for 4wd to find a flat area. It is rocky but I could quite put my tent easily. You hear the road but cars almost don't see you because you're far and higher. The views are super nice. 
No water.

name: Mizque
description:
Public stack in the middle of the main square of Mizque, in front of the cathedral
--
Pila pública en plena plaza principal de Mizque, frente a la catedral

name: Ducha Mizque
description:
Toilet for 1bs. and Showers for 5bs 15 min, a clean place
--
Baño por 1bs. y Duchas por 5bs 15 min, un lugar limpio

name: El escondite, gracias al jehova
description:
Beautiful campsite next to a very clean and clear river, perfect for swimming and fishing. We got the address from a bolivian friend of ours. The name might be confusing, but the owners are not witnesses of Jehova but very welcoming and helpful Bolivians.
There is space for camping, they also provide basic rooms, clean toilets, hot shower, outdoor kitchen.
There’s a playground for kids and outdoor grilling possibilities.
We stayed with our rooftop tent for one night for 50 Bolivianos and had a really lovely time with the owners.
There are beautiful hiking possibilities as well.

name: TB Tierras Bajas SRL
description:
Friendly worker couldn't fill our tank because of missing system for foreigners, but brought up the idea of filling jerry cans, which he did at a local price.
very friendly and helpful!!

name: Fatimas place
description:
Fatima is a wonderful, friendly helpful german speaking bolivian lady. She organised a tour for us and let us stay in front of her house in a fenced area. Please make sure to contact her in advance via whatsapp
Fatima: +59168354508

name: Under the bridge
description: Under the bridge, covered from the rain and the road and with a beautiful view. No facilites in the river bed. Safe and calm, almost no traffic at night. You can go down to the river but it’s very muddy.

name: Cristian's Welding Shop
description:
Cristian is a welder and can do any metal works for you. He works very professionally. we got some fixings on our roof done. he speaks only Spanish. Marcos from Las Lomas gave us his contact and he can also help you with translations, if needed. 

His phone number is: +591 79142193

name: In front of cemetery
description:
a calm and quiet night to make the border the next day.
---
uma noite calma e tranquila para fazer a fronteira no outro dia.

name: YPFB El Oasis
description: After talking to maybe the manager, they filled directly in our tank for the local price. we could even go in front of all the motos waiting. friendly workers!

name: Quite spot next to Village-Antenna
description: This is a nice free spot next to the guides office. Right next to the cell antenna. Village in walking distance and some nice dog protecting the car. Some people walking by in the morning but other then that very quite. we stayed 3 nights. We likes it better then the guides office, because less people here. Phone signal 10/10 ;)

name: grassy riverside
description:
Nice level place to pitch a tent or park your van. 
Only partly hidden from the road but didn't bother us. easily accessible but very calm on a sat night

name: Watch for Pedestrian Day
description: We were stopped by the police at this point and  we had to wait several hours parked here because in Oruro there is a law that prohibits all kind of car transit the Sunday before April’s 12th (children day) from 6:00 to 18:00. It is called “día del peatón” (Pedestrian day) and it applies to the whole city. I bet the city is nice this day but there are no buses or taxis to get close to downtown.

name: Centro comunitário Originário
description:
It's a community centre, they'll give you a roof over your head to sleep on.

Es un centro comunitario, te darán un techo sobre tu cabeza para dormir.

name: Small restaurant
description: just off the square. I think it's the same place but mentioned as a hostel. It is definitely a restaurant.  Today is sunny so tables have been set up in the courtyard.  soup with a choice of mains, 20 bol for 2 people.  soup very tasty main heavy on the carbs. we didn't ask about rooms

name: Pull off the dirt road in front of the lake
description: If you camp on the parking lot, you'll not have the view on the volcano, which would be a shame at sunset, but if you take the dirt road and go down 150 m, you'll find a flat space on the hard sand. From here, you have an incredible view on all volcanoes and the sunset is amazing. No signal from entel nor Tigo, and no flamingos for us, but maybe they come back later in the year. The dirt road is blocked just after that point. Nights are cold here, our windows froze from the inside.

name: La recoleta mirador over the city
description: Don't miss this gorgeous point of view on the city. Next to it, you'll find museums and the monasterio. Recommend doing it at sunset.

name: peaje
description: 18 bolivianos with motorhome twin wheel and police contrôle : Wave us

name: Turn-Off Point for Pico Austria Hike
description: If you want to hike the Pico Austria, turn off from the main road here. And use Maps.me for navigation. The other navigation systems send us to a completely wrong road, not knowing this one. You follow this path approx. 25 km, the path is clear and easy to drive. There is just one bridge that is a bit narrow with approx 2,40m.

name: Sauna San Silvestre
description: The showers and sauna (steam pipe) are in the same rooms, which may be individual (12 Bs.), double (20 Bs.) or family (didn’t ask). One hour time. Good and comfortable facilities, very clean. Bathrooms included.

name: Barrio Jardín
description: Several parking spots in front of a small soccer field. Very quite neighborhood with low traffic and very illuminated at night. Slept 2 nights and had no problems.

name: Nice place to camp
description:
Here is a good place to camp before or after Tupiza. Some dogs went to search for some food but except for that, the view is wonderful in the red mountains. The ground is flat and huge so place for many campers. We felt safe ! The only thing is that here starts the gravel road so many cars/trucks slow down here which gives the impression that they will come here but finally nobody comes.  No wifi but good connexion with Entel.
Follow us on Instagram if you want 🙂 @Objectif.monde3

name: Sol Naciente Ferreteria
description:
It's not for fill a tank but you can buy gaz bottle if, like us, you cook with small gaz bottle (unique use). it's rare to find those here so... 
30 BOB/bottle (negotiate price).
very nice and professional guy !

name: Flat wide land with some Lyama
description: Nice peaceful flat place to rest. A lot of Lyamas near by. A pity some rubbish around.

name: Hospital José Eduardo Perez
description: Medical atention in case of eventuality and you are not insured or you are just passing through the city.

name: Mecanico eléctrico de carros
description: The mechanic is honest, fast and very kind. The place is the grey wall door

name: Atelier de carrosserie, de peinture et de maintenance générale Maycol
description: I went to this workshop. They refurbished my big motorhome. I asked them lots of things: treating chassis rust, fixing the front doors which were making noise, fixing the aluminum rocker panels, repairing the plastic rear bumper, fixing the spare wheel under the motorhome and replacement of the double door mosquito nets. Michael is very knowledgeable. he works very well, I highly recommend

name: TinTin plaza comedor
description:
Nice and basic comedor on the main square. Very friendly owners.
If you ask very kindly they might even offer you a basic room (2beds). 
It seems allowed to camp on the square on the roofed terrace

name: Vigus Restaurant
description:
Very good restaurant if you want something out of the touristic crowd. not expensive for the big portion and the owner is sooo friendly and want to do his best !!! they even have vegetarian food (not much but at least they have what they offer on the menu in comparaison with other restaurants we have been to).
take your time and come in !!!

name: Water in fuel station
description: Good pressure. No fuel at the station but we manage to fill our tank. A woman came to ask what we wanted to do and ask money but we finally didn’t pay. Water clear

name: Lagunas Restaurant
description: Don Jaime and his Wife run the small restaurant on the way to to Cerro Tunari. On the weekend he catches trout's in the Laguna and sells them in the restaurant. I found them absolutely delicious! Plus it's an incredible scenery in over 4.000m. There is also Lama and some more dishes. A must stop after climbing Cerro Tunari.

name: Little Place with fresh Empanadas
description:
An really nice old woman runs this place. Typical bolivian food and the nicest selfmade Empanadas. Also cheap prices and cold beer.

We parked our car in front of the restaurant.

name: wonderful Local Farmers Market
description:
We were there on an sunday morning at 10 am. They had everything, good food, fresh fruits and all at really low price.

Only locals!

name: Hospedaje MALUQUI
description:
little hotel with private accommodation and private bathroom. hot showers but the pressure is not very good. there is a lot of blanket, towels and a heater.
we have been sick and showed up last minute and all rooms were free. we were allowed to use the kitchen because we were sick and could not go out. the abuela is very nice !

name: Toll Booth
description: Toll booth. Shouldn’t have to pay if you paid at the last one coming from tupiza

name: Todo Turbo
description: Excellent mechanic if you have problems with your turbo. Very friendly and helpful. Works very concentrated and professional. Reasonable price. Highly recommended!

name: Blue Moon
description: Super coffee, fresh cakes, tasty meals. Friendly owners!

name: VEGAN Resto Ay Ni
description: Best vegan Restaurant, they usually just have 1-2 dishes and are open for lunch and dinner (even if  Google tells it different)

name: water Tab in "mercado central"
description: there is a water Tab next to the public toilets. locals said it was ok to use the water.

name: Memo’s Coffee Bistro
description: Nice little breakfast spot with ok prices and good wifi. Felt safe and private to pull out electronics

name: Toncoli
description: We came when the level of the lake was high so all the other spots on the east side of the lake were flooded. Fortunately we found this dead end right next to the lake. There is just one house close so the place is really quiet. Nice views. Some rubbish as usual. Good Entel signal.

name: Calle López sobre Parque San Marcos
description: Parking on Lopez Street, above San Marcos Park. In the park there are public toilets and non-drinking water. Excellent view and friendly neighbors

name: Stadium grounds
description: There ‘s secure fenced areas around the stadium where dogs can run and play. Sometimes the gate is locked so walk around and find one that’s open. Campsites are so grounded in Sucre and this really saved us and our young need to run dogs. Park Bolivia is too crowded and opens late.

name: El Solar - best restaurant in town!
description:
Simply the best restaurant in town! (maybe in the best in whole of our South America trip!)
They only have 1 course with 7 dishes, 80BS as of 2024. Which is really really cheap considering the gastronomy course using 100% Bolivian ingredients. (we gave them a little tip aswell)
Staff all friendly, you will definitely be satisfied no dought. Highly recommend.

name: Lavado Al Paso
description:
Translation: In addition to a great oil spray to enter the salt flat, it is a great wash after leaving the salt flat, they also sell fuel to foreigners for 6 bob. The only downside is that it will be in gallons. At the gas station they wanted to charge us 9 bob.

Além de uma ótima pulverização de óleo para entrar no salar, é uma ótima lavação após sair do salar, eles também vendem combustível para estrangeiros a 6 bob. Único inconveniente é que será nos galões mesmo. No posto queriam nos cobrar 9 bob.

name: Estancia llallagua
description: We spent one night here, breaking our journey from Cochabamba to la Paz.Flat area, and felt safe. The only thing,you can hear the trucks passing by, but with some earplugs( the adults) we spent a good night sleep here.

name: Labatodo
description: 20 BS per kilo, next day service, not open Sundays

name: estacion tiquipaya
description: here we finally could fill our tank with diesel. International price.

name: Close to the Payment barrier
description:
The site is safety the night because there is the police army control all vehicles.
It a little bit noisy the morning but if you don’t stay close to the road it good.

name: Windscreens VIDCLA ​​SRL
description: Repair and replacement of Windshields (Windscreens). I paid 850B$ for my Toyota FJ Cruiser and the replacement was done on the spot in 2 hours. (The local Toyota dealerships could not help me, none in stock)

name: Cheap and clean - Hostal de sal
description:
We are glad we found Hostal de Sal as it is the cheapest option in this area. 2 person double room cost us only 100 bol. There is a shared bathroom with warm water and two toilets,  relieable WIFI (streamed movies with no issues) and the rooms look simply amazing as the walls and furnitures are made of salt. In addition, you can order breakfast (drink, bread, egg and yam) or dinner (vegetable soup for instance) for 15 bol. 

Don't let yourself be fooled by the outside look of the building! Contact the owner via Whatsapp +59167931074, because she normaly works during the day and arrives at the hostel in the evening (around 4-5pm). She is very friendly. We already arrived at midday and the building was empty. When we contacted the owner, we were permitted to enter and take a room by ourselves! Also we were allowed to put our two bicycles inside for the night. 

Of course, it is not perfect. The bed felt a bit like a crater (the sheets were clean), the shower seems old and the toilets (without toilet paper) are to be flushed via water buckets. 
Furthermore, you cannot lock your room! We used our own lock on the door to secure our stuff inside our room while we visited the salt flat. Maybe you can ask the owner for a solution in case she is present, I am sure she can give you a lock.  Given for the price this is still an incredible offer!

There are many rooms, however it seems this place is rarely visited by guests, so you will very likely get a room.

name: Socapampa
description:
bivouac in the small village of Socapampa. the surrounding buildings appear abandoned, but there is a water tap and electricity in the buildings. The access track is quite narrow, barely passable with our 15 ton 4x4 truck. from this bivouac it is less than a kilometer to access the socapampa waterfall via the suspension bridge which is not in very good condition. We spent a quiet night, the area is very pretty.


bivouac dans le petit village de Socapampa. les batiments alentours semblent abandonnés, mais il y a un robinet d'eau et de l'électricité dans les batiments. La piste d'accès est assez étroite, tout juste praticable avec notre camion 4x4 de 15 tonnes. depuis ce bivouc il y a moins d'un kilomètre pour accéder à la cascade de socapampa en passant par le pont suspendu qui n'est pas en très bon état. avons passé une nuit tranquille le coin est très joli.

name: Cascade socapampa
description:
socapampa waterfall. Very pretty waterfall, not very high, but which follows layers of land which make the environment very pretty and particular. Fairly short hike from the small village of Socapampa, less than 1 km using the suspension bridge which is not in very good condition. the access track to socapampa is narrow and a little rocky, to be avoided if your vehicle is low or with a large overhang.

cascade de socapampa. Trés joli cascade, pas très haute, mais qui suit des couches de terrain qui font que l'environnement est très joli et particulier. randonnée assez courte depuis le petit village de Socapampa, moins de 1 km en empruntant le pont suspendu qui n'est pas en très bon état. la piste d'accès jusqu'à socapampa est étroite et un peu rocailleuse, à éviter si votre véhicule est bas ou avec un gros porte à faux.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Just wanted to see drivers passport ant TIP

name: Entel Shop
description: Entel shop. Very helpful when we had isssues to register our phones.

name: Local school
description: Nice people at local school let me stay the night in a classroom when I came by on a bike trip.

name: Under the street
description:
Huge rectangular tunnel that could fit big rigs, height is about 3m. We pitched our tent there and had an undisturbed night apart from the traffic noise. There are no signs that vehicles pass through this tunnel, the nearest houses are distant. We only saw some lama and sheep herds in the evening guided by a shepherd. They might want to use the tunnel to avoid crossing the street so leave some space for this case. We managed to make a fireplace to warm us in the cold morning.
Tunnel is reachable by going off the street before the ramp and then following the grass path until the tunnel. Or with bicycle simply walk down the steep cemented water rines.

name: Wild Camping on the edge of Ayo Ayo
description: Simple place for putting up a tent. Place is at the edge of Ayo Ayo near an old soccer field (the new one is down in the village). We stayed directly besides the wall of the building. Some locals driving by but nobody bothered us and all were friendly. Potable water available in the village (also on iOverlander). Some road noice from the highway, but only visable from the village.

name: Hidden place behind dirt hills
description: We set up our tent at the edge of a field just before Huari. The place is behind some dirt hills, so you’re not visable from the road. You still hear some road noice but traffic isn’t to bad here.

name: Road underpass
description: This is a road underpass for a river, but if it is dry, it’s a nice option to set up a tent. Not visable from the road (which is hard to achive in this flat area) and road noise is not that bad either. Can be entered right behind the guard rail (coming from the south/east). All in all a good place for a night.

name: Abandoned train station
description: We wanted to camp a bit further down the road but were caught in a thunderstorm. Because of that we decided to get back to this small village. A man told us that we could set up the tent under the roof of this abandoned train station. Some people during the evening and morning but friendly and nobody sent us away. However would probably only recommend staying here with really bad weather and otherwise choose one of the other spots or just cycle 3 km or so more towards Tupiza and choose a spot between the bushes besides the road.

name: Wild camp
description: Nice small, flat place, sheltered from the wind and from view.  Space for several vans.

name: Good for a quiet night
description: Tranquilo place for a night at the main plaza in front of the church

name: SENASAG
description:
SENASAG offices located at Km 11 of Cochabamba, it is here that you must carry out the procedures to obtain a CZI (Zoosanitary Certificate international) if you do not want to pay the all-inclusive prices (800bs/Animals) of local veterinarians and carry out the procedures yourself. the office is on the first floor by taking the stairs on the left after the portal. the procedure here will cost you 277bs per official certificate per animal. If you have all the necessary documents it will take 48 to 72 hours. right in front of the senasag on the corner of the street is a very nice veterinarian, Yhovana (cf. photos of her office), who can provide you with the health certificate and a copy of her senasag accreditation, OBLIGATORY for the procedures for 150bs/Animals. (in photos you have the documents to fill out, this is the official example available at SENASAG which you can download from their website).
