Total 427bs/Animals if you do the procedure yourself! (Allow 10bs because photocopies will be requested)

Senasag hours: Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.
Yhovana's hours : Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and from 2:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. you can contact her via WhatsApp at +591 68026368

name: M.V.T. Yhovana Vet
description:
Here is Yhovana's office, she is a veterinarian, and mainly takes care of the procedures for obtaining an international Zoosanitary certificate, she offers :
- Do all the procedures for you and present it yourself to the Senasag office. (600bs/animals)
- Support you in your procedure so that you can do it yourself (150bs/Animals + 10bs for photocopies)

In both cases she will carry out a veterinary visit to your animal and provide you a veterinary certificate if everything is in order + a photocopy of her senasag accreditation which is obligatory for the procedure.

(in order to make you pay 800bs/animal most veterinarians in Cochabamba will not provide you a copy of their accreditation under false pretenses. The senasag we have confirmed that the copy accreditation must come with the veterinary certificate)

Yhovana is very professional, honest and will accompany you from start to finish.

opening hours: Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and from 2:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m.

You can contact her on her WhatsApp at +591 68026368

name: Place for Cyclists
description: Ok Place to put a tent. Take the dirt road next to the bus stop. This will lead you as far away from the main road as you wish. Plenty of flat spaces for a tent.

name: Outside of the town turco
description: Close to the road F27 at the north of the village turco, no wifi , internet is slow

name: Taller Charlie - Motorcycle mechanic
description: Motorcycle mechanic in Cochabamba.  He had good ratings in google and many people said he works in big bikes, so I tried him out.  He was a very nice guy and got me in to change my oil immediately.  He uses Motul oil.  His shop was clean and organized.  He also speaks English.  I would recommend him.

name: Local shop
description: Small store with the usual stuff. Super friendly people as well. They have computers so you might be able to use the internet there.

name: Just after to the church with view on the mountains
description: Quite place not so fare to the center with good internet spot.

name: 360 degree Panoramic View above Lagoon
description: Wonderful quiet place with amazing view in all directions. Needs a bit offroad cruising. Come here from the parking area of the lagoon. Enjoy.

name: Behind the church
description: Beautiful balcon with huge view behind a church in very quiet village. More than enough space for everybody

name: Alojamiento Mil Sueños
description:
New, very clean Alojamiento with clean Shared bathroom for 35 Bol. per person. Single, twin and double room with clean sheets!!! Cold shower only. Safe bicycle parking, maybe also space for motorbikes? Friendly reception. After checking out, definitely best option in town! 

Nuevo y muy limpio alojamiento con very clean baño compartido y ducha fría para 35 Bol. por persona. Habitaciones simples, dobles y matrimoniales. Se puede estacionar bicicletas en el patio. Tal vez también motos? 
Recepción muy amable. Lo mejor opción en el pueblo.

name: La Cabaña
description: Nice and clean hotel in a Green Valley with lots of wineries. Place has a own winery as well. The friendly owners offer private (50 B per person) and dormitory habitation and also campsites. Warm showers available.  But During school holidays and at weekends it’s necessary to book in advance. Entrance for pedestrians and cyclists at the entrance of the Village of Luribay, with car and motorbike the only way in is at the entrance of San Pedro (coming from Cruce Achocara first village on the way) doing a hard right turn upwards and following this way, it ends at La Cabaña) Note: most people don’t know this way and they’ll send you the way for pedestrians.

name: Valle de las Ánimas entrance
description: Here is where you enter one of the most popular trekking of Valle de las Ánimas. There is a chain in the road and most people leave their car before of it. If you want to cross with your car there is a community fee of BOB 30 for it (entrance is free for people). We crossed the chain, paid the fee and ask the lady if could sleep there in the entrance, “no problem” she said. There is only one spot for medium vans but maybe you could find more into the Valle. We did the trekking the next day, it is beautiful. Good Entel reception.

name: Toll and police
description:
direction la Paz, toll control, we paid the previous toll so nothing here, just after the police check TIP and driving licence, RAS

direction la Paz, Contrôle de péage, nous avons payé le péage précédent  donc rien ici, juste après la police contrôle TIP et permis de conduire, RAS

name: Toll for road in the north
description: Here is a toll gate that is closed. So you have to pay 10 BOBs for using the road to Julaca. It’s north from here.

name: Village Canaviri
description: Flat place and very quiet, good for big ring , van or other type of campers

name: Ruins and trees at dead end
description:
This is one of our favorite spots in South America so far. After staying a while in Altiplano you can enjoy warm night temperatures and shade of trees. There is a flat spot for a tent behind the wall, a fireplace, and enough wood to make a fire. Some trash, but collected and piled. Please keep it clean and bury your poop! 
As a bonus, there are tons of beautifully patterned small stones lying around. It is hard not to take some with you. 

To get there: 
At the bridge follow the gravel road until you come to the ruins. A farmer might use the street to reach the crops nearby. So finding a flat spot for a car could be challenging.

name: Parque Bolivia
description: Very dog friendly park. They can run off lead. Lots of strays but they’re all super friendly and up for playing.

name: Campamento Kewiña
description:
Tranquil campsite at the east side of the laguna.
During workdays I was alone but holidays and weekends can be more crowded.
It’s a Christian establishment but they don’t urge you to pray or anything ;-)
They have 1 hot shower AFAIK.
Dinner only prepared if groups have to be fed but it is 15 min to Colomi and besides there are some decent restaurants around the lake. You can use the fireplace.
20 bs for a tent
35 bs for a dorm bed

name: HOTEL W FREE PARKING
description:
All normal size SUVs should fit in here even with roof racks. 

120Bs/night for 2 people with private bathroom. 80 for a single person.

Best part is free parking in the hotel’s own courtyard. This is the only place I could find like this.

Super hot showers and pet friendly

name: House Ruins
description: An abandoned house just next to the road. Nothing special. Enough space for two two person tents. You are not super hidden but at least 40m from the Road and Most importantly sheltered from the wind. There are also some small caves in case it’s pouring rain.

name: Toll booth
description:
Here is another toll booth. You have to pay again when you go further north, even if you paid at the other stations. 

He said it’s until Challapata now.

We had to pay 5 BOBs here (paid 11 near Uyuni), we have a normal sized car. Can be cheaper if you drive something bigger.

name: K62
description: Petrol had recently arrived, lots of locals filling jerrycans. Immediately gave internacional price of 8BOB/L. Asked sin factura, attended wouldn't budge. We topped 20L directly to the car

name: Campo aberto
description:
Area away from the main highway, with good protection from the winds by a hill.  Soft, flat soil.  I recommend a 4x4 vehicle.
--
Área afastada da rodovia principal, com uma boa proteção dos ventos por um morro. Solo macio e plano. Recomendo veiculo 4x4.

name: Tienda Casa Real W
description:
Little tienda in the corner that sells some basic snacks, coke and other drinks.

You can buy gasoline and diesel from cherry cans here.
For gasoline we paid 6BOB/l

name: Duchas en Hostal
description:
There are duchas available in Hostal Sajama and Hostal Oasis. Both are next to each other.

Todays price was 
Oasis: 15 BOB/Person
Sajama: 10 BOB/Person

Today unfortunately cold in Sajama but they reduced the price for us. Very nice staff. And the Hostal looks gorgeous l.

name: Bad road for 2WD
description: At this point the road gets really bad with big rocks and holes. We had to turnaround with our 2WD. The clearance of our car is not that bad and we have managed many rocky roads but this was a bridge too far.

name: Several different ATMs
description:
At this roundabout there are ATMs of what I think is every bank in Bolivia.
BNB.24, Banco Ganadero, BCP, Banco Económica, La Primera, Banco Fie, Banco Unión.
I tried every ATM. Some wanted to charge me 90 BOB / 7 US Dollars fee, some did not charge.
I could withdraw 2000 BOB at a time for several times at the BNB.24 without fees with my German DKB Visa Card.

You will find a parking spot in one of the neighboring streets.

name: The Lucky Llama
description: Every day at 2pm. In the bar you can find the tourism tour in English, German, Spain and French, the price is 25 Bob pp + tip (for the guide) and at the end of the tour, the bar gives you a cocktail.

name: Servi Motors
description:
Great place to repair everything: General, electronics, oil, brakes, ...
Very professional, good equipment.
Friendly with strangers, and fast!

name: Road to Salar for non 4x4
description: If you want to drive to the south entrance of the Salar like us (2WD campervan) and driving anything else than a 4x4 with high clearance, then make sure to continuously follow the winding gravel road close to the mountain that runs trough the villages. Otherwise your vehicle WILL take a beating on the huge washboards and get stuck in the loose sand. These other roads look fine at the beginning, but they are all short cuts made by the tours Landcruiser’s and are terrible! Don’t rely on Google Maps or Maps.me, because they will send you on these roads.

name: Beautiful Laguna Pastos Grandes
description: This is a very pretty laguna with beautiful colours and many flamingos. Since it doesn’t seem to get visited by the regular tours that much, the road leading to it is in good shape (easy doable with our 2WD campervan) and you probably have the place to yourself. You can drive to the other side of the Laguna too, which looked nice from a distance (but haven’t been there).

name: Toll
description:
There is a toll here… 10 Bob.
It doesn’t make any sense, the road is maintained by the mine but they do not let you pass if you don’t pay. All these part is about paying tolls for destroyed roads

name: YPFB Water tap
description: On the station, under the “meeting point” sign. Nice staff. Not a lot of pressure.

name: BNB automat
description: First ATM we saw coming from Potosi. The street is wide to stop for a moment to withdraw

name: Aallni - Vegan Restaurant
description: Small vegan restaurant. Just opened. A rarity in Sucre. They prepare for take away. It’s cheap and super tasty. There’s dessert too. Don’t miss it.

name: Banco Prodem
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place has been reported as being closed.

Here you can change dollars 6,95 today. Very friendly. For diesel, you have to pay cash. Open M-Friday 8-15h and Saturday 9-12h morning. See pictures

name: Entel
description: An official Entel store inside the mall to get a Bolivian SIM card

name: Old mine with ovens.
description:
Driving the RT1 we saw this old mining towers and old buildings. Two people were working, we thing they tried to get some minerals out of the residues. No fences, just walk around. Multi colors, I would have like to fly a drone here. 
Enjoy, Arjen and Yvonne

name: YPFB
description:
A YPFB station where not so much cars waiting today. Fast service and friendly staff.
As part of the official ANH they have to give gasoline and diesel to foreigners.
We asked for a sin factura price today and they offered us 6 BOBs for the gasolina. They fueled directly in the tank, it was not possible to fill in the cherry cans.

name: Aditiva 3D
description: A 3D design shop where they can fabricate basically anything and they can do it very quickly. Relatively cheap as well.

name: School in irocota
description:
It’s a school in the little city. I asked in the health center and they sent me to the school, saying that the teachers would give me a room. Unfortunately the teachers were out to Sucre. I could enter and sleep inside, but the bathrooms and all the rooms were locked. The sink is outside so you can clean your dishes. 

To get here, you have to go down in a dirty road but it’s easy to find because you see the gymnasium.

name: E.S. SAN JAVIER
description: We have fueled here Saturday around 4 pm. Directly in the tank, about 20 liters. 3.72 bol per liter. Of course with good tip

name: Estrella del Sur
description:
Basic room with small bed ~10 sqm, showers are cold only - 30 bs.
They have matrimonials, too.
Motorbike can be stored in the restaurant after it is closed for business (9 PM).
The owner also owns the grocery store downstairs.
Friendly people

name: La Coccina
description: The best Pizza you could find!  Made entirely made before your eyes. Tasty like in Italy.  Young people very friendly.   Small place next the owen

name: Flat campsite on hill with nice view
description:
Flat wild campsite perfect for tent. Not suitable for cars or campers. Go to the side of the road, down the hill and next to a shelter there you’ll find the spot.   
(Necessity of a 4wd or motorbike to access the exact spot but it is possible to camp right next to the road)

Perfect spot hidden for road, not too windy, very nice view and there’s a hole where you can light a fire without being seen from around

name: Riverside flat quiet spot
description:
A road goes down to the riverside from the 25th. No one there. The river is not too cold and we took a bath. There’s room for tent and campervan but the road requires 4wd (we are riding motorbikes and it’s fine)

Nice place but not the most beautiful in this area. The river makes it good :)

name: plaza de aguirre
description:
quiet place to spend a night before arriving in cochabamba
There is no water but its square is beautiful and green, the inhabitants are friendly
---
sitio tranquilo donde pasar una noche antes de llegar a cochabamba
no hay agua pero su plaza es bonita y verde, los habitantes amables

name: Hostal Rurrenabaque
description:
Really nice and clean Hostal.
Really clean bathroom and shohwer.
Has Toiletpaper and seats.
Big backyard for Camping, Locked by Gate.
Has a big space with roof and tables.
Fast Wifi.
Hammocks on the Veranda.
Restaurants and Cafés nearby. 
In the city centre, so everything in walking distance.
Merija is a really lovely person who runns tgis place, everything clean and tidy.

name: Gasolinera with bottles
description: Small store/restaurant offers gasolina for 20l/150bs

name: Storage de Apache aventura
description: Here you can storage your vehicle when you go by apache aventure tour. All is closed and there is somebody here all day/noght. Very professional compagnie. You can ask them when you do the tour. Bigs rigs friendly and many places. No height restrictions Here contact of Nelson. Boss of the company +591 (7) 389-7711

name: Apache aventure tour
description: Very professional and familial tour. They adapted very well what you want. Trust and safe even for family with children. We had Alvaro guide. Very good driver. Safe and don’t take alcohol. Contact WhatsApp Alvaro +591 (7) 421-0733 or Nelson +591 (7) 389-7711, the boss of the agency. Here is the family house. They don’t have agency in Uyuni. You can start you tour from Uyuni, Tupiza, Chili Border. Very flexible. Recommended 200%

name: Small Lagune
description: Very quite place next to a small Lagune. No visible from the road. Went there with a 4x4 but should be doable with a 4x2.

name: Julio's mechanic
description:
We phoned Julio at 17:00h because we have problems with our van. 
Julio was really helpfull and fix the motorhome the next day súper eficient. 
He is mechanic about all types of gasolina Cars. 
He don't wont money for his job, but we want to give them 50bob for his help.

Julio es un mecánico muy eficiente y con una energía pausada y buena onda. 
No quiso cobrar nada pues dice que estamos para ayudarnos, pero nosotros le pagamos 50bob por su trabajo. 

His phone:+591 78620385
Adress: Cordova 300, Villa Imperial de Potosí

name: G&E Motors Ford
description: This is the new GyE Motors Ford Sucre workshop. The workshop at the other end of town is closed. We were here with our Ford Ranger as a coil spring was broken in front. The staff is very keen to order the spare parts and replace the parts. We could camp on the workshop grounds for so long.

name: Hospedaje y restaurant
description: Hotel economy in the village. They are also restaurant (10 Bolivianos per person). 50 Bolivianos for two people, matrimonial rooms. 10 Bolivianos to use the shower. Ps, there are a few smells of room that does not breathe. We put incense for the night

name: Banco union
description: no fee at this ATM, maximum withdrawal was 500 bob , so we withdrew 6 times

name: Taller Roman
description: bycicle garage, he fix my rear weel bike. friendly owner with solutions

name: Hostal Restaurante Potosi
description:
very basic place for one night, 20bb pp, no Wifi, no hot water, not so clean, shared toilet on the back yard.
the basic menu 10bb.
you can gard your bike inside in a backyard.

name: Alojamiento la Paz
description: Basic alojamiento, 30bb shared room, 40bb private room. wen I been there no shower in "maintenance", the room and the toilet clean. good wifi. centric place with a lot of shops for buy all you can need.

name: muddy and private road
description: Google Maps sent us along this road as a short cut instead of going to Santa Cruz while heading to Samaipata. DO NOT TAKE IT!! It was a very muddy road and we got stuck in the mud. Locals who drove by helped us (in exchange for money) and told us it is a private road.

name: Hostal Belisario
description:
Clean and spacious rooms, very friendly staff. Nice location with safe parking garage for motorcycles or even cars. We paid 165 Bs per night with breakfast and private bathroom. 
Teleferico is just few minutes away by foot. Multiple supermarkets are nearby and a lot of bars and restaurants too.

name: Pacoata cemetery
description: Flat place with nobody here. Very quiet. Place for many Big rigs. For all vehicles. No needs 4x4

name: YPFB 5 esquinas
description: Very friendly guy. We could have some diesel after 5 pump stations and 2h driving!!!! Other San Pedro have to many queues of lorries we can have some but didn’t want to wait all day! Foreigners price

name: alone front if the Cero Soniquera
description: a flat place at the beggining of south road for the laguna celeste et not to hight. The access is only with 4x4 .  Quiet and beautifull.

name: Mina Horsu route closed
description: we tryed to reach lagunas verde and blanca by the beautifull track thru Desierto de Dali but the road is closed at the Mina Horsu. No solution,  we had to go back

name: Wild camping in dry riverbed
description: There were no pins for wild camping on this stretch so I put this one to indicate it’s very much possible. Big rocks along the road provide wind protection for a tent. In my case I camped here in a dry riverbed. Accessible for cars too judging by the tracks. A bit sandy on 10m to get here but I guess even 2WD would be fine. Amazing views on the altiplano and the mountains! Sunset was crazy!

name: Mirador la Antesala del Cielo
description:
We spent the night in the Mirador parking lot, very quiet, safe, there are portable toilets and cell phone signal comes in but the best signal is next to the virgin that is located at the entrance to the viewpoint, we spent the night after going up to the viewpoint and go down after sunset.  This viewpoint is beautiful and it is recommended to do the entire circuit of viewpoints that are at the top.

Pasamos la noche en el parqueadero del Mirador, muy tranquilo, seguro, hay baños portatiles y entra señal de celular pero la mejor señal esta al lado de la virgen que esta ubicada en la entrada al mirador, pasamos la noche luego  de subir al mirador y bajar después del atardecer.  Éste mirador es hermoso y se recomienda hacer todo el circuito de miradores que están en la cima.

name: Restaurante Sabor y Arte el Posoka
description:
They offer three meals, they also have coffee, soft drinks, some very delicious corn empanadas with cheese and handicrafts made by Gabriela who is the owner of the restaurant.  It is located on the main avenue towards the Mirador.

Recomemdado ofrecen las tres comidas, también tienen cafes, refrescos, unas empanadas de choclo con queso muy deliciosas y Artesanias elaboradas por Gabriela quien es la dueña del restaurante. Esta ubicado por la avenida principal hacia el Mirador.

name: Sabor y Arte Posoka
description:
Posoka is guess in Chiquitano languaje.
Nice spot to stay a night . They have a  free showers and toilets and a good tipical food Ask for Gabriela +59177854125

name: Church miniature
description: Interesting mini church. Nice picture with volcano behind

name: tranqui spot to camp, view on sunset and sunrise
description:
This camp spot is easy to reach, just follow a small path to the tpunge of the island.
There is a nice flat area where there is space enough for 2 to 3 tents. The ground is soft, not many rocks.
The view on sunset is amazing and sunrise aswell.
In August it might be very windy.

I kniw there is/was a conflict on the island between north and south but i asked multiple persons and all of them were very very chilled about me camping there. Just make sure its not someones quinoa field where you place your tent on.
But this place is just grass.

However, maybe make sure the people there still dont mind if you camp there.

For me it was one of the nicest wild camps I've been so far

name: Dieselrio Mercedes Benz
description: We have a Sprinter and got help here. Friendly and good service for parts and mecanic.

name: Traditional rounded houses
description: 5 km away from Huari there is a small complex of traditional rounded houses in a village Llapa Llapani. Road to get here is quite sandy but I made it through by bike on a side of the road.

name: UNIVIDA
description: Here you can buy SOAT for extranjeros. Just bring your TIP, vehicle documents and drivers license.

name: Gasoline and Diesel
description:
Small shop which sells gasoline and diesel from a jug.

Asked for 7Bs per liter for gasoline, which is a bit expensive.

name: Lavados de Autos Splash
description: Right after you enter the town of Challapata on the left is a car wash station with ramps. We payed 30. bol for a carwash with foam and the undercarriage. They have good Wifi as well connection via QR Code.

name: E.S. Junior
description: Were able to get gasoline for local price + a 20bob propina. When it is busy they have a small queue in the street before driving in. Asked if we could buy gasoline as a non-local. After thinking about it she said yes if we could pay something extra. Then we could drive up and we could get a full tank for local price.

name: Ranger PN Sajama
description: Very friendly. You can ask to refill your tank.

name: Street parking
description: We found our car with a flat tire after two days of parking here. It’s clearly intentionnal

name: Hostal Claure
description:
Hotel and Hostel
120bs for a private Room with Bathroom.
They also have nice terrace with a bar. 

Garage / Garden for many motorbikes and/or 2 Cars.

name: Hôtel los Andes del sur
description:
Simple hôtel clean and frendly with a garage for vehicule 2m60 high maxi and able to maneuver on small space ( we have  Toyota Landcruiser,  it s OK but no more).
Heater in the room.  Bathroom really tiny. 
200 Bob for matrimonial with own bathroom

name: EESS Choropampa Fuel Station
description: Gasolina & diesel available here. Pleasant surprise to see a formal fuel station and it had fuel!

name: Museo del charango
description: Frank es el encargado de Cultura de Aiquile. El te guía y te cuenta la historia. Personas muy amables que de ser necesario te ubican un lugar seguro para pasar la noche.

name: Spot near the old churche
description:
next to the old earth church there is space to park. good, quiet bivouac. far enough away from the road to avoid traffic noise. we even bought potatoes from a farmer. good spot. We spent two nights there with our truck.

à côté de la vieille église en terre, il y a de la place pour stationner. bon bivouac bien tranquille. suffisamment à l’écart de la route pour ne pas avoir le bruit de la circulation. nous avons même acheté des pommes de terre à une fermière. bon spot. y avons passé deux nuit avec notre camion.

name: Boulangerie française
description:
French bakery with good bread. here you will find traditional baguettes, pain au chocolat, pain aux raisins, croissants… we bought 4 pains au chocolat, a croissant, a pain aux raisins, a baguette and a Swiss bread for around €9. very good.


boulangerie française au bon pain. ici vous trouverez des baguettes tradition, des pain au chocolat, pain aux raisins, croissants… nous avons acheté 4 pains au chocolat, un croissant, un pain aux raisins, une baguette et un pain suisse pour environ 9€. très bon.

name: Xtreme downhill dead road
description:
tours offering a bike ride down the Death Road. departure is by minibus from La Paz. in total 60 km almost only downhill. 20 km on asphalt and 40 km on stony path with a difference in altitude of 3600 m! why we chose this agency: because the bikes are of good quality and well maintained. given all the stones on the track and the slope it is better to have good brakes and good suspension. we did the tour with our 11 year old daughter, the bike was a little high for her, but if you have sporty and adventurous children it is possible. our 7 year old son was able to follow us in the van which followed us all the way on the road to death. for 4 it cost us around €200. This includes return transport from La Paz, breakfast, snacks, and at the end of the journey lunch with access to a swimming pool and showers. we had a French guide: Maxime who can talk to you at length about Bolivia. the tour lasts approximately from 7:15 a.m. until 8 p.m. we may have been privileged because we were alone with the guide, but otherwise there is approximately one guide for a maximum of 10 people. you can ride at your own pace as there are regular breaks. If your physical condition is good, absolutely do this tour, it’s great! Along the way we had the chance to zip line over the Amazon rainforest for 80 bowls per person, it was great.

tours proposant la descente en vélo de la route de la mort. le départ se fait en minibus depuis la Paz. au total 60 km quasiment que de la descente. 20 km sur de l’enrobé et 40 km sur chemin caillouteux avec un dénivelé de 3600 m! pourquoi avons nous choisi cette agence : car les vélos sont de bonne qualité et bien entretenus. au vu de tous les cailloux sur la piste et de la pente mieux vaut avoir de bons freins et une bonne suspension. nous avons fait le tour avec notre fille de 11 ans, le vélo était un peu haut pour elle, mais si vous avez des enfants sportifs et aventureux c’est possible. notre fils de 7 ans a pu nous suivre à bord du van qui nous a suivi sur tout le trajet sur la route de la mort. pour 4 ça nous a coûté environ 200€. ça inclus le transport aller retour depuis la Paz, le petit déjeuner, des en cas, et à la fin du chemin le repas de midi avec accès à une piscine et des douches. nous avions un guide français: Maxime qui pourra vous parler longuement de la Bolivie. le tour dure environ de 7h15 jusqu’à 20 h. nous avons peut être été privilégiés car nous étions seuls avec le guide, mais sinon il y a environ un guide pour maximum 10 personnes. vous pouvez rouler à votre rythme car il y a des pauses régulières. si votre condition physique est correcte faite absolument ce tour, c’est génial!  en cours de route nous avons eu la chance de pouvoir faire de la tyrolienne au dessus de la forêt amazonienne pour 80 bols par personne, c’était super.

name: Albergue Talina
description: Very basic place. Just beds and room to spend the night. 30 BOB/pp may 2024. Knock the door of any house or ask neighbours they will find the person in the community that is in charge. Very welcoming people.

name: Entrance Sajama
description:
Thanks to the park warden's directions, we filled our tank with drinking water just past the gate at the left-hand entrance. The flow is average.
--------
Grâce aux indications du gardien du parc, juste après la barrière à l'entrée à gauche nous avons rempli notre réservoir avec de l'eau potable. Le débit est moyen.

name: Tienda entel
description:
Very efficient personal. You have to register your phone number to be not blocked. Open all days 8-19h expect Sunday. Saturday 8-18h. 
Bring your passport. Very friendly ask for Juan Carlos

name: La cantonata
description: Italian restaurant. Many different plates like meat/ pasta and pizza. We had pizza. It was good but not the best we had in Amsud. Table is nice, service is good. Class atmosphere. Special birthday. Little bite expensive for quality

name: Zas Cholita
description:
Restaurant food and drinks
Paninis, Sandwich, Breakfast, desserts, diferents dishes
Vegetariana option
All hand Made and fresh food
Pet friendly 

Súper friendly

name: In the White …
description:
Lonely spot, close to salt statues.
No wind, no noise. After 6pm you are alone.
Entel service

name: Estadio
description: Huge place to stay. At the moment green. Nobody around. As well you can charge water

name: Heladeria sabores de Illimani
description: An excellent i e cream palce. All natural. Very small place and the owner she is so nice.

name: ATM ecofuturo no fee
description: We get some money here 3000 Bol without any problems and NO fee. But several withdrawals.

name: Hostal
description: We only took a shower at Hostal Montagna. 1bolivianos / minut. Nice people, clean shower.

name: Narrow streets
description:
Be careful with the narrow streets of Yotala
better keep outside of the white gates if you can

name: Pacú a la parrilla, Pescadería
description:
Road restaurant 
Saturday, Sundays and Feriados they server Pacú a la parrilla, is a river fish súper tasty 

The plate is Pacú, potatos and corn for 25bol
They put tradicional music 

Nice!

name: Dr. Miguel Angel -Veterinario UR.ME.VET
description:
SENASAG send us to this place, because Vet. San Silvestre was closed in the morning. Helpful & slowly. All his papers were fine at the Chilean border!

Contact: 71859005

name: Restaurants y Groceries
description: Several restaurants and groceries (biscuit, soda and agua). A lot of passage. They all make trout and soups

name: Foot of the rock
description: We are on a bicycle trip. At the foot of the rock. Next to the small pond a flat space for a large tent. Take a path from the road and then a straight path that goes down to the foot of the rocks. It's a bit humid in some places, well choose its corner. Quiet and quiet. We have the sun in the morning, it's great.

name: The road is collapsed
description: The road is closed and more used. There was a collapse that took the road over fifty yards. To go up or down, take the asphalt road (the only road to the valley)

name: Bum Rang Pizza
description: Very good pizza like Italy!!!! You can have a delivery pizza by WhatsApp even in the soccer field- RV spot!!!! Great service +591 (6) 888-2257

name: Saunas Y Duchas El Quirquincho
description: Very clean and unexpensive 1 hour sauna and showers with individual boxes

name: Eco Hotel Gota del Chaco
description:
Edward receives as well overlander. If you have a big rig you can park outside. Otherwise inside.

Wifi. Electricity and laundry service. 

please arrange prices with him directly

Whatsapp +591 71122494

name: Restaurants y tienda
description: Restaurants and mini-market. 13 Bolivianos per dish (grilled chicken, rice, yuca and plantin banana) with a drink. The dish is very good. Nice and clean. The dining room overlooks a view of the valley. The manager Isabelle is very friendly. For the tienda side, she sells biscuits, lamp and basic products.

name: hôtel and camping
description: 70 Bolivianos for a matrimonial room or two beds. Cold shower (electric system, but not connected to the current). It's clean. Greenery in front of the rooms (nice). Possible camping !

name: Before Puente La Canada
description: Overgrown former soccer field off Ruta 11. Very peaceful

name: Glamping refugio Codo de los andes
description: You can camping with your own tent here or rent a cabana. She is in FB or google. Near the trail. About 40 pp. wc and shower. No charge for trail and no guide obligation. His the owner of Codo. You can come by bicycle or a little vehicle. Ask for road conditions first. Call Veronica +59168783762.

name: Hay pan e más
description: Here you can buy some bread in the afternoon (16h) also first necessity sometimes veggies or fruits. You can ask his son William to drop you at Trails Codo

name: Codo de Los Andes
description: William is very honest and friendly guy. He can drop you near the entrance to the Trail Codo de Los Andes. Didn’t pay entrance because we entered to his garden- property. He asked 50 Bol for our family to go. He can do the way back for 50 more but we decided to do all trail and without guide. About 11km until Cuevas. Quite steep and difficult and some part are very narrow with ravines. So don’t do it if you have dizziness. You can also go to mirador and back. This is shorter. If you do all trails until Cuevas, this part is closed so when you finish trails you have to go through the fences near river at the right side. Try to be discreet. You can also do this with a guide, I don’t know the price. Don’t go to your car during wet season! William +591 67292537 Also he can organise 2 days trekking further in these beautiful mountains.

name: El Encanto camping
description: Here, you can fit you big rigs, your tent…very friendly staff. Big garden grassy and flat. There is a river, playground for kids, hanging bridge and a restaurant. In the garden you can take fruits you want. Now there are citrus. We paid 30 Bol PP. you can organise to go trekking in Codo de Los Andes with William (+591 (6) 346-9600 see point interest on IOverlander) also they have cabana, renting tent. Toilets is clean. They have shower clean but cold. Only thing they put some music until 5pm but was ok not to loudly and the road is just nearby if you have camper. But quiet at night. Tent can go further. They also can helps you to fill your tank

name: Limpieza Lavanderia Express
description: We payed 8 bol per Kg laundry after 2 hours it was ready not everything was fully dry but totally fine. The guy was very friendly.

name: gas station surtidor coripata
description:
Gas station at Coripata. When we came, they had no diesel but they had gasolina.
No issue to fill it up, we paid national price with a foreign plate.

name: Fil-Parts
description:
Store that sells all kinds of MANN filters. 
They didn’t have the air filter we needed, but shortened a larger filter for us within 3 hours. Very helpful!

name: Next to a river
description:
There is a small camp spot next to a river. Suitable for a car or tent. 
Not so leveled but ok for one night as there are not much possibilities along the road.

name: Gasoline and Diesel
description:
Long stretch of 440 kilometers between a gas station in Rurrenabaque and Triangulo.

The town of Australia has several shops along the road which sell gasoline and diesel from jugs.

I bought gasoline at this point for 7Bs per liter.

name: Tiendas
description: Several kiosk distributing water and food. It is possible to eat a Chicharone of Llama (very good)

name: restaurants
description: Several kiosks for lunch, breakfast and snack. Ice, cake and drink

name: Near sport field
description: We decided to stop in this little village. It like a place with few dust between 2 churches and football field. We ask The responsable from community and they said is ok and very safe. No problem to sleep here. The direct road to come here can be difficult because of concrete steep like V. So go to next entrance, see picture. Flat, safe, place many all rigs and many big rigs. Quiet at night. Train pat at 9 pm and about 7.30am.

name: Museo Misional and Church
description: Nice little museum. All explained in Spanish. Very nice wall paintings and nice church to visit. Little stop nice to do on the way. If you go straight to Brasil without visiting all missions, stop it is pretty!

name: Heladaria Ame Tauna
description: Very good ice cream in middle of nowhere and some good sweet tarts. Very good quality price. I had maracuja and it was sally tasty and the flavor was really natural! Open Tuesday to Sunday

name: The bridge
description: We are on a bicycle trip. After crossing the pedestrian bridge from Calacoto take a right and there are several space to put a tent. Take a pebble to plant the tent. It's soft ground. We have met a cow shepherd and there is no problem. No way, very quiet. I recommend. We're away from La Paz' direction of Sajama. PS, the Entel network works well here

name: Pension Mirador
description:
Good shop and restaurant, decent food and sells beer, also
has a toilet attached

name: Rio Secco
description: Coming from Rio Secco, after the bridge over the Rio Secco on the right there is a small dirt road that leads to the square.

name: Hôtel La Mision
description: good hotel in the center of the town, directly on the main place with a secure parking. The parking lot is limited in height due to the city's electrical wires around 180 cm.  Old hotel but clean and enought confortable. Beautiful patio. Wifi and breakfast.  Double 250 Bob with bathroom.

name: Alojamiento Avaroa
description:
It’s one of those ‘new’ but unfinished hotels, but it doesn’t look bad.

They offered me a room with 2 single beds for 40 with shared bathroom. The girls said it was normally 80 for 2 persons which seems a bit much. They have also a room for 120 with private bathroom.

WiFi works but cuts off regularly. They have a chicken-with-rice restaurant in the same building.

I could put my bicycle in the store downstairs, which was close all time I was there. I could not access my stuff on my bicycle which was a bit annoying.

They lock you in at night. When I wanted to leave at 9am the doors were still locked. Luckily I had the telephone number otherwise it would be a challenge to leave.

name: Toto Restaurante
description:
Just behind the corner od the main place (indicated with signs) , pizzeria Toto is a wonderful place. Managed by a  very friendly woman, pizzas are awesome and tasteful. Long time we had such good pizzas in s-a. The ice creams have to be tried as well!
Pizzas mediana around 50 and large at 80. Worthed it for us!

name: Laguna Charquini
description:
Parking and starting point for the hike to Laguna Charquini. About 1,5h hike to the Laguna. To get to the starting point you pass one military checkpoint and write down name, passport no. etc...
After the turnoff from the "main road" there is a gate and a sign which says its not allowed to enter, but you just pay the 20 bol entrance fee here and the guy will open the gate for you.

name: Salar wild camp
description:
Don't worry about following pin drops......
Just drive away from the roads for a few K's and pitch up your tent.
You'll have the most magical camp spot.
It does get cold though so prepare for that. We had -6°C but gets colder.
Also if you're camping near the island you can use the toilets there.

name: Hospedaje Posada del Rey
description:
Nice hotel right next to the plaza. 

There is a small parking area enough for one car or several motorcycles. 

I got a tiny room with a shared bathroom for 40Bs. Rooms with private bathrooms are also available, though I don't know the price. 

Electric shower. Clean bathroom. Good wifi. Pets are allowed. 

The hotel is run by a friendly mother and son. The son speaks a bit of English.

name: Restaurante Blackput
description:
Nice, new and clean restaurant 
Menu tasty for 17bol: soup + main Dish
Full of locals

name: YPFB backyard
description: We asked if we could stay here for the night. and the guard said ok. stayed in the backyard of the gas station. I think there is a toilet but it is not working.

name: Casa de Cambio/Money Exchange
description:
in the corner is a casa de cambio.
The man was a bit unfriendly and not willing to negotiate. but we got 8.1 BOB for 1US$

name: Around the road  (bike camping)
description: We're on a bike trip. The flat area around the road, takes a side road that brings to several spaces to put tents (5 tents can be placed). Flat, dessert and cold in our season. The road to Calacoto is sand in some way (for the bikes have large tire advice, we have 2. 2 and a rather light loading). We crossed several trucks, cars and motorcycles (so it must pass with these type of vehicles). The road is beautiful and you can see the stars at night. Little crossing at night. We're away from La Paz' direction of Sajama.

name: Sandy Passage
description: For cyclists! We are on a bicycle trip and we left La Paz to Sajama. We took that road, but we turned around. Because there is a lot of sandy passage that is difficult by cycling. We pushed the bike a lot. We are equipped with tires of size 2.2, luggage tyle bikepaking. After discussion with the locals, we confirmed that this pass is very sandy. If you want to ride on land, you have to go back to Calacoto and then Rosario. We do not recommend this passage for bikes with small tires, if you take this road there is a good chance that you push your bike

name: Tienda
description: Several mini-market in the village. There is water, bread, all products of first necessity and even gasoline.

name: Restaurants
description: Great restaurant in the village. 11 Bolivianos lunch (soup and secondary). Drink not included, 3 Bolivianos for a small coca format

name: Mini-supermarket
description: Supermarket of the village. Several products of first necessity and to prepare a food. Don't sell fruit and vegetables, but there's another store on the other side of the square to find some

name: Tienda
description: Superette of the village square in front of the church. Orange store with a white window. We find all the products of the first necessity (small pharmacy, canned box, paw, rice, biscuits, water, soda, etc...). There are no fresh vegetables and fruit. The owner is very nice.

name: The dry lake
description: The dry lake. We are travelling by bike and from La Paz to Sajama by the Pacajes region. This place of bivouac is flat, quiet, protects a little from the wind and away from the road. Possible to see the stars without light pollution. The road since Rosario is cycling, it is mainly from the land and there are some minor sandy passages

name: No bridge
description: There's no bridge. The river is about 30 cm deep on 15 meters long. We are travelling by bike and we have crossed by removing our shoes. The front and after roads are passable by bike and all-terrain vehicles (motorcycle or 4*4).

name: Water from the well of the village Janco Marca
description: There's access to water. The water comes from a well of town hall. The faucet is in the main courtyard of the village, or school (I can not know), left a table sheltered and children's games

name: Water pump
description: Water pump. Available. In this small crossroads in the Pampa there is a water pump. This water comes from a deeper source

name: River Crossings
description: Several river passes have to make on this road. The sand is very spongieux. NB, We are on a bike trip and we left from La Paz to Sajama. PS, it seems that there is no more road here.

name: little market
description: Small village supermarket. With first-class products (rice, oats, water, etc.). There is also fruit and vegetables

name: Source in the village square
description: Source in the village square. Water comes from a puit from a groundwater

name: Single track
description: Great place off the road with views of the Sajama volcano. There's water in the villages and hamlets before and after this spot. To get there you need to take a mono-track from the road. These tracks are used by the bikes and motorbikes of the locals. We're travelling by bike from La Paz towards the Sajama park.

name: YPFB
description:
Brand new petrol station, the only one we could see between Vallegrande and Tomina  if you take the route that avoids Padilla.

Wouldn't sell us without factura, so we got international price but with the actual factura with our plate on it.

name: Albergue Ecoturistico TOMARAPI
description: Great place to rest and eat well. We're travelling by bike from La Paz towards Sajama Park. After 5 days of bivouac, through the desert, the cold and the Pampa, we are happy to be here. There are rooms at different prices. It's quiet and peaceful. There is a very good hot shower. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean.

name: alojamiento
description:
The rooms are basic, but clean. The hostel itself is nice and made with love and flowers in the patio.
The owner is very friendly and even assisted in carrying my bags up. 50 bob pp with shared bathroom and hot shower. The village is surprisingly beautiful with old stone buildings and small churches and two plazas. A few restaurants, which mainly open during weekend, when people leave Sucre. Worth a stop, if you do not feel to make the last climb to Sucre.

name: Restaurant Bolivia
description:
Menú del día is 15 Bol, you can choose from for ex. Lomo, Milanesa, Chuleta, but they have sandwiches and hamburgers as well.
After checking out the rest of the restaurants in this city, would almost call this one romantic with the ambient lightning! can recommend

name: Clínica Veterinaria Madrid
description:
This new clinic they have a really care of the pets, and you can take all the vaccines and documents to cross the border. 
The veterinaria are amazing.
------------
En esta nueva clínica pueden poner todas las vacunas y los documentos necesarios para cruzar la frontera. 
Los veterinarios son unas grandes personas y aman a los animales.

name: Plaza chichis
description:
We stayed 2 nights here it was super quiet. The square is very nice, organized, and clean. We parked in front of the town hall.

Nos quedamos 2 noches y súper tranquilo, la plaza muy linda, organizada, limpia. Nos parqueamos frente a la alcaldía.

name: Hostel Restaurante El Reposo
description:
Good quality hostel by local standards: hot shower, clean bathroom, comfortable bed, good wifi.
The minuses: no towels, cold room. 
We paid 80 bol pp for a double. 
The restaurant serves huge servings of grilled meat at 50-70 pp.

name: Gomeria GAUCHO
description:
Small but very good tyre fixing person. He knows exactly what he dies and helps you with a lot of mecanics and good shops. 

+59178537875 Anibal

name: Nice camping behind a hill with a view to the west
description: Nice wild camping between eucalyptus tree and a great view to the lake

name: Mejia Tyres caseta #3
description:
Mejia sells good tyres, I got recomended by a local friend; he really seems very honest and know about our needs of overlanders. Balancing of tyres just oposite of his place inside of Mercado del Automovil
His wp/tel: +591 (7) 703-8523

name: walk the plank wildcamp
description: Just past a turning to a timber merchant. You can see the turn off and gate with flags. we spotted a plank over the ditch. we wheeled out bikes over and discovered a flat area with a couple of benches. as it's higher from the road we were reasonably well hidden, tho the security guards from the merchants waved .you could take the driveway to the timber merchants and the area would be on your left .We had stunning views, red macaws flew over, so many birds. in the morning the sun rose and we had breakfast with an awesome view. our wifi works now and again. we stocked up with water at a store about 4 k back, we're heading east towards Triangle. the road is really dry. We had 15 miles dirt, 10 miles concrete and 23 miles dirt so far.

name: Tienda at Santa Lucia
description: like buses no shops for a while then we get 2 together.  Good little store, seats outside in the shade. wide range of goods. Sat having an ice lolly and cool drink. bliss!

name: Mud Walls
description: Good house walls, no roof. space for 2 tents. Spring nearby. Clean.

name: Tap water at plaza
description: Free potable tap water at the main plaza.

name: Hostal - shower
description: We were able to just take a shower here. 10 BOL pp. Clean. Nice lady opened us.

name: Lakeside
description: Beautiful place directly on the lake. Very quiet at night. Also suitable for larger vehicles

name: Beautiful camp behind rockwall
description: Set up camp behind a huge rock (east of the road). Perfect wind shelter, had the calmest night of this trip, also surprisingly warm. As our camp is facing east we had the most beautiful sunrise with lamas walking by. 10/10 camp spot (probably only accessible for bikes though)

name: Genex gasolina
description:
Only gas station along route 4 that we could find that would sell to international plate, at international prices.
May have to do with the road blocks in the area currently but it’s the one other stations directed us to as well.

name: Gomeria Fuentes
description: Little shop on the side of the road will sell gasoline for 5 bob/liter.

name: Hospedaje Tunupa
description: very friendly great hospitality with room or possibilty to camp with banos and showers

name: Restaurant
description:
The only restaurant in the area. It might look closed but you have to knock on the door. I had a simple lunch for 10 bolivianos.

They is an old fountain in the front yard, and a sign ‘hay pan’, to recognise the place.

name: Small tienda/cafe
description: It doesn’t look like a shop from the outside, but if you knock on the green door they might open it. Well stocked store, no other stores in the area.

name: Camping in the health center
description: In the health center you can ask to put your tent inside. There is plenty of space and the people is super friendly. Doctor Vladimir was there at time and welcomed us. We could put our tent in an old garage in the center, use the bathroom and there are several taps to take water (please use your filter, they are not potable). Nice place to split the path between patacamaya and sajama.

name: Residential Victoria
description: Grim looking concrete block of a place. but big clean rooms. shower. good WiFi. smart TV. 140 bols for 2 in a matrimonial.  mattress awful but could see new ones ready in other rooms. seem to be doing the place up.  owner OK. got clothes dry fine in courtyard.  could easily cook there, we were tired so got a takeaway,  poor chicken and chips. whole town grim, must be hell when wet. bikes in room. motorcycles in courtyard

name: local school
description: We spotted a large open space in front of the school buildings. The teachers live in the end building but were out when we arrived.  we were advised to ask at one of the buildings on the other side of the road and a lady told us it was fine. We saw the teachers later and they were really friendly,  offered to show us where to get a wash, pit toilets out the back.  .We set up inside one of the classrooms, almost bug free! Heaven. We have come from close to Sena and passed a few tiendas on the way.  getting water was an issue but they all had coke etc. The local children popped over later and I gave them an impromptu English lesson. which was fun. oh and they love biscuits! We put our cycles in the classroom with us.

name: Small Tienda
description: little shop when we expected nothing for 30 miles ! we bought Coca-Cola and biscuits. sold fresh eggs and tinned corn, alcohol and usual biscuits etc. cute animals around. she has a well, so guess could maybe get water.

name: Tienda
description: Opposite the football pitch. Has water and cold drinks. Bread, biscuits, the usual, no fresh products. Also a farmacy section. seats in the shade outside.

name: Tienda y Pension
description: Another welcome surprise.  we just bought water but the store was stocked with the usual selection of products.  I think you could get a meal. Definitely worth asking.

name: El Rosario Pension and restaurant
description: Sat beside the road, outside eating area partly under a big tree, soup and fried chicken for lunch, we just had the chicken, it was hot! and really tasty, 12bols each and a further 10 bols for a bottle of fizzy orange.  Staff not particularly friendly, no interaction with us, but fab to have shade. we're on bicycles,  just ridden from Australia,  the waterholes that direction are teaming with Caymen and Capybarra. we must have seen 100s of both species.  and the bird life! Take it slow and stop frequently,  you'll be in for a treat. We rode mid June, as obviously will vary.

name: Pizza and Snacks
description: in the big square, just a few doors away from Hotel El Shadney. Opens at around 6pm in the evening,  not sure if does lunch. varied menu. I had medium pizza, 30 bols. Be warned the Margarita comes with ham.  My husband had a burger, with chips, both pretty good, especially the pizza.

name: Next to soccer field
description: Very chill spot, the small road to come down is not fantastic but it’s okay for any vehicle. The spot close to the river is not possible anymore, they have a fence around the soccer field. But atleast here at the soccer field you’re away from the main road.

name: Restaurante Patio Urbano
description: Good food, exzellent hamburgers but also sweet sour chinese food. Very friendly owner Jorge-Luis.

name: Casa Relax Chuquiñapi
description: A superb place: isolated, on a beautiful cliff overlooking lago Titicaca. Well furnished rooms, double with breakfast 240 bol. Hot shower! Comfy bed. Recommended if you want to get away from it all.

name: Johnny Diesel
description:
The best place in Tarija if you have problem with your Diesel Motor 
Johnny can repair almost everything! we have a problem with DPF and he can fix it
___________
El mejor lugar en Tarija si tienes problema con tu Motor Diesel
¡Johnny puede reparar casi todo! Tenemos un problema con el DPF y él puede solucionarlo.

name: Off the main road
description:
Small area on the secondary road.
Less traffic than the main road.
We spent 2 nights here, very quiet at night.
Locals waves at us but no one stopped.
Saw toucans and condors

name: Next to Ipita at the lake
description: Good and quiet place for one night. You could hear the roads, but at night very quiet.

name: Betanzos
description: Paramos a dormir dirección Sucre. Es un lugar amplio, un poco desnivelado, nada especial pero tranquilo para pasar la noche. Hay puestos para comer.

name: Alojamiento
description: Hotel on the road for travelers and truck drivers. 25 per person. Economic or more expensive room depending on the quality of the beds (50 Bolivianos for u'e room with shared toilet, 60-70 for private toilets and 80 for a matrimonial room with private shower and cable TV, that's to say a lot of channels). Rather noisy at the end of the day and early evening (normally we are on a crossroads). Pretty quiet at night (I used my crates balls to sleep well. NB, We are traveling by bike and had an inner courtyard to store the bikes

name: The sheepfold
description: Between the sheepfold and a muni salar there are small flat areas to put tents. The road to go is sandy in some place. NB, We are traveling by bicycle, 2.1 size tire. It's a little difficult

name: Tienda
description:
Super convenience store. We'll find all we need. Except for fresh fruit. There's a little bell to call the Dean. Otherwise, type in the doors around. The dean lives is next.
PS, It also offers a hotel service (50 Bolivianos for a matrimonial room or two bed), with toilets but without shower.

name: Alcaya sports field.
description: We slept well here next to this shepherd village. Quiet and quiet. We have sleep on the ground sports field, on one side. We went to the village to ask for permission. There's wind. In our season the sun arrives at 8:00. NB, We are traveling by bike.

name: ok spot for one tent
description:
the other spot did not seem really good for tents (lots of wind and only a few m next to the road).
this spot is further away from the road (about 100 m), has some natural wind protection from rocks. during the night only one car passed, and it wasn't loud.
lots of lama footprints around but until 7 in the morning none came by :-)
night time temperature in tent went down to -9 (Celsius), direct sun from 7:30 on
nice views
water available in the canyon nearby (300 m or so), did not try it so not sure if potable

name: warm food for hungry cyclists
description:
Looks like a kiosko from the outside (has an intel logo in the window) but they also have food. 
I came here once in the evening (around 21:00) and they had chicken with rice and potatoes and once during lunch (13:30) soup, a milk shake and a Segundo of rice vegetables and meat.
Expect a super friendly family also cooking for hungry cyclists rather than a full scale restaurant.

name: flat spot next to road
description:
normally this is nothing I would put on ioverlander but because thee is really nothing here:
flat spot next to the road with a bit of wind protection. ok to stop for lunch (with a bike) and could be an emergency camp aite. it's flat, thee are stones to build walls if needed but it's really only 3 m away from the road

name: wind protection next to (inhabited) house
description:
I got here when it was dark (around 19:00). I knocked on the window and owner pointed towards other side of his house. I pitched my tent there. ok wind protection and super quiet
The guy came by in the morning to check if I was ok. very nice person!

name: Hotel Lithium
description:
good place to get out of the cold (for cyclists )
dorm room 50 bol
dinner 15 bol (rice, french fries, meat and a bit of salad)
and they have a well stocked mini market
bicycle could be stored inside

entrance: via the mini market. (if you have bicycles they will open another door for you)

shower and toilet clean. water wasn't really warm (but I also did not wait very long)
owners friendly

name: Tienda de Iver
description:
First shop you’ll hit if you’re headed south. Has all the normal things you would expect, may be possible to buy onions, tomatoes, or other vegetables. 

Iver is very nice and let us cook some eggs in his kitchen for lunch. 

He will also exchange Bolivianos for USD or Chile pesos. Very nice guy! Give him some business if you can.

name: Building ruins to block wind
description: Nice place to stop for cyclists out of the wind. A few other building located nearby, but thought we would have the best odds of not being disturbed at this one.

name: Koky taller VW
description:
Great VW mechanic! Helped me out very quick and easy with a few small things and was even able to get some electrical issues sorted 

His contact is ‪+59178112050‬
Yes his shop is a bit out of the way but I think if you really need a VW specific mechanic he’s worth it

name: 2 river crossings
description:
As of Jun 19 2024 this river actually carries water and there are two crossings
One is ca 20 cm deep
the second one is up to 40 cm deep and was frozen over when I got there, so I first had to break the ice and then push my bike through. (I would assume with a 4 wheel drive you can just drive through)


it's not dangerous, but I still thought it's useful to know

name: Auto levado de ropa
description: Laundry service. Clean and dryish in 1,5 hours. For completely dry I had to wait to the next day. 7 bolivianos per kilo. Friendly people. Open around 9:30am.

name: Autopiezas Saldias
description: Small little shop but they have parts for Kombis, I found a gas tank floater which I couldn’t find anywhere else.

name: Restaurante Rosy
description: Little restaurant in the middle of nowhere. Good place for lunch on the way to or from Tupiza. Right at the turnoff towards San Vicente. Soup is 6 BOB, main course (chuleta) was 18. Soup was very good and chuleta excellent. The owner is very nice and also made us some tea.

name: Next to the train tracks
description: This ppace is shortly after the peaje. It is hidden from the road, just behind the train tracks.

name: Off a secondary road
description:
Beautiful wild spot, in the middle of nowhere
Take the secondary road then turn right
Alone in the wild
We spent 3 nights here
Fire pit-ish, some Tigo cell reception but not always
No service, bring your food and water
Sunny all day, good for solar panel
Can be windy sometimes but such a dream place with amazing views

name: Ecoturistico Pairumani Park
description:
Nice eco park with a great view of the city and a small hike to a waterfall. 
There are fields and a playground, lots of locals during the day but not many people staying the night. A lot of grills as well. It’s 10BOB pppn
Decent toilets, no showers. Sinks outside good for washing up dishes. 
Lots of places for tents or rigs. Road inside the park probably a little tight for bigger rigs.

name: SemRe mechanic
description: Helped me with a few electronic issues. Miguel and the other mechanics will help you with anything you need. These are the same mechanics from the other place marked down the road but here is their actual workshop.

name: Hostal San Francisco
description:
Basic but nice looking relatively new hotel. I had got a ‘simple’ one person room for 40 bolivianos. Shared bathroom, no WiFi.

They wanted to keep my passport until I leave. I don’t like that do they gave it back.

My bicycle could stay in the patio area, you can park at least two motorcycles as well. Street parking for cars.

They are building a sauna, so maybe one day it’s usable…

Two other hotels close by.

name: Simio de la chiquitania
description: Charly is an experienced couchsurfer and he has offered for people to come and help him build his tourism project here next to Chochis. He is building out a sendero/trail with a mirador filled with incredible creations of his using recycled metal and car tires. He has said that you can stay and use his bathroom and shower. He and his family have a beautiful energy and are working really hard to get the project off the ground. There is very little cell service and the place appears as arte ecológico poma in Google maps. The entrance is not made for big rigs. His number is +59163351828

name: Baño Santuario
description: Acceso a baño y agua dentro del santuario

name: Backpackers Hostal Oruro
description: Nice place, many beds with breakfast 🥞,  the cost is so cheap, 40 bs, there is two  kitchen , terrace, shower,  water hot, calefactor.

name: Poleria
description: Il fait du poulet à la broche avec des pommes de terre et du riz accompagné d'un bouillon. Il est possible d'avoir du "pollo broster", mais il faut le commander. Ouverture a partir de 18h. 13 Bolivianos par personne pour le poulet à la broche.

name: Banco unión atm
description: ATM for banco union a bank that usually works with most foreign cards

name: ATM Ecofuturo
description: ATM where you can withdraw money with Mastercard without fee. Worked for N26 Mastercard (while it didn't work in Potosí for example)

name: Nuvos Horizontes
description:
series of small shops with a variety of products, we bought cold drinks 
along the road to Rurrenbaque are a couple more small shops

name: Plaza principal El Carmen
description: Flat spot next to the plaza principal of the town. It is super quiet after 7:30-8pm. Not the greatest spot ever but more than adequate for a night either going to or coming from the border

name: alojamiento San luis
description:
seems to be the only place to stay in town (I got here at 18:00 and the municipality was not an option any more)
super simple (toilet but no shower, no heating, no WiFi...), soso Clean, but also super cheap 25 bol for one person 
if you want to get out of the wind might be a good option

name: AVOID Rodriguez Bike Shop
description: This guy sold me an old bicycle chain made to look new and sold as new. It wrecked my chainring and has caused a lot of wasted time and energy. Do not trust him. He didn’t even install it correctly (wrapped it the wrong side of the stay) first time so he snapped open the quick link to redo…

name: Residential
description:
Simple place to stay. WiFi works fine. Parking for lots of Motorcycles or a few cars.
Cold shower and shared bathroom. 
Private bathrooms are available for an extra cost.
Close to the place with lots of food options. 
The owner was friendly.
Rooms were basic but clean.
We paid $90BOB for 2 people and parking for the Motorcycles.

name: Quiet Area, Sand and Gras
description: Huge more or less flat area. I think during rainy season it is a lake. Next to road, semi hidden, but not more then 10 cars a day. Some shade. No signal. Very few mosquitoes in dry season.

name: RESIDENCIAL "AMERICAN VIP"
description: If you are stuck in this beautiful place you can sleep here safe! You can first check if you like it by using the banos for 1bol. They have a place behind the kind of hotel/restaurant where you can park safely with your car or van. Only rooftoptent no ground tent. There are also showers, we didnt use. There must be wifi but didnt use. Its just 10 bol for a car to camp here!! Really cheap! But basic ofcourse. But more safe then wildcamp here.

name: Ex Terminal
description:
Good enough place to sleep after the market closes. There is a security guard and cameras, and fairly safe. As long as you don't do drugs nor alcohol it should be fine. Homeless people sleep in different spots but they are not trouble, otherwise they are kicked out by the guard.
Slept here for three weeks.
Set up a bedroll and goodnight.
gas station one block away with free toilets. The ex Terminal has showers on business hours.

NOTE: Setting up a sleeping bag or bedroll is more convenient than tent. Roofed and with concrete floor.

---

Buen lugar para descansar. Hay guardia de seguridad y cámaras, pero en horario nocturno se puede tirar cama y dormir. Mientras no haya alcohol ni drogas no hay problema con el guardia. A una cuadra hay estación de servicio con baño gratis. En horario de comercio hay duchas en la ex Terminal. 
Estuve tres semanas durmiendo aquí.

NOTA: Tirar bolsa cama es más apropiado que carpa. Techado y con piso de baldosas.

name: Bicycle Spare Parts in La Loma Market
description:
Plenty of Bicycle spare parts and repair shops, as well as hardware stores.

---

Varias tiendas de reparación y repuestos de Bicicletas, así como también ferreterias.

name: Canteen of the square
description: Canteen of the square. It is possible to eat a Pollo Caldo or a Chicharone of Llama. 10 Bolivianos and 8 Bolivianos the dishes. Very good and simple

name: Agua del pueblo
description: Water available. Water from the city. In front of a yellow and gray building

name: Road side hotel
description: on your right if riding towards La Paz a block of rooms. Think its new. no curtains. no towels provided,  nor wifi, concrete floor. However it's clean, smart looking bathroom. our cheapest hotel of our 3 year trip so far. 30 bols for 2 people.  our cycles are under a covered area. Definitely paid a lot more for a lot less!

name: Street of shops
description: A good place to restock with food and  along this road.

name: Hotel Rodriguz
description: 3 level courtyard style Hotel.Unfinished  we had a matrimonial with bathroom,  150bol. definitely cheaper rooms available.  hot shower, clean room, air con. quiet at night. along the road is a hotel with a pool and in the square,  restaurants and shops and another hotel. we stored our cycles in the courtyard.  locked at night.

name: Bicycle repair shop; Todo en Bici
description: Just passed here and had a look. Very decent looking bicycle shop for Bolivian standards. Well stocked with Maxxis Mtb 29 tires and tubes, road and small gravel tires as well. Shimano parts and cheap chinese parts as well.

name: Baño público con ducha
description: Showers and quite clean toilets. Toilets 1 Bol, shower 3 bol

name: Ecofuturo - no Mastercard fee
description: This Ecofuturo ATM doesn't take 4 USD fees for Mastercard, as opposed to the one on Avenida Camacho. Worked a charm with my N26 Mastercard debit card.

name: Around Culpina'K
description: Around Culpina'K. We found a space to put several tents. It is possible to come with a vehicle as well. On leaving the village, to the Pampa, on the left there is a small building, surely a well. It is far from the village to be quiet and quiet

name: Shelter without roof
description: Shelter without roof. We are on a trip and we can eat here from the wind. They're ruins with flags. I don't know what it means

name: Ecoturismo Comunidad Villa Amboro
description:
Wonderful community ecotourism center. Camping and cabañas available. It's a really fun 4wd adventure to get there-- the only way to the village is to cross a river, which is possible most of the year except for january-march. There are trails, waterfalls, and natural swimming pools. You can also do a 1 night backpacking trip down the river to stunning waterfalls and caves. One of the best things we have done in 1.5 years of traveling, highly highly recommended.

Contact Don Hugo Rojas for more info:  73687784

name: Hiking and Ecoturismo Villa Amboro
description:
Community run ecoturism in Amboro National Park. Excellent and friendly guided hikes (Spanish only) to waterfalls, natural swimming pools, wildlife spotting.You can also do a 1 night backpacking trip down the river to stunning waterfalls and caves.  4wd absolutely needed- the only way to the village is to cross a river, which is possible most of the year except for january-march. One of the best things we have done in 1.5 years of traveling, highly highly recommended.

Contact Don Hugo Rojas for more info:  73687784

name: Dry river bed
description:
Amazing spot for wild camping right in the dry river bed with views on mountains.
Spent 5 nights here as almost no one pass by.
We saw a few locals walking by the river bed but all friendly. Some goats too.
There is no comodities. You need to bring your food and water.
Primary road is enough away to no hear it much.
Careful as a puma destroyed our bin during night.
Plenty of rocks to build a fire pit and enjoy beautiful stary nights.
We got not signal but open sky for starlink.
Please leave it as clean as nature is!
Enjoy

name: Riverside camping
description: quiet and nice campsite next to the river. would fit a couple of vehicles and tents. The access road is small. Not sure if possible with big rigs.
